general.quote: Into each life some rain must fall, some days be dark and dreary.
general.author: henry wadsworth longfellow

general.quote: The difficulties which I meet with in order to realize my existence are precisely what awaken and mobilize my activities, my capacities.
general.author: jose ortega y gasset

general.quote: Conversation is an exercise of the mind; gossip is merely an exercise of the tongue.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: The deeper the sorrow the less the tongue has it.
general.author: the talmud

general.quote: The pen is the tongue of the mind.
general.author: horace

general.quote: You can speak well if your tongue can deliver the message of your heart.
general.author: john ford

general.quote: The only weapon that becomes sharper with constant use is the tongue.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: I prefer tongue-tied knowledge to ignorant loquacity.
general.author: marcus t. cicero

general.quote: This is courtship all the world over – the man all tongue; the woman all ears.
general.author: emily murphy

general.quote: When men and woman die, as poets sung, his heart’s the last part moves, her last, the tongue.
general.author: benjamin franklin quotes

general.quote: I just tell you what I feel. I go out there, you put a quarter on my tongue, twist my ear and I’ll spit out some hit for you.
general.author: al jourgensen

general.quote: Let a fool hold his tongue and he will pass for a sage.
general.author: publilius syrus

general.quote: It’s going to be the year of the sharp elbow and the quick tongue.
general.author: george w. bush quotes

general.quote: The best time for you to hold your tongue is the time you feel you must say something or bust.
general.author: josh billings

general.quote: It is a sign that your reputation is small and sinking if your own tongue must praise you.
general.author: matthew hale

general.quote: Swollen in head, weak in legs, sharp in tongue but empty in belly.
general.author: mao zedong

general.quote: I will speak with a straight tongue.
general.author: chief joseph

general.quote: Teach your child to hold his tongue; he’ll learn fast enough to speak.
general.author: benjamin franklin

general.quote: If my tongue were trained to measures, I would sing a stirring song.
general.author: paul tillich

general.quote: The tongue is like a sharp knife: it kills without drawing blood.
general.author: anne seaton

general.quote: The tongue is the only instrument that gets sharper with use.
general.author: washington irving quotes

general.quote: When the lips are silent, the heart has a hundred tongues.
general.author: rumi

general.quote: It was my tongue that swore; my heart is unsworn.
general.author: euripides

general.quote: There is danger when a man throws his tongue into high gear before he gets his brain a-going.
general.author: c. c. phelps

general.quote: Having a sharp tongue will cut your throat.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: All parts of the human body get tired eventually – except the tongue.
general.author: konrad adenauer

general.quote: When the eyes say one thing, and the tongue another, a practiced man relies on the language of the first.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson quotes

general.quote: Let your tongue speak what your heart thinks.
general.author: davy crockett

general.quote: For us Indians, I don’t think English can ever exude that magic of emotions which our mother tongue can.
general.author: kailash kher

general.quote: Be slow of tongue and quick of eye.
general.author: miguel de cervantes

general.quote: For all sad words of tongue and pen, The saddest are these, ‘It might have been’.
general.author: john greenleaf whittier

general.quote: The eyes those silent tongues of love.
general.author: miguel de cervantes

general.quote: I have a very sharp tongue, I’m very impatient, and it’s a lifelong struggle.
general.author: karen armstrong

general.quote: Temper never mellows with age, and a sharp tongue is the only edged tool that grows keener with constant use.
general.author: washington irving quotes

general.quote: A sharp tongue is the only edge tool that grows keener with constant use.
general.author: washington irving

general.quote: Give me the ready hand rather than the ready tongue.
general.author: giuseppe garibaldi

general.quote: Humor is the first of the gifts to perish in a foreign tongue.
general.author: virginia woolf

general.quote: I just stick my tongue out because I hate smiling in pictures. It’s so awkward. It looks so cheesy.
general.author: miley cyrus

general.quote: Before the tongue can speak, it must have lost the power to wound.
general.author: peace pilgrim

general.quote: I think the first virtue is to restrain the tongue; he approaches nearest to gods who knows how to be silent, even though he is in the right.
general.author: cato the elder

general.quote: If the tongue had not been framed for articulation, man would still be a beast in the forest.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson

general.quote: Prayer requires more of the heart than of the tongue.
general.author: adam clarke

general.quote: Heaven finds an ear when sinners find a tongue.
general.author: francis quarles

general.quote: The hearing ear is always found close to the speaking tongue; and no genius can long or often utter anything which is not invited and gladly entertained by men around him.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson

general.quote: To speak kindly does not hurt the tongue.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: A good memory and a tongue tied in the middle is a combination which gives immortality to conversation.
general.author: mark twain quotes

general.quote: Give thy thoughts no tongue.
general.author: william shakespeare quotes

general.quote: You can change your world by changing your words… Remember, death and life are in the power of the tongue.
general.author: joel osteen

general.quote: I have often repented speaking, but never of holding my tongue.
general.author: xenocrates of chalcedon

general.quote: A distinguished diplomat could hold his tongue in ten languages.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: In nine times out of ten, the slanderous tongue belongs to a disappointed person.
general.author: george bancroft

general.quote: A quote is just a tattoo on the tongue.
general.author: william f. devault

general.quote: I’ll keep peace at all cost, even if I choke to death on my tongue.
general.author: paula deen

general.quote: The function of muscle is to pull and not to push, except in the case of the genitals and the tongue.
general.author: leonardo da vinci quotes

general.quote: Men are born with two eyes, but with one tongue, in order that they should see twice as much as they say.
general.author: charles caleb colton

general.quote: Violence of the tongue is very real-sharper than any knife.
general.author: mother teresa

general.quote: Those who are determined and control their mind, body, and tongue are indeed well controlled.
general.author: buddha

general.quote: Gray hairs are signs of wisdom if you hold your tongue, speak and they are but hairs, as in the young.
general.author: philo

general.quote: Fire and swords are slow engines of destruction, compared to the tongue of a Gossip.
general.author: richard steele

general.quote: An Englishman’s never so natural as when he’s holding his tongue.
general.author: henry james

general.quote: Commonly they must use their feet for defense whose only weapon is their tongue.
general.author: sir philip sidney

general.quote: For God’s sake hold your tongue, and let me love.
general.author: john donne

general.quote: A fluent tongue is the only thing a mother don’t like her daughter to resemble her in.
general.author: richard brinsley sheridan

general.quote: We have a natural right to make use of our pens as of our tongue, at our peril, risk and hazard.
general.author: voltaire quotes

general.quote: A long tongue shortens life.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: Don’t be afraid if things seem difficult in the beginning. That’s only the initial impression. The important thing is not to retreat; you have to master yourself.
general.author: olga korbut

general.quote: The greatest difficulties lie where we are not looking for them.
general.author: johann wolfgang von goethe quotes

general.quote: As a man handles his troubles during the day, so he goes to bed at night a General, Captain, or Private.
general.author: edgar watson howe

general.quote: The three things most difficult are–to keep a secret, to forget an injury, and to make good use of leisure.
general.author: chilo of sparta

general.quote: The occasion is piled high with difficulty, and we must rise high with the occasion.
general.author: abraham lincoln quotes

general.quote: Difficult times always create opportunities for you to experience more love in your life.
general.author: barbara de angelis

general.quote: People have a natural tendency to flee to the mountains when things get tough.
general.author: stuart briscoe

general.quote: Every cloud has its silver lining but it is sometimes a little difficult to get it to the mint.
general.author: don marquis

general.quote: Storms make the oak grow deeper roots.
general.author: george herbert

general.quote: The more powerful the obstacle, the more glory we have in overcoming it; and the difficulties with which we are met are the maids of honor which set off virtue.
general.author: moliere

general.quote: Troubles are often the tools by which God fashions us for better things.
general.author: henry ward beecher

general.quote: It has been my philosophy of life that difficulties vanish when faced boldly.
general.author: isaac asimov

general.quote: Hardship and opposition are the native soil of manhood and self-reliance.
general.author: john neil

general.quote: Every noble acquisition is attended with its risks; he who fears to encounter the one must not expect to obtain the other.
general.author: metastasio

general.quote: Difficulties are things that show what men are.
general.author: epictetus

general.quote: In a dark time, the eye begins to see.
general.author: theodore roethke

general.quote: A pessimist sees the difficulty in every opportunity; an optimist sees the opportunity in every difficulty.
general.author: winston churchill quotes

general.quote: You never will be the person you can be if pressure, tension and discipline are taken out of your life.
general.author: james g. bilkey

general.quote: Nothing is particularly hard if you divide it into small jobs.
general.author: henry ford quotes

general.quote: Bad times have a scientific value. These are occasions a good learner would not miss.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson quotes

general.quote: The illustration which solves one difficulty by raising another, settles nothing.
general.author: horace (quintus horatius flaccus)

general.quote: Difficulties increase the nearer we approach the goal.
general.author: johann wolfgang von goethe

general.quote: Trouble is the next best thing to enjoyment. There is no fate in the world so horrible as to have no share in either its joys or sorrows.
general.author: henry wadsworth longfellow

general.quote: Difficulties strengthen the mind, as labor does the body.
general.author: marcus annaeus seneca

general.quote: The eternal stars shine out as soon as it is dark enough.
general.author: thomas carlyle

general.quote: Difficulties strengthen the mind, as well as labor does the body.
general.author: seneca (lucius annaeus seneca)

general.quote: There are always difficulties arising that tempt you to believe your critics are right.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson

general.quote: Out of difficulties grow miracles.
general.author: jean de la bruyere

general.quote: It is surmounting difficulties that makes heroes.
general.author: louis kossuth

general.quote: The apprenticeship of difficulty is one which the greatest of men have had to serve.
general.author: samuel smiles

general.quote: Hardship makes the world obscure.
general.author: don delillo

general.quote: No matter how bad things get you’ve got to go on living, even if it kills you.
general.author: sholom aleichem

general.quote: The very greatest things — great thoughts, discoveries, inventions — have usually been nurtured in hardship, often pondered over in sorrow, and at length established with difficulty.
general.author: samuel smiles

general.quote: Difficulties are meant to rouse, not discourage. The human spirit is to grow strong by conflict.
general.author: william ellery channing

general.quote: Difficulties exist to be surmounted.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson

general.quote: Nothing is so difficult but that it may be found out by seeking.
general.author: terence (publius terentius afer),

general.quote: We have inherited new difficulties because we have inherited more privileges.
general.author: abram sacher

general.quote: It cannot be too often repeated that it is not help, but obstacles, not facilities, but difficulties that make men.
general.author: william mathews

general.quote: It is difficulties which give birth to miracles.
general.author: james sharp

general.quote: We were promised sufferings. They were part of the program. We were even told, "Blessed are they that mourn."
general.author: c. s. lewis

general.quote: There is such a choice of difficulties, that I own myself at a loss how to determine.
general.author: william james

general.quote: It is the surmounting of difficulties that makes heroes.
general.author: louis kossuth

general.quote: Half the spiritual difficulties that men and women suffer arise from a morbid state of health.
general.author: henry ward beecher

general.quote: Difficulties show men what they are. In case of any difficulty, God has pitted you against a rough antagonist that you may be a conqueror, and this cannot be without toil.
general.author: epictetus

general.quote: Difficulties should act as a tonic. They should spur us to greater exertion.
general.author: b.c. forbes

general.quote: When it is dark enough, you can see the stars.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson

general.quote: I attempt a difficult work; but there is no excellence without difficulty.
general.author: ovid (publius ovidius naso), ars amatoria

general.quote: Times of great calamity and confusion have been productive for the greatest minds. The purest ore is produced from the hottest furnace. The brightest thunder-bolt is elicited from the darkest storm.
general.author: charles caleb colton

general.quote: In every difficult situation is potential value. Believe this, then begin looking for it.
general.author: norman vincent peale

general.quote: The greater the difficulty, the more the glory in surmounting it.
general.author: epicurus

general.quote: There are two ways of meeting difficulties: you alter the difficulties or you alter yourself meeting them.
general.author: phyllis bottome

general.quote: There is such a choice of difficulties, that I own myself at a loss how to determine.
general.author: james wolfe

general.quote: Difficulties mastered are opportunities won.
general.author: winston churchill

general.quote: If we justify war, it is because all peoples always justify the traits of which they find themselves possessed, not because war will bear an objective examination of its merits.
general.author: ruth benedict

general.quote: The more prosperous and settled a nation, the more readily it tends to think of war as a regrettable accident; to nations less fortunate the chance of war presents itself as a possible bountiful friend.
general.author: lewis h. lapham

general.quote: All war represents a failure of diplomacy.
general.author: tony benn

general.quote: The most persistent sound which reverberates through man’s history is the beating of war drums.
general.author: arthur koestler

general.quote: How is the world ruled and led to war? Diplomats lie to journalists and believe these lies when they see them in print.
general.author: karl kraus

general.quote: War — what a waste of time. It’s all about great achievements for the very few but hideous losses for the very many.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: It is open to a war resister to judge between the combatants and wish success to the one who has justice on his side. By so judging he is more likely to bring peace between the two than by remaining a mere spectator.
general.author: mahatma gandhi

general.quote: Every attempt to make war easy and safe will result in humiliation and disaster.
general.author: william t. sherman

general.quote: Blunders are an inescapable feature of war, because choice in military affairs lies generally between the bad and the worse.
general.author: allan massie

general.quote: The real and lasting victories are those of peace, and not of war.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson

general.quote: America is addicted to wars of distraction.
general.author: barbara ehrenreich

general.quote: Moderation in war is imbecility.
general.author: admiral john fisher

general.quote: The real trouble with war (modern war) is that it gives no one a chance to kill the right people.
general.author: ezra pound

general.quote: I hate war as only a soldier who has lived it can, only as one who has seen its brutality, its futility, its stupidity.
general.author: dwight d. eisenhower

general.quote: The fault finder will find faults even in paradise.
general.author: henry david thoreau

general.quote: When one person makes an accusation, check to be sure he himself is not the guilty one. Sometimes it is those whose case is weak who make the most clamour.
general.author: piers anthony

general.quote: A trial without witnesses, when it involves a criminal accusation, a criminal matter, is not a true trial.
general.author: bill mccollum

general.quote: Accusations are useless.
general.author: dominique de villepin

general.quote: Those see nothing but faults that seek for nothing else.
general.author: thomas fuller

general.quote: The breath of accusation kills an innocent name, and leaves for lame acquittal the poor life, which is a mask without it.
general.author: percy bysshe shelley

general.quote: Knowledge of God’s Word is a bulwark against deception, temptation, accusation, even persecution.
general.author: edwin louis cole

general.quote: Accusations fit on a bumper sticker; the truth takes longer.
general.author: michael hayden

general.quote: Friends ask you questions; enemies question you.
general.author: criss jami

general.quote: It’s easy to point when you can’t heal it.
general.author: don walk

general.quote: Art is accusation, expression, passion. Art is a fight to the finish between black charcoal and white paper.
general.author: gunter grass

general.quote: Sometimes I lie awake at night and ask why me? Then a voice answers nothing personal, your name just happened to come up.
general.author: charles m. schulz

general.quote: Even doubtful accusations leave a stain behind them.
general.author: thomas fuller

general.quote: People love as self-recognition what they hate as an accusation.
general.author: elias canetti

general.quote: Whereas angels, which are greater in power and might, bring not railing accusation against them before the Lord.
general.author: bible

general.quote: He, who excuses himself, accuses himself.
general.author: gabriel meurier

general.quote: He that accuses all mankind of corruption ought to remember that he is sure to convict only one.
general.author: edmund burke

general.quote: Once the "what" is decided, the "how" always follows. We must not make the "how" an excuse for not facing and accepting the "what."
general.author: pearl s. buck

general.quote: Grace silences the voice of accusation and wipes all the evidence of guilt.
general.author: ikechukwu izuakor

general.quote: The best apology against false accusers is silence and sufferance, and honest deeds set against dishonest words.
general.author: john milton

general.quote: I couldn’t quite understand how an ordinary man’s good qualities could become crushing accusations against a guilty man.
general.author: albert camus

general.quote: Never make a defence or apology before you be accused.
general.author: charles i

general.quote: A man may fall many times, but he won’t be a failure until he says someone pushed him.
general.author: elmer g. letterman

general.quote: When all is summed up, a man never speaks of himself without loss; his accusations of himself are always believed, his praises never
general.author: michel de montaigne

general.quote: I am ready to accept all accusations, allegations, anger – but I have to succeed.
general.author: boris trajkovski

general.quote: A funeral is a pageant whereby we attest our respect for the dead by enriching the undertaker.
general.author: ambrose bierce

general.quote: A son can bear with equanimity the loss of his father, but the loss of his inheritance may drive him to despair.
general.author: niccolo machiavelli

general.quote: Say not you know another entirely, till you have divided an inheritance with him.
general.author: johann kaspar lavater

general.quote: We inherit nothing truly, but what our actions make us worthy of.
general.author: george chapman

general.quote: Fame is the inheritance not of the dead, but of the living. It is we who look back with lofty pride to the great names of antiquity.
general.author: william hazlitt

general.quote: Say not you know another entirely till you have divided an inheritance with him.
general.author: johann kaspar lavater

general.quote: We are all gifted. That is our inheritance.
general.author: ethel waters

general.quote: This is all the inheritance I give to my dear family. The religion of Christ will give them one which will make them rich indeed.
general.author: patrick henry

general.quote: Some believe all that parents, tutors, and kindred believe. They take their principles by inheritance, and defend them as they would their estates, because they are born heirs to them.
general.author: alan watts

general.quote: This our fathers bought for us, long and long ago.
general.author: rudyard kipling

general.quote: The richest inheritance any child can have is a stable, loving, disciplined family life.
general.author: daniel patrick moynihan

general.quote: Marriage is the only war in which you sleep with the enemy.
general.author: françois vi de la rochefoucault

general.quote: Marriage is a lottery in which men stake their liberty and women their happiness.
general.author: virginie des rieux

general.quote: A perfect marriage is one in which "I’m sorry" is said just often enough.
general.author: mignon mclaughlin

general.quote: One should never know too precisely whom one has married.
general.author: friedrich nietzsche

general.quote: Marriage, n. A community consisting of a master, a mistress, and two slaves, making in all two.
general.author: ambrose bierce

general.quote: There is no more lovely, friendly and charming relationship, communion or company than a good marriage.
general.author: martin luther

general.quote: Twenty years of romance make a woman look like a ruin, but twenty years of marriage make her something like a public building.
general.author: oscar wilde quotes

general.quote: I never knew what real happiness was until I got married. And by then it was too late.
general.author: max kauffman

general.quote: Marriage is the alliance of two people, one of whom never remembers birthdays and the other never forgets them.
general.author: ogden nash

general.quote: Marriage is a bribe to make the housekeeper think she’s a householder.
general.author: thornton wilder

general.quote: Marriage is three parts love and seven parts forgiveness of sins.
general.author: langdon mitchell

general.quote: Long engagements give people the opportunity of finding out each other’s character before marriage, which is never advisable.
general.author: oscar wilde

general.quote: Why does a woman work ten years to change a man’s habits and then complain that he’s not the man she married?
general.author: barbra streisand

general.quote: Almost no one is foolish enough to imagine that he automatically deserves great success in any field of activity; yet almost everyone believes that he automatically deserves success in marriage.
general.author: sydney j. harris

general.quote: A man in love is incomplete until he has married. Then he’s finished.
general.author: zsa zsa gabor

general.quote: God created sex. Priests created marriage.
general.author: voltaire quotes

general.quote: You can never be happily married to another until you get a divorce from yourself. Successful marriage demands a certain death to self.
general.author: jerry mccant

general.quote: Marriage is a wonderful invention: then again, so is a bicycle repair kit.
general.author: billy connolly

general.quote: Marriage: A word which should be pronounced "mirage."
general.author: herbert spencer

general.quote: Is not marriage an open question, when it is alleged, from the beginning of the world, that such as are in the institution wish to get out, and such as are out wish to get in?
general.author: ralph waldo emerson quotes

general.quote: Originally marriage meant the sale of a woman by one man to another; now most women sell themselves though they have no intention of delivering the goods listed in the bill of sale.
general.author: robert graves

general.quote: I have great hopes that we shall love each other all our lives as much as if we had never married at all.
general.author: lord byron

general.quote: Married life teaches one invaluable lesson: to think of things far enough ahead not to say them.
general.author: jefferson machamer

general.quote: Any intelligent woman who reads the marriage contract, and then goes into it, deserves all the consequences.
general.author: isadora duncan

general.quote: It is not marriage that fails; it is people that fail. All that marriage does is to show people up.
general.author: harry emerson fosdick

general.quote: Women hope men will change after marriage but they don’t; men hope women won’t change but they do.
general.author: bettina arndt

general.quote: Marriage, a market which has nothing free but the entrance.
general.author: michel de montaigne

general.quote: Happiness in marriage is entirely a matter of chance.
general.author: jane austen

general.quote: The secret of a happy marriage remains a secret.
general.author: henny youngman

general.quote: Marriage is an adventure, like going to war.
general.author: gilbert k. chesterton

general.quote: When a woman marries again it is because she detested her first husband. When a man marries again it is because he adored his first wife. Women try their luck; men risk theirs.
general.author: oscar wilde

general.quote: As to marriage or celibacy, let a man take which course he will, he will be sure to repent.
general.author: socrates quotes

general.quote: It takes a loose rein to keep a marriage tight.
general.author: john stevenson

general.quote: Marriage is the death of hope.
general.author: woody allen

general.quote: A long marriage is two people trying to dance a duet and two solos at the same time.
general.author: anne taylor fleming

general.quote: It’s a funny thing that when a man hasn’t anything on earth to worry about, he goes off and gets married.
general.author: robert frost

general.quote: Marriage is an alliance entered into by a man who can’t sleep with the window shut, and a woman who can’t sleep with the window open.
general.author: george bernard shaw

general.quote: Before marriage, a girl has to make love to a man to hold him. After marriage, she has to hold him to make love to him.
general.author: marilyn monroe

general.quote: A princely marriage is the brilliant edition of a universal fact, and, as such, it rivets mankind.
general.author: walter bagehot

general.quote: Marriage is our last, best chance to grow up.
general.author: joseph barth

general.quote: Love is blind, but marriage restores its sight.
general.author: samuel lichtenberg

general.quote: The highest happiness on earth is marriage.
general.author: william lyon phelps

general.quote: I have always considered marriage as the most interesting event of one’s life, the foundation of happiness or misery.
general.author: george washington quotes

general.quote: The problem with marriage is that it ends every night after making love, and it must be rebuilt every morning before breakfast.
general.author: gabriel garcía márquez

general.quote: The chief reason why marriage is rarely a success is that it is contracted while the partners are insane.
general.author: joseph collins

general.quote: The real act of marriage takes place in the heart, not in the ballroom or church or synagogue. .
general.author: barbara de angelis

general.quote: Marriage: that I call the will of two to create the one who is more than those who created it.
general.author: friedrich nietzsche

general.quote: More marriages might survive if the partners realized that sometimes the better comes after the worse.
general.author: doug larson

general.quote: Marriage is a mistake every man should make.
general.author: george jessel

general.quote: Love: A temporary insanity curable by marriage.
general.author: ambrose bierce

general.quote: Many marriages are simply working partnerships between businessmen and housekeepers.
general.author: mignon mclaughlin

general.quote: I guess walking slow getting married is because it gives you time to maybe change your mind.
general.author: virginia cary hudson

general.quote: Love and marriage, love and marriage go together like a horse and carriage. Dad was told by mother. You can’t have one without the other.
general.author: sammy cahn

general.quote: Success in marriage does not come merely through finding the right mate, but through being the right mate.
general.author: barnett r. brickner

general.quote: Marriage is not a word — it is a sentence.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: I came from a big family. As a matter of fact, I never got to sleep alone until I was married.
general.author: lewis grizzard

general.quote: After a few years of marriage, a man can look right at a woman without seeing her — and a woman can see right through a man without looking at him.
general.author: helen rowland

general.quote: Marriage is that relation between man and woman in which the independence is equal, the dependence mutual, and the obligation reciprocal.
general.author: louis k. anspacher

general.quote: Marriage is a meal where the soup is better than the dessert.
general.author: austin o’malley

general.quote: What counts in making a happy marriage is not so much how compatible you are, but how you deal with incompatibility.
general.author: george levinger

general.quote: I love being married. It’s so great to find that one special person you want to annoy for the rest of your life.
general.author: rita rudner

general.quote: Marriage is a great institution, but I’m not ready for an institution.
general.author: mae west

general.quote: Like good wine, marriage gets better with age — once you learn to keep a cork in it.
general.author: gene perret

general.quote: Men should keep their eyes wide open before marriage, and half-shut afterwards.
general.author: madeleine de scudery

general.quote: Some marriages break up, and some do not, and in our world you can usually explain the former better than the latter.
general.author: mignon mclaughlin

general.quote: A first-rate marriage is like a first-rate hotel: expensive, but worth it.
general.author: mignon mclaughlin

general.quote: Love requires a willingness to die; marriage, a willingness to live.
general.author: mignon mclaughlin

general.quote: The value of marriage is not that adults produce children, but that children produce adults.
general.author: peter de vries

general.quote: People do not marry people, not real ones anyway; they marry what they think the person is; they marry illusions and images. The exciting adventure of marriage is finding out who the partner really is.
general.author: james l. framo

general.quote: Our marriage has always been a 50-50 proposition — with the possible exception of closet space.
general.author: gene perret

general.quote: Though marriage makes man and wife one flesh, it leaves ’em still two fools.
general.author: william congreve

general.quote: Marriage ceremony: an incredible metaphysical sham of watching God and the law being dragged into the affairs of your family.
general.author: o.c. ogilvie

general.quote: Before marriage, a man declares that he would lay down his life to serve you; after marriage, he won’t even lay down his newspaper to talk to you.
general.author: helen rowland

general.quote: Politics doesn’t make strange bedfellows — marriage does.
general.author: groucho marx

general.quote: Marriage is a book of which the first chapter is written in poetry and the remaining chapters in prose.
general.author: beverley nichols

general.quote: A happy marriage is a long conversation which always seems too short.
general.author: andre maurois

general.quote: Marriage is not a noun; it’s a verb. It isn’t something you get. It’s something you do. It’s the way you love your partner every day.
general.author: barbara de angelis

general.quote: Marriage is like pleading guilty to an indefinite sentence. Without parole.
general.author: john mortimer

general.quote: The difficulty with marriage is that we fall in love with a personality, but must live with a character.
general.author: peter de vries

general.quote: The marriage state, with or without the affection suitable to it, is the completest image of Heaven and Hell we are capable of receiving in this life.
general.author: richard steele

general.quote: Marriage must constantly fight against a monster which devours everything: routine.
general.author: honoré de balzac

general.quote: No man expects a great deal from marriage. He is quite satisfied if his wife is a good cook, a good valet, an attentive audience, and a patient nurse.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: Marriage is like a bank account. You put it in, you take it out, and you lose interest.
general.author: irwin cory

general.quote: The most happy marriage I can imagine to myself would be the union of a deaf man to a blind woman.
general.author: samuel taylor coleridge

general.quote: Marriage means commitment. Of course, so does insanity.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: In every marriage more than a week old, there are grounds for divorce. The trick is to find, and continue to find, grounds for marriage.
general.author: robert anderson

general.quote: Chains do not hold a marriage together. It is threads, hundreds of tiny threads which sew people together through the years.
general.author: simone signoret

general.quote: Marriage is a ghastly public confession of a strictly private intention.
general.author: ian hay

general.quote: Love is one long sweet dream, and marriage is the alarm clock.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: For two people in a marriage to live together day after day is unquestionably the one miracle the Vatican has overlooked.
general.author: bill cosby

general.quote: I’d marry again if I found a man who had fifteen million dollars and would sign over half of it to me before the marriage, and guarantee he’d be dead within the year.
general.author: bette davis

general.quote: The sum which two married people owe to one another defies calculation. It is an infinite debt, which can only be discharged through eternity.
general.author: johann wolfgang von goethe qoutes

general.quote: Marriage is more than four bare legs in a bed.
general.author: hoshang n. akhtar

general.quote: What we love about love is the fever, which marriage puts to bed and cures.
general.author: mignon mclaughlin

general.quote: Often the difference between a successful marriage and a mediocre one consists of leaving about three or four things a day unsaid.
general.author: harlan miller

general.quote: A happy marriage is the union of two good forgivers.
general.author: ruth bell graham

general.quote: I’ve sometimes thought of marrying, and then I’ve thought again.
general.author: noel coward

general.quote: Marriage is a feast where the grace is sometimes better than the dinner.
general.author: charles caleb colton

general.quote: The music at a marriage procession always reminds me of the music of soldiers entering on a battle.
general.author: heinrich heine

general.quote: A successful marriage requires falling in love many times, always with the same person.
general.author: mignon mclaughlin

general.quote: Marrying for love may be a bit risky, but it is so honest that God can’t help but smile on it.
general.author: josh billings

general.quote: One of the best things about marriage is that it gets young people to bed at a decent hour.
general.author: m.m. musselman

general.quote: Marriage: A legal or religious ceremony by which two persons of the opposite sex solemnly agree to harass and spy on each other for ninety-nine years, or until death do them join.
general.author: elbert hubbard

general.quote: Marriage is like a phone call in the night: first the ring, and then you wake up.
general.author: evelyn hendrickson

general.quote: Through wisdom is a house built; and by understanding it is established; and by knowledge shall every room be filled with precious and pleasant riches.
general.author: bible

general.quote: To the old saying that man built the house but woman made of it a "home" might be added the modern supplement that woman accepted cooking as a chore but man has made of it a recreation.
general.author: emily post

general.quote: Woman, the more careful she is about her face, the more careless about her house.
general.author: ben johnson

general.quote: The world is the house of the strong.
general.author: denis diderot

general.quote: Every spirit makes its house, but as after wards the house confines the spirit, you had better build well.
general.author: elbert hubbard quotes

general.quote: Good food and a warm kitchen are what make a house a home.
general.author: rachael ray

general.quote: Hating people is like burning down your own house to get rid of a rat.
general.author: harry emerson fosdick

general.quote: He who leaves his house in search of happiness pursues a shadow.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: A man’s house is his castle.
general.author: edward coke

general.quote: My kid’s idea of a hard life is to live in a house with only one phone.
general.author: george foreman

general.quote: The ornament of a house is the friends who frequent it.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson quotes

general.quote: A comfortable house is a great source of happiness. It ranks immediately after health and a good conscience.
general.author: sydney smith

general.quote: Getting your house in order and reducing the confusion gives you more control over your life. Personal organization somehow releases or frees you to operate more effectively.
general.author: larry king

general.quote: One cat in a house is a sign of loneliness.
general.author: edward dahlberg

general.quote: The house is a castle which the King cannot enter.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson

general.quote: May the forces of evil become confused on the way to your house.
general.author: george carlin

general.quote: I had three chairs in my house: one for solitude, two for friendship, and three for society.
general.author: henry david thoreau

general.quote: Every well built house started in the form of a definite purpose plus a definite plan in the nature of a set of blueprints.
general.author: napoleon hill quotes

general.quote: The difference between a house and a home is like the difference between a man and a woman–it might be embarrassing to explain, but it would be very unusual to get them confused.
general.author: daniel handler

general.quote: The labor of women in the house, certainly, enables men to produce more wealth than they otherwise could; and in this way women are economic factors in society. But so are horses.
general.author: charlotte p. gillman

general.quote: A house is made of walls and beams; a home is built with love and dreams.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: A good laugh is sunshine in the house.
general.author: william m. thackeray

general.quote: A house is not a home unless it contains food and fire for the mind as well as the body.
general.author: margaret witter fuller

general.quote: Every house where love abides and friendship is a guest, is surely home, and home sweet home , for there the heart can rest.
general.author: henry van dyke

general.quote: Let me live in a house by the side of the road and be a friend to man.
general.author: sam walter foss

general.quote: If I were asked to name the chief benefit of the house, I should say: the house shelters day-dreaming, the house protects the dreamer, the house allows one to dream in peace.
general.author: gaston bachelard

general.quote: Your treasure house is within; it contains all you’ll ever need.
general.author: hui-hai

general.quote: A house is a machine for living in.
general.author: le corbusier

general.quote: If you burn your neighbor’s house down, it doesn’t make your house look any better.
general.author: lou holtz

general.quote: Character is like the foundation of a house — it is below the surface.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: There is nothing nobler or more admirable than when two people who see eye to eye keep house as man and wife, confounding their enemies and delighting their friends.
general.author: authour unknown

general.quote: One may make their house a palace of shame, or they can make it a home, a refuge.
general.author: mark twain quotes

general.quote: I loved the house the way you would any new house, because it is populated by your future, the family of children who will fill it with noise or chaos and satisfying busy pleasures.
general.author: jane smiley

general.quote: Houses are like the human beings that inhabit them.
general.author: victor hugo quotes

general.quote: Have nothing in your house that you do not know to be useful, or believe to be beautiful.
general.author: william morris

general.quote: May this house stand until an ant drinks the ocean and a tortoise circles the world.
general.author: jonathan carroll

general.quote: People who live in a glass house have to answer the door.
general.author: karl pilkington

general.quote: I’ve got seven kids. The three words you hear most around my house are ‘hello’, ‘goodbye’, and ‘I’m pregnant’.
general.author: dean martin

general.quote: No guest is so welcome in a friend’s house that he will not become a nuisance after three days.
general.author: plautus

general.quote: A house divided against itself cannot stand.
general.author: abraham lincoln quotes

general.quote: Hate has no place in the house of God.
general.author: desmond tutu

general.quote: The White House is the finest prison in the world.
general.author: harry s truman

general.quote: A house that does not have one warm, comfy chair in it is soulless.
general.author: may sarton

general.quote: Home is the place where we are treated the best, but grumble the most.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: If you break your neck, if you have nothing to eat, if your house is on fire, then you got a problem. Everything else is inconvenience.
general.author: robert fulghum

general.quote: A house must be built on solid foundations if it is to last. The same principle applies to man, otherwise he too will sink back into the soft ground and becomes swallowed up by the world of illusion.
general.author: sai baba

general.quote: The ego is not master in its own house.
general.author: sigmund freud

general.quote: The trouble with being a parent is that by the time you are experienced, you are unemployed.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: The unjustifiable severity of a parent is loaded with this aggravation, that those whom he injures are always in his sight.
general.author: joseph addison quotes

general.quote: Was there ever a grandparent, bushed after a day of minding noisy youngsters, who hasn’t felt the Lord knew what He was doing when He gave little children to young people?
general.author: joe e. wells

general.quote: The most important thing that parents can teach their children is how to get along without them.
general.author: frank a. clark

general.quote: Children learn to smile from their parents.
general.author: shinichi suzuki

general.quote: The guys who fear becoming fathers don’t understand that fathering is not something perfect men do, but something that perfects the man. The end product of child raising is not the child but the parent.
general.author: frank pittman

general.quote: Parents, they’re strict on you when you’re little, and you don’t understand why. But as you get older, you understand and you appreciate it.
general.author: grant hill

general.quote: Parenthood is not an object of appetite or even desire. It is an object of will. There is no appetite for parenthood; there is only a purpose or intention of parenthood.
general.author: robin g. collingwood

general.quote: The secret of dealing successfully with a child is not to be its parent.
general.author: mel lazarus

general.quote: The thing that impresses me most about America is the way parents obey their children.
general.author: edward, duke of windsor

general.quote: There are no illegitimate children — only illegitimate parents.
general.author: leon r. yankwich

general.quote: Is the parent better than the child into whom he has cast his ripened being? Whence, then, this worship of the past?
general.author: ralph waldo emerson quotes

general.quote: Children are natural mimics who act like their parents despite every effort to teach them good manners.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: Because of their size, parents may be difficult to discipline properly.
general.author: p.j. o’rourke

general.quote: A wise parent humors the desire for independent action, so as to become the friend and advisor when his absolute rule shall cease.
general.author: elizabeth gaskell

general.quote: It’s a sad moment, really, when parents first become a bit frightened of their children.
general.author: ama ata aidoo

general.quote: Children begin by loving their parents; as they grow older they judge them; sometimes they forgive them.
general.author: oscar wilde quotes

general.quote: Parenthood: That state of being better chaperoned than you were before marriage.
general.author: marcelene cox

general.quote: Having children makes one no more a parent than having a piano makes you a pianist.
general.author: michael levine

general.quote: It is not a bad thing that children should occasionally, and politely, put parents in their place.
general.author: colette

general.quote: In order to influence a child, one must be careful not to be that child’s parent or grandparent.
general.author: don marquis

general.quote: You don’t really understand human nature unless you know why a child on a merry-go-round will wave at his parents every time around — and why his parents will always wave back.
general.author: william d. tammeus

general.quote: How many hopes and fears, how many ardent wishes and anxious apprehensions are twisted together in the threads that connect the parent with the child!
general.author: samuel g. goodrich

general.quote: Parenthood remains the greatest single preserve of the amateur.
general.author: alvin toffler

general.quote: Parents send their children to college either because they went to college, or because they didn’t.
general.author: l. l. hendren

general.quote: Parents know best how to push our buttons because they installed them.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: We never know the love of the parent till we become parents ourselves.
general.author: henry ward beecher quotes

general.quote: My heroes are and were my parents. I can’t see having anyone else as my heroes.
general.author: michael jordan

general.quote: To a father, when a child dies, the future dies; to a child when a parent dies, the past dies.
general.author: red auerbach

general.quote: A lot of parents pack up their troubles and send them off to summer camp.
general.author: raymond duncan

general.quote: The best inheritance a parent can give his children is a few minutes of his time each day.
general.author: orlando a. battista

general.quote: The first half of our lives is ruined by our parents and the second half by our children.
general.author: clarence darrow

general.quote: If your parents didn’t have any children, there’s a good chance that you won’t have any.
general.author: clarence day

general.quote: Parents wonder why the streams are bitter, when they themselves have poisoned the fountain.
general.author: john locke

general.quote: Parents often talk about the younger generation as if they didn’t have anything to do with it.
general.author: haim ginott

general.quote: The pressures of being a parent are equal to any pressure on earth. To be a conscious parent, and really look to that little being’s mental and physical health, is a responsibility which most of us, including me, avoid most of the time because it’s too hard.
general.author: john lennon

general.quote: The child supplies the power but the parents have to do the steering.
general.author: benjamin spock

general.quote: The word NO, carries a lot more meaning when spoken by a parent who also knows how to say yes.
general.author: joyce maynard

general.quote: Most of us become parents long before we have stopped being children.
general.author: mignon mclaughlin

general.quote: Parents are not quite interested injustice, they are interested in quiet.
general.author: bill cosby

general.quote: The joys of parents are secret, and so are their grieves and fears.
general.author: francis bacon

general.quote: Respect the child. Be not too much his parent. Trespass not on his solitude.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson quotes

general.quote: There is no friendship, no love, like that of the parent for the child.
general.author: henry ward beecher

general.quote: There may be some doubt as to who are the best people to have charge of children, but there can be no doubt that parents are the worst.
general.author: george bernard shaw quotes

general.quote: If you have never been hated by your child, you have never been a parent.
general.author: bette davis

general.quote: Parents are the last people on earth who ought to have children.
general.author: samuel butler

general.quote: A parent who has never apologized to his children is a monster. If he’s always apologizing, his children are monsters.
general.author: mignon mclaughlin

general.quote: Where parents do too much for their children, the children will not do much for themselves.
general.author: elbert hubbard

general.quote: From where can your authority and license as a parent come from, when you who are old, do worse things?
general.author: (decimus junius juvenalis) juvenal

general.quote: The quickest way for a parent to get a child’s attention is to sit down and look comfortable.
general.author: lane olinghouse

general.quote: Parenthood is a lot easier to get into than out of.
general.author: bruce lansky

general.quote: A broad margin of leisure is as beautiful in a man’s life as in a book. Haste makes waste, no less in life than in housekeeping.
general.author: henry david thoreau

general.quote: Housekeeping is like being caught in a revolving door.
general.author: marcelene cox

general.quote: They’re sure housework won’t kill you, but why take the risk?
general.author: unknown

general.quote: There was no need to do any housework at all. After the first four years the dirt doesn’t get any worse.
general.author: quentin crisp

general.quote: My theory on housework is, if the item doesn’t multiply, smell, catch fire, or block the refrigerator door, let it be. No one else cares. Why should you?
general.author: erma bombeck

general.quote: My second favorite household chore is ironing. My first being hitting my head on the top bunk bed until I faint.
general.author: erma bombeck

general.quote: My idea of superwoman is someone who scrubs her own floors.
general.author: bette midler

general.quote: My idea of housework is to sweep the room with a glance.
general.author: erma bombeck

general.quote: Love is the thing that enables a woman to sing while she mops up the floor after her husband has walked across it in his barn boots.
general.author: hoosier farmer

general.quote: I think housework is the reason most women go to the office.
general.author: heloise cruse

general.quote: Housework is something you do that nobody notices until you don’t do it.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: God made rainy days so gardeners could get the housework done.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: Few tasks are more like the torture of Sisyphus than housework, with its endless repetition: the clean becomes soiled, the soiled is made clean, over and over, day after day.
general.author: simone de beauvoir

general.quote: Cleaning your house while your kids are still growing is like shoveling the walk before it stops snowing.
general.author: phyllis diller

general.quote: Beauty is also to be found in a day’s work.
general.author: mamie sypert burns

general.quote: [H]ousework, if it is done right, can kill you.
general.author: john skow

general.quote: The labor of women in the house, certainly, enables men to produce more wealth than they otherwise could; and in this way women are economic factors in society. But so are horses.
general.author: charlotte p. gillman

general.quote: At worst, a house unkept cannot be so distressing as a life unlived.
general.author: rose macaulay

general.quote: We are used to cleaning the outside house, but the most important house to clean is yourself – your own house – which we never do.
general.author: marina abramovic

general.quote: Cleaning your house while your kids are still growing is like shoveling the sidewalk before it stops snowing.
general.author: phyllis diller

general.quote: Housework is what a woman does that nobody notices unless she hasn’t done it.
general.author: evan esar

general.quote: You all know that even when women have full rights, they still remain fatally downtrodden because all housework is left to them. In most cases housework is the most unproductive, the most barbarous and the most arduous work a woman can do. It is exceptionally petty and does not include anything that would in any way promote the development of the woman.
general.author: vladimir ilyich lenin

general.quote: Housework expands to fill the time you have for it.
general.author: hayley foster

general.quote: In my house I’m the boss, my wife is just the decision maker.
general.author: woody allen

general.quote: As a housewife, I feel that if the kids are still alive when my husband gets home from work, then hey, I’ve done my job.
general.author: roseanne barr

general.quote: Housework is a breeze. Cooking is a pleasant diversion.
general.author: fawn m. brodie

general.quote: The worst thing about work in the house or home is that whatever you do it is destroyed, laid waste or eaten within twenty-four hours.
general.author: lady hasluck

general.quote: The house wife is an unpaid employee in her husband’s house in return for the security of being a permanent employee.
general.author: germaine greer

general.quote: I’m eighteen years behind in my ironing. There’s no use doing it now, it doesn’t fit anybody I know.
general.author: phyllis diller

general.quote: Housekeeping ain’t no joke.
general.author: louisa may alcott

general.quote: Like plowing, housework makes the ground ready for the germination of family life. The kids will not invite a teacher home if beer cans litter the living room. The family isn’t likely to have breakfast together if somebody didn’t remember to buy eggs, milk, or muffins. Housework maintains an orderly setting in which family life can flourish.
general.author: letty cottin pogrebin

general.quote: A man builds a fine house; and now he has a master, and a task for life: he is to furnish, watch, show it, and keep it in repair, the rest of his days.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson

general.quote: The important thing about women today is, as they get older, they still keep house. It’s one reason why they don’t die, but men die when they retire. Women just polish the teacups.
general.author: margaret mead

general.quote: Housework is work directly opposed to the possibility of human self-actualization.
general.author: ann oakley

general.quote: When a gay person turns his back on you, it is anything but an insult; it’s an invitation.
general.author: rush limbaugh

general.quote: The only man who is really free is the one who can turn down an invitation to dinner without giving an excuse.
general.author: jules renard

general.quote: A dinner invitation, once accepted, is a sacred obligation. If you die before the dinner takes place, your executor must attend.
general.author: ward mcallister

general.quote: A real conversation always contains an invitation. You are inviting another person to reveal herself or himself to you, to tell you who they are or what they want.
general.author: david whyte

general.quote: An invitation to a wedding invokes more trouble than a summons to a police court.
general.author: william feather

general.quote: Each morning, we awaken to the light and the invitation to a new day in the world of time; each night, we surrender to the dark to be taken to play in the world of dreams where time is no more.
general.author: john o’donohue

general.quote: When ‘happiness’ eludes us – as, eventually, it always will – we have the invitation to examine our programmed responses and to exercise our power to choose again.
general.author: richard rohr

general.quote: When autumn darkness falls, what we will remember are the small acts of kindness: a cake, a hug, an invitation to talk, and every single rose. These are all expressions of a nation coming together and caring about its people.
general.author: jens stoltenberg

general.quote: Philo declares he never dines at home, and that is no exaggeration: He has no place whereat to dine in Rome, Unless he hooks an invitation.
general.author: marcus aurelius

general.quote: A commission is an invitation to fall in love.
general.author: twyla tharp

general.quote: I respectfully decline the invitation to join your hallucination.
general.author: scott adams

general.quote: I must decline your invitation owing to a subsequent engagement.
general.author: oscar wilde

general.quote: Irritation in the heart of a believer is always an invitation to the devil to stand by.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: Wherever the invitation of men or your own occasions lead you, speak the very truth, as your life and conscience teach it, and cheer the waiting, fainting hearts of men with new hope and new revelation.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson

general.quote: You don’t have to accept the invitation to get angry. Instead, practice forgiveness, empathy and encouragement.
general.author: dan fallon

general.quote: Good daughters make good mothers.
general.author: abigail g. whittlesey

general.quote: Certain is it that there is no kind of affection so purely angelic as of a father to a daughter. In love to our wives there is desire; to our sons, ambition; but to our daughters there is something which there are no words to express.
general.author: joseph addison

general.quote: I only have two rules for my newly born daughter: she will dress well and never have sex.
general.author: john malkovich

general.quote: Many a man wishes he were strong enough to tear a telephone book in half – especially if he has a teenage daughter.
general.author: guy lombardo

general.quote: Oh, high is the price of parenthood, and daughters may cost you double. You dare not forget, as you thought you could, that youth is a plague and a trouble.
general.author: phyllis mcginley

general.quote: To a father growing old nothing is dearer than a daughter.
general.author: euripides

general.quote: My eleven year old daughter mopes around the house all day waiting for her breasts to grow.
general.author: bill cosby

general.quote: There’s something like a line of gold thread running through a man’s words when he talks to his daughter, and gradually over the years it gets to be long enough for you to pick up in your hands and weave into a cloth that feels like love itself.
general.author: john gregory brown

general.quote: Mothers and daughters are closest, when daughters become mothers.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: We’ve begun to raise daughters more like sons, but few have the courage to raise our sons more like our daughters.
general.author: gloria steinem

general.quote: Ability is what will get you to the top if the boss has no daughter.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: I have three daughters and I find as a result I played King Lear almost without rehearsal.
general.author: peter ustinov

general.quote: As the lily among thorns, so is my love among the daughters.
general.author: solomon ibn gabirol

general.quote: Old as she was, she still missed her daddy sometimes.
general.author: gloria naylor

general.quote: A daughter may outgrow your lap, but she will never outgrow your heart.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: See, indeed, that your daughter is thoroughly grounded and experienced in household duties; but take care, through religion and poetry, to keep her heart open to heaven.
general.author: johann paul richter

general.quote: Fame is rot; daughters are the thing.
general.author: james matthew barrie

general.quote: If you would have a good wife, marry one who has been a good daughter.
general.author: thomas fuller

general.quote: A mother’s treasure is her daughter.
general.author: catherine pulsifer

general.quote: Daughters are like flowers, they fill the world with beauty, and sometimes attract pests.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: A daughter is the happy memories of the past, the joyful moments of the present, and the hope and promise of the future.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: Of all the haunting moments of motherhood, few rank with hearing your own words come out of your daughter’s mouth.
general.author: victoria secunda

general.quote: Watching your daughter being collected by her date feels like handing over a million dollar Stradivarius to a gorilla.
general.author: jim bishop

general.quote: As long as a woman can look ten years younger than her own daughter, she is perfectly satisfied.
general.author: oscar wilde

general.quote: You teach your daughters the diameters of the planets and wonder when you are done that they do not delight in your company.
general.author: samuel johnson

general.quote: Our wedding was many years ago. The celebration continues to this day.
general.author: gene perret

general.quote: Many people spend more time in planning the wedding than they do in planning the marriage.
general.author: zig ziglar

general.quote: Wedding, what’s a wedding? It’s a prehistoric ritual. True, yes, but a wedding is also life at its most hopeful–full of promise and happiness and love.
general.author: jay mulvaney & doris kearns goodwin

general.quote: Weddings to me are wondrous because they are so filled with tomorrows.
general.author: mary forsell

general.quote: Fair weather weddings make fair weather lives.
general.author: richard hovey

general.quote: Pity all newlyweds. She cooks something nice for him, and he brings her flowers, and they kiss and think: How easy marriage is.
general.author: mignon mclaughlin

general.quote: A wedding dress is both an intimate and personal for a woman – it must reflect the personality and style of the bride.
general.author: carolina herrera

general.quote: The most difficult years of marriage are those following the wedding.
general.author: gary smalley

general.quote: Remember, a wedding is a celebration of your union, and there’s no price tag on what your love and your promises mean to your future. Don’t fall into the trap of thinking a bigger wedding means you love each other more.
general.author: karen schwartz

general.quote: One of the best wedding gifts God gave you was a full-length mirror called your spouse. Had there been a card attached, it would have said, "Here’s to helping you discover what you’re really like!"
general.author: gary & betsy ricucci

general.quote: To marry unequally is to suffer equally.
general.author: henri frederic amiel

general.quote: It is amazing at how small a price may the wedding ring be placed upon a worthless hand; but, by the beauty of our law, what heaps of gold are indispensable to take it off!
general.author: douglas jerold

general.quote: A woman seldom asks advice before she has bought her wedding clothes.
general.author: joseph addison

general.quote: For talk six times with the same single lady, and you may get the wedding dresses ready.
general.author: lord byron

general.quote: "I am" is reportedly the shortest sentence in the English language. Could it be that "I do" is the longest sentence?
general.author: unknown

general.quote: Every bride and groom would do well to remember that in wedding, the we comes before the I.
general.author: evan esar

general.quote: The fact is that no two weddings are alike. Who’s to say what percent of your budget needs to go to food, wine, or your gown? That’s a matter of your personal taste, finances, and circumstances.
general.author: marcy blum & laura f. kaiser

general.quote: Men marry because they are tired; women, because they are curious; both are disappointed.
general.author: oscar wilde

general.quote: Single people are precious fodder at weddings.
general.author: rebecca gregson

general.quote: It isn’t tying himself to one woman that a man dreads when he thinks of marrying; it’s separating himself from all the others.
general.author: helen rowland

general.quote: A wedding is the last gasp of your childhood family.
general.author: karen schwartz

general.quote: Three rings of marriage are the engagement ring, the wedding ring, and the suffering.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: A wedding is the formality a man has to go through before going to work for a new boss.
general.author: evan esar

general.quote: I dreamed of a wedding of elaborate elegance, a church filled with flowers and friends. I asked him what kind of wedding he wished for; he said one that would make me his wife.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: The funny thing is that although we place so much energy and importance on our wedding day, it isn’t the biggest day of our life. The biggest day of your life is every day thereafter. Because it’s not the pledge to love someone that matters, but the act of fulfilling that pledge that is most important.
general.author: laura wolf

general.quote: Many a wedding takes place when a man can’t afford to go steady with a girl any longer.
general.author: evan esar

general.quote: A wedding in haste is worth two at leisure.
general.author: gelett burgess

general.quote: Wedding rings: the world’s smallest handcuffs.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: Saw a wedding in the church. It was strange to see what delight we married people have to see these poor fools decoyed into our condition.
general.author: samuel pepys

general.quote: Men have a much better time of it than women. For one thing, they marry later; for another thing, they die earlier.
general.author: h.l. mencken

general.quote: Weddings are the biggest relationship killers out there. If you can survive the wedding, they say, the rest is a piece of cake.
general.author: noah hawley

general.quote: When a girl marries she exchanges the attentions of many men for the inattention of one.
general.author: helen rowland

general.quote: So heavy is the chain of wedlock that it needs two to carry it, and sometimes three.
general.author: alexandre dumas, fils

general.quote: The problem with being best man at a wedding is that you never get a chance to prove it.
general.author: jason mcintosh

general.quote: A person’s character is but half formed till after wedlock.
general.author: charles simmons

general.quote: The surest way to be alone is to get married.
general.author: gloria steinem

general.quote: I’ve sometimes thought of marrying, and then I’ve thought again.
general.author: noel coward

general.quote: A wedding anniversary is the celebration of love, trust, partnership, tolerance and tenacity. The order varies for any given year.
general.author: paul sweeney

general.quote: Never marry a man who hates his mother, because he’ll end up hating you.
general.author: jill bennett

general.quote: [W]hen you realize you want to spend the rest of your life with somebody, you want the rest of your life to start as soon as possible.
general.author: nora ephron

general.quote: I chose my wife, as she did her wedding gown, for qualities that would wear well.
general.author: oliver goldsmith

general.quote: The groom always smiles proudly because he’s convinced he’s accomplished something quite wonderful. The bride smiles because she’s been able to convince him of it.
general.author: judith mcnaught

general.quote: And when will there be an end of marrying? I suppose, when there is an end of living!
general.author: tertullian

general.quote: Remember that weddings are truly primal rituals and set off chains of chaos in even the most stable of family units.
general.author: tess ayers & paul brown

general.quote: A wedding is not a wedding without the feast — the ceremonial extension of celebration to the community, where the meal laid on is not just a feeding but an elaborate and extravagant bacchanal, accompanied by much drinking and the offering of public toasts.
general.author: karl e. scheibe

general.quote: If you are afraid of loneliness, don’t marry.
general.author: anton chekhov

general.quote: An invitation to a wedding invokes more trouble than a summons to a police court.
general.author: william feather

general.quote: Divorce has become so easy nowadays that women have stopped crying at weddings.
general.author: evan esar

general.quote: Music played at weddings always reminds me of the music played for soldiers before they go into battle.
general.author: heinrich heine

general.quote: Bride: A woman with a fine prospect of happiness behind her.
general.author: ambrose bierce

general.quote: He’s the kind of man a woman would have to marry to get rid of.
general.author: mae west

general.quote: Weddings are not over until they are sealed with a kiss.
general.author: susan marg

general.quote: Don’t marry the person you think you can live with; marry only the individual you think you can’t live without.
general.author: james c. dobson

general.quote: A man marries to have a home, but also because he doesn’t want to be bothered with sex and all that sort of thing.
general.author: w. somerset maugham

general.quote: Wedding is destiny, and hanging likewise.
general.author: john heywood

general.quote: A wedding is just like a funeral except that you get to smell your own flowers.
general.author: grace hansen

general.quote: I cried during my wedding, but my wife did not. That’s natural, because I was losing my freedom, and she was gaining a slave.
general.author: jarod kintz

general.quote: The sight of a wedding always has a disturbing effect on young girls; at such moments a mysterious sense of solidarity with their own sex takes possession of them.
general.author: stefan zweig

general.quote: Getting married is a lot like getting into a tub of hot water. After you get used to it, it ain’t so hot.
general.author: minnie pearl

general.quote: By all means marry; if you get a good wife, you’ll be happy; if you get a bad one, you’ll become a philosopher.
general.author: socrates

general.quote: There’s nothing like a Catholic wedding to make you wish life had a fast forward button.
general.author: daniel chopin

general.quote: Wedding: the point at which a man stops toasting a woman and begins roasting her.
general.author: helen rowland

general.quote: Weddings remind us that our lives have meaning and that love is the strongest bond, the happiest joy, and the loveliest healing we can ever experience.
general.author: daphne rose kingma

general.quote: When you’re in a relationship, you’re always surrounded by a ring of circumstances… joined together by a wedding ring, or in a boxing ring.
general.author: bob seger

general.quote: If I ever marry, it will be on a sudden impulse — as a man shoots himself.
general.author: h.l. mencken

general.quote: A gloomy guest fits not a wedding feast.
general.author: johann friedrich von schiller

general.quote: Weddings are important because they celebrate life and possibility.
general.author: anne hathaway

general.quote: They say that a kingdom is like a pyramid: the king on top and the people below. But in this country, it’s upside down.
general.author: bhumibol adulyadej

general.quote: It is the patriotic duty of every man to lie for his country.
general.author: alfred adler

general.quote: If we love our country, we should also love our countrymen.
general.author: ronald reagan

general.quote: The country is lyric,–the town dramatic. When mingled, they make the most perfect musical drama.
general.author: henry wadsworth longfellow

general.quote: The history of every country begins in the heart of a man or a woman.
general.author: willa cather

general.quote: Healthy citizens are the greatest asset any country can have.
general.author: winston churchill

general.quote: Patriotism is supporting your country all the time, and your government when it deserves it.
general.author: mark twain

general.quote: There is virtue in country houses, in gardens and orchards, in fields, streams, and groves, in rustic recreations and plain manners, that neither cities nor universities enjoy.
general.author: amos bronson alcott

general.quote: Humanity has won its battle. Liberty now has a country.
general.author: marquis de lafayette

general.quote: No country can really develop unless its citizens are educated.
general.author: nelson mandela

general.quote: Men are taught virtue and a love of independence by living in the country.
general.author: menander

general.quote: To get to know a country, you must have direct contact with the earth. It’s futile to gaze at the world through a car window.
general.author: albert einstein

general.quote: Our country is great because it is built on principles of self-reliance, opportunity, innovation, and compassion for others.
general.author: ronald reagan

general.quote: One country, one constitution, one destiny.
general.author: daniel webster

general.quote: May God save the country, for it is evident that the people will not.
general.author: millard fillmore

general.quote: I consider it the best part of an education to have been born and brought up in the country.
general.author: amos bronson alcott

general.quote: To make us love our country, our country ought to be lovely.
general.author: edmund burke

general.quote: The town is man’s world, but this (country life) is of God.
general.author: william cowper

general.quote: My country is the world; my countrymen are mankind.
general.author: william lloyd garrison

general.quote: Who saves his country violates no law.
general.author: napoleon bonaparte

general.quote: Our country is where ever we are well off.
general.author: john milton

general.quote: If country life be healthful to the body, it is no less so to the mind.
general.author: giovanni ruffini

general.quote: My country is the world, and my religion is to do good.
general.author: thomas paine

general.quote: My country… gave me schooling, independence of action and opportunity for service..:. I am indebted to my country beyond any human power to repay.
general.author: herbert clark hoover

general.quote: Those who own the country ought to govern it.
general.author: john jay

general.quote: The king must die so that the country can live.
general.author: maximilien robespierre

general.quote: The World is my country, all mankind are my brethren, and to do good is my religion.
general.author: thomas paine

general.quote: My country wrong or right is like saying my mother, drunk or sober.
general.author: gilbert k. chesterton

general.quote: In any country there must be people who have to die. They are the Sacrifices any nation has to make to achieve law and order.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: This country will not be a good place for any of us to live in unless we make it a good place for all of us to live in.
general.author: theodore roosevelt

general.quote: Though I love my country, I do not love my countrymen.
general.author: lord byron

general.quote: Thank God we’re living in a country where the sky’s the limit, the stores are open late and you can shop in bed thanks to television.
general.author: joan rivers

general.quote: There’s no glory like those who save their country.
general.author: lord alfred tennyson

general.quote: My fellow Americans, ask not what your country can do for you, ask what you can do for your country.
general.author: john f. kennedy

general.quote: God made the country and man made the town.
general.author: william cowper

general.quote: Every perfect traveler always creates the country where he travels.
general.author: nikos kazantzakis

general.quote: Without a country, I am not a man.
general.author: nawaf al-nasir al-sabah

general.quote: Townfolk know pleasures, country people joys.
general.author: minna thomas antrim

general.quote: The city reveals the moral ends of being, and sets the awful problem of life. The country soothes us, refreshes us, lifts us up with religious suggestion.
general.author: edwin hubbell chapin

general.quote: The love of one’s country is a splendid thing — but why should love stop at the border?
general.author: pablo casals

general.quote: Next to the love of God, the love of country is the best preventive of crime.
general.author: george borrow

general.quote: Our roots say we’re sisters, our hearts say we’re friends.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: A sister shares childhood memories and grown-up dreams.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: Sisters function as safety nets in a chaotic world simply by being there for each other.
general.author: carol saline

general.quote: Sisters is probably the most competitive relationship within the family, but once the sisters are grown, it becomes the strongest relationship.
general.author: margaret mead

general.quote: More than Santa Claus, your sister knows when you’ve been bad and good.
general.author: linda sunshine

general.quote: Sister is probably the most competitive relationship within the family, but once the sisters are grown, it becomes the strongest relationship.
general.author: margaret mead

general.quote: A sister is a forever friend.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: An older sister helps one remain half child, half woman.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: It was nice growing up with someone like you — someone to lean on, someone to count on… someone to tell on!
general.author: unknown

general.quote: Big sisters are the crab grass in the lawn of life.
general.author: charles m. schulz

general.quote: Help one another, is part of the religion of sisterhood.
general.author: louisa may alcott

general.quote: Sweet is the voice of a sister in the season of sorrow, and wise is the counsel of those who love us.
general.author: benjamin disraeli
