general.quote: Sisters may share the same mother and father but appear to come from different families.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: How do people make it through life without a sister?
general.author: sara corpening

general.quote: A sister is a gift to the heart, a friend to the spirit, a golden thread to the meaning of life.
general.author: isadora james

general.quote: In the cookies of life, sisters are the chocolate chips.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: A sister can be seen as someone who is both ourselves and very much not ourselves – a special kind of double.
general.author: toni morrison

general.quote: When sisters stand shoulder to shoulder, who stands a chance against us?
general.author: pam brown

general.quote: An older sister is a friend and defender — a listener, conspirator, a counsellor and a sharer of delights. And sorrows too.
general.author: pam brown

general.quote: Having a sister is like having a best friend you can’t get rid of. You know whatever you do, they’ll still be there.
general.author: amy li

general.quote: You can kid the world. But not your sister.
general.author: charlotte gray

general.quote: Sisters are blossoms in the garden of life.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: The best thing about having a sister was that I always had a friend.
general.author: cali rae turner

general.quote: A sister smiles when one tells one’s stories — for she knows where the decoration has been added.
general.author: chris montaigne

general.quote: There’s nobody in the world that knows me better than my sister.
general.author: tia mowry

general.quote: It’s hard to be responsible, adult and sensible all the time. How good it is to have a sister whose heart is as young as your own.
general.author: pam brown

general.quote: In thee my soul shall own combined the sister and the friend.
general.author: catherine killigrew

general.quote: I know my older sister loves me because she gives me all her old clothes and has to go out and buy new ones.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: Sisterly love is, of all sentiments, the most abstract. Nature does not grant it any functions.
general.author: ugo betti

general.quote: If your sister is in a tearing hurry to go out and cannot catch your eye, she’s wearing your best sweater.
general.author: pam brown

general.quote: Our brothers and sisters are there with us from the dawn of our personal stories to the inevitable dusk.
general.author: susan scarf merrell

general.quote: Sisters may share the same mother and father but appear to come from different families.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: You keep your past by having sisters. As you get older, they’re the only ones who don’t get bored if you talk about your memories.
general.author: deborah moggach

general.quote: There can be no situation in life in which the conversation of my dear sister will not administer some comfort to me.
general.author: mary montagu

general.quote: One of the best things about being an adult is the realization that you can share with your sister and still have plenty for yourself.
general.author: betsy cohen

general.quote: The mildest, drowsiest sister has been known to turn tiger if her sibling is in trouble.
general.author: clara ortega

general.quote: My sister taught me everything I really need to know, and she was only in sixth grade at the time.
general.author: linda sunshine

general.quote: We may look old and wise to the outside world. But to each other, we are still in junior school.
general.author: charlotte gray

general.quote: There is no better friend than a sister. And there is no better sister than you.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: Sisterhood is powerful.
general.author: robin morgan

general.quote: We acquire friends and we make enemies, but our sisters come with the territory.
general.author: evelyn loeb

general.quote: A sister is a little bit of childhood that can never be lost.
general.author: marion c. garretty

general.quote: Elder sisters never can do younger ones justice!
general.author: charlotte m. yonge

general.quote: When mom and dad don’t understand, a sister always will.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: Sisters never quite forgive each other for what happened when they were five.
general.author: pam brown

general.quote: Sisters share the scent and smells — the feel of a common childhood.
general.author: pam brown

general.quote: What’s the good of news if you haven’t a sister to share it?
general.author: jenny devries

general.quote: Sisters are different flowers from the same garden.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: Sisters are blossoms in the garden of life.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: Of two sisters one is always the watcher, one the dancer.
general.author: louise glück

general.quote: Between sisters, often, the child’s cry never dies down. "Never leave me," it says; "do not abandon me."
general.author: louise bernikow

general.quote: Bless you, my darling, and remember you are always in the heart — oh tucked so close there is no chance of escape — of your sister.
general.author: katherine mansfield

general.quote: I don’t think anybody whose ever been divorced can tell you divorce is easy or fun or feels like anything other than a tremendous failure.
general.author: sharon stone

general.quote: If it isn’t a success, that still wouldn’t be grounds for divorce.
general.author: geena davis

general.quote: France may claim the happiest marriages in the world, but the happiest divorces in the world are "made in America.
general.author: helen rowland

general.quote: The pretentiously named ensuite bathroom is a major factor in divorce. Privacy is paramount in marriage.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: Divorce is expensive. I used to joke they were going to call it ‘all the money,’ but they changed it to ‘alimony.’ It’s ripping your heart out through your wallet.
general.author: robin williams

general.quote: Nowadays love is a matter of chance, matrimony a matter of money and divorce a matter of course.
general.author: helen rowland

general.quote: You can’t underestimate how traumatic divorce is for the children.
general.author: isla fisher

general.quote: So many persons think divorce a panacea for every ill, who find out, when they try it, that the remedy is worse than the disease.
general.author: dorothy dix

general.quote: The only solid and lasting peace between a man and his wife is, doubtless, a separation.
general.author: philip dormer stanhope chesterfield

general.quote: Any woman who votes for no-fault divorce is like a turkey voting for Thanksgiving.
general.author: pat robertson

general.quote: Divorce is a declaration of independence with only two signers.
general.author: gerald f. lieberman

general.quote: The possibility of divorce renders both marriage partners stricter in their observance of the duties they owe to each other. Divorces help to improve morals and to increase the population.
general.author: denis diderot

general.quote: Divorce isn’t the child’s fault. Don’t say anything unkind about your ex to the child, because you’re really just hurting the child.
general.author: valerie bertinelli

general.quote: In every marriage more than a week old, there are grounds for divorce. The trick is to find, and continue to find, grounds for marriage.
general.author: robert anderson

general.quote: Divorce is hard and painful and complicated, and something you have to grow through.
general.author: sharon stone

general.quote: One study found that people who smile in childhood photographs are less likely to get a divorce.
general.author: jenna mccarthy

general.quote: It is he who has broken the bond of marriage — not I. I only break its bondage.
general.author: oscar wilde

general.quote: I do not consider divorce an evil by any means. It is just as much a refuge for women married to brutal men as Canada was to the slaves of brutal masters.
general.author: susan b. anthony

general.quote: If divorce has increased by one thousand percent, don’t blame the women’s movement. Blame the obsolete sex roles on which our marriages were based.
general.author: betty friedan

general.quote: Divorce is a failed challenge, which leads to a broken life. It is a socially transmittable disease that can transfer from one generation to another, and it is spreading fast.
general.author: sia f. dean

general.quote: Being divorced is like being hit by a Mack truck. If you live through it, you start looking very carefully to the right and to the left.
general.author: jean kerr

general.quote: Love, the quest; marriage, the conquest; divorce, the inquest.
general.author: helen rowland

general.quote: Getting divorced just because you don’t love a man is almost as silly as getting married just because you do.
general.author: zsa zsa gabor

general.quote: I don’t see divorce as a failure. I see it as the end to a story. In a story, everything has an end and a beginning.
general.author: olga kurylenko

general.quote: It takes two to destroy a marriage.
general.author: margaret trudeau

general.quote: My divorce came to me as a complete surprise. That’s what happens when you haven’t been home in eighteen years.
general.author: lee trevino

general.quote: Let me be serious: divorce is a sacred institution between a man and a woman who hate each other. God wanted Adam to pay alimony to Eve, not Steve.
general.author: lewis black

general.quote: Once you love something, you can never stop loving it. Even after a divorce, the heart will not stop loving.
general.author: gregory david roberts

general.quote: You know, that’s the only good thing about divorce; you get to sleep with your mother.
general.author: clare booth luce

general.quote: Divorce is the one human tragedy that reduces everything to cash.
general.author: rita mae brown

general.quote: There’s nothing like a family crisis, especially a divorce, to force a person to re-evaluate his life.
general.author: michael douglas

general.quote: For a couple with young children, divorce seldom comes as a "solution" to stress, only as a way to end one form of pain and accept another.
general.author: fred rogers

general.quote: The biggest financial pitfall in life is divorce. And the biggest reason for divorce is marriage.
general.author: gene simmons

general.quote: The best advice I have for other parents going through a divorce is that the kids need to know that both of their parents are good people.
general.author: bradly whitford

general.quote: I am a marvelous housekeeper. Every time I leave a man I keep his house.
general.author: zsa zsa gabor

general.quote: The real wonder is that anyone stays together, as impossible to live with and as broken as we all are.
general.author: kyran pittman

general.quote: know one husband and wife who, whatever the official reasons given to the court for the break up of their marriage, were really divorced because the husband believed that nobody ought to read while he was talking and the wife that nobody ought to talk while she was reading.
general.author: vera brittain

general.quote: Divorce is not easy, but if you genuinely put your kids first, that dictates the civility you should show each other. What example are you otherwise?
general.author: dawn french

general.quote: I’ve given my memoirs far more thought than any of my marriages. You can’t divorce a book.
general.author: gloria swanson

general.quote: You can fire your secretary, divorce your spouse, abandon your children. But they remain your co-authors forever.
general.author: ellen goodman

general.quote: You can’t stay married in a situation where you are afraid to go to sleep in case your wife might cut your throat.
general.author: mike tyson

general.quote: In our family we don’t divorce our men — we bury them.
general.author: ruth gordon

general.quote: Divorce is a time of change. It really rocks a foundation of most people’s lives. When we have our heart broken or our dreams taken away from us, it is a time of growth and change.
general.author: debbie ford

general.quote: You have to be with the right person. It’s so much more important to meet the right person, whether you’re married or not, than it is to get married and get a divorce.
general.author: joanna garcia

general.quote: Divorce is the psychological equivalent of a triple coronary bypass.
general.author: mary kay blakeley

general.quote: Every divorce is the result of selfishness on the part of one or the other or both parties to a marriage contract.
general.author: spencer w. kimball

general.quote: Marriage problems are relationship problems, they are the result of how two people interact with each other. You may abandon a troubled marriage, but you will still bring the way you interact with others along with you.
general.author: mark gungor

general.quote: Two lives that once part are as ships that divide.
general.author: edward g. bulwer-lytton

general.quote: When two people decide to get a divorce, it isn’t a sign that they "don’t understand" one another, but a sign that they have, at last, begun to.
general.author: helen rowland

general.quote: There is a rhythm to the ending of a marriage just like the rhythm of a courtship–only backward. You try to start again but get into blaming over and over. Finally you are both worn out, exhausted, hopeless. Then lawyers are called in to pick clean the corpses. The death has occurred much earlier.
general.author: erica jong

general.quote: Divorce is a game played by lawyers.
general.author: cary grant

general.quote: There are four stages in a marriage. First there’s the affair, then the marriage, then children and finally the fourth stage, without which you cannot know a woman, the divorce.
general.author: norman mailer

general.quote: No matter how you slice it, divorce is expensive and time-consuming.
general.author: emily doskow

general.quote: A society’s apprehensiveness about divorce is an expression of its fear of change and of its resulting desire that personality remain unvarying.
general.author: elsie clew parsons

general.quote: Divorce is probably as painful as death.
general.author: william shatner

general.quote: A divorce is like an amputation; you survive, but there’s less of you.
general.author: margaret atwood

general.quote: You never really know a man until you have divorced him.
general.author: zsa zsa gabor

general.quote: I firmly believe in marriage. It’s a real important decision that takes a lot of dedication and time. If you’re thinking about divorce. You shouldn’t get married.
general.author: seth green

general.quote: Children must be considered in a divorce considered valuable pawns in the nasty legal and financial contest that is about to ensue.
general.author: p. j. o’rourke

general.quote: Friendship is the marriage of the soul, and this marriage is subject to divorce.
general.author: voltaire

general.quote: You can never be happily married to another until you get a divorce from yourself. A successful marriage demands a certain death to self.
general.author: jerry w. mccant

general.quote: I have never met a man who found it difficult to marry, but I have never found a man who found it easy to divorce either.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: Anybody who’s been through a divorce will tell you that at one point. they’ve thought murder. The line between thinking murder and doing murder isn’t that major.
general.author: oliver stone

general.quote: Divorce is one of the key predictors of poverty for a child growing up in a home that’s broken.
general.author: mike huckabee

general.quote: Conventional wisdom tells us we’ll only be happier after a divorce if the marriage itself was a war zone.
general.author: ariel gore

general.quote: Divorce is probably of nearly the same date as marriage. I believe, however, that marriage is some weeks the more ancient.
general.author: voltaire

general.quote: Divorce is one of the most financially traumatic things you can go through. Money spent on getting mad or getting even is money wasted.
general.author: richard wagner

general.quote: Divorce is fairly common these days, and I think many times people disregard the emotional impact that divorce has on a couple and a family, because it happens so frequently.
general.author: steve carell

general.quote: If you made a list of reasons why any couple got married, and another list of the reasons for their divorce, you’d have a hell of a lot of overlapping.
general.author: mignon mclaughlin

general.quote: Marriage is grand. Divorce is about twenty grand.
general.author: jay leno

general.quote: Divorce is an embarrassing public admission of defeat.
general.author: tracy letts

general.quote: Divorce is never a pleasant experience. You look upon it as a failure. But I learned to be a different person once we broke up. Sometimes you learn more from failure than you do from success.
general.author: michael crawford

general.quote: The happiest time of anyone’s life is just after the first divorce.
general.author: john kenneth galbraith

general.quote: Marriage is the chief cause of divorce.
general.author: groucho marx

general.quote: There is far too much of divorce, wherein hearts are broken, and sometimes lives are destroyed.
general.author: gordon b. hinckley

general.quote: Grown-ups are worried that they’re going to ruin their children’s lives, but divorce is just a life experience and you learn from it.
general.author: evan stern

general.quote: Divorce is one of the most stressful life events anyone goes through.
general.author: emily doskow

general.quote: Asking the legal system to resolve divorce is like asking a boxing coach to be our marriage counselor.
general.author: warren farrell

general.quote: A 99-year-old man is filing for divorce from his 96-year-old wife, making them the world’s oldest divorced couple. It’s got to be weird when a divorce lawyer is fighting for your kids to get custody of you.
general.author: jimmy fallon

general.quote: Divorce these days is a religious vow, as if the proper offspring of marriage.
general.author: tertullian

general.quote: Call your mother. Tell her you love her. Remember, you’re the only person who knows what her heart sounds like from the inside.
general.author: rachel wolchin

general.quote: The mother of boys work son-up to son-down.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: Some are kissing mothers and some are scolding mothers, but it is love just the same — and most mothers kiss and scold together.
general.author: pearl s. buck

general.quote: Biology is the least of what makes someone a mother.
general.author: oprah winfrey

general.quote: I remember my mother’s prayers and they have always followed me. They have clung to me all my life.
general.author: abraham lincoln

general.quote: All women become like their mothers. That is their tragedy. No man does. That’s his.
general.author: oscar wilde

general.quote: A little girl, asked where her home was, replied, "where mother is."
general.author: keith l. brooks

general.quote: Any mother could perform the jobs of several air traffic controllers with ease.
general.author: lisa alther

general.quote: [A] mother is one to whom you hurry when you are troubled.
general.author: emily dickinson

general.quote: Let France have good mothers, and she will have good sons.
general.author: napoleon bonaparte

general.quote: The precursor of the mirror is the mother’s face.
general.author: d.w. winnicott

general.quote: I cannot forget my mother. [S]he is my bridge. When I needed to get across, she steadied herself long enough for me to run across safely.
general.author: renita weems

general.quote: No one in the world can take the place of your mother. Right or wrong, from her viewpoint you are always right. She may scold you for little things, but never for the big ones.
general.author: harry truman

general.quote: If the whole world were put into one scale, and my mother in the other, the whole world would kick the beam.
general.author: lord langdale

general.quote: Mother’s love grows by giving.
general.author: charles lamb

general.quote: Most of all the other beautiful things in life come by twos and threes, by dozens and hundreds. Plenty of roses, stars, sunsets, rainbows, brothers and sisters, aunts and cousins, comrades and friends — but only one mother in the whole world.
general.author: kate douglas wiggin

general.quote: When you are a mother, you are never really alone in your thoughts. A mother always has to think twice, once for herself and once for her child.
general.author: sophia loren

general.quote: Being a mother means that your heart is no longer yours; it wanders wherever your children do.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: Now, as always, the most automated appliance in a household is the mother.
general.author: beverly jones

general.quote: A mother who is really a mother is never free.
general.author: honore de balzac

general.quote: Mother love is the fuel that enables a normal human being to do the impossible.
general.author: marion c. garretty,

general.quote: A mother’s heart is a patchwork of love.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: A mom’s hug lasts long after she lets go.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: A man’s work is from sun to sun, but a mother’s work is never done.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: If evolution really works, how come mothers only have two hands?
general.author: milton berle

general.quote: A mother’s yearning feels the presence of the cherished child even in the degraded man.
general.author: george eliot

general.quote: Mothers are the most instinctive philosophers.
general.author: harriet beecher stowe

general.quote: My mother had a slender, small body, but a large heart — a heart so large that everybody’s joys found welcome in it, and hospitable accommodation.
general.author: mark twain

general.quote: Mothers are fonder than fathers of their children because they are more certain they are their own.
general.author: aristotle

general.quote: My mother had a great deal of trouble with me, but I think she enjoyed it.
general.author: mark twain

general.quote: A mother’s heart is always with her children.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: My mother was the most beautiful woman I ever saw. All I am I owe to my mother. I attribute all my success in life to the moral, intellectual and physical education I received from her.
general.author: george washington

general.quote: How beautifully everything is arranged by Nature; as soon as a child enters the world, it finds a mother ready to take care of it.
general.author: jules michelet

general.quote: Youth fades; love droops; the leaves of friendship fall; A mother’s secret hope outlives them all.
general.author: oliver wendell holmes

general.quote: The tie which links mother and child is of such pure and immaculate strength as to be never violated.
general.author: washington irving

general.quote: Mother’s love is peace. It need not be acquired, it need not be deserved.
general.author: erich fromm

general.quote: One good mother is worth a hundred schoolmasters.
general.author: george herbert

general.quote: Mother is the name for God on the lips and in the hearts of little children.
general.author: william m. thackeray

general.quote: That best academy, a mother’s knee.
general.author: james russell lowell

general.quote: The moment a child is born, the mother is also born. She never existed before. The woman existed, but the mother, never. A mother is something absolutely new.
general.author: rajneesh

general.quote: Mother — that was the bank where we deposited all our hurts and worries.
general.author: t. dewitt talmage

general.quote: Being a mother is learning about strengths you didn’t know you had, and dealing with fears you didn’t know existed.
general.author: linda wooten

general.quote: Anyone who doesn’t miss the past never had a mother.
general.author: gregory nunn

general.quote: The real religion of the world comes from women much more than from men — from mothers most of all, who carry the key of our souls in their bosoms.
general.author: oliver wendell holmes

general.quote: All that I am or hope to be, I owe to my angel mother.
general.author: abraham lincoln

general.quote: A man never sees all that his mother has been to him until it’s too late to let her know he sees it.
general.author: william dean howells

general.quote: Mother weaves her loving art and leaves her magic in our hearts.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: Mother, the ribbons of your love are woven around my heart.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: The kind of power mothers have is enormous.
general.author: angela carter

general.quote: There was never a great man who had not a great mother.
general.author: olive schreiner

general.quote: Being a full-time mother is one of the highest salaried jobs in my field, since the payment is pure love.
general.author: mildred b. vermont

general.quote: All mothers are working mothers.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: The heart of a mother is a deep abyss at the bottom of which you will always find forgiveness.
general.author: honoré de balzac

general.quote: Clearly, society has a tremendous stake in insisting on a woman’s natural fitness for the career of mother: the alternatives are all too expensive.
general.author: ann oakley

general.quote: With what price we pay for the glory of motherhood.
general.author: isadora duncan

general.quote: The best place to succeed is where you are with what you have.
general.author: charles m. schwab

general.quote: The best place to seek God is in a garden. You can dig for him there.
general.author: george bernard shaw

general.quote: I moved to New York City for my health. I’m paranoid and New York was the only place where my fears were justified.
general.author: anita weiss

general.quote: A good place to visit, but a poor place to stay.
general.author: josh billings

general.quote: How hard it is to escape from places. However carefully one goes they hold you — you leave little bits of yourself fluttering on the fences — like rags and shreds of your very life.
general.author: katherine mansfield

general.quote: Home is the place where we are treated the best, but grumble the most.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: I dream of a place and a time where America will once again be seen as the last best hope on earth.
general.author: abraham lincoln

general.quote: My philosophy is that not only are you responsible for your life, but doing the best at this moment puts you in the best place for the next moment.
general.author: oprah winfrey

general.quote: A place belongs forever to whoever claims it hardest, remembers it most obsessively, wrenches it from itself, shapes it, renders it, loves it so radically that he remakes it in his own image.
general.author: joan didion

general.quote: One does not love a place the less for having suffered in it, unless it has been all suffering, nothing but suffering.
general.author: jane austen

general.quote: California’s a wonderful place to live — if you happen to be an orange.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: France is France and a grand place for Frenchman.
general.author: harry truman

general.quote: You can fall in love at first sight with a place as with a person.
general.author: alec waugh

general.quote: You do what you have to do to get through today, and that puts you in the best place tomorrow.
general.author: oprah winfrey

general.quote: Handsome widows, after a twelve-month, enjoy a latitude and longitude without limit.
general.author: honore de balzac

general.quote: The comfortable estate of widowhood is the only hope that keeps up a wife’s spirits.
general.author: john gay

general.quote: Men should think twice before making widowhood women’s only path to power.
general.author: gloria steinem

general.quote: Widows and widowers like to date each other because they understand.
general.author: lisa iannucci

general.quote: Rich widows are the only secondhand goods that sell at first-class prices.
general.author: benjamin franklin

general.quote: Young widows still bide their time.
general.author: henry wheeler shaw

general.quote: He first deceased; she for a little tried to live without him, liked it not, and died.
general.author: sir henry wotton

general.quote: A widow is a fascinating being with the flavor of maturity, the spice of experience, the piquancy of novelty, the tang of practiced coquetry, and the halo of one man’s approval.
general.author: helen rowland

general.quote: Focus on where you want to go, not where your currently are.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: In all human affairs there are efforts, and there are results, and the strength of effort is the measure of the results.
general.author: james allen

general.quote: Our deeds determine us, as much as we determine our deeds.
general.author: george eliot

general.quote: A strong determination to get the best out of life, a keen desire to enjoy what one has, and no regrets if one fails: this is the secret of the Chinese genius for contentment.
general.author: lin yutang

general.quote: If your determination is fixed, I do not counsel you to despair. Few things are impossible to diligence and skill. Great works are performed not by strength, but perseverance.
general.author: samuel johnson

general.quote: I found that I could find the energy… that I could find the determination to keep on going. I learned that your mind can amaze your body, if you just keep telling yourself, I can do it… I can do it… I can do it!
general.author: jon erikson

general.quote: If you can’t find the key to success, pick the lock.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: Enclose your heart in times of need with the steel of your determination and your strength. In doing this, all things will be bearable.
general.author: lora leigh

general.quote: Determine that the thing can and shall be done, and then we shall find the way.
general.author: abraham lincoln

general.quote: Determination gives you the resolve to keep going in spite of the roadblocks that lay before you.
general.author: denis waitley

general.quote: You’ve got to get up every morning with determination if you’re going to go to bed with satisfaction.
general.author: geroge lorimer

general.quote: To succeed in life one must have determination and must be prepared to suffer during the process. If one isn’t prepared to suffer during adversities, I don’t really see how he can be successful.
general.author: gary player

general.quote: Nothing great will ever be achieved without great men, and men are great only if they are determined to be so.
general.author: charles de gaulle

general.quote: Determination is the mental "I will" that gets results.
general.author: wesley a. stanger

general.quote: Give me a lever long enough, and a prop strong enough, I can single-handedly move the world.
general.author: archimedes

general.quote: The man who can drive himself further once the effort gets painful is the man who will win.
general.author: roger bannister

general.quote: There is one quality more important than know-how…. This is know-how by which we determine not only how to accomplish our purposes, but what our purposes are to be.
general.author: norbert weiner

general.quote: Determination that just won’t quit — that’s what it takes.
general.author: aj foyt

general.quote: Real leaders are ordinary people with extraordinary determination.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: When you locate good in yourself, approve of it with determination. When you locate evil in yourself, despise it as something detestable.
general.author: confucius

general.quote: What this power is I cannot say; all I know is that it exists and it becomes available only when a man is in that state of mind in which he knows exactly what he wants and is fully determined not to quit until he finds it.
general.author: alexander graham bell

general.quote: If you must begin, then go all the way, because if you begin and quit, the unfinished business you have left behind begins to haunt you all the time.
general.author: chogyam trungpa

general.quote: The surest way to fail is not to determine to succeed.
general.author: richard brinsley sheridan

general.quote: Determination is the fuel that propels one to higher virtues.
general.author: aaidh ibn abdullah al-qarni

general.quote: Be determined to handle any challenge in a way that will make you grow.
general.author: les brown

general.quote: The price of success is hard work, dedication to the job at hand, and the determination that whether we win or lose, we have applied the best of ourselves to the task at hand.
general.author: vince lombardi

general.quote: Determine what specific goal you want to achieve. Then dedicate yourself to its attainment with unswerving singleness of purpose, the trenchant zeal of a crusader.
general.author: paul j. meyer

general.quote: Construct your Determination with Sustained Effort, Controlled Attention, and Concentrated Energy. opportunities never come to those who wait… they are captured by those who dare to attack.
general.author: paul j. meyer

general.quote: Those who want to succeed will find a way, those who don’t will find an excuse!
general.author: leo aguila

general.quote: You can do what you have to do, and sometimes you can do it even better than you think you can.
general.author: jimmy carter

general.quote: Only a man who knows what it is like to be defeated can reach down to the bottom of his soul and come up with the extra ounce of power it takes to win when the match is even.
general.author: muhammad ali

general.quote: In truth, people can generally make time for what they choose to do; it is not really the time but the will that is lacking.
general.author: sir john lubbock

general.quote: I’m a determined person. And if I’ve got an objective, I’ll make hours of sacrifice — whatever efforts are needed.
general.author: gerald r. ford

general.quote: An invincible determination can accomplish almost anything and in this lies the great distinction between great men and little men.
general.author: thomas fuller

general.quote: He who chooses the beginning of a road chooses the place it leads to. It is the means that determine the end.
general.author: harry emerson fosdick

general.quote: If you set goals and go after them with all the determination you can muster, your gifts will take you places that will amaze you.
general.author: les brown

general.quote: Determination is the thing on which you can depend. It plods along without a swing, but gets there in the end.
general.author: edgar guest

general.quote: We all have dreams. But in order to make dreams come into reality, it takes an awful lot of determination, dedication, self-discipline, and effort.
general.author: jesse owens

general.quote: So we built the wall and the whole wall was joined together to half its height; for the people had a mind to work.
general.author: bible

general.quote: The longer I live, the more I am certain that the great difference between the great and the insignificant, is energy — The difference between the impossible and the possible lies in a person’s determination.
general.author: tommy lasorda

general.quote: A determined heart takes no counsel.
general.author: quiros

general.quote: Human beings, by changing the inner attitudes of their minds, can change the outer aspects of their lives.
general.author: william james

general.quote: Resolve will melt no rocks. But it can scale them.
general.author: george eliot

general.quote: A man can do anything he wants to do in this world, at least if he wants to do it badly enough.
general.author: edward wyllis scripps

general.quote: Nothing is so common as unsuccessful men with talent. They lack only determination.
general.author: charles swindle

general.quote: Never let the fear of striking out get in your way.
general.author: babe ruth

general.quote: You too, can determine what you want. You can decide on your major objectives, targets, aims, and destination.
general.author: w. clement stone

general.quote: It has never been my object to record my dreams, just the determination to realize them.
general.author: man ray

general.quote: There is no chance, no destiny, no fate that can circumvent or hinder or control the firm resolve of a determined soul.
general.author: ella wheeler wilcox

general.quote: If at first you don’t succeed-try, try again. Don’t think of it as failure. Think of it as timed-release success.
general.author: robert orben

general.quote: Determination is the wake-up call to the human will.
general.author: anthony robbins

general.quote: I will go anywhere, provided it be forward.
general.author: david livingstone

general.quote: A failure establishes only this, that our determination to succeed was not strong enough.
general.author: christian nestell bovee

general.quote: As we express our gratitude, we must never forget that the highest appreciation is not to utter words, but to live by them.
general.author: john fitzgerald kennedy

general.quote: It is not the man who has too little, but the man who craves more, that is poor.
general.author: marcus annaeus seneca

general.quote: What you really value is what you miss, not what you have.
general.author: jorge luis borges

general.quote: A man should always consider… how much more unhappy he might be than he is.
general.author: joseph addison quotes

general.quote: Prosperity depends more on wanting what you have than having what you want.
general.author: geoffrey f. abert

general.quote: Let us learn to appreciate there will be times when the trees will be bare, and look forward to the time when we may pick the fruit.
general.author: peter sellers

general.quote: When I’m not thanked at all, I’m thanked enough, I’ve done my duty, and I’ve done no more.
general.author: henry fielding

general.quote: A mother’s arms are more comforting than anyone else’s.
general.author: princess diana quotes

general.quote: It is with certain good qualities as with the senses; those who are entirely deprived of them can neither appreciate nor comprehend them.
general.author: francois duc de la rochefoucauld

general.quote: Once we discover how to appreciate the timeless values in our daily experiences, we can enjoy the best things in life.
general.author: harry hepner

general.quote: It is a matter of the simplest demonstration, that no man can be really appreciated but by his equal or superior.
general.author: john ruskin

general.quote: Welcome everything that comes to you, but do not long for anything else.
general.author: andre gide

general.quote: If you look at life one way, there is always cause for alarm.
general.author: elizabeth bowen

general.quote: No music is so pleasant to my ears as that word father.
general.author: lydia m. child

general.quote: What sunshine is to flowers, smiles are to humanity. These are but trifles, to be sure; but, scattered along life’s pathway, the good they do is inconceivable.
general.author: joseph addison

general.quote: Appreciation is a wonderful thing; it makes what is excellent in others belong to us as well.
general.author: francois-marie arouet de voltaire quotes

general.quote: Being tall is an advantage, especially in business. People will always remember you. And if you’re in a crowd, you’ll always have some clean air to breathe.
general.author: julia child

general.quote: I actually remember feeling delight, at two o’clock in the morning, when the baby woke for his feed, because I so longed to have another look at him.
general.author: margaret drabble

general.quote: He is a man of sense who does not grieve for what he has not, but rejoices in what he has.
general.author: epictetus

general.quote: To appreciate the noble is a gain which can never be torn from us.
general.author: johann wolfgang von goethe quotes

general.quote: Appreciate life instead of resisting it.
general.author: judy tatelbaum

general.quote: It is up to us to give ourselves recognition. If we wait for it to come from others, we feel resentful when it doesn’t, and when it does, we may well reject it.
general.author: bernard berkowitz

general.quote: Appreciate me now, and avoid the rush.
general.author: ashleigh brilliant

general.quote: Who I am is the best I can be.
general.author: leontyne price

general.quote: It matters very little whether a man is discontented in the name of pessimism or progress, if his discontent does in fact paralyze his power of appreciating what he has got.
general.author: gilbert k. chesterton

general.quote: One appreciates that daily life is really good when one wakes from a horrible dream, or when one takes the first outing after a sickness. Why not realize it now?
general.author: william lyon phelps

general.quote: A word of appreciation often can accomplish what nothing else could accomplish.
general.author: b.c. forbes

general.quote: The happiest is he who suffers the least pain; the most miserable, he who enjoys the least pleasure.
general.author: jean jacques rousseau

general.quote: Appreciation is the purest vibration that exists on the planet today.
general.author: abraham hicks

general.quote: If we get everything that we want, we will soon want nothing that we get.
general.author: vernon luchies

general.quote: Courtesies of a small and trivial character are the ones which strike deepest in the grateful and appreciating heart.
general.author: henry clay

general.quote: We are very much what others think of us. The reception our observations meet with gives us courage to proceed or damps our efforts.
general.author: william hazlitt

general.quote: Considering the fortune you might have lost, you’ll have to admit you’re rich already.
general.author: john rothchild

general.quote: By appreciation we make excellence in others our own property.
general.author: voltaire quotes

general.quote: Next to invention is the power of interpreting invention; next to beauty, the power of appreciating beauty.
general.author: sarah margaret fuller

general.quote: Think of all the beauty still left around you and be happy.
general.author: anne frank

general.quote: Take full account of the excellencies which you possess, and in gratitude remember how you would hanker after them, if you had them not.
general.author: marcus aurelius

general.quote: Better a little fire to warm us than a great one to burn us.
general.author: thomas fuller

general.quote: It is common, to esteem most what is most unknown.
general.author: tacitus

general.quote: Appreciation can make a day — even change a life. Your willingness to put it into words is all that is necessary.
general.author: margaret cousins

general.quote: Long tresses down to the floor can be beautiful if you have that, but learn to love what you have.
general.author: anita baker

general.quote: I invented my life by taking for granted that everything I did not like would have an opposite, which I would like.
general.author: coco chanel

general.quote: God gave you a gift of 86,400 seconds today. Have you used one to say "thank you"?
general.author: william a. ward

general.quote: Generally the man with a good wife, or the woman with a good husband, or the children with good parents discover too late the goodness they overlooked while it was in full bloom.
general.author: james douglas

general.quote: The deepest principle in human nature is the craving to be appreciated.
general.author: william james

general.quote: We must never undervalue any person. The workman loves not that his work should be despised in his presence. Now God is present everywhere, and every person is His work.
general.author: saint francis de sales

general.quote: Thankfulness is the beginning of gratitude. Gratitude is the completion of thankfulness. Thankfulness may consist merely of words. Gratitude is shown in acts.
general.author: henri frederic amiel

general.quote: I would rather be able to appreciate things I can not have than to have things I am not able to appreciate.
general.author: elbert hubbard

general.quote: The talent for being happy is appreciating and liking what you have, instead of what you don’t have.
general.author: woody allen

general.quote: If you would but exchange places with the other fellow, how much more you could appreciate your own position.
general.author: victor e. gardner

general.quote: The human mind can bear plenty of reality, but not too much of intermittent gloom.
general.author: margaret drabble

general.quote: That which we obtain too easily, we esteem too lightly.
general.author: thomas paine

general.quote: Few love what they may have.
general.author: ovid

general.quote: To be of value, expressions of appreciation must be continually renewed.
general.author: sberee parris nudd

general.quote: May we never let the things we can’t have, or don’t have, spoil our enjoyment of the things we do have and can have.
general.author: richard l. evans

general.quote: In a little place is hid a great treasure, and in a small hope a boundless expectation.
general.author: j. bodenham

general.quote: Hope is the expectation that something outside of ourselves, something or someone external, is going to come to our rescue and we will live happily ever after.
general.author: dr. robert anthony

general.quote: Life is so constructed, that the event does not, cannot, will not, match the expectation.
general.author: charlotte bronte

general.quote: You are your own worst enemy. If you can learn to stop expecting impossible perfection, in yourself and others, you may find the happiness that has always eluded you.
general.author: llisa kleypas

general.quote: Consciously or unconsciously, you always get what you expect.
general.author: robert anthony

general.quote: We expect more of ourselves than we have any right to.
general.author: oliver wendell holmes

general.quote: If you expect nothing from anybody, you’re never disappointed.
general.author: sylvia plath

general.quote: Expectations are blossoms; few only mature in fruit.
general.author: emperor ye-wang

general.quote: It is great to be a blonde. With low expectations it’s very easy to surprise people.
general.author: pamela anderson

general.quote: Don’t expect to build up the weak by pulling down the strong.
general.author: calvin coolidge

general.quote: Unhappiness lies in that gap between our talents and our expectations.
general.author: sebastian horsley

general.quote: Here is the simple but powerful rule… always give people more than they expect to get.
general.author: nelson boswell

general.quote: Do a little more every day than you are expected to do, and soon you will be expected to do more.
general.author: evan esar

general.quote: So the secret to good self-esteem is to lower your expectations to the point where they’re already met?
general.author: bill watterson

general.quote: When love and skill work together, expect a masterpiece.
general.author: john ruskin

general.quote: Expectation ends only in heaven.
general.author: kentijern

general.quote: High expectations are the key to everything.
general.author: sam walton

general.quote: People live up to your expectations, not their potential.
general.author: stephen young

general.quote: He who awaits much can expect little.
general.author: gabriel garcia marquez

general.quote: Expect everything so that nothing comes unexpected.
general.author: norton juster

general.quote: In expectation there is happiness.
general.author: shi-ka-shiu

general.quote: A thing long expected takes the form of the unexpected when at last it comes.
general.author: mark twain

general.quote: We part more easily with what we possess, than with the expectation of what we wish for; and the reason of it is, that what we expect is always greater than what we enjoy.
general.author: g. e. ayscough

general.quote: Life is largely a matter of expectation.
general.author: horace

general.quote: Nothing in this world is so fatal to the development of the intellectual powers of the young, as what are commonly called expectations.
general.author: arster

general.quote: Those who’ll play with cats must expect to be scratched.
general.author: miguel de cervantes

general.quote: We love to expect, and when expectation is either disappointed or gratified, we want to be again expecting.
general.author: samuel johnson

general.quote: All earthy delights are sweeter in expectation than enjoyment; but all spiritual pleasures more in fruition than expectation.
general.author: owen felltham

general.quote: With every one, the expectation of a misfortune constitutes a dreadful, punishment. Suffering then assumes the proportions of the unknown, which is the soul’s infinite.
general.author: honore de balzac

general.quote: A good expectation is better than a bad possession.
general.author: ibn-hafsoon-omar

general.quote: The real winners in life are the people who look at every situation with an expectation that they can make it work or make it better.
general.author: barbara pletcher

general.quote: The wise don’t expect to find life worth living; they make it that way.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: That is a good book which is opened with expectation, and closed with delight and profit.
general.author: amos bronson alcott

general.quote: Plan for this world as if you expect to live forever; but plan for the hereafter as if you expect to die tomorrow.
general.author: ibn gabirol

general.quote: We love to expect, and when expectation is disappointed or gratified, we want to be again expecting.
general.author: samuel johnson

general.quote: Ican’t imagine going on when there are no more expectations.
general.author: dame e. evans

general.quote: Expect nothing, live frugally on surprise.
general.author: alice walker

general.quote: One gift creates appreciation, many gifts create expectation.
general.author: tony bright

general.quote: Today expect something good to happen to you no matter what occurred yesterday. Realize the past no longer holds you captive. It can only continue to hurt you if you hold on to it. Let the past go. A simply abundant world awaits.
general.author: sarah breathnach

general.quote: There would be few enterprises of great labor or hazard undertaken, if we had not the power of magnifying the advantages which we persuade ourselves to expect from them.
general.author: samuel johnson

general.quote: In all worldly things that a man pursues with the greatest eagerness and intention of mind imaginable, he finds not half the pleasure in the actual possession of them, as he proposed to himself in the expectation.
general.author: bishop robert south

general.quote: Nothing is so great an adversary to those who make it their business to please as expectation.
general.author: cicero

general.quote: We part more easily with what we possess, than with our expectations of what we wish for; because expectation always goes beyond enjoyment.
general.author: henry home

general.quote: Our desires always disappoint us; for though we meet with something that gives us satisfaction, yet it never thoroughly answers our expectation.
general.author: francois de la rochefoucauld

general.quote: It is a great obstacle to happiness to expect too much.
general.author: bernard de bovier de fontenelle

general.quote: Those who live on expectations are sure to be disappointed.
general.author: joachim murat

general.quote: Expect no more from the world than it is able to afford; it promises more than it bestows.
general.author: joseph guy

general.quote: If you expect to have it all, you will have nothing. Learn to be happy with nothing — and you will have it all!
general.author: eerniej. zelinski

general.quote: Always expect the worst, and you will never be disappointed.
general.author: peter wastholm

general.quote: Blessed is he who expects nothing, for he shall never be disappointed.
general.author: alexander pope

general.quote: We ought not to speculate on the future as if it were already past, nor build expectations on events which may eventually turn out very differently from what they seemed at first to promise.
general.author: polybius

general.quote: Some people expect the door of opportunity to be opened with an electric eye.
general.author: howard hendricks

general.quote: The true meaning of life is to plant trees, under whose shade you do not expect to sit.
general.author: nelson henderson

general.quote: He was swimming in a sea of other people’s expectations. Men had drowned in seas like that.
general.author: robert jordon

general.quote: You can’t expect to meet the challenges of today with yesterday’s tools and expect to be in business tomorrow.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: Sometimes the unexpected happens when you don’t expect a person to come up to expectations.
general.author: evan esar

general.quote: I’m not in this world to live up to your expectations and you’re not in this world to live up to mine.
general.author: bruce lee

general.quote: Expectations are dangerous when they are both too high and unformed.
general.author: lionel shriver

general.quote: There is no medicine like hope, no incentive so great, and no tonic so powerful as expectation of something tomorrow.
general.author: orison swett marden

general.quote: A life that is burdened with expectations is a heavy life. Its fruit is sorrow and disappointment.
general.author: douglas adams

general.quote: High achievement always takes place in the framework of high expectation.
general.author: jack kinder

general.quote: Uncertainty and expectation are the joys of life.
general.author: william congreve

general.quote: Carry out a random act of kindness, with no expectation of reward, safe in the knowledge that one day someone might do the same for you.
general.author: princess diana

general.quote: Some people bear three kinds of trouble — the ones they’ve had, the ones they have, and the ones they expect to have.
general.author: edward everett hale

general.quote: Those who live in expectation of an inheritance, must expect to receive the evil as well as the good therewith.
general.author: lord norbury

general.quote: Expect problems and eat them for breakfast.
general.author: alfred a. montapert

general.quote: Expect victory and you make victory.
general.author: preston bradley

general.quote: We never live; we are always in the expectation of living.
general.author: voltaire

general.quote: We will always tend to fulfill our own expectation of ourselves.
general.author: brian tracy

general.quote: Expect poison from standing water.
general.author: william blake

general.quote: We tend to get what we expect.
general.author: norman vincent peale

general.quote: Positive expectations are the mark of the superior personality.
general.author: brian tracy

general.quote: We expect everything and are prepared for nothing.
general.author: anne sophie swetchine

general.quote: Even in social life, it is persistency which attracts confidence, more than talents and accomplishments.
general.author: edwin percy whipple speare

general.quote: There is no royal road to anything. One thing at a time, all things in succession. That which grows fast withers rapidly; that which grows slowly endures.
general.author: josiah gilbert holland

general.quote: I do not think that there is any other quality so essential to success of any kind as the quality of perseverance. It overcomes almost everything, even nature.
general.author: john d. rockefeller

general.quote: Most people never run far enough on their first wind to find out they’ve got a second.
general.author: william james

general.quote: Nobody trips over mountains. It is the small pebble that causes you to stumble. Pass all the pebbles in your path and you will find you have crossed the mountain.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: Our greatest glory is not in never failing, but in rising up every time we fail.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson

general.quote: Perseverance is not the only ingredient to winning. You can stalk a field forever and not get any game if the field does not contain any.
general.author: confucius

general.quote: Look at a stone cutter hammering away at his rock, perhaps a hundred times without as much as a crack showing in it. Yet at the hundred-and-first blow it will split in two, and I know it was not the last blow that did it, but all that had gone before.
general.author: jacob a. riis

general.quote: Don’t worry about genius. Don’t worry about being clever. Trust to hard work, perseverance and determination. And the best motto for a long march is: "Don’t grumble. Plug on!"
general.author: sir thomas treves

general.quote: Press on! a better fate awaits thee.
general.author: victor hugo

general.quote: The block of granite, which was an obstacle in the pathway of the weak, becomes a stepping stone in the pathway of the strong.
general.author: thomas carlyle

general.quote: The practice of perseverance is the discipline of the noblest virtues. To run well, we must run to the end. It is not the fighting but the conquering that gives a hero his title to renown.
general.author: elias l. magoon

general.quote: To persevere in one’s duty, and be silent is the best answer to calumny.
general.author: george washington

general.quote: As you go along your road in life, you will, if you aim high enough, also meet resistance…. But no matter how tough the opposition may seem, have courage still and persevere.
general.author: madeleine albright

general.quote: Never think that God’s delays are God’s denials. Hold on; hold fast; hold out. Patience is genius.
general.author: georges-louis leclerc

general.quote: The drops of rain make a hole in the stone not by violence but by oft falling.
general.author: lucretius

general.quote: The great majority of men are bundles of beginnings.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson

general.quote: Hard pounding, gentlemen; but we will see who can pound the longest.
general.author: duke of wellington

general.quote: He conquers who endures.
general.author: persius

general.quote: The road to success is dotted with many tempting parking places.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: I may not be there yet, but I’m closer than I was yesterday.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: The great thing and the hard thing is to stick to things when you have outlived the first interest, and not yet got the second which comes with a sort of mastery.
general.author: janet erskine stuart

general.quote: The conditions of conquest are always easy. We have but to toil awhile, endure awhile, believe always, and never turn back.
general.author: william gilmore simms

general.quote: Whoever perseveres will be crowned.
general.author: johann gottfried von herder

general.quote: I frequently-regularly-often trip while reaching for my high ideals. Then I giggle, or cry, and get back up.
general.author: erika harris

general.quote: The will to persevere is often the difference between failure and success.
general.author: david sarnoff

general.quote: Don’t let the fear of the time it will take to accomplish something stand in the way of your doing it. The time will pass anyway; we might just as well put that passing time to the best possible use.
general.author: earl nightingale

general.quote: Problems are not stop signs, they are guidelines.
general.author: robert schuller

general.quote: You’ve got to say, "I think that if I keep working at this and want it badly enough, I can have it." It’s called perseverance.
general.author: lee iacocca

general.quote: Victory belongs to the most persevering.
general.author: napoleon bonaparte

general.quote: Few things are impracticable in themselves; and it is for want of application, rather than of means, that men fail of success.
general.author: francois duc de la rochefoucauld

general.quote: Success seems to be largely a matter of hanging on after others have let go.
general.author: william feather

general.quote: When you come to the end of your rope, tie a knot and hang on.
general.author: franklin d. roosevelt

general.quote: Keep on going, and the chances are that you will stumble on something, perhaps when you are least expecting it. I never heard of anyone ever stumbling on something sitting down.
general.author: charles f. kettering

general.quote: No worthy enterprise can be done by us without continual plodding and wearisomeness to our faint and sensitive abilities.
general.author: john milton

general.quote: Perseverance, self-reliance, energetic effort, are doubly strengthened when your rise to battle again.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: Perseverance is irresistible.
general.author: quintus sertorius

general.quote: Perseverance is a great element of success. If you only knock long enough and loud enough at the gate, you are sure to wake somebody.
general.author: henry wadsworth longfellow

general.quote: The miracle, or the power, that elevates the few is to be found in their industry, application, and perseverance under the prompting of a brave, determined spirit.
general.author: mark twain

general.quote: Don’t be afraid to give your best to what seemingly are small jobs. Every time you conquer one it makes you that much stronger. If you do the little jobs well, the big ones will tend to take care of themselves.
general.author: dale carnegie

general.quote: Do not turn back when you are just at the goal.
general.author: syrus

general.quote: No rock so hard but that a little wave may beat admission in a thousand years.
general.author: lord alfred tennyson

general.quote: We shall escape the uphill by never turning back.
general.author: christina georgina rossetti

general.quote: Perseverance and audacity generally win.
general.author: dorothee deluzy

general.quote: The nerve that never relaxes, the eye that never blenches, the thought that never wanders–these are the masters of victory.
general.author: edmund burke

general.quote: There is no telling how many miles you will have to run while chasing a dream.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: Perseverance is more prevailing than violence; and many things which cannot be overcome when they are together yield themselves up when taken little by little.
general.author: plutarch

general.quote: Perseverance and tact are the two great qualities most valuable for all men who would mount, but especially for those who have to step out of the crowd.
general.author: benjamin disraeli

general.quote: I hold a doctrine, to which I owe not much, indeed, but all the little I ever had, namely, that with ordinary talent and extraordinary perseverance, all things are attainable.
general.author: sir thomas fowell buxton

general.quote: It’s gonna be a long hard drag, but we’ll make it.
general.author: janis joplin

general.quote: Every noble work is at first impossible.
general.author: thomas carlyle

general.quote: Difficult things take a long time, impossible things a little longer.
general.author: andré a. jackson

general.quote: Nothing is so hard but search will find it out.
general.author: robert herrick

general.quote: Perseverance is the hard work you do after you get tired of doing the hard work you already did.
general.author: newt gingrich

general.quote: By gnawing through a dike, even a rat may drown a nation.
general.author: edmund burke

general.quote: You learn you can do your best even when it’s hard, even when you’re tired and maybe hurting a little bit. It feels good to show some courage.
general.author: joe namath

general.quote: Let perseverance be your engine and hope your fuel.
general.author: h. jackson brown, jr.

general.quote: Perseverance is failing 19 times and succeeding the 20th.
general.author: julie andrews

general.quote: Perseverance is the most overrated of traits, if it is unaccompanied by talent; beating your head against a wall is more likely to produce a concussion in the head than a hole in the wall.
general.author: sidney j. harris

general.quote: Even if a minefield or the abyss should lie before me, I will march straight ahead without looking back.
general.author: zhu rongji

general.quote: By perseverance, the snail reached the ark.
general.author: charles haddon spurgeon

general.quote: It is interesting to notice how some minds seem almost to create themselves, springing up under every disadvantage, and working their solitary but irresistible way through a thousand obstacles.
general.author: washington irving

general.quote: The difference between perseverance and obstinacy is that one often comes from a strong will, and the other from a strong won’t.
general.author: henry ward beecher

general.quote: Water continually dropping will wear hard rocks hollow.
general.author: plutarch

general.quote: Too much vigor in the beginning of an undertaking often intercepts and prevents the steadiness and perseverance always necessary in the conduct of a complicated scheme.
general.author: samuel johnson

general.quote: A falling drop at last will carve a stone.
general.author: lucretius

general.quote: Saints are sinners who kept on going.
general.author: robert louis stevenson

general.quote: Consider the postage stamp: its usefulness consists in the ability to stick to one thing till it gets there.
general.author: josh billings

general.quote: Perseverance is not a long race; it is many short races one after another.
general.author: walter elliott

general.quote: Big shots are only little shots who keep shooting.
general.author: christopher morley

general.quote: When your dreams turn to dust, vacuum.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: Vitality shows in not only the ability to persist but the ability to start over.
general.author: f. scott fitzgerald

general.quote: Perseverance… keeps honor bright: to have done, is to hang quite out of fashion, like a rusty nail in monumental mockery.
general.author: william shakespeare

general.quote: Life is not about how fast you run or how high you climb but how well you bounce.
general.author: vivian komori

general.quote: By preserving over all obstacles and distractions, one may unfailingly arrive at his chosen goal or destination.
general.author: christopher columbus

general.quote: Great works are performed not by strength, but by perseverance.
general.author: samuel johnson

general.quote: Great effects come of industry and perseverance: for audacity doth almost bind and mate the weaker sort of minds.
general.author: francis bacon

general.quote: Permanence, perseverance and persistence in spite of all obstacle s, discouragement s, and impossibilities: It is this, that in all things distinguishes the strong soul from the weak.
general.author: thomas carlyle

general.quote: Genius is divine perseverance. Genius I cannot have, but perseverance all can have.
general.author: woodrow t. wilson

general.quote: It’s not that I’m so smart, it’s just that I stay with problems longer.
general.author: albert einstein

general.quote: With ordinary talents and extraordinary perseverance, all things are attainable.
general.author: sir thomas fowell buxton

general.quote: Those who would attain to any marked degree of excellence in a chosen pursuit must work, and work hard for it, prince or peasant.
general.author: bayard taylor

general.quote: Don’t be discouraged. It’s often the last key in the bunch that opens the lock.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: Perpetual pushing and assurance put a difficulty out of countenance, and make a seeming impossibility give way.
general.author: jeremy collier

general.quote: There is no creature so contemptible but by resolution may gain his point.
general.author: sir roger l’estrange

general.quote: To convert ideas and good intentions into something real and positive requires time and perseverance.
general.author: eugenio mendoza

general.quote: But the moment you turn a corner you see another straight stretch ahead and there comes some further challenge to your ambition.
general.author: oliver wendell holmes, jr.

general.quote: People often say that motivation doesn’t last. Well, neither does bathing – that’s why we recommend it daily.
general.author: zig ziglar

general.quote: Perseverance gives power to weakness, and opens to poverty the world’s wealth. It spreads fertility over the barren landscape, and buds the choicest flowers and fruits spring up and flourish in the desert abode of thorns and briars.
general.author: samuel g. goodrich

general.quote: I’m proof against that word "failure." I’ve seen behind it. The only failure a man ought to fear is failure in cleaving to the purpose he sees to be best.
general.author: george eliot

general.quote: All the great captains have performed vast achievements by conforming with the rules of art–by adjusting efforts to obstacles.
general.author: napoleon bonaparte

general.quote: The soft droppes of raine perce the hard Marble, many strokes overthrow the tallest Oke.
general.author: john lyly

general.quote: For a man to achieve all that is demanded of him he must regard himself as greater than he is.
general.author: johann wolfgang von goethe

general.quote: The way to get things done is not to mind who gets the credit for doing them.
general.author: benjamin jowett

general.quote: Failures, repeated failures, are finger posts on the mad? to achievement. One fails? forward toward success.
general.author: charles f. kettering

general.quote: There is no limit to what can be accomplished if it doesn’t matter who gets the credit.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson

general.quote: Someone has defined genius as intensity of purpose: the ability to do, the patience to wait. Put these together and you have achievement.
general.author: leo j. muir

general.quote: The only worthwhile achievements of man are those which are socially useful.
general.author: alfred adler

general.quote: The great accomplishments of man have resulted from the transmission of ideas, into enthusiasm, into actions.
general.author: thomas j. vilord

general.quote: A dream is just a dream. A goal is a dream with a plan and a deadline.
general.author: harvey mackay

general.quote: Having once decided to achieve a certain task, achieve it at all costs of tedium and distaste. The gain in self confidence of having accomplished a tiresome labor is immense.
general.author: thomas a. bennett

general.quote: Every worthwhile accomplishment, big or little, has its stages of drudgery and triumph: a beginning, a struggle, and a victory.
general.author: mahatma gandhi

general.quote: A man may fulfill the object of his existence by asking a question he cannot answer, and attempting a task he cannot achieve.
general.author: oliver wendell holmes

general.quote: Step by step. I can’t think of any other way of accomplishing anything.
general.author: michael jordan

general.quote: Man is always more than he can know of himself; consequently, his accomplishments, time and again, will come as a surprise to him.
general.author: golo mann

general.quote: The roots of true achievement lie in the will to become the best that you can become.
general.author: harold taylor

general.quote: Let us, then, be up and doing, with a heart for any fate; still achieving, still pursuing, learn to labor and to wait.
general.author: henry wadsworth longfellow

general.quote: The greatest things are accomplished by individual people, not by committees or companies.
general.author: alfred a. montapert

general.quote: Great things are not accomplished by those who yield to trends and fads and popular opinion.
general.author: charles kuralt

general.quote: Somebody is always doing what somebody else said couldn’t be done.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: Our chief want in life is somebody who will make us do what we can.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson

general.quote: Our achievements speak for themselves. What we have to keep track of are our failures, discouragements and doubts. We tend to forget the past difficulties, the many false starts, and the painful groping.
general.author: eric hoffer

general.quote: The world is divided into people who do things and people who get the credit.
general.author: dwight whitney morrow

general.quote: It is time for us all to stand and cheer for the doer, the achiever — the one who recognizes the challenges and does something about it.
general.author: vince lombardi

general.quote: In the end, the size of a man’s accomplishments can best be measured by the size of their heart.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: Life affords no higher pleasure than that of surmounting difficulties, passing from one step of success to another, forming new wishes and seeing them gratified.
general.author: samuel johnson

general.quote: All successful people, men and women, are big dreamers. They imagine what their future could be, ideal in every respect, and then they work every day toward their distant vision, that goal or purpose.
general.author: brian tracy

general.quote: You can do anything you wish to do, have anything you wish to have, be anything you wish to be.
general.author: robert collier

general.quote: Every time you acquire a new interest, even more, a new accomplishment, you increase your power of life.
general.author: william lyon phelps

general.quote: That which is achieved the most, still has the whole of its future yet to be achieved.
general.author: lao-tzu

general.quote: The body achieves what the mind believes.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: Death comes to all, but great achievements build a monument which shall endure until the sun grows cold.
general.author: george fabricius

general.quote: To be yourself in a world that is constantly trying to make you something else is the greatest accomplishment.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson

general.quote: The will to win, the desire to succeed, the urge to reach your full potential… these are the keys that will unlock the door to personal excellence.
general.author: eddie robinson

general.quote: What you declare, you will achieve. When you think you can’t revisit a previous triumph.
general.author: jack canfield

general.quote: Do not be desirous of having things done quickly. Do not look at small advantages. Desire to have things done quickly prevents their being done thoroughly. Looking at small advantages prevents great affairs from being accomplished.
general.author: confucius

general.quote: Finish each day and be done with it. You have done what you could. Some blunders and absurdities no doubt crept in; forget them as soon as you can. Tomorrow is a new day; begin it well and serenely and with too high a spirit to be encumbered with your old nonsense.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson

general.quote: We will either find a way, or make one.
general.author: hannibal

general.quote: The achievements which society rewards are won at the cost of diminution of personality.
general.author: carl jung

general.quote: For what is the best choice, for each individual is the highest it is possible for him to achieve.
general.author: aristotle

general.quote: The only way around is through.
general.author: robert frost

general.quote: High achievement always takes place in the framework of high expectation.
general.author: jack kinder

general.quote: It is easy to hate and it is difficult to love. This is how the whole scheme of things works. All good things are difficult to achieve; and bad things are very easy to get.
general.author: morarji desai

general.quote: There are no shortcuts to life’s greatest achievements.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: It’s no use saying, "We are doing our best." You have got to succeed in doing what is necessary.
general.author: winston churchill

general.quote: Accomplishment is easiest when we work the hardest, and it is hardest when we work the easiest.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: Not the maker of plans and promises, but rather the one who offers faithful service in small matters. This is the person who is most likely to achieve what is good and lasting.
general.author: johann wolfgang von goethe

general.quote: What we achieve inwardly will change outer reality.
general.author: otto rank

general.quote: If life were measured by accomplishments, most of us would die in infancy.
general.author: a. p. gouthey

general.quote: Some people regard discipline as a chore. For me, it is a kind of order that sets me free to fly.
general.author: julie andrews

general.quote: Always remember that discipline is like a two-edged sword; it is not only to correct children when they are wrong, but to direct them to a way that is right.
general.author: james merritt

general.quote: Life without discipline is like a ship without a rudder.
general.author: ronie mathew thomas

general.quote: No man or woman has achieved an effective personality who is not self-disciplined. Such discipline must not be an end in itself, but must be directed to the development of resolute Christian character.
general.author: john s. bonnell

general.quote: The great end of education is to discipline rather than to furnish the mind; to train it to the use of its own powers, rather than fill it with the accumulation of others.
general.author: tryon edwards

general.quote: The secret of discipline is motivation. When a man is sufficiently motivated, discipline will take care of itself.
general.author: alexander paterson

general.quote: Better to be pruned to grow than cut up to burn.
general.author: john trapp

general.quote: If love is the heart of the person, discipline is the skeleton, giving a person form and protection.
general.author: henry cloud & john townsend

general.quote: Mistakes and errors are the discipline through which we advance.
general.author: william ellery channing

general.quote: A person’s attitude toward discipline is the measure of that person’s own orientation to order.
general.author: max van manen

general.quote: A person without discipline is like a ship without a rudder in the storm of life.
general.author: robert elias najemy

general.quote: Discipline must come through liberty.
general.author: maria montessori

general.quote: Only if we can restrain ourselves is good conversation possible. Good talk rises upon much discipline.
general.author: john erskine

general.quote: Genius at first is little more than a great capacity for receiving discipline.
general.author: george eliot

general.quote: Military discipline is merely a perfection of social servitude.
general.author: alexis de tocqueville

general.quote: At its best, discipline is a form of teaching inner controls.
general.author: alicia f. lieberman

general.quote: Talent without discipline is like an octopus on roller skates. There’s plenty of movement, but you never know if it’s going to be forward, backwards, or sideways.
general.author: h. jackson brown, jr

general.quote: The only thing that happens overnight is recognition. Not talent.
general.author: carol haney

general.quote: No man is such a conqueror, as the one that has defeated himself.
general.author: henry ward beecher

general.quote: The greatest influence of discipline is to repress the weaknesses which grow out of individuality.
general.author: g. burnett

general.quote: No one is free who does not lord over himself.
general.author: claudius

general.quote: I don’t think success is harmful, as so many people say. Rather I believe it indispensable to talent: if for nothing else than to increase the talent.
general.author: jeanne moreau

general.quote: Discipline is a necessity, as a regulator of society, so that those who break its rules may be taught the necessity of obeying them.
general.author: engineer lockhart

general.quote: Where one person shapes their life by precept and example, there are a thousand who have shaped it by impulse and circumstances.
