general.author: james russell lowell

general.quote: Fair and reasonable discipline is like a fence that provides protection and defines limits, demonstrating both care and concern.
general.author: les christie

general.quote: Practice yourself, for heaven’s sake in little things, and then proceed to greater.
general.author: epictetus

general.quote: It is not crazy to think of discipline as a chariot. Without discipline we would drive ourselves crazy.
general.author: noah benshea

general.quote: If we do not discipline ourselves, the world will do it for us.
general.author: william feather

general.quote: When things are steep, remember to stay level-headed.
general.author: horace

general.quote: Discipline is a symbol of caring to a child. Discipline is guidance. If there is love, there is no such thing as being too tough with a child.
general.author: bette davis

general.quote: Without discipline, there is no life at all.
general.author: katharine hepburn

general.quote: In the last analysis, our only freedom is the freedom to discipline ourselves.
general.author: bernard m. baruch

general.quote: Self-discipline is the free man’s yoke.
general.author: john w. gardner

general.quote: There is a certain combination of anarchy and discipline in the way I work.
general.author: robert de niro

general.quote: I believe that the road to pre-eminent success in any line of work is to make yourself master of that line of work.
general.author: andrew carnegie

general.quote: Self-respect is the root of discipline; the sense of dignity grows with the ability to say no to oneself.
general.author: abraham j. heschel

general.quote: What you’ve got to have is faith and discipline when you’re not yet a winner.
general.author: vince lombardi

general.quote: What it lies in our power to do, it lies in our power not to do.
general.author: aristotle

general.quote: Reasonable orders are easy enough to obey; it is capricious, bureaucratic or plain idiotic demands that form the habit of discipline.
general.author: barbara tuchman

general.quote: Self-command is the main discipline.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson

general.quote: The journey is my home.
general.author: muriel rukeyser

general.quote: What we do upon some great occasion will probably depend on what we already are. What we are will be the result of previous years of self-discipline.
general.author: henry parry liddon

general.quote: A sense of discipline is like the earth itself. It is the ground from which all good qualities can grow forth.
general.author: tsoknyi rinpoche

general.quote: Seek freedom and become captive of your desires. Seek discipline and find your liberty.
general.author: frank herbert

general.quote: To know how to dispense with things is to possess them.
general.author: jean francois regnard

general.quote: The person who masters himself through self-control and discipline is truly undefeatable.
general.author: buddha

general.quote: Discipline is like a muscle: the more you practice it, the bigger it gets.
general.author: steve demasco

general.quote: If you once turn on your side after the hour at which you ought to rise, it is all over. Bolt up at once.
general.author: sir walter scott

general.quote: Do your duty until it becomes your joy.
general.author: marie von ebner-eschenbach

general.quote: No evil propensity of the human heart is so powerful that it may not be subdued by discipline.
general.author: seneca

general.quote: You can judge the quality of their faith from the way they behave. Discipline is an index to doctrine.
general.author: tertullian

general.quote: Man must be disciplined, for he is by nature raw and wild.
general.author: immanuel kant

general.quote: If thou wouldn’t conquer thy weakness, thou must not gratify it.
general.author: william penn

general.quote: We must all suffer one of two things: the pain of discipline or the pain of regret or disappointment.
general.author: jim rohn

general.quote: All excellence involves discipline and tenacity of purpose.
general.author: john w. gardner

general.quote: Make your educational laws strict and your criminal ones can be gentle; but if you leave youth its liberty you will have to dig dungeons for ages.
general.author: michel eyquem de montaigne

general.quote: He who hath not Discipline is like a race-horse without a rider.
general.author: john ballou newbrough

general.quote: Tired mothers find that spanking takes less time than reasoning and penetrates sooner to the seat of the memory.
general.author: william j. durant

general.quote: Excellence is not an act but a habit. The things you do the most are the things you will do the best.
general.author: marva collins

general.quote: The discipline of writing something down is the first step toward making it happen.
general.author: lee iacocca

general.quote: Anybody who gets away with something will come back to get away with a little bit more.
general.author: harold schoenberg

general.quote: Discipline is the refining fire by which talent becomes ability.
general.author: roy l. smith

general.quote: Discipline is necessary to curb the mind, otherwise there is no peace.
general.author: jiddu krishnamurti

general.quote: Discipline is like a vaccine. It inflicts lesser pain now to avoid greater pain later.
general.author: dan doriani

general.quote: The discipline of desire is the background of character.
general.author: john locke

general.quote: If you will discipline yourself to make your mind self-sufficient you will thereby be least vulnerable to injury from the outside.
general.author: critias of athens

general.quote: Discipline is like the helm of a ship; it gives direction.
general.author: zester hatfield

general.quote: Nothing I do can’t be done by a ten-year-old…with fifteen years of practice.
general.author: harry blackstone, jr.

general.quote: The price of excellence is discipline. The cost of mediocrity is disappointment.
general.author: william a. ward

general.quote: The discipline of the written word punishes both stupidity and dishonesty.
general.author: john steinbeck

general.quote: Nothing can be more hurtful to the service, than the neglect of discipline; for that discipline, more than numbers, gives one army the superiority over another.
general.author: george washington

general.quote: The one thing more difficult than following a regimen is not imposing it on others.
general.author: marcel proust

general.quote: Blind and unwavering undisciplined at all times constitutes the real strength of all free men.
general.author: alfred jarry

general.quote: The greatest blessing of our democracy is freedom. But in the last analysis, our only freedom is the freedom to discipline ourselves.
general.author: bernard m. baruch

general.quote: Either you think — or else others have to think for you and take power from you, pervert and discipline your natural tastes, civilize and sterilize you.
general.author: f. scott fitzgerald

general.quote: A controlled mind is conducive to joyfulness.
general.author: buddha

general.quote: The man under no discipline is like the spoiled child whom nothing satisfies.
general.author: chester b. lord

general.quote: The victory of success is half done when one gains the habit of work.
general.author: sarah knowles bolton

general.quote: Look upon your chastening as God’s chariots sent to carry your soul into the high places of spiritual achievement.
general.author: hannah whitall smith

general.quote: Lack of discipline leads to frustration and self-loathing.
general.author: marie chapian

general.quote: It doesn’t matter what you’re trying to accomplish. It’s all a matter of discipline. I was determined to discover what life held for me beyond the inner-city streets.
general.author: wilma rudolph

general.quote: There’s no merit in discipline under ideal circumstances. I’ll have it in the face of death, or it’s useless.
general.author: isaac asimov

general.quote: Discipline is not a nasty word.
general.author: pat riley

general.quote: When discipline is sown, like a good seed, it yields a harvest of things that fulfill and satisfy us–things that make us happy and release peace and joy in our lives.
general.author: joyce meyer

general.quote: Discipline is the duty and the hope of all who would enjoy the benefits of society and of instruction.
general.author: john h. a. bomberger

general.quote: Discipline strengthens the mind so that it becomes impervious to the corroding influence of fear.
general.author: bernard law montgomery

general.quote: So far as discipline is concerned, freedom means not its absence but the use of higher and more rational forms as contrasted with those that are lower or less rational.
general.author: charles horton cooley

general.quote: The only discipline that lasts is self discipline.
general.author: bum phillips

general.quote: One of the great lessons I’ve learned in athletics is that you’ve got to discipline your life. No matter how good you may be, you’ve got to be willing to cut out of your life those things that keep you from going to the top.
general.author: bob richards

general.quote: To rejoice in the prosperity of another is to partake of it.
general.author: william austin

general.quote: Prosperity is the blessing of the Old Testament, adversity is the blessing of the New.
general.author: francis bacon

general.quote: It requires a strong constitution to withstand repeated attacks of prosperity.
general.author: james lendall basford

general.quote: A man is insensible to the relish of prosperity ’til he has tasted adversity.
general.author: sa’di

general.quote: Prosperity is very liable to bring pride among the other goods with which it endows an individual; it is then that prosperity costs too dear.
general.author: hosea ballou

general.quote: Prosperity not seldom begets its opposite, and produces a niggardly spirit.
general.author: henry giles

general.quote: A weak mind sinks under prosperity as well as under adversity. A strong and deep one has two highest tides,–when the moon is at the full, and when there is no moon.
general.author: augustus william hare

general.quote: There is in every true woman’s heart a spark of heavenly fire, which lies dormant in the broad daylight of prosperity; but which kindles up, and beams and blazes in the dark hour of adversity.
general.author: washington irving

general.quote: Prosperity is a feeble reed.
general.author: daniel d’ancheres

general.quote: The prosperous man does not know whether he is loved.
general.author: lucanus (marcus annaeus lucan)

general.quote: The temptations of prosperity insinuate themselves after a gentle, but very powerful manner; so that we are but little aware of them and less able to withstand them.
general.author: francis atterbury

general.quote: I will say this for adversity: people seem to be able to stand it, and that is more than I can say for prosperity.
general.author: kin hubbard

general.quote: Prosperity makes friends, adversity tries them.
general.author: publilius syrus

general.quote: The world of prosperity maintains the world of adversity.
general.author: james lendall basford

general.quote: Armaments, universal debt and planned obsolescence — those are the three pillars of Western prosperity.
general.author: aldous huxley

general.quote: The increase of a great number of citizens in prosperity is a necessary element to the security, and even to the existence, of a civilized people.
general.author: eugene buret

general.quote: Human prosperity never rests but always craves more, till blown up with pride it totters and falls.
general.author: aeschylus

general.quote: Whilst you are prosperous you can number many friends; but when the storm comes you are left alone.
general.author: ovid

general.quote: Prosperity in the form of wealth works exactly the same as everything else. You will see it coming into your life when you are unattached to needing it.
general.author: wayne dyer

general.quote: Americans have mastered the art of being prosperous though broke.
general.author: billy boy franklin

general.quote: The prosperous man is never sure that he is loved for himself.
general.author: f. l. lucan

general.quote: It is very difficult for the prosperous to be humble.
general.author: jane austen

general.quote: Nothing is harder to direct than a man in prosperity; nothing more easily managed that one is adversity.
general.author: plutarch

general.quote: Prosperity is only an instrument to be used, not a deity to be worshipped.
general.author: calvin coolidge

general.quote: When men and governments work intelligently and far-sightedly for the good of others, they achieve their own prosperity, too.
general.author: barbara ward

general.quote: I wish you every kind of prosperity, with a little more taste.
general.author: alain rene le sage

general.quote: He that swells in prosperity will be sure to shrink in adversity.
general.author: charles caleb colton

general.quote: Prosperity is not just having things. It is the consciousness that attracts the things. Prosperity is a way of living and thinking, and not just having money or things. Poverty is a way of living and thinking, and not just a lack of money or things.
general.author: eric butterworth

general.quote: Prosperity belongs to those who learn new things the fastest.
general.author: paul zane pilzer

general.quote: Prosperity demands of us more prudence and moderation than adversity.
general.author: cicero (marcus tullius cicero)

general.quote: Prosperity, in regard of our corrupt inclination to abuse the blessings of Almighty God, doth prove a thing dangerous to the soul of man.
general.author: richard hooker

general.quote: The prosperous can not easily form a right idea of misery.
general.author: quintilian (marcus fabius quintilianus),

general.quote: The mind that is much elevated and insolent with prosperity, and cast down with adversity, is generally abject and base.
general.author: epicurus

general.quote: Surer to prosper than prosperity could have assur’d us.
general.author: john milton

general.quote: When prosperity comes, do not use all of it.
general.author: confucius quotes

general.quote: Much effort, much prosperity.
general.author: euripides

general.quote: It as one of the worst effects of prosperity to make a man a vortex, instead of a fountain; so that, instead of throwing out, he learns only to draw in.
general.author: henry ward beecher

general.quote: As riches and favor forsake a man, we discover him to be a fool, but nobody could find it out in his prosperity.
general.author: jean de la bruyere

general.quote: Fate often puts all the material for happiness and prosperity into a man’s hands just to see how miserable he can make himself with them.
general.author: don marquis

general.quote: Only when a man’s life comes to its end in prosperity dare we pronounce him happy.
general.author: aeschylus

general.quote: Everything in the world may be endured, except only a succession of prosperous days.
general.author: johann wolfgang von goethe quotes

general.quote: Prosperity seems to be scarcely safe, unless it be mixed with a little adversity.
general.author: hosea ballou

general.quote: In prosperity prepare for a change; in adversity hope for one.
general.author: james burgh

general.quote: In general, mankind, since the improvement of cookery, eats twice as much as nature requires.
general.author: benjamin franklin quotes

general.quote: Prosperity is the surest breeder of insolence I know.
general.author: mark twain quotes

general.quote: Agriculture, manufactures, commerce and navigation, the four pillars of our prosperity, are the most thriving when left most free to individual enterprise.
general.author: thomas jefferson quotes

general.quote: Prosperity is not without many fears and distastes, and adversity is not without comforts and hopes.
general.author: francis bacon

general.quote: Prosperity makes few friends.
general.author: luc de clapiers

general.quote: Prosperity is often an equivocal word denoting merely affluence of possession.
general.author: hugh blair

general.quote: Prosperity doth best discover vice, but adversity doth best discover virtue.
general.author: francis bacon

general.quote: Man is the animal that intends to shoot himself out into interplanetary space, after having given up on the problem of an efficient way to get himself five miles to work and back each day.
general.author: bill vaughan

general.quote: The fact is prosperity has a purpose. It’s to allow us to pursue the better angels, to give us time to think and grow.
general.author: george h. w. bush quotes

general.quote: Arrogance is the outgrowth of prosperity.
general.author: plautus (titus maccius plautus)

general.quote: Prosperity gathers smiles, while adversity scatters them.
general.author: william scott downey

general.quote: We’ve got the most prosperous culture in human history and we’ve also got the biggest spiritual hole in human history.
general.author: mark victor hansen

general.quote: Americans have always been able to handle austerity and even adversity. Prosperity is what is doing us in.
general.author: james reston

general.quote: It shows a weak mind not to bear prosperity as well as adversity with moderation.
general.author: cicero (marcus tullius cicero)

general.quote: Watch lest prosperity destroy generosity.
general.author: henry ward beecher

general.quote: All prosperity begins in the mind and is dependent only upon the full use of our creative imagination.
general.author: ruth ross

general.quote: The prosperity of fools shall destroy them.
general.author: bilble

general.quote: Prosperity often presages adversity.
general.author: hosea ballou

general.quote: The human race has had long experience and a fine tradition in surviving adversity. But we now face a task for which we have little experience, the task of surviving prosperity.
general.author: alan gregg

general.quote: When you ascend the hill of prosperity, may you not meet a friend.
general.author: mark twain quotes

general.quote: Be moderate in prosperity, prudent in adversity.
general.author: periander of corinth

general.quote: Everything in the world may be endured except continual prosperity.
general.author: johann wolfgang von goethe

general.quote: Many people would rather fight for their principles than live up to them.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: I like persons better than principles, and I like persons with no principles better than anything else in the world.
general.author: oscar wilde

general.quote: To abandon oneself to principles is really to die — and to die for an impossible love which is the contrary of love.
general.author: albert camus

general.quote: Amid the pressure of great events, a general principle gives no help.
general.author: georg hegel

general.quote: Man has no nobler function than to defend the truth.
general.author: mahalia jackson

general.quote: Success is the ability to rise above principle.
general.author: gerald barzan

general.quote: Principle is a passion for truth.
general.author: william hazlitt

general.quote: When one bases her life on principle, 99 percent of her decisions are already made.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: He who knows right principles is not equal to him who loves them.
general.author: confucius

general.quote: People with good intentions never give up!
general.author: jane smiley

general.quote: Sacrifice money rather than principle.
general.author: nathaniel mayer victor rothschild

general.quote: Principles aren’t of much account anyway, except at election time. After that you hang them up to let them season.
general.author: mark twain

general.quote: Principles have no real force except when one is well-fed.
general.author: mark twain

general.quote: A people that values its privileges above its principles soon loses both.
general.author: dwight david eisenhower

general.quote: Don’t be concerned that you have no position; be concerned how you may fit yourself to occupy one. .
general.author: confucius

general.quote: You can’t learn too soon that the most useful thing about a principle is that it can always be sacrificed to expediency.
general.author: w. somerset maugham

general.quote: I find that principles have no real force except when one is well fed.
general.author: mark twain

general.quote: The value of a principle is the number of things it will explain; and there is no good theory of disease which does not at once suggest a cure.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson

general.quote: I have all reverence for principles which grow out of sentiments; but as to sentiments which grow out of principles, you shall scarcely build a house of cards thereon.
general.author: hermann jacobi

general.quote: Nobody ever did anything very foolish except from some strong principle.
general.author: lord melbourne

general.quote: A good message will always find a messenger.
general.author: amelia e. barr

general.quote: You can’t live principals you can’t understand.
general.author: stephen r. covey

general.quote: We may be personally defeated, but our principles never.
general.author: william lloyd garrison

general.quote: Still it is a fine sight to see a man who has never changed his principles.
general.author: gabriel claude jules favre

general.quote: You may be flexible on strategy, but must remain consistent on principle!
general.author: brubaker movie

general.quote: The principles we live by, in business and in social life, are the most important part of happiness.
general.author: harry harrison

general.quote: People must have righteous principals in the first, and then they will not fail to perform virtuous actions.
general.author: martin luther

general.quote: A man is usually more careful of his money than of his principles.
general.author: oliver wendell holmes

general.quote: Our principles are the springs of our actions. Our actions, the springs of our happiness or misery. Too much care, therefore, cannot be taken in forming our principles.
general.author: red skelton

general.quote: It is in vain to expect any advantage from our profession of the truth, if we be not sincerely just and honest in our actions.
general.author: james sharp

general.quote: Expedients are for the hour; principles for the ages.
general.author: henry ward beecher

general.quote: Principles cannot die.
general.author: wade hampton

general.quote: The principles which men give to themselves end by overwhelming their noblest intentions.
general.author: albert camus

general.quote: If they be principles evident of themselves, they need nothing to evidence them.
general.author: john tillotson

general.quote: There are two great forces in this world — good and evil; and no man is worth his salt unless he has lost and won battle for a principle.
general.author: a. p. gouthey

general.quote: Dangerous principles impose upon our understanding, emasculate our spirits, and spoil our temper.
general.author: jeremy collier

general.quote: It’s no good saying one thing and doing another.
general.author: catherine cookson

general.quote: If principle is good for anything, it is worth living up to.
general.author: benjamin franklin

general.quote: A good principle not rightly understood may prove as hurtful as a bad.
general.author: john milton

general.quote: It’s easy to have principles when you’re rich. The important thing is to have principles when you’re poor.
general.author: ray kroc

general.quote: In matters of principle, stand like a rock; in matters of taste, swim with the current.
general.author: thomas jefferson

general.quote: Men must have righteous principles in the first place, and then they will not fail to perform virtuous actions.
general.author: martin luther

general.quote: It is often easier to fight for one’s principles than to live up to them.
general.author: adlai e. stevenson

general.quote: A job is what we do for money; work is what we do for love.
general.author: marysarah quinn

general.quote: Prosperity is the best protector of principle.
general.author: mark twain

general.quote: Let how you live your life stand for something, no matter how small and incidental it may seem.
general.author: jodie foster

general.quote: Never do to others what you would not like them to do to you.
general.author: confucius

general.quote: If you want a place in the sun, you’ve got to expect a few blisters.
general.author: abigail van buren

general.quote: Convert difficulties into opportunities, for difficulties are divine surgeries to make you better.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: There is something beautiful about all scars of whatever nature. A scar means the hurt is over, the wound is closed and healed, done with.
general.author: harry crews

general.quote: The difficulties of life are intended to make us better, not bitter.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: Prosperity is a great teacher; adversity is a greater.
general.author: william hazlitt

general.quote: Let me embrace thee, sour adversity, for wise men say it is the wisest course.
general.author: william shakespeare quotes

general.quote: Turn your wounds into wisdom.
general.author: oprah winfrey quotes

general.quote: It is during our darkest moments that we must focus to see the light.
general.author: taylor benson

general.quote: Adversity introduces a man to himself.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: There are some defeats more triumphant than victories.
general.author: michel de montaigne

general.quote: A new wound makes all the old ones ache again.
general.author: mignon mclaughlin

general.quote: Count the garden by the flowers, never by the leaves that fall. Count your life with smiles and not the tears that roll.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: It is foolish to tear one’s hair in grief, as though sorrow would be made less by baldness.
general.author: cicero

general.quote: If you’re in a bad situation, don’t worry it’ll change. If you’re in a good situation, don’t worry it’ll change.
general.author: john a. simone, sr.

general.quote: The darkest hour has only sixty minutes.
general.author: morris mandel

general.quote: When life gives you a hundred reasons to cry, show life that you have a thousand reasons to smile.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: Adversity has the same effect on a man that severe training has on the pugilist — it reduces him to his fighting weight.
general.author: josh billings

general.quote: A bad grade is only one letter in the Essay of life.
general.author: lee drake

general.quote: You don’t develop courage by being happy in your relationships everyday. You develop it by surviving difficult times and challenging adversity.
general.author: barbara de angelis

general.quote: God brings men into deep waters, not to drown them, but to cleanse them.
general.author: john aughey

general.quote: If we had no winter, the spring would not be so pleasant; if we did not sometimes taste of adversity, prosperity would not be so welcome.
general.author: anne bradstreet

general.quote: Time engraves our faces with all the tears we have not shed.
general.author: natalie clifford barney

general.quote: Defeat may serve as well as victory to shake the soul and let the glory out.
general.author: edwin markham

general.quote: There’s a bit of magic in everything, and some loss to even things out.
general.author: lou reed

general.quote: Sometimes it’s worse to win a fight than to lose.
general.author: billie holiday

general.quote: The spiritual path is not strewn with roses.
general.author: haridas chaudhuri

general.quote: [L]ook evil in the face; walk up to it, and you will find it less than you imagined, and often you will not find it at all; for it will recede as you advance.
general.author: sydney smith

general.quote: Don’t let a bad day make you feel like you have a bad life.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: We have no right to ask when sorrow comes, "Why did this happen to me?" unless we ask the same question for every moment of happiness that comes our way.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: You may not realize it when it happens, but a kick in the teeth may be the best thing in the world for you.
general.author: walt disney

general.quote: Watch a man in times of… adversity to discover what kind of man he is; for then at last words of truth are drawn from the depths of his heart, and the mask is torn off.
general.author: lucretius

general.quote: Tragedy is restful: and the reason is that hope, that foul, deceitful thing, has no part in it.
general.author: jean anouilh

general.quote: There are times in everyone’s life when something constructive is born out of adversity... when things seem so bad that you’ve got to grab your fate by the shoulders and shake it.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: Some luck lies in not getting what you thought you wanted but getting what you have, which once you have got it you may be smart enough to see is what you would have wanted had you known.
general.author: garrison keillor

general.quote: Earth’s tribulations diminish in proportion to the elevation of our souls.
general.author: james lendall basford

general.quote: He that struggles with us strengthens our nerves, and sharpens our skill. Our antagonist is our helper.
general.author: edmund burke

general.quote: Don’t allow your wounds to turn you into a person you are not.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: Life didn’t promise to be wonderful.
general.author: teddy pendergrass

general.quote: The virtue of prosperity is temperance; the virtue of adversity is fortitude.
general.author: francis bacon

general.quote: When you’re feeling your worst, that’s when you get to know yourself the best.
general.author: leslie grossman

general.quote: It is a common experience that a problem difficult at night is resolved in the morning after the committee of sleep has worked on it.
general.author: john steinbeck

general.quote: A man is insensible to the relish of prosperity ’til he has tasted adversity.
general.author: saʿdī

general.quote: Adversity is like a strong wind. It tears away from us all but the things that cannot be torn, so that we see ourselves as we really are.
general.author: arthur golden

general.quote: Life is thickly sown with thorns, and I know no other remedy than to pass quickly through them. The longer we dwell on our misfortunes, the greater is their power to harm us.
general.author: voltaire

general.quote: It’s not the tragedies that kill us, it’s the messes.
general.author: dorothy parker

general.quote: You’ll never find a better sparring partner than adversity.
general.author: walt schmidt

general.quote: The misfortunes of mankind are of varied plumage.
general.author: aeschylus

general.quote: The virtue of adversity is fortitude, which in mortals is the heroic virtue.
general.author: francis bacon

general.quote: Adversity has the effect of eliciting talents which, in prosperous circumstances, would have lain dormant.
general.author: horace

general.quote: If you haven’t had at least a slight poetic crack in the heart, you have been cheated by nature.
general.author: phyllis battelle

general.quote: Adversity is the first path to truth.
general.author: lord byron

general.quote: In most cases, misfortune is an acquired habit.
general.author: james lendall basford

general.quote: In this world there are only two tragedies. One is not getting what one wants, and the other is getting it.
general.author: oscar wilde quotes

general.quote: When you come to a roadblock, take a detour.
general.author: mary kay ash

general.quote: Every problem has in it the seeds of its own solution. If you don’t have any problems, you don’t get any seeds.
general.author: norman vincent peale

general.quote: The cold is a good counselor, but it is cold.
general.author: antonio porchia

general.quote: Prosperity is not without many fears and distastes; adversity not without many comforts and hopes.
general.author: francis bacon

general.quote: Have the courage to face a difficulty lest it kick you harder than you bargained for.
general.author: stanislaus i, maxims

general.quote: The keenest sorrow is to recognize ourselves as the sole cause of all our adversities.
general.author: sophocles

general.quote: It is only possible to live happily-ever-after on a day-to-day basis.
general.author: margaret bonnano

general.quote: Poverty, Frost, Famine, Rain, Disease, are the beadles and guardsmen that hold us to Common Sense.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson

general.quote: Whenever you fall, pick something up.
general.author: oswald avery

general.quote: The brook would lose its song if you removed the rocks.
general.author: fred beck

general.quote: The gem cannot be polished without friction nor man without trials.
general.author: confucius

general.quote: A problem is a chance for you to do your best.
general.author: duke ellington

general.quote: It is not in the still calm of life, or the repose of a pacific station, that great characters are formed…. Great necessities call out great virtues.
general.author: abigail adams

general.quote: The most important thing in life is not to capitalize on your gains. Any fool can do that. The really important thing is to profit from your losses.
general.author: william bolitho

general.quote: He who has a why to live can bear almost any how.
general.author: friedrich nietzsche

general.quote: Life is made up of sobs, sniffles, and smiles, with sniffles predominating.
general.author: o. henry

general.quote: We acquire the strength we have overcome.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson quotes

general.quote: Some are born great, some achieve greatness, and others have greatness thrust upon them.
general.author: william shakespeare

general.quote: Great people are meteors designed to burn so that the earth may be lighted.
general.author: napoleon bonaparte quotes

general.quote: No one who has come to true greatness has not felt in some degree that his life belongs to the people, and what God has given them he gives it for mankind.
general.author: phillips brooks

general.quote: People are like stained-glass windows. They sparkle and shine when the sun is out, but when the darkness sets in their true beauty is revealed only if there is light from within.
general.author: elisabeth kübler-ross

general.quote: There would be no great men if there were no little ones.
general.author: george herbert

general.quote: Everybody can be great.
general.author: martin luther king jr.

general.quote: A great thing can only be done by a great person; and they do it without effort.
general.author: john ruskin

general.quote: He is greatest whose strength carries up the most hearts by the attraction of his own.
general.author: henry ward beecher

general.quote: The superiority of some men is merely local. They are great because their associates are little.
general.author: samuel johnson

general.quote: The greatness of a man’s power is the measure of his surrender.
general.author: william booth

general.quote: He is not great who is not greatly good.
general.author: william shakespeare

general.quote: It’s not what you take but what you leave behind that defines greatness.
general.author: edward gardner

general.quote: He is great who confers the most benefits.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson

general.quote: Nobody’s ever the greatest anything.
general.author: maralyn polak

general.quote: All great men are gifted with intuition. They know without reasoning or analysis, what they need to know.
general.author: dr. alexis carrel

general.quote: Neither wealth nor greatness render us happy.
general.author: jean de la fontaine

general.quote: Great people are they who see that spiritual is stronger than any material force, that thoughts rule the world.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson

general.quote: Greatness, in order to gain recognition, must all too often consent to ape greatness.
general.author: jean rostand

general.quote: The price of greatness is responsibility.
general.author: winston churchill quotes

general.quote: There is a great man who makes every man feel small. But the real great man is the man who makes every man feel great.
general.author: gilbert k. chesterton

general.quote: It’s not who you are that holds you back, it’s who you think you’re not.
general.author: hanoch mccarty

general.quote: There are no great men, only great challenges that ordinary men are forced by circumstances to meet.
general.author: william f. halsey

general.quote: Greatness does not approach him who is forever looking down.
general.author: hitopadesa

general.quote: Great men are rarely isolated mountain-peaks; they are the summits of ranges.
general.author: thomas wentworth higginson

general.quote: Great men never make bad use of their superiority. They see it and feel it and are not less modest. The more they have, the more they know their own deficiencies.
general.author: jean jacques rousseau

general.quote: To achieve greatness one should live as if they will never die.
general.author: francois de la rochefoucauld

general.quote: Great people are able to do great kindnesses.
general.author: miguel de cervantes

general.quote: Great men always pay deference to greater.
general.author: walter savage landor

general.quote: The lights of stars that were extinguished ages ago still reaches us. So it is with great men who died centuries ago, but still reach us with the radiations of their personalities.
general.author: kahlil gibran quotes

general.quote: It is the nature of all greatness not to be exact.
general.author: edmund burke

general.quote: Great men are the guideposts and landmarks in the state.
general.author: edmund burke

general.quote: No one ever became great by imitation.
general.author: samuel johnson

general.quote: Do not despise the bottom rungs in the ascent to greatness.
general.author: publilius syrus

general.quote: Traditionally the great men of our country have sprung from poor environments; that being so, it would appear we have long suffered from a severe lack of poverty.
general.author: gerald f. lieberman

general.quote: There is no greatness where there is not simplicity, goodness and truth.
general.author: count leo tolstoy

general.quote: Great necessities call forth great leaders.
general.author: abigail adams

general.quote: The essence of greatness is the perception that virtue is enough.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson

general.quote: To be great is to be misunderstood.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson

general.quote: Man is only truly great when he acts from his passions.
general.author: benjamin disraeli

general.quote: The first step toward greatness is to be honest.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: The greatest men of a nation are those it puts to death.
general.author: ernest renan

general.quote: Greatness and goodness are not means, but ends.
general.author: samuel taylor coleridge

general.quote: Great men are true men, the men in whom nature has succeeded. They are not extraordinary — they are in the true order. It is the other species of men who are not what they ought to be.
general.author: henri frederic amiel

general.quote: A really great man is known by three signs: Generosity in the design, humanity in the execution, moderation in success.
general.author: otto von bismarck

general.quote: All my life I have always known I was born to greatness.
general.author: oprah winfrey quotes

general.quote: Great men are not always wise.
general.author: bible

general.quote: A good name is rather to be chosen than great riches.
general.author: bible

general.quote: The history of the world is but the biography of great men.
general.author: thomas carlyle

general.quote: Great minds discuss ideas; average minds discuss events; small minds discuss people.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: Greatness is not standing above our fellows and ordering them around — it is standing with them and helping them to be all they can be.
general.author: arthur g. keough

general.quote: Those who intend on becoming great should love neither themselves or their own things, but only what is just, whether it happens to be done by themselves or others.
general.author: plato

general.quote: Great men are the commissioned guides of mankind, who rule their fellows because they are wiser.
general.author: thomas carlyle

general.quote: Great men are like eagles, and build their nest on some lofty solitude.
general.author: arthur schopenhauer

general.quote: It is the fate of the great ones of this earth, to be appreciated only after they are gone.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: No man is truly great who is great only in his lifetime. The test of greatness is the page of history.
general.author: william hazlitt

general.quote: A great man stands on God. A small man on a great man.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson quotes

general.quote: A position of eminence makes a great person greater and a small person less.
general.author: jean de la bruyere

general.quote: Greatness is a spiritual condition.
general.author: matthew arnold

general.quote: Great woman belong to history and to self sacrifice.
general.author: leigh hunt

general.quote: A great man’s greatest good luck is to die at the right time.
general.author: eric hoffer

general.quote: A great person is one who affects the mind of their generation.
general.author: benjamin disraeli

general.quote: They’re only truly great who are truly good.
general.author: george chapman

general.quote: The search after the great men is the dream of youth, and the most serious occupation of manhood.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson

general.quote: Great men hallow a whole people, and lift up all who live in their time.
general.author: sydney smith

general.quote: It is a melancholy truth that even great men have their poor relations.
general.author: charles dickens quotes

general.quote: If you would attain greatness, think no little thoughts.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: There never was a truly great man that was not at the same time truly virtuous.
general.author: benjamin franklin quotes

general.quote: No great man ever complains of want of opportunity.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson

general.quote: A woman’s guess is much more accurate than a man’s certainty.
general.author: rudyard kipling

general.quote: Certitude is not the test of certainty. We have been cock-sure of many things that were not so.
general.author: oliver wendell holmes

general.quote: The only certainty is that nothing is certain.
general.author: pliny the elder

general.quote: He who is certain he knows the ending of things when he is only beginning them is either extremely wise or extremely foolish; no matter which is true, he is certainly an unhappy man, for he has put a knife in the heart of wonder.
general.author: tad williams

general.quote: Only one thing is certain — that is, nothing is certain. If this statement is true, it is also false.
general.author: ancient paradox

general.quote: No great deed is done by flatterers who ask for certainty.
general.author: george eliot

general.quote: Certainties are arrived at only on foot.
general.author: antonio porchia

general.quote: Education is the path from cocky ignorance to miserable uncertainty.
general.author: mark twain quotes

general.quote: We are not certain, we are never certain. If we were we could reach some conclusions, and we could, at last, make others take us seriously.
general.author: albert camus

general.quote: Doubt is not a pleasant mental state, but certainty is a ridiculous one.
general.author: voltaire

general.quote: We delight in one knowable thing, which comprehends all that is knowable; in one apprehensible, which draws together all that can be apprehended; in a single being that includes all, above all in the one which is itself the all.
general.author: giordano bruno

general.quote: Who knows whether the gods will add tomorrow to the present hour?
general.author: horace

general.quote: The odds are six to five that the light in the end of the tunnel is the headlight of an oncoming train.
general.author: paul dickson

general.quote: If you do know that here is one hand, we’ll grant you all the rest.
general.author: ludwig wittgenstein

general.quote: What men want is not knowledge, but certainty.
general.author: bertrand russell

general.quote: There are only two things you have to do in life. You have to die. You have to live until you die. You make up all the rest.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: One must verify or expel his doubts, and convert them into the certainty of Yes or No.
general.author: thomas carlyle

general.quote: A reasonable probability is the only certainty.
general.author: edgar watson howe

general.quote: Unpredictability, too, can become monotonous.
general.author: eric hoffer

general.quote: It is not certain that everything is uncertain.
general.author: blaise pascal

general.quote: The more I see the less I know for sure.
general.author: john lennon

general.quote: The two hardest things to handle in life are failure and success.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: Events are never absolute, their outcome depends entirely upon the individual. Misfortune is a stepping stone for a genius, a piscina for a Christian, a treasure for a man of parts, and an abyss for a weakling.
general.author: honore de balzac

general.quote: I tore myself away from the safe comfort of certainties through my love for truth; and truth rewarded me.
general.author: sylvia ashton warner

general.quote: A chuck under the chin is worth two kisses.
general.author: jonathan swift

general.quote: All that lies betwixt the cradle and the grave is uncertain.
general.author: seneca

general.quote: There is nothing certain in a man’s life but that he must lose it.
general.author: owen meredith

general.quote: Live on doubts; it becomes madness or stops entirely as soon as we pass from doubt to certainty.
general.author: francois de la rochefoucauld

general.quote: If a man will begin with certainties, he shall end in doubts, but if he will be content to begin with doubts, he shall end in certainties.
general.author: francis bacon

general.quote: The best lack all conviction, while the worst are full of passionate intensity.
general.author: william butler yeats

general.quote: The longing for certainty… is in every human mind. But certainty is generally illusion.
general.author: oliver wendell holmes

general.quote: It is the dull man who is always sure, and the sure man who is always dull.
general.author: h. l. mencken

general.quote: There is nothing so uncertain as a sure thing.
general.author: scotty bowman

general.quote: When we are not sure, we are alive.
general.author: graham greene

general.quote: The present is the only reality and the only certainty.
general.author: arthur schopenhauer

general.quote: Certainty is the mother of quiet and repose, and uncertainty the cause of variance and contentions.
general.author: lord edward coke

general.quote: When the mind is in a state of uncertainty the smallest impulse directs it to either side.
general.author: terence

general.quote: If you have a choice between certainty and hope, choose certainty every time.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: What makes friendship indissolute and what doubles its charms is a feeling we find lacking in love: I mean certitude.
general.author: honore de balzac

general.quote: To be positive: to be mistaken at the top of one’s voice.
general.author: ambrose bierce

general.quote: I am certain of nothing but the holiness of the heart’s affections, and the truth of imagination.
general.author: john keats

general.quote: Positiveness is an absurd foible. If you are in the right, it lessens your triumph; if in the wrong, it adds shame to your defeat.
general.author: laurence sterne

general.quote: Science has proof without any certainty. Creationists have certainty without any proof.
general.author: charles edward montague

general.quote: The whole problem with the world is that fools and fanatics are always so certain of themselves, but wiser people so full of doubts.
general.author: bertrand arthur william russell

general.quote: There is nothing certain except the unforeseen.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: Convictions are more dangerous enemies of truth than lies.
general.author: friedrich nietzsche

general.quote: The one unchangeable certainty is that nothing is unchangeable or certain.
general.author: john f. kennedy quotes

general.quote: We can be absolutely certain only about things we do not understand.
general.author: eric hoffer

general.quote: Most men make the voyage of life as if they carried sealed orders which they were not to open till they were fairly in mid-ocean.
general.author: james russell lowell

general.quote: As we know, there are known knowns. There are things we know we know. We also know there are known unknowns. That is to say, we know there are some things we do not know. But there are also unknown unknowns; the one we don’t know we don’t know.
general.author: donald rumsfeld

general.quote: I have lived in this world just long enough to look carefully the second time into things that I am the most certain of the first time.
general.author: josh billings

general.quote: Certainty? In this world nothing is certain but death and taxes.
general.author: benjamin franklin quotes

general.quote: Inquiry is fatal to certainty.
general.author: william j. durant

general.quote: We do know of certain knowledge that he [Osama bin Laden] is either in Afghanistan, or in some other country, or dead.
general.author: donald rumsfeld

general.quote: Do not feel certain of anything.
general.author: bertrand arthur william russell

general.quote: Our awesome responsibility to ourselves, to our children, and to the future is to create ourselves in the image of goodness, because the future depends on the nobility of our imaginings.
general.author: barbara grizzuti harrison

general.quote: Nobility of birth does not always ensure a corresponding nobility of mind; if it did, it would always act as a stimulus to noble actions; but it sometimes acts as a clog, rather than a spur.
general.author: charles caleb colton

general.quote: What is madness but nobility of soul at odds with circumstance.
general.author: theodore roethke

general.quote: If there is anything good about nobility it is that it enforces the necessity of avoiding degeneracy.
general.author: boethius

general.quote: Nobility should be elective, not hereditary.
general.author: johann georg von zimmermann

general.quote: Nobility, without virtue, is a fine setting without a gem.
general.author: jane porter

general.quote: All nobility in its beginnings was somebody’s natural superiority.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson

general.quote: My nobility begins in me, but yours ends in you.
general.author: iphicrates

general.quote: Nobility of spirit has more to do with simplicity than ostentation, wisdom rather than wealth, commitment rather than ambition.
general.author: riccardo muti

general.quote: War alone brings up to their highest tension all human energies and imposes the stamp of nobility upon the peoples who have the courage to make it.
general.author: benito mussolini

general.quote: Of all varieties of fopperies, the vanity of high birth is the greatest. True nobility is derived from virtue, not from birth. Title, indeed, may be purchased, but virtue is the only coin that makes the bargain valid.
general.author: robert burton

general.quote: Everyone has something that blocks us from the full experience and expression of our nobility.
general.author: iyanla vanzant

general.quote: To be a good father and mother requires that the parents defer many of their own needs and desires in favor of the needs of their children. As a consequence of this sacrifice, conscientious parents develop a nobility of character and learn to put into practice the selfless truths taught by the Savior Himself.
general.author: james e. faust

general.quote: Life ought to be a struggle of desire toward adventures whose nobility will fertilize the soul.
general.author: rebecca west

general.quote: A wild, untamed youth learns nobility through art.
general.author: jacques d’amboise

general.quote: The army is the true nobility of our country.
general.author: napoleon bonaparte

general.quote: Noblest minds are easiest bent.
general.author: homer

general.quote: Real nobility is based on scorn, courage, and profound indifference.
general.author: albert camus

general.quote: Let wealth and commerce, laws and learning die, but leave us still our old nobility.
general.author: lord john james robert manners

general.quote: Noble by birth, yet nobler by great deeds.
general.author: henry wadsworth longfellow

general.quote: There are obligations to nobility.
general.author: gaston pierre marc

general.quote: There may be as much nobility in being last as in being first, because the two positions are equally necessary in the world, the one to complement the other.
general.author: jose ortega y gasset

general.quote: Noble hearts are neither jealous nor afraid because jealousy spells doubt and fear spells pettiness.
general.author: honore de balzac

general.quote: Better not to be at all than not to be noble.
general.author: lord alfred tennyson

general.quote: It shows nobility to be willing to increase your debt to a man to whom you already owe much.
general.author: marcus tullius cicero

general.quote: Talent and worth are the only eternal grounds of distinction. To these the Almighty has affixed His everlasting patent of nobility. Knowledge and goodness,–these make degrees in heaven, and they must be the graduating scale of a true democracy.
general.author: catharine maria sedgwick

general.quote: We must have kings, we must have nobles; nature is always providing such in every society; only let us have the real instead of the titular.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson

general.quote: True nobility is exempt from fear.
general.author: marcus tullius cicero

general.quote: Put more trust in nobility of character than in an oath.
general.author: solon

general.quote: There are epidemics of nobleness as well as epidemics of disease.
general.author: james anthony froude

general.quote: The nobility of a human being is strictly independent of that of his convictions.
general.author: jean rostand

general.quote: Be noble in every thought. And in every deed!
general.author: henry wadsworth longfellow

general.quote: Nature’s noblemen are everywhere,–in town and out of town, gloved and rough-handed, rich and poor. Prejudice against a lord, because he is a lord, is losing the chance of finding a good fellow, as much as prejudice against a ploughman because he is a ploughman.
general.author: nathaniel parker willis

general.quote: Noble blood is an accident of fortune; noble actions characterize the great.
general.author: carlo goldoni

general.quote: Idleness is an appendix to nobility.
general.author: robert burton

general.quote: He who is lord of himself, and exists upon his own resources, is a noble but a rare being.
general.author: egerton brydges

general.quote: The noblest character is stained by the addition of pride.
general.author: claudian

general.quote: Nobility is a graceful ornament to the civil order. It is the Corinthian capital of polished society.
general.author: edmund burke

general.quote: A noble life crowned with heroic death, rises above and outlives the pride and pomp and glory of the mightiest empire of the earth.
general.author: james abram garfield

general.quote: Nobility is a river that sets with a constant and undeviating current directly into the great Pacific Ocean of time; but, unlike all other rivers, it is more grand at its source than at its termination.
general.author: charles caleb colton

general.quote: Virtue is the truest nobility.
general.author: miguel de cervantes

general.quote: Nature makes all the noblemen; wealth, education, or pedigree never made one yet.
general.author: henry wheeler shaw

general.quote: We read our children stories starring elephants and monkeys and bears to teach them about nobility, curiosity and courage, to warn them against selfishness and stubbornness.
general.author: lydia millet

general.quote: The human element, the human flaw and the human nobility – those are the reasons that chess matches are won or lost.
general.author: viktor korchnoi

general.quote: Today nobility is gone: there is only a peerage.
general.author: honore de balzac

general.quote: If you are seeking creative ideas, go out walking. Angels whisper to a man when he goes for a walk.
general.author: raymond inmon

general.quote: Some people will believe anything if you whisper it to them.
general.author: miguel de unamuno

general.quote: What I like in a good author is not what he says but what he whispers.
general.author: logan pearsall smith

general.quote: When you whisper about something, it’s too big, and you can’t get it under control and take control of it.
general.author: joan rivers

general.quote: he gift of friendship… a willingness to listen… a pair of helping hands… a whisper from the heart. That someone cares and understands.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: Sometimes a whisper speaks volumes.
general.author: scott sheddan

general.quote: Ever notice that the whisper of temptation can be heard farther than the loudest call to duty.
general.author: earl wilson

general.quote: Death’s life should have listened to the moonly whispers of breathing in the coldest nights.
general.author: munia khan

general.quote: It is impossible that the whisper of a faction should prevail against the voice of a nation.
general.author: lord john russell

general.quote: Everything is my demon muse. I have a muse which whispers in my ear and says, ‘Do this, do that,’ but it’s my demon who provokes me.
general.author: ray bradbury

general.quote: A secret is not something unrevealed, but something told privately, in a whisper.
general.author: marcel pagnol

general.quote: Her voice was a hushed whisper against my ear. An audible smile.
general.author: richard e. gropp

general.quote: Now suddenly there was nothing but a world of cloud, and we three were there alone in the middle of a great white plain with snowy hills and mountains staring at us; and it was very still; but there were whispers.
general.author: black elk

general.quote: Leaks and whispers are a daily routine of news-gathering in Washington.
general.author: william greider

general.quote: None of us will ever accomplish anything excellent or commanding except when he listens to this whisper which is heard by him alone.
general.author: thomas carlyle

general.quote: It isn’t what they say about you, it’s what they whisper.
general.author: errol flynn

general.quote: Humor is a whisper from the soul, imploring mind and body to relax, let go and be at peace again.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: Every heart sings a song, incomplete, until another heart whispers back. Those who wish to sing always find a song. At the touch of a lover, everyone becomes a poet.
general.author: plato

general.quote: Too often government responds to the whispers of lobbyists before the cries of the people.
general.author: andrew cuomo

general.quote: Don’t write anything you can phone. Don’t phone anything you can talk. Don’t talk anything you can whisper. Don’t whisper anything you can smile. Don’t smile anything you can nod. Don’t nod anything you can wink.
general.author: earl long

general.quote: For it was not into my ear you whispered, but into my heart. It was not my lips you kissed, but my soul.
general.author: judy garland

general.quote: Speech is a very important aspect of being human. A whisper doesn’t cut it.
general.author: james earl jones

general.quote: Hope smiles from the threshold of the year to come, whispering, ‘It will be happier.
general.author: alfred lord tennyson

general.quote: All of nature begins to whisper its secrets to us through its sounds. Sounds that were previously incomprehensible to our soul now become the meaningful language of nature.
general.author: rudolf steiner

general.quote: Let us be silent, that we may hear the whispers of the gods.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson

general.quote: There’s not a wind but whispers of thy name; And not a flow’r that grows beneath the moon, But in its hues and fragrance tells a tale Of thee, my love.
general.author: bryan procter

general.quote: One should be more concerned about what his conscience whispers than about what other people shout.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: The novel is more of a whisper, whereas the stage is a shout.
general.author: robert holman

general.quote: And the first rude sketch that the world had seen was joy to his mighty heart, till the Devil whispered behind the leaves ‘It’s pretty, but is it Art?’
general.author: rudyard kipling

general.quote: The very winds whispered in soothing accents, and maternal Nature bade me weep no more.
general.author: mary shelley

general.quote: The words of the prophets are written on the subway walls and tenements halls and whispered in the sounds of silence.
general.author: paul simon

general.quote: Don’t let your will roar when your power only whispers.
general.author: thomas fuller

general.quote: It is harder to kill a whisper than even a shouted calumny.
general.author: mary w. stewart

general.quote: One test of strength is the ability to take defeat graciously.
general.author: lewise korns

general.quote: Faith is the strength by which a shattered world shall emerge into the light.
general.author: helen keller

general.quote: The strong are God’s natural protectors of the weak.
general.author: henry ward beecher

general.quote: Our strength is often composed of the weakness we’re damned if we’re going to show.
general.author: mignon mclaughlin

general.quote: We confide in our strength, without boasting of it; we respect that of others, without fearing it.
general.author: thomas jefferson

general.quote: A powerful idea communicates some of its strength to him who challenges it.
general.author: marcel proust

general.quote: The strongest man in the world is he who stands most alone.
general.author: henrik ibsen

general.quote: He sends a cross, but He also sends the strength to bear it.
general.author: leo s tolstoy

general.quote: Few men during their lifetime come anywhere near exhausting the resources dwelling within them. There are deep wells of strength that are never used.
general.author: richard btrd

general.quote: Be faithful in small things because it is in them that your strength lies.
general.author: mother teresa

general.quote: The strongest may have need of more strength.
general.author: edward counsel

general.quote: Strength comes from solitude, a waiting, a communion with the best in us, which is at one with the divine spark.
general.author: elbert hubbard

general.quote: Strengthen me by sympathizing with my strength, not my weakness.
general.author: amos bronson alcott

general.quote: It does not take much strength to do things, but it requires great strength to decide what to do.
general.author: elbert hubbard

general.quote: The man who is swimming against the stream knows the strength of it.
general.author: woodrow t. wilson

general.quote: The greatest strength expires with loss of breath; the mightiest in one minute stoop to death.
general.author: thomas dekker

general.quote: People do not lack strength; they lack will.
general.author: victor hugo

general.quote: Only actions give life strength; only moderation gives it charm.
general.author: jean paul richter

general.quote: You really have to look inside yourself and find your own inner strength, and say, "I’m proud of what I am and who I am, and I’m just going to be myself.
general.author: mariah carey

general.quote: Mastering others is strength; mastering yourself is true power…
general.author: tao te ching

general.quote: Strength is an empty shell.
general.author: jack london

general.quote: Consciousness of our strength increases it.
general.author: lucde claoiers

general.quote: The hand of the aggressor is stayed by strength–and strength alone.
general.author: dwight eisenhower

general.quote: Charm is a woman’s strength just as strength is a man’s charm.
general.author: havelock ellis

general.quote: We acquire the strength we have overcome.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson

general.quote: Never be afraid to expose a weakness in yourself. Exposing a weakness is the beginning of strength.
general.author: robert anthony

general.quote: Love many things, for therein lies the true strength, and whosoever loves much performs much, and can accomplish much, and what is done in love is done well.
general.author: vincent van gogh

general.quote: We do not have to become heroes overnight. Just a step at a time, meeting each thing that comes up … discovering we have the strength to stare it down.
general.author: eleanor roosevelt

general.quote: That which does not kill me makes me stronger.
general.author: friedrich nietzsche

general.quote: As long as I fear my weakness, I am stronger than when I trust my strength.
general.author: ivan panin

general.quote: Oh, it is excellent to have a giant’s strength, but it is tyrannous to use it like a giant.
general.author: william shakespeare

general.quote: If we are strong, our strength will speak for itself. If we are weak, words will be of no help.
general.author: john kennedy

general.quote: As our heart summons our strength, our wisdom must direct it.
general.author: dwight eisenhower

general.quote: The strength of a nation derives from the integrity of the home.
general.author: confucius

general.quote: Strength, if not used to protect, is but weakness.
general.author: lewise korns

general.quote: My strength is as the strength of ten, because my heart is pure.
general.author: alfred tennyson

general.quote: Endurance is nobler than strength and patience than beauty.
general.author: john ruskin

general.quote: Credulity is the man’s weakness, but the child’s strength.
general.author: charles lamb

general.quote: Promise, large promise, is the soul of an advertisement.
general.author: samuel johnson

general.quote: Promises may fit the friends, but non-performance will turn them into enemies.
general.author: benjamin franklin

general.quote: Promise is most given when the least is said.
general.author: george chapman

general.quote: Promises that you make to yourself are often like the Japanese plum tree – they bear no fruit.
general.author: francis marion

general.quote: Political promises are much like marriage vows. They are made at the beginning of the relationship between candidate and voter, but are quickly forgotten.
general.author: dick gregory

general.quote: For every promise, there is price to pay.
general.author: jim rohn

general.quote: Dignity and love were never yet boon companions.
general.author: henry fielding

general.quote: When boasting ends, there dignity begins.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: Place confers no dignity upon some men; like a balloon, the higher they rise the smaller they look.
general.author: g. d. prentice

general.quote: The generous mind adds dignity to every act, and nothing misbecomes it.
general.author: plutarch

general.quote: Every man has his dignity. I’m willing to forget mine, but at my own discretion and not when someone else tells me to.
general.author: denis diderot

general.quote: Clay and clay differs in dignity, whose dust is both alike.
general.author: william shakespeare

general.quote: Dignity is often a veil between us and the real truth of things.
general.author: edwin percy whipple

general.quote: Dignity has no price … when someone starts making small concessions, in the end life loses all meaning.
general.author: josé saramago

general.quote: If you want to know how little your dignity is worth, take it to the pawnbroker.
general.author: evan esar

general.quote: Dignity does not consist in possessing honors, but in deserving them.
general.author: aristotle

general.quote: Human rights rest on human dignity. The dignity of man is an ideal worth fighting for and worth dying for.
general.author: robert maynard

general.quote: Only man has dignity; only man, therefore, can be funny.
general.author: ronald knox

general.quote: There is nothing more dignified than a corpse.
general.author: evan esar

general.quote: Remember this,–that there is a proper dignity and proportion to be observed in the performance of every act of life.
general.author: marcus aurelius

general.quote: All celebrated people lose dignity upon close inspection.
general.author: napoleon bonaparte

general.quote: Natural dignity of mind or manners can never be concealed; it ever commands our respect: assumed dignity, or importance, excites our ridicule and contempt.
general.author: joseph bartlett

general.quote: Dignity of position adds to dignity of character, as well as to dignity of carriage. Give us a proud position, and we are impelled to act up to it.
general.author: christian nestell bovee

general.quote: Without dignity, identity is erased. In its absence, men are defined not by themselves, but by their captors and the circumstances in which they are forced to live.
general.author: laura hillenbrand

general.quote: Dignity is a mask we wear to hide our ignorance.
general.author: elbert hubbard

general.quote: By indignities men come to dignities.
general.author: francis bacon

general.quote: Dignity and love do not blend.
general.author: suzanne curchod necker

general.quote: It is of very little use in trying to be dignified, if dignity is no part of your character.
general.author: christian nestell bovee

general.quote: There is no dignity quite so impressive, and no one independence quite so important, as living within your means.
general.author: calvin coolidge

general.quote: Our dignity is not in what we do, but what we understand.
general.author: george santayana

general.quote: Men possessing minds which are morose, solemn, and inflexible enjoy generally a greater share of dignity than of happiness.
general.author: francis bacon

general.quote: There is even the dignity of vice.
general.author: antoine de rivarol

general.quote: At night, when the curtains are drawn and the fire flickers, my books attain a collective dignity.
general.author: edward m. forster

general.quote: Dignity is like air. When you breathe easily, you don’t think about it. But, when you don’t have enough of it, all you can think about is air, air, more air!
general.author: aigul aubanova

general.quote: There is a healthful hardiness about real dignity that never dreads contact and communion with others however humble.
general.author: washington irving

general.quote: Dignity belongs to the conquered.
general.author: kenneth burke

general.quote: Each of us, face to face with other men, is clothed with some sort of dignity, but we know only too well all the unspeakable things that go on in the heart.
general.author: luigi pirandello

general.quote: Dignity and love do not blend well, nor do they continue long together.
general.author: ovid

general.quote: Dignity increases more easily than it begins.
general.author: seneca

general.quote: A fit of anger is as fatal to dignity as a dose of arsenic is to life.
general.author: josiah gilbert holland

general.quote: Dignity of manner always conveys a sense of reserved force.
general.author: amos bronson alcott

general.quote: Victory belongs to those that believe in it the most and believe in it the longest.
general.author: randall wallace

general.quote: And either victory, or else a grave.
general.author: william shakespeare

general.quote: Beware of rashness, but with energy, and sleepless vigilance, go forward and give us victories.
general.author: abraham lincoln

general.quote: Wherever work is done, victory is attained.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson

general.quote: Victory shifts, you know, now one man, now another.
general.author: homer

general.quote: It is more difficult to look upon victory than upon battle.
general.author: sir walter scott

general.quote: The secret of all victory lies in the organization of the non-obvious.
general.author: oswald spengler

general.quote: There are some defeats more triumphant than victories.
general.author: michel eyquem de montaigne

general.quote: For every victory, there is a price.
general.author: jacqueline carey

general.quote: In victory, the hero seeks the glory, not the prey.
general.author: sir philip sidney

general.quote: Yes, victory is sweet, but it doesn’t necessarily make life any easier the next season or even the next day.
general.author: phil jackson

general.quote: Victory is a thing of the will.
general.author: general ferdinand foch

general.quote: The best policy is to declare victory and leave.
general.author: george d. aiken

general.quote: To whom God will, there be the victory.
general.author: william shakespeare

general.quote: The moment of victory is much too short to live for that and nothing else.
general.author: martina navratilova

general.quote: The ultimate victory in competition is derived from the inner satisfaction of knowing that you have done your best and that you have gotten the most out of what you had to give.
general.author: howard cosell

general.quote: One may know how to gain a victory, and know not how to use it.
general.author: pedro calderón de la barca

general.quote: You cannot expect victory and plan for defeat.
general.author: john osteen

general.quote: Victory is by nature insolent and haughty.
general.author: marcus t. cicero

general.quote: Victory is sweetest when you’ve known defeat.
general.author: malcolm s. forbes

general.quote: A victory is twice itself when the achiever brings home full numbers.
general.author: william shakespeare

general.quote: How beautiful is victory, but how dear!
general.author: marquis stanislas jean de boufflers

general.quote: The will to conquer is the first condition of victory.
general.author: ferdinand foch

general.quote: Victory goes to the player who makes the next-to-last mistake.
general.author: savielly grigorievitch tartakower

general.quote: The smile of God is victory.
general.author: john greenleaf whittier

general.quote: Even the smallest victory is never to be taken for granted. Each victory must be applauded…
general.author: audre lorde

general.quote: I love victory, but I love not triumph.
general.author: madame anne sophie swetchine

general.quote: A victory won over self, is the only victory acceptable to God.
general.author: charles nelson douglas

general.quote: Even victors are by victory undone.
general.author: john dryden

general.quote: If a victory is told in detail, one can no longer distinguish it from a defeat.
general.author: jean-paul sartre

general.quote: They see nothing wrong in the rule, that to the victors belong the spoils of the enemy.
general.author: william learned marcy

general.quote: God on our side, doubt not of victory.
general.author: william shakespeare

general.quote: Whether in chains or in laurels, liberty knows nothing but victories.
general.author: douglas macarthur

general.quote: The victor belongs to the spoils.
general.author: f. scott fitzgerald

general.quote: Victory and defeat are each of the same price.
general.author: thomas jefferson

general.quote: It is the contest that delights us, and not the victory.
general.author: blaise pascal

general.quote: A Victory without danger is a triumph without glory.
general.author: pierre corneille

general.quote: True moral elegance consists in the art of disguising one’s victories as defeats.
general.author: emile cioran

general.quote: To the victor belongs the spoils.
general.author: william learned marcy

general.quote: All victories breed hate, and that over your superior is foolish or fatal.
general.author: baltasar gracian

general.quote: Victory lies with the truth.
general.author: motto

general.quote: I will attained victory by God and my sword.
general.author: motto

general.quote: No battle is ever won … victory is an illusion of philosophers and fools.
general.author: william faulkner

general.quote: If you live long enough, you’ll see that every victory turns into a defeat.
general.author: simone de beauvoir

general.quote: Men talk as if victory were something fortunate. Work is victory.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson

general.quote: The most dangerous moment comes with victory.
general.author: napoleon bonaparte

general.quote: No matter how often you are defeated, you are born to victory.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson

general.quote: Self conquest is the greatest of victories.
general.author: plato

general.quote: You ask, what is our aim? I can answer in one word: It is victory, victory at all costs, victory in spite of all terror, victory, however long and hard the road may be.
general.author: winston churchill

general.quote: If you think you can win, you can win. Faith is necessary to victory.
general.author: william hazlitt

general.quote: Victory is increased by concord.
general.author: motto

general.quote: You win the victory when you yield to friends.
general.author: sophocles

general.quote: Be resolute, fear no sacrifice and surmount every difficulty to win victory.
general.author: mao zedong

general.quote: Victory becomes, to some degree, a state of mind. Knowing ourselves superior to the anxieties, troubles, and worries which obsess us, we are superior to them.
general.author: basil king

general.quote: Victory follows me, and all things follow victory.
general.author: george de scuderi

general.quote: The god of victory is said to be one-handed, but peace gives victory on both sides.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson

general.quote: Victory at all costs, victory in spite of all terror, victory however long and hard the road may be; for without victory there is no survival.
general.author: winston churchill

general.quote: Great victory requires great risk.
general.author: rick riodan

general.quote: The supreme excellence is not to win a hundred victories in a hundred battles. The supreme excellence is to subdue the armies of your enemies without even having to fight them.
general.author: lao-tzu

general.quote: Private victories precede public victories. You can’t invert that process any more than you can harvest a crop before you plant it.
general.author: stephen r. covey

general.quote: There is nothing so dreadful as a great victory–except a great defeat.
general.author: arthur wellesley

general.quote: I look at victory as milestones on a very long highway.
general.author: joan benoit samuelson

general.quote: What is the highest secret to victory and peace? To will what God wills, and strike a league with destiny.
general.author: william r. alger

general.quote: The most urgent necessity in human life is to be able to face life victoriously. For many are living mentally, physically, morally and spiritually defeated.
general.author: f. a. wickett

general.quote: Nothing is more precious than independence and liberty.
general.author: ho chi minh

general.quote: When liberty returns, I will return.
general.author: victor hugo quotes

general.quote: Liberty is not to be had or held without effort.
general.author: herbert clark hoover

general.quote: Liberty consists in the power of doing that which is permitted by the law.
general.author: marcus tullius cicero

general.quote: Love bondage more than liberty; Bondage with ease than strenuous liberty.
general.author: john milton
