general.quote: The joy of giving is as often overlooked as the giving of joy.
general.author: david barton

general.quote: We must not only give what we have; we must also give what we are.
general.author: desiree joseph mercier

general.quote: In giving is the true enlightenment.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: I hate the giving of the hand unless the whole man accompanies it.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson

general.quote: God let it be known that it is better to give than to receive, but a lot of people failed to get the message.
general.author: edmund w littlefield

general.quote: Sharing is sometimes more demanding than giving.
general.author: mary bateson

general.quote: The more sympathy you give, the less you need.
general.author: malcolm s. forbes

general.quote: You give but little when you give of your possessions. It is when you give of yourself that you truly give.
general.author: kahlil gibran

general.quote: Giving is true loving.
general.author: charles haddon spurgeon

general.quote: True giving knows no season.
general.author: florence e. king

general.quote: One man gives freely, yet grows all the richer; another withholds what he should give, and only suffers want.
general.author: bible

general.quote: In the long run, we get no more than we have been willing to risk giving.
general.author: sheldon kopp

general.quote: We give to others not out of a sense of obligation, but out of a sense of sincere appreciation for what our community has given us.
general.author: frank m. hubbard

general.quote: We do not quite forgive a giver. The hand that feeds us is in some danger of being bitten.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson quotes

general.quote: What you keep to yourself you lose, what you give away, you keep forever.
general.author: axel munthe

general.quote: It is normal to give away a little of one’s life in order not to lose it all.
general.author: albert camus

general.quote: The trick is to realize that after giving your best, there’s nothing more to give.
general.author: sparky anderson

general.quote: Giving until it hurts is not a true measure of charity. Some are more easily hurt than others.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: Do your giving while you’re living, then you’ll be knowing where it’s going.
general.author: ann landers

general.quote: Give a lot, expect a lot, and if you don’t get it, prune.
general.author: thomas j. peters

general.quote: Deeds of giving are the very foundation of the world.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: To give to the poor is to share one’s self; to give to the rich is to share one’s ego.
general.author: pedrito u. maynard-reid

general.quote: Giving is a privilege that fills the heart with joy.
general.author: henry a. rosso

general.quote: When you give, take to yourself no credit for generosity, unless you deny yourself something in order that you may give.
general.author: henry taylor

general.quote: You give before you get.
general.author: napoleon hill

general.quote: It is more blessed to give than to receive.
general.author: bible

general.quote: In Giving, a man receives more than he gives; and the more is in proportion to the worth of the thing given.
general.author: george mcdonald

general.quote: When I give I give myself.
general.author: walt whitman

general.quote: Seek joy in what you give not in what you get.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: The best thing about giving of ourselves is that what we get is always better than what we give. The reaction is greater than the action.
general.author: orison swett marden

general.quote: It is better to give than to lend, and it costs about the same.
general.author: philip gibbs

general.quote: One must be poor to know the luxury of giving.
general.author: george eliot

general.quote: What you give away is the only wealth you will always have.
general.author: marcus valerius martial

general.quote: Give plenty of what is given to you, and listen to pity’s call; don’t think the little you give is great and the much you get is small.
general.author: phoebe cary

general.quote: I have always noticed that a man who gives the most for the money gets the most business.
general.author: vash young

general.quote: Let us not be satisfied with just giving money. Money is not enough; money can be got; but they need your hearts to love them.
general.author: mother teresa

general.quote: To give and then not feel that one has given is the very best of all ways of giving.
general.author: max beerbohm

general.quote: The more you have, the more you are occupied, the less you give. But the less you have, the more free you are.
general.author: mother teresa

general.quote: You must be fit to give before you can be fit to receive.
general.author: james stephens

general.quote: Giving opens the way for receiving.
general.author: florence scovel shinn

general.quote: We must give more in order to get more, It is the generous giving of ourselves that produce the generous harvest.
general.author: orison swett marden

general.quote: Don’t give until it hurts. Give until it feels good!
general.author: unknown

general.quote: It is possible to give without loving, but it is impossible to love without giving.
general.author: richard braunstein

general.quote: All you have shall some day be given; therefore, give now that the season of giving may be yours and not your inheritor’s.
general.author: kahlil gibran quotes

general.quote: He that gives his heart will not deny his money.
general.author: thomas fuller

general.quote: Giving pays the highest interest rate and has the longest term of any investment available.
general.author: jeffrey k filson

general.quote: The more we give of anything, the more we shall get back.
general.author: grace speare

general.quote: Nature does not give to those who will not spend.
general.author: r.j. baughan

general.quote: The Lord loves a cheerful giver, and so does everyone else.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: Don’t be afraid of giving. You can never give too much, if you are giving willingly.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: Nothing that you have not given away will ever be really yours.
general.author: c. s. lewis

general.quote: You must give to get, You must sow the seed, before you can reap the harvest.
general.author: scott reed

general.quote: Blessed are those who give without remembering. And blessed are those who take without forgetting.
general.author: bernard meltzer

general.quote: All that this world knows of living lies in giving … and more giving; He that keeps, be sure he loses …Friendship grows by what it uses.
general.author: alexander maclaren

general.quote: We receive but what we give.
general.author: samuel taylor coleridge

general.quote: For of those to whom much is given, much is required.
general.author: john f. kennedy quotes

general.quote: Give because you love to give
general.author: ~ as the flower pours forth its perfume. ~ charles haddon spurgeon

general.quote: You cannot love much and give little. How much you love can be measured by how much you give.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: Giving honors the giver.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: People who give are rewarded, not monetarily, but because their involvement represents an expression beyond themselves.
general.author: henry a. rosso

general.quote: Giving should be based on principle, regulated by system, beautified by self
general.author: sacrifice. ~ author unknown

general.quote: To give without any reward, or any notice, has a special quality of its own.
general.author: anne morrow lindbergh

general.quote: If you give what can be taken, you are not really giving. Take what you are given, not what you want to be given. Give what cannot be taken.
general.author: idries shah

general.quote: To have and not to give is often worse than to steal.
general.author: marie von ebner~eschenbach

general.quote: He who gives while he lives, gets to know where it goes.
general.author: percy ross

general.quote: It’s not how much we give but how much love we put into giving.
general.author: mother teresa quotes

general.quote: Give, and it shall be given to you. For whatever measure you deal out to others, it will be dealt to you in return.
general.author: bible

general.quote: If you continually give, you will continually have.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: Give, if it means to suffer; give, if it means to lose; give, in life; give, in death; give forever throughout eternity.
general.author: evangeline cory booth

general.quote: We make a living by what we get. We make a life by what we give.
general.author: winston churchill quotes

general.quote: A person who knows how to laugh at himself will never cease to be amused.
general.author: shirley maclaine

general.quote: People who stop laughing are always the ones who get hurt.
general.author: josh sundquist

general.quote: Then let us laugh. It is the cheapest luxury man enjoys, and, as Charles Lamb says, "is worth a hundred groans in any state of the market."
general.author: william matthews

general.quote: You can’t stay mad at somebody who makes you laugh.
general.author: jay leno

general.quote: They laugh that win!
general.author: william shakespeare

general.quote: Men will let you abuse them if only you will make them laugh.
general.author: henry ward beecher

general.quote: Only in this world do we laugh: in hell, it won’t be possible; and in heaven, it won’t be proper.
general.author: jules renard

general.quote: The most completely wasted of all days is that in which we have not laughed.
general.author: nicolas chamfort

general.quote: To listen to some devout people, one would imagine that God never laughs.
general.author: ghose aurobindo

general.quote: He deserves Paradise who makes his companions laugh.
general.author: the holy koran

general.quote: A laugh costs too much when bought at the expense of virtue.
general.author: quintilian

general.quote: Beware of him who hates the laugh of a child.
general.author: johann kaspar lavater

general.quote: I can usually judge a fellow by what he laughs at.
general.author: wilson mizner

general.quote: You enjoy it more if you can laugh at it.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: He laughs best who laughs last.
general.author: john vanbrugh

general.quote: We sometimes laugh from ear to ear, but it would be impossible for a smile to be wider than the distance between our eyes.
general.author: malcolm de chazal

general.quote: I’ve always thought that a big laugh is a really loud noise from the soul saying, "Ain’t that the truth."
general.author: quincy jones

general.quote: If you lose the power to laugh, you lose the power to think.
general.author: clarence darrow

general.quote: By nothing do men show their character more than by the things they laugh at.
general.author: johann wolfgang von goethe

general.quote: When you laugh, be sure to laugh at what people do and not at what people are.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: Man is the only animal that laughs and weeps; for he is the only animal that is struck with the difference between what things are and what they might have been.
general.author: william hazlitt

general.quote: The best way to make your audience laugh is to start laughing yourself.
general.author: oliver goldsmith

general.quote: A laugh is a smile that bursts.
general.author: mary h. waldrip

general.quote: He who laughs last didn’t get the joke at first.
general.author: evan esar

general.quote: He who laughs best today, will also laugh last.
general.author: friedrich nietzsche

general.quote: Laugh at your friends, and if your friends are sore; So much the better, you may laugh the more.
general.author: alexander pope

general.quote: The man that loves and laughs must sure do well.
general.author: alexander pope

general.quote: When a person can no longer laugh at himself, it is time for others to laugh at him.
general.author: thomas szasz

general.quote: A laughing fool … seems born for nothing but to show his teeth.
general.author: george pope morris

general.quote: No one will be more profoundly sad than he who laughs too much.
general.author: jean paul friedrich richter

general.quote: The flower in the vase smiles, but no longer laughs.
general.author: malcolm de chazal

general.quote: She laughs at everything you say. Why? Because she has fine teeth.
general.author: benjamin franklin

general.quote: His own heart laughed: and that was quite enough for him.
general.author: charles dickens

general.quote: No man heartily hates him at who he can laugh.
general.author: samuel johnson

general.quote: A laugh a day keeps the psychiatrist away.
general.author: evan esar

general.quote: Life without laughing is a dreary blank.
general.author: william makepeace thackeray

general.quote: He is not always at ease who laughs.
general.author: charles de marguetel de saint-denis de saint-evremond

general.quote: Men show their character in nothing more clearly than by what they think laughable.
general.author: johann wolfgang von goethe

general.quote: We must laugh before we are happy, for fear we die before we laugh at all.
general.author: jean de la bruyere

general.quote: A good time to laugh is any time you can.
general.author: linda ellerbee

general.quote: I hasten to laugh at everything for fear of being obliged to weep.
general.author: pierre de beaumarchais

general.quote: The laughers are a majority.
general.author: alexander pope

general.quote: It is a good thing to laugh, at any rate; and if a straw can tickle a man, it is an instrument of happiness.
general.author: john dryden

general.quote: If you don’t learn to laugh at trouble, you won’t have anything to laugh at when you grow old.
general.author: edgar watson howe

general.quote: The earth laughs in flowers.
general.author: ee cummings

general.quote: To laugh is proper to man.
general.author: francois rabelais

general.quote: I love people who make me laugh. I honestly think it’s the thing I like most, to laugh. It cures a multitude of ills. It’s probably the most important thing in a person.
general.author: audrey hepburn

general.quote: We do not stop laughing because we grow old; we grow old because we stop laughing.
general.author: evan esar

general.quote: A laugh is worth a hundred groans in any market.
general.author: charles lamb

general.quote: Laugh and the world laughs with you, weep and you weep alone.
general.author: ella wheeler wilcox

general.quote: I found people looked better when they laughed.
general.author: mort sahl

general.quote: Man, when you lose your laugh you lose your footing.
general.author: ken kesey

general.quote: It’s hard … to hate a man who laughs at himself and the rest of the world.
general.author: jo clayton

general.quote: No one is laughable who laughs at himself.
general.author: marcus annaeus seneca

general.quote: The man who laughs has simply not yet had the terrible news.
general.author: bertolt brecht

general.quote: Always laugh heartily at the jokes your boss tells, it maybe a loyalty test.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: That is the saving grace of humor, if you fail no one is laughing at you.
general.author: a. whitney brown

general.quote: He who laughs … lasts.
general.author: erma bombeck

general.quote: If I am not allowed to laugh in heaven, I don’t want to go there.
general.author: martin luther

general.quote: Men are contented to be laughed at for their wit, but not for their folly.
general.author: jonathan swift

general.quote: The most wasted of all days is that on which one has not laughed.
general.author: sebastien-roch nicolas de chamfort

general.quote: More people laugh at us than with us, however it may appear at the moment.
general.author: giovanni ruffini

general.quote: It is easier to make people cry than to make them laugh.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: Whatever you laugh at in others, laughs at yourself.
general.author: harry emerson fosdick

general.quote: We don’t laugh because we’re happy — we’re happy because we laugh.
general.author: william james

general.quote: The joke loses everything when the joker laughs himself.
general.author: friedrich schiller

general.quote: It is more fitting for a man to laugh at life than to lament over it.
general.author: marcus annaeus seneca

general.quote: You grow up on the day you have your first real laugh at, yourself.
general.author: ethel barrymore

general.quote: Nothing shows a man’s character more than what he laughs at.
general.author: johann wolfgang von goethe

general.quote: He who laughs on Friday will weep on Sunday.
general.author: jean baptiste racine

general.quote: Laugh at yourself first, before anyone else can.
general.author: elsa maxwell

general.quote: There can never be enough said of the virtues, dangers, the power of a shared laugh.
general.author: françoise sagan

general.quote: One loses many laughs by not laughing at oneself.
general.author: sara jeannette duncan

general.quote: A laugh’s the wisest, easiest answer to all that’s queer.
general.author: herman melville

general.quote: The loud laugh that spoke the vacant mind.
general.author: oliver goldsmith

general.quote: A good laugh is sunshine in a house.
general.author: william makepeace thackeray

general.quote: No one is more profoundly sad as one who laughs too much.
general.author: jean paul richter

general.quote: Life is worth living as long as there’s a laugh in it.
general.author: lucy maud montgomery

general.quote: A good laugh makes any interview, or any conversation, so much better.
general.author: barbara walters

general.quote: You can judge a man by what he laughs at.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: A gentleman is often seen, but very seldom heard to laugh.
general.author: philip dormer stanhope

general.quote: If you want to tell people the truth, make them laugh, otherwise they’ll kill you.
general.author: oscar wilde

general.quote: A man isn’t poor if he can still laugh.
general.author: raymond hitchcock

general.quote: Nothing is sillier than a silly laugh.
general.author: caius quintus valerius catullus

general.quote: The laughter of man is more terrible than his tears, and takes more forms — hollow, heartless, mirthless, maniacal.
general.author: james thurber

general.quote: Learn to laugh at your troubles and you’ll never run out of things to laugh at.
general.author: lyn karol

general.quote: If we couldn’t laugh, we would all go insane.
general.author: jimmy buffet

general.quote: No man who has once heartily and wholly laughed can be altogether irreclaimably bad.
general.author: thomas carlyle

general.quote: He is a wise man who always knows what to laugh at, and a bold man that always dare laugh at what is laughable.
general.author: edward parsons day

general.quote: Laughing cheerfulness throws the light of day on all the paths of life.
general.author: jean paul richter

general.quote: Laugh and be fat.
general.author: john taylor

general.quote: Even in despair, man must laugh.
general.author: lin yutang

general.quote: A laugh, to be joyous, must flow from a joyous heart, for without kindness, there can be no true joy.
general.author: thomas carlyle

general.quote: We are rich only through what we give; and poor only through what we refuse and keep.
general.author: anne sophie swetchine

general.quote: Whenever the opportunity comes to give, which is pretty often, we are likely… to think of our poverty instead of our wealth.
general.author: t. t. frankenberg

general.quote: Giving is the secret to living fully while you are still alive.
general.author: douglas m. lawson

general.quote: Some people are at the top of the ladder, some are in the middle, still more are at the bottom, and a whole lot more don’t even know there is a ladder.
general.author: robert h. schuller

general.quote: A poet is a man who puts up a ladder to a star and climbs it while playing a violin.
general.author: edmond de goncourt

general.quote: I’ve never been one to look up the ladder. I’ve always looked down the ladder. As long as there’s one guy down there, I’m fine.
general.author: ron white

general.quote: It is only reason that teaches silence. The heart teaches us to speak.
general.author: jean paul friedrich richter

general.quote: Silence is like nightfall; objects are lost in it insensibly.
general.author: madame anne sophie swetchine

general.quote: The silence depressed me. It wasn’t the silence of silence. It was my own silence.
general.author: sylvia plath

general.quote: As widowers proverbially marry again, so a man with the habit of friendship always finds new friends.
general.author: george santayana

general.quote: I’m only upset that I’m not a widow. [On her ex-husband Tom Arnold]
general.author: roseanne

general.quote: There is no lonelier man in death, except the suicide, than that man who has lived many years with a good wife and then outlived her. If two people love each other there can be no happy end to it.
general.author: ernest hemingway

general.quote: Widow. The word consumes itself.
general.author: sylvia plath

general.quote: It is better to be the widow of a hero than the wife of a coward.
general.author: dolores ibarruri

general.quote: The very least you can do in your life is figure out what you hope for. And the most you can do is live right inside that hope. Not admire it from a distance, but live right in it, under its roof.
general.author: barbara kingsolver

general.quote: Rarely do members of the same family grow up under the same roof.
general.author: richard bach

general.quote: We’ve removed the ceiling above our dreams. There are no more impossible dreams.
general.author: jesse jackson

general.quote: Better an ounce from the ground than a pound from the roof.
general.author: the talmud

general.quote: The sky’s the limit if you have a roof over your head.
general.author: sol hurok

general.quote: Don’t complain about the snow on your neighbor’s roof when your own doorstep is unclean.
general.author: confucius

general.quote: Opportunity dances with those already on the dance floor.
general.author: h. jackson brown, jr.

general.quote: Not houses finely roofed or the stones of walls well builded, nay nor canals and dockyards make the city, but men able to use their opportunity.
general.author: alcaeus

general.quote: Life is like dancing. If we have a big floor, many people will dance. Some will get angry when the rhythm changes. But life is changing all the time.
general.author: don miguel ruiz

general.quote: Wisemen’s minds and hearts live together under the same roof of wisdom.
general.author: munia khan

general.quote: Sometimes you need to sit lonely on the floor in a quiet room in order to hear your own voice and not let it drown in the noise of others.
general.author: charlotte eriksson

general.quote: Enthusiasm is the inspiration of everything great. Without it no man is to be feared, and with it none despised.
general.author: john christian bovee

general.quote: Enthusiasms, like stimulants, are often affected by people with small mental ballast.
general.author: minna antrim

general.quote: Without enthusiasm, the adventurer could never kindle that fire in his followers which is so necessary to consolidate their mutual interests; for no one can heartily deceive numbers who is not first of all deceived himself.
general.author: bishop william warburton

general.quote: Ridicule has even been the most powerful enemy of enthusiasm, and properly the only antagonist that can be opposed to it with success.
general.author: oliver goldsmith

general.quote: Sometimes success is due less to ability than to zeal.
general.author: charles buxton

general.quote: The world belongs to the energetic.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson

general.quote: Enthusiasm moves the world.
general.author: arthur james balfour

general.quote: Enthusiasm goes out.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson

general.quote: The best thing which we derive from history is the enthusiasm that it raises in us.
general.author: johann wolfgang von goethe

general.quote: Nothing is so contagious as enthusiasm; it moves stones, it charms brutes. Enthusiasm is the genius of sincerity, and truth accomplishes no victories without it.
general.author: edward george earle lytton bulwer-lytton

general.quote: Practice being excited.
general.author: bill foster

general.quote: There is a melancholy which accompanies all enthusiasm.
general.author: lord shaftesbury

general.quote: Enthusiasm is the intoxication of earnestness.
general.author: alphonse de lamartine

general.quote: There is eloquence in true enthusiasm.
general.author: edgar allan poe

general.quote: All noble enthusiasms pass through a feverish stage, and grow wiser and more serene.
general.author: william ellery channing

general.quote: Enthusiasm is the fever of reason.
general.author: victor hugo

general.quote: Great eagerness in the pursuit of wealth, pleasure, or honor, cannot exist without sin.
general.author: desiderius erasmus

general.quote: If you have the will to win, you have achieved half your success; if you don’t, you have achieved half your failure.
general.author: david ambrose

general.quote: To waken interest and kindle enthusiasm is the sure way to teach easily and successfully.
general.author: tryon edwards

general.quote: Enthusiasm is nothing more or less than faith in action.
general.author: henry chester

general.quote: Enthusiasm is the height of man; it is the passing from the human to the divine.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson

general.quote: The only thing that keeps a man going is energy. And what is energy but liking life?
general.author: louis auchincloss

general.quote: I prefer the errors of enthusiasm to the indifference of wisdom.
general.author: anatole france

general.quote: Without enthusiasm, virtue functions not at all, and vice only poorly.
general.author: mignon mclaughlin

general.quote: I rate enthusiasm even above professional skill.
general.author: edward appleton

general.quote: Religion is among the most powerful causes of enthusiasm.
general.author: edmund burke

general.quote: One man has enthusiasm for 30 minutes, another for 30 days, but it is the man who has it for 30 years who makes a success of his life.
general.author: edward b. butler

general.quote: You will do foolish things, but do them with enthusiasm.
general.author: sidonie gabrielle colette

general.quote: We act as though comfort and luxury were the chief requirements of life, when all that we need to make us really happy is something to be enthusiastic about.
general.author: charles kingsley

general.quote: People who never get carried away should be.
general.author: malcolm s. forbes

general.quote: Flaming enthusiasm, backed up by horse sense and persistence, is the quality that most frequently makes for success.
general.author: dale carnegie

general.quote: Enthusiasm begets enthusiasm.
general.author: henry wadsworth longfellow

general.quote: You can’t sweep other people off their feet, if you can’t be swept off your own.
general.author: clarence day

general.quote: Vigor is contagious; and whatever makes us either think or feel strongly adds to our power and enlarges our field of action.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson

general.quote: Enthusiasm is the greatest asset in the world. It beats money, power and influence.
general.author: henry chester

general.quote: That youthful fervor, which is sometimes called enthusiasm, but which is a heat of imagination subsequently discovered to be inconsistent with the experience of actual life.
general.author: benjamin disraeli

general.quote: Every production of genius must be the production of enthusiasm.
general.author: benjamin disraeli

general.quote: No wild enthusiast could rest, till half the world like him was possessed.
general.author: william cowper

general.quote: The most enthusiastic man in a cause is rarely chosen as a leader.
general.author: sir arthur helps

general.quote: Every great and commanding movement in the annals of the world is due to the triumph of enthusiasm. Nothing great was ever achieved without it.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson

general.quote: The real secret to success is enthusiasm.
general.author: walter chrysler

general.quote: You can do anything if you have enthusiasm… Enthusiasm is at the bottom of all progress. With it, there is accomplishment. Without it, there are only alibis.
general.author: henry ford

general.quote: Enthusiasts soon understand each other.
general.author: washington irving

general.quote: Enthusiasm releases the drive to carry you over obstacles and adds significance to all you do.
general.author: norman vincent peale

general.quote: Enthusiasm is the breath of genius.
general.author: benjamin disraeli

general.quote: Nothing great was ever achieved without enthusiasm.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson

general.quote: The difference between one man and another is not mere ability… it is energy.
general.author: thomas arnold

general.quote: Enthusiasm is the leaping lightning, not to be measured by the horse-power of the understanding.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson

general.quote: In things pertaining to enthusiasm no man is sane who does not know how to be insane on proper occasions.
general.author: henry ward beecher

general.quote: Enthusiasm is the genius of sincerity; and truth accomplishes no victories without it.
general.author: edward g. bulwer-lytton

general.quote: Enthusiasm for one’s goal to lessens the disagreeableness of working toward it.
general.author: thomas eakins

general.quote: Enthusiasm imparts itself magnetically and fuses all into one happy and harmonious unity of feeling and sentiment.
general.author: amos bronson alcott

general.quote: A man can succeed at almost anything for which he has unlimited enthusiasm.
general.author: charles m. schwab

general.quote: The same reason makes a man a religious enthusiast that makes a man an enthusiast in any other way, an uncomfortable mind in an uncomfortable body.
general.author: william hazlitt

general.quote: My enthusiasms… constitute my reserves, my unexploited resources, perhaps my future.
general.author: e.m. cioran

general.quote: Great dejection often follows great enthusiasm.
general.author: joseph roux

general.quote: Act enthusiastic and you will be enthusiastic.
general.author: dale carnegie

general.quote: What we love, we shall grow to resemble.
general.author: bernard of clairvaux

general.quote: Success produces success, just as money produces money.
general.author: sebastien-roch nicolas de chamfort

general.quote: There is not a more melancholy object than a man who has his head turned with religious enthusiasm.
general.author: joseph addison

general.quote: If you can give your son only one gift, let it be enthusiasm.
general.author: bruce barton

general.quote: If you want to be enthusiastic, act enthusiastic.
general.author: dale carnegie

general.quote: Fires can’t be made with dead embers, nor can enthusiasm be stirred by spiritless men. Enthusiasm in our daily work lightens effort and turns even labor into pleasant tasks.
general.author: james baldwin

general.quote: Be not afraid of enthusiasm; you need it; you can do nothing effectually without it.
general.author: francois pierre g. guizot

general.quote: Charisma is the transference of enthusiasm.
general.author: ralph archbold

general.quote: Enthusiasm gives life to what is invisible; and interest to what has no immediate action on our comfort in this world.
general.author: madame de stael

general.quote: The prudent person may direct a state, but it is the enthusiast who regenerates or ruins it.
general.author: edward g. bulwer-lytton

general.quote: Enthusiasm for a cause sometimes warps judgment.
general.author: william howard taft

general.quote: Enthusiasm is that temper of the mind in which the imagination has got the better of the judgment.
general.author: bishop william warburton

general.quote: Not by wrath does one kill, but by laughter.
general.author: friedrich nietzsche

general.quote: Nothing can confound a wise man more than laughter from a dunce.
general.author: lord byron

general.quote: Present mirth hath present laughter. What’s to come is still unsure.
general.author: william shakespeare

general.quote: Laughter is the sun that drives winter from the human face.
general.author: victor hugo

general.quote: A gentleman is often seen, but very seldom heard to laugh.
general.author: philip dormer stanhope

general.quote: When you laugh, be sure to laugh at what people do and not at what people are.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: Laughter can be more satisfying than honor; more precious than money; more heart-cleansing than prayer.
general.author: harriet rochlin

general.quote: Laughter in the face of danger is a mark of courage.
general.author: jennifer lee carrell

general.quote: The malicious sneer is improperly called laughter.
general.author: oliver goldsmith

general.quote: Laughter and tears are both responses to frustration and exhaustion…. I myself prefer to laugh, since there is less cleaning do to do afterward.
general.author: kurt vonnegut

general.quote: Remember, men need laughter sometimes more than food.
general.author: anna fellows johnston

general.quote: Laughter is day, and sobriety is night; a smile is the twilight that hovers gently between both, more bewitching than either.
general.author: henry ward beecher

general.quote: There comes a time when suddenly you realize that laughter is something you remember and that you were the one laughing.
general.author: marlene dietrich

general.quote: You can turn painful situations around through laughter. If you can find humor in anything, even poverty, you can survive it.
general.author: bill cosby

general.quote: Laughter kills fear, and without fear there can be no faith. For without fear of the devil there is no need for God.
general.author: sean connery

general.quote: Seven days without laughter makes one weak.
general.author: mort walker

general.quote: Man is the only creature endowed with the power of laughter; is he not also the only one that deserves to be laughed at?
general.author: fulke greville

general.quote: Laughter is a great soul cleanser.
general.author: virginia sale

general.quote: Uncontrollable laughter arose among the blessed gods.
general.author: homer

general.quote: And unextinguish’d laughter shakes the skies.
general.author: homer

general.quote: Laughter is the only tranquilizer with no side effects.
general.author: graffiti

general.quote: Laughter rises out of tragedy when you need it the most, and rewards you for your courage.
general.author: erma bombeck

general.quote: The only medicine that needs no prescription, has no unpleasant taste, and costs no money is laughter.
general.author: evan esar

general.quote: Carry laughter with you wherever you go.
general.author: hugh sidey

general.quote: That laughter costs too much which is purchased by the sacrifice of decency.
general.author: john quinton

general.quote: Loud laughter is the mirth of the mob, who are only pleased with silly things; for true wit or good sense never excited a laugh since the creation of the world.
general.author: philip dormer stanhope,

general.quote: Laughter is a sunbeam of the soul.
general.author: thomas mann

general.quote: Let there be more joy and laughter in your living.
general.author: eileen caddy

general.quote: Laughter is the language of the soul.
general.author: pablo neruda

general.quote: A day without laughter is a day wasted.
general.author: charlie chaplin

general.quote: Laughter is the best way to make somebody’s heart beat.
general.author: robert holden

general.quote: Hearty laughter is a good way to jog internally without having to go outdoors.
general.author: norman cousins

general.quote: Laughter is, after speech, the chief thing that holds society together.
general.author: max eastman

general.quote: It is bad to suppress laughter. It goes back down to your hips.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: You can’t deny laughter; when it comes, it plops down in your favorite chair and stays as long as it wants.
general.author: stephen king

general.quote: Nobody ever died of laughter.
general.author: max beerbohm

general.quote: Laughter is a tranquilizer with no side effects.
general.author: arnold glasow

general.quote: The sense of humor has other things to do than to make itself conspicuous in the act of laughter.
general.author: alice meynell

general.quote: Better the last smile than the first laughter.
general.author: john ray

general.quote: He who always prefaces his tale with laughter, is poised between impertinence and folly.
general.author: johann kaspar lavater

general.quote: Remember laughter. You’ll need it even in the blessed isles of Ever After.
general.author: james thurber

general.quote: Laughter is poison to fear.
general.author: george r. r. martin

general.quote: Morally considered, laughter is next to the Ten Commandments.
general.author: henry wheeler shaw

general.quote: Laughter is higher than all pain.
general.author: elbert hubbard

general.quote: Laughter is the brush that sweeps away the cobwebs of the heart.
general.author: mort walker

general.quote: The sound of laughter is like the vaulted dome of a temple of happiness.
general.author: milan kundera

general.quote: Against the assault of laughter nothing can stand.
general.author: mark twain

general.quote: Laughter is the greatest weapon we have and we, as humans, use it the least.
general.author: mark twain

general.quote: The human race has but one really affective weapon, and that is laughter.
general.author: mark twain

general.quote: Laughter is by definition healthy.
general.author: doris lessing

general.quote: The laughter of man is more terrible than his tears, and takes more forms — hollow, heartless, mirthless, maniacal.
general.author: james thurber

general.quote: Laughter is the shortest distance between two people.
general.author: victor borge

general.quote: The only honest art form is laughter.
general.author: lenny bruce

general.quote: The salvation of the world depends on the men whose laughter destroys the fool instead of encouraging him.
general.author: george bernard shaw

general.quote: Laughter is a highly addictive positive contagion: if somebody starts, it’s very difficult to stop.
general.author: robert holden

general.quote: Frequent and loud laughter is the characteristic of folly and ill manners.
general.author: philip dormer stanhope chesterfield

general.quote: Shared laughter is erotic too.
general.author: marge piercy

general.quote: Laughter gives us distance. It allows us to step back from an event, deal with it and then move on.
general.author: bob newhart

general.quote: I think that wherever your journey takes you, there are new gods waiting there, with divine patience — and laughter.
general.author: susan m. watkins

general.quote: Take bread away from me, if you wish, take air away, but do not take from me your laughter.
general.author: pablo neruda

general.quote: Laughter is an instant vacation.
general.author: milton berle

general.quote: Laughter is inner jogging.
general.author: norman cousins

general.quote: Whoever undertakes to set himself up as judge in the field of truth and knowledge is shipwrecked by the laughter of the Gods.
general.author: albert einstein

general.quote: One should take good care not to grow too wise for so great a pleasure of life as laughter.
general.author: joseph addison

general.quote: Nothing is more silly than silly laughter.
general.author: catullus

general.quote: The laughter of man is the contentment of God.
general.author: john weiss

general.quote: Laughter does not seem to be a sin, but it leads to sin.
general.author: st. john chrysostom

general.quote: Laughter is not at all a bad beginning for a friendship, and it is by far the best ending for one.
general.author: oscar wilde

general.quote: The laughter of girls is, and ever was, among the delightful sounds of earth.
general.author: thomas de quincey

general.quote: There is little success where there is little laughter.
general.author: andrew carnegie

general.quote: People who laugh actually live longer than those who don’t laugh. Few persons realize that health actually varies according to the amount of laughter.
general.author: dr. james walsh

general.quote: Laughter is taken as a sign of strength, freedom, health, beauty, youth, and happiness.
general.author: martin grotjabn

general.quote: Laughter is a powerful way to tap positive emotions.
general.author: norman cousins

general.quote: Laughter … the hilarious declaration made by man that life is worth living.
general.author: sean o’casey

general.quote: Laughter is America’s most important export.
general.author: walt disney

general.quote: Laughter is the tonic, the relief, the surcease for pain.
general.author: charlie chaplin

general.quote: It is a fair, even-handed, noble adjustment of things, that while there is infection in disease and sorrow, there is nothing in the world so irresistibly contagious as laughter and good humour.
general.author: charles dickens

general.quote: With mirth and laughter let old wrinkles come.
general.author: william shakespeare

general.quote: Laughter was the most terrible weapon: you can kill anything with laughter.
general.author: yevgeny zamyatin

general.quote: There is nothing [that] disarms us like laughter.
general.author: henri bergson

general.quote: If we may believe our logicians, man is distinguished from all other creatures by the faculty of laughter.
general.author: joseph addison

general.quote: The power of man has grown in every sphere, except over himself.
general.author: winston churchill quotes

general.quote: What is good? All that heightens the feeling of power, the will to power, power itself in man.
general.author: friedrich nietzsche

general.quote: Make the best use of what is in your power, and take the rest as it happens.
general.author: epictetus

general.quote: Their insatiable lust for power is only equaled by their incurable impotence in exercising it.
general.author: winston churchill

general.quote: Longer in your power – he’s free again.
general.author: aleksander solzhenitsyn

general.quote: Only through destroying myself can I discover the greater power of my spirit.
general.author: chuck palahniuk

general.quote: The only way to predict the future is to have power to shape the future.
general.author: eric hoffer

general.quote: Power does not corrupt men; fools, however, if they get into a position of power, corrupt power.
general.author: george bernard shaw quotes

general.quote: Power is my mistress. I have worked too hard at her conquest to allow anyone to take her away from me.
general.author: napoleon bonaparte quotes

general.quote: The steps of power are often steps on sand.
general.author: edward counsel

general.quote: All I want is a warm bed and a kind word and unlimited power.
general.author: ashleigh brilliant

general.quote: There is no knowledge that is not power.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson

general.quote: Power is when you have every justification to kill someone, and then you don’t.
general.author: oskar shindler

general.quote: Power is not only what you have but what the enemy thinks you have.
general.author: saul alinsky

general.quote: I am not interested in power for power’s sake, but I’m interested in power that is moral, that is right and that is good.
general.author: martin luther king, jr.

general.quote: Each one of us has the power to make others feel better or worse. Making others feel better is much more fun than making others feel worse. Making others feel better generally makes us feel better.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: He, who is devoid of the power to forgive, is devoid of the power to love.
general.author: martin luther king, jr.

general.quote: The most common way people give up their power is by thinking they don’t have any.
general.author: alice walker

general.quote: Power is not alluring to pure minds.
general.author: thomas jefferson quotes

general.quote: Nearly all men can stand adversity, but if you want to test a man’s character, give him power.
general.author: abraham lincoln quotes

general.quote: Knowledge is power.
general.author: francis bacon

general.quote: The secret of power is the knowledge that others are more cowardly than you are.
general.author: ludwig borne

general.quote: The power of a thing or an act is in the meaning and the understanding.
general.author: nicholas black elk

general.quote: When the power of love overcomes the love of power, the world will know peace.
general.author: jimi hendrix

general.quote: We have the power to make this the best generation of mankind in the history of the world – or to make it the last.
general.author: john fitzgerald kennedy

general.quote: Anyone can become angry – that is easy, but to be angry with the right person at the right time, and for the right purpose and in the right way – that is not within everyone’s power and that is not easy.
general.author: aristotle quotes

general.quote: Never forget the three powerful resources you always have available to you: love, prayer, and forgiveness.
general.author: h. jackson brown, jr.

general.quote: If you realized how powerful your thoughts are, you would never think a negative thought.
general.author: peace pilgrim

general.quote: I hope our wisdom will grow with our power, and teach us that the less we use our power the greater it will be.
general.author: thomas jefferson

general.quote: Too often we underestimate the power of a touch, a smile, a kind word, a listening ear, an honest compliment, or the smallest act of caring, all of which have the potential to turn a life around.
general.author: leo f. buscaglia

general.quote: Between stimulus and response is our greatest power – the freedom to choose.
general.author: stephen r. covey

general.quote: He who controls others may be powerful, but he who has mastered himself is mightier still.
general.author: lao tzu

general.quote: The greater the power, the more dangerous the abuse.
general.author: edmund burke

general.quote: The attempt to combine wisdom and power has only rarely been successful and then only for a short while.
general.author: albert einstein

general.quote: Power gradually extirpates for the mind every humane and gentle virtue.
general.author: edmund burke

general.quote: In order to obtain and hold power, a man must love it.
general.author: leo tolstoy

general.quote: But the relationship of morality and power is a very subtle one. Because ultimately power without morality is no longer power.
general.author: james baldwin

general.quote: Justice and power must be brought together, so that whatever is just may be powerful, and whatever is powerful may be just.
general.author: blaise pascal

general.quote: Power over a man’s subsistence amounts to power over his will.
general.author: alexander hamilton

general.quote: You shall have joy, or you shall have power, said God; you shall not have both.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson

general.quote: But to die of laughter–this, too, seems to me a great euthanasia.
general.author: max beerbohm

general.quote: Perhaps I know best why it is man alone who laughs; he alone suffers so deeply that he had to invent laughter.
general.author: friedrich nietzsche

general.quote: Laughter is the most healthful exertion.
general.author: christoph wilhelm hufeland

general.quote: Success consists of going from failure to failure without loss of enthusiasm.
general.author: winston churchill

general.quote: None are so old as those who have outlived enthusiasm.
general.author: henry david thoreau

general.quote: If you can give your son or daughter only one gift, let it be enthusiasm.
general.author: bruce barton

general.quote: The time to repair the roof is when the sun is shining.
general.author: john f. kennedy

general.quote: You can have money piled to the ceiling but the size of your funeral is still going to depend on the weather.
general.author: chuck tanner

general.quote: Aim for the sky and you’ll reach the ceiling. Aim for the ceiling and you’ll stay on the floor.
general.author: bill shankly

general.quote: You’re not drunk if you can lie on the floor without holding on.
general.author: dean martin

general.quote: When you dance, your purpose is not to get to a certain place on the floor. It’s to enjoy each step along the way.
general.author: wayne dyer

general.quote: Hell isn’t merely paved with good intentions, it is walled and roofed with them.
general.author: aldous huxley

general.quote: The purpose of life is not to be happy–but to matter.
general.author: leo rosten

general.quote: Having purpose and vision during retirement is one of the most important determinants of mental, social, spiritual, and physical well-being in later life.
general.author: harold g. koenig

general.quote: I would rather work with five people who really believe in what they are doing rather than five hundred who can’t see the point.
general.author: patrick dixon

general.quote: What we must try to be, of course, is ourselves and wholeheartedly. We must find out what we really are and what we really want.
general.author: nelson boswell

general.quote: Give a man health and a course to steer; and he’ll never stop to trouble about whether he’s happy or not.
general.author: george bernard shaw

general.quote: The purpose of life is a life of purpose.
general.author: robert byrne

general.quote: I just wake up and say, "You’re a bum, go do something worthwhile today."
general.author: garth brooks

general.quote: Purpose is what gives life a meaning.
general.author: charles henry parkhurst

general.quote: If you don’t stand up for something, you may fall for anything.
general.author: les brown

general.quote: I don’t think life is absurd. I think we are all here for a huge purpose. I think we shrink from the immensity of the purpose we are here for.
general.author: norman mailer

general.quote: You have to know what is right for you and go after it regardless of what others say.
general.author: les brown

general.quote: What allows us, as human beings, to psychologically survive life on earth, with all of its pain, drama, and challenges, is a sense of purpose and meaning.
general.author: barbara de angelis

general.quote: Nothing contributes so much to tranquillize the mind as a steady purpose— a point on which the soul may fix its intellectual eye.
general.author: mary shelley

general.quote: Purpose… is held to be most closely connected with virtue, and to be a better token of our character than are even our acts.
general.author: aristotle

general.quote: He too serves a certain purpose who only stands and cheers.
general.author: henry brooks adams

general.quote: Purpose is a desire for something in our own power, coupled with an investigation into its means.
general.author: aristotle

general.quote: Nothing is more creative … nor destructive … than a brilliant mind with a purpose.
general.author: dan brown

general.quote: Your work is to discover your work and then with all your heart to give yourself to it.
general.author: buddha

general.quote: The only true happiness comes from squandering ourselves for a purpose.
general.author: john mason brown

general.quote: It may be that there was no reason or purpose, for mankind must always be finding reasons where there are none, and comfort in a purpose that hardly exists.
general.author: jeanette winterson

general.quote: The purpose firm is equal to the deed.
general.author: edward young

general.quote: It’s only … when we’re stripped of purpose that we know who we are.
general.author: samuel r. delany

general.quote: Great minds have purposes, others have wishes.
general.author: washington irving

general.quote: Above all be of single aim; have a legitimate and useful purpose, and devote yourself unreservedly to it.
general.author: james allen

general.quote: Childhood may do without a grand purpose, but manhood cannot.
general.author: josiah gilbert holland

general.quote: No one rises so high as he who knows not whither he is going.
general.author: oliver cromwell

general.quote: Purpose directs energy, and purpose makes energy.
general.author: charles henry parkhurst

general.quote: Men, like nails, lose their usefulness when they lose direction and begin to bend.
general.author: walter savage landor

general.quote: To have no set purpose in one’s life is the harlotry of the will.
general.author: stephen mackenna

general.quote: When through one man a little more love and goodness, a little more light and truth comes into the world, then that man’s life has had meaning.
general.author: alfred delp

general.quote: There may be ways in which we can work for change. We don’t have to do dramatic things or devote our entire lives to it. We can lead normal lives but at the same time try hard not to be bystanders.
general.author: helen bamber

general.quote: The man without a purpose is like a ship without a rudder — waif, a nothing, a no man. Have a purpose in life, and, having it, throw such strength of mind and muscle into your work as God has given you.
general.author: thomas carlyle

general.quote: Purpose has no place in biology, but history has no meaning without it.
general.author: george kubler

general.quote: What men want is not talent, it is purpose; in other words, not the power to achieve but the will to labour.
general.author: edward bulwer-lytton

general.quote: He who has a why to live for can bear almost any how.
general.author: friedrich nietzsche

general.quote: Now I shall be of some use in the world, as every one ought to be; it is the only way to be happy.
general.author: hans christian andersen

general.quote: A useless life is an early death.
general.author: johann wolfgang von goethe

general.quote: Until thought is linked with purpose there is no intelligent accomplishment.
general.author: james allen

general.quote: If a man knows not to which port he sails, no wind is favorable.
general.author: seneca

general.quote: Some people give time, some money, some their skills and connections, some literally give their life’s blood … but everyone has something to give.
general.author: barbara bush

general.quote: Does not the latent feeling that much of their striving is to no purpose tend to infuse large quantities of sham into men’s work?
general.author: william allingham

general.quote: Each of our acts makes a statement as to our purpose.
general.author: leo buscaglia

general.quote: God created man on purpose, and for a purpose.
general.author: zig ziglar

general.quote: If we crave some cosmic purpose, then let us find ourselves a worthy goal.
general.author: carl sagan

general.quote: What am I living for and what am I dying for are the same question.
general.author: margaret atwood

general.quote: Only the consciousness of a purpose that is mightier than any man and worthy of all men can fortify and inspirit and compose the souls of men.
general.author: walter lippmann

general.quote: An "unemployed" existence is a worse negation of life than death itself.
general.author: josé ortega y gasset

general.quote: Life, to be worthy of a rational being, must be always in progression; we must always purpose to do more or better than in time past.
general.author: samuel johnson

general.quote: We should all be obliged to appear before a board every five years, and justify our existence… on pain of liquidation.
general.author: george bernard shaw

general.quote: Never be afraid to treat the path alone. Know which is your path and follow it wherever it may lead you; do not feel you have to follow in someone else’s footsteps.
general.author: gita bellin

general.quote: To have a grievance is to have a purpose in life.
general.author: alan coren

general.quote: The man who is happy is fulfilling the purpose of existence.
general.author: fyodor dostoyevsky

general.quote: Ah, only he who knows where he sails, knows what wind is good, and a fair wind for him.
general.author: friedrich nietzsche

general.quote: All persons are puzzles until at last we find in some word or act the key to the man, to the woman; straightway all their past words and actions lie in light before us.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson

general.quote: Irrigators guide water; arrow-makers straighten arrows; carpenters bend wood; wise people shape themselves.
general.author: buddha

general.quote: When you walk in purpose, you collide with destiny.
general.author: ralph buchanan

general.quote: The purpose of man is in action not thought.
general.author: thomas carlyle

general.quote: The purposes of the Almighty are perfect, and must prevail, though we erring mortals may fail to accurately perceive them in advance.
general.author: abraham lincoln

general.quote: From the first, I made my learning, what little it was, useful every way I could.
general.author: mary mcleod bethune

general.quote: There’s heaven above, and night by night / I look right through its gorgeous roof.
general.author: robert browning

general.quote: If your thoughts are as tall as the height of your ceiling, you can’t fly above your room.
general.author: israelmore ayivor

general.quote: Don’t compare the size of your roof with the size of the sky.
general.author: amit kalantri

general.quote: Where can a person be better than in the bosom of their family.
general.author: marmontel gretry

general.quote: In that family where the husband is pleased with his wife, and the wife with her husband, happiness will assuredly be lasting.
general.author: brahma

general.quote: A happy family is but an earlier heaven.
general.author: sir john bowring

general.quote: Christmas is a holiday that we celebrate not as individuals nor as a nation, but as a human family.
general.author: ronald reagan quotes

general.quote: In intimate family life, there comes a moment when children, willingly or no, become the judges of their parents.
general.author: honore de balzac

general.quote: Rejoice with your family in the beautiful land of life!
general.author: albert einstein quotes

general.quote: Family: Life’s greatest blessing, family is what grounds you.
general.author: angelina jolie

general.quote: The strength of a family, like the strength of an army, is in its loyalty to each other.
general.author: mario puzo

general.quote: The family is the first essential cell of human society.
general.author: pope john xxiii

general.quote: Other things may change us, but we start and end with the family.
general.author: anthony brandt

general.quote: The family is both the fundamental unit of society as well as the root of culture. It … is a perpetual source of encouragement, advocacy, assurance, and emotional refueling that empowers a child to venture with confidence into the greater world and to become all that he can be.
general.author: marianne e. neifert

general.quote: Perhaps the greatest social service that can be rendered by anybody to the country and to mankind is to bring up a family.
general.author: george bernard shaw

general.quote: All men are children, and of one family. The same tale sends them all to bed, and wakes them in the morning.
general.author: henry david thoreau

general.quote: At the end of the day, a loving family should find everything forgivable.
general.author: mark v. olsen and will sheffer

general.quote: A family is a place where minds come in contact with one another.
general.author: buddha

general.quote: Call it a clan, call it a network, call it a tribe, call it a family. Whatever you call it, whoever you are, you need one.
general.author: jane howard

general.quote: To us, family means putting your arms around each other and being there.
general.author: barbara bush

general.quote: The only rock I know that stays steady, the only institution I know that works, is the family.
general.author: lee iacocca

general.quote: You leave home to seek your fortune and, when you get it, you go home and share it with your family.
general.author: anita baker

general.quote: The bond that links your true family is not one of blood, but of respect and joy in each other’s life. Rarely do members of one family grow up under the same roof.
general.author: richard bach

general.quote: To maintain a joyful family requires much from both the parents and the children. Each member of the family has to become, in a special way, the servant of the others.
general.author: pope john paul ii

general.quote: The family is a haven in a heartless world.
general.author: christopher lasch

general.quote: My family begins with me, your family ends with you.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: The trouble with the family is that children grow out of childhood, but parents never grow out of parenthood.
general.author: evan esar

general.quote: The family is the natural and fundamental group unit of society and is entitled to protection by society and the State.
general.author: eleanor roosevelt quotes

general.quote: Every family should have a plan for work that touches the life of each family member so that this eternal principle will be ingrained in their lives.
general.author: m. russell ballard

general.quote: No matter what you’ve done for yourself or for humanity, if you can’t look back on having given love and attention to your own family, what have you really accomplished?
general.author: lee iacocca

general.quote: A family can develop only with a loving woman as its center.
general.author: karl wilhelm friedrich

general.quote: The family is the nucleus of civilization.
general.author: william j. durant

general.quote: Friends are the family we choose for ourselves.
general.author: edna buchanan

general.quote: Nothing purchased can come close to the renewed sense of gratitude for having family and friends.
general.author: courtland milloy

general.quote: I would like to be remembered as a man who had a wonderful time living life, a man who had good friends, fine family – and I don’t think I could ask for anything more than that, actually.
general.author: frank sinatra

general.quote: To put the world in order, we must first put the nation in order; to put the nation in order, we must put the family in order; to put the family in order, we must cultivate our personal life; and to cultivate our personal life, we must first set our hearts right.
general.author: confucius quotes

general.quote: God created the family to provide the maximum love and support and morality and example that one can imagine.
general.author: jerry falwell

general.quote: If we abandon marriage, we abandon the family.
general.author: michael enzi

general.quote: I believe the world is one big family, and we need to help each other.
general.author: jet li

general.quote: Having a place to go — is a home. Having someone to love — is a family. Having both — is a blessing.
general.author: donna hedges

general.quote: The happiest moments of my life have been the few which I have passed at home in the bosom of my family.
general.author: thomas jefferson quotes

general.quote: The whole world is one family.
general.author: sun yat-sen

general.quote: The family is the most basic unit of government. As the first community to which a person is attached and the first authority under which a person learns to live, the family establishes society’s most basic values.
general.author: charles caleb colton

general.quote: Cherish your human connections: your relationships with friends and family.
general.author: barbara bush quotes

general.quote: The ultimate economic and spiritual unit of any civilization is still the family.
general.author: clare boothe luce

general.quote: I would rather start a family than finish one.
general.author: don marquis

general.quote: The family is the school of duties… founded on love.
general.author: felix adler

general.quote: I don’t care how poor a man is; if he has family, he’s rich.
general.author: dan wilcox and thad mumford

general.quote: My family really does come first. It always did and always will.
general.author: meryl streep

general.quote: The family is the test of freedom; because the family is the only thing that the free man makes for himself and by himself.
general.author: gilbert k. chesterton

general.quote: A family needs to work as a team, supporting each other’s individual aims and aspirations.
general.author: buzz aldrin

general.quote: Family means putting your arms around each other and being there.
general.author: barbara bush

general.quote: Love makes a family.
general.author: florence nightingale

general.quote: The presidency is temporary but the family is permanent.
general.author: yvonne de gaulle

general.quote: The family unit plays a critical role in our society and in the training of the generation to come.
general.author: sandra day o’connor

general.quote: He that raises a large family does, indeed, while he lives to observe them, stand a broader mark for sorrow; but then he stands a broader mark for pleasure too.
general.author: benjamin franklin quotes

general.quote: A woman can take care of the family. It takes a man to provide structure. To provide stability. Not that a woman can’t provide stability, I’m not saying that… It does take a father, though.
general.author: tom delay

general.quote: Family is the most important thing in the world.
general.author: princess diana quotes

general.quote: Family is not an important thing, it’s everything.
general.author: michael j. fox

general.quote: If you don’t believe in ghosts, you’ve never been to a family reunion.
general.author: ashleigh brilliant

general.quote: Marriage is to family what legs are to a table.
general.author: betty jane wylie

general.quote: Where there is lasting love, there is a family.
general.author: shere hite

general.quote: Children keep a family together, especially when one can’t get a babysitter.
general.author: frederick shepperd

general.quote: Family life is too intimate to be preserved by the spirit of justice. It can be sustained by a spirit of love which goes beyond justice.
general.author: reinhold niebuhr

general.quote: You don’t choose your family. They are God’s gift to you, as you are to them.
general.author: desmond tutu

general.quote: Rarely do members of the same family grow up under the same roof.
general.author: richard bach

general.quote: Learn to enjoy every minute of your life. Be happy now. Don’t wait for something outside of yourself to make you happy in the future. Think how really precious is the time you have to spend, whether it’s at work or with your family. Every minute should be enjoyed and savored.
general.author: earl nightingale

general.quote: A man cannot leave a better legacy to the world than a well-educated family.
general.author: thomas scott

general.quote: My family is my strength and my weakness.
general.author: aishwarya rai

general.quote: The angel of the Family is Woman. Mother, wife, or sister .
general.author: giuseppe mazzini

general.quote: In our family, as far as we are concerned, we were born and what happened before that is myth.
general.author: v. s. pritchett

general.quote: Family is just accident…. They don’t mean to get on your nerves. They don’t even mean to be your family, they just are.
general.author: marsha norman

general.quote: Disorder in the society is the result of disorder in the family.
general.author: elizabeth ann seton

general.quote: The family is the association established by nature for the supply of man’s everyday wants.
general.author: aristotle quotes

general.quote: [T]here is wisdom in every man, in every father, in your father. And that’s true whether you love him or despise him.
general.author: joe kita

general.quote: You don’t have to deserve your mother’s love. You have to deserve your father’s.
general.author: robert lee frost

general.quote: We think our fathers fools, so wise we grow. Our wiser sons, no doubt will think us so.
general.author: alexander pope

general.quote: By the time a man realizes that maybe his father was right, he usually has a son who thinks he’s wrong.
general.author: charles wadworth

general.quote: Fathers represent another way of looking at life — the possibility of an alternative dialogue.
general.author: louise j. kaplan

general.quote: To a father growing old nothing is dearer than a daughter.
general.author: euripides

general.quote: My dear father! When I remember him, it is always with his arms open wide to love and comfort me.
general.author: isobel field

general.quote: My heart is happy, my mind is free. I had a father who talked with me.
general.author: hilde bigelow

general.quote: The worst misfortune that can happen to an ordinary man is to have an extraordinary father.
general.author: austin o’malley

general.quote: As fathers commonly go, it is seldom a misfortune to be fatherless; and considering the general run of sons, as seldom a misfortune to be childless.
general.author: philip dormer stanhope chesterfield

general.quote: He who is taught to live upon little owes more to his father’s wisdom than he who has a great deal left him does to his father’s care.
general.author: william penn

general.quote: The words that a father speaks to his children in the privacy of home are not heard by the world, but, as in whispering-galleries, they are clearly heard at the end and by posterity.
general.author: jean paul richter

general.quote: An angry father is most cruel toward himself.
general.author: publilius syrus

general.quote: Sons have always a rebellious wish to be disillusioned by that which charmed their fathers.
general.author: aldous huxley

general.quote: If the relationship of father to son could really be reduced to biology, the whole earth would blaze with the glory of fathers and sons.
general.author: james baldwin

general.quote: How pleasant it is for a father to sit at his child’s board. It is like an aged man reclining under the shadow of an oak which he has planted.
general.author: voltaire

general.quote: The greatest gift I ever had came from God; I call him Dad!
general.author: unknown

general.quote: It is a wise father that knows his own child.
general.author: william shakespeare

general.quote: Father! — to God himself we cannot give a holier name.
general.author: william wordsworth

general.quote: I believe that what we become depends on what our fathers teach us at odd moments, when they aren’t trying to teach us. We are formed by little scraps of wisdom.
general.author: umberto eco

general.quote: Love and fear. Everything the father of a family says must inspire one or the other.
general.author: joseph joubert

general.quote: To be a successful father... there’s one absolute rule: when you have a kid, don’t look at it for the first two years.
general.author: ernest hemingway quotes

general.quote: Even in the best father-son relationships, there’s an uncomfortable familiarity that inhibits us from talking like friends.
general.author: joe kita

general.quote: Fathers do not exasperate your children; instead, bring them up in the training and instruction of the Lord.
general.author: bible

general.quote: My father must have had some elementary education for he could read and write and keep accounts inaccurately.
general.author: george bernard shaw quotes

general.quote: The father who does not teach his son his duties is equally guilty with the son who neglects them.
general.author: confucius quotes

general.quote: One father is more than a hundred schoolmasters.
general.author: george herbert

general.quote: It doesn’t matter who my father was; it matters who I remember he was.
general.author: anne sexton

general.quote: Dad taught me everything I know. Unfortunately, he didn’t teach me everything he knows.
general.author: al unser

general.quote: Why are men reluctant to become fathers? They aren’t through being children.
general.author: cindy garner

general.quote: Becoming a father isn’t difficult, But it’s very difficult to be a father.
general.author: wilhelm busch

general.quote: My father died many years ago, and yet when something special happens to me, I talk to him secretly not really knowing whether he hears, but it makes me feel better to half believe it.
general.author: natasha josefowitz

general.quote: I killed the monsters. That’s what fathers do.
general.author: f.k. wallace

general.quote: There are fathers who do not love their children, but there is no grandfather who does not adore his grandson.
general.author: victor hugo quotes

general.quote: He didn’t tell me how to live; he lived, and let me watch him do it.
general.author: clarence budington kelland

general.quote: It is not flesh and blood, but heart which makes us fathers and sons.
general.author: johann friedrich von schiller

general.quote: Nothing I’ve ever done has given me more joys and rewards than being a father to my children.
general.author: bill cosby

general.quote: Fatherhood is pretending the present you love most is soap-on-a-rope.
general.author: bill cosby

general.quote: A man knows when he is growing old because he begins to look like his father.
general.author: gabriel garcia marquez

general.quote: As a father, my first priority is to help my sons set and attain personal goals so they will develop self-confidence and individual strength.
general.author: alan thicke

general.quote: For rarely are sons similar to their fathers; most are worse, and a few are better than their fathers.
general.author: homer

general.quote: Fathers and mothers have lost the idea that the highest aspiration they might have for their children is for them to be wise… specialized competence and success are all that they can imagine.
general.author: allan bloom

general.quote: My mother protected me from the world and my father threatened me with it.
general.author: quentin crisp

general.quote: The most important thing a father can do for his children is to love their mother.
general.author: theodore m. hesburgh

general.quote: The fundamental defect with fathers is that they want their children to be a credit to them.
general.author: bertrand russell

general.quote: To her, the name of father was another name for love.
general.author: fanny fern

general.quote: Whoever does not have a good father should procure one.
general.author: friedrich nietzsche

general.quote: The heart of a father is the masterpiece of nature.
general.author: antoine-françois

general.quote: The best gift a father can give to his son is the gift of himself – his time. For material things mean little, if there is not someone to share them with.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: Dad, your guiding hand on my shoulder will remain with me forever.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: A father carries pictures where his money used to be.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: Any man can be a father. It takes someone special to be a dad.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: Noble fathers have noble children.
general.author: euripides

general.quote: Fathers should be neither seen nor heard. That is the only proper basis for family life.
general.author: oscar wilde quotes

general.quote: Those who have never had a father can at any rate never know the sweets of losing one. To most men the death of his father is a new lease of life.
general.author: samuel butler quotes

general.quote: What you have inherited from your fathers, earn over again for yourselves, or it will not be yours.
general.author: johann wolfgang von goethe quotes

general.quote: That is the thankless position of the father in the family — the provider for all, and the enemy of all.
general.author: august j. strindberg

general.quote: It is much easier to become a father than to be one.
general.author: kent nerburn

general.quote: I am not ashamed to say that no man I ever met was my father’s equal, and I never loved any other man as much.
general.author: hedy lamarr

general.quote: The affection of a father and a son are different: The father loves the person of the son, and the son loves the memory of his father.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: One night a father overheard his son pray: Dear God, Make me the kind of man my Daddy is. Later that night, the Father prayed, Dear God, Make me the kind of man my son wants me to be.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: The father is always a Republican toward his son, and his mother’s always a Democrat.
general.author: robert frost

general.quote: Don’t make a baby if you can’t be a father.
general.author: national urban league slogan

general.quote: Being a great father is like shaving. No matter how good you shaved today, you have to do it again tomorrow.
general.author: reed markham

general.quote: My father gave me the greatest gift anyone could give another person, he believed in me.
general.author: jim valvano

general.quote: I cannot think of any need in childhood as strong as the need for a father’s protection.
general.author: sigmund freud

general.quote: The longer I live the more keenly I feel that whatever was good enough for our fathers is not good enough for us.
general.author: oscar wilde quotes

general.quote: No music is so pleasant to my ears as that word father.
general.author: lydia m. child

general.quote: My father didn’t tell me how to live; he lived, and let me watch him do it.
general.author: clarence buddinton kelland

general.quote: A great city whose image dwells on the memory of man is the type of some great idea. Rome represents conquest; faith hovers over Jerusalem; and Athens embodies the pre-eminent quality of the antique world-art.
general.author: benjamin disraeli

general.quote: In the country the darkness of night is friendly and familiar, but in a city, with its blaze of lights, it is unnatural, hostile and menacing. It is like a monstrous vulture that hovers, biding its time.
general.author: somerset maugham

general.quote: I always seem to suffer some loss of faith on entering cities.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson

general.quote: What is the city but the people?
general.author: william shakespeare

general.quote: In Rome you long for the country; in the country – oh inconstant! – you praise the distant city to the stars.
general.author: horace

general.quote: The number of objects we see from living in a large city amuses the mind like a perpetual raree-show, without supplying it with any ideas.
general.author: william hazlitt

general.quote: A small country town is not the place in which one would choose to quarrel with a wife; every human being in such places is a spy.
general.author: samuel johnson

general.quote: Divine Nature gave the fields, human art built the cities.
general.author: marcus terentius varro

general.quote: Great towns are but a large sort of prison to the soul; like cages to birds, or pounds to beasts.
general.author: pierre charron

general.quote: There is hardly one in three of us who live in the cities who is not sick with unused self.
general.author: ben hecht

general.quote: No city should be too large for a man to walk out of in a morning.
general.author: cyril connolly

general.quote: The axis of the earth sticks out visibly through the centre of each and every town or city.
general.author: oliver wendell holmes

general.quote: There are natures that go to the streams of life in great cities as the hart goes to the water brooks.
general.author: philip g. hamerton

general.quote: Ye are the light of the world. A city that is set on a hill cannot be hid.
general.author: bible

general.quote: The truest wild beasts live in the most populous places.
general.author: baltasar gracian
