general.quote: A very populous city can rarely, if ever, be well governed.
general.author: aristotle

general.quote: All cities are mad: but the madness is gallant. All cities are beautiful: but the beauty is grim.
general.author: christopher morley

general.quote: Cities are the abyss of the human species.
general.author: jean-jacques rousseau

general.quote: A city is a large community where people are lonesome together.
general.author: herbert prochnow

general.quote: Cities force growth, and make men talkative and entertaining, but they make them artificial.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson

general.quote: If you would know and not be known, live in a city.
general.author: charles caleb colton

general.quote: If you would be known, and not know, vegetate in a village; if you would know, and not be known, live in a city.
general.author: charles caleb colton

general.quote: Cities give us collision. ‘Tis said London and New York take the nonsense out of a man.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson

general.quote: God made the country, and man made the town.
general.author: william cowper

general.quote: The first requisite to happiness is that a man be born in a famous city.
general.author: euripides

general.quote: I have an affection for a great city. I feel safe in the neighbourhood of man, and enjoy the sweet security of the streets.
general.author: henry wadsworth longfellow

general.quote: The city disappears street by street as you enter it.
general.author: ian seed

general.quote: The Internet is becoming the town square for the global village of tomorrow.
general.author: bill gates

general.quote: I have found by experience that they who have spent all their lives in cities contract not only an effeminacy of habit, but of thinking.
general.author: oliver goldsmith

general.quote: Clearly, then, the city is not a concrete jungle, it is a human zoo.
general.author: desmond morris

general.quote: Blessed indeed is the man who hears many gentle voices call him father!
general.author: lydia m. child

general.quote: The child is the father of the man.
general.author: william wordsworth

general.quote: I could never have a better teacher in those days than my father.
general.author: tony visconti

general.quote: A family is a tyranny ruled over by it’s weakest member.
general.author: george bernard shaw quotes

general.quote: A man should never neglect his family for business.
general.author: walt disney

general.quote: Family life is the source of the greatest human happiness.
general.author: robert j. havighurst

general.quote: There is nothing on earth so easy as to forget, if a person chooses to set about it. I’m sure I have as much forgot your poor, dear uncle, as if he had never existed; and I thought it my duty to do so.
general.author: richard brinsley sheridan

general.quote: Widows are divided into two classes — the bereaved and relieved.
general.author: victor robinson

general.quote: Widows, like ripe fruit, drop easily from their perch.
general.author: jean de la bruyere

general.quote: The accent of one’s birthplace remains in the mind and in the heart as in one’s speech.
general.author: francois de la rochefoucauld

general.quote: The best place to find a helping hand is at the end of your own arm.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: The best place a person can die, is where they die for others.
general.author: james m. barrie

general.quote: A mother’s arms are made of tenderness and children sleep soundly in them.
general.author: victor hugo

general.quote: Where there is a mother in the home, matters go well.
general.author: amos bronson alcott

general.quote: The mother’s heart is the child’s schoolroom.
general.author: henry ward beecher

general.quote: Divorce. A resumption of diplomatic relations and rectification of boundaries.
general.author: ambrose bierce

general.quote: A new study found that women gain more weight after marriage, but men gain more weight after a divorce. Yeah, the divorce usually takes place after men point out that women gained more weight after marriage.
general.author: jimmy fallon

general.quote: Divorce is just the most awful thing in the world.
general.author: john denver

general.quote: Until blacks and whites see each other as brother and sister, we will not have parity. It’s very clear.
general.author: maya angelou

general.quote: A sister is both your mirror – and your opposite.
general.author: elizabeth fishel

general.quote: Is solace anywhere more comforting than in the arms of a sister.
general.author: alice walker

general.quote: Where liberty is, there is my country.
general.author: benjamin franklin

general.quote: The test of good citizenship is loyalty to country.
general.author: bainbridge colby

general.quote: My country owes me nothing. It gave me, as it gives every boy and girl, a chance. It gave me schooling, independence of action, opportunity for service and honor. In no other land could a boy from a country village, without inheritance or influential friends, look forward with unbounded hope.
general.author: herbert clark hooverf

general.quote: Never get married in the morning, because you never know who you’ll meet that night.
general.author: paul hornung

general.quote: It’s not as great a day for the bride as she thinks. She’s not marrying the best man.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: A wedding is the only time a woman will ever have veto over what her best friends wear.
general.author: amy cameron

general.quote: The woman who bore me is no longer alive, but I seem to be her daughter in increasingly profound ways.
general.author: johnnetta betsch cole

general.quote: Every mother hopes that her daughter will marry a better man than she did, and is convinced that her son will never find a wife as good as his father did.
general.author: martin andersen-nexö

general.quote: Our sons and daughters must be trained in national service, taught to give as well as to receive.
general.author: emmeline pankburst

general.quote: A daughter is a mother’s gender partner, her closest ally in the family confederacy, an extension of her self.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: A daughter is a little girl who grows up to be a friend.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: A man is free to go up as high as he can reach up to; but I, with all my style and pep, can’t get a man my equal because a girl is always judged by her mother.
general.author: anzia yezierska

general.quote: The mother-daughter relationship is the most complex.
general.author: wynonna judd

general.quote: Daughter am I in my mother’s house, but mistress in my own.
general.author: rudyard kipling

general.quote: And mothers are their daughters‘ role model, their biological and emotional road map, the arbiter of all their relationships.
general.author: victoria secunda

general.quote: Any astronomer can predict with absolute accuracy just where every star in the universe will be at 11.30 tonight. He can make no such prediction about his teenage daughter.
general.author: james t. adams

general.quote: Oh my son’s my son till he gets him a wife, but my daughter’s my daughter all her life.
general.author: dinah mulock craik

general.quote: A daughter is a day brightener and a heart warmer.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: A lively and lasting sense of filial duty is more effectually impressed on the mind of a son or daughter by reading King Lear, than by all the dry volumes of ethics, and divinity, that ever were written.
general.author: thomas jefferson

general.quote: If you can give your son or daughter only one gift, let it be enthusiasm.
general.author: bruce barton

general.quote: I think that carrying a baby inside you is like running as fast as you can. It feels like finally letting go and filling yourself up to the wildest limits.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: A baby is something you carry inside you for nine months, in your arms for three years, and in your heart until the day you die.
general.author: mary mason

general.quote: Being pregnant was a lot like being a child again. There was always someone telling you what to do.
general.author: emily oster

general.quote: All the time we wondered and wondered, who is this person coming, growing, turning, floating, swimming deep, deep inside?
general.author: crescent dragonwagon

general.quote: Being pregnant is an occupational hazard of being a wife.
general.author: queen victoria

general.quote: You are pregnant and you are powerful. You are bold and you are beautiful. Go forward in your boldness, in your beauty and in your connectedness. Trust your body to birth and know that the collective power of women worldwide will be with you.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: Pregnancy is a disease from which you recover in 18 years and 9 months.
general.author: carrie latet

general.quote: I truly loved being pregnant and feeling what was going on inside my body and watching it change. It’s difficult to recoup, but still amazing nonetheless. I would have another one.
general.author: jill scott

general.quote: Of course I’d like children. But I have to get over my impression that being pregnant is like popping corn. You expand and expand until you pop.
general.author: markie post

general.quote: I love being pregnant!
general.author: soleil moon frye

general.quote: Giving birth and being born brings us into the essence of creation, where the human spirit is courageous and bold and the body, a miracle of wisdom.
general.author: harriette hartigan

general.quote: There are three reasons for breast-feeding: the milk is always at the right temperature; it comes in attractive containers; and the cat can’t get it.
general.author: irena chalmers

general.quote: I feel cheated never being able to know what it’s like to get pregnant, carry a child and breastfeed.
general.author: dustin hoffman

general.quote: Whether your pregnancy was meticulously planned, medically coaxed, or happened by surprise, one thing is certain – your life will never be the same.
general.author: catherine jones

general.quote: In the pregnancy process I have come to realize how much of the burden is on the female partner. She’s got a construction zone going on in her belly.
general.author: al roker

general.quote: Birth is not only about making babies. Birth is about making mothers… strong, competent, capable mothers who trust themselves and know their inner strength.
general.author: barbara katz rothman

general.quote: Being pregnant is supposed to be the happiest time in your life.
general.author: kyla pratt

general.quote: Birth is a mystery. Words are not enough.
general.author: marie o’connor

general.quote: For far too many, pregnancy and birth is still something that happens to them rather than something they set out consciously and joyfully to do themselves.
general.author: sheila kitzinger

general.quote: Before you were born I carried you under my heart. From the moment you arrived in this world until the moment I leave it, I will always carry you in my heart.
general.author: mandy harrison

general.quote: The only time a women wishes she was a year older is when she’s expecting a baby.
general.author: mary marsh

general.quote: Pregnancy is a process that invites you to surrender to the unseen force behind all life.
general.author: judy ford

general.quote: Before you were conceived I wanted you. Before you were born I loved you. Before you were here an hour I would die for you. This is the miracle of Mother’s Love.
general.author: maureen hawkins

general.quote: I’ve got seven kids. The three words you hear most around my house are ‘hello,’ ‘goodbye,’ and ‘I’m pregnant‘"
general.author: dean martin

general.quote: These wretched babies don’t come until they are ready.
general.author: queen elizabeth

general.quote: To be pregnant is to be vitally alive, thoroughly woman, and distressingly inhabited. Soul and spirit are stretched – along with body – making pregnancy a time of transition, growth, and profound beginnings.
general.author: anne christian buchanan and debra k. kingsporn

general.quote: I know what it’s like to be pregnant and nervous and poor.
general.author: loretta lynn

general.quote: I wasn’t ecstatic about being pregnant – I wasn’t somebody who actively wanted kids. Certainly there were no fantasies about nappy-changing.
general.author: elizabeth mcgovern

general.quote: The dreams that we have in pregnancy are tainted with the worries and joys of pregnancy and the changing roles of our lives.
general.author: robin elise weiss

general.quote: I usually claim that pregnant women should not read books about pregnancy and birth. Their time is too precious. They should, rather, watch the moon and sing to their baby in the womb.
general.author: michel odent

general.quote: Recession is when a neighbor loses his job. Depression is when you lose yours.
general.author: ronald reagan

general.quote: As man draws nearer to the stars, why should he not also draw nearer to his neighbor?
general.author: lyndon b. johnson

general.quote: A good neighbor is a fellow who smiles at you over the back fence, but doesn’t climb over it.
general.author: arthur baer

general.quote: A bad neighbor is a misfortune, as much as a good one is a great blessing.
general.author: hesiod

general.quote: Your neighbor is the man who needs you.
general.author: elbert hubbard

general.quote: Nothing makes you more tolerant of a neighbor’s noisy party than being there.
general.author: franklin p. jones

general.quote: There are many who dare not kill themselves for fear of what the neighbors will say.
general.author: cyril connolly

general.quote: If you must love your neighbor as yourself, it is at least as fair to love yourself as your neighbor.
general.author: sebastien-roch nicolas de chamfort

general.quote: No man can worship God or love his neighbor on an empty stomach.
general.author: woodrow wilson

general.quote: Regard your neighbor’s gain as your own gain, and your neighbor’s loss as your own loss.
general.author: tai shang kan ying pien

general.quote: Love thy neighbor as thyself, but choose your neighborhood.
general.author: louise beal

general.quote: Don’t throw stones at your neighbors, if your own windows are glass.
general.author: benjamin franklin

general.quote: We make our friends; we make our enemies; but God makes our next door neighbor.
general.author: gilbert chesterton

general.quote: You shall love your neighbor as yourself.
general.author: bible

general.quote: If you burn your neighbor’s house down, it doesn’t make your house look any better.
general.author: lou holtz

general.quote: Every man is surrounded by a neighborhood of voluntary spies.
general.author: jane austen

general.quote: My neighbor doesn’t want to be loved as much as he wants to be envied.
general.author: irving layton

general.quote: It is easier to love humanity as a whole than to love one’s neighbor.
general.author: eric hoffer

general.quote: The impersonal hand of government can never replace the helping hand of a neighbor.
general.author: hubert h. humphrey

general.quote: For what do we live, but to make sport for our neighbors, and laugh at them in our turn?
general.author: jane austen

general.quote: Borrow trouble for yourself, if that’s your nature, but don’t lend it to your neighbors.
general.author: rudyard kipling

general.quote: If you want to annoy your neighbors, tell the truth about them.
general.author: pietro aretino

general.quote: Don’t complain about the snow on your neighbor’s roof when your own doorstep is unclean.
general.author: confucius

general.quote: This is the sum of all — righteousness. In causing pleasure or in giving pain, in doing good or injury to others, a man obtains a proper rule of action by looking at his neighbor as himself.
general.author: the mahabharta

general.quote: Your next-door neighbor is not a man; he is an environment. He is the barking of a dog; he is the noise of a piano; he is a dispute about a party wall; he is drains that are worse than yours, or roses that are better than yours.
general.author: gilbert k. chesterton

general.quote: Love thy neighbor — but don’t pull down your hedge.
general.author: benjamin franklin

general.quote: There is nothing so consoling as to find one’s neighbor’s troubles are at least as great as one’s own.
general.author: george moore

general.quote: Your own safety is at stake when your neighbor’s house is in flames.
general.author: horace

general.quote: It’s not necessary to blow out your neighbor’s light to let your own shine.
general.author: m.r. dehaan

general.quote: Being pregnant finally helped me understand what my true relationship was with my body – meaning that it wasn’t put on this earth to look good in a swimsuit.
general.author: amy adams

general.quote: Childbearing is glorified in part because women die from it.
general.author: andrea dworkin

general.quote: People always say that pregnant women have a glow. And I say it’s because you’re sweating to death.
general.author: jessica simpson

general.quote: A father is always making his baby into a little woman. And when she is a woman he turns her back again.
general.author: enid bagnold

general.quote: An undutiful daughter will prove an unmanageable wife.
general.author: benjamin franklin

general.quote: A memoir is an invitation into another person’s privacy.
general.author: isabel allende

general.quote: So many plays with magic in them that would be a terrific invitation to an imaginative animation team.
general.author: kenneth branagh

general.quote: If I have to climb to heaven on a ladder, I shall decline the invitation.
general.author: mercedes mccambridge

general.quote: Housework can kill you if done right.
general.author: erma bombeck

general.quote: I hate housework! You make the beds; you do the dishes. And six months later you have to start all over again.
general.author: joan rivers

general.quote: When it comes to housework the one thing no book of household management can ever tell you is how to begin. Or maybe I mean why.
general.author: katharine whitehorn

general.quote: The best training any parent can give a child is to train the child to train himself.
general.author: a. p. gouthey

general.quote: No matter how calmly you try to referee, parenting will eventually produce bizarre behavior, and I’m not talking about the kids. Their behavior is always normal.
general.author: bill cosby

general.quote: Parents are traffic signs that are always in our blind spots.
general.author: jeremy p. johnson

general.quote: Love is a fire. But whether it is going to warm your hearth or burn down your house, you can never tell.
general.author: joan crawford

general.quote: In a rich man’s house there is no place to spit but his face.
general.author: diogenes

general.quote: Intelligence and courtesy not always are combined; Often in a wooden house a golden room we find.
general.author: henry wadsworth longfellow

general.quote: If you want to read about love and marriage, you’ve got to buy two separate books.
general.author: alan king

general.quote: I was married by a judge. I should have asked for a jury.
general.author: groucho marx

general.quote: Of all actions of a man’s life, his marriage does least concern other people, yet of all actions of our life ‘Tis most meddled with by other people.
general.author: john selden

general.quote: The finest inheritance you can give to a child is to allow it to make its own way, completely on its own feet.
general.author: isadora duncan

general.quote: What we have inherited from our fathers and mothers is not all that ‘walks in us.’ There are all sorts of dead ideas and lifeless old beliefs.
general.author: henrik ibsen

general.quote: The Bible tells us that we’re supposed to leave an inheritance for children.
general.author: marvin sapp

general.quote: I did not attend his funeral, but I wrote a nice letter saying I approved of it.
general.author: mark twain

general.quote: They say such nice things about people at their funerals that it makes me sad to realize I’m going to miss mine by just a few days.
general.author: garrison keillor

general.quote: A funeral eulogy is a belated plea for the defense delivered after the evidence is all in.
general.author: irvin s. cobb

general.quote: Even the best of friends cannot attend each other’s funeral.
general.author: kehlog albran

general.quote: Always go to other people’s funerals, otherwise they won’t come to yours.
general.author: yogi berra

general.quote: Never joke at funerals, or during business transactions.
general.author: herman melville

general.quote: It is extremely hard to have a funeral when you don’t have anything to bury.
general.author: ellen gilchrist

general.quote: Some people never head a procession until they’re dead.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: A wedding is a funeral where you smell your own flowers.
general.author: eddie cantor

general.quote: If you want to really know what your friends and family think of you die broke, and then see who shows up for the funeral.
general.author: gregory nunn

general.quote: In the city a funeral is just an interruption of traffic; in the country it is a form of popular entertainment.
general.author: george ade

general.quote: You should always go to other people’s funerals; otherwise, they won’t come to yours.
general.author: yogi berra

general.quote: Funerals all over the world everywhere every minute. Shovelling them under by the cartload doublequick. Thousands every hour. Too many in the world.
general.author: james joyce

general.quote: Weddings and funerals. That’s what religion is good for.
general.author: kate cohen

general.quote: Success is a public affair. Failure is a private funeral.
general.author: rosalind russell

general.quote: Funerals aren’t supposed to be funny.
general.author: cheryl anne porter

general.quote: When I die, I’ll probably climb out of the coffin and play the organ at my own funeral!
general.author: rick wakeman

general.quote: Funerals are pretty compared to death. Funerals are quiet, but deaths not always.
general.author: tennessee williams

general.quote: Rather upsets a man’s day a funeral does.
general.author: james joyce

general.quote: The only reason I might go to the funeral is to make absolutely sure that he’s dead.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: Nowadays, the only occassions that seem to bring families together are weddings and funerals.
general.author: julia mcnamara

general.quote: Justice consists of doing no one injury, decency in giving no one offense.
general.author: marcus t. cicero

general.quote: Injuries may be forgiven, but not forgotten.
general.author: aesop

general.quote: Slight small injuries, and they’ll become none at all.
general.author: thomas fuller

general.quote: As a Christian should do no injuries to others, so he should forgive the injuries that others do to him. It is to be like God, who is a good-giving God, and a sin-forgiving God.
general.author: ralph venning

general.quote: Let us forget and forgive injuries.
general.author: miguel de cervantes

general.quote: There is nothing that people bear more impatiently, or forgive less, than contempt: and an injury is much sooner forgotten than an insult.
general.author: philip dormer stanhope chesterfield

general.quote: If the other person injures you, you may forget the injury; but if you injure him you will always remember.
general.author: kahlil gibran

general.quote: No man ever did a designed injury to another, but at the same time he did a greater to himself.
general.author: lord kames

general.quote: Lay silently the injuries you receive upon the altar of oblivion.
general.author: hosea ballou

general.quote: One ungrateful person does an injury to all needy people.
general.author: publilius syrus

general.quote: Violence and injury enclose in their net all that do such things, and generally return upon him who began.
general.author: lucretius

general.quote: There is no ghost so difficult to lay as the ghost of an injury.
general.author: alexander smith

general.quote: The best revenge is to be unlike him who performed the injury.
general.author: marcus aurelius

general.quote: Write your injuries in dust, your benefits in marble.
general.author: benjamin franklin

general.quote: It’s a fact that it is much more comfortable to be in the position of the person who has been offended than to be the unfortunate cause of it.
general.author: barbara walters

general.quote: Injuries accompanied with insults are never forgiven: all men, on these occasions, are good haters, and lay out their revenge at compound interest.
general.author: charles caleb colton

general.quote: There are some cases in which the sense of injury breeds — not the will to inflict injuries and climb over them as a ladder, but, a hatred of all injury.
general.author: george eliot

general.quote: Kindnesses are easily forgotten; but injuries! — what worthy man does not keep those in mind?
general.author: william m. thackeray

general.quote: An honest man speaks the truth, though it may give offence; a vain man, in order that it may.
general.author: william hazlitt

general.quote: If men wound you with injuries, meet them with patience; hasty words rankle the wound, soft language dresses it, forgiveness cures it, and oblivion takes away the scar. It is more noble by silence to avoid an injury by argument to overcome it.
general.author: francis beaumont

general.quote: The injuries we do and those we suffer are seldom weighed in the same scales.
general.author: aesop

general.quote: To live is to hurt others, and through others, to hurt oneself. Cruel earth! How can we manage not to touch anything? To find what ultimate exile?
general.author: albert camus

general.quote: The injuries that befall us unexpectedly are less severe than those which are deliberately anticipated.
general.author: marcus t. cicero

general.quote: Where there is injury let me sow pardon.
general.author: st. francis of assisi

general.quote: He who has injured thee was either stronger or weaker. If weaker, spare him; if stronger, spare thyself.
general.author: lucius annaeus seneca

general.quote: No man is hurt but by himself.
general.author: laertius diogenes

general.quote: It is more noble by silence to avoid an injury than by argument to overcome it.
general.author: francis beaumont

general.quote: To willful men, the injuries that they themselves procure must be their schoolmasters.
general.author: william shakespeare

general.quote: One who is injured ought not to return the injury, for on no account can it be right to do an injustice; and it is not right to return an injury, or to do evil to any man, however much we have suffered from him.
general.author: socrates

general.quote: If an injury has to be done to a man it should be so severe that his vengeance need not be feared.
general.author: niccolo machiavelli

general.quote: I do myself a greater injury in lying that I do him of whom I tell a lie.
general.author: michel eyquem de montaigne

general.quote: Anger, if not restrained, is frequently more hurtful to us than the injury that provokes it.
general.author: marcus annaeus seneca

general.quote: Recompense injury with justice, and recompense kindness with kindness.
general.author: confucius

general.quote: Forget like a child any injury done by somebody immediately. Never keep it in the heart. It kindles hatred.
general.author: swami sivananda

general.quote: Reject your sense of injury and the injury itself disappears.
general.author: marcus aurelius

general.quote: Where there is injury let me sow pardon.
general.author: francis of assisi

general.quote: Everyone suffers wrongs for which there is no remedy.
general.author: edgar watson howe

general.quote: No man ever did a designed injury to another without doing a greater to himself.
general.author: henry home

general.quote: To deaden yourself against any hurt is to deaden yourself also against the hurt of others.
general.author: max lerner

general.quote: Children show scars like medals. Lovers use them as secrets to reveal. A scar is what happens when the word is made flesh.
general.author: leonard cohen

general.quote: Have you ever been hurt and the place tries to heal a bit, and you just pull the scar off of it over and over again.
general.author: rosa parks

general.quote: It is better to receive than to do injury.
general.author: marcus t. cicero

general.quote: I don’t believe in accidents; there are only encounters in history. There are no accidents.
general.author: elie wiesel

general.quote: Nothing is accidental in the universe — this is one of my Laws of Physics — except the entire universe itself, which is Pure Accident, pure divinity.
general.author: joyce carol oates

general.quote: Fame is a vapor, popularity an accident, and riches take wings. Only one thing endures and that is character.
general.author: horace greeley

general.quote: Accidents on big mountains happen when people’s ambitions cloud their good judgment. Good climbing is about climbing with heart and with instinct, not ambition and pride.
general.author: bear grylls

general.quote: I am a poor man, but I have this consolation: I am poor by accident, not by design.
general.author: josh billings quotes

general.quote: An accident is an inevitable occurrence due to the actions of immutable natural laws.
general.author: ambrose bierce quotes

general.quote: We try not to have ideas, preferring accidents. To create, you must empty yourself of every artistic thought.
general.author: gilbert george

general.quote: One does not become a guru by accident.
general.author: james fenton

general.quote: Literature, art, like civilization itself, are only accidents.
general.author: joyce carol oates

general.quote: Always have a plan, and believe in it. Nothing happens by accident.
general.author: chuck knox

general.quote: The greatest pleasure I know, is to do a good action by stealth, and to have it found out by accident.
general.author: charles lamb quotes

general.quote: Accidents are not accidents but precise arrivals at the wrong right time.
general.author: dejan stojanovic

general.quote: The ideal man bears the accidents of life with dignity and grace, making the best of circumstances.
general.author: aristotle quotes

general.quote: To be born free is an accident; To live free a responsibility; To die free is an obligation.
general.author: mrs hubbard davis

general.quote: We don’t make mistakes, we only have happy accidents.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: Fathers are biological necessities, but social accidents.
general.author: margaret mead

general.quote: Life is a gamble. You can get hurt, but people die in plane crashes, lose their arms and legs in car accidents; people die every day. Same with fighters: some die, some get hurt, some go on. You just don’t let yourself believe it will happen to you.
general.author: muhammad ali quotes

general.quote: Quality is never an accident; it is always the result of high intention, sincere effort, intelligent direction and skillful execution; it represents the wise choice of many alternatives.
general.author: william a. foster

general.quote: There is no such thing as chance; and what seem to us merest accident springs from the deepest source of destiny.
general.author: johann friedrich von schiller

general.quote: I never did anything by accident, nor did any of my inventions come by accident; they came by work.
general.author: thomas edison quotes

general.quote: A discovery is said to be an accident meeting a prepared mind.
general.author: albert szent-gyorgyi

general.quote: Now and then there is a person born who is so unlucky that he runs into accidents which started out to happen to somebody else.
general.author: don marquis

general.quote: Some accidents there are in life that a little folly is necessary to help us out of.
general.author: francois de la rochefoucauld

general.quote: Was it always in my nature to take a bad time and block out the good times, until any success becomes an accident and failure seemed the only truth?
general.author: lillian hellman

general.quote: To succeed is nothing — it’s an accident. But to feel no doubts about oneself is something very different: it is character.
general.author: marie leneru

general.quote: Friends are thieves of time.
general.author: francis bacon

general.quote: Stolen kisses are always sweetest.
general.author: leigh hunt

general.quote: Who steals my purse, steals trash, but he that filches from me my good name robs me of that which not enriches him and makes me poor indeed.
general.author: william shakespeare

general.quote: What do the nationalists say about killers punishing murderers and thieves sentencing looters?
general.author: kahlil gibran

general.quote: Many of us crucify ourselves between two thieves – regret for the past and fear of the future.
general.author: fulton oursler

general.quote: Don’t worry about people stealing your ideas. If your ideas are any good, you’ll have to ram them down people’s throats.
general.author: howard aiken

general.quote: He who will not apply himself to business, eventually discovers that he means to get his bread by cheating, stealing, or begging, or else is wholly void of reason.
general.author: ischomachus

general.quote: Progress always involves risk; you can’t steal second base and keep your foot on first base.
general.author: frederick wilcox

general.quote: Bad artists copy. Good artists steal.
general.author: pablo picasso

general.quote: When I was a kid I used to pray every night for a new bicycle. Then I realised that the Lord doesn’t work that way so I stole one and asked Him to forgive me.
general.author: emo philips

general.quote: Let us not forget that the greatest composers where also the greatest thieves. They stole from everyone and everywhere.
general.author: pablo casals

general.quote: The robb’d that smiles steals something from the thief: He robs himself that spends a bootless grief.
general.author: william shakespeare

general.quote: The thief and the murderer follow nature just as much as the philanthropist.
general.author: thomas henry huxley

general.quote: It is long and hard and painful to create life: it is short and easy to steal the life others have made.
general.author: george bernard shaw

general.quote: About the most originality that any writer can hope to achieve honestly is to steal with good judgment.
general.author: josh billings

general.quote: Ordinary riches can be stolen, real riches cannot. In your soul are infinitely precious things that cannot be taken from you.
general.author: oscar wilde

general.quote: Thieves respect property. They merely wish the property to become their property that they may more perfectly respect it.
general.author: g. k. chesterton

general.quote: Immature poets imitate; mature poets steal.
general.author: t.s. eliot

general.quote: Jealousy is a dog’s bark which attracts thieves.
general.author: karl kraus

general.quote: One bush, they say, can never hide two thieves.
general.author: aristophanes

general.quote: Small faults indulged are little thieves that let in greater.
general.author: thomas fuller

general.quote: Oh God, that men should put an enemy in their mouths to steal away their brains!
general.author: william shakespeare

general.quote: What is gained by violence must be lost before superior violence.
general.author: mahatma gandhi

general.quote: Under all conditions, well-organized violence seems to him the shortest distance between two points.
general.author: leon trotsky

general.quote: As long as people use violence to combat violence, we will always have violence.
general.author: michael berg

general.quote: For violence, like Achilles’ lance, can heal the wounds it has inflicted.
general.author: frantz fanon

general.quote: In violence, we forget who we are.
general.author: mary mccarthy

general.quote: In some cases nonviolence requires more militancy than violence.
general.author: cesar chavez

general.quote: Violence is never the answer, until it’s the only answer.
general.author: derek landy

general.quote: I maintain that nothing useful and lasting can emerge from violence.
general.author: shirin ebadi

general.quote: Nonviolence doesn’t always work — but violence never does.
general.author: madge micheels-cyrus

general.quote: There is a great streak of violence in every human being. If it is not channeled and understood, it will break out in war or in madness.
general.author: sam peckinpah

general.quote: A little violence never hurt anybody.
general.author: benjamin ruggiero

general.quote: Violence does, in truth, recoil upon the violent, and the schemer falls into the pit which he digs for another.
general.author: sir arthur conan doyle

general.quote: Violence does even justice unjustly.
general.author: thomas carlyle

general.quote: Violence is not the problem; it is a consequence of the problem.
general.author: jim wallis

general.quote: It is clear that the way to heal society of its violence… and lack of love is to replace the pyramid of domination with the circle of equality and respect.
general.author: manitonquat

general.quote: All violence is the result of people tricking themselves into believing that their pain derives from other people and that consequently those people deserve to be punished.
general.author: marshall rosenberg

general.quote: No amount of violence you’ve done to others prepares you for violence done to yourself.
general.author: glen duncan

general.quote: Nonviolence means avoiding not only external physical violence but also internal violence of spirit. You not only refuse to shoot a man, but you refuse to hate him.
general.author: martin luther king, jr.

general.quote: Violence is a disease, a disease that corrupts all who use it regardless of the cause.
general.author: chris hedges

general.quote: Non violence is the answer to the crucial political and moral questions of our time; the need for mankind to overcome oppression and violence without resorting to oppression and violence.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: Violence never settles anything right: apart from injuring your own soul, it injures the best cause. It lingers on long after the object of hate has disappeared from the scene to plague the lives of those who have employed it against their foes.
general.author: obafemi awolowo

general.quote: The state calls its own violence law, but that of the individual crime.
general.author: max stirner

general.quote: Violence gains nothing, killing wins nothing — only sometimes nothing is what people want. Death is what they want. And they get it.
general.author: ursula k. le guin

general.quote: Extreme violence has a way of preventing us from seeing the interests it serves.
general.author: naomi klein

general.quote: Victory attained by violence is tantamount to a defeat, for it is momentary.
general.author: mahatma gandhi

general.quote: Violence is man re-creating himself.
general.author: frantz fanon

general.quote: We pay for the violence of our ancestors.
general.author: frank herbert

general.quote: Power and violence are opposites; where the one rules absolutely, the other is absent. Violence appears where power is in jeopardy, but left to its own course it ends in power’s disappearance.
general.author: hannah arendt

general.quote: People sleep peaceably in their beds at night only because rough men stand ready to do violence on their behalf.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: Violence is a dark contrast to what so many of us still believe in — love.
general.author: robi ludwig

general.quote: I object to violence because when it appears to do good, the good is only temporary; the evil it does is permanent.
general.author: mahatma gandhi

general.quote: All violence flows from the same source … the need for power. Power is the only true morality … the only deathless god, and the appetite for violence is its only commandment.
general.author: dan simmons

general.quote: Our fear of violence may have been as destructive as the violence itself.
general.author: hilary bailey

general.quote: Violence can only be concealed by a lie, and the lie can only be maintained by violence. Any man who has once proclaimed violence as his method is inevitably forced to take the lie as his principle.
general.author: alexander solzhenitsyn

general.quote: Keep violence in the mind where it belongs.
general.author: brian w. aldiss

general.quote: Moderate strength is shown in violence, supreme strength is shown in levity.
general.author: g. k. chesterton

general.quote: All violence consists in some people forcing others, under threat of suffering or death, to do what they do not want to do.
general.author: leo tolstoy

general.quote: Violence is the last refuge of the incompetent.
general.author: isaac asimov

general.quote: Bad people excuse their faults; wise people leave them.
general.author: ben johnston

general.quote: We are all manufacturers — some make good, others make trouble, and still others make excuses.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: Any excuse will serve a tyrant.
general.author: aesop

general.quote: Several excuses are always less convincing than one.
general.author: aldous huxley

general.quote: There is no greater symphony of self-destruction than the beautifully poisonous melody found in our excuses.
general.author: steve maraboli

general.quote: Destiny. A tyrant’s authority for crime and a fool’s excuse for failure.
general.author: ambrose bierce

general.quote: Difficulty is the excuse history never accepts.
general.author: edward r. murrow

general.quote: Ignorance is no excuse, it’s the real thing.
general.author: irene peter

general.quote: I’ve always wondered where explanations end and excuses begin.
general.author: errol morris

general.quote: Nature has no compassion. Nature accepts no excuses and the only punishment it knows is death.
general.author: eric hoffer

general.quote: The best excuse is to have none.
general.author: ivan panin

general.quote: Don’t make excuses — make good.
general.author: elbert hubbard

general.quote: No doubt Jack the Ripper excused himself on the grounds that it was human nature.
general.author: a. a. milne

general.quote: I attribute my success to this–I never gave or took any excuse.
general.author: florence nightingale

general.quote: I respect my limitations, but I don’t use them as an excuse.
general.author: stephen r. donaldson

general.quote: Excuses are the nails used to build a house of failure.
general.author: don wilder and bill rechin

general.quote: Before we blame we should first see whether we cannot excuse.
general.author: georg c. lichtenberg

general.quote: There is hardly any man so strict as not to vary a little from truth when he is to make an excuse.
general.author: george savile

general.quote: Pessimism is an excuse for not trying and a guarantee to a personal failure.
general.author: bill clinton

general.quote: Never make excuses. Your friends don’t need them and your foes won’t believe them.
general.author: john wooden

general.quote: Love will find a way. Indifference will find an excuse.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: It is better to offer no excuse than a bad one.
general.author: george washington

general.quote: There is one excuse for every mistake a man can make, but only one. When a fellow makes the same mistake twice he’s got to throw up both hands and own up to carelessness or cussedness.
general.author: george horace lorimer

general.quote: An excuse is worse and more terrible than a lie; for an excuse is a lie guarded.
general.author: alexander pope

general.quote: Ninety-nine percent of failures come from people who have the habit of making excuses.
general.author: george washington carver

general.quote: Good excuses rarely collect dust. We use them, and use them, and use them.
general.author: andy stanley

general.quote: Excuses are the tools with which persons with no purpose in view build for themselves great monuments of nothing.
general.author: steven grayhm

general.quote: One of the most important tasks of a manager is to eliminate his people’s excuses for failure.
general.author: robert townsend

general.quote: The longer the excuse the less likely it’s the truth.
general.author: robert half

general.quote: The manly man is one who always finds excuses for others, but never for himself.
general.author: henry ward beecher

general.quote: Temptation is a woman’s weapon and man’s excuse.
general.author: h. l. mencken

general.quote: How strange to use "You only live once" as an excuse to throw it away.
general.author: bill copeland

general.quote: No one ever excused his way to success.
general.author: dave del dotto

general.quote: Every vice has its excuse ready.
general.author: publilius syrus

general.quote: He, who excuses himself, accuses himself.
general.author: gabriel meurier

general.quote: We excuse our sloth under the pretext of difficulty.
general.author: marcus fabius quintilian

general.quote: Sometimes I wish I had a terrible childhood, so that at least I’d have an excuse.
general.author: jimmy fallon

general.quote: There are a great many excuses that are worse than the offense.
general.author: h. w. shaw

general.quote: Don’t bother explaining–I’ve heard all the excuses and the trouble is most of them are true.
general.author: john brunner

general.quote: The excuses we make to ourselves when we want to do something are excellent material for soliloquies, for they are rarely made except when we are alone, and are very often made aloud.
general.author: georg christoph lichtenberg

general.quote: Two wrongs don’t make a right, but they make a good excuse.
general.author: thomas szasz

general.quote: An excuse has been defined as the skin of reason stuffed with a lie.
general.author: michael green

general.quote: Once the "what" is decided, the "how" always follows. We must not make the "how" an excuse for not facing and accepting the "what."
general.author: pearl s. buck

general.quote: We weave our excuses around events.
general.author: phillip pulfrey

general.quote: He that is good for making excuses is seldom good for anything else.
general.author: benjamin franklin

general.quote: Ambition is a poor excuse for not having sense enough to be lazy.
general.author: charlie mccarthy

general.quote: Any excuse will serve when one has not a mind to do a thing.
general.author: guicciardini

general.quote: You can make excuses or you can get the job done, but you can’t do both.
general.author: hap holmstead

general.quote: Excuses are your lack of faith in your own power.
general.author: robert anthony

general.quote: We have forty million reasons for failure, but not a single excuse.
general.author: rudyard kipling

general.quote: Every life is its own excuse for being.
general.author: elbert hubbard

general.quote: The absent are never without fault, nor the present without excuse.
general.author: benjamin franklin

general.quote: Whoever wants to be a judge of human nature should study people’s excuses.
general.author: hebbel

general.quote: The sincere intention of doing a good action, and a good excuse for not doing it, are equivalent to its performance.
general.author: yahya khalid

general.quote: Once your excuses are gone, you will simply have to settle for being awesome!
general.author: lorii myers

general.quote: It is wise to direct your anger towards problems — not people, to focus your energies on answers — not excuses.
general.author: william arthur ward

general.quote: When you’re good at making excuses, it’s hard to excel at anything else.
general.author: john l. mason

general.quote: Excuses, criticisms, and superstitions are vitamins for haters, but poison for the successful. Rise above!
general.author: steve maraboli

general.quote: Hold yourself responsible for a higher standard than anyone else expects of you. Never excuse yourself.
general.author: henry ward beecher

general.quote: The only man who is really free is the one who can turn down an invitation to dinner without giving an excuse.
general.author: jules renard

general.quote: What is the good of being a genius if you cannot use it as an excuse for being unemployed?
general.author: gerald barzan

general.quote: The person who really wants to do something finds a way; the other person finds an excuse.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: An excuse is a skin of a reason stuffed with a lie.
general.author: billy sunday

general.quote: A private excuse will not atone for a public insult.
general.author: hamid

general.quote: If you don’t like to make excuses or apologies, stop making promises.
general.author: evan esar

general.quote: A bad excuse confirms a fault.
general.author: al-isfaraini

general.quote: Never ruin an apology with an excuse.
general.author: kimberly johnson

general.quote: And oftentimes excusing of a fault doth make the fault the worse by the excuse.
general.author: william shakespeare

general.quote: A real failure does not need an excuse. It is an end in itself.
general.author: gertrude stein

general.quote: Good taste is the excuse I’ve always given for leading such a bad life.
general.author: oscar wilde

general.quote: We have more ability than will power, and it is often an excuse to ourselves that we imagine that things are impossible.
general.author: françois de la rochefoucauld

general.quote: Usually, terrible things that are done with the excuse that progress requires them are not really progress at all, but just terrible things.
general.author: russell baker

general.quote: Bad excuses are worse than none.
general.author: thomas fuller

general.quote: Violence is my last option.
general.author: chuck norris

general.quote: Return not violence for violence.
general.author: abu hanifa

general.quote: A person who commits a violence against another is obviously in need of medical care.
general.author: mack reynolds

general.quote: Why grab possessions like thieves, or divide them like socialists, when you can ignore them like wise men?"
general.author: natalie clifford barney

general.quote: Let us not forget that the greatest composers where also the greatest thieves. They stole from everyone and everywhere.
general.author: pablo casals

general.quote: The passing years steal from us one thing after another.
general.author: horace

general.quote: Accident is the name of the greatest of all inventors.
general.author: mark twain quotes

general.quote: Did you ever observe to whom the accidents happen? Chance favors only the prepared mind.
general.author: louis pasteur

general.quote: We must judge a government by its general tendencies and not by its happy accidents.
general.author: thomas b.macaulay

general.quote: The marks you receive in the school of experience are mostly bruises.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: The flea, though he kill none, he does all the harm he can.
general.author: dr. john donne

general.quote: A strong sense of injury often gives point to the expression of our feelings.
general.author: pliny the younger

general.quote: The chief mourner does not always attend the funeral.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson

general.quote: The Nobel is a ticket to one’s own funeral. No one has ever done anything after he got it.
general.author: t. s. eliot

general.quote: Funeral pomp is more for the vanity of the living than for the honor of the dead.
general.author: francois de la rochefoucauld

general.quote: To find a fault is easy; to do better may be difficult.
general.author: plutarch

general.quote: …guilt is often assumed before innocence can be proven.
general.author: miguel syjuco

general.quote: In marriage there are no manners to keep up, and beneath the wildest accusations no real criticism. If you could kick the person in the pants responsible for most of your trouble, you wouldn’t sit for a month.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: A trial without witnesses, when it involves a criminal accusation, a criminal matter, is not a true trial.
general.author: bill mccollum

general.quote: Don’t accuse others of your past, hidden guilt and sins.
general.author: angelica hopes

general.quote: All men’s misfortunes spring from their hatred of being alone.
general.author: jean de la bruyere

general.quote: We enter the world alone, we leave the world alone.
general.author: james a. froude

general.quote: It is strange how the presence of additional people can make you feel more alone.
general.author: james alan gardner

general.quote: One travels more usefully when alone, because he reflects more.
general.author: thomas jefferson

general.quote: When thinking about companions gone, we feel ourselves doubly alone.
general.author: sir walter scott

general.quote: The strong man is strongest when alone.
general.author: johann friedrich von schiller

general.quote: We walk alone in the world.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson

general.quote: Everything that lives, lives not alone, nor for itself.
general.author: william blake

general.quote: To be adult is to be alone.
general.author: jean rostand

general.quote: The man who follows the crowd will usually get no further than the crowd. The man who walks alone is likely to find himself in places no one has.
general.author: alan ashley-pitt

general.quote: The right to be alone — the most comprehensive of rights, and the right most valued by civilized man.
general.author: louis d. brandeis

general.quote: Alone we can do so little; together we can do so much.
general.author: helen keller

general.quote: Often we can help each other most by leaving each other alone; at other times we need the hand-grasp and the word of cheer.
general.author: elbert hubbard

general.quote: Just as the individual is not alone in the group, nor any one in society alone among the others, so man is not alone in the universe.
general.author: claude levi-strauss

general.quote: If you make friends with yourself you will never be alone.
general.author: maxwell maltz

general.quote: Do not rely completely on any other human being … we meet all of life’s greatest tests alone.
general.author: agnes macphail

general.quote: It is a rather pleasant experience to be alone in a bank at night.
general.author: william sutton

general.quote: One can endure sorrow alone, but it takes two to be glad.
general.author: elbert hubbard

general.quote: On stage I make love to twenty five thousand people; and then I go home alone.
general.author: janis joplin

general.quote: Is he alone who has courage on his right hand and faith on his left hand?
general.author: charles a. lindbergh

general.quote: Better mad with the rest of the world than wise alone.
general.author: baltasar gracian

general.quote: A man can be himself only so long as he is alone.
general.author: arthur schopenhauer

general.quote: The right to be let alone is indeed the beginning of all freedom.
general.author: william o. douglas

general.quote: We’re born alone, we live alone, we die alone. Only through our love and friendship can we create the illusion for the moment that we’re not alone.
general.author: orson welles

general.quote: We are never the same with others as when we are alone. We are different, even when we are in the dark with them.
general.author: maurice maeterlinck

general.quote: Walking with a friend in the dark is better than walking alone in the light.
general.author: helen keller

general.quote: To live alone is the fate of all great souls.
general.author: arthur schopenhauer

general.quote: The reason old souls enjoy spending time alone is because they never really are.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: The strongest man in the world is he who stands most alone.
general.author: henrik ibsen

general.quote: We are rarely proud when we are alone.
general.author: voltaire

general.quote: It’s better to be unhappy alone than unhappy with someone – so far.
general.author: marilyn monroe

general.quote: A man is never completely alone in this world. At the worst, he has the company of a boy, a youth, and by and by a grown man — the one he used to be.
general.author: cesare pavese

general.quote: I restore myself when I’m alone.
general.author: marilyn monroe

general.quote: A dream you dream alone is only a dream. A dream you dream together is reality.
general.author: john lennon

general.quote: The person who tries to live alone will not succeed as a human being. His heart withers if it does not answer another heart. His mind shrinks away if he hears only the echoes of his own thoughts and finds no other inspiration.
general.author: pearl s. buck

general.quote: I would rather go to heaven alone than go to hell in company.
general.author: r.a.torry

general.quote: Perhaps I know best why it is man alone who laughs; he alone suffers so deeply that he had to invent laughter.
general.author: friedrich nietzsche

general.quote: In our extreme youth, in our most humiliating sorrow, we think we are alone. When we are older we find that others have suffered too.
general.author: suzanne moarny

general.quote: Inside myself is a place where I live all alone, and that’s where I renew my springs that never dry up.
general.author: pearl buck

general.quote: When we cannot bear to be alone, it means we do not properly value the only companion we will have from birth to death — ourselves.
general.author: eda leshan

general.quote: We’re all in this alone.
general.author: lily tomlin

general.quote: By all means use sometimes to be alone. Salute thyself; see what thy soul doth wear.
general.author: george herbert

general.quote: It’s a terrible thing to be alone — yes it is — it is — but don’t lower your mask until you have another mask prepared beneath — as terrible as you like — but a mask.
general.author: katherine mansfield

general.quote: They are never alone that are accompanied with noble thoughts.
general.author: sir philip sidney

general.quote: It is better to be alone than in bad company.
general.author: george washington

general.quote: Reading well is one of the great pleasures that solitude can afford you.
general.author: harold bloom

general.quote: If you are lonely when you are alone, you are in bad company.
general.author: jean-paul sarter

general.quote: In cities no one is quiet but many are lonely; in the country, people are quiet but few are lonely.
general.author: geoffrey f. fisher

general.quote: In solitude, where we are least alone.
general.author: george gordon

general.quote: At the innermost core of all loneliness is a deep and powerful yearning for union with one’s lost self.
general.author: brendan francis

general.quote: Be good and you will be lonely.
general.author: mark twain

general.quote: We are all sentenced to solitary confinement inside our own skins, for life.
general.author: tennessee williams

general.quote: An artist is always alone — if he is an artist. No, what the artist needs is loneliness.
general.author: henry miller

general.quote: There is none more lonely than the man who loves only himself.
general.author: abraham ibn esra

general.quote: With some people solitariness is an escape not from others but from themselves. For they see in the eyes of others only a reflection of themselves.
general.author: eric hoffer

general.quote: I celebrate myself, and sing myself.
general.author: walt whitman

general.quote: People are lonely because they build walls instead of bridges.
general.author: joseph f. newton

general.quote: Every time I look at you I get a fierce desire to be lonesome.
general.author: oscar levant

general.quote: We are most of us very lonely in this world; you who have any who love you, cling to them and thank God.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: What should young people do with their lives today? Many things, obviously. But the most daring thing is to create stable communities in which the terrible disease of loneliness can be cured.
general.author: kurt vonnegut

general.quote: Solitude appeared to me as the only fit state of man.
general.author: walter benjamin

general.quote: It is very lonely sometimes, trying to play God.
general.author: oliver wendell holmes

general.quote: The fool needs company, the wise solitude.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: Loneliness is never more cruel than when it is felt in close propinquity with someone who has ceased to communicate.
general.author: germaine greer

general.quote: A lyric touch of the solitude…
general.author: bliss carman

general.quote: No man should go through life without once experiencing healthy, even bored solitude in the wilderness, finding himself depending solely on himself and thereby learning his true and hidden strength.
general.author: jack kerouac

general.quote: Only in a house where one has learnt to be lonely does one have this solicitude for things. One’s relation to them, the daily seeing or touching, begins to become love, and to lay one open to pain.
general.author: elizabeth bowen

general.quote: Loneliness can be conquered only by those who can bear solitude.
general.author: paul tillich

general.quote: Our language has wisely sensed the two sides of being alone. It has created the word "loneliness" to express the pain of being alone. And it has created the word "solitude" to express the glory of being alone.
general.author: paul johannes tillich

general.quote: Man’s loneliness is but his fear of life.
general.author: eugene o’neill

general.quote: There are days when solitude is a heady wine that intoxicates you with freedom, others when it is a bitter tonic, and still others when it is a poison that makes you beat your head against the wall.
general.author: colette

general.quote: The worst loneliness is not to be comfortable with yourself.
general.author: mark twain

general.quote: It is strange to be known so universally and yet to be so lonely.
general.author: albert einstein

general.quote: For it may be said, in general, that every man will love or hate solitude — in other words, his own society — just in proportion as he is worth anything in himself.
general.author: arthur schopenhauer

general.quote: Solitude shows us what should be; society shows us what we are.
general.author: robert cecil

general.quote: I love to be alone. I never found the companion that was so companionable as solitude.
general.author: henry david thoreau

general.quote: Lonely people, in talking to each other can make each other lonelier.
general.author: lillian hellman

general.quote: Towards evening, they wound down precipices, black with forests of cypress, pine and cedar, into a glen so savage and secluded, that, if Solitude ever had local habitation, this might have been "her place of dearest residence."
general.author: ann radcliffe

general.quote: Loneliness and the feeling of being unwanted is the most terrible poverty.
general.author: mother teresa

general.quote: How tired God must be of guilt and loneliness, for that is all we ever bring to Him.
general.author: mignon mclaughlin

general.quote: The happiest of all lives is a busy solitude.
general.author: voltaire

general.quote: I owe my solitude to other people.
general.author: alan watts

general.quote: The gift of loneliness is sometimes a radical vision of society or one’s people that has not previously been taken into account.
general.author: alice walker

general.quote: Columbus discovered no isle or key so lonely as himself.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson

general.quote: I never found the companion that was so companionable as solitude. We are for the most part more lonely when we go abroad among men than when we stay in our chambers.
general.author: henry david thoreau

general.quote: What loneliness is more lonely than distrust?
general.author: george eliot

general.quote: Language has created the word loneliness to express the pain of being alone, and the word solitude to express the glory of being alone.
general.author: paul tillich

general.quote: What makes loneliness anguish is not that I have no one to share my burden, but this: I have only my own burden to bear.
general.author: dag hammarskjold

general.quote: Leadership is the other side of the coin of loneliness, and he who is a leader must always act alone. And acting alone, accept everything alone.
general.author: ferdinand e.marcos

general.quote: The great omission in American life is solitude; not loneliness, for this is an alienation that thrives most in the midst of crowds, but that zone of time and space, free from the outside pressures, which is the incubator of the spirit.
general.author: marya mannes

general.quote: But on the first day came veiled spirits from all hours into his soul… a soft intoxication, which the atmosphere of nature, like that of a wine-store, communicated to him, spread itself, like an enchanted solitude around his soul.
general.author: jean paul friedrich richter

general.quote: Solitude never hurt anyone. Emily Dickinson lived alone, and she wrote some of the most beautiful poetry the world has ever known… then went crazy as a loon.
general.author: matt groening

general.quote: We live in a very tense society. We are pulled apart… and we all need to learn how to pull ourselves together…. I think that at least part of the answer lies in solitude.
general.author: helen hayes

general.quote: To most people loneliness is a doom. Yet loneliness is the very thing which God has chosen to be one of the schools of training for His very own. It is the fire that sheds the dross and reveals the gold.
general.author: bernard m. martin

general.quote: True solitude is a din of birdsong, seething leaves, whirling colors, or a clamor of tracks in the snow.
general.author: edward hoagland

general.quote: I’m not anti-social. I’m pro-solitude.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: The eternal quest of the human being is to shatter his loneliness.
general.author: norman cousins

general.quote: When people are lonely they stoop to any companionship.
general.author: lew wallace

general.quote: No one ever discovers the depths of his own loneliness.
general.author: georges bernanos

general.quote: The world loves a spice of wickedness.
general.author: henry wadsworth longfellow

general.quote: There is wickedness in the intention of wickedness, even though it be not perpetrated in the act.
general.author: marcus t. cicero

general.quote: There is a method in man’s wickedness; it grows up by degrees.
general.author: francis beaumont

general.quote: Few are so wicked as to take delight in crimes unprofitable.
general.author: john dryden

general.quote: Wickedness is a wonderfully diligent architect of misery, of shame, accompanied with terror, and commotion, and remorse, and endless perturbation.
general.author: plutarch

general.quote: We can never be grieved for their miseries who are thoroughly wicked, and have thereby justly called their calamities on themselves.
general.author: john dryden

general.quote: There are wicked people who would be much less dangerous if they were totally without goodness.
general.author: francois de la rochefoucauld

general.quote: Our goodness comes solely from thinking on goodness; our wickedness from thinking on wickedness. We too are the victims of our own contemplation.
general.author: john jay chapman

general.quote: To see and listen to the wicked is already the beginning of wickedness.
general.author: confucius

general.quote: This is the very worst wickedness, that we refuse to acknowledge the passionate evil that is in us. This makes us secret and rotten.
general.author: david herbert lawrence

general.quote: What is their potential for evil; what is their potential for wickedness? That’s the only time that those characters become interesting to watch.
general.author: jennifer beals

general.quote: Hint at the existence of wickedness in a light, easy, and agreeable manner, so that nobody’s fine feelings may be offended.
general.author: william makepeace thackeray

general.quote: Tolerating evil leads only to more evil. And when good people stand by and do nothing while wickedness reigns, their communities will be consumed.
general.author: bob riley

general.quote: No wickedness proceeds on any grounds of reason.
general.author: titus livy

general.quote: Doubtless the world is wicked enough; but it will not be improved by the extension of a spirit which self-righteously sees more to reform outside of itself than in itself.
general.author: josiah gilbert holland

general.quote: It is a statistical fact that the wicked work harder to reach hell than the righteous do to enter heaven.
general.author: henry wheeler shaw

general.quote: You may be as orthodox as the devil and as wicked.
general.author: john wesley

general.quote: The wicked are always surprised to find that the good can be clever.
general.author: luc de clapiers de vauvenargues

general.quote: Peace and wickedness are far asunder.
general.author: benjamin stillingfleet

general.quote: The proposition that we should encourage wickedness and violence by exposing one side of the face to blows because we have been beaten on the other is too great an absurdity.
general.author: thomas mellon

general.quote: The wickedness of the few makes the calamity of the many.
general.author: publilius syrus

general.quote: I never wonder to see men wicked, but I often wonder to see them not ashamed.
general.author: jonathan swift

general.quote: It is no sin to be tempted; the wickedness lies in being overcome.
general.author: honore de balzac

general.quote: The doctor sees all the weakness of mankind; the lawyer all the wickedness, the theologian all the stupidity.
general.author: arthur schopenhauer

general.quote: The disposition to do a bad deed is the most terrible punishment of the deed it does.
general.author: charles arundell st. john-mildmay

general.quote: The belief in a supernatural source of evil is not necessary; men alone are quite capable of every wickedness.
general.author: joseph conrad

general.quote: Human blunders usually do more to shape history than human wickedness.
general.author: a. j. p. taylor

general.quote: God has sometimes converted wickedness into madness; and it is to the credit of human reason that men who are not in some degree mad are never capable of being in the highest degree wicked.
general.author: edmund burke

general.quote: Melancholy and sadness are the start of doubt… doubt is the beginning of despair; despair is the cruel beginning of the differing degrees of wickedness.
general.author: isidore ducasse lautreamont

general.quote: Wickedness resides in the very hesitation about an act, even though it be not perpetrated.
general.author: cicero

general.quote: One man’s wickedness may easily become all men’s curse.
general.author: publilius syrus

general.quote: The majority is wicked.
general.author: bias of priene

general.quote: For never, never wicked man was wise.
general.author: alexander pope

general.quote: What rein can bold licentious wickedness, when down the hill he holds his fierce career?
general.author: william shakespeare

general.quote: In morals what begins in fear usually ends in wickedness; in religion what begins in fear usually ends in fanaticism. Fear, either as a principle or a motive, is the beginning of all evil.
general.author: anna jameson

general.quote: Such are the heights of wickedness to which men are driven by religion.
general.author: lucretius

general.quote: War contains so much folly, as well as wickedness, that much is to be hoped from the progress of reason.
general.author: james madison

general.quote: Wickedness may well b compared to a bottomless pit, into which it is easier to keep one’s self from falling, then, being fallen, to give one’s self any stay from falling infinitely.
general.author: sir philip sidney

general.quote: Wickedness is a myth invented by good people to account for the curious attraction of others.
general.author: oscar wilde

general.quote: Wickedness is its own punishment.
general.author: francis quarles

general.quote: Wickedness is a kind of voluntary frenzy, and a chosen distraction.
general.author: john tillotson

general.quote: Was ever any wicked man free from the stings of a guilty conscience?
general.author: john tillotson

general.quote: In wickedness of pride is lost the light to understand how little grace is earned and how much given.
general.author: robert hunter

general.quote: There’s a method in man’s wickedness; it grows up by degrees.
general.author: francis beaumont and john fletcher

general.quote: Do not be deceived; happiness and enjoyment do not lie in wicked ways.
general.author: isaac watts

general.quote: It is right noble to fight with wickedness and wrong; the mistake is in supposing that spiritual evil can be overcome by physical means.
general.author: lydia m. child

general.quote: Foolishness is indeed the sister of wickedness.
general.author: sophocles

general.quote: The sun also shines on the wicked.
general.author: marcus annaeus seneca

general.quote: God bears with the wicked, but not forever.
general.author: miguel de cervantes

general.quote: Wickedness may prosper for a while.
general.author: sir roger l’estrange

general.quote: There is no dignity in wickedness, whether in purple or rags; and hell is a democracy of devils, where all are equals.
general.author: herman melville

general.quote: It is less to suffer punishment than to deserve it.
general.author: ovid

general.quote: Capital punishment is as fundamentally wrong as a cure for crime as charity is wrong as a cure for poverty.
general.author: henry ford

general.quote: Let the punishment be equal with the offence.
general.author: cicero

general.quote: The idea that the sole aim of punishment is to prevent crime is obviously grounded upon the theory that crime can be prevented, which is almost as dubious as the notion that poverty can be prevented.
general.author: henry louis mencken

general.quote: Distrust everyone in whom the impulse to punish is powerful!
general.author: friedrich nietzsche

general.quote: Punishment is a fruit that, unsuspected, ripens within the flower of the pleasure that concealed it.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson

general.quote: Prisons don’t rehabilitate, they don’t punish, they don’t protect, so what the hell do they do?
general.author: jerry brown

general.quote: Many without punishment, none without sin.
general.author: john ray

general.quote: The time that precedes punishment is the severest part of it.
general.author: seneca

general.quote: Capital punishment would be more effective as a preventive measure if it were administered prior to the crime.
general.author: woody allen

general.quote: A variety in punishment is of utility, as well as a proportion.
general.author: george washington

general.quote: The punishment of criminals should be of use; when a man is hanged he is good for nothing.
general.author: voltaire

general.quote: It is as expedient that a wicked man be punished as that a sick man be cured by a physician; for all chastisement is a kind of medicine.
general.author: plato

general.quote: I hear much of people’s calling out to punish the guilty, but very few are concerned to clear the innocent.
general.author: daniel defoe

general.quote: There is no person so severely punished, as those who subject themselves to the whip of their own remorse.
general.author: marcus annaeus seneca

general.quote: If punishment reaches not the mind and makes not the will supple, it hardens the offender.
general.author: john locke

general.quote: Faults of the head are punished in this world, those of the heart in another; but as most of our vices are compound, so also is their punishment.
general.author: charles caleb colton

general.quote: Let those who have deserved their punishment, bear it patiently.
general.author: ovid

general.quote: There is no greater punishment of wickedness that that it is dissatisfied with itself and its deeds.
general.author: seneca

general.quote: Well, there’s no one at all, they do be saying, but is deserving of some punishment from the very minute of his birth.
general.author: lady gregory

general.quote: Punishment follows close on crime.
general.author: horace

general.quote: I should be very willing to redress men wrongs, and rather check than punish crimes, had not Cervantes, in that all too true tale of Quixote, shown how all such efforts fail.
general.author: lord byron

general.quote: Punishment is justice for the unjust.
general.author: st. augustine

general.quote: Punishment is the last and the least effective instrument in the hands of the legislator for the prevention of crime.
general.author: john ruskin

general.quote: If punishment makes not the will supple it hardens the offender.
general.author: john locke

general.quote: And Cain said unto the Lord, My punishment is greater than I can bear.
general.author: bible

general.quote: The public have more interest in the punishment of an injury than he who receives it.
general.author: cato

general.quote: The work of eradicating crimes is not by making punishment familiar, but formidable.
general.author: oliver goldsmith

general.quote: The sins committed by many pass unpunished.
general.author: lucanus

general.quote: Punishment, that is the justice for the unjust.
general.author: saint aurelius augustine

general.quote: The power of punishment is to silence, not to confute.
general.author: samuel johnson

general.quote: If he who breaks the law is not punished, he who obeys it is cheated. .
general.author: thomas szasz

general.quote: Don’t let us rejoice in punishment, even when the hand of God alone inflicts it. The best of us are but poor wretches, just saved from shipwreck. Can we feel anything but awe and pity when we see a fellow-passenger swallowed by the waves?
general.author: george eliot

general.quote: Corporal punishment is as humiliating for him who gives it as for him who receives it; it is ineffective besides. Neither shame nor physical pain have any other effect than a hardening one.
general.author: ellen key

general.quote: Care should be taken that the punishment does not exceed the guilt; and also that some men do not suffer for offenses for which others are not even indicted.
general.author: cicero

general.quote: There is no greater punishment than that of being abandoned to one’s self.
general.author: pasquier quesnel

general.quote: If the people be led by laws, and uniformity sought to be given them by punishments, they will try to avoid the punishment, but have no sense of shame.
general.author: confucius

general.quote: Though punishment be slow, still it comes.
general.author: george herbert

general.quote: Even legal punishments lose all appearance of justice, when too strictly inflicted on men compelled by the last extremity of distress to incur them.
general.author: junius

general.quote: In its function, the power to punish is not essentially different from that of curing or educating.
general.author: michel foucault

general.quote: Punishment is not for revenge, but to lessen crime and reform the criminal.
general.author: elizabeth fry

general.quote: The first and greatest punishment of the sinner is the conscience of sin.
general.author: marcus annaeus seneca

general.quote: The severest punishment a man can receive who has injured another, is to have committed the injury; and no man is more severely punished than he who is subject to the whip of his own repentance.
general.author: seneca

general.quote: Every great example of punishment has in it some injustice, but the suffering individual is compensated by the public good.
general.author: tacitus
