general.author: e. p. day

general.quote: The cold iron of neglect is sharper to a child’s sensitive nature than any alteration of harshness and affection.
general.author: annie edwards

general.quote: No man is well pleased to have his all neglected, be it ever so little.
general.author: samuel johnson

general.quote: Neglect is an insidious form of maltreatment. It starves the developing mind of stimulation. It denies the child information and interest about the self and others.
general.author: david howe

general.quote: A wise and salutary neglect.
general.author: edmund burke

general.quote: A little neglect may breed great mischief; for want of a nail the shoe was lost; for want of the shoe the horse was lost; for want of the horse the rider was lost–being overtaken and slain by an enemy–all for the want of care about a horse-shoe nail.
general.author: benjamin franklin

general.quote: We labour unceasingly to adorn and preserve this imaginary existence, and neglect the real.
general.author: blaise pascal

general.quote: His noble negligences teach, what others’ toils despair to reach.
general.author: matthew prior

general.quote: It will generally be found that men who are constantly lamenting their ill luck are only reaping the consequences of their own neglect, mismanagement, and improvidence, or want of application.
general.author: samuel smiles

general.quote: Neglect is enough to ruin a man; a man who is in business need not commit forgery or robbery to ruin himself; he has only to neglect his business, and his ruin is certain.
general.author: albert barnes

general.quote: The first instance of men’s neglect, is in their frequent absence from the church. There is no excuse so trivial, that will not pass upon some men’s consciences to excuse their attendance at the public worship of God.
general.author: jonathan swift

general.quote: Misunderstandings and neglect occasion more mischief in the world than even malice and wickedness.
general.author: johann wolfgang von goethe

general.quote: When loneliness is a constant state of being, it harkens back to a childhood wherein neglect and abandonment were the landscape of life.
general.author: alexandra katehakis

general.quote: The weak man who whines of neglect gives the sign of his own weakness.
general.author: ada isaacs menken

general.quote: My worst fears are realized–my husband’s neglect is occasioned by his love for another.
general.author: charles dickens

general.quote: It cannot be when the root is neglected that what springs from it will be well ordered.
general.author: confucius

general.quote: Very useless things we neglect, till they become old and useless enough to be put in Museums: and so very important things we study till, when they become important enough, we ignore them — and rightly.
general.author: samuel butler

general.quote: It takes two to make a murder. There are born victims, born to have their throats cut, as the cut-throats are born to be hanged.
general.author: aldous huxley

general.quote: After all, every murderer when he kills runs the risk of the most dreadful of deaths, whereas those who kill him risk nothing except promotion.
general.author: albert camus

general.quote: Cruel with guilt, and daring with despair, the midnight murderer bursts the faithless bar; invades the sacred hour of silent rest and leaves, unseen, a dagger in your breast.
general.author: samuel johnson

general.quote: I love the old way best, the simple way of poison, where we too are strong as men.
general.author: euripides

general.quote: Murder, like talent, seems occasionally to run in families.
general.author: george henry lewes

general.quote: Every murder turns on a bright hot light, and a lot of people have to walk out of the shadows.
general.author: mark hellinger

general.quote: Murder is always a mistake. One should never do anything that one cannot talk about after dinner.
general.author: oscar wilde

general.quote: A murderer is regarded by the conventional world as something almost monstrous, but a murderer to himself is only an ordinary man. It is only if the murderer is a good man that he can be regarded as monstrous.
general.author: graham greene

general.quote: If we believe that murder is wrong and not admissible in our society, then it has to be wrong for everyone, not just individuals but governments as well.
general.author: helen prejean

general.quote: Even in killing men, observe the rules of propriety.
general.author: confucius

general.quote: This is the law: blood spilt upon the ground cries out for more.
general.author: aeschylus

general.quote: When you have to kill a man it costs nothing to be polite.
general.author: winston churchill

general.quote: Kill one man, and you are a murderer. Kill millions of men, and you are a conqueror. Kill them all, and you are a god.
general.author: jean rostand

general.quote: It’s frightening how easy it is to commit murder in America. Just a drink too much. I can see myself doing it. In England, one feels all the social restraints holding one back. But here, anything can happen.
general.author: w. h. auden

general.quote: Killing is not nearly as easy as the innocent believe.
general.author: j. k. rowling

general.quote: Murder is unique in that it abolishes the party it injures, so that society has to take the place of the victim and on his behalf demand atonement or grant forgiveness; it is the one crime in which society has a direct interest.
general.author: w.h. auden

general.quote: Murder is an inherently evil act, no matter what the circumstances, no matter how convincing the rationalizations.
general.author: bentley little

general.quote: It’s only in love and in murder that we still remain sincere.
general.author: friedrich dürrenmatt

general.quote: In every pang that rends the heart the Man of Sorrows has a part.
general.author: michael bruce

general.quote: Earth has no sorrow that Heaven cannot heal.
general.author: thomas moore

general.quote: Sorrows are like thunderclouds, in the distance they look black, over our heads scarcely gray.
general.author: jean paul richter

general.quote: The natural effect of sorrow over the dead is to refine and elevate the mind.
general.author: washington irving

general.quote: What an insidious drug memory can be. Especially the memory of unhappiness.
general.author: horace holley

general.quote: And almost everyone when age, disease, or sorrows strike him, inclines to think there is a God, or something very like him.
general.author: arthur hugh clough

general.quote: Joy’s recollection is no longer joy, while Sorrow’s memory is a sorrow still.
general.author: lord byron

general.quote: The sorrows and disasters of Europe always brought fortune to America.
general.author: stephen b. leacock

general.quote: Joys impregnate. Sorrows bring forth.
general.author: william blake

general.quote: We should feel sorrow, but not sink under its oppression.
general.author: confucius quotes

general.quote: A great sorrow, like a mariner’s quadrant, brings the sun at noon down to the horizon, and we learn where we are on the sea of life.
general.author: henry wadsworth longfellow

general.quote: Excessive sorrow laughs. Excessive joy weeps.
general.author: william blake

general.quote: Our comforts come from God; our sorrows, from ourselves.
general.author: ivan panin

general.quote: We tell our triumphs to the crowds, but our own hearts are the sole confidants of our sorrows.
general.author: edward g. bulwer-lytton

general.quote: The lives of happy people are dense with their own doings — crowded, active, thick. But the sorrowing are nomads, on a plain with few landmarks and no boundaries; sorrow’s horizons are vague and its demands are few.
general.author: larry mcmurtry

general.quote: The cure for sorrow is to learn something.
general.author: barbara sher

general.quote: There is something in sorrow more akin to the course of human affairs than joy.
general.author: c. fitzhugh

general.quote: Cares are often more difficult to throw off than sorrows; the latter die with time, the former grow.
general.author: jean paul richter

general.quote: Sorrow makes for sincerity, I think.
general.author: tennessee williams

general.quote: Sorrow may be a good thing for a woman’s heart, but it is a poor cosmetic for her face.
general.author: austin o’malley

general.quote: There is this difference between the grief of youth and that of old age: youth’s burden is lightened by as much of it as another shares; old age may give and give, but the sorrow remains the same.
general.author: o. henry

general.quote: There is no despair so absolute as that which comes with the first moments of our first great sorrow, when we have not yet known what it is to have suffered and be healed, to have despaired and to have recovered hope.
general.author: george eliot

general.quote: Bear and endure: This sorrow will one day prove to be for your good.
general.author: ovid

general.quote: Sadness does not inhere in things; it does not reach us from the world and through mere contemplation of the world. It is a product of our own thought. We create it out of whole cloth.
general.author: emile durkheim

general.quote: Pure and complete sorrow is as impossible as pure and complete joy.
general.author: leo tolstoy quotes

general.quote: Sorrow like rain makes roses and mud.
general.author: austin o’malley

general.quote: Sorrow is tranquility remembered in emotion.
general.author: dorothy parker

general.quote: It is foolish to tear one’s hair in grief, as though sorrow would be made less with baldness.
general.author: marcus t. cicero

general.quote: Every heart has its secret sorrows which the world knows not, and oftentimes we call a man cold, when he is only sad.
general.author: henry wadsworth longfellow

general.quote: Trouble comes to us all in this life: we set our hearts on things which it isn’t God’s will for us to have, and then we go sorrowing.
general.author: george eliot

general.quote: The path of sorrow and that path alone, leads to a land where sorrow is unknown.
general.author: william cowper

general.quote: There is no wisdom in useless and hopeless sorrow, but there is something in it so like virtue, that he who is wholly without it cannot be loved.
general.author: samuel johnson

general.quote: Melancholy and sadness are the start of doubt… doubt is the beginning of despair; despair is the cruel beginning of the differing degrees of wickedness.
general.author: comte de lautreamont, isidore ducasse

general.quote: Jesus, Buddha, Mohammed, great as each may be, their highest comfort given to the sorrowful is a cordial introduction into another’s woe. Sorrow’s the great community in which all men born of woman are members at one time or another.
general.author: sean o’casey

general.quote: Some sorrows are but footprints in the snow, which the genial sun effaces, or, if it does not wholly efface, changes into dimples.
general.author: henry ward beecher

general.quote: Pain and fear and hunger are effects of causes which can be foreseen and known: but sorrow is a debt which someone else makes for us.
general.author: freya stark

general.quote: In my dream, I was drowning my sorrows, but my sorrows they’d learned to swim.
general.author: u2

general.quote: The pleasure that is in sorrow is sweeter than the pleasure of pleasure itself.
general.author: percy bysshe shelley

general.quote: Sorrow has produced more melody than mirth.
general.author: c. fitzhugh

general.quote: The keenest sorrow is to recognize ourselves as the sole cause of all our adversities.
general.author: sophocles

general.quote: True sorrow is as rare as true love.
general.author: stephen king

general.quote: The busy have no time for tears.
general.author: lord byron

general.quote: Sorrow is knowledge, those that know the most must mourn the deepest, the tree of knowledge is not the tree of life.
general.author: lord byron

general.quote: Only one-fourth of the sorrow in each man’s life is caused by outside uncontrollable elements, the rest is self-imposed by failing to analyze and act with calmness.
general.author: george holbrook jackson

general.quote: Sorrow is how we learn to love. Your heart isn’t breaking. It hurts because it’s getting larger. The larger it gets, the more love it holds.
general.author: rita mae brown

general.quote: Sorrow makes us all children again, destroys all differences of intellect. The wisest knows nothing.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson quotes

general.quote: In this sad world of ours sorrow comes to all, and to the young it comes with bittered agony because it takes them unawares. The older have learned to expect it.
general.author: abrahm lincoln quotes

general.quote: When sorrows come, they come not single spies, but in battalions.
general.author: william shakespeare quotes

general.quote: Sorrow is the rust of the soul and activity will cleanse and brighten it.
general.author: samuel johnson quotes

general.quote: Sorrow and silence are strong, and patient endurance is godlike.
general.author: henry wadsworth longfellow

general.quote: There is pleasure in calm remembrance of a past sorrow.
general.author: marcus t. cicero

general.quote: Life’s joys and sorrows meet us every day, but some are blinded by their tears of sorrow and see no joy.
general.author: s.moore

general.quote: Sorrow is a kind of rust of the soul, which every new idea contributes in its passage to scour away. It is the putrefaction of stagnant life, and is remedied by exercise and motion.
general.author: samuel johnson quotes

general.quote: One drop of sorrow heals the troubled heart more than a thousand tongues of consolation.
general.author: robert leighton

general.quote: Sorrows are gardeners: they plant flowers along waste places, and teach vines to cover barren heaps.
general.author: henry ward beecher

general.quote: Two thirds of all sorrow is homemade and, so far as the universe is concerned, unnecessary.
general.author: aldous huxley

general.quote: True merit is like a river, the deeper it is, the less noise it makes.
general.author: edward f. halifax

general.quote: Trees love to toss and sway; they make such happy noises.
general.author: emily carr

general.quote: The world is never quiet, even its silence eternally resounds with the same notes, in vibrations which escape our ears. As for those that we perceive, they carry sounds to us, occasionally a chord, never a melody.
general.author: albert camus

general.quote: The English may not like music, but they absolutely love the noise it makes.
general.author: sir thomas beecham

general.quote: Ten people who speak make more noise than ten thousand who are silent.
general.author: napoleon bonaparte

general.quote: Strategy without tactics is the slowest route to victory. Tactics without strategy is the noise before defeat.
general.author: sun tzu

general.quote: Quietness is the beginning of virtue. To be silent is to be beautiful. Stars do not make a noise.
general.author: james stephens

general.quote: People who make no noise are dangerous.
general.author: jean de la fontaine

general.quote: Of all the noises known to man, opera is the most expensive.
general.author: moliere

general.quote: Noise proves nothing. Often a hen who has merely laid an egg cackles as if she laid an asteroid.
general.author: mark twain

general.quote: Much outcry, little outcome.
general.author: aesop

general.quote: In antiquity there was only silence. In the nineteenth century, with the invention of the machine, Noise was born. Today, Noise triumphs and reigns supreme over the sensibility of men.
general.author: luigi russolo

general.quote: I would take a bomb, but I can’t stand the noise.
general.author: joe e. lewis

general.quote: I frequently hear music in the very heart of noise.
general.author: george gershwin

general.quote: He who sleeps in continual noise is wakened by silence.
general.author: william dean howells

general.quote: He who establishes his argument by noise and command shows that his reason is weak.
general.author: michel eyquem de montaigne

general.quote: All wrong-doing arises because of mind. If mind is transformed can wrong-doing remain?
general.author: buddha

general.quote: When women go wrong, men go right after them.
general.author: mae west

general.quote: Nine out of ten people who change their minds are wrong the second time too.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: If there is nothing wrong with me, maybe there’s something wrong with the universe.
general.author: dr. beverly crusher

general.quote: Never do wrong when people are looking.
general.author: mark twain

general.quote: All wrong doing is done in the sincere belief that it is the best thing to do.
general.author: arnold bennett

general.quote: You cannot do wrong without suffering wrong.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson

general.quote: Do not choose to be wrong for the sake of being different.
general.author: lord samuel

general.quote: I cannot wish the fault undone, the issue of it being so proper.
general.author: shakespeare

general.quote: When things go wrong, don’t go with them.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: No persons are more frequently wrong, than those who will not admit they are wrong.
general.author: francois de la rochefoucauld

general.quote: It is terrible to speak well and be wrong.
general.author: sophocles

general.quote: When people agree with me I always feel that I must be wrong.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: Law is intelligence, whose natural function it is to command right conduct and forbid wrong-doing.
general.author: marcus tullius

general.quote: When fear seizes, change what you are doing. You are doing something wrong.
general.author: jean craighead george

general.quote: Out beyond ideas of wrong-doing and rightdoing, there is a field. I will meet you there.
general.author: jalal ad-din rumi

general.quote: It takes less time to do a thing right than to explain why you did it wrong.
general.author: henry wadsworth longfellow

general.quote: If you can smile when things go wrong, you have someone in mind to blame.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: Thus to persist In doing wrong extenuates not wrong, But makes it much more heavy.
general.author: shakespeare

general.quote: I’d rather be strongly wrong than weakly right.
general.author: tallulah bankhead

general.quote: To live a creative life, we must lose our fear of being wrong.
general.author: joseph chilton pearce

general.quote: Get the facts, or the facts will get you. And when you get ’em, get ’em right, or they will get you wrong.
general.author: thomas fuller

general.quote: We are innocent of wrong-doing. We are attacked by unforeseeable forces come to harm us. We are, thus, innocent even of negligence. Though those forces are insuperable, chance will come to our aid and we shall emerge victorious.
general.author: david mamet

general.quote: There are no good girls gone wrong, just bad girls found out.
general.author: mae west

general.quote: If two people have only one thought between them, something is very wrong.
general.author: sarah jessica parker

general.quote: Logic is the art of going wrong with confidence.
general.author: joseph wood krutch

general.quote: The majority is always wrong; the minority is rarely right.
general.author: henrik ibsen

general.quote: If thy brother wrongs thee, remember not so much his wrong-doing, but more than ever that he is thy brother.
general.author: epictetus

general.quote: When everyone is against you, it means you are absolutely wrong — or you are absolutely right.
general.author: albert guinon

general.quote: Truth is always in harmony with herself, and is not concerned chiefly to reveal the justice that may consist with wrong-doing.
general.author: henry david thoreau

general.quote: Every woman is wrong until she cries, and then she is right; immediately.
general.author: sam slick

general.quote: Right or wrong, the customer is always right.
general.author: marshall field

general.quote: If you have behaved badly, repent, make what amends you can and address yourself to the task of behaving better next time. On no account brood over your wrong-doing.
general.author: aldus huxley

general.quote: Science must have originated in the feeling that something was wrong.
general.author: thomas carlyle

general.quote: I always thought that if I was popular I must be doing something wrong.
general.author: suzanne vega

general.quote: Singularity shows something wrong in the mind.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: If you can find something everyone agrees on, it’s wrong.
general.author: morris k. udall

general.quote: You have much more power when you are working for the right thing than when you are working for the wrong thing.
general.author: peace pilgrim

general.quote: If something is wrong, fix it if you can. But train yourself not to worry. Worry never fixes anything.
general.author: mary hemingway

general.quote: Post-Watergate morality, by which anything left private, is taken as presumptive evidence of wrong-doing.
general.author: charles krauthammer

general.quote: There are two sides to every question: my side and the wrong side.
general.author: oscar levant

general.quote: Wrong is wrong, no matter who does it or who says it.
general.author: malcolm x

general.quote: What wound did ever heal but my degrees?
general.author: william shakespeare

general.quote: A wound will perhaps become tolerable with length of time; but wounds which are raw shudder at the touch of the hands.
general.author: ovid

general.quote: The wound is for you, but the pain is for me.
general.author: charles ix

general.quote: It has been said that time heals all wounds. I don’t agree. The wounds remain. Time – the mind, protecting its sanity – covers them with some scar tissue and the pain lessens, but it is never gone.
general.author: rose kennedy

general.quote: It’s a shallow life that doesn’t give a person a few scars.
general.author: garrison keillor

general.quote: A wounded deer leaps the highest.
general.author: emily dickinson

general.quote: Laughter heals all wounds, and that’s one thing that everybody shares. No matter what you’re going through, it makes you forget about your problems. I think the world should keep laughing.
general.author: kevin hart

general.quote: Faithful are the wounds of a friend; but the kisses of an enemy are deceitful.
general.author: bible

general.quote: Turn your wounds into wisdom.
general.author: oprah winfrey

general.quote: The wounds of love can only be healed by the one who made them.
general.author: publilius syrus

general.quote: It is the false shame of fools to try to conceal wounds that have not healed.
general.author: horace

general.quote: Nobody likes having salt rubbed into their wounds, even if it is the salt of the earth.
general.author: rebecca west

general.quote: The soldier above all others prays for peace, for it is the soldier who must suffer and bear the deepest wounds and scars of war.
general.author: douglas macarthur

general.quote: All honor’s wounds are self-inflicted.
general.author: andrew carnegie

general.quote: In every community, there is work to be done. In every nation, there are wounds to heal. In every heart, there is the power to do it.
general.author: marianne williamson

general.quote: A man that studieth revenge keeps his own wounds green.
general.author: francis bacon

general.quote: I believe time wounds all heels.
general.author: john lennon

general.quote: Time wounds all heels.
general.author: jane sherwood ace

general.quote: We shall heal our wounds, collect our dead and continue fighting.
general.author: mao zedong

general.quote: Out of suffering have emerged the strongest souls; the most massive characters are seared with scars.
general.author: khalil gibran

general.quote: Love hurts, love scars, love wounds, and mars.
general.author: roy orbison

general.quote: You don’t learn from successes; you don’t learn from awards; you don’t learn from celebrity; you only learn from wounds and scars and mistakes and failures. And that’s the truth.
general.author: jane fonda

general.quote: Poetry heals the wounds inflicted by reason.
general.author: novalis

general.quote: I think scars are like battle wounds – beautiful, in a way. They show what you’ve been through and how strong you are for coming out of it.
general.author: demi lovato

general.quote: Better to die ten thousand deaths than wound my honor.
general.author: joseph addison

general.quote: There’s a lot of bitterness, there’s a lot of anger out there. We all have to work hard to heal those wounds.
general.author: allen boyd

general.quote: War is devastating, and it leaves its scars for generations.
general.author: james blunt

general.quote: Yes, we love peace, but we are not willing to take wounds for it, as we are for war.
general.author: john holmes

general.quote: But there are some wounds that can never be healed.
general.author: helen garner

general.quote: Scars show toughness: that you’ve been through it, and you’re still standing.
general.author: theo rossi

general.quote: Wounds turn into scars and scars make you tough.
general.author: aisha tyler

general.quote: There is always tension between the possibilities we aspire to and our wounded memories and past mistakes.
general.author: sean brady

general.quote: We should meet abuse by forbearance. Human nature is so constituted that if we take absolutely no notice of anger or abuse, the person indulging in it will soon weary of it and stop.
general.author: mahatma gandhi

general.quote: The only cure for contempt is counter-contempt.
general.author: h. l. mencken

general.quote: A fly may sting a stately horse and make him wince; but one is but an insect, and the other is a horse still.
general.author: samuel johnson

general.quote: Abuse a man unjustly, and you will make friends for him.
general.author: douglas horton

general.quote: We sleep safe in our beds because rough men stand ready in the night to visit violence on those who would do us harm.
general.author: george orwell

general.quote: All cruelty springs from weakness.
general.author: lucius annaeus seneca

general.quote: No one is to be called an enemy, all are your benefactors, and no one does you harm. You have no enemy except yourselves.
general.author: francis of assisi

general.quote: People who treat other people as less than human must not be surprised when the bread they have cast on the waters comes floating back to them, poisoned.
general.author: james baldwin

general.quote: I believe the root of all evil is abuse of power.
general.author: patricia cornwell

general.quote: Liberty may be endangered by the abuse of liberty, but also by the abuse of power.
general.author: james madison

general.quote: What I fear most is power with impunity. I fear abuse of power, and the power to abuse.
general.author: isabel allende

general.quote: If you can, help others; if you cannot do that, at least do not harm them.
general.author: dalai lama

general.quote: Any abuse of animals is the same as abuse of men, women, or children.
general.author: alison goldfrapp

general.quote: No business can stay in business without customers. How you treat – or mistreat – them determines how long your doors stay open.
general.author: harvey mackay

general.quote: There is no harm in repeating a good thing.
general.author: plato

general.quote: The greater the power, the more dangerous the abuse.
general.author: edmund burke

general.quote: A strength to harm is perilous in the hand of an ambitious head.
general.author: elizabeth i

general.quote: Nothing is so wearing as the possession or abuse of liberty.
general.author: emile m. cioran

general.quote: Once we know our weaknesses they cease to do us any harm.
general.author: georg c. lichtenberg

general.quote: Sustainability is no longer about doing less harm. It’s about doing more good.
general.author: jochen zeitz

general.quote: It’s not a slam at you when people are rude — it’s a slam at the people they’ve met before.
general.author: f. scott fitzgerald

general.quote: Pity is just another form of abuse.
general.author: michael j. fox

general.quote: The person who dumps garbage into your mind will do you considerably more harm than the person who dumps garbage on your floor, because each load of mind garbage negatively impacts your possibilities and lowers your expectations.
general.author: zig ziglar

general.quote: Kindness is the beginning of cruelty.
general.author: frank herbert

general.quote: Power without abuse loses its charm.
general.author: paul valery

general.quote: There are no necessary evils in government. Its evils exist only in its abuses.
general.author: andrew jackson

general.quote: The ultimate tragedy is not the oppression and cruelty by the bad people but the silence over that by the good people.
general.author: martin luther king, jr.

general.quote: A nation that mistreats its own citizens is more likely to mistreat its neighbours.
general.author: óscar arias

general.quote: War is cruelty. There is no use trying to reform it. The crueler it is, the sooner it will be over.
general.author: william tecumseh sherman

general.quote: Democracy is an abuse of statistics.
general.author: jorge luis borges

general.quote: It is always good men who do the most harm in the world.
general.author: henry adams

general.quote: Everything I do you blame on me.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: Some blames are actually praise, and some praises are actually blame.
general.author: francois de la rochefoucauld

general.quote: Whatever side I take, I know well that I will be blamed.
general.author: louis xiv

general.quote: People blame their environment. There is only one person to blame — and only one — themselves.
general.author: robert collier

general.quote: Our culture peculiarly honors the act of blaming, which it takes as the sign of virtue and intellect.
general.author: lionel trilling

general.quote: I praise loudly, I blame softly.
general.author: catherine ii of russia

general.quote: We live in a society that blames everybody else for what’s wrong.
general.author: max cannon

general.quote: There’s man all over for you, blaming on his boots the fault of his feet.
general.author: samuel beckett

general.quote: The easiest thing to do, whenever you fail, is to put yourself down by blaming your lack of ability for your misfortunes.
general.author: kenneth hildebrand

general.quote: God, Private Enterprise and government have made me what I am, and now they have to take some of the blame.
general.author: joy baluch

general.quote: When you blame others, you give up your power to change.
general.author: dr. robert anthony

general.quote: Ninety percent of politics is deciding whom to blame.
general.author: meg greenfield

general.quote: The superior man blames himself. The inferior man blames others.
general.author: don shula

general.quote: No blame should attach to telling the truth. But it does, it does.
general.author: anita brookner

general.quote: Take your life in your own hands and what happens? A terrible thing: no one is to blame.
general.author: erica jong

general.quote: Blame is safer than praise.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson

general.quote: Democracy is a process by which the people are free to choose the man who will get the blame.
general.author: laurence j. peter

general.quote: What fate can be worse than to know we have no one but ourselves to blame for our misfortunes!
general.author: sophocles

general.quote: Think how many blameless lives are brightened by the blazing indiscretions of other people.
general.author: saki

general.quote: Mistakes fail in their mission of helping the person who blames them on the other fellow.
general.author: henry s. haskins

general.quote: Luck’s always to blame.
general.author: jean de la fontaine

general.quote: A man can get discouraged many times but he is not a failure until he begins to blame somebody else and stops trying.
general.author: john burroughs

general.quote: A good leader takes a little more than his share of the blame, a little less than his share of the credit.
general.author: arnold h. glasgow

general.quote: If you can smile when things go wrong, you have someone in mind to blame.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: There can be no doubt that the average man blames much more than he praises. His instinct is to blame. If he is satisfied, he says nothing; if he is not, he most illogically kicks up a row.
general.author: arnold bennett

general.quote: When we blame, we give away our power.
general.author: greg anderson

general.quote: No one is to blame. It is neither their fault nor ours. It is the misfortune of being born when a whole world is dying.
general.author: alexander herzen

general.quote: The sad souls of those who lived without blame and without praise.
general.author: alighieri

general.quote: You can’t blame gravity for falling in love.
general.author: albert einstein

general.quote: In passing, also, I would like to say that the first time Adam had a chance he laid the blame on a woman.
general.author: lady nancy astor

general.quote: No one is a failure until they blame somebody else.
general.author: charles jones

general.quote: Do not blame anybody for your mistakes and failures.
general.author: bernard m. baruch

general.quote: All blame is a waste of time. No matter how much fault you find with another, and regardless of how much you blame him, it will not change you
general.author: wayne dyer

general.quote: There is no crime of which I do not deem myself capable.
general.author: johann wolfgang von goethe

general.quote: Crime in full glory consolidates authority by the sacred fear it inspires.
general.author: emil cioran

general.quote: Crime is a product of social excess.
general.author: nikolai vladimir ilyich lenin

general.quote: Great thieves punish little ones.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: For the credit of virtue we must admit that the greatest misfortunes of men are those into which they fall through their crimes.
general.author: francois duc de la rochefoucauld

general.quote: It becomes not a law-maker to be a law-breaker.
general.author: bias of priene

general.quote: Heaven takes care that no man secures happiness by crime.
general.author: vittorio alfieri

general.quote: Poverty is the mother of crime.
general.author: marcus aurelius

general.quote: Society prepares the crime; the criminal commits it.
general.author: henry thomas buckle

general.quote: Almost all crime is due to the repressed desire for aesthetic expression.
general.author: evelyn waugh

general.quote: Poverty is the parent of revolution and crime.
general.author: aristotle

general.quote: Every crime has, in the moment of its perpetration, its own avenging angel–dark misgiving, an ominous sinking at the inmost heart.
general.author: samuel taylor coleridge

general.quote: You are not to do evil that good may come of it.
general.author: legal maxim

general.quote: Whoever commits a crime strengthens his enemy.
general.author: daniel o’connell

general.quote: From a single crime know the nation.
general.author: virgil

general.quote: Many a man is saved from being a thief by finding everything locked up.
general.author: edgar watson howe

general.quote: If you share the crime of your friend, you make it your own.
general.author: syrus

general.quote: After all, crime is only a left-handed form of human endeavor.
general.author: john huston

general.quote: Crimes of which a people is ashamed constitute its real history. The same is true of man.
general.author: jean genet

general.quote: One crime is everything; two nothing.
general.author: dorothee deluzy

general.quote: Crime is terribly revealing. Try and vary your methods as you will, your tastes, your habits, your attitude of mind, and your soul is revealed by your actions.
general.author: agatha christie

general.quote: Crime expands according to our willingness to put up with it.
general.author: barry j. farber

general.quote: For centuries the death penalty, often accompanied by barbarous refinements, has been trying to hold crime in check; yet crime persists.
general.author: albert camus

general.quote: Crime is a fact of the human species, a fact of that specieas alone, but it is above all the secret aspect, impenetrable and hidden. Crime hides, and by far the most terrifying things are those which elude us.
general.author: georges bataille

general.quote: No crime has been without a precedent.
general.author: marcus annaeus seneca

general.quote: Man’s crimes are his worst enemies, following like shadows, till they drive his steps into the pit he dug.
general.author: creon

general.quote: I think crime pays. The hours are good, you meet a lot of interesting people, you travel a lot.
general.author: woody allen

general.quote: The common argument that crime is caused by poverty is a kind of slander on the poor.
general.author: henry louis mencken

general.quote: Many commit the same crimes with a very different result. One bears a cross for his crime; another a crown.
general.author: juvenal

general.quote: For whoever meditates a crime is guilty of the deed.
general.author: juvenal

general.quote: He who helps the guilty, shares the crime.
general.author: publilius syrus

general.quote: Responsibility prevents crimes.
general.author: edmund burke

general.quote: Crimes lead one into another; they who are capable of being forgers are capable of being incendiaries.
general.author: edmund burke

general.quote: Crime and bad lives are the measure of a State’s failure, all crime in the end is the crime of the community.
general.author: h.g. wells

general.quote: When a doctor does go wrong he is the first of criminals. He has nerve and he has knowledge.
general.author: sir arthur conan doyle

general.quote: Crimes sometimes shock us too much; vices almost always too little.
general.author: augustus william hare

general.quote: If we were brought to trial for the crimes we have committed against ourselves, few would escape the gallows.
general.author: paul eldridge

general.quote: Every crime is born of necessity. If you want less crime, you must change the conditions. Poverty makes crime. Want, rags, crusts, misfortune — all these awake the wild beast in man, and finally he takes, and takes contrary to law, and becomes a criminal.
general.author: robert ingersoll

general.quote: Crime is a logical extension of the sort of behaviour that is often considered perfectly respectable in legitimate business.
general.author: robert rice

general.quote: Crime is naught but misdirected energy.
general.author: emma goldman

general.quote: From each crime are born bullets that will one day seek out in you where the heart lies.
general.author: pablo neruda

general.quote: The crime and not the scaffold makes the shame.
general.author: pierre corneille

general.quote: Crime has always been a regrettably consistent element of the human experience.
general.author: mark frost

general.quote: Crime is as much a condition as an intention.
general.author: lewis f. korns

general.quote: He who does not prevent a crime when he can, encourages it.
general.author: seneca

general.quote: Crimes, like virtues, are their own rewards.
general.author: george farquhar

general.quote: Small crimes always precede great ones.
general.author: jean racine

general.quote: What is crime amongst the multitude, is only vice among the few.
general.author: benjamin disraeli

general.quote: While crime is punished it yet increases.
general.author: seneca

general.quote: There is a heroism in crime as well as in virtue. Vice and infamy have their altars and their religion.
general.author: william hazlitt

general.quote: There are crimes which become innocent and even glorious through their splendor, number and excess.
general.author: francois de la rochefoucauld

general.quote: Those magistrates who can prevent crime, and do not, in effect encourage it.
general.author: cato

general.quote: Crime, when it succeeds, is called virtue.
general.author: marcus annaeus seneca

general.quote: The greatest crimes are caused by surfeit, not by want.
general.author: aristotle

general.quote: Organized crime constitutes nothing less than a guerrilla war against society.
general.author: lyndon baines johnson

general.quote: There is no such crime as a crime of thought; there are only crimes of action.
general.author: clarence darrow

general.quote: Crime is to man as fleas are to dog, the likelihood of its presence increases as the quality of one’s personal circumstances decreases.
general.author: jerome p. crabb

general.quote: Commit a crime and the world is made of glass. Commit a crime, and it seems as if a coat of snow fell on the ground, such as reveals in the woods the track of every partridge and fox and squirrel and mole.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson

general.quote: Not failure, but low aim, is crime.
general.author: james russell lowell

general.quote: Criminals are dumb as stumps. If they were smart they could go be investment bankers. Or judges.
general.author: black jack point

general.quote: He has committed the crime who profits by it.
general.author: marcus annaeus seneca

general.quote: The tears of those repenting are the wine of angels.
general.author: st. bernard

general.quote: In art there are tears that lie too deep for thought.
general.author: louis kronenberger

general.quote: Only to have a grief equal to all these tears!
general.author: adrienne rich

general.quote: And God shall wipe away all tears from their eyes; and there shall be no more death, neither sorrow nor crying, neither shall there be any more pain.
general.author: bible

general.quote: Whatever tears one may shed, in the end one always blows one’s nose.
general.author: heinrich heine

general.quote: No more tears now; I will think upon revenge.
general.author: mary stuart

general.quote: In youth one has tears without grief, in old age grief without tears.
general.author: jean paul richter

general.quote: For women’s tears are but the sweat of eyes.
general.author: juvenal

general.quote: Tears such as angels weep.
general.author: john milton

general.quote: Shining through tears, like April suns in showers, that labor to overcome the cloud that loads em.
general.author: thomas otway

general.quote: Through reconciliation, streams of tears will come to our eyes.
general.author: jean-bertrand aristide

general.quote: Tears may be dried up, but the heart never.
general.author: margaret valois

general.quote: Love is a smoke made with the fume of sighs. Being purged, a fire sparkling in lovers eyes. Being vexed, a sea nourished with lovers tears. What is it else? A madness most discreet, a choking gall and a preserving sweet.
general.author: william shakespeare

general.quote: Pearls mean tears.
general.author: doris lessing

general.quote: Let a man accept his destiny. No pity and no tears.
general.author: euripides

general.quote: Every woman is wrong until she cries, and then she is right; immediately.
general.author: sam slick

general.quote: There is a sacredness in tears. They are not the mark of weakness, but of power. They speak more eloquently than ten thousand tongues. They are the messengers of overwhelming grief, of deep contrition, and of unspeakable love.
general.author: washington irving

general.quote: Tears are the silent language of grief.
general.author: voltaire quotes

general.quote: It is only the women whose eyes have been washed clear with tears who get the broad vision that makes them little sisters to all the world.
general.author: dorothy dix

general.quote: Tears are the silent language of grief.
general.author: voltaire

general.quote: Time engraves our faces with all the tears we have not shed.
general.author: natalie clifford barney

general.quote: Tears are the summer showers to the soul.
general.author: alfred austin

general.quote: Tears are the symbol of the inability of the soul to restrain its emotion and retain its self command.
general.author: henri frederic amiel

general.quote: I have nothing to offer but blood, toil, tears and sweat.
general.author: winston churchill

general.quote: Delicious tears! The heart’s own dew.
general.author: letitia elizabeth landon

general.quote: Tears of joy are like the summer rain drops pierced by sunbeams.
general.author: hosea ballou

general.quote: There are times when God asks nothing of his children except silence, patience and tears.
general.author: c. s. robinson

general.quote: Music should strike fire from the heart of man, and bring tears form the eyes of woman.
general.author: ludwig van beethoven

general.quote: Many shed tears merely for show, and have dry eyes when no one’s around to observe them.
general.author: marcus annaeus seneca

general.quote: Only eyes washed by tears can see clearly.
general.author: louis l. mann

general.quote: My tears of love are a waste of time if I turn away.
general.author: kim wilde

general.quote: The busy have no time for tears.
general.author: lord byron

general.quote: Tears are the natural penalties of pleasure. It is a law that we should pay for all that we enjoy.
general.author: william gilmore simms

general.quote: Tears are nature’s lotion for the eyes. The eyes see better for being washed by them.
general.author: john christian bovee

general.quote: Oh eyes, no eyes, but fountains fraught with tears; O life, no life, but lively form of death; Oh world, no world, but mass of public wrongs.
general.author: thomas kyd

general.quote: Tearless grief bleeds inwardly.
general.author: john christian bovee

general.quote: Tears shed for self are tears of weakness, but tears shed for others are a sign of strength.
general.author: billy graham

general.quote: We know God wipes away all tears, but it certainly feels good when He uses human hands.
general.author: mary paulson-lauda

general.quote: Tears mess up your makeup.
general.author: julia child

general.quote: Whoever blushes confesses guilt, true innocence never feels shame.
general.author: jean jacques rousseau

general.quote: Where all are guilty, no one is; confessions of collective guilt are the best possible safeguard against the discovery of culprits, and the very magnitude of the crime the best excuse for doing nothing.
general.author: hannah arendt

general.quote: When guilt is in its blush of infancy, it trembles in a tenderness of shame; and the first eye that pierces through the veil that hides the secret brings it to the face.
general.author: thomas southerne

general.quote: What we call real estate–the solid ground to build a house on–is the broad foundation on which nearly all the guilt of this world rests.
general.author: nathaniel hawthorne

general.quote: Those who guilt stains it equals.
general.author: lucanus

general.quote: They whose guilt within their bosom lies, imagine every eye beholds their blame.
general.author: william shakespeare

general.quote: The sin lessens in human estimation only as the guilt increases.
general.author: johann christoph friedrich von schiller

general.quote: The Negro needs the white man to free him from his fears. The white man needs the Negro to free him from his guilt.
general.author: martin luther king jr.

general.quote: The more sinful and guilty a person tends to feel, the less chance there is that he will be a happy, healthy, or law-abiding citizen. He will become a compulsive wrong-doer.
general.author: dr. albert ellis

general.quote: The mind of guilt is full of scorpions.
general.author: william shakespeare

general.quote: The innocent are free from fear, but the guilty always the dread of punishment before their eyes.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: The guilty mind debases the great image that it wears, and levels us with brutes.
general.author: william havard

general.quote: The guilt being great, the fear doth still exceed.
general.author: william shakespeare

general.quote: The greatest incitement to guilt is the hope of sinning with impunity.
general.author: cicero

general.quote: The ghostly consciousness of wrong.
general.author: thomas carlyle

general.quote: The fearful face usually betrays great guilt.
general.author: seneca

general.quote: Suspicion always haunts the guilty mind; the thief doth fear each bush an officer.
general.author: william shakespeare

general.quote: Sin, guilt, neurosis — they are one and the same, the fruit of the tree of knowledge.
general.author: henry miller

general.quote: Shame and guilt are noble emotions essential in the maintenance of civilized society, and vital for the development of some of the most refined and elegant qualities of human potential.
general.author: willard gaylen

general.quote: Seek to make a person blush for their guilt rather than shed their blood.
general.author: publius cornelius tacitus

general.quote: Saints should always be judged guilty until they are proved innocent.
general.author: george orwell

general.quote: Nothing is more wretched that the mind of a man conscious of guilt.
general.author: plautus

general.quote: My hands are guilty, but my heart is free.
general.author: john dryden

general.quote: My guiding principle is this: Guilt is never to be doubted.
general.author: franz kafka

general.quote: Life without industry is guilt. Industry without Art is Brutality.
general.author: john ruskin

general.quote: Let wickedness escape as it may at the bar, it never fails of doing justice upon itself; for every guilty person is his own hangman.
general.author: seneca

general.quote: Let no guilty man escape, if it can be avoided. No personal consideration should stand in the way of performing a public duty.
general.author: ulysses simpson grant

general.quote: It is more dangerous that even a guilty person should be punished without the forms of law than that he should escape.
general.author: thomas jefferson

general.quote: It is easy to defend the innocent; but who is eloquent enough to defend the guilty?
general.author: syrus

general.quote: It is criminal to steal a purse, daring to steal a fortune, a mark of greatness to steal a crown. The blame diminishes as the guilt increases.
general.author: johann friedrich von schiller

general.quote: It is better that ten guilty persons escape than one innocent suffer.
general.author: sir william blackstone

general.quote: If you commit a crime, you’re guilty.
general.author: rush limbaugh

general.quote: I hear much of people’s calling out to punish the guilty, but very few are concerned to clear the innocent.
general.author: daniel defoe

general.quote: I am having so much fun performing, I feel almost guilty. I think, my God, I hope no one comes and busts me for this.
general.author: david crosby

general.quote: How glowing guilt exalts the keen delight!
general.author: alexander pope

general.quote: He who flees from trial confesses his guilt.
general.author: syrus

general.quote: He that is conscious of guilt cannot bear the innocence of others: So they will try to reduce all others to their own level.
general.author: charles james fox

general.quote: He that commits a sin shall find the pressing guilt lie heavy on his mind.
general.author: thomas creech

general.quote: He is not guilty who is not guilty of his own free will.
general.author: seneca

general.quote: Guilt’s a terrible thing.
general.author: ben jonson

general.quote: Guiltiness will speak, though tongues were out of use.
general.author: william shakespeare

general.quote: Guilt was never a rational thing; it distorts all the faculties of the human mind, it perverts them, it leaves a man no longer in the free use of his reason, it puts him into confusion.
general.author: edmund burke

general.quote: Guilt soon learns to lie.
general.author: mary elizabeth braddon

general.quote: Guilt once harbored in the conscious breast, intimidates the brave, degrades the great.
general.author: samuel johnson

general.quote: Guilt is the source of sorrows, the avenging fiend that follows us behind with whips and stings.
general.author: nicholas rowe

general.quote: Guilt is present in the very hesitation, even though the deed be not committed.
general.author: cicero

general.quote: Guilt is perhaps the most painful companion of death.
general.author: elisabeth kubler-ross

general.quote: Guilt is ever at a loss, and confusion waits upon it.
general.author: william congreve

general.quote: Guilt is always jealous.
general.author: john ray

general.quote: Guilt is a timorous thing ere perpetration; despair alone makes guilty men be bold.
general.author: samuel taylor coleridge

general.quote: Guilt is a spiritual Rubicon.
general.author: jane porter

general.quote: Guilt has very quick ears to an accusation.
general.author: henry fielding

general.quote: Glory, built on selfish principles, is shame and guilt.
general.author: william cowper

general.quote: Forbear to lay the guilt of a few on the many.
general.author: ovid

general.quote: Every man is guilty of all the good he didn’t do.
general.author: voltaire

general.quote: Every guilty person is his own hangman.
general.author: marcus annaeus seneca

general.quote: By working hard, you get to play hard, guilt-free.
general.author: jim rohn

general.quote: Whoever blushes confesses guilt, true innocence never feels shame.
general.author: jean jacques rousseau

general.quote: Where all are guilty, no one is; confessions of collective guilt are the best possible safeguard against the discovery of culprits, and the very magnitude of the crime the best excuse for doing nothing.
general.author: hannah arendt

general.quote: When guilt is in its blush of infancy, it trembles in a tenderness of shame; and the first eye that pierces through the veil that hides the secret brings it to the face.
general.author: thomas southerne

general.quote: What we call real estate–the solid ground to build a house on–is the broad foundation on which nearly all the guilt of this world rests.
general.author: nathaniel hawthorne

general.quote: Those who guilt stains it equals.
general.author: lucanus

general.quote: They whose guilt within their bosom lies, imagine every eye beholds their blame.
general.author: william shakespeare

general.quote: The sin lessens in human estimation only as the guilt increases.
general.author: johann christoph friedrich von schiller

general.quote: The Negro needs the white man to free him from his fears. The white man needs the Negro to free him from his guilt.
general.author: martin luther king jr.

general.quote: The more sinful and guilty a person tends to feel, the less chance there is that he will be a happy, healthy, or law-abiding citizen. He will become a compulsive wrong-doer.
general.author: dr. albert ellis

general.quote: The mind of guilt is full of scorpions.
general.author: william shakespeare

general.quote: The innocent are free from fear, but the guilty always the dread of punishment before their eyes.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: The guilty mind debases the great image that it wears, and levels us with brutes.
general.author: william havard

general.quote: The guilt being great, the fear doth still exceed.
general.author: william shakespeare

general.quote: The greatest incitement to guilt is the hope of sinning with impunity.
general.author: cicero

general.quote: The ghostly consciousness of wrong.
general.author: thomas carlyle

general.quote: The fearful face usually betrays great guilt.
general.author: seneca

general.quote: Suspicion always haunts the guilty mind; the thief doth fear each bush an officer.
general.author: william shakespeare

general.quote: Sin, guilt, neurosis — they are one and the same, the fruit of the tree of knowledge.
general.author: henry miller

general.quote: Shame and guilt are noble emotions essential in the maintenance of civilized society, and vital for the development of some of the most refined and elegant qualities of human potential.
general.author: willard gaylen

general.quote: Seek to make a person blush for their guilt rather than shed their blood.
general.author: publius cornelius tacitus

general.quote: Saints should always be judged guilty until they are proved innocent.
general.author: george orwell

general.quote: Nothing is more wretched that the mind of a man conscious of guilt.
general.author: plautus

general.quote: My hands are guilty, but my heart is free.
general.author: john dryden

general.quote: My guiding principle is this: Guilt is never to be doubted.
general.author: franz kafka

general.quote: Life without industry is guilt. Industry without Art is Brutality.
general.author: john ruskin

general.quote: Let wickedness escape as it may at the bar, it never fails of doing justice upon itself; for every guilty person is his own hangman.
general.author: seneca

general.quote: Let no guilty man escape, if it can be avoided. No personal consideration should stand in the way of performing a public duty.
general.author: ulysses simpson grant

general.quote: It is more dangerous that even a guilty person should be punished without the forms of law than that he should escape.
general.author: thomas jefferson

general.quote: It is easy to defend the innocent; but who is eloquent enough to defend the guilty?
general.author: syrus

general.quote: It is criminal to steal a purse, daring to steal a fortune, a mark of greatness to steal a crown. The blame diminishes as the guilt increases.
general.author: johann friedrich von schiller

general.quote: It is better that ten guilty persons escape than one innocent suffer.
general.author: sir william blackstone

general.quote: If you commit a crime, you’re guilty.
general.author: rush limbaugh

general.quote: I hear much of people’s calling out to punish the guilty, but very few are concerned to clear the innocent.
general.author: daniel defoe

general.quote: I am having so much fun performing, I feel almost guilty. I think, my God, I hope no one comes and busts me for this.
general.author: david crosby

general.quote: How glowing guilt exalts the keen delight!
general.author: alexander pope

general.quote: He who flees from trial confesses his guilt.
general.author: syrus

general.quote: He that is conscious of guilt cannot bear the innocence of others: So they will try to reduce all others to their own level.
general.author: charles james fox

general.quote: He that commits a sin shall find the pressing guilt lie heavy on his mind.
general.author: thomas creech

general.quote: He is not guilty who is not guilty of his own free will.
general.author: seneca

general.quote: Guilt’s a terrible thing.
general.author: ben jonson

general.quote: Guiltiness will speak, though tongues were out of use.
general.author: william shakespeare

general.quote: Guilt was never a rational thing; it distorts all the faculties of the human mind, it perverts them, it leaves a man no longer in the free use of his reason, it puts him into confusion.
general.author: edmund burke

general.quote: Guilt soon learns to lie.
general.author: mary elizabeth braddon

general.quote: Guilt once harbored in the conscious breast, intimidates the brave, degrades the great.
general.author: samuel johnson

general.quote: Guilt is the source of sorrows, the avenging fiend that follows us behind with whips and stings.
general.author: nicholas rowe

general.quote: Guilt is present in the very hesitation, even though the deed be not committed.
general.author: cicero

general.quote: Guilt is perhaps the most painful companion of death.
general.author: elisabeth kubler-ross

general.quote: Guilt is ever at a loss, and confusion waits upon it.
general.author: william congreve

general.quote: Guilt is always jealous.
general.author: john ray

general.quote: Guilt is a timorous thing ere perpetration; despair alone makes guilty men be bold.
general.author: samuel taylor coleridge

general.quote: Guilt is a spiritual Rubicon.
general.author: jane porter

general.quote: Guilt has very quick ears to an accusation.
general.author: henry fielding

general.quote: Glory, built on selfish principles, is shame and guilt.
general.author: william cowper

general.quote: Forbear to lay the guilt of a few on the many.
general.author: ovid

general.quote: Every man is guilty of all the good he didn’t do.
general.author: voltaire

general.quote: Every guilty person is his own hangman.
general.author: marcus annaeus seneca

general.quote: By working hard, you get to play hard, guilt-free.
general.author: jim rohn

general.quote: Beside one deed of guilt, how blest is guiltless woe!
general.author: edward george earle lytton bulwer-lytton

general.quote: All good men and women should be on their guard to avoid guilt, and even the suspicion of it.
general.author: plautus

general.quote: A guilty conscience never feels secure.
general.author: syrus

general.quote: A one-inch error at the start can be a thousand miles at the end.
general.author: chinese prsoverb

general.quote: Where there is much freedom there is much error.
general.author: johann friedrich von schiller

general.quote: A double error sometimes sets us right.
general.author: philip james bailey

general.quote: Without music, life would be an error. The German imagines even God singing songs
general.author: friedrich nietzsche

general.quote: It is human to err, but it is devilish to remain willfully in error.
general.author: st. augustine

general.quote: Nothing is more damaging to a new truth than an old error.
general.author: johann wolfgang von goethe

general.quote: The wise man corrects his own errors by observing those of others.
general.author: publilius syrus

general.quote: It is error only, and not truth, that shrinks from inquiry.
general.author: thomas paine

general.quote: There are some errors so sweet that we repent them only to bring them to memory.
general.author: jean-antoine petit-senn

general.quote: Man errs as long as he strives.
general.author: johann wolfgang von goethe

general.quote: There is no such source of error as the pursuit of truth.
general.author: samuel butler

general.quote: One cannot too soon forget his errors and misdemeanors; for to dwell upon them is to add to the offense.
general.author: henry david thoreau

general.quote: Failure is simply a few errors in judgment, repeated every day.
general.author: jim rohn

general.quote: Sometimes we may learn more from a man’s error than from his virtues.
general.author: henry wadsworth longfellow

general.quote: Admit your errors before someone else exaggerates them.
general.author: andrew v. mason

general.quote: An error is not a mistake until you refuse to correct it.
general.author: grenville kleiser

general.quote: Error is discipline through which we advance.
general.author: william ellery channing

general.quote: Error is just as important a condition of life as truth.
general.author: carl gustav jung

general.quote: Learn to distinguish the difference between errors of knowledge and breaches of morality.
general.author: ayn rand

general.quote: Truth will sooner come out of error than from confusion.
general.author: francis bacon

general.quote: If all else fails, immortality can always be assured by spectacular error.
general.author: john kenneth galbraith

general.quote: He is a thorough accountant who can cast up correctly the sum of his own errors.
general.author: eliza cook

general.quote: Error, by force of contrast, enhances the triumph of Truth.
general.author: marcel proust

general.quote: Knowledge is ancient error reflecting on its youth.
general.author: francis picabia

general.quote: The wisest of the wise may err.
general.author: aeschylus

general.quote: An error is the more dangerous in proportion to the degree of truth which it contains.
general.author: henri-frederic amiel

general.quote: Error, when she retraces her steps, has farther to go before she can arrive at truth than ignorance.
general.author: charles caleb colton

general.quote: It is not so difficult a task to plant new truths, as to root out old errors; for there is this paradox in men, they run after that which is new, but are prejudiced in favour of that which is old.
general.author: charles caleb colton

general.quote: No tempting form of error is without some latent charm derived from truth.
general.author: sir arthur keith

general.quote: Weeds are omnipresent; errors are to be found in the heart of the most lovable.
general.author: george sand

general.quote: From the errors of others, a wise man corrects his own.
general.author: syrus

general.quote: All men may err; but he that keepeth not his folly, but repenteth, doeth well; but stubbornness cometh to great trouble.
general.author: sophocles

general.quote: From error to error, one discovers the entire truth.
general.author: sigmund freud

general.quote: n error gracefully acknowledged is a victory won.
general.author: caroline l. gascoigne

general.quote: Any man can make mistakes, but only an idiot persists in his error.
general.author: marcus t. cicero

general.quote: Dark Error’s other hidden side is truth.
general.author: victor hugo

general.quote: The smallest errors are always the best.
general.author: moliere

general.quote: One error persisted in, frequently produces others.
general.author: samuel richardson

general.quote: All errors spring up in the neighborhood of some truth; they grow round about it, and, for the most part, derive their strength from such contiguity.
general.author: thomas binney

general.quote: Great errors seldom originate but with men of great minds.
general.author: francesco petrarch

general.quote: Love has no errors, for all errors are the want for love.
general.author: william law

general.quote: A man’s errors are what make him amiable.
general.author: johann wolfgang von goethe

general.quote: The broadest and most prevalent error requires the most disinterested virtue to sustain it.
general.author: henry david thoreau

general.quote: A man of genius makes no mistakes. His errors are volitional and are the portals of discovery.
general.author: james joyce

general.quote: Truth is a good dog; but beware of barking too close to the heels of an error, lest you get your brains kicked out.
general.author: samuel taylor coleridge

general.quote: There are errors which no wise man will treat with rudeness while there is a probability that they may be the refraction of some great truth still below the horizon.
general.author: samuel taylor coleridge

general.quote: Error is certainty’s constant companion. Error is the corollary of evidence. And anything said about truth may equally well be said about error: the delusion will be no greater.
general.author: louis aragon

general.quote: No one who lives in error is free.
general.author: euripides

general.quote: Admitting error clears the score, and proves you wiser than before.
general.author: arthur guiterman

general.quote: Error is always more busy than ignorance. Ignorance is a blank sheet on which we may write; but error is a scribbled one from which we must first erase.
general.author: charles caleb colton

general.quote: There is no original truth, only original error.
general.author: gaston bachelard

general.quote: Error is a hardy plant; it flourishes in every soil.
general.author: martin f. tupper

general.quote: Truth is immortal; error is mortal.
general.author: mary baker eddy

general.quote: To err is human, but to persevere in error is only the act of a fool.
general.author: marcus tullius cicero

general.quote: Error is always more busy than truth.
general.author: hosea ballou

general.quote: Give me a fruitful error anytime, full of seeds, bursting with its own corrections.
general.author: vilfredo pareto

general.quote: There is something to be said for every error; but, whatever may be said for it, the most important thing to be said about it is that it is erroneous.
general.author: g. k. chesterton

general.quote: Truly even he errs that is wiser than the wise.
general.author: aeschylus

general.quote: Error is sometimes so nearly allied to truth that it blends with it as imperceptibly as the colors of the rainbow fade into each other.
general.author: william benton clulow

general.quote: Error is ever talkative.
general.author: oliver goldsmith

general.quote: Who thinks it just to be judged by a single error?
general.author: beryl markham

general.quote: To free a person from error is to give, and not to take away.
general.author: arthur schopenhauer

general.quote: Errors to be dangerous must have a great deal of truth mingled with them. It is only from this alliance that they can ever obtain an extensive circulation.
general.author: sydney smith

general.quote: The noblest spirits are most sensible of the possibility of Error: and the weakest do most hardly lay down an Error.
general.author: benjamin whichcote

general.quote: I postpone death by living, by suffering, by error, by risking, by giving, by losing.
general.author: anais nin

general.quote: Do not be too severe upon the errors of the people, but reclaim them by enlightening them.
general.author: thomas jefferson

general.quote: In all science, error precedes the truth, and it is better it should go first than last.
general.author: sir hugh walpole

general.quote: Find earth where grows no weed, and you may find a heart wherein no error grows.
general.author: james sheridan knowles

general.quote: To err is human; to admit it, superhuman.
general.author: doug larson

general.quote: Football is a game of errors. The team that makes the fewest errors in a game usually wins.
general.author: paul brown

general.quote: Falsity cannot keep an idea from being beautiful; there are certain errors of such ingenuity that one could regret their not ranking among the achievements of the human mind.
general.author: jean rostand

general.quote: We are built to make mistakes, coded for error.
general.author: lewis thomas

general.quote: An error doesn’t become a mistake until you refuse to correct it.
general.author: orlando a. battista

general.quote: Honest error is to be pitied, not ridiculed.
general.author: philip dormer stanhope

general.quote: It is only an error of judgment to make a mistake, but it argues an infirmity of character to adhere to it when discovered.
general.author: christian nestell bovee

general.quote: To err is human, but it feels divine.
general.author: mae west

general.quote: If you don’t have a margin for error, error kills you.
general.author: s. m. stirling

general.quote: No mans error becomes his own Law; nor obliges him to persist in it.
general.author: thomas hobbes

general.quote: It is the nature of every person to error, but only the fool perseveres in error.
general.author: marcus t. cicero

general.quote: We are never so liable to fall into an error, as when we have just escaped from one.
general.author: norman macdonald

general.quote: All men are liable to error; and most men are, in many points, by passion or interest, under temptation to it.
general.author: john locke

general.quote: There are men who never err, because they never propose anything rational.
general.author: johann wolfgang von goethe

general.quote: An error gracefully acknowledged is a victory won.
general.author: caroline leigh gascoigne

general.quote: Every error is truth abused.
general.author: jacques benigue bossuet

general.quote: Knowledge rests not upon truth alone, but upon error also.
general.author: carl jung

general.quote: Error is worse than ignorance.
general.author: philip james bailey

general.quote: Nothing hurts a new truth more than an old error.
general.author: johann wolfgang von goethe

general.quote: Error is none the better for being common, nor truth the worse for having lain neglected.
general.author: john locke

general.quote: Look upon the errors of others in sorrow, not in anger.
general.author: henry wadsworth longfellow

general.quote: Mistakes are a fact of life it is the response to error that counts.
general.author: nikki giovanni

general.quote: Let the answers be wrong, let the philosophy be mistaken — errors are more valuable than truths: truth is of the machine, error is alive; truth reassures, error disturbs.
general.author: yevgeny zamyatin

general.quote: If you shut your door to all errors truth will be shut out.
general.author: rabindranath tagore

general.quote: The cautious seldom err.
general.author: confucius

general.quote: Fear is a disease that eats away at logic and makes man inhuman.
general.author: marian anderson

general.quote: Fear is met and destroyed with courage.
general.author: james f. bell

general.quote: Men are Moved by two levers only: fear and self interest.
general.author: napoleon bonaparte

general.quote: We must travel in the direction of our fear.
general.author: john berryman

general.quote: First you jump off the cliff and you build wings on the way down.
general.author: ray bradbury

general.quote: When fear is excessive it can make many a man despair.
general.author: st. thomas aquinas

general.quote: Introversion, at least if extreme, is a sign of mental and spiritual immaturity.
general.author: pearl s. buck

general.quote: We fear the thing we want the most.
general.author: dr. robert anthony

general.quote: It’s better to get mugged than to live a life of fear.
general.author: freeman dyson

general.quote: The concessions of the weak are the concessions of fear.
general.author: edmund burke

general.quote: It is a miserable state of mind to have few things to desire and many things to fear.
general.author: francis bacon

general.quote: Nothing is terrible except fear itself.
general.author: francis bacon

general.quote: The key to change … is to let go of fear.
general.author: rosanne cash

general.quote: Fluidity and discontinuity are central to the reality in which we live.
general.author: mary bateson

general.quote: Fear is stronger than arms.
general.author: aeschylus

general.quote: Fear is an emotion indispensable for survival.
general.author: hannah arendt

general.quote: He who fears being conquered is sure of defeat.
general.author: napoleon bonaparte

general.quote: We all fear what we don’t know — it’s natural.
general.author: leo buscaglia

general.quote: Listen to what you know instead of what you fear.
general.author: richard bach

general.quote: How often the fear of one evil leads into a worse.
general.author: nicolas bouleau-despreaux

general.quote: The fear of being wrong is the prime inhibitor of the creative process.
general.author: jean bryant

general.quote: Fear has many eyes and can see things underground.
general.author: miguel de cervantes

general.quote: Half our fears are baseless, the other half discreditable.
general.author: john christian bovee

general.quote: The habits of a vigorous mind are formed in contending with difficulties.
general.author: abigail adams

general.quote: Fear secretes acids; but love and trust are sweet juices.
general.author: henry ward beecher

general.quote: Fear is static that prevents me from hearing myself.
general.author: samuel butler

general.quote: The habit of doing one’s duty drives away fear.
general.author: charles baudelaire

general.quote: Fear is not a good teacher. The lessons of fear are quickly forgotten.
general.author: mary bateson

general.quote: The man who has ceased to fear has ceased to care.
general.author: francis h. bradley

general.quote: Only your mind can produce fear.
general.author: a course in miracles

general.quote: Excessive fear is always powerless.
general.author: aeschylus

general.quote: It is not death that a man should fear, but he should fear never beginning to live.
general.author: marcus aurelius

general.quote: The truly fearless think of themselves as normal.
general.author: margaret atwood

general.quote: They that know no evil will suspect none.
general.author: ben jonson

general.quote: We often do good in order that we may do evil with impunity.
general.author: francois de la rochefoucauld

general.quote: Evil be to him who evil thinks.
general.author: edward ii

general.quote: The only thing necessary for the triumph of evil is for good men to do nothing.
general.author: edmund burke

general.quote: Evil is like water, it abounds, is cheap, soon fouls, but runs itself clear of taint.
general.author: samuel butler

general.quote: And shares our bed and eats at our own table.
general.author: w.h. auden

general.quote: What we call evil, it seems to me, is simply ignorance bumping its head in the dark.
general.author: henry ford

general.quote: To do no evil is good, to intend none better.
general.author: claudius

general.quote: We may draw good out of evil; we must not do evil, that good may come.
general.author: maria weston chapman

general.quote: He who passively accepts evil is as much involved in it as he who helps to perpetrate it.
general.author: martin luther king jr.

general.quote: There has to be evil so that good can prove its purity above it.
general.author: buddha

general.quote: There is hardly a man clever enough to recognize the full extent of the evil he does.
general.author: francois de la rochefoucauld

general.quote: Our evil actions do not attract as much persecution and hatred as our good qualities.
general.author: francois de la rochefoucauld

general.quote: Evil is something you recognize immediately when you see it: it works through charm.
general.author: brian masters

general.quote: All concerns of men go wrong when they wish to cure evil with evil.
general.author: sophocles

general.quote: The belief in a supernatural source of evil is not necessary; men alone are quite capable of every wickedness.
general.author: joseph conrad

general.quote: Even an evil man can have principles—he can be true to his own evil, which is not always so easy.
general.author: norman mailer

general.quote: No evil dooms us hopelessly except the evil we love, and desire to continue in, and make no effort to escape from.
general.author: george eliot

general.quote: It is by its promise of a sense of power that evil often attracts the weak.
general.author: eric hoffer

general.quote: The soul that has conceived one wickedness can nurse no good thereafter.
general.author: sophocles

general.quote: Many evil things there are that your strong walls and bright swords do not stay.
general.author: j. r. r. tolkien

general.quote: Evil is always possible. And goodness is eternally difficult.
general.author: anne rice

general.quote: Woe unto them that call evil good, and good evil; that put darkness for light, and light for darkness; they put bitter for sweet, and sweet for bitter!
general.author: bible

general.quote: Evil events from evil causes spring.
general.author: aristophanes

general.quote: Evil and good are God’s right hand and left.
general.author: philip james bailey

general.quote: Love is the medicine of all moral evil. By it the world is to be cured of sin.
general.author: henry ward beecher

general.quote: There are evils that have the ability to survive identification and go on for ever… money, for instance, or war.
general.author: saul bellow

general.quote: It is some compensation for great evils that they enforce great lessons.
general.author: christian nestell novee

general.quote: All evils are equal when they are extreme.
general.author: pierre corneille

general.quote: Conquer thy own evils before you judge others.
general.author: edward counsel

general.quote: Evil is unspectacular and always human, and shares our bed and eats at our own table.
general.author: w. h. auden

general.quote: I am one of those who think like Nobel, that humanity will draw more good than evil from new discoveries.
