general.author: madame marie curie

general.quote: Some people show evil as a great racehorse shows breeding. They have the dignity of a hard chancre.
general.author: ernest hemingway

general.quote: Nature, in her indifference, makes no distinction between good and evil.
general.author: anatole france

general.quote: A resolution to avoid an evil is seldom framed till the evil is so far advanced as to make avoidance impossible.
general.author: thomas hardy

general.quote: If there was no moral evil upon earth, there would be no physical evil.
general.author: joseph de maistre

general.quote: Evil is a point of view.
general.author: anne rice

general.quote: We are tainted by modern philosophy which has taught us that all is good, whereas evil has polluted everything and in a very real sense all is evil, since nothing is in its proper place.
general.author: joseph de maistre

general.quote: When you choose the lesser of two evils, always remember that it is still an evil.
general.author: max lernerall things truly wicked start from an innocence. ~ ernest hemingway

general.quote: Must I do all the evil I can before I learn to shun it? Is it not enough to know the evil to shun it? If not, we should be sincere enough to admit that we love evil too well to give it up.
general.author: mahatma gandhi

general.quote: How many things are now called the worst evil, which are only twelve feet wide and three months long! But some day greater dragons will come into the world.
general.author: friedrich nietzsche

general.quote: But evil is wrought by want of thought as well as want of heart!
general.author: thomas hood

general.quote: There can be no existence of evil as a force to the healthy-minded individual.
general.author: william james

general.quote: For neither good nor evil can last for ever; and so it follows that as evil has lasted a long time, good must now be close at hand.
general.author: miguel de vervantes

general.quote: Now I know the full power of evil. It makes ugliness seem beautiful and goodness seem ugly and weak.
general.author: august strindberg

general.quote: The belief that there is only one truth and that oneself is in possession of it seems to me the deepest root of all evil that is in the world.
general.author: max born

general.quote: Men never do evil so completely and cheerfully as when they do it from a religious conviction.
general.author: blaise pascal

general.quote: Evil then results from imperfection.
general.author: philip james bailey

general.quote: Only evil grows of itself, while for goodness we want effort and courage.
general.author: henri-frederic amiel

general.quote: Nothing in the nature around us is evil.
general.author: john berger

general.quote: It is much easier at all times to prevent an evil than to rectify mistakes.
general.author: george washington

general.quote: Evil is done without effort, naturally, it is the working of fate; good is always the product of an art.
general.author: charles baudelaire

general.quote: In many cases, it is very hard to fix the bounds of Good and Evil, because these part, as Day and Night, which are separated by Twilight.
general.author: benjamin whichcote

general.quote: Don’t let us make imaginary evils, when you know we have so many real ones to encounter.
general.author: oliver goldsmith

general.quote: The evil that is in the world almost always comes of ignorance, and good intentions may do as much harm as malevolence if they lack understanding.
general.author: albert camus

general.quote: Why was so much evil pleasant, pretty on the outside, like poisoned candy?
general.author: laurell k. hamilton

general.quote: There surely is in human nature an inherent propensity to extract all the good out of all the evil.
general.author: benjamin haydon

general.quote: The sad truth is that most evil is done by people who never make up their minds to be good or evil.
general.author: hannah arendt

general.quote: It is a cursed evil to any man to become as absorbed in any subject as I am in mine.
general.author: charles darwin

general.quote: The most tangible of all visible mysteries–fire.
general.author: leigh hunt

general.quote: A spark neglected makes a mighty fire.
general.author: robert herrick

general.quote: Among the notable things about fire is that it also requires oxygen to burn – exactly like its enemy, life. Thereby are life and flames so often compared.
general.author: otto weininger

general.quote: One can enjoy a wood fire worthily only when he warms his thoughts by it as well as his hands and feet.
general.author: odell shepard

general.quote: When you set yourself on fire, people love to come and see you burn.
general.author: john wesley

general.quote: What is more useful than fire? Yet if any one prepares to burn a house, it is with fire that he arms his daring hands.
general.author: ovid

general.quote: As soon go kindle fire with snow, as seek to quench the fire of love with words.
general.author: william shakespeare

general.quote: Your own property is concerned when your neighbor’s house is on fire.
general.author: horace

general.quote: Kick up the fire, and let the flames break loose, to drive the shadows back; Prolong the talk on this or that excuse….
general.author: philip larkin

general.quote: We circle in the night and we are devoured by fire.
general.author: heraclitus of ephesus

general.quote: The fire is the main comfort of the camp, whether in summer or winter, and is about as ample at one season as at another. It is as well for cheerfulness as for warmth and dryness.
general.author: henry david thoreau

general.quote: From small fires comes oft no small mishap.
general.author: george herbert

general.quote: The most powerful weapon on earth is the human soul on fire.
general.author: ferdinand poch

general.quote: Life is a flame that is always burning itself out, but it catches fire again every time a child is born.
general.author: george bernard shaw

general.quote: Fire takes no holiday.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: There can no great smoke arise, but there must be some fire.
general.author: john lyly

general.quote: Fire destroys that which feeds it.
general.author: simone weil

general.quote: The fire which enlightens is the same fire which consumes.
general.author: henri frederic amiel

general.quote: Don’t let your dreams go up in smoke – practice fire safety.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: Education is not the filling of the pail, but, the lighting of the fire.
general.author: william butler yeats

general.quote: People who fight fire with fire usually end up with ashes.
general.author: abigail van buren

general.quote: There may be a great fire in our soul, yet no one ever comes to warm himself at it, and the passers-by see only a wisp of smoke.
general.author: vincent van gogh

general.quote: It is with our passions as it is with fire and water; they are good servants, but bad masters.
general.author: roger l’estrange

general.quote: A spark neglected makes a mighty fire.
general.author: robert herrick

general.quote: Time is the fire in which we burn.
general.author: delmore schwartz

general.quote: The finest steel has to go through the hottest fire.
general.author: richard m. nixon

general.quote: The fire which seems extinguished often slumbers beneath the ashes.
general.author: pierre corneille

general.quote: Practice fire safety – watch what you heat.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: To poke a wood fire is more solid enjoyment than almost anything else in the world.
general.author: charles dudley warner

general.quote: He who sits by the fire, thankless for the fire, is just as if he had no fire. Nothing is possessed save in appreciation, of which thankfulness is the indispensable ingredient.
general.author: w.j. cameron

general.quote: It takes two flints to make a fire.
general.author: louisa may alcott

general.quote: Where no wood is, the fire goes out; so where there is no tale bearer, the strife ceaseth.
general.author: bible

general.quote: Anything that creates a spark is going to start, potentially, a big brush fire.
general.author: victor hill

general.quote: Words pregnant with celestial fire.
general.author: william cowper

general.quote: Fire is the most tolerable third party.
general.author: henry david thoreau

general.quote: Folded eyes see brighter colors than the open ever do.
general.author: elizabeth barrett browning

general.quote: When there is love in the heart there are rainbows in the eyes, which cover every black cloud with gorgeous hues.
general.author: henry ward beecher

general.quote: What we learn only through the ears makes less impression upon our minds than what is presented to the trustworthy eye.
general.author: horace

general.quote: The eyes of other people are the eyes that ruin us.
general.author: benjamin franklin

general.quote: The eyes have one language everywhere.
general.author: george herbert

general.quote: The eyes are the windows of a woman’s heart; you may enter that a way!
general.author: eugene sue

general.quote: He that lives by the sight of the eye may grow blind.
general.author: henry ward beecher

general.quote: Men trust their ears less than their eyes.
general.author: herodotus

general.quote: Tears are nature’s lotion for the eyes. The eyes see better for being washed by them.
general.author: christian nevell bovee

general.quote: The voyage of discovery is not in seeking new landscapes but in having new eyes.
general.author: marcel proust

general.quote: The eyes see only what the mind is prepared to comprehend.
general.author: robertson davies

general.quote: The eye is the mirror of the soul.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: I need no dictionary of quotations to remind me that the eyes are the windows of the soul.
general.author: max beerbohm

general.quote: Her eyes are homes of silent prayers.
general.author: lord alfred tennyson

general.quote: Who has a daring eye tell downright truths and downright lies.
general.author: johann kaspar lavater

general.quote: Do everything as in the eye of another.
general.author: senecaw

general.quote: Close both eyes, to see with the other eye.
general.author: rumi

general.quote: The eye sees only what the mind is prepared to comprehend.
general.author: robertson davies

general.quote: A beautiful eye makes silence eloquent, a kind eye makes contradiction an assent, an enraged eye makes beauty deformed.
general.author: joseph addison

general.quote: An animal will always look for a person’s intentions by looking them right in the eyes.
general.author: h.powers

general.quote: The eyes of the lord are in every place seeing the evil and the good.
general.author: bible

general.quote: The eyes are not responsible when the mind does the seeing.
general.author: publilius syrus

general.quote: One’s eyes are what one is; one’s mouth is what one becomes.
general.author: john galsworthy

general.quote: Responsibilities gravitate to the person who can shoulder them.
general.author: tom stoppard

general.quote: If you have ambitions, dream of what you wish to accomplish, and then put your shoulder to the wheel and work.
general.author: heber j. grant

general.quote: Put your shoulder to the wheel.
general.author: aesop

general.quote: Nature is full of freaks, and now puts an old head on young shoulders, and then takes a young heart heating under fourscore winters.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson

general.quote: Will power is to the mind like a strong blind man who carries on his shoulders a lame man who can see.
general.author: arthur schopenhauer

general.quote: There are times in everyone’s life when something constructive is born out of adversity…when things seem so bad that you’ve got to grab your fate by the shoulders and shake it.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: True freedom has always moved forward in the hearts and upon the shoulders of willing volunteers.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: Choose a subject equal to your abilities; think carefully what your shoulders may refuse, and what they are capable of bearing.
general.author: horace

general.quote: From birth, man carries the weight of gravity on his shoulders. He is bolted to earth. But man has only to sink beneath the surface and he is free.
general.author: jacques yves cousteau

general.quote: It is a terrible thing to look over your shoulder when you are trying to lead and find no one there.
general.author: franklin d. roosevelt

general.quote: Don’t be afraid to let her into your heart and when your down, don’t try to carry the whole world on your shoulders.
general.author: elton john

general.quote: Man is always looking for someone to boast to; woman is always looking for a shoulder to put her head on.
general.author: h. l. mencken

general.quote: If you’re good, you’re always looking over your shoulder.
general.author: bruce springsteen

general.quote: Revolutions have never lightened the burden of tyranny: they have only shifted it to another shoulder.
general.author: george bernard shaw

general.quote: One man with a head on his shoulders is worth a dozen without.
general.author: elizabeth i

general.quote: Each generation goes further than the generation preceding it because it stands on the shoulders of that generation. You will have opportunities beyond anything we’ve ever known.
general.author: ronald reagan

general.quote: Fortune soon tires of carrying anyone long on her shoulders.
general.author: baltasar gracian

general.quote: Death makes angels of us all and gives us wings where we had shoulders smooth as ravens claws.
general.author: jim morrison

general.quote: I was always willing to take a great deal of the burden of getting along in life on my own shoulders, but I wasn’t willing to give myself a pat on the back. I was always looking to somebody else to give me that…. That was all wrong.
general.author: raquel welch

general.quote: What can we do but keep on breathing in and out, modest and willing, and in our places?
general.author: mary oliver

general.quote: Thinking about swimming isn’t much like actually getting in the water. Actually getting in the water can take your breath away.
general.author: barbara sher

general.quote: Give me golf clubs, fresh air and a beautiful partner, and you can keep the clubs and the fresh air.
general.author: jack benny

general.quote: Water and air, the two essential fluids on which all life depends, have become global garbage cans.
general.author: jacques cousteau

general.quote: Plans to protect air and water, wilderness and wildlife are in fact plans to protect man.
general.author: stewart udall

general.quote: The only reason I would take up jogging is so that I could hear heavy breathing again.
general.author: erma bombeck

general.quote: If you woke up breathing, congratulations! You have another chance.
general.author: andrea boydston

general.quote: Listen, are you breathing just a little and calling it a life?
general.author: mary oliver

general.quote: Fresh air is good if you do not take too much of it; most of the achievements and pleasures of life are in bad air.
general.author: oliver wendell holmes

general.quote: The pure air and dazzling snow belong to things beyond the reach of all personal feeling, almost beyond the reach of life.
general.author: frederick soddy

general.quote: What art offers is space — a certain breathing room for the spirit.
general.author: john updike

general.quote: Learn how to exhale, the inhale will take care of itself.
general.author: carla melucci ardito

general.quote: Arguments are healthy. They clear the air.
general.author: john deacon

general.quote: Imagination is the air of mind.
general.author: philip james bailey

general.quote: Without the breath of real freedom we’re getting nowhere fast.
general.author: gordon sumner

general.quote: Society is like the air, necessary to breathe but insufficient to live on.
general.author: george santayana

general.quote: Just breathing isn’t living!
general.author: eleanor h. porter

general.quote: Freedom is strangely ephemeral. It is something like breathing; one only becomes acutely aware of its importance when one is choking.
general.author: william e. simon

general.quote: Breathe. Let go. And remind yourself that this very moment is the only one you know you have for sure.
general.author: oprah winfrey

general.quote: If you surrendered to the air, you could ride it.
general.author: toni morrison

general.quote: Fear is excitement without breath.
general.author: robert heller

general.quote: He lives most life whoever breathes most air.
general.author: elizabeth barrett browning

general.quote: Keep breathing.
general.author: sophie tucker

general.quote: Focusing on the act of breathing clears the mind of all daily distractions and clears our energy enabling us to better connect with the Spirit within.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: I’m a guy who gets more out of life than some people — more out of one big breath of fresh air than most people get from breathing in and out for a lifetime.
general.author: vince mcmahon

general.quote: A healthy mind has an easy breath.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: Throughout this life, you can never be certain of living long enough to take another breath.
general.author: huang po

general.quote: The very air in which you live is an inspiration.
general.author: william henry moody

general.quote: To live is not breathing it is action.
general.author: jean-jacques rousseau

general.quote: I love to breathe. Oxygen is sexy!
general.author: kris carr

general.quote: In this very breath that we now take lies the secret that all great teachers try to tell us.
general.author: peter matthiessen

general.quote: People happy in love have an air of intensity.
general.author: stendhal

general.quote: Breath is Spirit. The act of breathing is Living.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: Anyone’s life truly lived consists of work, sunshine, exercise, soap, plenty of fresh air, and a happy contented spirit.
general.author: lillie langtry

general.quote: Our most basic common link is that we all inhabit this planet. We all breathe the same air. We all cherish our children’s future. And we are all mortal.
general.author: john f. kennedy

general.quote: I love the feeling of the fresh air on my face and the wind blowing through my hair.
general.author: evel knievel

general.quote: The air of ideas is the only air worth breathing.
general.author: edith wharton

general.quote: When you own your breath, nobody can steal your peace.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: We breathed the air of freedom without knowing the language or any person.
general.author: nelly sachs

general.quote: There can be no friendship where there is no freedom. Friendship loves a free air, and will not be fenced up in straight and narrow enclosures.
general.author: william penn

general.quote: One way to break up any kind of tension is good deep breathing.
general.author: byron nelson

general.quote: Breathing, according to me, corresponds to taking charge of one’s own life.
general.author: luce irigaray

general.quote: The air soft as that of Seville in April, and so fragrant that it was delicious to breathe it.
general.author: christopher columbus

general.quote: Who will tell whether one happy moment of love or the joy of breathing or walking on a bright morning and smelling the fresh air, is not worth all the suffering and effort which life implies.
general.author: erich fromm

general.quote: Water, air, and cleanness are the chief articles in my pharmacy.
general.author: napoleon bonaparte

general.quote: Breathing is the greatest pleasure in life.
general.author: giovanni papini

general.quote: Do not be afraid that joy will make the pain worse; it is needed like the air we breathe.
general.author: goran persson

general.quote: Being tall is an advantage, especially in business. People will always remember you. And if you’re in a crowd, you’ll always have some clean air to breathe.
general.author: julia child

general.quote: Forests are the lungs of our land, purifying the air and giving fresh strength to our people.
general.author: franklin d. roosevelt

general.quote: I’ve got to keep breathing. It’ll be my worst business mistake if I don’t.
general.author: sir nathan rothschild

general.quote: Memories, imagination, old sentiments, and associations are more readily reached through the sense of smell than through any other channel.
general.author: oliver wendell holmes, sr.

general.quote: Criminals usually prey on weakness. They can smell it.
general.author: steven seagal

general.quote: Smell is a potent wizard that transports you across thousands of miles and all the years you have lived.
general.author: helen keller

general.quote: Loneliness adds beauty to life. It puts a special burn on sunsets and makes night air smell better.
general.author: henry rollins

general.quote: The best smell in the world is that man that you love.
general.author: jennifer aniston

general.quote: Nothing revives the past so completely as a smell that was once associated with it.
general.author: vladimir nabokov

general.quote: I love the smell of paper in the morning; it smells like victory.
general.author: alan moore

general.quote: Beauty is an ecstasy; it is as simple as hunger. There is really nothing to be said about it. It is like the perfume of a rose: you can smell it, and that is all.
general.author: w. somerset maugham

general.quote: Feelings are like chemicals, the more you analyze them the worse they smell.
general.author: charles kingsley

general.quote: Get excited and enthusiastic about your own dream. This excitement is like a forest fire — you can smell it, taste it, and see it from a mile away.
general.author: denis waitley

general.quote: An author knows his landscape best; he can stand around, smell the wind, get a feel for his place.
general.author: tony hillerman

general.quote: What’s in a name? That which we call a rose by any other name would smell as sweet.
general.author: william shakespeare

general.quote: Keep it simple. Tell the truth. People can smell the truth.
general.author: steve wynn

general.quote: A wedding is a funeral where you smell your own flowers.
general.author: eddie cantor

general.quote: The lovesick, the betrayed, and the jealous all smell alike.
general.author: sidonie gabrielle colette

general.quote: Nothing is more memorable than a smell. One scent can be unexpected, momentary and fleeting, yet conjure up a childhood summer beside a lake in the mountains.
general.author: diane ackerman

general.quote: If you are possessed by an idea, you find it expressed everywhere, you even smell it.
general.author: thomas mann

general.quote: What is the most precious, the most exciting smell awaiting you in the house when you return to it after a dozen years or so? The smell of roses, you think? No, moldering books.
general.author: andre sinyavsky

general.quote: I know every book of mine by its smell, and I have but to put my nose between the pages to be reminded of all sorts of things.
general.author: george robert gissing

general.quote: Wake up with a smile and go after life…. Live it, enjoy it, taste it, smell it, feel it.
general.author: joe knapp

general.quote: As you walk down the fairway of life you must smell the roses, for you only get to play one round.
general.author: ben hogan

general.quote: A book has got smell. A new book smells great. An old book smells even better. An old book smells like ancient Egypt.
general.author: ray bradbury

general.quote: You’re only here for a short visit. Don’t hurry, don’t worry. And be sure to smell the flowers along the way.
general.author: walter hagen music can be made anywhere, is invisible and does not smell. ~ w. h. auden

general.quote: Natural forces within us are the true healers of disease.
general.author: hippocrates

general.quote: There are some remedies worse than the disease.
general.author: publilius syrus

general.quote: The diseases which destroy a man are no less natural than the instincts which preserve him.
general.author: george santayana

general.quote: Disease generally begins that equality which death completes.
general.author: samuel johnson

general.quote: Disease is war with the laws of our being, and all war, as a great general has said, is hell.
general.author: lewis g. janes

general.quote: The patient does not care about your science; what he wants to know is, can you cure him?
general.author: martin h. fischer

general.quote: For every ailment under the sun, There is a remedy, or there is none, If there be one, try to find it; If there be none, never mind it.
general.author: mother goose

general.quote: In the nineteenth century men lost their fear of God and acquired a fear of microbes.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: Diseases are the tax on pleasures.
general.author: john ray

general.quote: The worst of all diseases is a nervous ability.
general.author: edward dyson

general.quote: What can’t be cured must be endured.
general.author: robert burton

general.quote: Diagnosis is not the end, but the beginning of practice.
general.author: martin h. fischer

general.quote: Everything on the earth has a purpose, every disease an herb to cure it, and every person a mission.
general.author: mourning dove

general.quote: He who considers disease results to be the disease itself, and expects to do away with these as diseases, is insane. It is an insanity in medicine, an insanity that has grown out of the milder forms of mental disorder in science, crazy whims.
general.author: james tyler kent

general.quote: Once a disease has entered the body, all parts which are healthy must fight it: not one alone, but all. Because a disease might mean their common death. Nature knows this; and Nature attacks the disease with whatever help she can muster.
general.author: philippus a. paracelsus

general.quote: There are relapses in the diseases of the mind just like those of the body; what we call a cure is often merely an intermission or change of disease.
general.author: francois de la rochefoucauld

general.quote: When you treat a disease, first treat the mind.
general.author: chen jen

general.quote: The fact that your patient gets well does not prove that your diagnosis was correct.
general.author: samuel j. meltzer

general.quote: Doctors are men who prescribe medicines of which they know little, to cure diseases of which they know less, in human beings of whom they know nothing.
general.author: voltaire

general.quote: He who cures a disease may be the skillfullest, but He who prevents it is the safest physician.
general.author: thomas fuller

general.quote: Disease is an experience of a so-called mortal mind. It is fear made manifest on the body.
general.author: mary baker eddy

general.quote: Disease is not of the body but of the place.
general.author: marcus annaeus seneca

general.quote: Water, air, and cleanness are the chief articles in my pharmacy.
general.author: napoleon bonaparte

general.quote: You may know the intractability of a disease by its long list of remedies.
general.author: alonzo clark

general.quote: The patient has the right to accept your advice or to ignore it.
general.author: martin h. fischer

general.quote: It is with disease of the mind, as with those of the body; we are half dead before we understand our disorder, and half cured when we do.
general.author: charles caleb colton

general.quote: You might be a medical worker if you firmly believe that "too stupid to live" should be a diagnosis.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: Misdirected life force is the activity in disease process. Disease has no energy save what it borrows from the life of the organism. It is by adjusting the life force that healing must be brought about, and it is the sun as transformer and distributor of primal spiritual energy that must be utilized in this process, for life and the sun are so intimately connected.
general.author: kabbalah

general.quote: Disease is the retribution of outraged Nature.
general.author: hosea ballou

general.quote: Well, now there’s a remedy for everything except death.
general.author: miguel de cervantes

general.quote: The cure for anything is salt water — sweat, teats, or the sea.
general.author: isak dinesen

general.quote: The purse of the patient often protracts his case.
general.author: zimmermann

general.quote: So many come to the sickroom thinking of themselves as men of science fighting disease and not as healers with a little knowledge helping nature to get a sick man well.
general.author: auckland geddes, the practitioner

general.quote: We all labor against our own cure, for death is the cure of all diseases.
general.author: sir thomas browne

general.quote: Disease is a vital expression of the human organism.
general.author: georg groddeck

general.quote: Prevention is better than cure.
general.author: desiderius gerhard erasmus

general.quote: When a lot of remedies are suggested for a disease, that means it can’t be cured.
general.author: anton chekhov

general.quote: Let the young know they will never find a more interesting, more instructive book than the patient himself.
general.author: giorgio baglivi

general.quote: A decadent civilization compromises with its disease, cherishes the virus infecting it, loses its self-respect.
general.author: e. m. cioran

general.quote: There is at bottom only one genuinely scientific treatment for all diseases, and that is to stimulate the phagocytes.
general.author: george bernard shaw

general.quote: The best cure for the body is a quiet mind.
general.author: napoleon bonaparte

general.quote: Half of us are blind, few of us feel, and we are all deaf.
general.author: sir william osler

general.quote: The public wishes itself to be managed like a woman; one must say nothing to it except what it likes to hear.
general.author: johann wolfgang von goethe

general.quote: Romans, countrymen, and lovers, hear me for my cause, and be silent, that you may hear.
general.author: william shakespeare

general.quote: Hear me for my cause, and be silent that you may hear.
general.author: william shakespeare

general.quote: Heaven is never deaf but when man’s heart is dumb.
general.author: francis quarles

general.quote: Went in at the one ear and out at the other.
general.author: john heywood

general.quote: If you are the master be sometimes blind, if you are the servant be sometimes deaf.
general.author: r. buckminster fuller

general.quote: The most happy marriage I can imagine to myself would be the union of a deaf man to a blind woman.
general.author: samuel taylor coleridge

general.quote: None so deaf as those who will not hear.
general.author: matthew henry

general.quote: It is the fee that draws the doctor.
general.author: edward counsel

general.quote: It’s kinda scary when a doctor asks your price range!
general.author: tom wilson

general.quote: ‘Tis not always in a physician’s power to cure the sick; at times the disease is stronger than trained art.
general.author: ovid

general.quote: The greatest mistake in the treatment of diseases is that there are physicians for the body and physicians for the soul, although the two cannot be separated.
general.author: plato

general.quote: Observation, Reason, Human Understanding, Courage; these make the physician.
general.author: martin h. fischer

general.quote: Doctors think a lot of patients are cured who have simply quit in disgust.
general.author: don herold

general.quote: Our profession is the only one which works unceasingly to annihilate itself.
general.author: martin h. fischer

general.quote: The best doctor is the one you run to and can’t find.
general.author: denis diderot

general.quote: It is a mathematical fact that fifty percent of all doctors graduate in the bottom half of their class.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: My physician has become warden of my medically imprisoned body, pharmaceuticals the bars on my cell.
general.author: grey e. livingston

general.quote: I mean some doctor told me I had six months to live and I went to their funeral.
general.author: keith richards

general.quote: A smart mother makes often a better diagnosis than a poor doctor.
general.author: august bier

general.quote: Physicians and politicians resemble one another in this respect, that some defend the constitution and others destroy it.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: Joy, temperance, and repose, slam the door on the doctor’s nose.
general.author: henry wadsworth longfellow

general.quote: It is a good thing for a physician to have prematurely grey hair and itching piles. The first makes him appear to know more than he does, and the second gives him an expression of concern which the patient interprets as being on his behalf.
general.author: a. benson cannon

general.quote: God heales, and the Physitian hath the thankes.
general.author: george herbert

general.quote: Never go to a doctor whose office plants have died.
general.author: erma bombeck

general.quote: A great doctor kills more people than a great general.
general.author: g.w. leibniz

general.quote: A physician is nothing but a consoler of the mind.
general.author: petronius

general.quote: A physician is obligated to consider more than a diseased organ, more even than the whole man — he must view the man in his world.
general.author: harvey cushing

general.quote: The minister sees them half undressed; the doctor sees them naked. They lie to the minister; they masquerade before the lawyer; they cannot deceive the discerning physician.
general.author: martin h. fischer

general.quote: People pay the doctor for his trouble; for his kindness they still remain in his debt.
general.author: seneca

general.quote: Tidy fees are the most effective remedy, both for the doctor and the patient.
general.author: dario fo

general.quote: I wondher why ye can always read a doctor’s bill an’ ye niver can read his purscription.
general.author: finley peter dunne

general.quote: The best doctors in the world are Doctor Diet, Doctor Quiet, and Doctor Merryman.
general.author: voltaire

general.quote: What clinical lectures I will give in heaven, demonstrating the ignorance of doctors!
general.author: israel zangwill

general.quote: Medicine is the one place where all the show is stripped off the human drama. You, as doctors, will be in a position to see the human race stark naked — not only physically, but mentally and morally as well.
general.author: martin h. fischer

general.quote: A doctor must work eighteen hours a day and seven days a week. If you cannot console yourself to this, get out of the profession.
general.author: martin h. fischer

general.quote: The doctor may also learn more about the illness from the way the patient tells the story than from the story itself.
general.author: james b. herrick

general.quote: To me the ideal doctor would be a man endowed with profound knowledge of life and of the soul, intuitively divining any suffering or disorder of whatever kind, and restoring peace by his mere presence.
general.author: henri amiel

general.quote: A doctor who cannot take a good history and a patient who cannot give one are in danger of giving and receiving bad treatment.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: Each patient ought to feel somewhat the better after the physician’s visit, irrespective of the nature of the illness.
general.author: warfield theobald longcope

general.quote: The downside to becoming a doctor, I think, is it’s a very long process; four years of medical school, three years of internship, two years of residency, umpteen years of specialization, and then finally you get to be what you have trained almost all your life for.
general.author: jim lee

general.quote: My doctor is nice; every time I see him, I’m ashamed of what I think of doctors in general.
general.author: mignon mclaughlin

general.quote: The physician should look upon the patient as a besieged city and try to rescue him with every means that art and science place at his command.
general.author: alexander of tralles

general.quote: The world is dying for want, not of good preaching, but of good hearing.
general.author: george dana boardman

general.quote: The will is deaf and hears no heedful friends.
general.author: william shakespeare

general.quote: Kindness is a language which the deaf can hear and the blind can see.
general.author: mark twain

general.quote: God who sends the wound sends the medicine.
general.author: miguel de cervantes

general.quote: Medicines are only fit for old people.
general.author: napoleon bonaparte

general.quote: Medical liability reform is not a Republican or Democrat issue or even a doctor versus lawyer issue. It is a patient issue.
general.author: john ensign

general.quote: Medicines heal doubts as well as diseases.
general.author: karl marx

general.quote: A doctor whose breath smells has no right to medical opinion.
general.author: martin h. fischer

general.quote: Medicine sometimes snatches away health, sometimes gives it.
general.author: ovid

general.quote: Experience stands on its own dunghill in medicine, and reason yields it place. Medicine has always professed experience to be the touchstone of its operations.
general.author: michel eyquem de montaigne

general.quote: The medicine increases the disease.
general.author: virgil

general.quote: Poisons and medicine are oftentimes the same substance given with different intents.
general.author: peter mere latham

general.quote: Once you’re labeled as mentally ill, and that’s in your medical notes, then anything you say can be discounted as an artefact of your mental illness.
general.author: hilary mantel

general.quote: The Christian’s Bible is a drug store. Its contents remain the same, but the medical practice changes.
general.author: mark twain

general.quote: Medicine heals doubts as well as diseases.
general.author: karl marx

general.quote: Medicine is a collection of uncertain prescriptions, the results of which, taken collectively, are more fatal than useful to mankind.
general.author: napoleon bonaparte

general.quote: It is medicine, not scenery, for which a sick man must go searching.
general.author: marcus annaeus seneca

general.quote: Medicine is the only profession that labours incessantly to destroy the reason for its own existence.
general.author: james bryce

general.quote: The patient’s autonomy always, always should be respected, even if it is absolutely contrary – the decision is contrary to best medical advice and what the physician wants.
general.author: jack kevorkian

general.quote: There are three subjects on which the knowledge of the medical profession in general is woefully weak; they are manners, morals, and medicine.
general.author: gerald f. lieberman

general.quote: You know what they call the fellow who finishes last in his medical school graduating class? They call him ‘Doctor.’
general.author: abe lemons

general.quote: The road to medical knowledge is through the pathological museum and not through an apothecary’s shop.
general.author: william withey gull

general.quote: The worst thing about medicine is that one kind makes another necessary.
general.author: elbert hubbard

general.quote: The poets did well to conjoin music and medicine, because the office of medicine is but to tune the curious harp of man’s body.
general.author: francis bacon

general.quote: In the sick room, ten cents’ worth of human understanding equals ten dollars’ worth of medical science.
general.author: martin h. fischer

general.quote: A pregnant woman facing the most dire circumstances must be able to count on her doctor to do what is medically necessary to protect her from serious physical harm.
general.author: barbara mikulski

general.quote: To live by medicine is to live horribly.
general.author: carolus linnaeus

general.quote: The best of healers is good cheer.
general.author: peter pindar

general.quote: Though bitter, good medicine cures illness. Though it may hurt, loyal criticism will have beneficial effects.
general.author: sima qian

general.quote: In the medical profession a horse and carriage are more necessary than any scientific knowledge.
general.author: honore de balzac

general.quote: The art of medicine consists of amusing the patient while nature cures the disease.
general.author: francois-marie arouet de voltaire

general.quote: To array a man’s will against his sickness is the supreme art of medicine.
general.author: henry ward beecher

general.quote: He’s the best physician that knows the worthlessness of the most medicines.
general.author: benjamin franklin

general.quote: If you want total security, go to prison. There you’re fed, clothed, given medical care and so on. The only thing lacking… is freedom.
general.author: dwight d. eisenhower

general.quote: Only one rule in medical ethics need concern you: that action on your part which best conserves the interest of your patient.
general.author: martin h. fischer

general.quote: In medicine sins of commission are mortal, sins of omission are venial.
general.author: theodore tronchin

general.quote: Faith and knowledge lean largely upon each other in the practice of medicine.
general.author: peter mere latham

general.quote: Formerly, when religion was strong and science weak, men mistook magic for medicine; now, when science is strong and religion weak, men mistake medicine for magic.
general.author: thomas szasz

general.quote: If you look at the human condition today, not everyone is well fed, has access to good medical care, or the physical basics that provide for a healthy and a happy life.
general.author: ralph merkle

general.quote: He who lives by medical prescriptions lives miserably.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: Medicine is a science of uncertainty and an art of probability.
general.author: sir william osler

general.quote: I firmly believe that if the whole material medical could be sunk to the bottom of the sea, it would be all the better for mankind and all the worse for the sea.
general.author: oliver wendell holmes

general.quote: Because all the sick do not recover, therefore medicine is not an art.
general.author: marcus t. cicero

general.quote: Modern medicine is a negation of health. It isn’t organized to serve human health, but only itself, as an institution. It makes more people sick than it heals.
general.author: ivan illich

general.quote: What medicines do not heal, the lance will; what the lance does not heal, fire will.
general.author: hippocrates

general.quote: Better use medicines at the outset than at the last moment.
general.author: publilius syrus

general.quote: The public blabbers about preventative medicine, but will neither appreciate nor pay for it. You get paid for what you cure.
general.author: martin h. fischer

general.quote: I find the medicine worse than the malady.
general.author: francis beaumont

general.quote: Wherever the art of medicine is loved, there is also a love of humanity.
general.author: hippocrates of iphicrates

general.quote: Medicine, the only profession that labors incessantly to destroy the reason for its existence.
general.author: james bryce

general.quote: The desire to take medicine is perhaps the greatest feature which distinguishes man from animals.
general.author: sir william osler

general.quote: Medicine makes people ill, mathematics makes them sad, and theology makes them sinful.
general.author: martin luther

general.quote: Financial ruin from medical bills is almost exclusively an American disease.
general.author: roul turley

general.quote: Physiology is the stepchild of medicine. That is why Cinderella often turns out the queen.
general.author: martin h. fischer

general.quote: The only medicine that does women more good than harm is dress.
general.author: jean paul richter

general.quote: The doctor of the future will give no medicine but will interest his patients in the care of the human frame, in diet and in the cause and prevention of disease.
general.author: thomas a. edison

general.quote: They do certainly give very strange, and newfangled, names to diseases.
general.author: plato

general.quote: Learn from the beasts the physic of the field.
general.author: alexander pope

general.quote: Our job as nurses is to cushion the sorrow and celebrate the job, everyday, while we are "just doing our jobs".
general.author: christine belle

general.quote: We’d all be worse without a nurse.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: America’s nurses are the beating heart of our medical system.
general.author: barack obama

general.quote: Nurses – one of the few blessings of being ill.
general.author: sara moss

general.quote: Nurse will always give us hope, an angel with a stethoscope.
general.author: carrie latet

general.quote: Apprehension, uncertainty, waiting, expectation, fear of surprise, do a patient more harm than any exertion.
general.author: florence nightingale

general.quote: Nurses are the heart of healthcare.
general.author: donna wilk cardillo

general.quote: I may be compelled to face danger, but never fear it, and while our soldiers can stand and fight, I can stand and feed and nurse them.
general.author: clara barton

general.quote: Bound by paperwork, short on hands, sleep, and energy… nurses are rarely short on caring.
general.author: sharon hudacek

general.quote: Nurses can take the pressure.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: A nurse is compassion in scrubs.
general.author: lexis saige

general.quote: Some people think that doctors and nurses can put scrambled eggs back into the shell.
general.author: dorothy canfield fisher

general.quote: Caring is the essence of nursing.
general.author: jean watson

general.quote: Constant attention by a good nurse may be just as important as a major operation by a surgeon.
general.author: dag hammarskjold

general.quote: If love can’t cure it, nurses can.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: Wives are young men’s mistresses; companions for middle age, and old men’s nurses.
general.author: francis bacon

general.quote: The trained nurse has become one of the great blessings of humanity, taking a place beside the physician and the priest….
general.author: william osler

general.quote: The nurse sleeps sweetly, hired to watch the sick, / whom, snoring, she disturbs.
general.author: william cowper

general.quote: Nurses may not be angels, but they are the next best thing!
general.author: unknown

general.quote: Nurses are the hospitality of the hospital.
general.author: carrie latet

general.quote: The character of a nurse is just as important as the knowledge he/she possesses.
general.author: carolyn jarvis

general.quote: A nurse will always give us hope, an angel with a stethoscope.
general.author: carrie latet

general.quote: Nurses are patient people.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: Confucius say: "Man who want pretty nurse, must be patient."
general.author: unknown

general.quote: The relation nurse/doctor is even more complex than the relation patient/doctor.
general.author: gerhard kocher

general.quote: I wanted to be a model; I wanted to be a nurse; I wanted to be so many things, almost anything but being part of show business.
general.author: shirley bassey

general.quote: Nursing would be a dream job if there were no doctors.
general.author: gerhard kocher

general.quote: To do what nobody else will do, in a way that nobody else can, in spite of all we go through; is to be a nurse.
general.author: rawsi williams

general.quote: Whether a person is a male or female, a nurse is a nurse.
general.author: gary veale

general.quote: When you’re a nurse you know that every day you will touch a life or a life will touch yours.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: Nurses dispense comfort, compassion, and caring without even a prescription.
general.author: val saintsbury

general.quote: To smoke or not to smoke: I can make of either a life-work.
general.author: mignon mclaughlin

general.quote: A nonsmoker is forced to find food, but for a smoker breakfast can be a cigarette and a cup of bad coffee.
general.author: brock fiant

general.quote: The believing we do something when we do nothing is the first illusion of tobacco.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson quotes

general.quote: A cigarette is the perfect type of a perfect pleasure. It is exquisite, and it leaves one unsatisfied. What more can one want?
general.author: oscar wilde

general.quote: Tobacco saps the land, saps the purse, and saps the man.
general.author: james lendall basford

general.quote: The man who smokes, thinks like a sage and acts like a Samaritan!
general.author: edward george earle lytton bulwer-lytton

general.quote: I tried to stop smoking cigarettes by telling myself I just didn’t want to smoke, but I didn’t believe myself.
general.author: barbara kelly

general.quote: But when I don’t smoke I scarcely feel as if I’m living. I don’t feel as if I’m living unless I’m killing myself.
general.author: russell hoban

general.quote: Smoking kills. If you’re killed, you’ve lost a very important part of your life.
general.author: brooke shields

general.quote: No matter what Aristotle and the Philosophers say, nothing is equal to tobacco; it’s the passion of the well-bred, and he who lives without tobacco lives a life not worth living.
general.author: moliere quotes

general.quote: Cigarettes are killers that travel in packs.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: Coffee and smoking are the last great addictions.
general.author: lara flynn boyle

general.quote: I kissed my first girl and smoked my first cigarette on the same day. I haven’t had time for tobacco since.
general.author: arturo toscanini

general.quote: A wild and crazy weekend involves sitting on the front porch, smoking a cigar, reading a book.
general.author: robert m. gates

general.quote: If we see you smoking we will assume you are on fire and take appropriate action.
general.author: douglas adams

general.quote: One thousand Americans stop smoking every day – by dying.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: Nicotine patches are great. Stick one over each eye and you can’t find your cigarettes.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: Giving up smoking is the easiest thing in the world. I know because I’ve done it thousands of times.
general.author: mark twain

general.quote: There’s nothing quite like tobacco: it’s the passion of decent folk, and whoever lives without tobacco doesn’t deserve to live.
general.author: jean baptiste molière

general.quote: The cigarette does the smoking — you’re just the sucker.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: Smokers, male and female, inject and excuse idleness in their lives every time they light a cigarette.
general.author: sidonie gabrielle colette

general.quote: Much smoking kills live men and cures dead swine.
general.author: george d. prentice

general.quote: If you resolve to give up smoking, drinking and loving, you don’t actually live longer; it just seems longer.
general.author: clement freud

general.quote: Remember, if you smoke after sex you’re doing it too fast.
general.author: woody allen

general.quote: The best way to stop smoking is to carry wet matches.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: The best way to stop smoking is to just stop — no ifs, ands or butts.
general.author: edith zittler

general.quote: Smoking is hateful to the nose, harmful to the brain, and dangerous to the lungs.
general.author: king james i

general.quote: Pipe–smokers spend so much time cleaning, filling and fooling with their pipes, they don’t have time to get into mischief.
general.author: bill vaughan

general.quote: Smoking is one of the leading causes of all statistics.
general.author: liza minnelli

general.quote: A cigarette is a pipe with a fire at one end and a fool at the other.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: It is quite a three-pipe problem.
general.author: arthur conan doyle

general.quote: So smoking is the perfect way to commit suicide without actually dying. I smoke because it’s bad, it’s really simple.
general.author: damien hirst

general.quote: Good food, good sex, good digestion, good sleep: to these basic animal pleasures, man has added nothing but the good cigarette.
general.author: mignon mclaughlin

general.quote: The true face of smoking is disease, death and horror – not the glamour and sophistication the pushers in the tobacco industry try to portray.
general.author: david byrne

general.quote: For more information on lung cancer, keep smoking.
general.author: the lung association of british colombia

general.quote: If you must smoke, take your butt outside.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: My rule of life prescribed as an absolutely sacred rite smoking cigars and also the drinking of alcohol before, after and if need be during all meals and in the intervals between them.
general.author: winston churchill quotes

general.quote: To cease smoking is the easiest thing I ever did, I ought to know because I’ve done it a thousand times.
general.author: mark twain quotes

general.quote: There’s a lot of people who, a cigarette is about the only vacation they have.
general.author: trey parker

general.quote: Smoking calms me down. It’s enjoyable. I don’t want politicians deciding what is exciting in my life.
general.author: david hockney

general.quote: I know a man who gave up smoking, drinking, sex, and rich food. He was healthy right up to the day he killed himself.
general.author: johnny carson

general.quote: I was warned to stop smoking, which I did, for two or three days, but it was too lonesome, and I have resumed — in a modified way — 4 smokes a day instead of 40. This will have a good effect. On the bank balance.
general.author: mark twain

general.quote: Parents should not smoke in order to discourage their kids from smoking. A child is more likely to smoke when they have been raised in the environment of a smoker.
general.author: christy turlington

general.quote: I want all hellions to quit puffing that hell fume in God’s clean air.
general.author: carrie nation

general.quote: And a woman is only a woman, but a good cigar is a smoke.
general.author: rudyard kipling,

general.quote: I’ve been smoking nearly 50 years now. I just don’t feel safe breathing anything I can’t see!
general.author: dave beard

general.quote: For the first time in history, sex is more dangerous than the cigarette afterward.
general.author: jay leno

general.quote: As an example to others, and not that I care for moderation myself, it has always been my rule never to smoke when asleep, and never to refrain from smoking when awake.
general.author: mark twain quotes

general.quote: You’re always better off if you quit smoking; it’s never too late.
general.author: loni anderson

general.quote: Panic plays no part in the training of a nurse.
general.author: elizabeth kenny

general.quote: Some people think that doctors and nurses can put scrambled eggs back in the shell.
general.author: cass canfield

general.quote: Nurses don’t wait until October to celebrate Make a Difference Day – they make a difference every day!
general.author: unknown

general.quote: One of the first duties of the physician is to educate the masses not to take medicine.
general.author: sir william osler

general.quote: Today’s medicine is at the end of its road. It can no longer be transformed, modified, readjusted. That’s been tried too often. Today’s medicine must DIE in order to be reborn. We must prepare its complete renovation.
general.author: maurice delort

general.quote: Walking is a man’s best medicine.
general.author: hippocrates

general.quote: It is part of the cure to wish to be cured.
general.author: marcus annaeus seneca

general.quote: Cancer patients are lied to, not just because the disease is (or is thought to be) a death sentence. It is felt to be obscene — in the original meaning of that word: ill-omened, abominable, repugnant to the senses.
general.author: susan sontag

general.quote: The biggest disease today is not leprosy or tuberculosis, but rather the feeling of being unwanted.
general.author: mother teresa

general.quote: Only the actions of the just smell sweet and blossom in the dust.
general.author: james shirley

general.quote: I seem to smell the stench of appeasement in the air.
general.author: margaret thatcher

general.quote: The smell of profit is clean and sweet, whatever the source.
general.author: juvenal

general.quote: We breathe love as we breathe air; we hold it in ourselves as we hold our thoughts. Nothing more exists for us.
general.author: guy de maupassant

general.quote: The ingredients of health and long life, are great temperance, open air, easy labor, and little care.
general.author: philip sidney

general.quote: I took a deep breath and listened to the old bray of my heart: I am, I am, I am.
general.author: sylvia plath

general.quote: When I sing, trouble can sit right on my shoulder and I don’t even notice.
general.author: sarah vaughan

general.quote: If I have seen further than others, it is by standing upon the shoulders of giants.
general.author: isaac newton

general.quote: I built my talents on the shoulders of someone else’s talent.
general.author: michael jordan

general.quote: The eye is the jewel of the body.
general.author: henry david thoreau

general.quote: The eyes indicate the antiquity of the soul.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson

general.quote: My eyes make pictures, when they are shut.
general.author: samuel taylor coleridge

general.quote: Man is the only creature that dares to light a fire and live with it. The reason? Because he alone has learned to put it out.
general.author: henry jackson vandyke, jr.

general.quote: It is your business when the wall next door catches fire.
general.author: horace

general.quote: If you break your neck, if you have nothing to eat, if your house is on fire—then you got a problem. Everything else is inconvenience.
general.author: sigmund wollman

general.quote: Never open the door to a lesser evil, for other ones invariably slink in after it.
general.author: baltasar gracian

general.quote: I would far rather be ignorant than knowledgeable of evils.
general.author: aeschylus

general.quote: There is no explanation for evil. It must be looked upon as a necessary part of the order of the universe. To ignore it is childish, to bewail it, senseless.
general.author: w. somerset maugham

general.quote: God! Is there anything uglier than a frightened man!
general.author: jean anouilh

general.quote: If you banish fear, nothing terribly bad can happen to you.
general.author: margaret bourke-white

general.quote: Fear does not have any special power unless you empower it by submitting to it.
general.author: les brown

general.quote: Life is an error-making and an error-correcting process…
general.author: dr. jonas salk

general.quote: To kill an error is as good a service as, and sometimes even better than, the establishing of a new truth or fact.
general.author: charles darwin

general.quote: There are strange flowers of reason to match each error of the senses.
general.author: louis aragon

general.quote: Beside one deed of guilt, how blest is guiltless woe!
general.author: edward george earle lytton bulwer-lytton

general.quote: All good men and women should be on their guard to avoid guilt, and even the suspicion of it.
general.author: plautus

general.quote: A guilty conscience never feels secure.
general.author: syrus

general.quote: Oh, I am very weary, though tears no longer flow; my eyes are tired of weeping, my heart is sick of woe.
general.author: anne bronte

general.quote: The soul would have no rainbow had the eyes no tears.
general.author: john vance cheney

general.quote: Tears are the noble language of the eye.
general.author: robert herrick

general.quote: There are crimes that, like frost on flowers, in one single night destroy character and reputation.
general.author: henry ward beecher

general.quote: Organized crime in America takes in over forty billion dollars a year. This is quite a profitable sum, especially when one considers that the Mafia spends very little for office supplies.
general.author: woody allen

general.quote: Purposelessness is the fruitful mother of crime.
general.author: charles henry parkhurst

general.quote: There is luxury in self-reproach. When we blame ourselves, we feel no one else has a right to blame us.
general.author: oscar wilde

general.quote: Yes, there are times when something is legitimately not our fault. Blaming others, however, keeps us in a stuck state and is ultimately rough on our own self-esteem.
general.author: eric allenbaugh

general.quote: Whatever one of us blames in another, each one will find in his own heart.
general.author: lucius annaeus seneca

general.quote: Make a habit of two things: to help; or at least to do no harm.
general.author: hippocrates

general.quote: Abuse is the means in which violence retards love.
general.author: inga muscio

general.quote: There is no greater harm than that of time wasted.
general.author: michelangelo

general.quote: Ah me! we wound where we never intended to strike; we create anger where we never meant harm; and these thoughts are the thorns in our cushion.
general.author: william makepeace thackeray

general.quote: He jests at scars that never felt a wound.
general.author: william shakespeare

general.quote: Turn your scars into stars.
general.author: robert h. schuller

general.quote: If something goes wrong at the plant, blame the guy who can’t speak English.
general.author: dan castellaneta

general.quote: Anything that comes easy comes wrong.
general.author: josephine tessier

general.quote: There is always a time to make right what is wrong.
general.author: susan griffin

general.quote: All this talk and turmoil and noise and movement and desire is outside of the veil; within the veil is silence and calm and rest.
general.author: bayazid al-bistami

general.quote: Accustomed to the veneer of noise, to the shibboleths of promotion, public relations, and market research, society is suspicious of those who value silence.
general.author: john lahr

general.quote: The world is noisy and messy. You need to deal with the noise and uncertainty.
general.author: daphne koller

general.quote: Since my earliest childhood a barb of sorrow has lodged in my heart. As long as it stays I am ironic — if it is pulled out I shall die.
general.author: soren kierkegaard

general.quote: The closest bonds we will ever know are bonds of grief. The deepest community one of sorrow.
general.author: cormac mccarthy

general.quote: Sorrow is easy to express and so hard to tell.
general.author: joni mitchell

general.quote: I was in the war. I know how to kill. I was over there. I know how to do it. I’ve done it before. It’s no big deal. You just make an adjustment. You convince yourself it’s all right. That’s all. It’s easy. You just slaughter them.
general.author: sam shepard

general.quote: Murder is born of love, and love attains the greatest intensity in murder.
general.author: octave mirbeau

general.quote: You can always count on a murderer for a fancy prose style.
general.author: vladimir nabokov

general.quote: Neglect will drive a noble mind to depart for another land.
general.author: ibn muner

general.quote: Is it necessary that actuality is tempered and neglect is rolled. A little piece. The blame which makes a coping out of a cellar and into a curtain and behind behind a frontyard is that then. Please dust.
general.author: gertrude stein

general.quote: He that thinks he can afford to be negligent is not far from being poor.
general.author: samuel johnson

general.quote: Prisons are built with stones of Law, Brothels with bricks of Religion.
general.author: william blake

general.quote: Two men look out the same prison bars; one sees mud and the other stars.
general.author: frederick langbridge

general.quote: He who opens a school door, closes a prison.
general.author: victor hugo

general.quote: There is not a man living who wishes more sincerely than I do to see a plan adopted for the abolition of slavery.
general.author: george washington

general.quote: Slavery is theft — theft of a life, theft of work, theft of any property or produce, theft even of the children a slave might have borne.
general.author: kevin bales

general.quote: Corrupted freemen are the worst of slaves.
general.author: david garrick

general.quote: You will find that silence or very gentle words are the most exquisite revenge for insult.
general.author: judge hall

general.quote: The indulgence of revenge tends to make men more savage and cruel.
general.author: henry home

general.quote: Revenge is a kind of wild justice, which the more a man’s nature runs to, the more ought law to weed it out.
general.author: francis bacon

general.quote: In the case of scandal, as in that of robbery, the receiver is always thought as bad as the thief.
general.author: philip dormer stanhope chesterfield

general.quote: A man dishonored is worse than dead.
general.author: cervantes

general.quote: Her tea she sweetens, as she sips, with scandal.
general.author: samuel rogers

general.quote: It is harder to kill a whisper than even a shouted calumny.
general.author: mary w. stewart

general.quote: No sword bites so fiercely as an evil tongue.
general.author: sydney

general.quote: Those men who carry about and who listen to accusations, should all be hanged, if so it could be at my decision–the carriers by their tongues, the listeners by their ears.
general.author: plautus

general.quote: Life is like an onion; you peel it off one layer at a time, and sometimes you weep.
general.author: carl sandburg

general.quote: Weeping is not the same thing as crying. It takes your whole body to weep, and when it’s over, you feel like you don’t have any bones left to hold you up.
general.author: sarah ockler

general.quote: For one drop calls another down, till we are drowned in seas of grief.
general.author: isaac watts

general.quote: From a shy, timid girl I had become a woman of resolute character, who could no longer be frightened by the struggle with troubles.
general.author: anna dostoevsky

general.quote: I’m shy, paranoid, whatever word you want to use. I hate fame. I’ve done everything I can to avoid it.
general.author: johnny depp

general.quote: Scientists have found the gene for shyness. They would have found it years ago, but it was hiding behind a couple of other genes.
general.author: jonathan katz

general.quote: Probably the only place where a man can feel really secure is in a maximum security prison, except for the imminent threat of release.
general.author: germaine greer

general.quote: Patriotism is an ephemeral motive that scarcely ever outlasts the particular threat to society that aroused it.
general.author: denis diderot

general.quote: Great writers arrive among us like new diseases — threatening, powerful, impatient for patients to pick up their virus, irresistible.
general.author: craig raine

general.quote: Trouble is only opportunity in work clothes.
general.author: henry j. kaiser

general.quote: A crown, if it hurts us, is not worth wearing.
general.author: pearl bailey

general.quote: Expensive clothes are a waste of money.
general.author: meryl streep

general.quote: If it requires a uniform it’s a worthless endeavor.
general.author: george carlin

general.quote: Walk in the shoes of a giver and you will find the pathway to joyful living.
general.author: douglas m. lawson

general.quote: Clothes are fun. The designers have so much fun making them, you should have fun wearing them, too.
general.author: rita ora

general.quote: Advertising is the most fun you can have with your clothes on.
general.author: jerry della femina

general.quote: Many come to bring their clothes to church rather than themselves.
general.author: thomas fuller

general.quote: Our incomes are like our shoes; if too small, they gall and pinch us; but if too large, they cause us to stumble and trip.
general.author: charles caleb colton

general.quote: The bigger a man’s head gets, the easier it is to fill his shoes.
general.author: henry courtney

general.quote: The best-dressed woman is one whose clothes wouldn’t look too strange in the country.
general.author: sir hardy amies

general.quote: Good clothes open all doors.
general.author: thomas fuller

general.quote: Behind every successful man you’ll find a woman who has nothing to wear.
general.author: harold coffin

general.quote: I never thought that a lot of money or fine clothes would make you happy.
general.author: coretta scott king

general.quote: To wear your heart on your sleeve isn’t a very good plan; you should wear it inside, where it functions best.
general.author: margaret thatcher

general.quote: Clothes are like a gloss that sets off everything; dresser were invented more to enhance physical advantages than to veil physical defects.
general.author: honore de balzac

general.quote: Clothes make the poor invisible. America has the best-dressed poverty the world has ever known.
general.author: michael harrington

general.quote: The connection between dress and war is not far to seek; your finest clothes are those you wear as soldiers.
general.author: virginia woolf

general.quote: Fine clothes are good only as they supply the want of other means of procuring respect.
general.author: samuel johnson

general.quote: The True Artist has the planet for his pedestal; the adventurer, after years of strife, has nothing broader than his shoes.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson

general.quote: Practical prayer is harder on the soles of your shoes than on the knees of your trousers.
general.author: austin o’malley

general.quote: One should either be a work of art, or wear a work of art.
general.author: oscar wilde

general.quote: When in doubt, wear red.
general.author: bill blass

general.quote: I buy women shoes and they use them to walk away from me.
general.author: mickey rooney

general.quote: Good humor is one of the best articles of dress one can wear in society.
general.author: william m. thackeray

general.quote: You may not be able to leave your children a great inheritance, but day by day, you may be weaving coats for them which they will wear for all eternity.
general.author: theodore l. cuyler

general.quote: Problems are only opportunities in work clothes.
general.author: henry j. kaiser

general.quote: Biographies are but the clothes and buttons of the man. The biography of the man himself cannot be written.
general.author: mark twain

general.quote: Clothes don’t tell the character of the man, but they just as well talk for him as against him.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: Leisure is a beautiful garment, but it will not do for constant wear.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: We do not need to be shoemakers to know if our shoes fit, and just as little have we any need to be professionals to acquire knowledge of matters of universal interest.
general.author: georg hegel

general.quote: A rent in your clothes is a mishap, a stain on them is a vice.
general.author: honore de balzac

general.quote: Few people know how to take a walk. The qualifications are endurance, plain clothes, old shoes, an eye for nature, good humor, vast curiosity, good speech, good silence and nothing too much.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson

general.quote: Before you criticize a man, walk a mile in his shoes. That way, when you do criticize him, you’ll be a mile away and have his shoes.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: Clothes make the man. Naked people have little or no influence in society.
general.author: mark twain

general.quote: Beauty when most unclothed is clothed best.
general.author: phineas fletcher

general.quote: True compassion is walking in the shoes of those who have no feet.
general.author: jackie a. strange

general.quote: It is the eye of other people that ruin us. If I were blind I would want, neither fine clothes, fine houses or fine furniture.
general.author: benjamin franklin

general.quote: Only men who are not interested in women are interested in women’s clothes. Men who like women never notice what they wear.
general.author: anatole france

general.quote: Because of what’s going on with the economy, I think women are realizing that maybe they don’t need a closet full of clothes. They just need the right clothes.
general.author: michael kors

general.quote: The reason a lot of people do not recognize opportunity is because it usually goes around wearing overalls looking like hard work.
general.author: thomas a. edison

general.quote: Common sense is genius dressed in its working clothes.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson

general.quote: There is much to support the view that it is clothes that wear us, and not we, them; we may make them take the mould of arm or breast, but they mould our hearts, our brains, our tongues to their liking.
general.author: virginia woolf

general.quote: We ought not to treat living creatures like shoes or household belongings, which when worn with use we throw away.
general.author: plutarch

general.quote: Distrust any enterprise that requires new clothes.
general.author: henry david thoreau

general.quote: The most important thing you wear is the expression on your face.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: He is to be educated not because he’s to make shoes, nails, and pins, but because he is a man.
general.author: william ellery channing

general.quote: A man cannot make a pair of shoes rightly unless he do it in a devout manner.
general.author: thomas carlyle

general.quote: Dress to please yourself…. Forget you are what you wear…. Wear what you are.
general.author: elizabeth hawkes

general.quote: Probably every new and eagerly expected garment ever put on since clothes came in fell a trifle short of the wearer’s expectation.
general.author: charles dickens

general.quote: Never wear your best trousers when you go out to fight for freedom and truth.
general.author: henrik ibsen

general.quote: A man with a good coat upon his back meets with a better reception than he who has a bad one.
general.author: samuel johnson

general.quote: The vanity of loving fine clothes and new fashion, and placing value on ourselves by them is one of the most childish pieces of folly.
general.author: sir matthew hale

general.quote: Trust not the heart of that man for whom old clothes are not venerable.
general.author: thomas carlyle

general.quote: If a woman rebels against high-heeled shoes, she should take care to do it in a very smart hat.
general.author: george bernard shaw

general.quote: Death means change our clothes. Clothes become old, then time to come change. So this body become old, and then time come, take young body.
general.author: dalai lama

general.quote: He’s got the whole world at his feet and he can’t find his shoes.
general.author: john williamson

general.quote: Life stands before me like an eternal spring with new and brilliant clothes.
general.author: carl friedrich gauss

general.quote: All women’s dresses, in every age and country, are merely variations on the eternal struggle between the admitted desire to dress and the unadmitted desire to undress.
general.author: lin yutang

general.quote: Many search for happiness as we look for a hat we wear on our heads.
general.author: nikolaus lenus

general.quote: A woman seldom asks advice before she has bought her wedding clothes.
general.author: joseph addison

general.quote: The last suit that you wear, you don’t need any pockets.
general.author: wayne dyer

general.quote: Nothing improves the memory more than trying to forget.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: The man with a clear conscience probably has a poor memory.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: We are linked by blood, and blood is memory without language.
general.author: joyce carol oates

general.quote: A man’s memory may almost become the art of continually varying and misrepresenting his past, according to his interest in the present.
general.author: george santayana

general.quote: Memory is the diary that we all carry about with us.
general.author: oscar wilde

general.quote: It is surprising how much of memory is built around things unnoticed at the time.
general.author: barbara kingsolver

general.quote: I’m always fascinated by the way memory diffuses fact.
general.author: diane sawyer

general.quote: Memory always obeys the commands of the heart.
general.author: antoine rivarol

general.quote: The struggle of man against power is the struggle of memory against forgetting.
general.author: milan kundera

general.quote: For the memory of love is sweet, though the love itself were in vain. And what I have lost of pleasure, assuage what I find of pain.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: The best way to keep good acts in memory is to refresh them with new.
general.author: cato the elder

general.quote: In memory’s telephoto lens, far objects are magnified.
general.author: john updike

general.quote: A man’s real possession is his memory. In nothing else is he rich, in nothing else is he poor.
general.author: alexander smith

general.quote: One must always maintain one’s connection to the past and yet ceaselessly pull away from it. To remain in touch with the past requires a love of memory. To remain in touch with the past requires a constant imaginative effort.
general.author: gaston bachelard

general.quote: Memory is a child walking along a seashore. You never can tell what small pebble it will pick up and store away among its treasured things.
general.author: pierce harris

general.quote: Memory is what tells a man that his wife’s birthday was yesterday.
general.author: mario rocco

general.quote: In memory everything seems to happen to music.
general.author: tennessee williams

general.quote: A man of great memory without learning hath a rock and a spindle and no staff to spin.
general.author: george herbert

general.quote: Observation is an old man’s memory.
general.author: jonathan swift

general.quote: Memory only slumbers—never dies.
general.author: thomas paine

general.quote: She glances at the photo, and the pilot light of memory flickers in her eyes.
general.author: frank deford

general.quote: Memory itself is an internal rumour.
general.author: george santayana

general.quote: A memory is what is left when something happens and does not completely unhappen.
general.author: edward de bono

general.quote: The advantage of a bad memory is that one enjoys several times the same good things for the first time.
general.author: friedrich nietzsche

general.quote: Memory is the thing you forget with.
general.author: alexander chase

general.quote: Every man’s memory is his private literature.
general.author: aldous huxley

general.quote: With most men, scarce a link of memory holds yesterday and to-day together.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson

general.quote: Our memory is like a shop in the window of which is exposed now one, now another photograph of the same person. And as a rule the most recent exhibit remains for some time the only one to be seen.
general.author: marcel proust

general.quote: The memory represents to us not what we choose but what it pleases.
general.author: michel eyquem de montaigne

general.quote: Nothing fixes a thing so intensely in the memory as the wish to forget it.
general.author: michel de montaigne

general.quote: I have a memory like an elephant. In fact, elephants often consult me.
general.author: noel coward

general.quote: The biggest thing in today’s sorrow is the memory of yesterday’s joy.
general.author: kahlil gibran
