general.quote: Everyone complains of the badness of his memory, but nobody of his judgment.
general.author: francois de la rochefoucauld

general.quote: Oh, how cruelly sweet are the echoes that start when memory plays an old tune on the heart!
general.author: eliza cook

general.quote: Memory is a complicated thing, a relative to truth, but not its twin.
general.author: barbara kingsolver

general.quote: The moments of the past do not remain still; they retain in our memory the motion which drew them towards the future, towards a future which has itself become the past, and draw us on in their train.
general.author: marcel proust

general.quote: It was one of those perfect English autumnal days which occur more frequently in memory than in life.
general.author: p.d. james

general.quote: The life of the dead is placed in the memory of the living.
general.author: marcus t. cicero

general.quote: A good memory is one trained to forget the trivial.
general.author: cliff fadiman

general.quote: We are able to find everything in our memory, which is like a dispensary or chemical laboratory in which chance steers our hand sometimes to a soothing drug and sometimes to a dangerous poison.
general.author: marcel proust

general.quote: Vanity plays lurid tricks with our memory.
general.author: joseph conrad

general.quote: Sweet is the memory of past troubles.
general.author: marcus t. cicero

general.quote: The two offices of memory are collection and distribution.
general.author: samuel johnson

general.quote: Be careful about lending a friend money. It may damage her memory.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: Memory moderates prosperity, decreases adversity, controls youth and delights old age.
general.author: lactantius firmianus

general.quote: Memory is the mother of all wisdom.
general.author: aeschylus

general.quote: Memory is the scribe of the soul.
general.author: aristotle

general.quote: Memory is not wisdom; idiots can by rote repeat volumes. Yet what is wisdom without memory?
general.author: martin tupper

general.quote: Memory is the greatest of artists, and effaces from your mind what is unnecessary.
general.author: maurice baring

general.quote: One lives in the hope of becoming a memory.
general.author: antonio porchia

general.quote: It’s surprising how much memory is built around things unnoticed at the time.
general.author: barbara kingsolver

general.quote: He who has not a good memory should never take upon himself the trade of lying.
general.author: michel eyquem de montaigne

general.quote: Memory depends very much on the perspicuity, regularity, and order of our thoughts. Many complain of the want of memory, when the defect is in the judgment; and others, by grasping at all, retain nothing.
general.author: thomas fuller

general.quote: A man’s real possession is his memory. In nothing else is he rich, in nothing else is he poor.
general.author: alexander smith

general.quote: The world shrieks and sinks talons into our hearts. This we call memory.
general.author: tim o’brien

general.quote: The heart’s memory eliminates the bad and magnifies the good.
general.author: gabriel garcia marquez

general.quote: Lord, keep my memory green.
general.author: charles dickens

general.quote: No man has a good enough memory to make a successful liar.
general.author: abraham lincoln

general.quote: Memory is more than a dustbin of time, stuffed with yesterday’s trash. Rather, memory is a glorious grab bag of the past from which one can at leisure pluck bittersweet experiences of times gone by and relive them.
general.author: hal boyle

general.quote: The memory is perpetually looking back when we have nothing present to entertain us. It is like those repositories in animals that are filled with food, on which they may ruminate when their present pastures fail.
general.author: joseph addison

general.quote: Nothing is so admirable in politics as a short memory.
general.author: john kenneth galbraith

general.quote: A very great memory often forgetteth how much time is lost by repeating things of no use.
general.author: george savile

general.quote: Why is our memory good enough to recall to the last detail things that have happened to us, yet not good enough to recall how often we have told them to the same person.
general.author: francois de la rochefoucauld

general.quote: It was as if some silver chime had waked a chord in his memory.
general.author: florence bone

general.quote: Each day of our lives we make deposits in the memory banks of our children.
general.author: charles swindoll

general.quote: Your memory is a monster; you forget—it doesn’t. It simply files things away. It keeps things for you, or hides things from you—and summons them to your recall with a will of its own. You think you have a memory; but it has you!
general.author: john irving

general.quote: Memory is the only paradise from which we cannot be driven.
general.author: jean paul richter

general.quote: We can invent only with memory.
general.author: alphonse karr

general.quote: The selective memory isn’t selective enough.
general.author: blake morrison

general.quote: If we carry any possession from this world, it is the memory of a great love.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: The more connections that can be made in the brain, the more integrated the experience is within memory.
general.author: don campbell

general.quote: Memory is like an orgasm. It’s a lot better if you don’t have to fake it.
general.author: cray seymore

general.quote: There are lots of people who mistake their imagination for their memory.
general.author: josh billings

general.quote: God gave us memory that we might have roses in December.
general.author: james m. barrie

general.quote: The effectiveness of our memory banks is determined not by the total number of facts we take in, but the number we wish to reject.
general.author: jon wynne-tyson

general.quote: There is not any memory with less satisfaction than the memory of some temptation we resisted.
general.author: james branch cabell

general.quote: Live out of your imagination instead of out of your memory.
general.author: les brown

general.quote: Life is all memory, except for the one present moment that goes by you so quickly you hardly catch it going.
general.author: tennessee williams

general.quote: Memory is the cabinet of the imagination, the treasury of reason, the registry of conscience, and, the council chamber of thought.
general.author: st. basil

general.quote: A bad conscience has a very good memory.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: The true art of memory is the art of attention.
general.author: samuel johnson

general.quote: A retentive memory may be a good thing, but the ability to forget is the true token of greatness.
general.author: elbert hubbard

general.quote: The memory of most men is an abandoned cemetery where lie, unsung and unhonored, the dead whom they have ceased to cherish. Any lasting grief is reproof to their forgetfulness.
general.author: marguerite yourcenar

general.quote: Don’t waste today regretting yesterday instead of making a memory for tomorrow.
general.author: laura palmer

general.quote: Memory is the treasury and guardian of all things.
general.author: marcus t. cicero

general.quote: The only permanent thing that money can buy is a happy memory.
general.author: sydney j. harris

general.quote: Let your entrance into the sick room decrease, not increase, the irritability of your patient.
general.author: martin h. fischer

general.quote: Stress is nothing more than a socially acceptable form of mental illness.
general.author: richard carlson

general.quote: I reckon being ill as one of the great pleasures of life, provided one is not too ill and is not obliged to work till one is better.
general.author: samuel butler

general.quote: In sickness the soul begins to dress herself for immortality. And first she unties the strings of vanity that made her upper garments cleave to the world and sit uneasy.
general.author: jeremy taylor

general.quote: For each illness that doctors cure with medicine, they provoke ten in healthy people by inoculating them with the virus that is a thousand times more powerful than any microbe: the idea that one is ill.
general.author: marcel proust

general.quote: Many ordinary illnesses are nothing but the expression of a serious dissatisfaction with life.
general.author: dr. paul tournier

general.quote: You can die of the cure before you die of the illness.
general.author: michael landon

general.quote: A wise man should consider that health is the greatest of human blessings, and learn how by his own thought to derive benefit from his illnesses.
general.author: hippocrates

general.quote: If you constantly think of illness, you eventually become ill; if you believe yourself to be beautiful, you become so.
general.author: shakti gawain

general.quote: Most of the time we think we’re sick, it’s all in the mind.
general.author: thomas wolfe

general.quote: An illness is like a journey into a far country; it sifts all one’s experience and removes it to a point so remote that it appears like a vision.
general.author: sholem asch

general.quote: Ill-health, of body or of mind, is defeat. Health alone is victory. Let all men, if they can manage it, contrive to be healthy!
general.author: thomas carlyle

general.quote: Do not believe yourself healthy. Immortality is health; this life is a long sickness.
general.author: st. augustine

general.quote: Those who think they have not time for bodily exercise will sooner or later have to find time for illness.
general.author: edward stanley

general.quote: Neurotics complain of their illness, but they make the most of it, and when it comes to talking it away from them they will defend it like a lioness her young.
general.author: sigmund freud

general.quote: Just like those who are incurably ill, the aged know everything about their dying except exactly when.
general.author: philip roth

general.quote: The secret of learning to be sick is this: Illness doesn’t make you less of what you were. You are still you.
general.author: tony snow

general.quote: Few spirits are made better by the pain and languor of sickness; as few great pilgrims become eminent saints.
general.author: thomas a kempis

general.quote: When you are called to a sick man, be sure you know what the matter is — if you do not know, nature can do a great deal better than you can guess.
general.author: nicholas de belleville

general.quote: To safeguard one’s health at the cost of too strict a diet is a tiresome illness indeed.
general.author: francois de la rochefoucauld

general.quote: People who cannot find time for recreation are obliged sooner or later to find time for illness.
general.author: john wanamaker

general.quote: Illness is the most heeded of doctors: to goodness and wisdom we only make promises; pain we obey.
general.author: marcel proust

general.quote: Humor may be hazardous to your illness.
general.author: ellie katz

general.quote: Sickness is a belief, to be annihilated by the divine Mind.
general.author: mrs. mary baker glover eddy

general.quote: Refuse to be ill. Never tell people you are ill; never own it to yourself. Illness is one of those things which a man should resist on principle at the onset.
general.author: edward g. bulwer-lytton

general.quote: If you be sick, your own thoughts make you sick.
general.author: ben jonson

general.quote: If you start to think about your physical or moral condition, you usually find that you are sick.
general.author: johann wolfgang von goethe

general.quote: To hate and to fear is the be psychologically ill… it is, in fact, the consuming illness of our time.
general.author: harry a. overstreet

general.quote: Most illnesses do not, as is generally thought, come like a bolt out of the blue. The ground is prepared for years through faulty diet, intemperance, overwork, and moral conflicts, slowly eroding the subject’s vitality.
general.author: dr. paul tournier

general.quote: In sickness let me not so much say, am I getting better of my pain? as am I getting better for it?
general.author: william shakespeare

general.quote: To live by medicine is to live horribly.
general.author: carolus linnaeus

general.quote: There are two kinds of people; those who are always well and those who are always sick. Most of the evils of the world come from the first sort and most of the achievement from the second.
general.author: louis dudek

general.quote: To be too conscious is an illness. A real thorough going illness.
general.author: fyodor dostoevsky

general.quote: It is dainty to be sick, if you have leisure and convenience for it.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson

general.quote: Illness is the doctor to whom we pay most heed; to kindness, to knowledge we make promise only; pain we obey.
general.author: marcel proust

general.quote: I enjoy convalescence. It is the part that makes the illness worthwhile.
general.author: george bernard shaw

general.quote: The sovereign cure for worry is prayer.
general.author: william james

general.quote: To be sick is to enjoy monarchical prerogatives.
general.author: charles lamb

general.quote: The most important thing when ill, is to never lose heart.
general.author: vladimir ilyich lenin

general.quote: The sick soon come to understand that they live in a different world from that of the well and that the two cannot communicate.
general.author: jessamyn west

general.quote: The question is not so much what the hand is doing but what the heart is thinking while the hand is doing it.
general.author: john r. stott

general.quote: Whoever falls from God’s right hand Is caught into his left.
general.author: edwin markham

general.quote: If my hands are fully occupied in holding on to something, I can neither give nor receive.
general.author: dorothy solle

general.quote: To make a man happy, fill his hands with work.
general.author: frederick e. crane

general.quote: The gift of friendship… … a pair of helping hands.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: God warms his hands at man’s heart when he prays.
general.author: john masefield

general.quote: A long tongue is a sign of a short hand.
general.author: george herbert

general.quote: If we could but paint with the hand what we see with the eye.
general.author: honore de balzac

general.quote: I am like a little pencil in God’s hand. He does the writing. The pencil has nothing to do with it.
general.author: mother teresa

general.quote: The final forming of a person’s character lies in their own hands.
general.author: anne frank

general.quote: The game of life is not so much in holding a good hand as playing a poor hand well.
general.author: h.t. leslie

general.quote: Sometimes if you want to see a change for the better, you have to take things into your own hands.
general.author: clint eastwood

general.quote: The hands that help are holier than the lips that pray.
general.author: robert green ingersoll

general.quote: Jump into the middle of things, get your hands dirty, fall flat on your face, and then reach for the stars.
general.author: joan l. curcio

general.quote: Even God lends a hand to honest boldness.
general.author: menander of athens

general.quote: I love a hand that meets my own with a grasp that causes some sensation.
general.author: samuel osgood

general.quote: The desire of the lazy kill him; for his hands refuse to labor.
general.author: bible

general.quote: Success in life comes not from holding a good hand, but in playing a poor hand well.
general.author: denis waitley

general.quote: If you ever need a helping hand, you’ll find one at the end of your arm.
general.author: samuel levenson

general.quote: The ultimate test of a relationship is to disagree but to hold hands.
general.author: alexandria penney

general.quote: Only with the tools of production in their own hands could the workers ever hope to control their own lives and receive the fruits of their labor.
general.author: ella r. bloor

general.quote: Give me the ready hand rather than the ready tongue.
general.author: giuseppe garibaldi

general.quote: Happy is the man to whom nature has given a sufficiency with even a sparing hand.
general.author: samuel johnson

general.quote: A heart to resolve, a head to contrive, and a hand to execute.
general.author: edward gibbon

general.quote: Men are made stronger on realization that the helping hand they need is at the end of their own arm.
general.author: sir philip sidney

general.quote: The open hand of giving is always full.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: God has given us two hands, one to receive with and the other to give with.
general.author: billy graham

general.quote: Put your future in good hands — your own.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: The hand cannot reach higher than does the heart.
general.author: orison swett marden

general.quote: We do not quite forgive a giver. The hand that feeds us is in some danger of being bitten.
general.author: ralph waldo

general.quote: The lonely one offers his hand too quickly to whomever he encounters.
general.author: friedrich nietzsche

general.quote: People who bite the hand that feeds them usually lick the boot that kicks them.
general.author: eric hoffer

general.quote: Chiefly the mold of a man’s fortune is in his own hands.
general.author: francis bacon

general.quote: The world is in your hands, now use it.
general.author: phil collins

general.quote: The dead hold in their hands only what they have given away.
general.author: carl sandburg

general.quote: I hate the giving of the hand unless the whole man accompanies it.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson

general.quote: The fragrance always stays in the hand that gives the rose.
general.author: heda be jar

general.quote: He whose hand is clasped in friendship cannot throw mud.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: Before you point your fingers be sure your hands are clean.
general.author: bob marley

general.quote: Prayer moves the hand that moves the world.
general.author: john aikman wallace

general.quote: Men and women are like right and left hands: it doesn’t make sense not to use both.
general.author: jeannette rankin

general.quote: Now join your hands, and with your hands your hearts.
general.author: william shakespeare

general.quote: Only the hand that erases can write the true thing.
general.author: meister eckhart

general.quote: Taking the future in your own hands has a fantastic psychological impact.
general.author: aleqa hammond

general.quote: The mould of a man’s fortune is in his own hands.
general.author: francis bacon

general.quote: Take your life in your own hands, and what happens? A terrible thing: no one to blame.
general.author: erica jong

general.quote: Ah, how good it feels! The hand of an old friend.
general.author: henry wadsworth longfellow

general.quote: I’ve taken my destiny into my own hands and I’m in a happy place.
general.author: charlie simpson

general.quote: To the man who himself strives earnestly, God also lends a helping hand.
general.author: aeschylus

general.quote: I’ve taken my destiny into my own hands and I’m in a happy place.
general.author: charlie simpson

general.quote: Stretch out your hand! Let no human soul wait for a benediction.
general.author: marie corelli

general.quote: The difference between a helping hand and an outstretched palm is a twist of the wrist.
general.author: laurence leamer

general.quote: Prayer puts God’s work in his hands — and keeps it there.
general.author: e.m. bounds

general.quote: One of the best ways to do yourself a favor is to lend somebody else a helping hand.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: Nature has made you for a giver: Your hands are born open, and so is your heart.
general.author: frances hodgson burnett

general.quote: Walk boldly and wisely…. There is a hand above that will help you on.
general.author: philip james bailey

general.quote: A face is like the outside of a house, and most faces, like most houses, give us an idea of what we can expect to find inside.
general.author: loretta young

general.quote: He had a face like a blessing.
general.author: miguel de cervantes

general.quote: As Americans, our purpose is to make kinder the face of the nation and gentler the face of the world.
general.author: george h. bush

general.quote: A blank helpless sort of face, rather like a rose just before you drench it with D.D.T.
general.author: john carey

general.quote: Her face was her chaperone.
general.author: rupert hughes

general.quote: The serial number of a human specimen is the face, that accidental and unrepeatable combination of features. It reflects neither character nor soul, nor what we call the self. The face is only the serial number of a specimen.
general.author: milan kundera

general.quote: Every man over forty is responsible for his face.
general.author: abraham lincoln

general.quote: Even if you fall on your face, you’re still moving forward.
general.author: victor kiam

general.quote: A woman knows the face of the man she loves as a sailor knows the open sea.
general.author: honore de balzac

general.quote: To love another person is to see the face of God.
general.author: victor hugo

general.quote: Trust not too much to an enchanting face.
general.author: virgil

general.quote: Often a noble face hides filthy ways.
general.author: euripides

general.quote: I wake up every morning literally with a smile on my face, grateful for another day I never thought I’d see.
general.author: dick cheney

general.quote: The face is the mirror of the mind, and eyes without speaking confess the secrets of the heart.
general.author: st. jerome

general.quote: What is a face, really? Its own photo? Its make-up? Or is it a face as painted by such or such painter? That which is in front? Inside? Behind? And the rest? Doesn’t everyone look at himself in his own particular way? Deformations simply do not exist.
general.author: pablo picasso

general.quote: A brave man is a man who dares to look the Devil in the face and tell him he is a Devil.
general.author: james a. garfieldv

general.quote: The smile on your face lets me know that you need me, there’s a truth in your heart that says you’ll never leave me, and the touch of your hand says you’ll catch me whenever I fall.
general.author: allison krauss

general.quote: The eyes those silent tongues of love.
general.author: miguel de cervantes

general.quote: It matters more what’s in a woman’s face than what’s on it.
general.author: claudette colbert, quoted in kindling the spirit by lois p. frankel

general.quote: A writer never reads his work. For him, it is the unreadable, a secret, and he cannot remain face to face with it. A secret, because he is separated from it.
general.author: maurice blanchot

general.quote: When a wife has a good husband it is easily seen in her face.
general.author: johann wolfgang von goethe quotes

general.quote: A man finds room in the few square inches of the face for the traits of all his ancestors; for the expression of all his history, and his wants.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson

general.quote: A man’s face is his autobiography. A woman’s face is her work of fiction.
general.author: oscar wilde quotes

general.quote: The human face is the organic seat of beauty. It is the register of value in development, a record of Experience, whose legitimate office is to perfect the life, a legible language to those who will study it, of the majestic mistress, the soul.
general.author: eliza farnham

general.quote: God has given you one face, and you make yourself another.
general.author: william shakespeare

general.quote: No one ever graduates from Bible study until he meets its Author face to face.
general.author: everett harris

general.quote: We see God face to face every hour, and know the savor of Nature.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson

general.quote: As a beauty I’m not a great star. Others are handsomer far; but my face — I don’t mind it because I’m behind it; it the folks out in front that I jar.
general.author: a. h. euwer

general.quote: The soul can split the sky in two and let the face of God shine through.
general.author: edna st. vincent millay

general.quote: After reading all that has been written, and after thinking all that can be thought on the topics of God and the soul, the man who has a right to say that he thinks at all, will find himself face to face with the conclusion that, on these topics, the most profound thought is that which can be the least easily distinguished from the most superficial sentiment.
general.author: edgar allan poe

general.quote: Keep your face to the sunshine and you cannot see a shadow.
general.author: helen keller quotes

general.quote: The face of evil is always the face of total need.
general.author: william s. burroughs

general.quote: The face of a child can say it all, especially the mouth part of the face.
general.author: jack handy

general.quote: For by his face straight shall you know his heart.
general.author: william shakespeare

general.quote: My face is set, my gait is fast, my goal is Heaven, my road is narrow, my way is rough, my companions are few, my guide is reliable, my mission is clear.
general.author: robert moorehead

general.quote: A caricature is putting the face of a joke on the body of a truth.
general.author: joseph conrad

general.quote: What is your fortune, my pretty maid? "My face is my fortune, Sir," she said.
general.author: nursery rhyme

general.quote: I am ready to meet God face to face tonight and look into those eyes of infinite holiness, for all my sins are covered by the atoning blood.
general.author: r. a. torrey

general.quote: The world is a looking glass and gives back to every man the reflection of his own face.
general.author: william makepeace thackeray

general.quote: A man’s face as a rule says more, and more interesting things, than his mouth, for it is a compendium of everything his mouth will ever say, in that it is the monogram of all this man’s thoughts and aspirations.
general.author: arthur schopenhauer

general.quote: The tartness of his face sours ripe grapes.
general.author: william shakespeare quotes

general.quote: For now we see through a glass darkly, but then face to face; now I know in part, but then shall I know even as also I am known.
general.author: bible

general.quote: I have never been aware before how many faces there are. There are quantities of human beings, but there are many more faces, for each person has several.
general.author: rainer maria rilke

general.quote: A good face they say, is a letter of recommendation. O Nature, Nature, why art thou so dishonest, as ever to send men with these false recommendations into the World!
general.author: henry fielding

general.quote: The faces that have charmed us the most escape us the soonest.
general.author: sir walter scott

general.quote: Now and then one sees a face which has kept its smile pure and undefiled. Such a smile transfigures; such a smile, if the artful but know it, is the greatest weapon a face can have.
general.author: helen hunt jackson

general.quote: My face looks like a wedding cake left out in the rain.
general.author: w. h. auden

general.quote: It has been said that a pretty face is a passport. But it’s not, it’s a visa, and it runs out fast.
general.author: julie burchill

general.quote: Honest labor bears a lovely face.
general.author: thomas dekker

general.quote: I never forget a face, but in your case I’ll make an exception.
general.author: groucho marx

general.quote: A face is too slight a foundation for happiness.
general.author: lady mary wortley montagu

general.quote: Laughter is the sun that drives winter from the human face.
general.author: victor hugo quotes

general.quote: My evening visitors, if they cannot see the clock should find the time in my face.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson quotes

general.quote: Keep your face always toward the sunshine – and shadows will fall behind you.
general.author: walt whitman

general.quote: Life began with waking up and loving my mother’s face.
general.author: george eliot

general.quote: Her angel’s face, as the great eye of heaven shined bright, And made a sunshine in the shady place.
general.author: edmund spenser

general.quote: If I were two-faced, would I be wearing this one?
general.author: abraham lincoln quotes

general.quote: The face is more honest than the mouth will ever be.
general.author: daphne orebaugh

general.quote: People remain what they are even if their faces fall apart.
general.author: bertolt brecht

general.quote: You look rather rash my dear your colors don’t quite match your face.
general.author: daisy ashford

general.quote: All progress is precarious, and the solution of one problem brings us face to face with another problem.
general.author: martin luther king jr. quotes

general.quote: Keep your nose out the sky, keep your heart to god, and keep your face to the raising sun.
general.author: kanye west

general.quote: You would not go out to work with a dirty face. Why start the day with the face of your soul unwashed?
general.author: robert a. cook

general.quote: Our work brings people face to face with love.
general.author: mother teresa quotes

general.quote: Somehow our devils are never quite what we expect when we meet them face to face.
general.author: nelson demille

general.quote: Wicked thoughts and worthless efforts gradually set their mark on the face, especially the eyes.
general.author: arthur schopenhauer

general.quote: He, whose face gives no light, shall never become a star.
general.author: william blake

general.quote: It is only at the first encounter that a face makes its full impression on us.
general.author: arthur schopenhauer

general.quote: Some people, no matter how old they get, never lose their beauty – they merely move it from their faces into their hearts.
general.author: martin buxbaum

general.quote: I think your whole life shows in your face and you should be proud of that.
general.author: lauren bacall

general.quote: I got sick of turning on the TV and seeing my face.
general.author: michael j. fox

general.quote: The countenance is the portrait of the soul, and the eyes mark its intentions.
general.author: cicero

general.quote: Who sees the human face correctly: the photographer, the mirror, or the painter?
general.author: pablo picasso quotes

general.quote: It is the common wonder of all men, how among so many million faces, there should be none alike.
general.author: sir thomas browne

general.quote: Wicked thoughts and worthless efforts gradually set their mark on the face, especially the eyes.
general.author: arthur schopenhauer

general.quote: You’ve got to get up every morning with a smile on your face, and show the world all the love in your heart.
general.author: carole king

general.quote: Joyfulness keeps the heart and face young. A good laugh makes us better friends with ourselves and everybody around us.
general.author: orison swett marden

general.quote: Thinking a smile all the time will keep your face youthful.
general.author: frank gelett burgess

general.quote: When matters are desperate we must put on a desperate face.
general.author: robert burn

general.quote: False face must hide what the false heart doth know.
general.author: william shakespeare quotes

general.quote: The brain is wider than the sky.
general.author: emily dickinson

general.quote: My thoughts, my beliefs, my feelings are all in my brain. My brain is going to rot.
general.author: richard dawkins

general.quote: The brain can be easy to buy, but the heart never comes to market.
general.author: james russell lowell

general.quote: It’s good to make your brain work more than your body.
general.author: conor mcgregor

general.quote: It is necessary to relax your muscles when you can. Relaxing your brain is fatal.
general.author: stirling moss

general.quote: The heart has eyes which the brain knows nothing of.
general.author: charles h. perkhurst

general.quote: But if God had wanted us to think just with our wombs, why did He give us a brain?
general.author: clare boothe luce

general.quote: Research has shown that even small amounts of processed food alter the chemical balance in our brain and cause negative mood swings along with noticeable dips ill energy.
general.author: marilu henner

general.quote: You can’t change who you are, but you can change what you have in your head, you can refresh what you’re thinking about, you can put some fresh air in your brain.
general.author: ernesto bertarelli

general.quote: Where the heart lies, let the brain lie also.
general.author: robert browning

general.quote: The human brain has 100 billion neurons, each neuron connected to 10 thousand other neurons. Sitting on your shoulders is the most complicated object in the known universe.
general.author: michio kaku

general.quote: There is no need for temples, no need for complicated philosophies. My brain and my heart are my temples; my philosophy is kindness.
general.author: dalai lama

general.quote: I was taught that the human brain was the crowning glory of evolution so far, but I think it’s a very poor scheme for survival.
general.author: kurt vonnegut

general.quote: Tears come from the heart and not from the brain.
general.author: leonardo da vinci

general.quote: I like nonsense; it wakes up the brain cells.
general.author: dr. seuss

general.quote: In making our decisions, we must use the brains that God has given us. But we must also use our hearts which He also gave us.
general.author: alexander maclaren

general.quote: Build your self-esteem by recalling all the ways you have succeeded, and your brain will be filled with images of you making your achievements happen again and again.
general.author: jack canfield

general.quote: The chief function of the body is to carry the brain around.
general.author: thomas a. edison

general.quote: The brain is a wonderful organ; it starts working the moment you get up in the morning and does not stop until you get into the office.
general.author: robert frost

general.quote: The stupidity of one brain multiplied by twelve.
general.author: elbert hubbard

general.quote: Math is like going to the gym for your brain. It sharpens your mind.
general.author: danica mckellar

general.quote: When God endowed human beings with brains, He did not intend to guarantee them.
general.author: charles de montesquieu

general.quote: A man’s brain has a more difficult time shifting from thinking to feeling than a women’s brain does.
general.author: barbara de angelis

general.quote: As long as my brain and fingers work, I’m cool.
general.author: eddie van halen

general.quote: Any man who reads too much and uses his own brain too little falls into lazy habits of thinking.
general.author: albert einstein

general.quote: No brain is stronger than its weakest think.
general.author: thomas l. masson

general.quote: A brain of feathers, and a heart of lead.
general.author: alexander pope

general.quote: We are all now connected by the Internet, like neurons in a giant brain.
general.author: stephen hawking

general.quote: Humor is by far the most significant activity of the human brain.
general.author: edward de bono

general.quote: To think is to practice brain chemistry.
general.author: deepak chopra

general.quote: Love is like an hourglass, with the heart filling up as the brain empties.
general.author: jules renard

general.quote: A fool’s brain digests philosophy into folly, science into superstition, and art into pedantry. Hence University education.
general.author: george bernard shaw

general.quote: Dollars and guns are no substitutes for brains and will power.
general.author: dwight david eisenhower

general.quote: We are dealing with the best-educated generation in history. But they’ve got a brain dressed up with nowhere to go.
general.author: timothy leary

general.quote: My own brain is to me the most unaccountable of machinery – always buzzing, humming, soaring roaring diving, and then buried in mud. And why? What’s this passion for?
general.author: virginia woolf

general.quote: Brains are an asset, if you hide them.
general.author: mae west

general.quote: Aristotle was famous for knowing everything. He taught that the brain exists merely to cool the blood and is not involved in the process of thinking. This is true only of certain persons.
general.author: will cuppy

general.quote: I regard the brain as a computer which will stop working when its components fail. There is no heaven or afterlife for broken down computers; that is a fairy story for people afraid of the dark.
general.author: stephen hawking

general.quote: Better a tooth out than always aching.
general.author: thomas fuller

general.quote: Faced with the choice of enduring a bad toothache or going to the dentist, we generally tried to ride out the bad tooth.
general.author: joseph barbera

general.quote: I have a sweet tooth for song and music. This is my Polish sin.
general.author: pope john paul ii

general.quote: Americans may have no identity, but they do have wonderful teeth.
general.author: jean baudrillard

general.quote: Perhaps no mightier conflict of mind occurs ever again in a lifetime than that first decision to unseat one’s own tooth.
general.author: gene fowler

general.quote: In order to change the world, you have to get your head together first.
general.author: jimi hendrix

general.quote: You have brains in your head. You have feet in your shoes. You can steer yourself in any direction you choose. You’re on your own, and you know what you know. And you are the guy who’ll decide where to go.
general.author: dr. seuss

general.quote: If I create from the heart, nearly everything works; if from the head, almost nothing.
general.author: marc chagall

general.quote: No matter where you go or what you do, you live your entire life within the confines of your head.
general.author: terry josephson

general.quote: Never let your head hang down. Never give up and sit down and grieve. Find another way. And don’t pray when it rains if you don’t pray when the sun shines.
general.author: richard m. nixon quotes

general.quote: Swollen in head, weak in legs, sharp in tongue but empty in belly.
general.author: mao zedong

general.quote: People are governed with the head; kindness of heart is little use in chess.
general.author: nicolas chamfort

general.quote: Sometimes life hits you in the head with a brick. Don’t lose faith.
general.author: steve jobs quotes

general.quote: Never make your home in a place. Make a home for yourself inside your own head. You’ll find what you need to furnish it – memory, friends you can trust, love of learning, and other such things. That way it will go with you wherever you journey.
general.author: tad williams

general.quote: A man is not paid for having a head and hands, but for using them.
general.author: elbert hubbard

general.quote: Everyone has highs and lows that they have to learn from, but every morning I start off with a good head on my shoulders, saying to myself, ‘it’s going to be a good day!’
general.author: lindsay lohan

general.quote: A heart to resolve, a head to contrive, and a hand to execute.
general.author: edward gibbon

general.quote: Sometimes, you just have to clear your head and get out to see other things.
general.author: marc jacobs

general.quote: It is better to have your head in the clouds, and know where you are… than to breathe the clearer atmosphere below them, and think that you are in paradise.
general.author: henry david thoreau

general.quote: If you aren’t in over your head, how do you know how tall you are?
general.author: t. s. eliot

general.quote: The head has the most beautiful appearance, as well as the highest station, in a human figure.
general.author: joseph addison quotes

general.quote: If you talk to a man in a language he understands, that goes to his head. If you talk to him in his language, that goes to his heart.
general.author: nelson mandela quotes

general.quote: After all, the head only reproduces what the heart creates; and so we give the mocking-bird credit when he imitates the loving murmurs of the dove.
general.author: george john whyte-melville

general.quote: Stop a minute, right where you are. Relax your shoulders, shake your head and spine like a dog shaking off cold water. Tell that imperious voice in your head to be still.
general.author: barbara kingsolver

general.quote: It’s hard to fight an enemy who has outposts in your head.
general.author: sally kempton

general.quote: The heart is forever making the head its fool.
general.author: françois de la rochefoucauld

general.quote: No one realizes how beautiful it is to travel until he comes home and rests his head on his old, familiar pillow.
general.author: lin yutang

general.quote: Greet every morning with open arms and say thanks every night with a full heart. Each day is a precious gift to be savored and used, not left unopened and hoarded for a future that may never come.
general.author: regina brett

general.quote: The length of a man’s outspread arms is equal to his height.
general.author: leonardo da vinci

general.quote: Every man’s dream is to be able to sink into the arms of a woman without also falling into her hands.
general.author: jerry lewis

general.quote: Stand by your man. Give him two arms to cling to and something warm to come to.
general.author: tammy wynette

general.quote: Don’t stand back with your arms folded; step forward… There is hope and light to resist injustice and promote peace without violence.
general.author: adolfo perez esquivel

general.quote: A truly rich man is one whose children run into his arms when his hands are empty.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: A mother’s arms are made of tenderness and children sleep soundly in them.
general.author: victor hugo

general.quote: That’s what people do who love you. They put their arms around you and love you when you’re not so lovable.
general.author: deb caletti

general.quote: I’m of a fearsome mind to throw my arms around every living librarian who crosses my path, on behalf of the souls they never knew they saved.
general.author: barbara kingsolver

general.quote: Millions and millions of years would still not give me half enough time to describe that tiny instant of all eternity when you put your arms around me and I put my arms around you.
general.author: jacques prévert

general.quote: Gamble, cheat, lie, and steal. Let me explain: Gamble for your best shot in life – dare to take risks. Cheat those who would have you be less than you are. Lie in the arms of those you love. And finally, steal every moment of happiness.
general.author: caitlyn jenner

general.quote: Raise your eyes and count the small gang of your oppressors who are only strong through the blood they suck from you and through your arms which you lend them unwillingly.
general.author: georg buchner

general.quote: To us, family means putting your arms around each other and being there.
general.author: barbara bush

general.quote: Father God, we just ask You to open Your wide, wide arms and look down upon us, Lord, and lead us, and let us know what we should do to stop this, this terrible, terrible holocaust.
general.author: norma mccorvey

general.quote: The best way to hold a man is in your arms.
general.author: mae west

general.quote: A hug delights and warms and charms, that must be why God gave us arms.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: There are some people who want to throw their arms round you simply because it is Christmas; there are other people who want to strangle you simply because it is Christmas.
general.author: robert staughton lynd

general.quote: If I must die, I will encounter darkness as a bride, and hug it in mine arms.
general.author: william shakespeare

general.quote: Men greet each other with a sock on the arm, women with a hug, and the hug wears better in the long run.
general.author: edward hoagland

general.quote: Open your arms to life! Let it strut into your heart in all its messy glory!
general.author: deborah wiles

general.quote: Free men have arms; slaves do not.
general.author: william blackstone

general.quote: Many people may listen, but few people actually hear.
general.author: harvey mackay

general.quote: One ear it heard, at the other out it went.
general.author: geoffrey chaucer

general.quote: The ear in man and beast is an evidence of blood and high breeding.
general.author: nathaniel parker willis

general.quote: Make not my, ear a stranger to thy thoughts.
general.author: joseph addison

general.quote: Little pitchers have wide ears.
general.author: george herbert

general.quote: If truth is beauty, how come no one has their hair done in a library?
general.author: lily tomlin

general.quote: Men’s fame is like their hair, which grows after they are dead, and with just as little use to them.
general.author: george villiers

general.quote: It’s not the hair on your head that matters. It’s the kind of hair you have inside.
general.author: garry shandling

general.quote: Your hair may be brushed, but your mind’s untidy. You’ve had about seven hours of sleep since Friday. No wonder you feel that lost sensation. You’re sunk from a riot of relaxation.
general.author: ogden nash

general.quote: Inflation is when you pay fifteen dollars for the ten-dollar haircut you used to get for five dollars when you had hair.
general.author: sam ewing

general.quote: Long, beautiful, gleaming, steaming, flaxen, waxen… I adore hair!
general.author: james rado and gerome ragni

general.quote: How can I control my life when I can’t control my hair?
general.author: unknown

general.quote: It seems no more than right that men should seize time by the forelock, for the rude old fellow, sooner or later, pulls all their hair out.
general.author: george dennison prentice

general.quote: A hair divides what is false and true.
general.author: omar khayyam

general.quote: A hair in the head is worth two in the brush.
general.author: oliver herford

general.quote: Beauty draws us with a single hair.
general.author: alexander pope

general.quote: Violet will be a good color for hair at just about the same time that brunette becomes a good color for flowers.
general.author: fran lebowitz

general.quote: Hair brings one’s self-image into focus; it is vanity’s proving ground. Hair is terribly personal, a tangle of mysterious prejudices.
general.author: shana alexander

general.quote: When it comes to spotting a blonde hair on a man’s coat, every wife has 20-20 vision.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: Forget not that the earth delights to feel your bare feet and the winds long to play with your hair.
general.author: kahlil gibran quotes

general.quote: A celebrity is any well-known TV or movie star who looks like he spends more than two hours working on his hair.
general.author: steve martin

general.quote: Gray hair is a blessing — ask any bald man.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: Let us dance in the sun, wearing wild flowers in our hair…
general.author: susan polis shutz

general.quote: By common consent gray hairs are a crown of glory; the only object of respect that can never excite envy.
general.author: george bancroft

general.quote: They’re not gray hairs. They’re wisdom highlights.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: It is not by the gray of the hair that one knows the age of the heart.
general.author: edward g. bulwer-lytton

general.quote: Babies haven’t any hair; Old men’s heads are just as bare; between the cradle and the grave lie a haircut and a shave.
general.author: samuel hoffenstein

general.quote: It is foolish to tear one’s hair in grief, as though sorrow would be made less with baldness.
general.author: marcus t. cicero

general.quote: Rest is a fine medicine
general.author: thomas carlyle

general.quote: What is without periods of rest will not endure.
general.author: ovid

general.quote: If you rest, you rust.
general.author: helen hayes

general.quote: The stars that have most glory have no rest.
general.author: samuel daniel

general.quote: Absence of occupation is not rest; A mind quite vacant is a mind distressed.
general.author: william cowper

general.quote: Sometimes the most urgent thing you can possibly do is take a complete rest.
general.author: ashleigh brilliant

general.quote: Nothing gives rest but the sincere search for truth.
general.author: blaise pascal

general.quote: Rest when you’re weary. Refresh and renew yourself, your body, your mind, your spirit. Then get back to work.
general.author: ralph marston

general.quote: Take my yoke upon you, and learn of me; for I am meek and lowly in heart; and you shall find rest for your souls.
general.author: bible

general.quote: Ignorance is the softest pillow on which a man can rest his head.
general.author: michel de montaigne

general.quote: He who seeks rest finds boredom. He who seeks work finds rest.
general.author: dylan thomas

general.quote: No rest is worth anything except the rest that is earned.
general.author: jean paul richter

general.quote: Too much rest becomes a pain.
general.author: homer

general.quote: Rest is the fitting of self to its sphere.
general.author: john sullivan dwight

general.quote: He that can take rest is greater than he that can take cities.
general.author: benjamin franklin

general.quote: It is necessary to relax your muscles when you can. Relaxing your brain is fatal.
general.author: stirling moss

general.quote: Good, better, best. Never let it rest. ‘Til your good is better and your better is best.
general.author: st. jerome

general.quote: No one needs a vacation more than the person who just had one.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: Put off thy cares with thy clothes; so shall thy rest strengthen thy labor, and so thy labor sweeten thy rest.
general.author: francis quarles

general.quote: Rest is a good thing, but boredom is its brother.
general.author: voltaire

general.quote: Every now and then go away, have a little relaxation, for when you come back to your work your judgment will be surer. Go some distance away because then the work appears smaller and more of it can be taken in at a glance and a lack of harmony and proportion is more readily seen.
general.author: leonardo da vinci

general.quote: It’s no rest to be idle.
general.author: paul peel

general.quote: The word "rest" is not in my vocabulary.
general.author: horace greeley

general.quote: Rest is the sweet sauce of labor.
general.author: plutarch

general.quote: Sundays, quiet islands on the tossing seas of life.
general.author: s. w. duffield

general.quote: Rest is not idleness, and to lie sometimes on the grass on a summer day listening to the murmur of water, or watching the clouds float across the sky, is hardly a waste of time.
general.author: sir john lubbock

general.quote: For too much rest becomes a pain.
general.author: homer

general.quote: Rest, rest, shall I have not all eternity to rest.
general.author: antoine arnauld

general.quote: When red-headed people are above a certain social grade their hair is auburn.
general.author: mark twain quotes

general.quote: Life is an endless struggle full of frustrations and challenges, but eventually you find a hair stylist you like.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: The hair is the richest ornament of women.
general.author: martin luther quotes

general.quote: I have often lamented that we cannot close our ears with as much ease as we can our eyes.
general.author: sir richard steele

general.quote: He that has ears to hear, let him stuff them with cotton.
general.author: william makepeace thackeray

general.quote: Eyes and ears, two traded pilots ‘twixt the dangerous shores of will and judgment.
general.author: william shakespeare

general.quote: A hug is two hearts wrapped in arms.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: My arms are too short to box with God.
general.author: johnny cash

general.quote: The best place to cry is on a mother’s arms."
general.author: jodi picoult

general.quote: A good head and a good heart are always a formidable combination.
general.author: nelson mandela quotes

general.quote: Some people carry their hearts in their heads; very many carry their heads in their hearts. The difficulty is to keep them apart, yet both actively working together.
general.author: augustus william hare

general.quote: There is wisdom of the head, and wisdom of the heart.
general.author: charles dickens quotes

general.quote: Good instincts usually tell you what to do long before your head has figured it out.
general.author: michael burke

general.quote: Make decisions from the heart and use your head to make it work out.
general.author: sir girad

general.quote: When you realize how perfect everything is you will tilt your head back and laugh at the sky.
general.author: buddha quotes

general.quote: Good dental care doesn’t make you a good student, but if your tooth hurts, it’s hard to be a good student.
general.author: geoffrey canada

general.quote: Let us have a dagger between our teeth, a bomb in our hands, and an infinite scorn in our hearts.
general.author: benito mussolini

general.quote: I told my dentist my teeth are going yellow. he told me to wear a brown tie.
general.author: rodney dangerfield

general.quote: The more you use your brain, the more brain you will have to use.
general.author: george a. dorsey

general.quote: Never trust anything that can think for itself if you can’t see where it keeps its brain.
general.author: j. k. rowling

general.quote: The right half of the brain controls the left half of the body. This means that only left handed people are in their right mind.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: Nature gives you the face you have at twenty; it is up to you to merit the face you have at fifty.
general.author: coco chanel

general.quote: After a certain number of years our faces become our biographies. We get to be responsible for our faces.
general.author: cynthia ozick

general.quote: Beauty is not in the face; beauty is a light in the heart.
general.author: kahlil gibran quotes

general.quote: Never hesitate to hold out your hand; never hesitate to accept the outstretched hand of another.
general.author: pope john xxiii

general.quote: Take a look at those two open hands of yours. They are tools with which to serve, make friends, and reach out for the best in life. Open hands open the way to achievement Put them to work today.
general.author: wilfred a. peterson

general.quote: Put your hands to work, and your hearts to God.
general.author: mother ann lee

general.quote: Art is a kind of illness.
general.author: giacomo puccini

general.quote: It’s no longer a question of staying healthy. It’s a question of finding a sickness you like.
general.author: jackie mason

general.quote: A sure cure for seasickness is to sit under a tree.
general.author: spike milligan

general.quote: A Man’s illness is his private territory and, no matter how much he love you and how close you are, you stay an outsider. You are healthy.
general.author: lauren bacall

general.quote: The modern sympathy with invalids is morbid. Illness of any kind is hardly a thing to be encouraged in others.
general.author: oscar wilde

general.quote: When a man is ill nothing is so important to him as his own illness.
general.author: anthony trollope

general.quote: To have a curable illness and to leave it untreated except for prayer is like sticking your hand in a fire and asking God to remove the flame.
general.author: sandra l. douglas

general.quote: Illness strikes men when they are exposed to change.
general.author: herodotus

general.quote: Sickness is a sort of early old age; it teaches us a diffidence in our earthly state.
general.author: alexander pope

general.quote: Serious illness doesn’t bother me for long because I am too inhospitable a host.
general.author: albert schweitzer

general.quote: If you look like your passport picture you’re too ill to travel.
general.author: will kommen

general.quote: Because there is no glory in illness. There is no meaning to it. There is no honor in dying of.
general.author: john green

general.quote: The more serious the illness, the more important it is for you to fight back, mobilizing all your resources-spiritual, emotional, intellectual, physical.
general.author: norman cousins

general.quote: Memory is a crazy woman that hoards colored rags and throws away food.
general.author: austin o’malley

general.quote: Sooner or later we all discover that the important moments in life are not the advertised ones, not the birthdays, the graduations, the weddings, not the great goals achieved. The real milestones are less prepossessing. They come to the door of memory.
general.author: susan b. anthony

general.quote: Memory… is the diary that we all carry about with us.
general.author: oscar wilde

general.quote: Clothes and manners do not make the man; but when he is made, they greatly improve his appearance.
general.author: henry ward beecher

general.quote: If you don’t think it’s safe, it probably isn’t.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: Playing safe is only playing.
general.author: chuck olson

general.quote: A short absence is the safest.
general.author: ovid

general.quote: Be daring, be different, be impractical, be anything that will assert integrity of purpose and imaginative vision against the play-it-safers, the creatures of the commonplace, the slaves of the ordinary.
general.author: sir cecil beaton

general.quote: The safest risk is the one you didn’t take.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: Don’t play for safety — it’s the most dangerous thing in the world.
general.author: sir hugh walpole

general.quote: The safest words are always those which bring us most directly to facts.
general.author: charles h. parkhurst

general.quote: There is only one duty, only one safe course, and that is to try to be right.
general.author: winston churchill quotes

general.quote: Truth is the only safe ground to stand upon.
general.author: elizabeth cady stanton

general.quote: When you play it too safe, you’re taking the biggest risk of your life. Time is the only wealth we’re given.
general.author: barbara sher

general.quote: The world must be made safe for democracy.
general.author: woodrow t. wilson

general.quote: Don’t play for safety — it’s the most dangerous thing in the world.
general.author: sir hugh walpole

general.quote: If you wait for the perfect moment when all is safe and assured, it may never arrive. Mountains will not be climbed, races won, or lasting happiness achieved.
general.author: maurice chevalier

general.quote: Working safely is like breathing – if you don’t, you die.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: It is playing safe that we create a world of utmost insecurity.
general.author: dag hammarskjold

general.quote: Unsafe acts will keep you in stitches.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: Your safety gears are between your ears.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: Working safely may get old, but so do those who practice it.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: You only live once. You don’t want your tombstone to read: ‘Played it Safe.’
general.author: rosario dawson

general.quote: Our insignificance is often the cause of our safety.
general.author: aesop

general.quote: Out of this nettle, danger, we pluck this flower, safety.
general.author: william shakespeare quotes

general.quote: Wishing won’t keep you safe – safety will.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: Don’t learn safety rules simply by accident.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: Let the people know the truth and the country is safe.
general.author: abraham lincoln quotes

general.quote: Playing safe is probably the most unsafe thing in the world. You cannot stand still. You must go forward.
general.author: robert collier

general.quote: I never want to feel that I’m playing it safe.
general.author: christian bale

general.quote: The coward threatens when he is safe.
general.author: johann wolfgang von goethe quotes

general.quote: Early and provident fear is the mother of safety.
general.author: edmund burke

general.quote: One can advise comfortably from a safe port.
general.author: johann friedrich von schiller

general.quote: It’s better to explore life and make mistakes than to play it safe. Mistakes are part of the dues one pays for a full life.
general.author: sophia loren

general.quote: If there was no faith there would be no living in this world. We could not even eat hash with any safety.
general.author: josh billings

general.quote: Is anyone in all the world safe from unhappiness?
general.author: sophocles

general.quote: Accidents hurt – safety doesn’t.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: It is never safe to look into the future with eyes of fear.
general.author: edward h. harriman

general.quote: Know safety, no injury. No safety, know injury.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: One can go back toward safety or forward toward growth.
general.author: abraham h. maslow

general.quote: If we cannot end our differences, at least we can make the world safe for diversity.
general.author: john f. kennedy quotes

general.quote: Obscurity brings safety.
general.author: aesop

general.quote: To play safe, I prefer to accept only one type of power: the power of art over trash, the triumph of magic over the brute.
general.author: vladimir nabokov

general.quote: The way to be safe is never to be secure.
general.author: benjamin franklin quotes

general.quote: Be daring, be different, be impractical, be anything that will assert integrity of purpose and imaginative vision against the play-it-safers, the creatures of the commonplace, the slaves of the ordinary.
general.author: sir cecil beaton

general.quote: If you play it safe in life, you’ve decided that you don’t want to grow anymore.
general.author: shirley hufstedler

general.quote: The desire for safety stands against every great and noble enterprise.
general.author: publius cornelius tacitus

general.quote: Safety isn’t just a slogan, it’s a way of life.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: He that’s secure is not safe.
general.author: benjamin franklin

general.quote: Safety doesn’t happen by accident.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: It’s better to be cautious and play it safe than regret pushing him too hard. We’re supposed to get another read on it soon.
general.author: dick vermeil

general.quote: I want to show up to work and take risks. I don’t ever want to play it safe.
general.author: james badge dale

general.quote: Don’t learn safety by accident.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: There is no safety in numbers, or in anything else.
general.author: james thurber

general.quote: Safety is as simple as ABC – Always Be Careful.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: Working without safety is a dead-end job.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: If you never struggle with confidence, you obviously are not stretching yourself far enough. You are not pressing to the edge of your abilities. In other words, the only way to never struggle with confidence is to play it safe. Play it known. Play it in a way that you achieve stability, but lose opportunity.
general.author: timothy ursiny

general.quote: If everyone played it safe, we wouldn’t get anywhere.
general.author: vinod khosla

general.quote: Safety is a cheap and effective insurance policy.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: When ever a separation is made between liberty and justice, neither is safe.
general.author: edmund burke

general.quote: If safety is a joke, then death is the punchline.
general.author: paul laforest

general.quote: When you gamble with safety, you bet your life.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: Actually, the streets are quite safe today, it’s the people on them who aren’t.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: Safety first has been the motto of the human race for half a million years; but it has never been the motto of leaders.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: Luck runs out but safety is good for life.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: We are very near to greatness: one step and we are safe; can we not take the leap?
general.author: ralph waldo emerson quotes

general.quote: I’ll always push the envelope. To me, the ultimate sin in life is to be boring. I don’t play it safe.
general.author: cybil shepherd

general.quote: It is much safer to obey, than to govern.
general.author: thomas a kempis

general.quote: When safety is a factor, call in a contractor.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: "Safety First" is "Safety Always."
general.author: charles m. hayes

general.quote: Think then act safely.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: To play it safe is not to play.
general.author: robert altman

general.quote: It is when we all play safe that we create a world of utmost insecurity.
general.author: dag hammarskjold

general.quote: In writing, I’ve found, playing it safe and familiar is no way to energize anybody.
general.author: jonathan evison

general.quote: You can’t play it safe if you want to get ahead.
general.author: irene rosenfeld

general.quote: In skating over thin ice, our safety is in our speed.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson

general.quote: To keep oneself safe does not mean to bury oneself.
general.author: marcus annaeus seneca

general.quote: The safest hope is in heaven.
general.author: motto

general.quote: Safety means first aid to the uninjured.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: Safety never takes a holiday.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: Liberty is always dangerous, but it is the safest thing we have.
general.author: harry emerson fosdick

general.quote: The door to safety swings on the hinges of common sense.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: Happy were men if they but understood There is no safety but in doing good.
general.author: john fountain

general.quote: Safety first has been the motto of the human race for half a million years; but it has never been the motto of leaders.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: Hope is a pleasant acquaintance, but an unsafe friend.
general.author: thomas c. haliburton

general.quote: I’ll always push the envelope. To me, the ultimate sin in life is to be boring. I don’t play it safe.
general.author: cybil shepherd

general.quote: Let love give way to business; give attention to business and you will be safe.
general.author: ovid

general.quote: Do you want to be safe and good, or do you want to take a chance and be great?
general.author: jimmy johnson

general.quote: Tomorrow – your reward for working safely today.
general.author: robert pelton

general.quote: For safety is not a gadget but a state of mind.
general.author: eleanor everet

general.quote: Man was made for joy and woe; And when this we rightly know, Through the world we safely go.
general.author: william blake

general.quote: There is always safety in valor.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson

general.quote: Safety isn’t expensive, its priceless.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: The wronged side is always the safest.
general.author: richard sibbes

general.quote: You will go most safely in the middle.
general.author: ovid

general.quote: Safety is from God alone.
general.author: motto

general.quote: If you wait for the perfect moment when all is safe and assured, it may never arrive. Mountains will not be climbed, races won, or lasting happiness achieved.
general.author: maurice chevalier

general.quote: As cowardly as a coward is, it is not safe to call a coward a coward.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: If you don’t fail now and again, it’s a sign you’re playing it safe.
general.author: woody allen

general.quote: Playing it safe is the riskiest choice we can ever make.
general.author: sarah ban breathnach

general.quote: Wisdom is the abstract of the past, but beauty is the promise of the future.
general.author: oliver wendell holmes

general.quote: The beautiful seems right by force of beauty, and the feeble wrong because of weakness.
general.author: elizabeth barrett browning

general.quote: There are as many kinds of beauty as there are habitual ways of seeking happiness.
general.author: charles baudelaire

general.quote: A woman who cannot be ugly is not beautiful.
general.author: karl kraus

general.quote: All kinds of beauty don’t inspire love; there is a kind that pleases only the sight, but does not captivate the affections.
general.author: miguel de cervantes

general.quote: There is no excellent beauty that hath not some strangeness in the proportion.
general.author: francis bacon

general.quote: As we grow old, the beauty steals inward.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson

general.quote: Beauty – in projection and perceiving – is 99.9% attitude.
general.author: grey livingston

general.quote: In life, as in art, the beautiful moves in curves.
general.author: edward g. bulwer-lytton

general.quote: I think that there is something truly beautiful in everybody you meet.
general.author: katie lowes

general.quote: Beauty is a form of genius, is higher, indeed, than genius, as it needs no explanation. It is of the great facts in the world like sunlight or springtime or the reflection in dark water of that silver shell we call the moon.
general.author: oscar wilde

general.quote: Beauty is not in the face; beauty is a light in the heart.
general.author: kahlil gibran quotes

general.quote: Beauty is desired in order that it may be befouled, not for its own sake, but for the joy brought by the certainty of profaning it.
general.author: georges bataille

general.quote: Beauty is in the heart of the beholder.
general.author: al bernstein

general.quote: An art aims, above all, at producing something beautiful which affects not our feelings but the organ of pure contemplation, our imagination.
general.author: eduard hanslick

general.quote: Nobody is bored when he is trying to make something that is beautiful, or to discover something that is true.
general.author: william ralph inge

general.quote: It is generally a feminine eye that first detects the moral deficiencies hidden under the "dear deceit" of beauty.
general.author: george eliot

general.quote: What humbugs we are, who pretend to live for Beauty, and never see the Dawn!
general.author: logan pearsall smith

general.quote: Beauty: the power by which a woman charms a lover and terrifies a husband.
general.author: ambrose bierce

general.quote: Heat cannot be separated from fire, or beauty from the eternal.
general.author: dante, alighieri

general.quote: The ideal has many names, and beauty is but one of them.
general.author: w. somerset maugham

general.quote: As soon as beauty is sought not from religion and love, but for pleasure, it degrades the seeker.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson

general.quote: Beauty is unbearable, drives us to despair, offering us for a minute the glimpse of an eternity that we should like to stretch out over the whole of time.
general.author: albert camus quotes

general.quote: Beauty is not caused. It is.
general.author: emily dickinson

general.quote: Do I love you because you’re beautiful, Or are you beautiful because I love you?
general.author: richard rodgers and oscar hammerstein ii

general.quote: By plucking her petals, you do not gather the beauty of the flower.
general.author: rabindrath tagore

general.quote: A beautiful form is better than a beautiful face; it gives a higher pleasure than statues or pictures; it is the finest of the fine arts.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson

general.quote: There is no cosmetic for beauty like happiness.
general.author: marguerite gardiner

general.quote: Beauty is the mark God sets on virtue: every natural action is graceful, every heroic act is also decent and causes the place and the bystanders to shine.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson quotes

general.quote: I don’t want something special. I want something beautifully plain.
general.author: anne lamott

general.quote: The beauty seen, is partly in him who sees it.
general.author: john christian bovee

general.quote: There is certainly no absolute standard of beauty. That precisely is what makes its pursuit so interesting.
general.author: john kenneth galbraith

general.quote: Remember that the most beautiful things in the world are the most useless; peacocks and lilies for instance.
general.author: john ruskin

general.quote: I’m not ugly, but my beauty is a total creation.
general.author: tyra banks

general.quote: Beauty will be convulsive or will not be at all.
general.author: andre breton

general.quote: Our hearts are drunk with a beauty our eyes could never see.
general.author: george w. russell

general.quote: Everybody needs beauty as well as bread, places to play in and pray in, where nature may heal and give strength to body and soul.
general.author: john muir

general.quote: Strange that the vanity which accompanies beauty — excusable, perhaps, when there is such great beauty, or at any rate understandable — should persist after the beauty was gone.
general.author: mary arnim

general.quote: If I think something is beautiful, there must be somebody out there who will agree with me.
general.author: william kraft

general.quote: Exuberance is beauty.
general.author: william blake

general.quote: Beauty is one of the rare things that do not lead to doubt of God.
general.author: jean anouilh

general.quote: Beauty… when you look into a woman’s eyes and see what is in her heart.
general.author: nate dircks

general.quote: Personal beauty is a greater recommendation than any letter of reference.
general.author: aristotle quotes

general.quote: Plainness has its peculiar temptations quite as much as beauty.
general.author: george eliot

general.quote: Always have something beautiful in sight, even if it’s just a daisy in a jelly glass.
general.author: h. jackson brown, jr.

general.quote: Beauty?… To me it is a word without sense because I do not know where its meaning comes from nor where it leads to.
general.author: pablo picasso quotes

general.quote: The soul that sees beauty may sometimes walk alone.
general.author: johann wolfgang von goethe quotes

general.quote: There is nothing that makes its way more directly to the soul than beauty.
general.author: joseph addison

general.quote: The most beautiful view is the one I share with you.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: Beauty itself is but the sensible image of the infinite.
general.author: george bancroft

general.quote: Beauty in the flesh will continue to rule the world.
general.author: florenz ziegfeld

general.quote: Remember, no effort that we make to attain something beautiful is ever lost.
general.author: helen keller quotes

general.quote: Beauty and folly are generally companions.
general.author: baltasar gracian

general.quote: I don’t like standard beauty – there is no beauty without strangeness.
general.author: karl lagerfeld

general.quote: Beauty is but the sensible image of the infinite. Like truth and justice, it lives within us; like virtue and the moral law, it is a companion of the soul.
general.author: george bancroft

general.quote: In every man’s heart there is a secret nerve that answers to the vibrations of beauty.
general.author: christopher morley

general.quote: Beauty always promises, but never gives anything.
general.author: simone weil

general.quote: Things are beautiful if you love them.
general.author: jean anouilh

general.quote: Beauty soon grows familiar to the lover, fades in his eye, and palls upon the sense.
general.author: joseph addison quotes

general.quote: Beauty… is the shadow of God on the universe.
general.author: gabriela mistral

general.quote: Everything has beauty, but not everyone sees it.
general.author: confucius quotes

general.quote: I’ve never seen a smiling face that was not beautiful.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: Beauty is the promise of happiness.
general.author: stendhal

general.quote: Beauty comes as much from the mind as from the eye.
general.author: grey livingston

general.quote: We each have a sixth sense that is attuned to the oneness dimension in life, providing a means for us to guide our lives in accord with our ideas.
general.author: henry reed

general.quote: Fine sense and exalted sense are not half as useful as common sense. There are forty men of wit for one man of sense. And he that will carry nothing about him but gold will be every day at a loss for readier change.
general.author: alexander pope

general.quote: There is no way in which to understand the world without first detecting it through the radar — net of our senses.
general.author: diane ackerman

general.quote: Whatsoever contradicts my sense, I hate to see, and never can believe.
general.author: wentworth dillon

general.quote: Reason is the cause of our falsification of the evidence of the senses. In so far as the senses show becoming, passing away, change, they do not lie.
general.author: friedrich nietzsche

general.quote: We live on the leash of our senses.
general.author: diane ackerman

general.quote: I never know whether to pity or congratulate a man on coming to his senses.
general.author: william m. thackeray

general.quote: A good head and a good heart are always a formidable combination.
general.author: nelson mandela

general.quote: The five senses are horse sense, innocence, common sense, concupiscence, and nonsense.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: If Poverty is the Mother of Crimes, want of Sense is the Father.
general.author: jean de la bruyere

general.quote: Our ideas are the offspring of our senses; we are not more able to create the form of a being we have not seen, without retrospect to one we know, than we are able to create a new sense.
general.author: henry fuseli

general.quote: No sense makes sense.
general.author: charles manson

general.quote: You are an annihilator of sense.
general.author: william congreve

general.quote: Perfect good sense shuns all extremity, content to couple wisdom with sobriety.
general.author: moliere

general.quote: The senses do not deceive us, but the judgment does.
general.author: johann wolfgang von goethe

general.quote: We are all instruments endowed with feeling and memory. Our senses are so many strings that are struck by surrounding objects and that also frequently strike themselves.
general.author: denis diderot

general.quote: Nothing can cure the soul but the senses, just as nothing can cure the senses but the soul.
general.author: oscar wilde

general.quote: There is nothing a man of good sense dreads in a wife so much as her having more sense than himself.
general.author: henry fielding

general.quote: I am almost frightened out of my seven senses.
general.author: cervantes

general.quote: The difference between life and the movies is that a script has to make sense, and life doesn’t.
general.author: joseph l. mankiewicz

general.quote: Injustice is a sixth sense, and rouses all the others.
general.author: amelia e. barr

general.quote: I think with Blair Witch and The Sixth Sense, people are much more open to something that is different.
general.author: sam mendes

general.quote: Half of us are blind, few of us feel, and we are all deaf.
general.author: sir william osler

general.quote: Between good sense and good taste there is the difference between cause and effect.
general.author: jean de la bruyere

general.quote: I was afraid that by observing objects with my eyes and trying to comprehend them with each of my other senses I might blind my soul altogether.
general.author: socrates
