general.quote: We have five senses in which we glory and which we recognize and celebrate, senses that constitute the sensible world for us. But there are other senses – secret senses, sixth senses, if you will – equally vital, but unrecognized, and unlauded.
general.author: oliver sacks

general.quote: The trouble with men of sense is that they are so dreadfully in earnest all the while.
general.author: christian nestell bovee

general.quote: The sixth sense is at the core of our experiences. It is what makes experiences out of events.
general.author: henry reed

general.quote: The value of money is that with it we can tell any man to go to the devil. It is the sixth sense which enables you to enjoy the other five.
general.author: w. somerset maugham

general.quote: If a man can have only one kind of sense, let him have common sense. If he has that and uncommon sense, too, he is not far from genius.
general.author: henry ward beecher

general.quote: Take care of the sense and the sounds will take care of themselves.
general.author: lewis carroll

general.quote: Blood will tell, but often it tells too much.
general.author: don marquis

general.quote: Blud’s thicker than water.
general.author: sir walter scott

general.quote: The blood of the martyrs is the seed of the church.
general.author: tertullian

general.quote: No one need think that the world can be ruled without blood. The civil sword shall and must be red and bloody.
general.author: martin luther

general.quote: Noble blood! bah! What blood is more noble or so pure as that of the lion? And yet he is only a brute. It is merit, education and virtue, not blood, that lift men above the level of the brutes.
general.author: michael le faucheur

general.quote: The future can be anything we want it to be, providing we have the faith and that we realize that peace, no less than war, required "blood and sweat and tears."
general.author: charles f. kettering

general.quote: In countries where innocent people are dying, the leaders are following their blood rather than their brains.
general.author: nelson mandela

general.quote: The bond that links your true family is not one of blood, but of respect and joy in each other’s life.
general.author: richard bach

general.quote: I have ceased to question stars and books; I have begun to listen to the teaching my blood whispers to me.
general.author: herman hesse

general.quote: A pint of sweat, saves a gallon of blood.
general.author: george s. patton

general.quote: Blood follows blood.
general.author: daniel defoe

general.quote: The best blood will at some time get into a fool or a mosquito.
general.author: austin o’malley

general.quote: Blood is a cleansing and sanctifying thing, and the nation that regards it as the final horror has lost its manhood… there are many things more horrible than bloodshed, and slavery is one of them!
general.author: padraic pearse

general.quote: Peace, above all things, is to be desired, but blood must sometimes be spilled to obtain it on equable and lasting terms.
general.author: andrew jackson

general.quote: Young blood must have its course, lad, and every dog its day.
general.author: charles kingsley

general.quote: There is no glory in battle worth the blood it costs.
general.author: dwight d. eisenhower

general.quote: The patriot’s blood is the seed of Freedom’s tree.
general.author: thomas campbell

general.quote: Sometimes democracy must be bathed in blood.
general.author: augusto pinochet

general.quote: Blood is that fragile scarlet tree we carry within us.
general.author: osbert sitwell

general.quote: Blood alone moves the wheels of history.
general.author: benito mussolini

general.quote: Was the blood which has been shed then so pure?
general.author: antoine barnave

general.quote: I think it’s liquid aggravation that circulates through his veins, and not regular blood.
general.author: charles dickens

general.quote: Blood… ’tis the ink of lovers.
general.author: george chapman

general.quote: Not one drop of blood is left inside my veins that does not throb: I recognize signs of the ancient flame.
general.author: dante

general.quote: Sleep is a reward for some, a punishment for others. For all, it is a sanction.
general.author: comte de lautreamont

general.quote: People who snore always fall asleep first.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: There is nothing like a sleepless couch for a clear vision of one’s environment.
general.author: arnold bennett

general.quote: People who say they sleep like a baby usually don’t have one.
general.author: leo j. burke

general.quote: The best bridge between despair and hope is a good night’s sleep.
general.author: e. joseph cossman

general.quote: He who sleeps half a day has won half a life.
general.author: karl kraus

general.quote: There will be sleeping enough in the grave.
general.author: benjamin franklin

general.quote: If you’re going to do something tonight that you’ll be sorry for in the morning, sleep late.
general.author: henny youngman

general.quote: Sleeplessness is a desert without vegetation or inhabitants.
general.author: jessamyn west

general.quote: Life is something that happens when you can’t get to sleep.
general.author: fran lebowitz

general.quote: The amount of sleep required by the average person is about half an hour more.
general.author: evan esar

general.quote: If you can’t sleep, then get up and do something instead of lying there worrying. It’s the worry that gets you, not the lack of sleep.
general.author: dale carnegie

general.quote: How blessed are some people, whose lives have no fears, no dreads, to whom sleep is a blessing that comes nightly, and brings nothing but sweet dreams.
general.author: bram stoker

general.quote: The amount of sleep required by the average person is five minutes more.
general.author: wilson mizner

general.quote: I divide my time as follows: half the time I sleep, the other half I dream. I never dream when I sleep, for that would be a pity, for sleeping is the highest accomplishment of genius.
general.author: soren kierkegaard

general.quote: Laugh and the world laughs with you, snore and you sleep alone.
general.author: anthony burgess

general.quote: There is no hope for a civilization which starts each day to the sound of an alarm clock.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: Sleep ’til you’re hungry, eat ’til you’re sleepy.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: Sleep is sweet to the labouring man.
general.author: john bunyan

general.quote: Sleep. To lie down and shut out the noise, the fear, the unceasing misery.
general.author: tad williams

general.quote: The worst thing in the world is to try to sleep and not to.
general.author: f. scott fitzgerald

general.quote: The breeze at dawn has secrets to tell you. Do not go back to sleep.
general.author: rumi

general.quote: God has made sleep to be a sponge by which to rub out fatigue. A man’s roots are planted in night as in a soil.
general.author: henry ward beecher

general.quote: Sleep doesn’t help if it’s your soul that’s tired.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: Sleeping is no mean art: for its sake one must stay awake all day.
general.author: friedrich nietzsche

general.quote: S leep is not a waste of time. During sleep, a variety of biological processes take place that restore our bodies and minds.
general.author: nancy foldvary-schaefer

general.quote: Thus we travel from sleep to sleep, learning again to dream.
general.author: nico slate

general.quote: I’m not asleep… but that doesn’t mean I’m awake.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: When every inch of the world is known, sleep may be the only wilderness that we have left.
general.author: louise erdrich

general.quote: Leisure time is that five or six hours when you sleep at night.
general.author: george allen

general.quote: You lose such a lot of time just sleeping!… when you might be just living, you know. It seems such a pity we can’t live nights, too.
general.author: eleanor h. porter

general.quote: No day is so bad it can’t be fixed with a nap.
general.author: carrie snow

general.quote: Sleep is the best meditation.
general.author: dalai lama

general.quote: To achieve the impossible dream, try going to sleep.
general.author: joan klempner

general.quote: The feeling of sleepiness when you are not in bed, and can’t get there, is the meanest feeling in the world.
general.author: edgar watson howe

general.quote: It is one of life’s bitterest truths that bedtime so often arrives just when things are really getting interesting.
general.author: daniel handler

general.quote: The reasons we can’t sleep at night are usually the same reasons we don’t truly live during the day.
general.author: michael xavier

general.quote: Not being able to sleep is terrible. You have the misery of having partied all night… without the satisfaction.
general.author: lynn johnston

general.quote: I have nothing to offer but blood, toil, tears and sweat.
general.author: winston churchill

general.quote: The tree of liberty must be refreshed from time to time with the blood of patriots and tyrants.
general.author: thomas jefferson

general.quote: Blood is a juice of rarest quality.
general.author: johann wolfgang von goethe

general.quote: He who loses not his senses in certain things has no senses to lose.
general.author: ephraim gotthold lessing

general.quote: You cram these words into mine ears, against the stomach of my sense.
general.author: william shakespeare

general.quote: Each day I live in a glass room unless I break it with the thrusting of my senses and pass through the splintered walls to the great landscape.
general.author: mervyn peake

general.quote: Some people, no matter how old they get, never lose their beauty – they merely move it from their faces into their hearts.
general.author: martin buxbaum

general.quote: The idea that happiness could have a share in beauty would be too much of a good thing.
general.author: walter benjamin

general.quote: The best part of beauty is that which no picture can express.
general.author: francis bacon

general.quote: No one is wise or safe, but they that are honest.
general.author: sir walter raleigh

general.quote: The best safety lies in fear.
general.author: william shakespeare

general.quote: Road sense is the offspring of courtesy and the parent of safety.
general.author: australian traffic rule

general.quote: When you have got an elephant by the hind legs and he is trying to run away, it’s best to let him run.
general.author: abraham lincoln

general.quote: A Traveller should have a hog’s nose, deer’s legs, and an ass’s back.
general.author: benjamin franklin

general.quote: Me thinks that the moment my legs begin to move, my thoughts begin to flow.
general.author: henry david thoreau

general.quote: Money is like an arm or a leg – use it or lose it.
general.author: henry ford

general.quote: Coward: One who, in a perilous emergency, thinks with his legs.
general.author: ambrose bierce

general.quote: In the morning a man walks with his whole body; in the evening, only with his legs.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson

general.quote: A conservative is a man with two perfectly good legs who, however, has never learned how to walk forward.
general.author: franklin d. roosevelt a lie stands on one leg, truth on two. ~ benjamin franklin

general.quote: A baby is an angel whose wings decrease as his legs increase.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: A dog may bark, but his legs will never grow longer.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: I prayed for twenty years but received no answer until I prayed with my legs.
general.author: frederick douglass

general.quote: If you call a tail a leg, how many legs does a horse have? Four, calling a tail a leg does not make it a leg.
general.author: abraham lincoln

general.quote: Your body is a temple, but only if you treat it as one.
general.author: astrid alauda

general.quote: The labor of the body frees us from the pains of the mind, and thus makes the poor happy.
general.author: francois de la rochefoucauld

general.quote: The best cure for the body is a quiet mind.
general.author: napoleon bonaparte quotes

general.quote: The body manifests what the mind harbors.
general.author: jerry augustine

general.quote: The body never lies.
general.author: martha graham

general.quote: A feeble body weakens the mind.
general.author: jean jacques rousseau

general.quote: Emotion always has its roots in the unconscious and manifests itself in the body.
general.author: irene claremont de castillejo

general.quote: Few of us have lost our minds, but most of us have long ago lost our bodies.
general.author: ken wilbur

general.quote: Man consists of two parts, his mind and his body, only the body has more fun.
general.author: woody allen

general.quote: It takes more than just a good looking body. You’ve got to have the heart and soul to go with it.
general.author: lee haney

general.quote: Body and mind, like man and wife, do not always agree to die together.
general.author: charles caleb colton

general.quote: I’ve made many good friends in bodybuilding, though there are few I’d trust to oil my back.
general.author: lee labrada

general.quote: The body is an instrument, the mind its function, the witness and reward of its operation.
general.author: george santayana

general.quote: Sometimes your body is smarter than you are.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: Take care of your body. It’s the only place you have to live.
general.author: jim rohn

general.quote: The human body is a machine which winds its own springs.
general.author: julien offroy de la mettrie

general.quote: A woman watches her body uneasily, as though it were an unreliable ally in the battle for love.
general.author: leonard cohen

general.quote: The human body is the only machine for which there are no spare parts.
general.author: hermann m. biggs

general.quote: The body is your temple. Keep it pure and clean for the soul to reside in.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: It is not I who become addicted, it is my body.
general.author: jean cocteau

general.quote: When the belly is empty, the body becomes spirit; and when it is full, the spirit becomes body.
general.author: saadi

general.quote: Modern bodybuilding is ritual, religion, sport, art, and science, awash in Western chemistry and mathematics. Defying nature, it surpasses it.
general.author: camille paglia

general.quote: If the body be feeble, the mind will not be strong.
general.author: thomas jefferson quotes

general.quote: Good for the body is the work of the body, good for the soul the work of the soul, and good for either the work of the other.
general.author: henry david thoreau

general.quote: Work consists of whatever a body is obliged to do, and play consists of whatever a body is not obliged to do.
general.author: mark twain quotes

general.quote: There is nothing the body suffers which the soul may not profit by.
general.author: george meredith

general.quote: Beyond my body my veins are invisible.
general.author: antonio porchia

general.quote: Our bodies are our gardens – our wills are our gardeners.
general.author: william shakespeare quotes

general.quote: The chief function of the body is to carry the brain around.
general.author: thomas a. edison quotes

general.quote: Gracefulness is to the body what understanding is to the mind.
general.author: francois de la rochefoucauld

general.quote: Let me look at the foulness and ugliness of my body. Let me see myself as an ulcerous sore running with every horrible and disgusting poison.
general.author: st. ignatius loyola

general.quote: When we do any good to others, we do as much, or more, good to ourselves.
general.author: benjamin whichcote

general.quote: As the purse is emptied the heart is filled.
general.author: victor hugo

general.quote: Every charitable act is a stepping stone towards heaven.
general.author: henry ward beecher

general.quote: Do something for somebody every day for which you do not get paid.
general.author: albert schweitzer

general.quote: There can be no Christianity where there is no charity.
general.author: charles caleb colton

general.quote: Be charitable and indulgent to everyone but yourself.
general.author: joseph joubert

general.quote: The smallest act of charity shall stand us in great stead.
general.author: francis atterbury

general.quote: Charity is the note that resolves the discord.
general.author: austin o’malley

general.quote: True charity is the desire to be useful to others without thought of recompense.
general.author: emanuel swedenborg

general.quote: No communication or gift can exhaust genius or impoverish charity.
general.author: johann kaspar lavater

general.quote: Charity ever finds in the act reward, and needs no trumpet in the receiver.
general.author: francis beaumont and john fletcher

general.quote: The small charity that comes from the heart is better than the great charity that comes from the head.
general.author: ivan panin

general.quote: Charity that is always beginning at home stays there.
general.author: austin o’malley

general.quote: We are rich only through what we give, and poor only through what we refuse.
general.author: madame anne sophie swetchine

general.quote: In charity there is no excess.
general.author: francis bacon

general.quote: The heart of a girl is like a convent–the holier the cloister, the more charitable the door.
general.author: edward george earle lytton bulwer-lytton

general.quote: That charity which is the perfection and ornament of religion.
general.author: joseph addison

general.quote: It is with charity as with money–the more we stand in need of it, the less we have to give away.
general.author: christian nestell bovee

general.quote: A charitable man is like an apple tree–he gives his fruit and is silent; the philanthropist is like the successful hen.
general.author: austin o’malley

general.quote: In necessary things, unity; in doubtful things, liberty; in all things, charity.
general.author: richard baxter

general.quote: Let them learn first to show pity at home.
general.author: francis beaumont and john fletcher

general.quote: A bone to the dog is not charity. Charity is the bone shared with the dog, when you are just as hungry as the dog.
general.author: jack london

general.quote: Those who minister to poverty and disease are accomplices in the two worst of all crimes.
general.author: george bernard shaw

general.quote: Charity is the root of all good works.
general.author: st. augustine

general.quote: Large charity doth never soil, but only whitens soft white hands.
general.author: james russell lowell

general.quote: The place of charity, like that of God, is everywhere.
general.author: alexandre rodolphe vinet

general.quote: When Charity walks into the lower places of Want, we most distinctly see the purity of her robes.
general.author: eliza cook

general.quote: You must have a genius for charity as well as for anything else.
general.author: henry david thoreau

general.quote: Where charity keeps pace with gain, industry is blessed.
general.author: william penn

general.quote: Our energies are often stimulated by the necessity of supporting a being weaker than ourselves.
general.author: honore de balzac

general.quote: Charity is not one of the virtues practiced on the stock market. The heart of a bank is but one of many viscera.
general.author: honore de balzac

general.quote: Charity. . . is the opium of the privileged.
general.author: chinua achebe

general.quote: The bread of charity is life itself for the needy; he who withholds it is a man of blood.
general.author: ben sira

general.quote: That charity which longs to publish itself ceases to be charity.
general.author: eliza cook

general.quote: Charity and treating begin at home.
general.author: francis beaumont and john fletcher

general.quote: Do not give, as many rich men do, like a hen that lays her egg and then cackles.
general.author: henry ward beecher

general.quote: A woman who wants a charitable heart wants a pure mind.
general.author: thomas chandler haliburton

general.quote: The man who cannot live with charity, sharing other men’s pain, is punished by feeling his own with intolerable anguish.
general.author: cesare pavese

general.quote: Charity is a virtue of the heart, and not of the hands.
general.author: joseph addison

general.quote: The life of a man consists not in seeing visions and in dreaming dreams, but in active charity and in willing service.
general.author: henry wadsworth longfellow

general.quote: While we do our good works let us not forget that the real solution lies in a world in which charity will have become unnecessary.
general.author: chinua achebe

general.quote: The highest exercise of charity is charity towards the uncharitable.
general.author: joseph stevens buckminster charity is the scope of all god’s commands. ~ st. john chrysostom

general.quote: The living need charity more than the dead.
general.author: george arnold

general.quote: Nothing contributes more to make men polite and civilized, than true and genuine Charity.
general.author: wellins calcott

general.quote: Charity creates a multitude of sins.
general.author: oscar wilde

general.quote: All that we send into the lives of others comes back into our own.
general.author: edwin markham

general.quote: Charity isn’t a good substitute for justice.
general.author: jonathan kozol

general.quote: Charity should always be a constant.
general.author: eva larue

general.quote: The worst of charity is that the lives you are asked to preserve are not worth preserving.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson

general.quote: You cannot separate charity and religion.
general.author: charles caleb colton

general.quote: Be charitable before wealth makes thee covetous.
general.author: sir thomas browne

general.quote: I love the body. Flesh is so honest, and organs do not lie.
general.author: candea core-starke

general.quote: Our body is simply a social structure made of many souls.
general.author: friedrich nietzsche

general.quote: The body achieves what the mind believes.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: If God wanted us to be brave, why did He give us legs?
general.author: marvin kitman

general.quote: A lie has no leg, but a scandal has wings.
general.author: thomas fuller

general.quote: Dancing is poetry with arms and legs.
general.author: charles baudelaire

general.quote: Every man should have aunts. They illustrate the triumph of guess work over logic.
general.author: agatha christie

general.quote: Memory is a complicated thing, a relative to truth, but not its twin.
general.author: barbara kingsolver

general.quote: Use the right word and not its second cousin.
general.author: mark twain

general.quote: The best aunts aren’t substitute parents, they’re co-conspirators.
general.author: daryl gregory

general.quote: Only an aunt can give hugs like a mother, can keep secrets like a sister, and share love like a friend.
general.author: author unkown

general.quote: How often we find ourselves turning our backs on our actual friends, that we may go and meet their ideal cousins.
general.author: henry david thoreau

general.quote: Honest criticism is hard to take, especially from a relative, a friend, an acquaintance, or a stranger.
general.author: franklin p. jones

general.quote: An aunt is a safe haven for a child. Someone who will keep your secrets and is always on your side.
general.author: sara sheridan

general.quote: An aunt grows more treasured as time goes by.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: All nieces are brilliant and beautiful… and obviously take after their aunt.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: A niece is a friend given by Nature.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: A cousin is a sister you never had.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: A cousin is a little bit of childhood that can never be lost.
general.author: marion c. garretty

general.quote: To kill a relative of whom you are tired is something. But to inherit his property afterwards, that is genuine pleasure.
general.author: honore de belzac

general.quote: Great sisters get promoted to aunt.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: God made us cousins, chance made us friends.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: Distant relatives are the best kind, and the further the better.
general.author: kin hubbard

general.quote: Visit your Aunt, but not every Day; and call at your Brother’s, but not every night.
general.author: benjamin franklin

general.quote: It is no use telling me that there are bad aunts and good aunts. At the core, they are all alike.
general.author: pelham grenville wodehouse

general.quote: Friendship is the only cement that will ever hold the cousins together.
general.author: woodrow wilson

general.quote: Cousins from the beginning, friends till the end!
general.author: unknown

general.quote: A close relative is one you see occasionally between family funerals.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: A very quiet and tasteful way to be famous is to have a famous relative. Then you can not only be nothing, you can do nothing too.
general.author: p. j. o’rourke

general.quote: If a man’s character is to be abused there’s nobody like a relative to do the business.
general.author: alexander pope

general.quote: A friend who is near and dear may in time become as useless as a relative.
general.author: george ade

general.quote: Cousins are those rare people who ask how we are and then wait to hear the answer.
general.author: ed cunningham

general.quote: Cousins are those childhood playmates who grow up to be forever friends.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: Cousins are many. Best friends are few. What a rare delight to find both in you.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: One loyal friend is worth ten thousand relatives.
general.author: euripides

general.quote: Cousins are different beautiful flowers in the same garden.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: Cousins are cool to see, Impossible to Forget and true to your heart.
general.author: leo farno

general.quote: Aunt ― a double blessing. You love like a parent and act like a friend.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: When brothers agree, no fortress is so strong as their common life.
general.author: antisthenes

general.quote: We came into the world like brother and brother; and now let’s go hand in hand, not one before another.
general.author: william shakespeare

general.quote: Sometimes being a brother is even better than being a superhero.
general.author: marc brown

general.quote: The younger brother must help to pay for the pleasures of the elder.
general.author: jane austen

general.quote: A friend is a brother who was once a bother.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: I don’t believe an accident of birth makes people sisters or brothers. It makes them siblings, gives them mutuality of parentage. Sisterhood and brotherhood is a condition people have to work at.
general.author: maya angelou

general.quote: Visit your Aunt, but not every Day; and call at your Brother’s, but not every night.
general.author: benjamin franklin

general.quote: Our brothers and sisters are there with us from the dawn of our personal stories to the inevitable dusk.
general.author: susan scarf merrell

general.quote: If you want to know how your girl will treat you after marriage, just listen to her talking to her little brother.
general.author: sam levenson

general.quote: It takes three to make a child.
general.author: ee cummings

general.quote: Children are a great comfort to us in our old age, and they help us reach it faster too.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: Children are not casual guests in our home. They have been loaned to us temporarily for the purpose of loving them and instilling a foundation of values on which their future lives will be built.
general.author: dr. james c. dobson

general.quote: I love these little people; and it is not a slight thing when they, who are so fresh from God, love us.
general.author: charles dickens,

general.quote: The finest inheritance you can give to a child is to allow it to make its own way, completely on its own feet.
general.author: isadora duncan

general.quote: Children are poor men’s riches.
general.author: john ray (1627-1705, british naturalist)

general.quote: Children seldom misquote. In fact, they usually repeat word for word what you shouldn’t have said.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: You can learn many things from children. How much patience you have, for instance.
general.author: franklin p. jones

general.quote: If children grew up according to early indications, we should have nothing but geniuses.
general.author: johann wolfgang von goethe

general.quote: There never was a child so lovely, but his mother was glad to get him asleep.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson

general.quote: Hugs can do great amounts of good — especially for children.
general.author: princess diana

general.quote: A rich child often sits in a poor mothers lap.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: What is done to children, they will do to society.
general.author: karl a. menninger

general.quote: The world today is bad… because people don’t talk to the children in the way that the children need.
general.author: pablo casals

general.quote: You know children are growing up when they start asking questions that have answers.
general.author: john plomp

general.quote: Children and drunks always speak the truth.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: It is dangerous to confuse children with angels.
general.author: david fyfe

general.quote: Children find everything in nothing; men find nothing in everything.
general.author: giacomo leopardi

general.quote: We cannot fashion our children after our desires, we must have them and love them as God has given them to us.
general.author: johann wolfgang von goethe

general.quote: Let the child’s first lesson be obedience, and the second will be what thou wilt.
general.author: benjamin franklin

general.quote: If we had paid no more attention to our plants than we have to our children, we would now be living in a jungle of weed.
general.author: luther burbank

general.quote: Who is not attracted by bright and pleasant children, to prattle, to creep, and to play with them?
general.author: epictetus

general.quote: Where children are, there is the golden age.
general.author: novalis

general.quote: Children are given to us to discourage our better emotions.
general.author: saki

general.quote: So long as little children are allowed to suffer, there is no true love in this world.
general.author: isadora duncan

general.quote: A child miseducated is a child lost.
general.author: john f. kennedy

general.quote: There are no seven wonders of the world in the eyes of a child. There are seven million.
general.author: walt streightiff

general.quote: Each child is an adventure into a better life — an opportunity to change the old pattern and make it new.
general.author: hubert h. humphrey

general.quote: Children are very precious. We are blessed to have them, but we are blessed even more if we take care of them and see to their needs.
general.author: delores bennett

general.quote: My best creation is my children.
general.author: diane von furstenberg

general.quote: Children need models rather than critics.
general.author: joseph joubert

general.quote: How little is the promise of the child fulfilled in the man.
general.author: ovid

general.quote: Children always turn to the light.
general.author: david hare

general.quote: The only thing worth stealing is a kiss from a sleeping child.
general.author: joe houldsworth

general.quote: Adults are obsolete children.
general.author: dr. seuss

general.quote: Each day of our lives we make deposits in the memory banks of our children.
general.author: charles swindoll

general.quote: We worry about what a child will become tomorrow, yet we forget that he is someone today.
general.author: stacia tauscher

general.quote: What is a home without children? Quiet.
general.author: henny youngman

general.quote: A child can ask questions that a wise man cannot answer.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: I brought children into this dark world because it needed the light that only a child can bring.
general.author: liz armbruster

general.quote: Before you beat a child, be sure you are not the cause of the offense.
general.author: austin o’malley

general.quote: Children’s talent to endure stems from their ignorance of alternatives.
general.author: maya angelou

general.quote: Always be nice to your children because they are the ones who will choose your rest home.
general.author: phyllis diller

general.quote: Children are the living messages we send to a time we will not see.
general.author: neil postman

general.quote: A child learns to discard his ideals, whereas a grown-up never wears out his short pants.
general.author: karl kraus

general.quote: Your children will see what you’re all about by what you live rather than what you say.
general.author: wayne dyer

general.quote: The child is the father of the man.
general.author: william wordsworth

general.quote: Anyone who thinks the art of conversation is dead ought to tell a child to go to bed.
general.author: robert gallagher

general.quote: When children are doing nothing, they are doing mischief.
general.author: henry fielding

general.quote: Let your children be as so many flowers, borrowed from God. If the flowers die or wither, thank God for a summer loan of them.
general.author: samuel rutherford

general.quote: Some of my best friends are children. In fact, all of my best friends are children.
general.author: j. d. salinger

general.quote: Children make you want to start life over.
general.author: muhammad ali

general.quote: Children in a family are like flowers in a bouquet: there’s always one determined to face in an opposite direction from the way the arranger desires.
general.author: marcelene cox

general.quote: We must teach our children to dream with their eyes open.
general.author: harry edwards

general.quote: The distinctive character of a child is to always live in the tangible present.
general.author: john ruskin

general.quote: I have found the best way to give advice to your children is to find out what they want and then advise them to do it.
general.author: harry s. truman

general.quote: There is not so much comfort in having children as there is sorrow in parting with them.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: What you don’t know takes a lot of explaining to the children.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: Don’t limit a child to your own learning, for he was born in another time.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: Children’s liberation is the next item on our civil rights shopping list.
general.author: letty cottin pogrebin

general.quote: Every child comes with the message that God is not yet discouraged of man.
general.author: rabindranath tagore

general.quote: Do not handicap your children by making their lives easy.
general.author: lazarus long

general.quote: We dont see the passage of time so much in ourselves as in our children.
general.author: hayley foster

general.quote: Children have never been very good at listening to their elders, but they have never failed to imitate them.
general.author: james baldwin

general.quote: Children are curious and are risk takers. They have lots of courage. They venture out into a world that is immense and dangerous. A child initially trusts life and the processes of life.
general.author: john bradshaw

general.quote: For many children, joy comes as the result of mining something unique and wondrous about themselves from some inner shaft.
general.author: thomas j. cottle

general.quote: Give me four years to teach the children and the seed I have sown will never be uprooted.
general.author: vladimir ilyich lenin

general.quote: The best way to keep children at home is to make the home a pleasant atmosphere and let the air out of the tires.
general.author: dorothy parker

general.quote: Children enjoy the present because they have neither a past nor a future.
general.author: jean de la bruyere

general.quote: It is not a bad thing that children should occasionally, and politely, put parents in their place.
general.author: sidonie gabrielle colette

general.quote: The secret of dealing successfully with a child is not to be its parent.
general.author: mel lazarus

general.quote: You see much more of your children once they leave home.
general.author: lucille ball

general.quote: We inevitably doom our children to failure and frustration when we try to set their goals for them.
general.author: dr. jess lair

general.quote: Every child is an artist. The problem is to remain an artist once they grow up.
general.author: pablo picasso

general.quote: A child’s education should begin at least one hundred years before he is born.
general.author: oliver wendell holmes

general.quote: A little less worry over the child and a bit more concern about the world we make for the child to live in.
general.author: adolph meyer

general.quote: Give a little love to a child, and you get a great deal back.
general.author: john ruskin

general.quote: Children need love, especially when they don’t deserve it.
general.author: harold hulbert

general.quote: Too often we give children answers to remember rather than problems to solve.
general.author: roger lewin

general.quote: Children are the keys of paradise.
general.author: richard henry stoddard (

general.quote: To be ignorant of what occurred before you were born is to remain always a child.
general.author: marcus t. cicero

general.quote: With children we must mix gentleness with firmness. They must not always have their own way, but they must not always be thwarted.
general.author: charles haddon spurgeon

general.quote: The best way for a man to train up a child in the way he should go is to travel that way himself.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: The training of children is a profession, where we must know how to waste time in order to save it.
general.author: jean jacques rousseau

general.quote: The first duty to children is to make them happy, If you have not made them so, you have wronged them, No other good they may get can make up for that.
general.author: charles buxton

general.quote: Children make your life important.
general.author: erma bombeck

general.quote: A brother shares childhood memories and grown-up dreams.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: Never make a companion equal to a brother.
general.author: hesiod

general.quote: It was nice growing up with someone like you — someone to lean on, someone to count on… someone to tell on!
general.author: unknown

general.quote: At Christmas, Cousins are the presents under the tree.
general.author: karen decourcey

general.quote: An aunt makes life a little sweeter.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: God gives us our relatives, thank God we can choose our friends.
general.author: ethel watts mumford

general.quote: Create a vision and never let the environment, other people’s beliefs, or the limits of what has been done in the past shape your decisions. Ignore conventional wisdom.
general.author: anthony robbins

general.quote: A vision without a task is but a dream. A task without a vision is drudgery. A vision with a task is the hope of the world.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: Your successful past will block your visions of the future.
general.author: joel a. barker

general.quote: Vision without a task is only a dream. A task without a vision is but drudgery. But vision with a task is a dream fulfilled.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: The vision that you glorify in your mind, the ideal that you enthrone in your heart – this you will build your life by, and this you will become.
general.author: james allen

general.quote: Seeing is not always believing.
general.author: martin luther king, jr.

general.quote: To come to be you must have a vision of Being, a Dream, a Purpose, a Principle. You will become what your vision is.
general.author: peter nivio zarlenga

general.quote: Vision without action is merely a dream. Action without vision just passes the time. Vision with action can change the world.
general.author: joel a. barker

general.quote: Because they had a vision, a desire, and they took action.
general.author: thomas j. vilord

general.quote: I would give all the wealth of the world, and all the deeds of all the heroes, for one true vision.
general.author: henry david thoreau

general.quote: The point of vision and desire are the same.
general.author: wallace stevens

general.quote: We start out in our lives as little children, full of light and the clearest vision.
general.author: brenda ueland

general.quote: The only thing an artist has to remember is to never lose faith in his vision.
general.author: james lee burke

general.quote: Your vision is the promise of what you shall one day be; your ideal is the prophecy of what you shall at last unveil.
general.author: james allen

general.quote: It’s easy to say "no!" when there’s a deeper "yes!" burning inside.
general.author: stephen r. covey

general.quote: We need to give ourselves permission to act out our dreams and visions, not look for more sensations, more phenomena, but live our strongest dreams — even if it takes a lifetime.
general.author: vijali hamilton

general.quote: Vision gives you the impulse to make the picture your own.
general.author: robert collier

general.quote: All successful people are big dreamers. They imagine what their future could be, ideal in every respect, and then they work every day toward their distant vision, that goal or purpose.
general.author: brian tracy

general.quote: A dreamer is one who can only find his way by moonlight, and his punishment is that he sees the dawn before the rest of the world.
general.author: oscar wilde

general.quote: Man cannot aspire if he looked down; if he rise, he must look up.
general.author: samuel smiles

general.quote: A powerful combination to ensure success is having the vision of an eagle and the heart of a lion.
general.author: robert g. allen

general.quote: Vision plus desire equals reality.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: We need to take advantage of the opportunity we have now to create a vision and become great.
general.author: christine gregoire

general.quote: What can any of us do with his talent but try to develop his vision, so that through frequent failures we may learn better what we have missed in the past.
general.author: william carlos

general.quote: Leadership is the capacity to translate vision into reality.
general.author: warren g. bennis

general.quote: Your vision will become clear only when you can look into your own heart. Who looks outside, dreams; who looks inside, awakens.
general.author: carl jung

general.quote: A man to carry on a successful business must have imagination. He must see things as in a vision, a dream of the whole thing.
general.author: charles m. schwab

general.quote: Every age needs men who will redeem the time by living with a vision of the things that are to be.
general.author: adlai e. stevenson

general.quote: The bravest are surely those who have the clearest vision of what is before them.
general.author: thucydides

general.quote: Leaders need to be optimists. Their vision is beyond the present.
general.author: rudy giuliani

general.quote: Necessity can set me helpless on my back, but she cannot keep me there; nor can four walls limit my vision.
general.author: margaret fairless barber

general.quote: If you have a vision, do something with it.
general.author: anthony j. d’angelo

general.quote: Cherish you visions and your dreams as they are the children of your soul; the blue prints of your ultimate achievements.
general.author: napoleon hill

general.quote: Just because a man lacks the use of his eyes doesn’t mean he lacks vision.
general.author: stevie wonder

general.quote: It’s marvelous what you can see when you open your eyes.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: Give us clear vision that we may know where to stand and what to stand for- because unless we stand for something we shall fall for anything.
general.author: peter marshall

general.quote: I do believe I am special. My special gift is my vision, my commitment, and my willingness to do whatever it takes.
general.author: anthony robbins

general.quote: As all Art depends on Vision, so the different kinds of Art depend on the different ways in which minds look at things.
general.author: george henry lewes

general.quote: Who is the wise man? He who sees what’s going to be born.
general.author: solomon

general.quote: Keep your dreams alive. Understand to achieve anything requires faith and belief in yourself, vision, hard work, determination, and dedication. Remember all things are possible for those who believe.
general.author: gail devers

general.quote: If we are to survive, we must have ideas, vision, and courage.
general.author: arthur m. schlesinger, jr.

general.quote: No man that does not see visions will ever realize any high hope or undertake any high enterprise.
general.author: thomas woodrow wilson

general.quote: It is never safe to look into the future with eyes of fear.
general.author: edward h. harriman

general.quote: It’s easy to see, hard to foresee.
general.author: benjamin franklin

general.quote: Vision looks inwards and becomes duty. Vision looks outwards and becomes aspiration. Vision looks upwards and becomes faith.
general.author: stephen s. wise

general.quote: True originality consists not in a new manner but in a new vision.
general.author: edith wharton

general.quote: When you have vision it affects your attitude. Your attitude is optimistic rather than pessimistic.
general.author: charles r. swindoll

general.quote: Every man takes the limits of his own field of vision for the limits of the world.
general.author: arthur schopenhauer

general.quote: Put your vision to reality. Wake Up and Live!
general.author: bob marley

general.quote: One eye sees, the other feels.
general.author: paul klee

general.quote: We lift ourselves by our thought. We climb upon our vision of ourselves. If you want to enlarge your life, you must first enlarge your thought of it and of yourself. Hold the ideal of yourself as you long to be, always everywhere.
general.author: orison swett marden

general.quote: With vision there is no room to be frightened., No reason for intimidation. It’s time to march forward! Let’s be confident and positive!.
general.author: charles r. swindoll

general.quote: The vision is really about empowering workers, giving them all the information about what’s going on so they can do a lot more than they’ve done in the past.
general.author: bill gates

general.quote: A leader has the vision and conviction that a dream can be achieved. He inspires the power and energy to get it done.
general.author: ralph nader

general.quote: A daydreamer is prepared for most things.
general.author: joyce carol oates

general.quote: Vision is the true creative rhythm.
general.author: robert delaunay

general.quote: When I think of vision, I have in mind the ability to see above and beyond the majority.
general.author: charles swindoll

general.quote: If I have seen further than others, it is by standing upon the shoulders of giants.
general.author: sir isaac newton

general.quote: Tomorrow belongs to those who have vision today!
general.author: unknown

general.quote: Every moment is a golden one for him who has the vision to recognize it as such.
general.author: henry miller

general.quote: If you want a vision of the future, imagine a boot stamping on a human face — forever.
general.author: george orwell

general.quote: Throughout the centuries there were men who took first steps, down new roads, armed with nothing but their own vision.
general.author: ayn rand

general.quote: Never be afraid to sit awhile and think.
general.author: lorraine hansbury

general.quote: Keep your feet on the ground and keep reaching for the stars.
general.author: casey kasem

general.quote: We are limited, not by our abilities, but by our vision.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: Faith is the vision of the heart; it sees God in the dark as well as in the day.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: The very essence of leadership is that you have to have vision. You can’t blow an uncertain trumpet.
general.author: theodore m. hesburgh

general.quote: The cities and mansions that people dream of are those in which they finally live.
general.author: lewis mumford

general.quote: If the vision is there, the means will follow.
general.author: faith popcorn

general.quote: We go where our vision is.
general.author: joseph edward murphy

general.quote: As selfishness and complaint pervert and cloud the mind, so love with its joy clears and sharpens the vision.
general.author: helen keller

general.quote: The only limits are, as always, those of vision.
general.author: james broughton

general.quote: Gratitude makes sense of our past, brings peace for today, and creates a vision for tomorrow.
general.author: melody beattie

general.quote: Vision is the art of seeing things invisible.
general.author: jonathan swift

general.quote: In order to get somewhere in life, you need to have a vision. The vision brings you to the table. Without a vision, you just do what everybody else does and you are just there.
general.author: michael schenker

general.quote: A dream is your creative vision for your life in the future. You must break out of your current comfort zone and become comfortable with the unfamiliar and the unknown.
general.author: denis waitley

general.quote: If only we could pull out our brain and use only our eyes.
general.author: pablo picasso

general.quote: America was established not to create wealth but to realize a vision, to realize an ideal – to discover and maintain liberty among men.
general.author: woodrow wilson

general.quote: It is a terrible thing to see and have no vision.
general.author: helen keller

general.quote: Unless you have some goals, I don’t think there’s any way to get above the pack. My vision was always well beyond what I had any reason to expect.
general.author: john fuqua

general.quote: You can’t hit a target you cannot see and you cannot see a target you do not have.
general.author: zig ziglar

general.quote: A vision is not just a picture of what could be; it is an appeal to our better selves, a call to become something more.
general.author: rosabeth moss kanter

general.quote: Worse than being blind would be to be able to see but not have any vision.
general.author: helen keller

general.quote: Vision — It reaches beyond the thing that is, into the conception of what can be. Imagination gives you the picture. Vision gives you the impulse to make the picture your own.
general.author: robert collier

general.quote: The best vision is insight.
general.author: malcolm s. forbes

general.quote: It takes someone with a vision of the possibilities to attain new levels of experience. Someone with the courage to live his dreams.
general.author: les brown

general.quote: Faith is power to believe and power to see…
general.author: prentice mulford

general.quote: Leaders establish the vision for the future and set the strategy for getting there.
general.author: john p. kotter

general.quote: We need to learn to set our course by the stars, not by the lights of every passing ship.
general.author: omar nelson bradley

general.quote: The only thing worse than being blind is having sight but no vision.
general.author: helen keller

general.quote: Celebrity is the chastisement of merit and the punishment of talent.
general.author: emily dickinson

general.quote: We may not always get what we want, but surely we will get what we deserve.
general.author: doug horton

general.quote: The best evidence of merit is a cordial recognition of it whenever and wherever it may be found.
general.author: christian nestell bovee

general.quote: Honest people will respect us for our merit: the public, for our luck.
general.author: francois de la rochefoucauld

general.quote: The favor of princes does not preclude the existence of merit, and yet does not prove that it exists.
general.author: jean de la bruyere

general.quote: Your idea may or may not have merit. The key is to get started.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: Evidently the merit depends on the result of the work.
general.author: henryk sienkiewicz

general.quote: The art of being able to make a good use of moderate abilities wins esteem and often confers more reputation than real merit.
general.author: francois duc de la rochefoucauld,

general.quote: ‘Tis not in mortals to command success, but we’ll do more, Sempronius, we’ll deserve it.
general.author: joseph addison

general.quote: Wanting to work is so rare a merit that it should be encouraged.
general.author: abraham lincoln

general.quote: Where we can compete on merit, we do very well.
general.author: jim barksdale

general.quote: Man is obviously made for thinking. Therein lies all his dignity and his merit; and his whole duty is to think as he ought.
general.author: blaise pascal

general.quote: On their own merits modest men are dumb.
general.author: george colman

general.quote: Merit has rarely risen of itself, but a pebble or a twig is often quite sufficient for it to spring from to the highest ascent. There is usually some baseness before there is any elevation.
general.author: walter savage landor

general.quote: The mark of extraordinary merit is to see those most envious of it constrained to praise.
general.author: francois duc de la rochefoucauld

general.quote: There are few cases in which mere popularity should be considered a proper test of merit; but the case of song-writing is, I think, one of the few.
general.author: edgar allan poe

general.quote: Merit challenges envy.
general.author: john dryden

general.quote: Those who do not know how to live must make a merit of dying.
general.author: george bernard shaw

general.quote: There is merit without elevation, but there is no elevation without some merit.
general.author: francois duc de la rochefoucauld,

general.quote: There is a proud modesty in merit.
general.author: john dryden

general.quote: The sufficiency of merit is to know that my merit is not sufficient.
general.author: francis quarles

general.quote: Charm strikes the sight, but merit wins the soul.
general.author: alexander pope

general.quote: Those who mistake their good luck for their merit are inevitably bound for disaster.
general.author: christopher herold

general.quote: How vain, without the merit, is the name.
general.author: homer

general.quote: Eminence without merit earns deference without esteem.
general.author: sebastien-roch nicolas de chamfort

general.quote: Contemporaries appreciate the person rather than their merit; posterity will regard the merit rather than the person.
general.author: charles caleb colton

general.quote: Merit is often an obstacle to fortune; the reason is it produces two bad effects, envy and fear.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: Merit is born with men; happy those with whom it dies!
general.author: christiana of sweden

general.quote: The merit of originality is not novelty; it is sincerity.
general.author: thomas carlyle

general.quote: True merit is like a river, the deeper it is, the less noise it makes.
general.author: edward f. halifax

general.quote: Fame, we may understand, is no sure test of merit, but only a probability of such; it is an accident, not a property of man.
general.author: thomas carlyle

general.quote: Real merit requires as much labor, to be placed in a true light, as humbug to be elevated to an unworthy eminence; only the success of the false is temporary, that of the true, immortal.
general.author: francis alexander durivage

general.quote: Merit was ever modest known.
general.author: john gay

general.quote: Mere bashfulness without merit is awkwardness.
general.author: joseph addison

general.quote: There are people who in spite of their merit disgust us and others who please us in spite of their faults.
general.author: francois de la rochefoucauld

general.quote: True merit, like a river, the deeper it is, the less noise it makes.
general.author: charles montagu halifax

general.quote: Merit, however inconsiderable, should be sought for and rewarded. Methods are the master of masters.
general.author: charles maurice de talleyrand

general.quote: Men of real merit, whose noble and glorious deeds we are ready to acknowledge are not yet to be endured when they vaunt their own actions.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: It is more honorable to be raised to a throne than to be born to one. Fortune bestows the one, merit obtains the other.
general.author: francesco petrarch

general.quote: It is of no consequence of what parents a man is born, as long as he be a man of merit.
general.author: horace

general.quote: The same principle leads us to neglect a man of merit that induces us to admire a fool.
general.author: jean de la bruyere

general.quote: An ingenuous, mind feels in unmerited praise, the bitterest reproof.
general.author: walter savage landor

general.quote: Whoever gains the palm by merit, let him hold it.
general.author: lord horatio nelson

general.quote: Modesty is the chastity of merit, the virginity of noble souls.
general.author: madame de girardin

general.quote: Arrogance on the part of the meritorious is even more offensive to us than the arrogance of those without merit: for merit itself is offensive.
general.author: friedrich nietzsche

general.quote: I love the lineage of heroes, but I love merit more.
general.author: frederick ii

general.quote: The world rewards the appearance of merit oftener than merit itself.
general.author: francois duc de la rochefoucauld

general.quote: Here is a field open for talent; and here, merit will a have certain favor, and industry is graced with its due reward.
general.author: claudius

general.quote: Fondly we think we honor merit then, when we but praise ourselves in other men.
general.author: alexander pope

general.quote: Perpetual modernism is the measure of merit in every work of art.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson

general.quote: Ambition is pitiless. Any merit that it cannot use it finds despicable.
general.author: joseph joubert

general.quote: Real merit of any kind cannot long be concealed; it will be discovered, and nothing can depreciate it, but a man’s exhibiting it himself. It may not always be rewarded as it ought; but it will always be known.
general.author: philip dormer stanhope

general.quote: Reputation is only a candle, of wavering and uncertain flame, and easily blown out, but it is the light by which the world looks for and finds merit.
general.author: james russell lowell

general.quote: There is a season for man’s merit as well as for fruit.
general.author: francois duc de la rochefoucauld

general.quote: The silence that accepts merit as the most natural thing in the world is the highest applause.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson

general.quote: We should try to succeed by merit, not by favor. He who does well will always have patrons enough.
general.author: plautus

general.quote: The world more frequently recompenses the appearance of merit, than merit itself.
general.author: francois duc de la rochefoucauld

general.quote: Reputation is an idle and most false imposition; oft got without merit, and lost without deserving.
general.author: william shakespear

general.quote: Men sometimes feel injured by praise because it assigns a limit to their merit; few people are modest enough not to take offense that one appreciates them.
general.author: marquis de vauvenargues

general.quote: There is merit in the attempt, and a whole lot accomplished along the way.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: Nature makes merit, and fortune puts it to work.
general.author: francois duc de la rochefoucauld

general.quote: It never occurs to fools that merit and good fortune are closely united.
general.author: johann wolfgang von goethe

general.quote: Contemporaries appreciate the man rather than his merit; posterity will regard the merit rather than the man.
general.author: charles caleb colton

general.quote: Good birth is a fine thing, but the merit is our ancestors.
general.author: plutarch

general.quote: Nature gives you the face you have at twenty; it is up to you to merit the face you have at fifty.
general.author: coco chanel

general.quote: Love exalts as much as glory does.
general.author: juliette drouet

general.quote: All glory comes from daring to begin.
general.author: eugene f. ware

general.quote: We are motivated by a keen desire for praise, and the better a man is the more he is inspired by glory. The very philosophers themselves, even in those books which they write in contempt of glory, inscribe their names.
general.author: marcus t. cicero

general.quote: There’s no glory like those who save their country.
general.author: lord alfred tennyson

general.quote: It is indeed a desirable thing to be well-descended, but the glory belongs to our ancestors.
general.author: plutarch

general.quote: A Victory without danger is a triumph without glory.
general.author: pierre corneille

general.quote: Every man must be content with that glory which he may have at home.
general.author: boethius

general.quote: Politics is a profession where the paths of glory lead but to the gravy.
general.author: billy boy franklin

general.quote: The glory of each generation is to make its own precedents.
general.author: belva lockwood

general.quote: The deed is everything, the glory is naught.
general.author: goethe

general.quote: True glory takes root, and even spreads; all false pretences, like flowers, fall to the ground; nor can any counterfeit last long.
general.author: marcus t. cicero

general.quote: For glory gives herself only to those who have always dreamed of her.
general.author: charles de gaulle

general.quote: The greatest Glory of a free-born People is to transmit that Freedom to their Children.
general.author: william havard

general.quote: True glory lies in noble deeds.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: Glory is the child of peril.
general.author: tobias g. smollett

general.quote: The fire of glory is the torch of the mind.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: We exaggerate the glory of some men in order to detract from that of others.
general.author: francois de la rochefoucauld

general.quote: Language has created the word loneliness to express the pain of being alone, and the word solitude to express the glory of being alone.
general.author: paul tillich

general.quote: Glory paid to our ashes comes too late.
general.author: marcus valerius martial

general.quote: The glory of friendship is not in the outstretched hand, nor the kindly smile, nor the joy of companionship; it is in the spiritual inspiration that comes to one when he discovers that someone else believes in him and is willing to trust him.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson

general.quote: There is no greater glory than love, nor any greater punishment than jealously.
general.author: lope de vega

general.quote: I glory in this world of men and women, torn with troubles, yet living on to love and laugh through it all.
general.author: carl sandburg

general.quote: Love of glory can only create a great hero; contempt of glory creates a great man.
general.author: charles maurice de talleyrand

general.quote: The paths of glory lead but to the grave.
general.author: thomas gray

general.quote: The chief glory of every people arises from its authors.
general.author: samuel johnson

general.quote: All honor to him who shall win the prize. The world has cried for a thousand years. But to him who tries and fails and dies, I give great honor and glory and tears.
general.author: joaquin miller

general.quote: Real glory springs from the silent conquest of ourselves.
general.author: joseph p. thompson

general.quote: The noblest spirit is most strongly attracted by the love of glory.
general.author: marcus t. cicero

general.quote: There is many a boy here today who looks on war as all glory; but boys, it is all hell.
general.author: william t. sherman

general.quote: There is a glory in a great mistake.
general.author: nathalia crane

general.quote: Thought is great and swift and free, the light of the world, the chief glory of man.
general.author: bertrand russell

general.quote: We are all motivated by a keen desire for praise, and the better a man is, the more he is inspired by glory.
general.author: marcus t. cicero

general.quote: Glory is largely a theatrical concept. There is no striving for glory without a vivid awareness of an audience.
general.author: eric hoffer

general.quote: To conquer without risk is to triumph without glory.
general.author: pierre corneille

general.quote: I have lived long enough to satisfy both nature and glory.
general.author: julius caesar

general.quote: The glory of a nation and an age is always the work of a few great persons, and it disappears with them.
general.author: baron grimm

general.quote: You can’t appreciate home till you’ve left it, money till it’s spent your wife till she’s joined a woman’s club, nor Old Glory till you see it hanging on a broomstick on the shanty of a consul in a foreign town.
general.author: henry o. porter

general.quote: And they who for their country die shall fill an honored grave, for glory lights the soldier’s tomb, and beauty weeps the brave.
general.author: joseph drake

general.quote: Work is not man’s punishment! It is his reward and his strength, his glory and his pleasure.
general.author: george sand

general.quote: Think where man’s glory most begins and ends, and say my glory was I had such friends.
general.author: william butler yeats

general.quote: Sudden glory is the passion which makes those grimaces called laughter.
general.author: thomas hobbes

general.quote: Glory, built on selfish principles, is shame and guilt.
general.author: william cowper

general.quote: Glory follows virtue as if it were its shadow.
general.author: marcus t. cicero

general.quote: The medals don’t mean anything and the glory doesn’t last. It’s all about your happiness. The rewards are going to come, but my happiness is just loving the sport and having fun performing.
general.author: jackie joyner-kersee

general.quote: And say my glory was I had such friends.
general.author: william butler yeats

general.quote: If the relationship of father to son could really be reduced to biology, the whole earth would blaze with the glory of fathers and sons.
general.author: james baldwin

general.quote: Grace is but glory begun, and glory is but grace perfected.
general.author: jonathan edwards

general.quote: I have touched the highest point of all my greatness, and from that full meridian of my glory I haste now to my setting.
general.author: william shakespeare

general.quote: Look at everything as though you were seeing it for the first time or the last time. Then your time on earth will be filled with glory.
general.author: betty smith

general.quote: Military glory — the attractive rainbow that rises in showers of blood.
general.author: abraham lincoln

general.quote: Let authors write for glory and reward. The truth is well paid when she is sung and heard.
general.author: james j. corbett

general.quote: I will not by the noise of bloody wars and the dethroning of kings advance you to glory: but by the gentle ways of peace and love.
general.author: thomas traherne

general.quote: Glory comes too late, after one has been reduced to ashes.
general.author: marcus valerius martial

general.quote: Keep us, Lord, so awake in the duties of our calling that we may sleep in thy peace and wake in thy glory.
general.author: john donne

general.quote: The nearest way to glory is to strive to be what you wish to be thought to be.
general.author: socrates

general.quote: True glory consists in doing what deserves to be written; in writing what deserves to be read; and in so living as to make the world happier and better for our living in it.
general.author: pliny the elder

general.quote: Glory is like a circle in the water, which never ceaseth to enlarge itself, till, by broad spreading, it disperse to naught.
general.author: william shakespeare

general.quote: Love of glory, fear of shame, greed for fortune, the desire to make life agreeable and comfortable, and the wish to depreciate others — all of these are often the causes of the bravery that is spoken so highly of by men.
general.author: francois de la rochefoucauld

general.quote: Who tracks the steps of glory to the grave?
general.author: lord byron

general.quote: Valor, glory, firmness, skill, generosity, steadiness in battle and ability to rule — these constitute the duty of a soldier. They flow from his own nature.
general.author: bhagavad gita

general.quote: We rise in glory as we sink in pride.
general.author: andrew young

general.quote: The love of glory gives an immense stimulus.
general.author: ovid

general.quote: Our greatest glory is not in never failing, but in rising up every time we fail.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson

general.quote: Boasting of glory does not make glory, and singing in the dark does not dispel fear.
general.author: king hussein

general.quote: Glory is fleeting, but obscurity is forever.
general.author: napoleon bonaparte

general.quote: Don’t gain the world and lose your soul; wisdom is better than silver or gold.
general.author: bob marley

general.quote: Everywhere in life, the true question is not what we gain, but what we do.
general.author: thomas carlyle

general.quote: When you gain maximum knowledge in any area of work and put it into practice, no power.
general.author: sunday adelaja

general.quote: A rolling stone gathers no moss, but it gains a certain polish.
general.author: oliver herford

general.quote: What you gain here, you lose on the other side.
general.author: dejan stojanovic

general.quote: Force may subdue, but love gains, and he that forgives first wins the laurel.
general.author: william penn

general.quote: All men’s gains are the fruit of venturing.
general.author: herodotus

general.quote: To gain that which is worth having, it may be necessary to lose everything else.
general.author: bernadette devlin

general.quote: Men of action get the largest fraction of benefits.
general.author: constance chuks friday

general.quote: Losing something is difficult while gaining something is easier. So try to gain beauty and make your life prettier.
general.author: debasish mridha

general.quote: He is no fool who gives what he cannot keep to gain what he cannot lose.
general.author: jim elliot

general.quote: Don’t run away from the gains because it comes with pains. If you ever love to go for the sweet honey, be ready to be stung by a busy bee! Go for it anyway!
general.author: israelmore ayivor

general.quote: Don’t fight a battle if you don’t gain anything by winning.
general.author: erwin rommel

general.quote: Remain open-minded, even when you believe yourself to be a king among peasants. You never know what blessings can be gained or crises averted just by listening.
general.author: a.j. darkholme

general.quote: Without change there is no gain, but every change brings some pain.
general.author: debasish mridha

general.quote: You may be able to conquer the whole world and gain everything in action, but you’ll live in torment if you can’t find peace of mind and satisfaction.
general.author: mouloud benzadi

general.quote: The easiest way to gain someone’s trust is to deserve it. This should be pretty easy, assuming you’re just being you and being real. Minimal effort too.
general.author: ashly lorenzana

general.quote: He only earns his freedom and his life who takes them every day by storm.
general.author: johann wolfgang von goethe quotes

general.quote: Counts his sure gains, and hurries back for more.
general.author: james montgomery

general.quote: The end of labor is to gain leisure.
general.author: aristotle quotes

general.quote: Great gains come from setting one’s brains into the right frames of thinking.
general.author: constance chuks friday

general.quote: Keep Inspiring everyday, because when you retire, you will lose desire, become tired, and expire.
general.author: michael bassey johnson

general.quote: An evil gain equals a loss.
general.author: publilius syrus

general.quote: And gain is gain, however small.
general.author: robert browning

general.quote: He who seeks for gain, must be at some expense.
general.author: plautus

general.quote: Beware of fame; for when they come for you, they come not to give, but for to gain.
general.author: justin k. mcfarlane beau

general.quote: Greed robs you of more value than the price of what you’ve gained.
general.author: a.j. darkholme

general.quote: Shake hands with today; it is here already. Bid farewell to yesterday; it’s gone already. Never let yesterday’s pain rob you of today’s gains. Drive yourself positively!
general.author: israelmore ayivor

general.quote: In solitude the mind gains strength and learns to lean upon itself.
general.author: laurence sterne

general.quote: And if you mean to profit, learn to please.
general.author: charles churchill

general.quote: Rash oaths, whether kept or broken, frequently produce guilt.
general.author: samuel johnson

general.quote: When I place my hand on the Bible and take the oath of office, that oath becomes my highest promise to God.
general.author: mitt romney

general.quote: You can have no oath registered in heaven to destroy the Government; while I shall have the most solemn one to "preserve, protect, and defend" it.
general.author: abraham lincoln

general.quote: A liar is always lavish of oaths.
general.author: pierre corneille

general.quote: Of all men, a philosopher should be no swearer; for an oath, which is the end of controversies in law, cannot determine any here, where reason only must induce.
general.author: sir thomas browne

general.quote: It is useless to hold a person to anything he says while he is in love, drunk, or running for office.
general.author: shirley maclaine

general.quote: An oath! why, it is the traffic of the soul, it is law within a man; the seal of faith, the bond of every conscience; unto whom we set our thoughts like hands.
general.author: thomas dekker

general.quote: Oaths are but words, and words but wind.
general.author: samuel butler

general.quote: The best way to keep one’s word is not to give it.
general.author: napoleon bonaparte

general.quote: It’s a hard world, neighbors, if a man’s oath must be his master.
general.author: john dryden

general.quote: Recognized probity is the surest of all oaths.
general.author: madame suzanne curchod necker

general.quote: There is no such thing as a lovers’ oath.
general.author: plato

general.quote: In lapidary inscriptions a man is not upon oath.
general.author: samuel johnson

general.quote: Oaths are the counterfeit money with which we pay the sacrifice of love.
general.author: ninon de l’enclos

general.quote: Never take a solemn oath. People think you mean it.
general.author: norman douglas

general.quote: When a man takes an oath… he’s holding his own self in his own hands. Like water. And if he opens his fingers then — he needn’t hope to find himself again.
general.author: robert bolt

general.quote: It is not the oath that makes us believe the man, but the man the oath.
general.author: aeschylus

general.quote: Oaths are the fossils of piety.
general.author: george santayana

general.quote: Unless commitment is made, there are only promises and hopes; but no plans.
general.author: peter f. drucker

general.quote: Put more trust in nobility of character than in an oath.
general.author: solon

general.quote: I take the official oath to-day with no mental reservations and with no purpose to construe the Constitution by any hypercritical rules.
general.author: abraham lincoln

general.quote: Thou ought to be nice, even to superstition, in keeping thy promises, and therefore equally cautious in making them.
general.author: thomas fuller

general.quote: I never saw any good that came of telling truth.
general.author: john dryden

general.quote: Men ardently pursue truth, assuming it will be angels’ bread when found.
general.author: w. macneile dixon

general.quote: Believe those who are seeking the truth. Doubt those who find it.
general.author: andre gide

general.quote: Theories are private property, but truth is common stock.
general.author: charles caleb colton

general.quote: Don’t keep searching for the truth, just let go of your opinions.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: The truth does not change according to our ability to stomach it.
general.author: flannery o’connor

general.quote: Pure truth, like pure gold, has been found unfit for circulation, because men have discovered that it is far more convenient to adulterate the truth, than to refine themselves.
general.author: charles caleb colton

general.quote: Great truths are portions of the soul of man.
general.author: james russell lowell

general.quote: There is no Truth. There is only the truth within each moment.
general.author: ramana maharshi

general.quote: Man has always sacrificed truth to his vanity, comfort and advantage. He lives… by make-believe.
general.author: w. somerset maugham

general.quote: Truth and Good are one; and Beauty dwells in them, and they in her.
general.author: mark akenside

general.quote: Truth — there’s no such thing.
general.author: tankred dorst

general.quote: Truth makes all things beautiful.
general.author: edward counsel

general.quote: When we walk towards the sun of Truth, all shadows are cast behind us.
general.author: henry wadsworth longfellow

general.quote: Truth is the breath of life to human society. It is the food of the immortal spirit. Yet a single word of it may kill a man as suddenly as a drop of prussic acid.
general.author: oliver wendell holmes

general.quote: Truth will only make you unpopular.
general.author: wolfgang borchert

general.quote: In a free society, there comes a time when the truth — however hard it may be to hear, however impolitic it may seem to say — must be told.
general.author: al gore

general.quote: Truth will ultimately prevail where there is pains taken to bring it to light.
general.author: george washington quotes

general.quote: There is nothing so strong or safe in an emergency of life as the simple truth.
general.author: charles dickens quotes

general.quote: Truth breeds hatred.
general.author: bias of priene

general.quote: All great truths are simple in final analysis, and easily understood; if they are not, they are not great truths.
general.author: napoleon hill

general.quote: The naked truth is always better than the best-dressed lie.
general.author: ann landers

general.quote: The truth won’t set us free – until we develop the skills and the habit and the talent and the moral courage to use it.
general.author: margaret heffernan

general.quote: The greatest truths are the simplest: so likewise are the greatest men.
general.author: augustus william hare

general.quote: There is no god higher than truth.
general.author: mahatma gandhi quotes

general.quote: Truth has rough flavours if we bite it through.
general.author: george eliot

general.quote: It’s no wonder that truth is stranger than fiction. Fiction has to make sense.
general.author: mark twain
