general.quote: The truth … is a beautiful and terrible thing and should therefore be treated with great caution.
general.author: j. k. rowling

general.quote: Man is least himself when he talks in his own person. Give him a mask, and he will tell you the truth.
general.author: oscar wilde

general.quote: They frequently find the truth who do not seek it, they who do, frequently lose it.
general.author: fanny kemble

general.quote: If you shut up truth and bury it under the ground, it will but grow, and gather to itself such explosive power that the day it bursts through it will blow up everything in its way.
general.author: emile zola

general.quote: There is nothing as boring as the truth.
general.author: charles bukowski

general.quote: It is a terrible thing for a man to find out suddenly that all his life he has been speaking nothing but the truth.
general.author: oscar wilde

general.quote: Truth is a great flirt.
general.author: franz liszt

general.quote: The pure and simple truth is rarely pure and never simple.
general.author: oscar wilde quotes

general.quote: Truth has very few friends and those few are suicides.
general.author: antonio porchia

general.quote: Nobody ever sees truth except in fragments.
general.author: henry ward beecher

general.quote: There are trivial truths and the great truths. The opposite of a trivial truth is plainly false. The opposite of a great truth is also true.
general.author: niels bohr

general.quote: There must be repressed truth even in lies.
general.author: stanislaw ignacy witkiewicz

general.quote: The truth will set you free, but first it will make you miserable.
general.author: james a. garfield

general.quote: If you cannot find the truth right where you are, where else do you expect to find it?
general.author: dōgen zenji

general.quote: Truth has no path. Truth is living and, therefore, changing.
general.author: bruce lee

general.quote: The truth sets you free. It’s a very liberating thing, when you say this is who I am warts and all and then you can just get on with life. It’s amazing.
general.author: geri halliwell

general.quote: When I tell any truth, it is not for the sake of convincing those who do not know it, but for the sake of defending those that do.
general.author: william blake

general.quote: Truth is rarely writ in ink; it lives in nature.
general.author: martin h. fischer

general.quote: Truth has a way of waiting for us to come forth and confess the lies of our lives. It has a way of gazing at us until we can bear the look of truth no longer.
general.author: macrina wiederkehr

general.quote: Truth is within ourselves.
general.author: robert browning

general.quote: The truth isn’t always beauty, but the hunger for it is.
general.author: nadine gordimer

general.quote: Truth doesn’t always heal a wounded soul.
general.author: maxim gorky

general.quote: Truth is the highest thing that man may keep.
general.author: geoffrey chaucer

general.quote: Truth, like gold, is to be obtained not by its growth, but by washing away from it all that is not gold.
general.author: leo tolstoy

general.quote: Truth is on the march; nothing can stop it now.
general.author: emile zola

general.quote: Human truth is always soiled with falsehood.
general.author: austin o’malley

general.quote: Truth only reveals itself when one gives up all preconceived ideas.
general.author: shoseki

general.quote: Truth crushed to earth shall rise again.
general.author: william cullen bryant

general.quote: It will never be possible by pure reason to arrive at some absolute truth.
general.author: werner heisenberg

general.quote: Whoever is careless with the truth in small matters cannot be trusted with important matters.
general.author: albert einstein quotes

general.quote: The greatest truths are the simplest, and so are the greatest men.
general.author: julius charles hare

general.quote: There is no religion higher than the truth.
general.author: mark frost

general.quote: Truth lives in the cellar, error on the doorstep.
general.author: austin o’malley

general.quote: Only enemies speak the truth; friends and lovers lie endlessly, caught in the web of duty.
general.author: stephen king

general.quote: The pursuit of truth will set you free; even if you never catch up with it.
general.author: clarence darrow

general.quote: Truth is universal. Perception of truth is not.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: No real gentleman will tell the naked truth in the presence of ladies.
general.author: mark twain quotes

general.quote: The truth is never dangerous. Except when told.
general.author: philip moeller

general.quote: Truth never hurts the teller.
general.author: robert browning

general.quote: Tell the truth, or someone will tell it for you.
general.author: edgar watson howe

general.quote: Truth is like the sun. You can shut it out for a time, but it ain’t goin’ away.
general.author: elvis presley

general.quote: Facing the truth really will set you free.
general.author: oprah winfrey quotes

general.quote: Truth sits upon the lips of dying men.
general.author: mathew arnold

general.quote: If you tell the truth you don’t have to remember anything.
general.author: mark twain

general.quote: Where one door closes, another opens.
general.author: don quijote

general.quote: The will to win, the desire to succeed, the urge to reach your full potential… these are the keys that will unlock the door to personal excellence.
general.author: confucius quotes

general.quote: There are things known and things unknown and in between are the doors.
general.author: jim morrison

general.quote: If the doors of perception were cleansed everything would appear to man as it is, infinite.
general.author: william blake

general.quote: Follow your bliss and the universe will open doors where there were only walls.
general.author: joseph campbell

general.quote: Opportunity does not knock; it presents itself when you beat down the door.
general.author: kyle chandler

general.quote: Death is a door life opens.
general.author: adela rogers st. johns

general.quote: We keep moving forward, opening new doors, and doing new things, because we’re curious and curiosity keeps leading us down new paths.
general.author: walt disney quotes

general.quote: A clever, imaginative, humorous request can open closed doors and closed minds.
general.author: percy ross

general.quote: When one door closes another door opens; but we so often look so long and so regretfully upon the closed door, that we do not see the ones which open for us.
general.author: alexander graham bell

general.quote: Listen, real poetry doesn’t say anything; it just ticks off the possibilities. Opens all doors. You can walk through any one that suits you.
general.author: jim morrison

general.quote: God enters by a private door into every individual.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson quotes

general.quote: Doorman — a genius who can open the door of your car with one hand, help you in with the other, and still have one left for the tip.
general.author: dorothy kilgallen

general.quote: Education is the key to unlock the golden door of freedom.
general.author: george washington carver

general.quote: Opportunities comes from knocking on doors until they open.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: It is sometimes the man who opens the door who is the last to enter the room.
general.author: elizabeth bibesco

general.quote: When the doors of opportunity swing open, we must make sure that we are not too drunk or too indifferent to walk through.
general.author: jesse jackson

general.quote: Well, well, my boy, if good luck knocks at your door, don’t you put your head out at window and tell it to be gone about its business, that’s all.
general.author: george eliot

general.quote: Prayer is the key that opens the door to all that is good in life.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: Joy, temperance, and repose, slam the door on the doctor’s nose.
general.author: henry wadsworth longfellow

general.quote: The outward man is the swinging door; the inner man is the still hinge.
general.author: meister eckhart

general.quote: Though you are disappointed is hope; never let hope fail you! Though one door is shut, there are thousands still open to you.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: You are opportunity, and you must knock on the door leading to your destiny.
general.author: maxwell maltz

general.quote: Fortune knocks at every man’s door once in a life,.
general.author: mark twain quotes

general.quote: The doors we open and close each day decide the lives we live.
general.author: flora whittemore

general.quote: I feel very adventurous. There are so many doors to be opened, and I’m not afraid to look behind them.
general.author: elizabeth taylor

general.quote: Great works are often born on a street corner or in a restaurant’s revolving door.
general.author: albert camus quotes

general.quote: Just be honest with yourself. That opens the door.
general.author: vernon howard

general.quote: If I see a door comin’ my way, I’m knockin’ it down. And if I can’t knock down the door, I’m sliding through the window.
general.author: rosie perez

general.quote: Some people expect the door of opportunity to be opened with an electric eye.
general.author: howard hendricks

general.quote: The lips of the wise are as the doors of a cabinet; no sooner are they opened, but treasures are poured out before thee.
general.author: akhenaton

general.quote: However much you knock at nature’s door, she will never answer you in comprehensible words.
general.author: ivan turgenev

general.quote: Happiness sneaks in through a door you didn’t know you left open.
general.author: john barrymore

general.quote: Fortune rarely accompanies anyone to the door.
general.author: torquato tasso

general.quote: Don’t ever slam a door; you might want to go back.
general.author: don herold

general.quote: He that bringeth a present findeth the door open.
general.author: thomas fuller

general.quote: There is always one moment in childhood when the door opens and lets the future in.
general.author: deepak chopra

general.quote: Good manners will open doors that the best education cannot.
general.author: clarence thomas

general.quote: The door that nobody else will go in at, seems always to swing open widely for me.
general.author: clara barton

general.quote: Reality is a sliding door.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson quotes

general.quote: People talk about opportunity knocking, but the gate was always swinging in the breeze before I got to the door.
general.author: rufus sewell

general.quote: Ideas can be life-changing. Sometimes all you need to open the door is just one more good idea.
general.author: jim rohn

general.quote: Never open the door to a lesser evil, for other ones invariably slink in after it.
general.author: baltasar gracian

general.quote: So I say to you, Ask and it will be given to you; search, and you will find; knock, and the door will be opened for you.
general.author: jesus christ

general.quote: If opportunity doesn’t knock, build a door.
general.author: milton berle

general.quote: Good clothes open all doors.
general.author: thomas fuller

general.quote: Don’t spend time beating on a wall, hoping to transform it into a door.
general.author: dr. laura schlessinger

general.quote: The doors of wisdom are never shut.
general.author: benjamin franklin quotes

general.quote: If a door slams shut it means that God is pointing to an open door further on down.
general.author: anna delaney peale

general.quote: Look for opportunity. You can’t wait for it to knock on the door…. You might not be home.
general.author: jinger heath

general.quote: Often God has to shut a door in our face, so that He can subsequently open the door through which He wants us to go.
general.author: catherine marshall

general.quote: Let everyone sweep in front of his own door, and the whole world will be clean.
general.author: johann wolfgang von goethe

general.quote: Big doors swing on little hinges.
general.author: w. clement stone

general.quote: He, who opens a school door, closes a prison.
general.author: victor hugo quotes

general.quote: All doors open to courtesy.
general.author: thomas fuller

general.quote: In oneself lies the whole world and if you know how to look and learn, the door is there and the key is in your hand. Nobody on earth can give you either the key or the door to open, except yourself.
general.author: jiddu krishnamurti

general.quote: Our abilities and ambitions count for little, unless the door of opportunity is open to us.
general.author: nicias ballard cooksey

general.quote: You can’t knock on opportunity’s door and not be ready.
general.author: bruno mars

general.quote: Not knowing when the dawn will come, I open every door.
general.author: emily dickinson

general.quote: The door of opportunity won’t open unless you do some pushing.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: The door of opportunity is wide open if you are prepared.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: Opportunity rarely knocks on your door. Knock rather on opportunity’s door if you ardently wish to enter.
general.author: b.c. forbes

general.quote: It is your business when the wall next door catches fire.
general.author: horace

general.quote: We must open the doors of opportunity.
general.author: lyndon b. johnson

general.quote: Traveling is not just seeing the new; it is also leaving behind. Not just opening doors; also closing them behind you, never to return. But the place you have left forever is always there for you to see whenever you shut your eyes.
general.author: jan myrdal

general.quote: There’s some end at last for the man who follows a path; mere rambling is interminable.
general.author: marcus annaeus seneca

general.quote: There is no easy path leading out of life, and few are the easy ones that lie within it.
general.author: walter savage landor

general.quote: The ultimate Path is without difficulty. Just avoid picking and choosing.
general.author: seng-ts’an

general.quote: The path to success is to take massive, determined action.
general.author: anthony robbins

general.quote: The path of sorrow and that path alone, leads to a land where sorrow is unknown.
general.author: william cowper

general.quote: The path of social advancement is, and must be, strewn with broken friendships.
general.author: h.g. wells

general.quote: The path of least resistance makes all rivers, and some men, crooked.
general.author: napoleon hill

general.quote: The path of least resistance is the path of the loser.
general.author: phil weltman

general.quote: The path of civilization is paved with tin cans.
general.author: elbert hubbard

general.quote: The path is smooth that leadeth on to danger.
general.author: william shakespeare quotes

general.quote: The best path through life is the highway.
general.author: henri frederic amiel

general.quote: Over every mountain there is a path, although it may not be seen from the valley.
general.author: james rogers

general.quote: Our way is not soft grass, it’s a mountain path with lots of rocks. But it goes upwards, forward, toward the sun.
general.author: dr. ruth westheimer

general.quote: One may not reach the dawn save by the path of the night.
general.author: kahlil gibran quotes

general.quote: Noble discontent is the path to heaven.
general.author: thomas wentworth higginson

general.quote: No love, no friendship can cross the path of our destiny without leaving some mark on it forever.
general.author: francois muriac

general.quote: Never be afraid to treat the path alone. Know which is your path and follow it wherever it may lead you; do not feel you have to follow in someone else’s footsteps.
general.author: gita bellin

general.quote: Look at every path closely and deliberately, then ask ourselves this crucial question: Does this path have a heart? If it does, then the path is good. If it doesn’t, it is of no use.
general.author: carlos castaneda

general.quote: Let the path be open to talent.
general.author: napoleon bonaparte quotes

general.quote: If you find a path with no obstacles, it probably doesn’t lead anywhere.
general.author: frank a. clark

general.quote: Education is the path from cocky ignorance to miserable uncertainty.
general.author: mark twain quotes

general.quote: Do not let a leader lead you on a bad path.
general.author: confucius quotes

general.quote: Do not follow where the path may lead. Go, instead, where there is no path and leave a trail.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: Courage is daring to take the first step, or a different path.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: Be more charitable: don’t follow the path of least assistance.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: As people are walking all the time, in the same spot, a path appears.
general.author: lu xun

general.quote: Art is the path of the creator to his work.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson quotes

general.quote: All paths are the same, leading nowhere. Therefore, pick a path with heart!
general.author: carlos castaneda

general.quote: Nice manners are the secret keys to the universe.
general.author: amy poehler

general.quote: The self-image is the key to human personality and human behavior. Change the self-image and you change the personality and the behavior.
general.author: maxwell maltz

general.quote: Honesty and loyalty are key. If two people can be honest with each other about everything, that’s probably the biggest key to success.
general.author: taylor lautner

general.quote: The key to success isn’t kicking down the door; it’s building your own.
general.author: brian celio

general.quote: Three keys to more abundant living: caring about others, daring for others, sharing with others.
general.author: william arthur ward

general.quote: Learning to celebrate success is a key component of learning how to win in the market.
general.author: douglas conant

general.quote: One important key to success is self-confidence. An important key to self-confidence is preparation.
general.author: arthur ashe

general.quote: Have the courage to say no. Have the courage to face the truth. Do the right thing because it is right. These are the magic keys to living your life with integrity.
general.author: w. clement stone

general.quote: You unlock the door with the key of imagination…
general.author: rod serling

general.quote: Education is the key to success in life, and teachers make a lasting impact in the lives of their students.
general.author: solomon ortiz

general.quote: Fascination is a key to productivity; it unites experiences; it is even its own reward.
general.author: erving polster

general.quote: The key of persistence will open up any door that has been closed by resistance.
general.author: john di lemme

general.quote: Since we are not solely material creatures, it is a mistake to place all our hopes for happiness on external development alone. The key is to develop inner peace.
general.author: dalai lama quotes

general.quote: I believe that one key to success is to accept truth, no matter how it’s spoken.
general.author: robert kiyosaki

general.quote: We believe that the business system only is the key to success. It’s no miracle, only day-to-day work in the appropriate way.
general.author: alexei mordashov

general.quote: No one can drive us crazy unless we give them the keys.
general.author: douglas horton

general.quote: One of the keys to happiness is a bad memory.
general.author: rita mae brown

general.quote: The key to my success has been to give up everything for my dream.
general.author: john h. johnson

general.quote: Smile, it is the key that fits the lock of everybody’s heart.
general.author: anthony j. d’angelo

general.quote: Six essential qualities that are the key to success: sincerity, personal integrity, humility, courtesy, wisdom, charity.
general.author: william c. menninger

general.quote: I don’t know the key to success, but the key to failure is trying to please everybody.
general.author: bill cosby

general.quote: Willpower is the key to success. Successful people strive no matter what they feel by applying their will to overcome apathy, doubt or fear.
general.author: dan millman

general.quote: The key of knowledge is in the application of what you have learned. Anything less makes you an armchair artist.
general.author: roger asselin

general.quote: Positive thinking is the key to success in business, education, pro football, anything that you can mention. I go out there thinking that I’m going to complete every pass.
general.author: ron jaworski

general.quote: Experimentation is the key to ‘lively up’ the art.
general.author: bob marley

general.quote: The keys to patience are acceptance and faith. Accept things as they are, and look realistically at the world around you. Have faith in yourself and in the direction you have chosen.
general.author: ralph marston

general.quote: Action is the foundational key to success.
general.author: pablo picasso quotes

general.quote: Maintaining a spirit of anticipation and joy are the key to success.
general.author: linda blondheim

general.quote: Persistence and love of one’s work is the key.
general.author: paul russo

general.quote: Instead of giving a politician the keys to the city, it might be better to change the locks.
general.author: doug larson

general.quote: The precept that location is key to the success of a business applies to art, and even to life itself: we thrive or wither depending on how nourishing our environment is.
general.author: yann martel

general.quote: The key to making healthy decisions is to respect your future self. Honor him or her. Treat him or her like you would treat a friend or a loved one.
general.author: a.j. jacobs

general.quote: Teach a man to read and write, and you have put into his hands the great keys of the wisdom box. But it is quite another thing to open the box.
general.author: thomas h. huxley

general.quote: Strokes are indeed the sensual emissions of the creative artist. Good strokes and the persistent making of good strokes are the key to productivity.
general.author: cesar girolamo

general.quote: There is a master key to success with which no man can fail. Its name is simplicity… reducing to the simplest possible terms every problem.
general.author: henri deterding

general.quote: If you can’t find the key to success, pick the lock.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: The short-goal habit is key to larger success and is at the root of human greatness. Life is think and do, think and do, think and do. Small steps can be greater than great leaps.
general.author: robert genn

general.quote: We must therefore turn to the child as to the key to the fate of our future life.
general.author: maria montessori

general.quote: The key to growth is the introduction of higher dimensions of consciousness into our awareness.
general.author: lao tzu

general.quote: The key to success is to focus our conscious mind on things we desire not things we fear.
general.author: brian tracy

general.quote: We receive His peace when we ask Him for it. We keep His peace by extending it to others. Those are the keys and there are no others.
general.author: marianne williamson

general.quote: The first key to wisdom is assiduous and frequent questioning.
general.author: peter abelard

general.quote: I believe there are three keys to success. For me it is keeping my priorities in order: It’s my faith and my family, and then the business.
general.author: kathy ireland

general.quote: A key to achieving success is to assemble a strong and stable management team.
general.author: vivek wadhwa

general.quote: Reading can be a road to freedom or a key to a secret garden, which, if tended, will transform all of life.
general.author: katherine paterson

general.quote: Success is not the key to happiness. Happiness is the key to success. If you love what you are doing, you will be successful.
general.author: albert schweitzer

general.quote: A graduation ceremony is an event where the commencement speaker tells thousands of students dressed in identical caps and gowns that ‘individuality’ is the key to success.
general.author: robert orben

general.quote: With one day’s reading a man may have the key in his hands.
general.author: ezra pound

general.quote: The key to success is to keep growing in all areas of life — mental, emotional, spiritual, as well as physical.
general.author: julius erving

general.quote: Having an aim is the key to achieving your best.
general.author: henry j. kaiser

general.quote: Order is the key to all problems.
general.author: alexandre dumas

general.quote: My brain is the key that sets my mind free.
general.author: harry houdini

general.quote: ‘The reality of things’ is the key to being able to be alone… the key to our progress, our stability, poise, and is the rudder for our sanity and happiness.
general.author: nancy schempp

general.quote: The key to handling pressure is to enjoy it when you’re confronted with it rather than worry about it too much.
general.author: steve waugh

general.quote: The will to win, the desire to succeed, the urge to reach your full potential… these are the keys that will unlock the door to personal excellence.
general.author: confucius quotes

general.quote: Gratefulness is the key to a happy life that we hold in our hands, because if we are not grateful, then no matter how much we have we will not be happy…
general.author: david steindl-rast

general.quote: The keys to brand success are self-definition, transparency, authenticity and accountability.
general.author: simon mainwaring

general.quote: Questions provide the key to unlocking our unlimited potential.
general.author: tony robbins

general.quote: I think there are those individuals who are intimidated by really smart, talented people. But for me, surrounding yourself with great talent is the key to success.
general.author: monika chiang

general.quote: Humility and openness are the key to success without compromising your beliefs.
general.author: george hickenlooper

general.quote: Failure is the key to success; each mistake teaches us something.
general.author: morihei ueshiba

general.quote: Variation is key to creating interest in a painting: sharp and soft, cool and warm, dark and light…
general.author: richard robinson

general.quote: You are searching for the magic key that will unlock the door to the source of power; and yet you have the key in your own hands, and you may use it the moment you learn to control your thoughts.
general.author: napoleon hill

general.quote: The pursuit of art on a regular basis may be the key to healing our minds and bodies.
general.author: kim blair

general.quote: The key is to trust your heart to move where your talents can flourish. This old world will really spin when work becomes a joyous expression of the soul.
general.author: al sacharov

general.quote: Finding good partners is the key to success in anything: in business, in marriage and, especially, in investing.
general.author: robert kiyosaki

general.quote: If you ask what is the single most important key to longevity, I would have to say it is avoiding worry, stress and tension. And if you didn’t ask me, I’d still have to say it.
general.author: george burns

general.quote: The real key to being creative lies in what you do with your knowledge.
general.author: roger von oech

general.quote: The single most important key to success is to be a good listener.
general.author: kelly wearstler

general.quote: Ambivalence is a key to success. You have to care about your work but not the result. You have to care about how good you are… but not about how good people think you are…
general.author: amy poehler

general.quote: We are all eternal students – and this may be one of the keys to success.
general.author: stella violano

general.quote: A critical key to achieving success lies in your ability to activate your potential to create the results you seek… start by being aware of your self-sabotaging patterns.
general.author: lauren mackler

general.quote: Educated risks are the key to success.
general.author: william olsten

general.quote: Having the keys to unlock your talent is a talent.
general.author: william carmen soyak iii

general.quote: Maintaining spirituality and humanism are the keys to success. It’s a balance.
general.author: bikram choudhury

general.quote: Adjusting to the passage of time, I think, is a key to success and to life: just being able to roll with the punches.
general.author: dolly parton

general.quote: People are the key to success or extraordinary success.
general.author: azim premji

general.quote: Learning to focus and pay attention, if only for a short time, has been identified as a primary key to the development of human effectiveness.
general.author: robert genn

general.quote: If greater openness is a key to economic success, I believe there is increasingly a need for openness in the political sphere as well.
general.author: paul wolfowitz

general.quote: Communication – the human connection – is the key to personal and career success.
general.author: paul j. meyer

general.quote: Physical fitness is not only one of the most important keys to a healthy body, it is the basis of dynamic and creative intellectual activity.
general.author: john f. kennedy quotes

general.quote: Only divine love bestows the keys of knowledge.
general.author: arthur rimbaud

general.quote: People say that money isn’t the key to happiness, but I always figured if you have enough money, you can have a key made.
general.author: joan rivers

general.quote: Key metaphors help determine what and how we perceive and how we think about our perceptions.
general.author: m. h. abrams

general.quote: You will find the key to success under the alarm clock.
general.author: benjamin franklin quotes

general.quote: The bad news: There is no key to the universe. The good news: It was never locked.
general.author: swami beyondananda

general.quote: Creativity is the key to success in the future, and primary education is where teachers can bring creativity in children at that level.
general.author: a. p. j. abdul kalam

general.quote: Before anything else, preparation is the key to success.
general.author: alexander graham bell

general.quote: Adversity is the first path to truth.
general.author: lord byron

general.quote: Zeal without knowledge is the sister of folly.
general.author: sir john davies

general.quote: Nothing to build, and all things to destroy.
general.author: john dryden

general.quote: Whether zeal or moderation be the point we aim at, let us keep fire out of the one and frost out of the other.
general.author: joseph addison

general.quote: Zeal, the blind conductor of the will.
general.author: john dryden

general.quote: There are zealots for slavery as well as zealots for freedom.
general.author: william henry burleigh

general.quote: Through zeal knowledge is gotten, through lack of zeal knowledge is lost; let a man who knows this double path of gain and loss thus place himself that knowledge may grow.
general.author: buddha

general.quote: He that does a base thing in zeal for his friend burns the golden thread that ties their hearts together.
general.author: jeremy taylor

general.quote: Blind zeal can only do harm.
general.author: magnus gottfried lichtwer

general.quote: Motives by excess reverse their very nature and instead of exciting, stun and stupefy the mind.
general.author: samuel taylor coleridge

general.quote: I do not love a man who is zealous for nothing.
general.author: oliver goldsmith

general.quote: Zeal is like fire: it needs both feeding and watching.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: There is no greater sign of a general decay of virtue in a nation, than a want of zeal in its inhabitants for the good of their country.
general.author: joseph addison

general.quote: I have never known a trader in philanthropy who was not wrong in his head or heart somewhere or other.
general.author: samuel taylor coleridge

general.quote: When you are laboring for others let it be with the same zeal as if it were for yourself.
general.author: confucius

general.quote: If our zeal were true and genuine we should be much more angry with a sinner than a heretic.
general.author: joseph addison

general.quote: I would have every zealous man examine his heart thoroughly, and I believe he will often find that what be calls a zeal for his religion is either pride, interest, or ill-repute.
general.author: joseph addison

general.quote: Zeal without knowledge is like expedition to a man in the dark.
general.author: john newton

general.quote: There is nothing in which men more deceive themselves than in what they call zeal.
general.author: joseph addison

general.quote: Zeal is fit for wise men, but flourishes chiefly among fools.
general.author: john tillotson

general.quote: The zeal which begins with hypocrisy must conclude in treachery; at first it deceives, at last it betrays.
general.author: francis bacon

general.quote: Zealous men are ever displaying to you the strength of their belief. while judicious men are showing you the grounds of it.
general.author: william shenstone

general.quote: Zeal without knowledge is fire without light.
general.author: thomas fuller

general.quote: Zeal without humanity is like a ship without a rudder, liable to be stranded at any moment.
general.author: owen felltham

general.quote: Zealous, not modest.
general.author: james beattie

general.quote: Zeal is very blind, or badly regulated, when it encroaches upon the rights of others.
general.author: pasquier quesnel

general.quote: Let a good person do good deeds with the same zeal that an evil person does bad ones.
general.author: shalom rokeach

general.quote: It is a zealot’s faith that blasts the shrines of the false god, but builds no temple to the true.
general.author: sydney thompson dobell

general.quote: True zeal is an ignis lambeus, a soft and gentle flame that will not scorch one’s hand.
general.author: ralph cudworth

general.quote: Experience shows that success is due less to ability than to zeal. The winner is he who gives himself to his work body and soul.
general.author: charles buxton

general.quote: If you are right, take the humble side — you will help the other fellow. If you are wrong, take the humble side — and you will help yourself.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: One of the best ways to do yourself a favor is to lend somebody else a helping hand.
general.author: author unknownthe best place to find a helping hand is at the end of your own arm. ~ author unknown

general.quote: I’ve learned… that sometimes coming public with certain things, it inspires other people. And sometimes I want to keep things private… but then I found out that it helps other families…
general.author: bubba watson

general.quote: Down in their hearts, wise men know this truth: the only way to help yourself is to help others.
general.author: elbert hubbard

general.quote: Never worry about numbers. Help one person at a time, and always start with the person nearest you.
general.author: mother teresa quotes

general.quote: True charity consists of helping those you have every reason to believe would not help you.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: There are at least four things you can do with your hands. You can wring them in despair; you can fold them in idleness; you can clench them in anger; or you can use them to help someone.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: Sometimes a man imagines that he will lose himself if he gives himself, and keep himself if he hides himself. But the contrary takes place with terrible exactitude.
general.author: ernest hello

general.quote: Worry doesn’t help tomorrow’s troubles, but it does ruin today’s happiness.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: A real friend helps us think our best thoughts, do our noblest deeds, be our finest selves.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: It seems to me that any full grown, mature adult would have a desire to be responsible, to help where he can in a world that needs so very much, that threatens us so very much.
general.author: norman lear

general.quote: Only through caring and helping can life’s true successes be found.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: Seek the friend whose hand helped you and tell them what they mean to you.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: Children are a great comfort to us in our old age, and they help us reach it faster too.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: Help me to live time, not just to use it; to breathe it in, and return it in acts of love and presence.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: Instead of counting your days, make your days count.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: A little help is worth a great deal of pity.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: There is one pleasure that the human being cannot tire of and that is the pleasure that comes from helping someone who really needs you.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: God helps everyone with what is his own.
general.author: miguel de cervantes saavedra

general.quote: A good way to forget your troubles is to help others out of theirs.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: In about the same degree as you are helpful, you will be happy.
general.author: karl reiland

general.quote: Time and money spent in helping men do more for themselves is far better than mere giving.
general.author: henry ford quotes

general.quote: Nothing makes one feel so strong as a call for help.
general.author: george macdonald

general.quote: Act as if what you do makes a difference. It does.
general.author: william james

general.quote: Successful people are always looking for opportunities to help others. Unsuccessful people are always asking "What’s in it for me?"
general.author: brian tracy

general.quote: Sympathy sees, and says, ‘I’m sorry.’ Compassion feels, and whispers, ‘I’ll help.’
general.author: unknown

general.quote: People support what they help create.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: Every great man is always being helped by everybody; for his gift is to get good out of all things and all persons.
general.author: john ruskin

general.quote: There is no use whatever trying to help people who do not help themselves. You cannot push anyone up a ladder unless he is willing to climb himself.
general.author: andrew carnegie

general.quote: Heaven’s help is better than early rising.
general.author: miguel de cervantes saavedra

general.quote: The gift of friendship… a willingness to listen… a pair of helping hands… a whisper from the heart. That someone cares and understands.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: No one who achieves success does so without acknowledging the help of others. The wise and confident acknowledge this help with gratitude.
general.author: alfred north whitehead

general.quote: I want to help you to grow as beautiful as God meant you to be when he thought of you first.
general.author: george macdonald

general.quote: The difference between a helping hand and an outstretched palm is a twist of the wrist.
general.author: laurence leamer

general.quote: Even if it’s a little thing, do something for those who have need of a man’s help, something for which you get no pay but the privilege of doing it. For, remember, you don’t live in a world all your own. Your brothers are here too.
general.author: albert schweitzer

general.quote: To the man who himself strives earnestly, God also lends a helping hand.
general.author: aeschylus

general.quote: Great opportunities to help others seldom come, but small ones surround us every day.
general.author: sally koch

general.quote: The best kind of charity is the kind that helps others to eliminate any further need of it.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: If you’re too busy to help those around you succeed, you’re too busy.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: Help one another; there’s no time like the present and no present like the time.
general.author: james durst

general.quote: God helps him who strives hard.
general.author: euripides

general.quote: Take the time to understand and lend a gentle helping hand.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: You can’t pursue happiness and catch it. Happiness comes upon you unaware while you are helping others.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: The first question which the priest and the Levite asked was: "If I stop to help this man, what will happen to me?" But… the good Samaritan reversed the question: "If I do not stop to help this man, what will happen to him?"
general.author: martin luther king, jr. quotes

general.quote: Nobody will persist long in helping those who will not help themselves.
general.author: samuel johnson

general.quote: Do not wait for leaders; do it alone, person to person.
general.author: mother teresa

general.quote: He has the right to criticize who has the heart to help.
general.author: abraham lincoln quotes

general.quote: We win half the battle when we make up our minds to take the world as we find it, including the thorns.
general.author: orison swett marden

general.quote: One of my favorite philosophical tenets is that people will agree with you only if they already agree with you. You do not change people’s minds.
general.author: frank zappa

general.quote: In order to learn, one must change one’s mind.
general.author: orson scott card

general.quote: I usually make up my mind about a man in ten seconds, and I very rarely change it.
general.author: margaret thatcher

general.quote: This is as true in everyday life as it is in battle: we are given one life and the decision is ours whether to wait for circumstances to make up our mind, or whether to act, and in acting, to live.
general.author: omar n. bradley

general.quote: Total loyalty is possible only when fidelity is emptied of all concrete content, from which changes of mind might naturally arise.
general.author: hannah arendt

general.quote: It is well for people who think to change their minds occasionally in order to keep them clean. For those who do not think, it is best to at least rearrange their prejudices once in a while.
general.author: luther burbank

general.quote: Everything changes as you get older – your mind, your body, the way you view the world.
general.author: antonio banderas

general.quote: I am artistic so I reserve the right to change my mind at any point. I just like to do different things. What is more important than the name is that people know that I really like acting, I enjoy it and I want people to know that I am serious.
general.author: ll cool j

general.quote: You’re only as young as the last time you changed your mind.
general.author: timothy leary

general.quote: True wisdom is less presuming than folly. The wise man doubteth often, and changeth his mind; the fool is obstinate, and doubteth not; he knoweth all things but his own ignorance.
general.author: akhenaton

general.quote: I guess walking slow getting married is because it gives you time to maybe change your mind.
general.author: virginia cary hudson

general.quote: He who is fixed to a star does not change his mind.
general.author: leonardo da vinci

general.quote: Life is not a static thing. The only people who do not change their minds are incompetents in asylums, who can’t are those in cemeteries.
general.author: everett dirksen

general.quote: Those who don’t believe in you won’t change their minds when you succeed.
general.author: david brown

general.quote: The first thing I do in the morning is to make my bed and while I am making up my bed I am making up my mind as to what kind of a day I am going to have.
general.author: robert frost

general.quote: You had better be ready to change your mind when needed, or your mind will change you.
general.author: henry b. wilson

general.quote: The only means of strengthening one’s intellect is to make up one’s mind about nothing, to let the mind be a thoroughfare for all thoughts.
general.author: john keats

general.quote: You are always free to change your mind and choose a different future, or a different past.
general.author: richard bach

general.quote: A woman’s mind is cleaner than a man’s: She changes it more often.
general.author: oliver herford

general.quote: We are given one life, and the decision is our whether to wait for circumstances to make up our mind, or whether to act, and in acting, to live.
general.author: omar nelson bradley

general.quote: Make up your mind to act decidedly and take the consequences. No good is ever done in this world by hesitation.
general.author: thomas huxley

general.quote: A fanatic is one who can’t change his mind and won’t change the subject.
general.author: winston churchill

general.quote: If you never change your mind, why have one?
general.author: edward de bono

general.quote: I came from a different mind-set growing up, and my mind has changed.
general.author: katy perry

general.quote: For me it’s more important that I outline all the facets of a controversial issue and let the reader make up his or her mind. I don’t care if readers change their minds, but I would like readers to ask themselves why their opinion is what it is.
general.author: jodi picoult

general.quote: When you cannot make up your mind which of two evenly balanced courses of action you should take — choose the bolder.
general.author: william joseph slim

general.quote: The only man who can’t change his mind is a man who hasn’t got one.
general.author: edward noyes westcott

general.quote: Only fools and dead men don’t change their minds. Fools won’t. Dead men can’t.
general.author: john h. patterson

general.quote: Progress is impossible without change, and those who cannot change their minds cannot change anything.
general.author: george bernard shaw

general.quote: Nothing is wonderful when you get used to it.
general.author: edgar watsonhowe

general.quote: How can you build something for someone else if you don’thave enough familiarity with them to imagine the world through their eyes?
general.author: chris sacca

general.quote: Familiarity is a magician that is cruel to beauty but kindto ugliness.
general.author: ouida

general.quote: There can be no prestige without mystery, for familiarity breeds contempt.
general.author: charles de gaulle

general.quote: Familiar acts are beautiful through love.
general.author: percy byssheshelley

general.quote: A shocking occurrence ceases to be shocking when it occursdaily.
general.author: alexander chase

general.quote: All objects lose by too familiar a view.
general.author: john dryden

general.quote: In communications, familiarity breeds apathy.
general.author: williambernbach

general.quote: Few men have been admired by their own households.
general.author: micheleyquem de montaigne

general.quote: Sweets grown common lose their dear delight.
general.author: williamshakespeare

general.quote: The hues of the opal, the light of the diamond, are not tobe seen if the eye is too near.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson

general.quote: Marriage must incessantly contend with a monster thatdevours everything: familiarity.
general.author: honore de balzac

general.quote: Like any friendship or marriage, familiarity breeds morecontempt, and love, and everything.
general.author: martin freeman

general.quote: Normality highly values its normal man. It educates childrento lose themselves and to become absurd, and thus to be normal. Normal men havekilled perhaps 100, 000 of their fellow normal men in the last fifty years.
general.author: r. d. laing

general.quote: Normal is nothing more than a cycle on a washing machine.
general.author: whoopi goldberg

general.quote: Though familiarity may not breed contempt, it takes off theedge of admiration.
general.author: william hazlitt

general.quote: Familiarity breeds contempt; and children.
general.author: mark twain

general.quote: Fabulous is familiarity.
general.author: jillionaire

general.quote: To be natural is such a very difficult pose to keep up.
general.author: oscar wilde

general.quote: Admiration and familiarity are strangers.
general.author: george sand

general.quote: Familiarity is the root of the closest friendships, as wellas the interest’s hatreds.
general.author: antoine rivarol

general.quote: It is not from reason that justice springs, but goodness is born of wisdom.
general.author: maurice maeterlinck

general.quote: Goodness is love in action, love with its hand to the plow, love with the burden on its back, love following his footsteps who went about continually doing good.
general.author: james hamilton

general.quote: Nothing can be compared to a faithful friend, and no weight of gold and silver is able to countervail the goodness of his fidelity.
general.author: apocrypha

general.quote: Our will is always for our own good, but we do not always see what that is.
general.author: jean jacques rousseau

general.quote: It is very hard to be simple enough to be good.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson

general.quote: The ideals which have always shone before me and filled me with the joy of living are goodness, beauty, and truth.
general.author: albert einstein

general.quote: Secrecy is the element of all goodness; even virtue, even beauty is mysterious.
general.author: thomas carlyle

general.quote: Beauty endures only for as long as it can be seen; goodness, beautiful today, will remain so tomorrow.
general.author: sappho

general.quote: The soul is strong that trusts in goodness.
general.author: philip massinger

general.quote: Good and bad men are less than they seem.
general.author: samuel taylor coleridge

general.quote: Mere goodness can achieve little against the power of nature.
general.author: georg hegel

general.quote: An act of goodness is of itself an act of happiness.
general.author: maurice maeterlinck

general.quote: ‘Tis better to be known as a good man than a great one, for greatness is an assessment of mortals; goodness a gift of God.
general.author: spark matsunaga

general.quote: The first condition of human goodness is something to love; the second, something to revere.
general.author: george eliot

general.quote: It is very hard to separate the general goodnesss pread all over the world from great cleverness.
general.author: francois de la rochefoucauld

general.quote: Loving-kindness is the better part of goodness.
general.author: w. somerset maugham

general.quote: Goodness is generous and diffusive; it is largeness of mind, and sweetness of temper,–balsam in the blood, and justice sublimated to a richer spirit.
general.author: jeremy collier

general.quote: The main source of our wealth is goodness. The affections and the generous qualities that God admires in a world full of greed.
general.author: alfred a. montapert

general.quote: Real goodness does not attach itself merely to this life; it points to another world.
general.author: daniel webster

general.quote: Goodness and love mould the form into their own image, and cause the joy and beauty of love to shine forth from every part of the face.
general.author: emanuel swedenborg

general.quote: Generally the man with a good wife, or the woman with a good husband, or the children with good parents discover too late the goodness they overlooked while it was in full bloom.
general.author: james douglas

general.quote: Give in to goodness now and then.
general.author: arthur gordon

general.quote: Being good is just a matter of temperament in the end.
general.author: iris murdoch

general.quote: Human nature is evil, and goodness is caused by intentional activity.
general.author: xun zi

general.quote: To make one good action succeed another is the perfection of goodness.
general.author: ali ibn-abi-talib

general.quote: Experience has convinced me that there is a thousand times more goodness, wisdom, and love in the world than men imagine.
general.author: gehler

general.quote: Greatness is not found in possessions, power, position, or prestige. It is discovered in goodness, humility, service and character.
general.author: william a. ward

general.quote: Goodness thinks no ill where no ill seems.
general.author: john milton

general.quote: He who believes in goodness has the essence of all faith. He is a man "of cheerful yesterdays and confident to-morrows..
general.author: james freeman clarke

general.quote: The nature of man is evil; his goodness is the result of his activity.
general.author: xunsi

general.quote: Evil is committed without effort, naturally, fatally; goodness is always the product of some art.
general.author: charles baudelaire

general.quote: Your goodness must have some edge to it, else it is none.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson

general.quote: Believe that you possess a basic goodness, which is the foundation for the greatness you can ultimately achieve.
general.author: les brown

general.quote: Look for no reward in goodness but goodness itself.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: As if one could know the good a person is capable of, when one doesn’t know the bad he might do.
general.author: elias canetti

general.quote: Our goodness comes solely from thinking on goodness; our wickedness from thinking on wickedness. We too are the victims of our own contemplation.
general.author: john jay chapman

general.quote: The chief beginning of evil is goodness in excess.
general.author: menander

general.quote: Greatness and goodness are not means, but ends.
general.author: samuel taylor coleridge

general.quote: He whose goodness is part of himself, is what is called a real man.
general.author: mencius

general.quote: True human goodness, in all its purity and freedom, can come to the fore only when its recipient has no power.
general.author: milan kundera

general.quote: The measure of your holiness is proportionate to the goodness of your will.
general.author: jan van ruysbroeck

general.quote: Goodness is the only investment which never fails.
general.author: henry david thoreau

general.quote: Goodness consists not in the outward things we do, but in the inward thing we are. To be is the great thing.
general.author: edwin hubbell chapin

general.quote: In goodness there are all kinds of wisdom.
general.author: euripides

general.quote: It is easy to perform a good action, but not easy to acquire a settled habit of performing such actions.
general.author: aristotle

general.quote: Goodness is beauty in its best estate.
general.author: christopher marlowe

general.quote: Nothing that was worthy in the past departs; no truth or goodness realized by man ever dies, or can die.
general.author: thomas carlyle

general.quote: Goodness is uneventful. It does not flash, it glows.
general.author: david grayson

general.quote: Goodness is something so simple; always live for others, never to seek one’s own advantage.
general.author: dag hammarskjold

general.quote: Forever al lgoodness will be most charming; forever all wickedness will be most odious.
general.author: thomas sprat

general.quote: Choose the way of life. Choose the way of love. Choose the way of caring. Choose the way of goodness. It’s up to you. It’s your choice.
general.author: leo buscaglia

general.quote: To rid ourselves of our shadows — who we are — we must step into either total light or total darkness. Goodness and evil.
general.author: jeremy p. johnson

general.quote: The monument of a great man is not of granite or marble or bronze. It consists of his goodness, his deeds, his love and his compassion.
general.author: alfred a. montapert

general.quote: Virtue is bold and goodness never fearful.
general.author: william shakespeare

general.quote: Nothing leads to good that is not natural.
general.author: johann friedrich von schiller

general.quote: It is by the goodnesso f God that in our country we have those three unspeakably precious things: freedom of speech, freedom of conscience, and the prudence never to practice either.
general.author: mark twain

general.quote: How far that little candle throws its beams! So shines a good deed in a naughty world.
general.author: william shakespeare

general.quote: Goodness admits of no excess, but error.
general.author: francis bacon

general.quote: We can be wise from goodness and good from wisdom.
general.author: marie von ebner-eschenbach

general.quote: Evil is always possible. Goodness is a difficulty.
general.author: anne rice

general.quote: We must not wish anything other than what happens from moment to moment, all the while, however, exercising ourselves in goodness.
general.author: st. catherine of genoa

general.quote: Good will, like a good name, is got by many actions and lost by one.
general.author: francis jeffrey

general.quote: If you pretend to be good, the world takes you very seriously. If you pretend to be bad, it doesn’t. Such is the astounding stupidity of optimism.
general.author: oscar wilde

general.quote: It is amazing how complete is the delusion that beauty is goodness.
general.author: count leo tolstoy

general.quote: Hope in action is charity, and beauty in action is goodness.
general.author: miguel de unamuno

general.quote: To have beauty is to have only that, but to have goodness is to be beautiful too.
general.author: sappho

general.quote: Only a writer who has the sense of evil can make goodness readable.
general.author: e. m. forster

general.quote: The cheerful live longest in years, and afterwards in our regards. Cheerfulness is the off-shoot of goodness.
general.author: john christian bovee

general.quote: Live not as though there were a thousand years ahead of you. Fate is at your elbow; make yourself good while life and power are still yours.
general.author: marcus aurelius

general.quote: On the whole, human beings want to be good, but not too good, and not quite all the time.
general.author: george orwell

general.quote: Goodness, armed with power, is corrupted; and pure love without power is destroyed.
general.author: reinhold niebuhr

general.quote: Who does not befriend himself by doing good?
general.author: sophocles

general.quote: How goodness heightens beauty!
general.author: hannah more

general.quote: It’s better to be good than evil, but one achieves goodness at a terrific cost.
general.author: stephen king

general.quote: There are wicked people who would be much less dangerous if they were totally without goodness.
general.author: francois de la rochefoucauld

general.quote: That man is happiest who lives from day to day and asks no more, garnering the simple goodness of a life.
general.author: euripides

general.quote: No man or woman can be strong, gentle, pure, and good, without the world being better for it and without someone being helped and comforted by the very existence of that goodness.
general.author: phillips brooks

general.quote: The devil himself is good when he is pleased.
general.author: thomas fuller

general.quote: He who knows how to suffer everything can dare everything.
general.author: marquis de vauvenargues

general.quote: The most that any of us know is the least of that which is to be known.
general.author: benjamin whichcote

general.quote: You have to live to really know things.
general.author: dan simmons

general.quote: He who knows he has enough is rich.
general.author: lao-tzu

general.quote: The most happy man is he who knows how to bring into relation the end and beginning of his life.
general.author: goethe

general.quote: The happy man is he who knows his limitations, yet bows to no false gods.
general.author: robert w. service

general.quote: What you know is a club for yourself, and what you don’t know is a meat-ax for the other fellow.
general.author: george horace lorimer

general.quote: Few can tell what they know without also showing what they do not know.
general.author: ivan panin

general.quote: He who knows only his own side of the case, knows little of that.
general.author: john stuart mill

general.quote: He who knows others is clever; He who knows himself has discernment.
general.author: lao-tzu

general.quote: Acceptance of the power of God in one’s life lays the groundwork for personal commitment to both science and Christianity, which so often have been in conflict.
general.author: kenneth l. pike

general.quote: Happiness can exist only in acceptance.
general.author: george orwell

general.quote: Almost any event will put on a new face when received with cheerful acceptance.
general.author: henry s. haskins

general.quote: The art of life lies in a constant readjustment to our surroundings.
general.author: okakura kakuzo

general.quote: After an argument, silence may mean acceptance or the continuation of resistance by other means.
general.author: mason cooley

general.quote: God asks no man whether he will accept life. This is not the choice. You must take it. The only question is how.
general.author: henry ward beecher

general.quote: What it is forbidden to be put right becomes lighter by acceptance.
general.author: horace

general.quote: I think tolerance and acceptance and love is something that feeds every community.
general.author: lady gaga

general.quote: Happiness is a function of accepting what is.
general.author: werner erhard

general.quote: Acceptance of what has happened is the first step to overcoming the consequences of any misfortune.
general.author: william james

general.quote: with a grace to reason and bow and accept at the end of a love or a season.
general.author: robert frost

general.quote: A man doesn’t learn to understand anything unless he loves it.
general.author: johann wolfgang von goethe

general.quote: But after observation and analysis, when you find that anything agrees with reason and is conducive to the good and benefit of one and all, then accept it and live up to it.
general.author: buddha

general.quote: The first step toward change is awareness. The second step is acceptance.
general.author: nathaniel branden

general.quote: It is almost more important how a person takes his fate than what it is.
general.author: karl wilhelm von humboldt

general.quote: Acceptance makes any event put on a new face.
general.author: henry s. haskins

general.quote: Ride the horse in the direction that it’s going.
general.author: werner erhard

general.quote: Getting older is a struggle. I always feel that just under the surface of acceptance and enjoyment of the ageing process is a terrible hysteria just waiting to burst out.
general.author: michael sheen

general.quote: The keys to patience are acceptance and faith. Accept things as they are, and look realistically at the world around you. Have faith in yourself and in the direction you have chosen.
general.author: ralph marston

general.quote: The homosexual community has more acceptance in America than it ever has, and the suicide rate is as high as it’s always been.
general.author: randall terry

general.quote: No intelligent idea can gain general acceptance unless some stupidity is mixed in with it.
general.author: fernando pessoa

general.quote: Acceptance doesn’t mean resignation; it means understanding that something is what it is and that there’s got to be a way through it.
general.author: michael j. fox

general.quote: We cannot change anything unless we accept it.
general.author: carl jung

general.quote: You have to accept whatever comes and the only important thing is that you meet it with courage and with the best that you have to give.
general.author: eleanor roosevelt

general.quote: Let there be no doubt, while I strongly disagree with the court’s decision, I accept it.
general.author: al gore,

general.quote: The minute you settle for less than you deserve, you get even less than you settled for.
general.author: maureen dowd

general.quote: The most terrifying thing is to accept oneself completely.
general.author: carl gustav jung

general.quote: If you can accept losing, you can’t win.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: The real world is not easy to live in. It is rough; it is slippery. Without the most clear-eyed adjustments we fall and get crushed.
general.author: clarence day

general.quote: Our entire life consists ultimately in accepting ourselves as we are.
general.author: jean anouilh

general.quote: We must like what we have when we don’t have what we like.
general.author: comte de bussy-rabutin

general.quote: Parents need to teach their children principles of respect and acceptance.
general.author: zachary quinto

general.quote: The greatest gift that you can give to others is the gift of unconditional love and acceptance.
general.author: brian tracy

general.quote: Services like Google and Facebook only exist because of the social acceptance of a mass amount of distributed volunteer labor from tons and tons of people.
general.author: jaron lanier

general.quote: I hate the giving of the hand unless the whole man accompanies it.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson

general.quote: Acceptance of prevailing standards often means we have no standards of our own.
general.author: jean toomer

general.quote: Human beings, like plants, grow in the soil of acceptance, not in the atmosphere of rejection.
general.author: sir john powell

general.quote: Once we accept our limits, we go beyond them.
general.author: brendan francis

general.quote: If you can’t fight, and you can’t flee, flow.
general.author: robert eliot

general.quote: Acceptance is the truest kinship with humanity.
general.author: gilbert k. chesterton

general.quote: The antiquity and general acceptance of an opinion is not assurance of its truth.
general.author: pierre bayle

general.quote: People are lucky and unlucky… according to the ratio between what they get and what they have been led to expect.
general.author: samuel butler

general.quote: Acceptance and tolerance and forgiveness, those are life-altering lessons.
general.author: jessica lange

general.quote: My happiness grows in direct proportion to my acceptance, and in inverse proportion to my expectations.
general.author: michael j. fox

general.quote: As long as people will accept crap, it will be financially profitable to dispense it.
general.author: dick cavett

general.quote: Always fall in with what you’re asked to accept. Take what is given, and make it over your way. My aim in life has always been to hold my own with whatever’s going. Not against: with.
general.author: robert frost

general.quote: For this is wisdom: to live, to take what fate, or the Gods, may give.
general.author: laurence hope

general.quote: I wish they would only take me as I am.
general.author: vincent van gogh

general.quote: The art of acceptance is the art of making someone who has just done you a small favor wish that he might have done you a greater one.
general.author: martin luther king, jr.

general.quote: The first step toward change is acceptance. Once you accept yourself, you open the door to change. That’s all you have to do. Change is not something you do, it’s something you allow.
general.author: will garcia

general.quote: Acceptance is not love. You love a person because he or she has lovable traits, but you accept everybody just because they’re alive and human.
general.author: albert ellis

general.quote: Everything in life depends on how that life accepts its limits.
general.author: james baldwin

general.quote: If you are wise, live as you can; if you cannot, live as you would.
general.author: baltasar gracian

general.quote: Every man must be content with that glory which he may have at home.
general.author: boethius

general.quote: Ask not that events should happen as you will, but let your will be that events should happen as they do, and you shall have peace.
general.author: epictetus

general.quote: Leadership is particularly necessary to ensure ready acceptance of the unfamiliar and that which is contrary to tradition.
general.author: cyril falls

general.quote: Be willing to have it so. Acceptance of what has happened is the first step to overcoming the consequences of any misfortune.
general.author: william james

general.quote: I will not meddle with that which I cannot mend.
general.author: thomas fuller

general.quote: Better to accept whatever happens.
general.author: horace

general.quote: What we need is not more distrust and division. What we need now is acceptance.
general.author: tom daschle

general.quote: Let a man accept his destiny. No pity and no tears.
general.author: euripides

general.quote: Our accepting what we must always inhibits our being what we ought to be.
general.author: john fowles

general.quote: I stand for freedom of expression, doing what you believe in, and going after your dreams.
general.author: madonna

general.quote: When I dream, I am ageless.
general.author: elizabeth coatsworth

general.quote: I believe that any single dream contains the essential message about our existence.
general.author: frederick salomon perls

general.quote: One must have strategies to execute dreams.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: Everything starts as somebody’s daydream.
general.author: larry niven

general.quote: Dreams make all men authors.
general.author: edward counsel

general.quote: All of us failed to match our dreams of perfection.
general.author: william faulkner

general.quote: I was trying to daydream, but my mind kept wandering.
general.author: steven wright

general.quote: If you can dream it, you can do it. Our limits are all within yourself.
general.author: brian tracy

general.quote: The best reason for having dreams is that in dreams no reasons are necessary.
general.author: ashleigh brilliant

general.quote: If you do not fear God, then fear your dreams, because they’re how He talks to you.
general.author: tim lebbon

general.quote: Dreams are life, real life, not simply reflections. Dreams are honest.
general.author: tim lebbon

general.quote: All human beings are also dream beings. Dreaming ties all mankind together.
general.author: kerouac jack

general.quote: Dream as if you’ll live forever. Live as if you’ll die tomorrow.
general.author: james dean

general.quote: Did anyone ever have a boring dream?
general.author: ralph hodgson

general.quote: Dreams say what they mean, but they don’t say it in daytime language.
general.author: gail godwin

general.quote: Goals are dreams with deadlines.
general.author: diana scharf hunt

general.quote: No dreamer is ever too small; no dream is ever too big.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: Saddle your dreams before you ride ’em.
general.author: mary webb

general.quote: If you can dream it and you want it bad enough, then the reality will become real.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: Dreams are more real than reality itself, they’re closer to the self.
general.author: gao xingjian

general.quote: A dream has power to poison sleep.
general.author: percy bysshe shelley

general.quote: Dreams are the sources of action, the meeting and the end, a resting place among the flight of things.
general.author: muriel rukeyser

general.quote: If we couldn’t dream, our lives wouldn’t mean anything anymore.
general.author: george kaiser

general.quote: If a woman wants her dreams to come true, she must wake up.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: Choose your dreams and leave your doubts behind.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: We are near waking when we dream we are dreaming.
general.author: novalis

general.quote: We must teach our children to dream with their eyes open.
general.author: harry edwards

general.quote: I like the dreams of the future better than the history of the past.
general.author: thomas jefferson

general.quote: I have spread my dreams under your feet; Tread softly, because you tread on my dreams.
general.author: william butler yeats

general.quote: Much of our waking experience is but a dream in the daylight.
general.author: george eliot

general.quote: Sometimes a winner is just a dreamer that never gave up.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: Some men see things as they are and say, "Why?" I dream of things that never were, and say, "Why not?"
general.author: george bernard shaw

general.quote: When you cease to dream you cease to live.
general.author: malcolm s. forbes

general.quote: Dreams are only thoughts you didn’t have time to think about during the day.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: To dream anything that you want to dream, that is the beauty of the human mind.
general.author: bernard edmonds

general.quote: In a dream you are never eighty.
general.author: anne sexton

general.quote: Man dreams of fame while woman wakes to love.
general.author: lord alfred tennyson

general.quote: Dreams are answers to questions we haven’t yet figured out how to ask.
general.author: x-files

general.quote: I dream, therefore I exist.
general.author: august j. strindberg

general.quote: A story in your head isn’t a story. It’s just a daydream until you actually write it down. So write it down.
general.author: andy weir

general.quote: In dreams no man wears a mask.
general.author: edward counsel

general.quote: And our dreams are who we are.
general.author: barbara sher

general.quote: Nothing happens unless first a dream.
general.author: carl sandburg

general.quote: Action is the last resource of those who know not how to dream.
general.author: oscar wilde

general.quote: It is a shame that when we have a good dream we are asleep at the time.
general.author: p.k. shaw

general.quote: Dreams are true while they last, and do we not live in dreams?
general.author: alfred, lord tennyson

general.quote: Don’t ever let anyone steal your dreams.
general.author: dexter yager

general.quote: Dreams are illustrations… from the book your soul is writing about you.
general.author: marsha norman

general.quote: Some men dream of worthy accomplishments, while others stay awake and do them.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: Dreaming men are haunted men.
general.author: stephen vincent benet

general.quote: It is difficult to say what is impossible, for the dream of yesterday is the hope of today and the reality of tomorrow.
general.author: robert h. goddard

general.quote: Only things the dreamers make live on. They are the eternal conquerors.
general.author: herbert kaufman

general.quote: The dream is not the destination but the journey.
general.author: diane sawyer

general.quote: Dream your wildest dreams and you will live a wild life.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: Nothing is as real as a dream. The world can change around you, but your dream will not.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: Only in dreams does the happiness of the earth dwell.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: We all have the same dreams.
general.author: joan didion

general.quote: A dream is a microscope through which we look at the hidden occurrences in our soul.
general.author: erich fromm

general.quote: A dreamer is one who can only find his way by moonlight, and his punishment is that he sees the dawn before the rest of the world.
general.author: oscar wilde

general.quote: Dreams are the seedlings of reality.
general.author: napoleon hilll

general.quote: Listen to the color of your dreams.
general.author: the beatles

general.quote: If a little dreaming is dangerous, the cure for it is not to dream less but to dream more, to dream all the time.
general.author: marcel proust

general.quote: Dreams are necessary to life.
general.author: anais nin

general.quote: Never let your fears be the boundaries of your dreams.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: When your heart is in your dream, no request is too extreme.
general.author: jiminy cricket

general.quote: Who is more deprived and alone than the man who has achieved his dream?
general.author: brendan francis

general.quote: To dream of the person you would like to be is to waste the person you are.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: Dreaming permits each and every one of us to be quietly and safely insane every night of the week.
general.author: william dement

general.quote: We do not really feel grateful toward those who make our dreams come true; they ruin our dreams.
general.author: eric hoffer

general.quote: If there were dreams to sell, what would you buy?
general.author: thomas lovell beddoes

general.quote: Oversleeping will never make one’s dreams come true.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: Society often forgives the criminal; it never forgives the dreamer.
general.author: oscar wilde

general.quote: Happy are those who dream dreams and are willing to pay the price to make them come true.
general.author: l.j. cardinal suenens

general.quote: Judge of your natural character by what you do in dreams.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson

general.quote: It may seem that those who do the most, dream the most.
general.author: stephen b. leacock

general.quote: If all of our wishes were gratified, many of our dreams would be destroyed.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: When we can’t dream any longer, we die.
general.author: goldman emma

general.quote: Dreams fade with morning light, never a morn for thee, Dreamer of dreams, goodnight.
general.author: joyce kilmer

general.quote: I dream of painting, and then I paint my dream.
general.author: vincent van gogh

general.quote: We grow by our dreams.
general.author: woodrow t. wilson

general.quote: All that we see or seem, is but a dream within a dream.
general.author: edgar allan poe

general.quote: It’s not what the dream is but what the dream does.
general.author: john h. johnson

general.quote: I cannot sing the old songs, or dream those dreams again.
general.author: charlotte barnard

general.quote: Within your heart, keep one still, secret spot where dreams may go.
general.author: louise driscoll

general.quote: More things are wrought by prayer than this world dreams of.
general.author: lord alfred tennyson

general.quote: Dreams are free.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: Who would ever give up the reality of dreams for relative knowledge?
general.author: alice james

general.quote: A dream which is not interpreted is like a letter which is not read.
general.author: the talmud

general.quote: A daydream is an evasion.
general.author: thomas merton

general.quote: A man is not old until regrets take the place of dreams.
general.author: john barrymore

general.quote: The poor man is not he who is without a cent, but he who without a dream.
general.author: harry kemp

general.quote: Dreams: the place most of us get what we need.
general.author: amy hempel

general.quote: Dreams get you into the future and add excitement to the present.
general.author: robert conklin

general.quote: In dreams, we enter a world that’s entirely our own.
general.author: steven kloves

general.quote: Dreams are the reality of tomorrow.
general.author: dean marshall

general.quote: Dreams are today’s answers to tomorrow’s questions.
general.author: edgar cayce

general.quote: Perhaps life is just that… a dream and a fear.
general.author: joseph conrad

general.quote: A house is made of walls and beams; a home is built with love and dreams.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: You must be the change you wish to see in the world.
general.author: mahatma gandhi quotes

general.quote: Nothing is ever done in this world until men are prepared to kill one another if it is not done.
general.author: george bernard shaw quotes

general.quote: My hope still is to leave the world a bit better than when I got here.
general.author: jim henson

general.quote: Women rule the world. It’s not really worth fighting because they know what they’re doing.
general.author: jon bon jovi

general.quote: One cannot be deeply responsive to the world without being saddened very often.
