general.author: erich fromm

general.quote: The world breaks everyone, and afterward, some are strong at the broken places.
general.author: ernest hemingway quotes

general.quote: The world is full of people who have never, since childhood, met an open doorway with an open mind.
general.author: e. b. white

general.quote: When the world is so complicated, the simple gift of friendship is within all of our hands.
general.author: maria shriver

general.quote: We live in a world of denial, and we don’t know what the truth is anymore.
general.author: javier bardem

general.quote: You’ll never have a quiet world till you knock the patriotism out of the human race.
general.author: george bernard shaw

general.quote: You know, my view is that we have a big world out there.
general.author: hillary clinton

general.quote: You live in a great, big, vast world that you’ve seen none percent of.
general.author: louis c. k.

general.quote: The world is weary of statesmen whom democracy has degraded into politicians.
general.author: benjamin disraeli

general.quote: Has this world been so kind to you that you should leave with regret? There are better things ahead than any we leave behind.
general.author: c. s. lewis

general.quote: So go ahead. Fall down. The world looks different from the ground.
general.author: oprah winfrey quotes

general.quote: We must all learn a good lesson – how to live together. That is the new challenge of the new world… learning to co-exist and not co-annihilate.
general.author: jesse jackson

general.quote: If you cannot renounce the world the genius of happiness will never salute you.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: Life is not fair; get used to it.
general.author: bill gates

general.quote: We talk of our mastery of nature, which sounds very grand; but the fact is we respectfully adapt ourselves, first, to her ways.
general.author: clarence day

general.quote: Sometimes, occasions occur in life which demands you to be a little foolish in order to skillfully extricate yourself.
general.author: francois de la rochefoucauld

general.quote: To exist is to adapt, and if one could not adapt, one died and made room for those who could.
general.author: louis l’amour

general.quote: There are no conditions to which a man cannot become accustomed.
general.author: count leo tolstoy

general.quote: It’s hard for me to get used to these changing times. I can remember when the air was clean and sex was dirty.
general.author: george burns

general.quote: Enjoying success requires the ability to adapt. Only by being open to change will you have a true opportunity to get the most from your talent.
general.author: nolan ryan

general.quote: They are as much for Mars, as for Mercury; as well qualified for war, as for business.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: The assumption must be that those who can see value only in tradition, or versions of it, deny man’s ability to adapt to changing circumstances.
general.author: stephen bayley

general.quote: To the man who only has a hammer, everything he encounters begins to look like a nail.
general.author: abraham h. maslow

general.quote: Wise people are foolish if they cannot adapt to foolish people.
general.author: michel eyquem de montaigne

general.quote: Make the most of the best and the least of the worst.
general.author: robert louis stevenson

general.quote: They that will not apply new remedies must expect new evils.
general.author: francis bacon

general.quote: It is a wise person that adapts themselves to all contingencies; it’s the fool who always struggles like a swimmer against the current.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: Adapt or perish, now as ever, is Nature’s inexorable imperative.
general.author: h.g. wells

general.quote: Things turn out best for people who make the best out of the way things turn out.
general.author: john wooden

general.quote: Marriage is like a hot bath. Once you get used to it, it’s not so hot.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: A well adjusted person is one who makes the same mistake twice without getting nervous.
general.author: jane heard

general.quote: Greatness of soul consists not so much in soaring high and in pressing forward, as in knowing how to adapt and limit oneself.
general.author: michel eyquem de montaigne

general.quote: Nothing is wonderful when you get used to it.
general.author: edgar watson howe

general.quote: We must cut our coat according to our cloth, and adapt ourselves to changing circumstances.
general.author: william ralph inge

general.quote: One learns to adapt to the land in which one lives.
general.author: louis l’amour

general.quote: We must make the best of those ills which cannot be avoided.
general.author: alexander hamilton

general.quote: The weather-cock on the church spire, though made of iron, would soon be broken by the storm-wind if it did not understand the noble art of turning to every wind.
general.author: heinrich heine

general.quote: Singularity shows something wrong in the mind.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: Complete adaptation to environment means death. The essential point in all response is the desire to control environment.
general.author: john dewey

general.quote: The reasonable man adapts himself to the world; the unreasonable man persists in trying to adapt the world to himself. Therefore, all progress depends on the unreasonable man.
general.author: george bernard shaw

general.quote: In the face of an obstacle which is impossible to overcome, stubbornness is stupid.
general.author: simone de beauvoir

general.quote: Adaptability is not imitation. It means power of resistance and assimilation.
general.author: mahatma gandhi

general.quote: It is not the strongest of the species that survives, nor the most intelligent. It is the one that is the most adaptable to change.
general.author: charles galton darwin

general.quote: Learn to adjust yourself to the conditions you have to endure, but make a point of trying to alter or correct conditions so that they are most favorable to you.
general.author: william frederick book

general.quote: For organizations and employees alike, the only real security is the ability to grow, change and adapt.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: One learns to itch where one can scratch.
general.author: ernest bramah

general.quote: In war as in life, it is often necessary when some cherished scheme has failed, to take up the best alternative open, and if so, it is folly not to work for it with all your might.
general.author: winston churchill

general.quote: If we suspect that a man is lying, we should pretend to believe him; for then he becomes bold and assured, lies more vigorously, and is unmasked.
general.author: arthur schopenhauer

general.quote: Most people have seen worse things in private than they pretend to be shocked at in public.
general.author: edgar watson howe

general.quote: It is not good to see people who have been pretending strength all their lives lose it even for a minute.
general.author: lillian hellman

general.quote: Who can direct when all pretend to know?
general.author: oliver goldsmith

general.quote: It’s amazing how many things you can do when you’re just pretending.
general.author: kim gordon

general.quote: Modesty: the gentle art of enhancing your charm by pretending not to be aware of it.
general.author: oliver herford

general.quote: Never pretend to a love which you do not actually feel, for love is not ours to command.
general.author: alan watts

general.quote: We may pretend that we’re basically moral people who make mistakes, but the whole of history proves otherwise.
general.author: terry hands

general.quote: Pretend that every single person you meet has a sign around his or her neck that says, "Make me feel important." Not only will you succeed in sales, you will succeed in life.
general.author: mary kay ash

general.quote: When one is pretending the entire body revolts.
general.author: anais nin

general.quote: China is a civilization pretending to be a nation.
general.author: michael ledeen

general.quote: I can’t pretend that I’m brave and that I can beat the whole world.
general.author: nelson mandela

general.quote: If you would be powerful, pretend to be powerful.
general.author: horne tooke

general.quote: Pretense is the overrating of any kind of knowledge we pretend to.
general.author: jonathan swift

general.quote: It is always self-defeating to pretend to the style of a generation younger than your own; it simply erases your own experience in history.
general.author: renata adler

general.quote: We often pretend to fear what we really despise, and more often despise what we really fear.
general.author: charles caleb colton

general.quote: Some people have a difficult time facing truth and reality. They prefer to live in a make-believe world, pretending that certain things aren’t happening.
general.author: joyce meyer

general.quote: I think women are foolish to pretend they are equal to men; they are far superior and always have been.
general.author: william golding

general.quote: What is it in us that makes us feel the need to keep pretending… we gotta let ourselves be.
general.author: christina aguilera

general.quote: A liberal pretending to be a conservative? That’s like a straight person pretending to be gay to get greater acceptance.
general.author: david mamet

general.quote: Virtue must be valuable, if men and women of all degrees pretend to have it.
general.author: edgar watson howe

general.quote: Nobody’s perfect, and to try to pretend you’re perfect is an exhausting fool’s errand.
general.author: rosemary mahoney

general.quote: We are what we pretend to be, so we must be careful about what we pretend to be.
general.author: kurt vonnegut jr.

general.quote: Always keep that happy attitude. Pretend that you are holding a beautiful fragrant bouquet.
general.author: earl nightingale

general.quote: The great and almost only comfort about being a woman is that one can always pretend to be more stupid than one is and no one is surprised.
general.author: freya stark

general.quote: Life’s like a movie, write your own ending. Keep believing, keep pretending.
general.author: jim henson

general.quote: The greatest way to live with honor in this world is to be what we pretend to be.
general.author: socrates

general.quote: The whole business is built on ego, vanity, self-satisfaction, and it’s total crap to pretend it’s not.
general.author: george michael

general.quote: The surest way to lose truth is to pretend that one already wholly possesses it.
general.author: gordon w. allport

general.quote: It is foolish to pretend that one is fully recovered from a disappointed passion. Such wounds always leave a scar.
general.author: henry wadsworth longfellow

general.quote: I don’t pretend to understand the Universe — it’s a great deal bigger than I am.
general.author: thomas carlyle

general.quote: Being is like pretending.
general.author: mira sorvino

general.quote: I am an agnostic; I do not pretend to know what many ignorant men are sure of.
general.author: clarence darrow

general.quote: Pretending that we live doesn’t make us alive.
general.author: serj tankian

general.quote: Whoever you pretend to be, you must face yourself eventually.
general.author: al stewart

general.quote: I’m not an actress who can create a character. I play me.
general.author: mary tyler moore

general.quote: You don’t get in life what you want; you get in life what you are.
general.author: les brown

general.quote: Character is doing the right thing when nobody’s looking. There are too many people who think that the only thing that’s right is to get by, and the only thing that’s wrong is to get caught.
general.author: j.c. watts

general.quote: Action is character.
general.author: f. scott fitzgerald

general.quote: It is not what he had, or even what he does which expresses the worth of a man, but what he is.
general.author: henri frederic amiel

general.quote: The highest qualities of character… must be earned.
general.author: lyman abbott

general.quote: As fire when thrown into water is cooled down and put out, so also a false accusation when brought against a man of the purest and holiest character, boils over and is at once dissipated, and vanishes and threats of heaven and sea, himself standing unmoved.
general.author: marcus t. cicero

general.quote: Character is that which reveals moral purpose, exposing the class of things a man chooses or avoids.
general.author: aristotle

general.quote: People seem not to see that their opinion of the world is also a confession of character.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson

general.quote: Character is victory organized.
general.author: napoleon bonaparte

general.quote: Let us not say, every man is the architect of his own fortune; but let us say, every man is the architect of his own character.
general.author: george d. boardman

general.quote: Beauty can’t amuse you, but brainwork — reading, writing, thinking — can.
general.author: helen gurley brown

general.quote: A man’s character is the reality of himself; his reputation, the opinion others have formed about him; character resides in him, reputation in other people; that is the substance, this is the shadow.
general.author: henry ward beecher

general.quote: Character is what you know you are, not what others think you have.
general.author: marva collins

general.quote: Character matters: leadership descends from character.
general.author: rush limbaugh

general.quote: Reputation is character minus what you’ve been caught doing.
general.author: michael iapoce

general.quote: Character must be kept bright as well as clean.
general.author: philip dormer stanhope chesterfield

general.quote: Action, looks, words, steps, form the alphabet by which you may spell character.
general.author: johann kaspar lavater

general.quote: Property may be destroyed and money may lose its purchasing power; but, character, health, knowledge and good judgment will always be in demand under all conditions.
general.author: roger babson

general.quote: In each human heart are a tiger, a pig, an ass and a nightingale. Diversity of character is due to their unequal activity.
general.author: ambrose bierce

general.quote: I hope I shall possess firmness and virtue enough to maintain what I consider the most enviable of all titles, the character of an honest man.
general.author: george washington

general.quote: Nearly all men can stand adversity, but if you want to test a man’s character, give him power.
general.author: abraham lincoln

general.quote: Character is the basis of happiness and happiness the sanction of character.
general.author: george santayana

general.quote: Character is higher than intellect.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson

general.quote: Our character is basically a composite of our habits. Because they are consistent, often unconscious patterns, they constantly, daily, express our character…
general.author: stephen r. covey

general.quote: Style is the image of character.
general.author: edward gibbon

general.quote: If you create an act, you create a habit. If you create a habit, you create a character. If you create a character, you create a destiny.
general.author: andre maurois

general.quote: Luck relies on chance, labor on character.
general.author: richard cobden

general.quote: Those who cross the sea change only the climate, not their character.
general.author: horace

general.quote: Sports do not build character. They reveal it.
general.author: john wooden

general.quote: Surmounting difficulty is the crucible that forms character.
general.author: anthony robbins

general.quote: Watch your thoughts; they become words. Watch your words; they become actions. Watch your actions; they become habits. Watch your habits; they become character. Watch your character; it becomes your destiny.
general.author: frank outlaw

general.quote: During my eighty-seven years, I have witnessed a whole succession of technological revolutions. But none of them has done away with the need for character in the individual or the ability to think.
general.author: bernard m. baruch

general.quote: The history of mankind is his character.
general.author: johann wolfgang von goethe

general.quote: Character is much easier kept than recovered.
general.author: thomas paine

general.quote: Of all the properties which belong to honorable men, not one is so highly prized as that of character.
general.author: henry clay

general.quote: By constant self-discipline and self-control you can develop greatness of character.
general.author: grenville kleiser

general.quote: Be your character what it will, it will be known; and nobody will take it upon your word.
general.author: philip dormer stanhope chesterfield

general.quote: Fame is a vapor, popularity an accident, and riches take wings. Only one thing endures and that is character.
general.author: horace greeley

general.quote: When we see men of a contrary character, we should turn inwards and examine ourselves.
general.author: confucius

general.quote: Before you advise anyone "Be yourself!" reassess his character.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: Character is doing the right thing even when it costs more than you want to pay.
general.author: michael josephson

general.quote: No man can climb out beyond the limitations of his own character.
general.author: john morley

general.quote: Success can never be measured by bank balances. Money measures only prosperity. Success is a matter of character.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: To succeed is nothing — it’s an accident. But to feel no doubts about oneself is something very different: it is character.
general.author: marie leneru

general.quote: All men are alike in their lower natures; it is in their higher characters that they differ.
general.author: john christian bovee

general.quote: Characters do not change. Opinions alter, but characters are only developed.
general.author: benjamin disraeli

general.quote: Every human being is intended to have a character of his own; to be what no others are, and to do what no other can do.
general.author: william ellery channing

general.quote: Talent is commonly developed at the expense of character.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson

general.quote: I have discovered that we may be in some degree whatever character we choose. Besides, practice forms a man to anything.
general.author: james boswell

general.quote: Good character is not formed in a week or a month. It is created little by little, day by day. Protracted and patient effort is needed to develop good character.
general.author: sri swami sivananda

general.quote: The universe seems bankrupt as soon as we begin to discuss the characters of individuals.
general.author: henry david thoreau

general.quote: he best efforts of a fine person is felt after we have left their presence.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson

general.quote: The humblest individual exerts some influence, either for good or evil, upon others.
general.author: henry ward beecher

general.quote: One concept corrupts and confuses the others. I am not speaking of the Evil whose limited sphere is ethics; I am speaking of the infinite.
general.author: jorge luis borges

general.quote: A community is like the ones who govern it.
general.author: marcus t. cicero

general.quote: Who shall set a limit to the influence of a human being?
general.author: ralph waldo emerson

general.quote: The influence of individual character extends from generation to generation.
general.author: iain macleod

general.quote: We are like chameleons, we take our hue and the color of our moral character, from those who are around us.
general.author: john locke

general.quote: It is a strange trade that of advocacy. Your intellect, your highest heavenly gift is hung up in the shop window like a loaded pistol for sale.
general.author: thomas carlyle

general.quote: The serene, silent beauty of a holy life is the most powerful influence in the world, next to the might of the Spirit of God.
general.author: charles haddon spurgeon

general.quote: No star ever rose or set without influence somewhere.
general.author: lord edward robert bulwer lytton

general.quote: In our society a man is known by the company he owns.
general.author: gerald f. lieberman

general.quote: Influence: Science and Practice.
general.author: book previw

general.quote: It is by women that nature writes on the hearts of men.
general.author: richard brinsley sheridan

general.quote: I thank God that if I am gifted with little of the spirit which is said to be able to raise mortals to the skies, I have yet none, as I trust, of that other spirit, which would drag angels down.
general.author: daniel webster,

general.quote: No man stands alone. Through all the centuries of recorded time, men have set into motion influences that affect your life today.
general.author: wilferd arlan peterson

general.quote: At the same time, as social beings, we are moved in the relations with our fellow beings by such feelings as sympathy, pride, hate, need for power, pity, and so on.
general.author: albert einstein

general.quote: Give me a child and I’ll shape him into anything.
general.author: burrhus frederic skinner

general.quote: The work an unknown good man has done is like a vein of water flowing hidden underground, secretly making the ground green.
general.author: thomas carlyle

general.quote: The influential man is the successful man, whether he be rich or poor.
general.author: orison swett marden

general.quote: All talk of winning the people by appealing to their intelligence, of conquering them by impeccable syllogism, is so much moonshine.
general.author: henry louis mencken

general.quote: We should gain more by letting the world see what we are than by trying to seem what we are not.
general.author: francois de la rochefoucauld

general.quote: I’m just a person trapped inside a woman’s body.
general.author: elayne boosler

general.quote: The most important single influence in the life of a person is another person. W e may say to our children: Here is art, science, philosophy, mathematics, music, psychology, history, religion–and we may open innumerable doors along the corridors of living so that they will have a broad and even a minute acquaintance with the segments of life; but these introductions are not as important as knowing people whose characters and actions, personalities and words have grown after similar introductions and have become worthy of emulation.
general.author: paul d. shafer

general.quote: Every life is a profession of faith, and exercises an inevitable and silent influence.
general.author: henri frederic amiel

general.quote: If woman lost us Eden, such as she alone restore it!
general.author: john greenleaf whittier

general.quote: Nothing has a stronger influence psychologically on their environment and especially on their children than the unlived life of the parent.
general.author: carl jung

general.quote: A cloudy day, or a little sunshine, have as great an influence on many constitutions as the most real blessings or misfortunes.
general.author: joseph addison

general.quote: Let no man imagine that he has no influence. Whoever he may be, and where ever he may be placed, the man who thinks becomes a light and a power.
general.author: henry george

general.quote: Get around people who have something of value to share with you. Their impact will continue to have a significant effect on your life long after they have departed.
general.author: jim rohn

general.quote: A woman is more influenced by what she divines than by what she is told.
general.author: ninon de l’enclos

general.quote: Influence is exerted by every human being from the hour of birth to that of death.
general.author: edwin hubbell chapin

general.quote: The secret of my influence has always been that it remained secret.
general.author: salvador dali

general.quote: We must not enable anyone to impose his personal view regarding religion on others by force, oppression, or pressure.
general.author: shirin ebadi

general.quote: There are only about a half dozen things that make 80% of the difference in any area of our lives.
general.author: jim rohn

general.quote: We must not allow other people’s limited perceptions to define us.
general.author: virginia satir

general.quote: God in making man intended by him to reduce all His Works back again to Himself.
general.author: matthew barker

general.quote: Be a pattern to others, and then all will go well; for as a whole city is affected by the licentious passions and vices of great men, so it is likewise reformed by their moderation.
general.author: cicero

general.quote: Every thought which genius and piety throw into the world alters the world.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson

general.quote: It’s just like magic. When you live by yourself, all your annoying habits are gone!
general.author: merrill markoe

general.quote: Some wisdom you must learn from one who’s wise.
general.author: euripides

general.quote: Every one comes between men’s souls and God, either as a brick wall or as a bridge. Either you are leading men to God or you are driving them away.
general.author: canon lindsay dewar

general.quote: Blessed is the influence of one true, loving human soul on another.
general.author: george eliot

general.quote: We live in a world which is full of misery and ignorance, and the plain duty of each and all of us is to try to make the little corner he can influence somewhat less miserable and somewhat less ignorant than it was before he entered it.
general.author: thomas h. huxley

general.quote: Woman’s influence embraces the whole of life.
general.author: alexander walker

general.quote: It’s better to be alone than in foolish and troublesome company. I lay no great stress upon my opinions, or on those of others.
general.author: michel eyquem de montaigne

general.quote: The influence of a beautiful, helpful character is contagious, and may revolutionize a whole town.
general.author: eleanor h. porter

general.quote: It’s easy to make a buck. It’s a lot tougher to make a difference.
general.author: tom brokaw

general.quote: People will sit up and take notice of you if you will sit up and take notice of what makes them sit up and take notice.
general.author: frank romer

general.quote: The words that a father speaks to his children in the privacy of home are not heard by the world, but, as in whispering galleries, they are clearly heard at the end, and by posterity.
general.author: jean paul richter

general.quote: He who influences the thought of his times influences the times that follow.
general.author: elbert hubbard

general.quote: It’s funny. All you have to do is say something nobody understands and they’ll do practically anything you want them to.
general.author: holden caulfield

general.quote: A true measure of your worth includes all the benefits others have gained from your success.
general.author: cullen hightower

general.quote: Socrates had a student named Plato, Plato had a student named Aristotle, and Aristotle had a student named Alexander the Great.
general.author: tom morris

general.quote: The bird that would soar above the plain of tradition and prejudice must have strong wings.
general.author: douglas adams

general.quote: Cultures grow on the vine of tradition.
general.author: jonah goldberg

general.quote: Every heart that has beat strongly and cheerfully has left a hopeful impulse behind it in the world, and bettered the tradition of mankind.
general.author: robert louis stevenson

general.quote: Tradition is the illusion of permanence.
general.author: woody allen

general.quote: Sometimes tradition and habit are just that, comfortable excuses to leave things be, even when they are unjust and unworthy.
general.author: matthew scully

general.quote: Nothing is more powerful than custom or habit.
general.author: ovid

general.quote: Nature is seldom in the wrong, custom always.
general.author: lady mary wortley montagu

general.quote: Almost always tradition is nothing but a record and a machine-made imitation of the habits that our ancestors created.
general.author: walter lippmann

general.quote: As soon as tradition has come to be recognized as tradition, it is dead.
general.author: allan bloom

general.quote: People do more from custom than from reason.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: Of course poets have morals and manners of their own, and custom is no argument with them.
general.author: thomas hardy

general.quote: Tradition is a guide and not a jailer.
general.author: w. somerset maugham

general.quote: Tradition, long conditioned thinking, can bring about a fixation, a concept that one readily accepts, perhaps not with a great deal of thought.
general.author: jiddu krishnamurti

general.quote: Traditionalists are pessimists about the future and optimists about the past.
general.author: lewis mumford

general.quote: I was brought up in the great tradition of the late nineteenth century: that a writer never complains, never explains and never disdains.
general.author: james a. michener

general.quote: Tradition becomes our security, and when the mind is secure it is in decay.
general.author: jiddu krishnamurti

general.quote: Customs and convictions change; respectable people are the last to know, or to admit, the change, and the ones most offended by fresh reflections of the facts in the mirror of art.
general.author: john updike

general.quote: Teaching is not a lost art, but the regard for it is a lost tradition.
general.author: jacques barzun

general.quote: Tradition is comforting. It’s solemn, steady and unwavering.
general.author: will peebles

general.quote: Tradition does not mean that the living are dead, it means that the dead are living.
general.author: harold macmillan

general.quote: Laws are subordinate to custom.
general.author: titus maccius plautus

general.quote: It cannot be inherited, and if you want it you must obtain it by great labor.
general.author: t. s. eliot

general.quote: Traditions are the guideposts driven deep in our subconscious minds. The most powerful ones are those we can’t even describe and aren’t even aware of.
general.author: ellen goodman

general.quote: Tradition is an important help to history, but its statements should be carefully scrutinized before we rely on them.
general.author: joseph addison

general.quote: Tradition is the living faith of the dead, traditionalism is the dead faith of the living. And, I suppose I should add, it is traditionalism that gives tradition such a bad name.
general.author: jaroslav pelikan

general.quote: Tradition is a fine thing. Nothing comes out of the blue, except perhaps thunderbolts and they are not really very useful things.
general.author: stacy aumonier

general.quote: Tradition may be good or bad.
general.author: noah webster

general.quote: A precedent embalms a principle.
general.author: benjamin disraeli

general.quote: The dead govern the living.
general.author: auguste comte

general.quote: It is of the essence of traditions that they cover or conceal their humble foundations by erecting impressive edifices on them.
general.author: leo strauss

general.quote: A love of tradition has never weakened a nation, indeed it has strengthened nations in their hour of peril; but the new view must come, the world must roll forward.
general.author: winston churchill

general.quote: Often, the less there is to justify a traditional custom, the harder it is to get rid of it.
general.author: mark twain

general.quote: Tradition: one of those words conservative people use as a shortcut to thinking.
general.author: warren ellis

general.quote: Observance of customs and laws can very easily be a cloak for a lie so subtle that our fellow human beings are unable to detect it.
general.author: carl jung

general.quote: Our American tradition of neighbor helping neighbor has always been one of our greatest strengths and most noble traditions.
general.author: ronald reagan

general.quote: Marriage brings one into fatal connection with custom and tradition, and traditions and customs are like the wind and weather, altogether incalculable.
general.author: soren kierkegaard

general.quote: A tradition without intelligence is not worth having.
general.author: t. s. eliot

general.quote: The way of the world is to make laws, but follow custom.
general.author: michel eyquem de montaigne

general.quote: Human beings need to belong to a tradition and equally need to know about the world in which they find themselves.
general.author: paula gunn allen

general.quote: Learning to touch deeply the jewels of our own tradition will allow us to understand and appreciate the values of other traditions.
general.author: thich nhat hanh

general.quote: A kind Providence furnishes the limpest personality with a little gum or starch in the form of tradition.
general.author: george eliot

general.quote: In America nothing dies easier than tradition.
general.author: russell wayne baker

general.quote: When men are oppressed, it’s a tragedy. When women are oppressed, it’s tradition.
general.author: letty cottin pogrebin

general.quote: The empire of custom is most mighty.
general.author: publilius syrus

general.quote: Don’t talk to me about naval tradition. It’s nothing but rum, sodomy and the lash.
general.author: winston churchill

general.quote: Tradition is a great resistant force and the inertia of history. Yet because it is only negative, it must be destroyed.
general.author: friedrich engels

general.quote: The assumption must be that those who can see value only in tradition, or versions of it, deny man’s ability to adapt to changing circumstances.
general.author: stephen bayley

general.quote: The youth of America is their oldest tradition. It has been going on now for three hundred years.
general.author: oscar wilde

general.quote: The less there is to justify a traditional custom, the harder it is to get rid of it.
general.author: mark twain

general.quote: You do not understand your own tradition if you do not see it in relation to others.
general.author: john searle

general.quote: All tradition is merely the past.
general.author: jiddu krishnamurti

general.quote: The despotism of custom is everywhere the standing hindrance to human advancement.
general.author: john stuart mill

general.quote: Custom, then, is the great guide of human life.
general.author: david hume

general.quote: As tradition is a gift of the Spirit, its trajectory moves in the right direction, although it has not arrived at its destination.
general.author: brian d. mclaren

general.quote: Custom reconciles us to everything.
general.author: edmund burke

general.quote: Sometimes traditions turn into unwritten rules we don’t want to break.
general.author: jay feeney

general.quote: People usually think according to their inclinations, speak according to their learning and ingrained opinions, but generally act according to custom.
general.author: francis bacon

general.quote: Whoever approaches me walking, I will come to him running; and he who meets me with sins equivalent to the whole world, I will greet him with forgiveness equal to it.
general.author: mishkat al-massabaih

general.quote: Whether it’s eight o’clock in the morning or eight o’clock at night, I always try to greet others before they have a chance to speak to me.
general.author: zig ziglar

general.quote: How glorious a greeting the sun gives the mountains!
general.author: john muir

general.quote: When an opponent comes forward, move in and greet him; if he wants to pull back, send him on his way.
general.author: morihei ueshiba

general.quote: Trouble will come soon enough, and when he does come receive him as pleasantly as possible. The more amiably you greet him, the sooner he will go away.
general.author: artemus ward

general.quote: There is no friend like an old friend who has shared our morning days, no greeting like his welcome, no homage like his praise.
general.author: oliver wendell holmes, sr.

general.quote: There is an invisible garment woven around us from our earliest years; it is made of the way we eat, the way we walk, the way we greet people.
general.author: jean giraudoux

general.quote: The true adventurer goes forth aimless and uncalculating to meet and greet unknown fate.
general.author: o. henry

general.quote: Strong men greet war, tempest, hard times. They wish, as Pindar said, to tread the floors of hell, with necessities as hard as iron.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson

general.quote: Men greet each other with a sock on the arm, women with a hug, and the hug wears better in the long run.
general.author: edward hoagland

general.quote: Love consists in this, that two solitudes protect and touch and greet each other.
general.author: rainer maria rilke

general.quote: If I should meet thee after long years, how should I greet thee? – With silence and tears.
general.author: lord byron

general.quote: I will greet this day with love in my heart. For this is the greatest secret of success in all ventures. Muscles can split a shield and even destroy life itself but only the unseen power of love can open the hearts of man.
general.author: og mandino

general.quote: I try to greet my friends with a drink in my hand, a warm smile on my face, and great music in the background, because that’s what gets a dinner party off to a fun start.
general.author: ina garten

general.quote: I love spring anywhere, but if I could choose I would always greet it in a garden.
general.author: ruth stout

general.quote: I don’t turn to greeting cards for wisdom and advice, but they are a fine reflection of the general drift of the culture.
general.author: susan orlean

general.quote: Greet every morning with open arms and say thanks every night with a full heart. Each day is a precious gift to be savored and used, not left unopened and hoarded for a future that may never come.
general.author: regina

general.quote: Gratitude is a twofold love — love coming to visit us, and love running out to greet a welcome guest.
general.author: henry van dyke

general.quote: Don’t tell your friends about your indigestion. ‘How are you’ is a greeting, not a question.
general.author: arthur guiterman

general.quote: Don’t send funny greeting cards on birthdays or at Christmas. Save them for funerals, when their cheery effect is needed.
general.author: p. j. o’rourke

general.quote: As ships meet at sea a moment together, when words of greeting must be spoken, and then away upon the deep, so men meet in this world; and I think we should cross no man’s path without hailing him, and if he needs giving him supplies.
general.author: henry ward beecher

general.quote: And if you don’t believe the sun will rise, stand alone and greet the coming night in the last remaining light.
general.author: chris cornell

general.quote: Not only does the wind of accidents stir me according to its blowing, but I am also stirred and troubled by the instability of my attitude.
general.author: michel de montaigne

general.quote: The most vital thing in a man’s life is his mental attitude.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: Your attitude is like the engine that runs the car. The more finely tuned that engine is, the better the car will run.
general.author: keith harrell

general.quote: Excellence is not a skill. It is an attitude.
general.author: ralph marston

general.quote: Attitudes are the forerunners of conditions.
general.author: eric butterworth

general.quote: The greatest discovery of my generation is that a human being can alter his life by altering his attitudes.
general.author: william james

general.quote: Great effort springs naturally from a great attitude.
general.author: pat riley

general.quote: Whenever you’re in conflict with someone, there is one factor that can make the difference between damaging your relationship and deepening it. That factor is attitude.
general.author: timothy bentley

general.quote: Your attitude about who you are and what you have is a very little thing that makes a very big difference.
general.author: theodore roosevelt

general.quote: Attitudes are more important than facts.
general.author: karl a. menninger

general.quote: When one maintains his proper attitude in life, he does not long after externals.
general.author: epictetus

general.quote: Attitude is more important than the past, than education, than money, than circumstances, than what people do or say. It is more important than appearance, giftedness, or skill.
general.author: charles swindoll

general.quote: Our own attitudes always seem OK because we use an attitude to judge itself. No matter how much misery our attitudes cause, we will always defend them.
general.author: thomas r. blakeslee

general.quote: A child’s attitude toward everything is an artist’s attitude.
general.author: willa cather

general.quote: The only difference between a good day and a bad day is your attitude.
general.author: dennis s. brown

general.quote: Attitude … is the vanguard of your true self.
general.author: john c. maxwell

general.quote: It is our attitude at the beginning of a difficult task which, more than anything else, will affect its successful outcome.
general.author: william james

general.quote: People with a positive attitude are influenced by what goes on within them. People with a negative attitude are influenced by what goes on around them.
general.author: keith harrell

general.quote: Adopting the right attitude can convert a negative stress into a positive one.
general.author: hans selye

general.quote: Possessing a great attitude is like having a secret weapon. All things being equal, attitude wins. All things not being equal, attitude still sometimes wins.
general.author: john c. maxwell

general.quote: The only disability in life is a bad attitude.
general.author: scott hamilton

general.quote: A strong positive mental attitude will create more miracles than any wonder drug.
general.author: patricia neal

general.quote: Ability is what you’re capable of doing. Motivation determines what you do. Attitude determines how well you do it.
general.author: lou holtz

general.quote: The remarkable thing is, we have a choice everyday regarding the attitude we will embrace for that day.
general.author: charles swindoll

general.quote: Take the attitude of a student: never be too big to ask questions; never know too much to learn something new.
general.author: og mandino

general.quote: The bottom line on attitude is that a good one helps to increase your possibilities. Pessimists usually get what they expect. So do optimists.
general.author: john c. maxwell

general.quote: Happiness is an attitude. We either make ourselves miserable, or happy and strong. The amount of work is the same.
general.author: francesca reigler

general.quote: A positive attitude may not solve all your problems, but it will annoy enough people to make it worth the effort.
general.author: herm albright

general.quote: Humor prevents a "hardening of the attitudes."
general.author: joel goodman

general.quote: Happiness is an attitude of mind, born of the simple determination to be happy under all outward circumstances.
general.author: j. donald walters

general.quote: The greatest day in your life and mine is when we take total responsibility for our attitudes. That’s the day we truly grow up.
general.author: john c. maxwell

general.quote: The happiest people are the people with the best attitudes, not the best lives.
general.author: bob lonsberry

general.quote: The ideal attitude is to be physically loose and mentally tight.
general.author: arthur ashe

general.quote: Attitudes are contagious. Are yours worth catching?
general.author: dennis and wendy mannering

general.quote: Your attitude determines how you experience the world.
general.author: sanaya roman

general.quote: A bad attitude is the worst thing that can happen to a group of people. It’s infectious.
general.author: roger allan raby

general.quote: Attitude is your acceptance of the natural laws, or your rejection of the natural laws.
general.author: jim rohn

general.quote: The greatest revolution in our generation is that of human beings, who by changing the inner attitudes of their minds, can change the outer aspects of their lives.
general.author: marilyn ferguson

general.quote: Your attitude is either in the way, on the way, or creating a way.
general.author: sam glenn

general.quote: Our attitude toward life determines life’s attitude towards us.
general.author: earl nightingale

general.quote: A happy person is not a person in a certain set of circumstances, but rather a person with a certain set of attitudes.
general.author: hugh downs

general.quote: A kick butt attitude is like a breath of fresh air that will attract opportunities. A sour attitude is like bad breath that can clear a room in a heartbeat, repelling opportunities.
general.author: sam glenn

general.quote: Pathetic attitudes are not in keeping with greatness.
general.author: friedrich wilhelm nietzsche

general.quote: We are injured and hurt emotionally, Not so much by other people or what they say and don’t say, But by our own attitude and our own response.
general.author: maxwell maltz

general.quote: Certain thoughts are prayers. There are moments when, whatever the attitude of the body, the soul is on its knees.
general.author: victor hugo

general.quote: Whether your attitude is good or bad, it is what people are going to remember about you.
general.author: renee evenson

general.quote: Eagles come in all shapes and sizes, but you will recognize them chiefly by their attitudes.
general.author: charles prestwich scott

general.quote: Weakness of attitude becomes weakness of character.
general.author: albert einstein

general.quote: There are no menial jobs, only menial attitudes.
general.author: william j. bennett

general.quote: Human beings can alter their lives by altering their attitudes of mind.
general.author: william james

general.quote: Nothing can stop the man with the right mental attitude from achieving his goal; nothing on earth can help the man with the wrong mental attitude.
general.author: thomas jefferson

general.quote: Your attitude determines your altitude.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: Your attitude to life is far more important in determining your happiness than your money, appearance, social status or talent.
general.author: stephanie dowrick

general.quote: Man’s rise or fall, success or failure, happiness or unhappiness depends on his attitude… a man’s attitude will create the situation he imagines.
general.author: james allen

general.quote: You cannot tailor make your situation in life, but you can tailor make your attitudes to fit those situations.
general.author: zig ziglar

general.quote: Always keep that happy attitude. Pretend that you are holding a beautiful fragrant bouquet.
general.author: candice m. pope

general.quote: Your attitude, not your aptitude, will determine your altitude.
general.author: zig zigler

general.quote: Being a sex symbol has to do with an attitude, not looks. Most men think it’s looks, most women know otherwise.
general.author: kathleen turner

general.quote: Attitude is like chalk dust–it gets on everything you touch.
general.author: sam glenn

general.quote: A healthy attitude is contagious but don’t wait to catch it from others. Be a carrier.
general.author: source unknown

general.quote: Leadership is practiced not so much in words as in attitude and in actions.
general.author: harold geneen

general.quote: For success, attitude is equally as important as ability.
general.author: harry f. banks

general.quote: We awaken in others the same attitude of mind we hold toward them.
general.author: elbert hubbard

general.quote: Work is either fun or drudgery. It depends on your attitude.
general.author: colleen c. barrett

general.quote: A person with a positive attitude is like a fruit of all seasons.
general.author: shiv khera

general.quote: The control center of your life is your attitude.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: The name we give to something shapes our attitude toward it.
general.author: katherine paterson

general.quote: Attitude is a little thing that makes a big difference.
general.author: winston churchill

general.quote: When you are thwarted, it is your own attitude that is out of order.
general.author: johann echkart

general.quote: He, who should teach men to die, would at the same time teach them to live.
general.author: michel eyquem de montaigne

general.quote: Example sheds a genial ray which men are apt to borrow, so first improve yourself today, and then your friends tomorrow.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: Other men are lenses through which we read our own minds.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson

general.quote: When we see men of worth, we should think of becoming like them; when we see men of a contrary character, we should turn inward and examine ourselves.
general.author: confucius

general.quote: We should never permit ourselves to do anything that we are not willing to see our children do.
general.author: brigham young

general.quote: First find the man in yourself if you will inspire manliness in others.
general.author: amos bronson alcott

general.quote: None preaches better than the ant, and she says nothing.
general.author: benjamin franklin

general.quote: Example is a bright looking-glass, universal and for all shapes to look into.
general.author: michel eyquem de montaigne

general.quote: A good example is far better than a good precept.
general.author: dwight l. moody

general.quote: Example is a motive of very prevailing force on the actions of men.
general.author: samuel rogers

general.quote: Life will teach you the lessons; it is up to you to learn them.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: Examples would indeed be excellent things were not people so modest that none will set, and so vain that none will follow them.
general.author: augustus william hare

general.quote: Employee of the month is a good example of how somebody can be both a winner and a loser at the same time.
general.author: demetri martin

general.quote: You train people how to treat you by how you treat yourself.
general.author: martin rutte

general.quote: They who set an example make a highway. Others follow the example, because it is easier to travel on a highway than over untrodden grounds.
general.author: horace mann

general.quote: The world is upheld by the veracity of good men: they make the earth wholesome. They who lived with them found life glad and nutritious. Life is sweet and tolerable only in our belief in such society.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson

general.quote: The road by precepts is tedious, by example, short and efficacious.
general.author: seneca

general.quote: It is well to learn from the misfortunes of others what should be avoided.
general.author: syrus

general.quote: Nothing is so contagious as an example. We never do great good or evil without bringing about more of the same on the part of others.
general.author: francois de la rochefoucauld

general.quote: Man is an imitative creature, and whoever is foremost leads the herd.
general.author: johann christoph friedrich von schiller

general.quote: The efficacy of good examples in the formation of public opinion is incalculable. Though men justify their conduct by reasons, and sometimes bring the very rules of virtue to the touchstone of abstraction, yet they principally act from example.
general.author: robert hall

general.quote: Example is contagious behavior.
general.author: charles reade

general.quote: Don’t be just another member of society, be a living example of your dreams and goals.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: Examples draw where precept fails, and sermons are less read than tales.
general.author: matthew prior

general.quote: I don’t know any other way to lead but by example.
general.author: don shula

general.quote: We should look at the lives of all as at a mirror, and take from others an example for ourselves.
general.author: terence

general.quote: This, then, is the test we must set for ourselves; not to march alone but to march in such a way that others will wish to join us.
general.author: hubert h. humphrey

general.quote: You have to set the tone and the pace, define objectives and strategies, and demonstrate through personal example what you expect from others.
general.author: stanley c. gault

general.quote: There is a transcendent power in example. We reform others unconsciously when we walk uprightly.
general.author: madame anne sophie swetchine

general.quote: No man is so insignificant as to be sure his example can do no hurt.
general.author: lord clarendon

general.quote: There is nothing so annoying as a good example!
general.author: mark twain

general.quote: A person always doing his or her best becomes a natural leader, just by example.
general.author: joe dimaggio

general.quote: Setting an example is not the main means of influencing others; it is the only means.
general.author: albert einstein

general.quote: Be careful how you live; you will be the only Bible some people ever read.
general.author: william j. toms

general.quote: Whoever would change men must change the conditions of their lives.
general.author: theodor herz

general.quote: Others will follow your footsteps easier than they will your advice.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: Example moves the world more than doctrine. The great exemplars are the poets of action, and it makes little difference whether they be forces for good or forces for evil.
general.author: henry miller

general.quote: Practice what you preach.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: The professionals must set a good example.
general.author: a. bartlett giamatti

general.quote: No rules exist, and examples are simply life-savers answering the appeals of rules making vain attempts to exist.
general.author: andre breton

general.quote: Whatever parent gives his children good instruction and sets them at the same time a bad example, may be considered as bringing them food in one hand and poison in the other.
general.author: john balguy

general.quote: Well done, is better than well said.
general.author: benjamin franklin

general.quote: Few things are harder to put up with than the annoyance of a good example.
general.author: mark twain

general.quote: Example is the school of mankind, and they will learn at no other.
general.author: edmund burke

general.quote: Example is the best precept.
general.author: aesop

general.quote: A wise and good man will turn examples of all sorts to his own advantage. The good he will make his patterns, and strive to equal or excel them. The bad he will by all means avoid.
general.author: thomas a kempis

general.quote: Every man is bound to tolerate the act of which be himself has set the example.
general.author: phaedrus

general.quote: The greatest gift you and your partner can give your children is the example of an intimate, healthy, and loving relationship.
general.author: barbara de angelis

general.quote: Produce great men, the rest follows.
general.author: walt whitman

general.quote: The first great gift we can bestow on others is a good example.
general.author: thomas morell

general.quote: You’ve got to make it a good example for those kids regardless of how much you mess up.
general.author: fantasia barrino

general.quote: Whence do you derive the power and privilege of a parent, when you, though an old man, do worse things (than your child)?
general.author: juvenal

general.quote: Where one man reads the Bible, a hundred read you and me.
general.author: dwight l. moody

general.quote: What you learn from bad habits and in bad society you will never forget, and it will be a lasting pang to you.
general.author: john bartholomew gough

general.quote: No reproof or denunciation is so potent as the silent influence of a good example.
general.author: hosea baalou

general.quote: Example has more followers than reason. We unconsciously imitate what pleases us, and approximate to the characters we most admire.
general.author: john christian bovee

general.quote: We live in an age that hath more need of good example than precepts.
general.author: george herbert

general.quote: Children will imitate their fathers in their vices, seldom in their repentance.
general.author: charles haddon spurgeon

general.quote: We should correct our own faults by seeing how uncomely they appear in others; who will not abhor a choleric passion, and a saucy pride in himself, that sees how ridiculous and contemptible they render those who are infested with them?
general.author: j. beaumont

general.quote: Examples of vicious courses practiced in a domestic circle corrupt more readily and more deeply when we behold them in persons in authority.
general.author: juvenal

general.quote: Nothing preaches better than the act.
general.author: benjamin franklin

general.quote: Example acquires tenfold authority when it speaks from the grave.
general.author: wendell phillips

general.quote: What you do not want others to do to you, do not do to others.
general.author: confucius

general.quote: There is no teaching to compare with example.
general.author: robert baden-powell

general.quote: The trouble with using experience as a guide is that the final exam often comes first and then the lesson.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: The road to learning by precept is long, but by example short and effective.
general.author: marcus annaeus seneca

general.quote: Advice maybe wrong, but examples prove themselves.
general.author: henry wheeler shaw

general.quote: Much more profitable and gracious is doctrine by example than by rule.
general.author: edmund spenser

general.quote: The best teachers of humanity are the lives of great men.
general.author: samuel johnson

general.quote: A man who lives right, and is right, has more power in his silence than another has by his words.
general.author: phillips brooks

general.quote: If you must hold yourself up to your children as an object lesson, hold yourself up as a warning and not an example.
general.author: george bernard shaw

general.quote: What we have achieved is a good example of how the right policies deliver.
general.author: rodrigo rato

general.quote: If there is such a thing as good leadership, it is to give a good example.
general.author: ingvar kamprad

general.quote: Children are natural mimics — they act like their parents in spite of every attempt to teach them good manners.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: We are too quick to imitate depraved examples.
general.author: juvenal

general.quote: Example is not the main thing in influencing others. It is the only thing.
general.author: albert schweitzer

general.quote: Ill patterns are sure to be followed more than good rules.
general.author: john locke

general.quote: Example is more forcible than precept. People look at my six days in the week to see what I mean on the seventh.
general.author: richard cecil

general.quote: No man or woman of the humblest sort can really be strong, gentle, pure, and good, without the world being the better for it, without somebody being helped and comforted by the very existence of that goodness.
general.author: phillips brooks

general.quote: Setting a good example for your children takes all the fun out of middle age.
general.author: william feather

general.quote: Example is always more efficacious than precept.
general.author: samuel johnson

general.quote: Example is leadership.
general.author: albert schweitzer

general.quote: They teach the morals of a whore, and the manners of a dancing master.
general.author: samuel johnson

general.quote: Setting a good example is a far better way to spread ideals than through force of arms.
general.author: ron paul

general.quote: It is easier to exemplify values than teach them.
general.author: theodore m. hesburgh

general.quote: There are bad examples which are worse than crimes; and more states have perished from the violation of morality than from the violation of law.
general.author: charles de montesquieu

general.quote: Live as you wish your kids would.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: Precept is instruction written in the sand, the tide flows over it and the record is gone. Example is graven on the rock, and the lesson is not soon lost.
general.author: william ellery channing

general.quote: I am satisfied that we are less convinced by what we hear than by what we see.
general.author: herodotus

general.quote: I have ever deemed it more honorable and more profitable, too, to set a good example than to follow a bad one.
general.author: thomas jefferson

general.quote: He teaches me to be good who does me good.
general.author: thomas fuller

general.quote: Example, whether it be good or bad, has a powerful influence.
general.author: george washington

general.quote: We are more speedily and fatally corrupted by domestic examples of vice, and particularly when they are impressed on our minds as from authority.
general.author: horace

general.quote: Men trust rather to their eyes than to their ears; the effect of precepts is therefore slow and tedious, whilst that of examples is summary and effectual.
general.author: seneca

general.quote: The strongest principle of growth lies in human choice.
general.author: george eliot

general.quote: You and I are essentially infinite choice-makers. In every moment of our existence, we are in that field of all possibilities where we have access to an infinity of choices.
general.author: deepak chopra

general.quote: Courage is when you have choices.
general.author: terry anderson

general.quote: The measure of choosing well is whether a man likes what he has chosen.
general.author: charles lamb

general.quote: Every choice you make has an end result.
general.author: zig ziglar

general.quote: There’s a small, choice in rotten apples.
general.author: william shakespeare quotes

general.quote: Everything is something you decide to do, and there is nothing you have to do.
general.author: denis waitley

general.quote: Choose your love, Love your choice.
general.author: thomas s. monson

general.quote: A man is too apt to forget that in this world he cannot have everything. A choice is all that is left for him.
general.author: harry mathews

general.quote: Love is a choice — not simply, or necessarily, a rational choice, but rather a willingness to be present to others without pretense or guile.
general.author: carter heyward

general.quote: We are free up to the point of choice, then the choice controls the chooser.
general.author: mary crowley

general.quote: If you choose not to decide, you still have made a choice.
general.author: neil peart

general.quote: You have no choice about how you lose, but you do have a choice about how you come back and prepare to win again.
general.author: pat riley

general.quote: Man’s power of choice enables him to think like an angel or a devil, a king or a slave. Whatever he chooses, mind will create and manifest.
general.author: frederick bailes

general.quote: I choose to be found doing my duty.
general.author: abraham davenport

general.quote: We do not choose the day of our birth nor may we choose the day of our death, yet choice is the sovereign faculty of the mind.
general.author: thornton wilder

general.quote: You are where you are today because you have chosen to be there.
general.author: harry browne

general.quote: The difficulty in life is the choice.
general.author: george moore

general.quote: So much to win, so much to lose, No marvel that I fear to choose.
general.author: letitia elizabeth landon

general.quote: Look for your choices, pick the best one, then go with it.
general.author: pat rile

general.quote: When you have to make a choice and don’t make it, that is in itself a choice.
general.author: william james

general.quote: In the choice between changing one’s mind and proving there’s no need to do so, most people get busy on the proof.
general.author: john kenneth galbraith

general.quote: Every person has free choice. Free to obey or disobey the Natural Laws. Your choice determines the consequences. Nobody ever did, or ever will, escape the consequences of his choices.
general.author: alfred a. montapert

general.quote: The key to your universe is that you can choose.
general.author: frederick (carl) frieseke

general.quote: Choose the life that is most useful, and habit will make it the most agreeable.
general.author: francis bacon

general.quote: Choose the way of life. Choose the way of love. Choose the way of caring. Choose the way of goodness. It’s up to you. It’s your choice.
general.author: leo buscaglia

general.quote: Life is the sum of all your choices.
general.author: albert camus

general.quote: What we call the secret of happiness is no more a secret than our willingness to choose life.
general.author: leo buscaglia

general.quote: We choose our joys and sorrows long before we experience them.
general.author: kahlil gibran

general.quote: When making your choice in life, do not neglect to live.
general.author: samuel johnson

general.quote: Of course, fortune has its part in human affairs, but conduct is really much more important.
general.author: jean detourbey

general.quote: Seeing the light is a choice, not seeing the light is no choice.
general.author: doug horton

general.quote: Choice strengthens all.
general.author: neal prescot

general.quote: Be miserable. Or motivate yourself. Whatever has to be done, it’s always your choice.
general.author: wayne dyer

general.quote: To decide is to walk facing forward with nary a crick in your neck from looking back at the crossroads.
general.author: betsy cañas garmon

general.quote: We cannot lead a choiceless life. Every day, every moment, every second, there is a choice. If it were not so, we would not be individuals.
general.author: ernest holmes

general.quote: God offers to every mind its choice between truth and repose.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson

general.quote: Guess, if you can, and choose, if you dare.
general.author: pierre corneille

general.quote: Some persons are very decisive when it comes to avoiding decisions.
general.author: brendan francis

general.quote: Each person designs his own life, freedom gives him the power to carry out his own designs, and power gives the freedom to interfere with the designs of others.
general.author: eric berne

general.quote: The more equally attractive two alternatives seem, the harder it can be to choose between them — no matter that, to the same degree, the choice can only matter less.
general.author: edward fredkin’s paradox

general.quote: Reconsider, v. To seek a justification for a decision already made.
general.author: ambrose bierce

general.quote: Using the power of decision gives you the capacity to get past any excuse to change any and every part of your life in an instant.
general.author: anthony robbins

general.quote: You are the person who has to decide. Whether you’ll do it or toss it aside.
general.author: edgar a. guest

general.quote: It is your own convictions which compels you; that is, choice compels choice.
general.author: epictetus

general.quote: There is always a time to make right what is wrong.
general.author: susan griffin

general.quote: Between two evils, choose neither; between two goods, choose both.
general.author: tryon edwards

general.quote: You can’t choose up sides on a round world.
general.author: wayne dyer

general.quote: You are either part of the solution or part of the problem.
general.author: eldridge cleaver

general.quote: The hardest thing to learn in life is which bridge to cross and which to burn.
general.author: david russell

general.quote: A human being is a deciding being.
general.author: viktor e. frankl

general.quote: It is not something I must do but something I want to do.
general.author: james fixx

general.quote: You’ve got a lot of choices. If getting out of bed in the morning is a chore and you’re not smiling on a regular basis, try another choice.
general.author: steven d. woodhull

general.quote: The difference between fiction and reality? Fiction has to make sense.
general.author: tom clancy

general.quote: Everything is self-evident.
general.author: rene descartes

general.quote: Reality, as usual, beats fiction out of sight.
general.author: joseph conrad

general.quote: One of the definitions of sanity, itself, is the ability to tell real from unreal. Shall we need a new definition?
general.author: alvin toffler

general.quote: Reality becomes a prison to those who can’t get out of it.
general.author: joyce cary

general.quote: If you try hard enough, you can bend the spoon; you can shift reality.
general.author: christopher meloni

general.quote: The reality of life is that your perceptions — right or wrong — influence everything else you do.
general.author: roger birkman

general.quote: Reality must prove itself again and again to questioners … it is the fantasy which goes on without contradiction, without having to prove itself.
general.author: samuel r. delany

general.quote: Your goals, minus your doubts, equal your reality.
general.author: ralph marston

general.quote: One is forever throwing away substance for shadows.
general.author: jennie jerome churchill

general.quote: Nothing is more important than reconnecting with your bliss. Nothing is as rich. Nothing is more real.
general.author: deepak chopra

general.quote: It is sometimes an appropriate response to reality to go insane.
general.author: philip k. dick

general.quote: Reality is divinely indifferent.
general.author: richard bach

general.quote: This sort of adoration of the real is but a heightening of the beau ideal.
general.author: lord byron

general.quote: Underneath the reality in which we live and have our being, another altogether different reality lies concealed.
general.author: friedrich wilhelm nietzsche

general.quote: Fear not what is not real, never was and never will be. What is real, always was and cannot be destroyed.
general.author: bhagavad gita

general.quote: Reality has always had too many heads.
general.author: bob dylan

general.quote: One might speak to great length of the three corners of reality what was seen, what was thought to be seen, and what was thought ought to be seen.
general.author: marvel bell

general.quote: Thinking something does not make it true. Wanting something does not make it real.
general.author: michelle hodkin

general.quote: Everything is the way it is because we’ve all agreed that’s the way it is.
general.author: charles de lint

general.quote: Each for himself creates the world in which he dwells.
general.author: caroline spencer

general.quote: Reality is whatever refuses to go away when I stop believing in it.
general.author: philip k. dick

general.quote: Realists do not fear the results of their study.
general.author: fyodor dostoevsky

general.quote: We must find our duties in what comes to us, not in what might have been.
general.author: george eliot

general.quote: Imagination might be scarier than reality … but not by much.
general.author: james siegel

general.quote: A cause a day keeps reality away.
general.author: jim fraser

general.quote: Meaning and reality were not hidden somewhere behind things, they were in them, in all of them.
general.author: hermann hesse

general.quote: Reality is neither good nor bad; it just is.
general.author: arbie m. dale

general.quote: To be realistic today is to be visionary. To be realistic is to be starry-eyed.
general.author: hubert h. humphrey

general.quote: You knock at the door of Reality. You shake your thought wings, loosen your shoulders, and open.
general.author: rumi

general.quote: How hard it is, sometimes, to trust the evidence of one’s senses! How reluctantly the mind consents to reality.
general.author: norman douglas

general.quote: Reality is created by the action of Mind from the Void.
general.author: diane stein

general.quote: The world is so constructed, that if you wish to enjoy its pleasures, you must also endure its pains. Whether you like it or not, you cannot have one without the other.
general.author: swami brahmananda

general.quote: True realism consists in revealing the surprising things which habit keeps covered and prevents us from seeing.
general.author: jean cocteau

general.quote: We are beginning to see the influence of dream upon reality and reality upon dream.
general.author: anaïs nin

general.quote: It is only hope which is real, and reality is a bitterness and a deceit.
general.author: william makepeace thackeray

general.quote: Reality can destroy the dream; why shouldn’t the dream destroy reality?
general.author: george moore

general.quote: To paint things as they are requires a minute attention, and employs the memory rather than the fancy.
general.author: samuel johnson

general.quote: He who has the bigger stick has the better chance of imposing his definitions of reality.
general.author: peter berger

general.quote: Don’t mess around with reality and reality won’t mess around with you.
general.author: ernie j. zelinski

general.quote: We can evade reality, but we cannot evade the consequences of evading reality.
general.author: ayn rand

general.quote: Reality, if rightly interpreted, is grander than fiction.
general.author: thomas carlyle

general.quote: Tomorrow changes the face of reality.
general.author: philip jose farmer

general.quote: Our intention creates our reality.
general.author: wayne dyer

general.quote: We live on two levels … the realistic level and the fantastic level, and which is the real one, really?
general.author: tennessee williams

general.quote: It is impossible to survive in a prolonged state of reality.
general.author: carlos ruiz zafon

general.quote: The supreme reality of our time is the vulnerability of this planet.
general.author: john f. kennedy

general.quote: There’s no remaking reality…. Just take it as it comes. Hold your ground and take it as it comes. There’s no other way.
general.author: philip roth

general.quote: People see the world not as it is, but as they are.
general.author: al lee

general.quote: If it looks like a duck, walks like a duck and quacks like a duck, then it just may be a duck.
general.author: walter reuther

general.quote: We must learn to tailor our concepts to fit reality, instead of trying to stuff reality into our concepts.
general.author: victor daniels

general.quote: Without poetry, reality is speechless.
general.author: delmore schwartz

general.quote: Either you deal with what is the reality, or you can be sure that the reality is going to deal with you.
general.author: alex haley

general.quote: There are many sides to reality. Choose the one that’s best for you.
general.author: eugene ionesco

general.quote: Reality is subject to the mind’s creation.
general.author: diane stein

general.quote: Reality is a sound, you have to tune in to it not just keep yelling.
general.author: anne carson

general.quote: Reality only reveals itself when it is illuminated by a ray of poetry.
general.author: georges braque

general.quote: Facts as facts do not always create a spirit of reality, because reality is a spirit.
general.author: gilbert k. chesterton

general.quote: Reality is something you rise above.
general.author: liza minnelli

general.quote: Things are the way they are because they were the way they were.
general.author: fred hoyle

general.quote: Reality is merely an illusion, albeit a very persistent one.
general.author: albert einstein

general.quote: Relativity teaches us the connection between the different descriptions of one and the same reality.
general.author: albert einstein

general.quote: I believe in looking reality straight in the eye and denying it.
general.author: garrison keillor

general.quote: Things are sullen, and will be as they are, whatever we think them or wish them to be.
general.author: ralph cudworth

general.quote: Everything that we see is a shadow cast by that which we do not see.
general.author: martin luther king, jr.

general.quote: Reality is that which, when you stop believing in it, doesn’t go away.
general.author: philip k. dick

general.quote: Take things as they are. Punch when you have to punch. Kick when you have to kick.
general.author: bruce lee

general.quote: Any mental activity is easy if it need not take reality into account.
general.author: marcel proust

general.quote: You cannot do wrong without suffering wrong.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson

general.quote: I like reality. It tastes like bread.
general.author: jean anouilh

general.quote: Reality leaves a lot to the imagination.
general.author: john lennon

general.quote: It is astonishing what force, purity, and wisdom it requires for a human being to keep clear of falsehoods.
general.author: margaret witter fuller

general.quote: Reality in our century is not something to be faced.
general.author: graham greene

general.quote: Reality is frequently inaccurate.
general.author: douglas adams

general.quote: Absolute reality is and always will be unknowable to us.
general.author: leena kohn

general.quote: The world of reality has its limits, the world of imagination is boundless.
general.author: jean-jacques rousseau

general.quote: Between certainty and the real, an ancient enmity.
general.author: jane hirshfield

general.quote: A theory must be tempered with reality.
general.author: jawaharlal nehru

general.quote: I accept reality and dare not question it.
general.author: walt whitman

general.quote: Humankind cannot bear very much reality.
general.author: t.s. eliot

general.quote: The unreal is more powerful than the real. Because nothing is as perfect as you can imagine it.
general.author: chuck palahniuk

general.quote: How do we know that the sky is not green and we are all colour-blind?
general.author: unknown

general.quote: We won’t have a society if we destroy the environment.
general.author: margaret mead

general.quote: Society is a masked ball, where everyone hides his real character, and reveals it by hiding.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson

general.quote: There is nothing that Nature seems to have inclined us to as much as society.
general.author: niccolo machiavelli

general.quote: Society is no more indulgent than was the God of Genesis.
general.author: honore de balzac

general.quote: If a free society cannot help the many who are poor, it cannot save the few who are rich.
general.author: john fitzgerald kennedy

general.quote: The family is the natural and fundamental group unit of society and is entitled to protection by society and the State.
general.author: eleanor roosevelt

general.quote: It has been said that society is for the happy, the rich; we should rather say the happy have no need of it.
general.author: madame delphine gay de girardin

general.quote: Society is a strong solution of books. It draws the virtue out of what is best worth reading, as hot water draws the strength of tea-leaves.
general.author: oliver wendell holmes, sr.

general.quote: People who climb from one rung of society to another can never do anything simply.
general.author: honore de balzac

general.quote: Gold is the key to society; but poverty its barrier.
general.author: william scott downey

general.quote: Sweet reader! you know what a toady is?–that agreeable animal which you meet every day in civilized society.
general.author: benjamin disraeli

general.quote: Agreeable society is the first essential in constituting the happiness and of course the value of our existence.
