general.author: thomas jefferson

general.quote: Individual commitment to a group effort – that is what makes a team work, a company work, a society work, a civilization work.
general.author: vince lombardi

general.quote: Society knows perfectly well how to kill a man and has methods more subtle than death.
general.author: andre gide

general.quote: Society does not exist for itself, but for the individual; and man goes into it, not to lose, but to find himself.
general.author: phillips brooks

general.quote: Society is, and must be, based upon appearances, and not upon the deepest appearances, and not realities.
general.author: philip gilbert hamerton

general.quote: There is a society in the deepest solitude.
general.author: isaac d’israeli

general.quote: The great society is a place where men are more concerned with the quality of their goods than with the quantity of their goods.
general.author: lyndon b. johnson

general.quote: Society attacks early, when the individual is helpless.
general.author: b. f.skinner

general.quote: Society lives by faith, and develops by science.
general.author: henri frederic amiel

general.quote: Society may predict, but only I can determine my destiny.
general.author: clair oliver

general.quote: Society cares for the individual only so far as he is profitable.
general.author: simone de beauvoir

general.quote: The only important elements in any society are the artistic and the criminal, because they alone, by questioning society’s values, can force it to change.
general.author: samuel delany

general.quote: No man can have society upon his own terms.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson

general.quote: Society is like a lawn, where every roughness is smoothed, every bramble eradicated, and where the eye is delighted by the smiling verdure of a velvet surface.
general.author: washington irving

general.quote: Society is like a schoolmaster who estimates boys according to their conformity to a standard that is easiest for running a school.
general.author: henry sedgwick

general.quote: Society in shipwreck is comfort to all.
general.author: publilius syrus

general.quote: The wise man sometimes flees from society from fear of being bored.
general.author: jean de la bruyere

general.quote: Society is a sphere that demands all our energies, and deserves all that it demands.
general.author: charles caleb colton

general.quote: Society always consists in the greatest part, of young and foolish persons.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson

general.quote: Society will pardon much to genius and special gifts; but, being in its nature conventional, it loves what is conventional, or what belongs to coming together.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson

general.quote: Society is a hospital of incurables.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson

general.quote: The great always sell their society to the vanity of the little.
general.author: sebastien-roch-nicolas de chamfort

general.quote: Under any system of society … the family holds the future in its bosom.
general.author: charles franklin thwing

general.quote: It is our first duty to serve society.
general.author: samuel johnson

general.quote: Those who are actually in society, are not as ridiculous as those who are trying to get in.
general.author: edgar watson howe

general.quote: A society regulated by a public sense of justice is inherently stable.
general.author: john rawls

general.quote: What can you say about a society that says God is dead and Elvis is alive?
general.author: irv kupcinet

general.quote: There is no such thing as society: there are individual men and women, and there are families.
general.author: margaret thatcher

general.quote: Society is like a stew. If you don’t keep it stirred up, you get a lot of scum on top.
general.author: edward abbey

general.quote: The upper current of society presents no pertain criterion by which we can judge of the direction in which the under current flows.
general.author: thomas babington macaulay

general.quote: Society rests upon conscience and not upon science.
general.author: henri-frederic amiel

general.quote: Society is like a large piece of frozen water; and skating well is the great art of social life.
general.author: letitia elizabeth landon

general.quote: Justice is the great end of civil society.
general.author: david dudley field

general.quote: Society is the atmosphere of souls; and we necessarily imbibe from it something which is either infectious or healthful.
general.author: joseph hall

general.quote: In this great society wide lying around us, a critical analysis would find very few spontaneous actions. It is almost all custom and gross sense.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson

general.quote: What is called good society is usually nothing but a mosaic of polished caricatures.
general.author: friedrich schlegel

general.quote: The sanity of society is a balance of a thousand insanities.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson

general.quote: He who is unable to live in society, or who has no need because he is sufficient for himself, must be either a beast or a god.
general.author: aristotle

general.quote: Society proceeds like the ocean. After a disaster, it resume its wonted level and rhythms; its devouring interests efface all traces of damage.
general.author: honore de balzac

general.quote: Society is the union of men and not the men themselves.
general.author: charles de montesquieu

general.quote: The regeneration of society is the regeneration of society by individual education.
general.author: jean de la bruyere

general.quote: Society exists only as a mental concept; in the real world there are only individuals.
general.author: oscar wilde

general.quote: The spirit of truth and the spirit of freedom — these are the pillars of society.
general.author: henrik ibsen

general.quote: We must reform society before we can reform ourselves.
general.author: george bernard shaw

general.quote: Without society, and a society to our taste, men are never contented.
general.author: thomas jefferson

general.quote: Society is like the air, necessary to breathe but insufficient to live on.
general.author: george santayana

general.quote: Man is a social animal formed to please in society.
general.author: charles de montesquieu

general.quote: A free society is a society where it is safe to be unpopular.
general.author: adlai e. stevenson

general.quote: If you really wish to become a man of society, you must learn first either to be an imbecile or to hold your tongue.
general.author: octave mirbeau

general.quote: Society acquires new arts, and loses old instincts.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson

general.quote: It is the fine souls who serve us, and not what is called fine society. Fine society is only a self-protection against the vulgarities of the street and the tavern.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson

general.quote: The happiness of society is the end of government.
general.author: john adams

general.quote: To understand how any society functions you must understand the relationship between the men and the women.
general.author: angela davis

general.quote: Man was formed for society.
general.author: sir william blackstone

general.quote: Society makes. Then society rewards and punishes her handiwork.
general.author: john daniel barry

general.quote: Society is composed of two great classes,–those who have more dinners than appetite, and those who have more appetite than dinners.
general.author: sebastien-roch-nicolas de chamfort

general.quote: Society is a troop of thinkers and the best heads among them take the best places.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson

general.quote: Society is the mother of us all.
general.author: john daniel barry

general.quote: Never speak disrespectfully of Society. Only people who can’t get into it do that.
general.author: oscar wilde

general.quote: Society never advances. It recedes as fast on one side as it gains on the other. Society acquires new arts, and loses old instincts.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson

general.quote: Society is always trying in some way to grind us down to a single flat surface.
general.author: oliver wendell holmes

general.quote: It is so easy for society to shock the people who are not in it.
general.author: edgar watson howe

general.quote: Our society is not a community, but merely a collection of isolated family units.
general.author: valerie solanis

general.quote: Take control of your consistent emotions and begin to consciously and deliberately reshape your daily experience of life.
general.author: anthony robbins

general.quote: Question: Why are we Masters of our Fate, the captains of our souls? Because we have the power to control our thoughts, our attitudes. That is why many people live in the withering negative world. That is why many people live in the Positive Faith world.
general.author: alfred a. montapert

general.quote: Getting your house in order and reducing the confusion gives you more control over your life. Personal organization somehow releases or frees you to operate more effectively.
general.author: larry king

general.quote: It’s essential to distinguish between events that are really beyond your control and events you caused yourself.
general.author: barbara sher

general.quote: To know is to control.
general.author: scott reed

general.quote: The soul will take that love and put it where it can best be used.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: While we may not be able to control all that happens to us, we can control what happens inside us.
general.author: benjamin franklin

general.quote: Who controls the past controls the future: who controls the present controls the past.
general.author: george orwell

general.quote: Everybody has a hot button. Who is pushing yours? While you probably cannot control that person, you can control the way you react to them..
general.author: unknown

general.quote: The word is control. That’s my ultimate — to have control.
general.author: nick faldo

general.quote: The secret of success is learning how to use pain and pleasure instead of having pain and pleasure use you. If you do that, you’re in control of your life. If you don’t, life controls you.
general.author: anthony robbins

general.quote: The one thing over which you have absolute control is your own thoughts. It is this that puts you in a position to control your own destiny.
general.author: paul g. thomas

general.quote: You cannot control what happens to you, but you can control your attitude toward what happens to you, and in that, you will be mastering change rather than allowing it to master you.
general.author: brian tracy

general.quote: Winners take chances. Like everyone else, they fear failing, but they refuse to let fear control them.
general.author: nancy simms

general.quote: A desire to be in charge of our own lives, and a need for control is born in each of us. It is essential to our mental health, and our success, that we take control.
general.author: robert f. bennett

general.quote: When we direct our thoughts properly, we can control our emotions…
general.author: w. clement stone

general.quote: We fail to see that we can control our own destiny; make ourselves do whatever is possible; make ourselves become whatever we long to be.
general.author: orison swett marden

general.quote: What man’s mind can create, man’s character can control.
general.author: thomas a. edison

general.quote: What do I know of man’s destiny? I could tell you more about radishes.
general.author: samuel beckett

general.quote: We are not permitted to choose the frame of our destiny. But what we put into it is ours.
general.author: dag hammarskjold

general.quote: The law of harvest is to reap more than you sow. Sow an act, and you reap a habit. Sow a habit and you reap a character. Sow a character and you reap a destiny.
general.author: james allen

general.quote: Our problems are man-made, therefore they may be solved by man. No problem of human destiny is beyond human beings.
general.author: john f. kennedy

general.quote: Destiny. A tyrant’s authority for crime and a fool’s excuse for failure.
general.author: ambrose bierce

general.quote: In my clinical experience, the greatest block to a person’s development is his having to take on a way of life which is not rooted in his own powers.
general.author: rollo may

general.quote: Our destiny changes with our thought; we shall become what we wish to become, do what we wish to do, when our habitual thought corresponds with our desire.
general.author: orison swett marden

general.quote: Each man’s destiny is hung like a medallion around his neck.
general.author: gai eaton

general.quote: Destiny is an absolutely definite and inexorable ruler. Physical ability and moral determination count for nothing. It is impossible to perform the simplest act when the gods say "no." I have no idea how they bring pressure to bear on such occasions; I only know that it is irresistible.
general.author: aleister crowley

general.quote: I believe that you control your destiny, that you can be what you want to be. You can also stop and say, No, I won’t do it, I won’t behave his way anymore. I’m lonely and I need people around me, maybe I have to change my methods of behaving and then you do it.
general.author: leo buscaglia

general.quote: What God writes on your forehead you will become.
general.author: the koran

general.quote: Destiny is not a matter of chance, it is a matter of choice; it is not a thing to be waited for, it is a thing to be achieved.
general.author: william jennings bryan

general.quote: Men heap together the mistakes of their lives, and create a monster they call Destiny.
general.author: john oliver hobbes

general.quote: We are made for larger ends than Earth can encompass. Oh, let us be true to our exalted destiny.
general.author: catherine booth

general.quote: There can be no exit from manifest destiny.
general.author: mick farren

general.quote: It appears I am destined for something; I will live.
general.author: robert clive

general.quote: Live as you will wish to have lived when you are dying.
general.author: christian furchtegott gellert

general.quote: I must in the face of a storm, think, live and die as a king.
general.author: frederick the great

general.quote: Destiny waits in the hand of God, not in the hands of statesmen.
general.author: t. s. eliot

general.quote: We do not create our destiny; we participate in its unfolding.
general.author: david richo

general.quote: Anatomy is destiny.
general.author: sigmund freud

general.quote: Destiny is the essence of worldly powers.
general.author: edward counsel

general.quote: We must look for ways to be an active force in our own lives. We must take charge of our own destinies, design a life of substance and truly begin to live our dreams.
general.author: les brown

general.quote: Every man has his own destiny; the only imperative is to follow it, to accept it, no matter where it leads him.
general.author: henry miller

general.quote: No one’s born with their destiny stamped on their forehead … we make the choices to fulfill our destiny.
general.author: naomi judd

general.quote: Destiny is something men select; women achieve it only by default or stupendous suffering.
general.author: harriet rosenstein

general.quote: Ya gotta do what ya gotta do.
general.author: sylvester stallone

general.quote: Personality, too, is destiny.
general.author: erik h. erikson

general.quote: People are ridiculous only when they try or seem to be that which they are not.
general.author: giacomo leopardi

general.quote: The real test of a man is not how well he plays the role he has invented for himself, but how well he plays the role that destiny assigned to him.
general.author: jan patocka

general.quote: There is a Destiny which has the control of our actions, not to be resisted by the strongest efforts of Human Nature.
general.author: george washington

general.quote: The destiny of man is in his own soul.
general.author: herodotus

general.quote: The destiny of any nation at any given time depends on the opinion of its young people, those under twenty-five.
general.author: johann wolfgang von goethe

general.quote: Lots of folks confuse bad management with destiny.
general.author: kin hubbard

general.quote: No man is great enough or wise enough for any of us to surrender our destiny to. The only way in which anyone can lead us is to restore to us the belief in our own guidance.
general.author: henry miller

general.quote: Man’s ultimate destiny is to become one with the Divine Power which governs and sustains the creation and its creatures.
general.author: alfred a. montapert

general.quote: A consistent soul believes in destiny, a capricious one in chance.
general.author: benjamin disraeli

general.quote: There is no such thing as chance; and what seems to us merest accident springs from the deepest source of destiny.
general.author: johann friedrich von schiller

general.quote: No cause has he to say his doom is harsh, who’s made the master of his destiny.
general.author: johann friedrich von schiller

general.quote: It’s not what’s happening to you now or what has happened in your past that determines who you become. Rather, it’s your decisions about what to focus on, what things mean to you, and what you’re going to do about them that will determine your ultimate destiny.
general.author: anthony robbins

general.quote: More than anything else, I believe it’s our decisions, not the conditions of our lives, that determine our destiny.
general.author: anthony robbins

general.quote: Thoughts lead on to purposes; purposes go forth in action; actions form habits; habits decide character; and character fixes our destiny.
general.author: tryon edwards

general.quote: Youth is often a scoffer at destiny.
general.author: edward counsel

general.quote: There is just one life for each of us: our own.
general.author: euripides

general.quote: Destiny is … the range of formal or structured human possibility within which human freedom is actual.
general.author: donald j. keefe

general.quote: I knew what my job was; it was to go out and meet the people and love them.
general.author: princess diana

general.quote: There’s no mystical energy field that controls my destiny.
general.author: han solo

general.quote: We write our own destiny; we become what we do.
general.author: madame chiang kai-shek

general.quote: The purpose of polite behavior is never virtuous. Deceit, surrender, and concealment: these are not virtues. The goal of the mannerly is comfort, per se.
general.author: june jordan

general.quote: Says the rude child: "No, I won’t do it." Says the courteous grown-up: "Yes, I won’t do it."
general.author: mignon mclaughlin

general.quote: Manners must adorn knowledge, and smooth its way through the world.
general.author: philip dormer stanhope chesterfield

general.quote: Treat everyone with politeness, even those who are rude to you — not because they are nice, but because you are.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: Good manners: the noise you don’t make when you’re eating soup.
general.author: bennett cerf

general.quote: Treat people as you would like to be treated. Karma’s only a bitch if you are.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: Manners are not idle, but the fruit of loyal nature, and of noble mind.
general.author: lord alfred tennyson

general.quote: Parents are usually more careful to bestow knowledge on their children rather than virtue, the art of speaking well rather than doing well; but their manners should be of the greatest concern.
general.author: r. buckminster fuller

general.quote: There are men whose manners have the same essential splendor as the simple and awful sculpture on the friezes of the Parthenon, and the remains of the earliest Greek art.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson

general.quote: In truth, politeness is artificial good humor, it covers the natural want of it, and ends by rendering habitual a substitute nearly equivalent to the real virtue.
general.author: thomas jefferson

general.quote: Life be not so short but that there is always time for courtesy.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson

general.quote: Manners require time, and nothing is more vulgar than haste.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson

general.quote: I have always been of the mind that in a democracy, manners are the only effective weapons against the bowie-knife.
general.author: james russell lowell

general.quote: Manners are like the shadows of virtues, they are the momentary display of those qualities which our fellow creatures love and respect.
general.author: sydney smith

general.quote: Good manners are made up of petty sacrifices.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson

general.quote: Many who would not take the last cookie would take the last lifeboat.
general.author: mignon mclaughlin

general.quote: Manners are a sensitive awareness of the feelings of others. If you have that awareness, you have good manners, no matter which fork you use.
general.author: emily post

general.quote: A man’s own manner and character is what most becomes him.
general.author: marcus t. cicero

general.quote: Manners are the hypocrisy of a nation.
general.author: honore de balzac

general.quote: Etiquette means behaving yourself a little better than is absolutely essential.
general.author: will cuppy

general.quote: Nothing is so great an example of bad manners as flattery. If you flatter all the company, you please none; If you flatter only one or two, you offend the rest.
general.author: jonathan swift

general.quote: Manners easily and rapidly mature into morals.
general.author: horace mann

general.quote: Manners are love in a cool climate.
general.author: quentin crisp

general.quote: Discretion is being able to raise your eyebrow instead of your voice.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: Manners are the happy way of doing things.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson

general.quote: A man’s own good breeding is the best security against other people’s ill manners.
general.author: philip dormer stanhope chesterfield

general.quote: A man that should call everything by its right name would hardly pass the streets without being knocked down as a common enemy.
general.author: lord halifax

general.quote: Savages we call them because their manners differ from ours.
general.author: benjamin franklin

general.quote: If you would win the world, melt it, do not hammer it.
general.author: alexander maclaren

general.quote: The basis of good manners is self-reliance.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson

general.quote: There can be no defence like elaborate courtesy.
general.author: e.v. lucas

general.quote: Is man a savage at heart, skinned o’er with fragile Manners? Or is savagery but a faint taint in the natural man’s gentility, which erupts now and again like pimples on an angel’s arse?
general.author: john barth

general.quote: Manners are of more importance than laws. Manners are what vex or soothe, corrupt or purify, exalt or debase, barbarize or refine us, by a constant, steady, uniform, insensible operation, like that of the air we breathe in.
general.author: edmund burke

general.quote: Good manners are just a way of showing other people that we have respect for them.
general.author: bill kelly

general.quote: The test of good manners is to be patient with bad ones.
general.author: ibn gabirol

general.quote: I don’t think you want too much sincerity in society. It would be like an iron girder in a house of cards.
general.author: w. somerset maugham

general.quote: Consideration for others is the basic of a good life, a good society.
general.author: confucius

general.quote: Hospitality is making your guests feel at home, even if you wish they were.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: Never be late. When you’re late, what you’re saying is that your time is more important than the other person’s time. That’s pretty egotistical.
general.author: alice cooper

general.quote: Ceremony is necessary as the outwork and defense of manners.
general.author: philip dormer stanhope chesterfield

general.quote: What once were vices are manners now.
general.author: marcus annaeus seneca

general.quote: Nowadays, manners are easy and life is hard.
general.author: benjamin disraeli

general.quote: The test of good manners is to be patient with bad ones.
general.author: gabirol

general.quote: Courtesies cannot be borrowed like snow shovels; you must have some of your own.
general.author: john wanamaker

general.quote: Prepare yourself for the world, as the athletes used to do for their exercise; oil your mind and your manners, to give them the necessary suppleness and flexibility; strength alone will not do.
general.author: philip dormer stanhope chesterfield

general.quote: Manhood is melted into courtesies, valor into compliment, and men are only turned into tongue, and trim ones, too.
general.author: william shakespeare

general.quote: A person will gain everyone’s approval if he mixes the pleasant with the useful.
general.author: horace

general.quote: We are justified in enforcing good morals, for they belong to all mankind; but we are not justified in enforcing good manners, for good manners always mean our own manners.
general.author: gilbert k. chesterton

general.quote: Manners are of such great consequence to the novelist that any kind will do. Bad manners are better than no manners at all, and because we are losing our customary manners, we are probably overly conscious of them; this seems to be a condition that produces writers.
general.author: flannery o’connor

general.quote: Whoever one is, and wherever one is, one is always in the wrong if one is rude.
general.author: maurice baring

general.quote: Children are natural mimics who act like their parents despite every effort to teach them good manners.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: A man’s manners are a mirror in which he shows his portrait.
general.author: johann wolfgang von goethe

general.quote: Good manners can replace morals. It may be years before anyone knows if what you are doing is right. But if what you are doing is nice, it will be immediately evident.
general.author: p.j. o’rourke

general.quote: When you want to get your way, simply try being mannerly. It’s become so rare nowadays that it disarms people. It throws them off balance. Don’t think of it as merely being nice; rather, consider it "civil" war.
general.author: joe kita

general.quote: A traveler of taste will notice that the wise are polite all over the world, but the fool only at home.
general.author: oliver goldsmith

general.quote: If a man has good manners and is not afraid of other people he will get by, even if he is stupid.
general.author: david eccles

general.quote: Teach your child to hold his tongue; he’ll learn fast enough to speak.
general.author: benjamin franklin

general.quote: Learn young about hard work and manners — and you’ll be through the whole dirty mess and nicely dead again before you know it.
general.author: f. scott fitzgerald

general.quote: The biggest bore of all is he who is overflowing with congratulations.
general.author: thomas hood

general.quote: If you’re bored with life — you don’t get up every morning with a burning desire to do things — you don’t have enough goals.
general.author: lou holtz

general.quote: Highly educated bores are by far the worst; they know so much, in such fiendish detail, to be boring about.
general.author: louis kronenberger

general.quote: Boredom is like a pitiless zooming in on the epidermis of time. Every instant is dilated and magnified like the pores of the face.
general.author: charlotte whitton

general.quote: If your daily life seems poor, do not blame it; blame yourself, tell yourself that you are not poet enough to call forth its riches.
general.author: rainer maria rilke

general.quote: One must choose in life between boredom and suffering.
general.author: anne germain de stael

general.quote: Boredom is the feeling that everything is a waste of time; serenity, that nothing is.
general.author: thomas szasz

general.quote: One can be bored until boredom becomes a mystical experience.
general.author: logan pearsall smith

general.quote: Boredom is rage spread thin.
general.author: paul johannes tillich

general.quote: Only those who want everything done for them are bored.
general.author: billy graham

general.quote: The man who lets himself be bored is even more contemptible than the bore.
general.author: samuel butler

general.quote: We are almost always bored with people that we should not be bored with.
general.author: francois de la rochefoucauld

general.quote: Boredom is just the reverse side of fascination: both depend on being outside rather than inside a situation, and one leads to the other.
general.author: susan sontag

general.quote: You’ll find boredom where there is an absence of a good idea.
general.author: earl nightingale

general.quote: Men grow tired of sleep, love, singing, and dancing sooner than war.
general.author: homer

general.quote: We often bore others when we think we cannot possibly bore them.
general.author: francois de la rochefoucauld

general.quote: Boredom slays more of existence than war.
general.author: norman mailer

general.quote: Goodbye. I am leaving because I am bored.
general.author: george saunders

general.quote: The cure for boredom is curiosity. There is no cure for curiosity.
general.author: ellen parr

general.quote: A bore is a fellow who opens his mouth and puts his feats in it.
general.author: henry ford

general.quote: Boredom flourishes too, when you feel safe. It’s a symptom of security.
general.author: eugene ionesco

general.quote: People of Wealth and the so called upper class suffer the most from boredom.
general.author: arthur schopenhauer

general.quote: Boredom is always counter-revolutionary. Always.
general.author: guy debord

general.quote: Everything considered, work is less boring than amusing oneself.
general.author: charles baudelaire

general.quote: I’m afraid of nothing except being bored.
general.author: greta garbo

general.quote: Passions are less mischievous than boredom, for passions tend to diminish and boredom increase.
general.author: barbey d’aurevilly

general.quote: Man is the only animal that can be bored.
general.author: erich fromm

general.quote: The secret of being a bore is to tell everything.
general.author: francois-marie arouet de voltaire

general.quote: The one sure means of dealing with boredom is to care for someone else, to do something kind and good.
general.author: theodore haecker

general.quote: Some people are so boring that they make you waste an entire day in five minutes.
general.author: jules renard

general.quote: The world is eaten up by boredom. You can’t see it all at once. It is like dust. You go about and never notice, you breathe it in, you eat and drink it.
general.author: georges bernanos

general.quote: Everyone is a bore to someone. That is unimportant. The thing to avoid is being a bore to oneself.
general.author: gerald brenan

general.quote: Just standing around looking beautiful is so boring, really boring, so boring.
general.author: michelle pfeiffer

general.quote: The penalty for success is to be bored by people who used to snub you.
general.author: lady nancy astor

general.quote: One of the worst forms of mental suffering is boredom, not knowing what to do with oneself and one’s life.
general.author: erich fromm

general.quote: Boredom is an emptiness filled with insistence.
general.author: leo stein

general.quote: Boredom, after all, is a form of criticism.
general.author: wendell phillips

general.quote: Boring people are a reflection of boring people.
general.author: doug horton

general.quote: Bore — a person who talks when you wish him to listen.
general.author: ambrose bierce

general.quote: The only unhappiness is a life of boredom.
general.author: henri b. stendhal

general.quote: The only thing worse than being bored is being boring.
general.author: jean baudrillard

general.quote: Over-excitement and boredom are states of mind which I equally shun.
general.author: e.v. knox

general.quote: He who seeks rest finds boredom. He who seeks work finds rest.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: The concept of boredom entails an inability to use up present moments in a personally fulfilling way.
general.author: wayne dyer

general.quote: Life is never boring, but some people choose to be bored.
general.author: wayne dyer

general.quote: Bored people, unless they sleep a lot, are cruel.
general.author: renata adler

general.quote: Boredom: the desire for desires.
general.author: leo tolstoy

general.quote: Are you bored with life? Then throw yourself into some work you believe in with all your heart, live for it, die for it, and you will find happiness that you had thought could never be yours.
general.author: dale carnegie

general.quote: Against boredom the gods themselves fight in vain.
general.author: friedrich nietzsche

general.quote: To do the same thing over and over again is not only boredom: it is to be controlled by rather than to control what you do.
general.author: heraclitus

general.quote: Boredom acts as an initiator of originality by pushing me into new activities or new thoughts.
general.author: hugh prather

general.quote: Since boredom advances and boredom is the root of all evil, no wonder, then, that the world goes backwards, that evil spreads..
general.author: soren kierkegaard

general.quote: Boredom is the root of all evil — the despairing refusal to be oneself.
general.author: soren kierkegaard

general.quote: When people are bored it is primarily with themselves.
general.author: eric hoffer

general.quote: Hell is more like boredom, or not having enough to do, and too much time to contemplate one’s deficiencies.
general.author: dorothy gilman

general.quote: Bores bore each other too; but it never seems to teach them anything.
general.author: don marquis

general.quote: The life of the creative man is lead, directed and controlled by boredom. Avoiding boredom is one of our most important purposes.
general.author: saul steinberg

general.quote: Boredom is not an end-product, is comparatively rather an early stage in life and art.
general.author: f. scott fitzgerald

general.quote: Every improvement in communication makes the bore more terrible.
general.author: frank moore colby

general.quote: Punctuality is the virtue of the bored.
general.author: evelyn waugh

general.quote: Nobody is bored when he is trying to make something that is beautiful, or to discover something that is true.
general.author: dean william r. inge

general.quote: Boredom is the dream bird that hatches the egg of experience. A rustling in the leaves drives him away.
general.author: walter benjamin

general.quote: A bore is a man who, when you ask him how he is, tells you.
general.author: bert leston taylor

general.quote: Being bored is an insult to oneself.
general.author: jules renard

general.quote: Is boredom anything less than the sense of one’s faculties slowly dying?
general.author: john berger

general.quote: Bore: A man who deprives you of solitude without providing you with company.
general.author: gian vincenzo gravina

general.quote: Boredom is a vital problem for the moralist, since at least half the sins of mankind are caused by the fear of it.
general.author: bertrand russell

general.quote: Boredom is a sickness the cure for which is work; pleasure is only a palliative.
general.author: le duc de lévis

general.quote: If you’re bored with life — you don’t get up every morning with a burning desire to do things — you don’t have enough goals.
general.author: lou holtz

general.quote: People who have nothing to do are quickly tired of their own company.
general.author: jeremy collier

general.quote: All kinds are good except the kind that bores you.
general.author: voltaire

general.quote: Grasp your opportunities, no matter how poor your health; nothing is worse for your health than boredom.
general.author: mignon mclaughlin

general.quote: The nice thing about being a celebrity is that, if you bore people, they think it’s their fault.
general.author: henry kissinger

general.quote: Perfect happiness is a beautiful sunset, the giggle of a grandchild, the first snowfall. It’s the little things that make happy moments, not the grand events. Joy comes in sips, not gulps.
general.author: sharon draper

general.quote: Every person, all the events of your life are there because you have drawn them there. What you choose to do with them is up to you.
general.author: richard bach

general.quote: We cannot make events. Our business is wisely to improve them.
general.author: samuel adams

general.quote: It’s essential to distinguish between events that are really beyond your control and events you caused yourself.
general.author: barbara sher

general.quote: Every event that a man would master must be mounted on the run, and no man ever caught the reins of a thought except as it galloped past him.
general.author: oliver wendell holmes

general.quote: I claim not to have controlled events, but confess plainly that events have controlled me.
general.author: abraham lincoln quotes

general.quote: I am more and more convinced that our happiness or our unhappiness depends far more on the way we meet the events of life than on the nature of those events themselves.
general.author: karl wilhelm von humboldt

general.quote: You never know what events are going to transpire to get you home.
general.author: og mandino quotes

general.quote: It’s not the events of our lives that shape us, but our beliefs as to what those events mean.
general.author: anthony robbins

general.quote: The greatest event for the world is the arrival of a new and wise person.
general.author: thomas carlyle

general.quote: Even a minor event in the life of a child is an event of that child’s world and thus a world event.
general.author: gaston bachelard

general.quote: It’s a great event to get outside and enjoy nature. I find it very exciting no matter how many times I see bald eagles.
general.author: karen armstrong

general.quote: The measure of an enthusiasm must be taken between interesting events. It is between bites that the lukewarm angler loses heart.
general.author: edwin way teale

general.quote: Great events have sent before them their announcements.
general.author: pedro calderon de la barca

general.quote: Few will have the greatness to bend history itself; but each of us can work to change a small portion of events, and in the total; of all those acts will be written the history of this generation.
general.author: robert f. kennedy

general.quote: Events are influenced by our very great desires.
general.author: william james

general.quote: The events in our lives happen in a sequence in time, but in their significance to ourselves, they find their own order … the continuous thread of revelation.
general.author: eudora welty

general.quote: An event described by those to whom it was told by men who did not see it.
general.author: elbert hubbard

general.quote: Man is troubled not by events, but by the meaning he gives them.
general.author: epictetus

general.quote: You may not control all the events that happen to you, but you can decide not to be reduced by them.
general.author: maya angelou

general.quote: Early in life I had noticed that no event is ever correctly reported in a newspaper.
general.author: george orwell

general.quote: The great events of life often leave one unmoved; they pass out of consciousness, and, when one thinks of them, become unreal. Even the scarlet flowers of passion seem to grow in the same meadow as the poppies of oblivion.
general.author: oscar wilde quotes

general.quote: Mental events, it is said, are not passive happenings but the acts of a subject.
general.author: hermann ebbinghaus

general.quote: A dramatist is one who believes that the pure event, an action involving human beings, is more arresting than any comment that can be made upon it.
general.author: thornton wilder

general.quote: Do we not all spend the greater part of our lives under the shadow of an event that has not yet come to pass?
general.author: maurice maeterlinck

general.quote: Genius is present in every age, but the men carrying it within them remain benumbed unless extraordinary events occur to heat up and melt the mass so that it flows forth.
general.author: denis diderot

general.quote: We are ready for any unforeseen event that may or may not occur.
general.author: dan quayle

general.quote: When I can’t handle events, I let them handle themselves.
general.author: henry ford

general.quote: You have power over your mind – not outside events. Realize this, and you will find strength.
general.author: marcus aurelius

general.quote: If men could regard the events of their own lives with more open minds, they would frequently discover that they did not really desire the things they failed to obtain.
general.author: andre maurois

general.quote: A miracle is an event which creates faith. That is the purpose and nature of miracles. Frauds deceive. An event which creates faith does not deceive: therefore it is not a fraud, but a miracle.
general.author: george bernard shaw quotes

general.quote: Painful as it may be, a significant emotional event can be the catalyst for choosing a direction that serves us– and those around us — more effectively. Look for the learning.
general.author: eric allenbaugh

general.quote: Almost any event will put on a new face when received with cheerful acceptance.
general.author: henry s. haskins

general.quote: What wonderful things are events! The least are of greater importance than the most sublime and comprehensive speculations.
general.author: benjamin disraeli

general.quote: Man reconciles himself to almost any event, however trying, if it happens in the ordinary course of nature. It is the extraordinary alone that he rebels against. There is a moral idea associated with this feeling; for the extraordinary appears to be something like an injustice of heaven.
general.author: wilhelm von humboldt

general.quote: Laughter gives us distance. It allows us to step back from an event, deal with it and then move on.
general.author: bob newhart

general.quote: A single event can awaken within us a stranger totally unknown to us. To live is to be slowly born.
general.author: antoine de saint-exupery

general.quote: Not being able to govern events, I govern myself, and apply myself to them if they will not apply themselves to me.
general.author: michel eyquem de montaigne

general.quote: Events of great consequence often spring from trifling circumstances.
general.author: titus livy

general.quote: Failure is not a single, cataclysmic event. You don’t fail overnight. Instead, failure is a few errors in judgment, repeated every day.
general.author: jim rohn

general.quote: The greatest events occur without intention playing any part in them; chance makes good mistakes and undoes the most carefully planned undertaking. The world’s greatest events are not produced, they happen.
general.author: georg c. lichtenberg

general.quote: If you believe that feeling bad or worrying long enough will change a past or future event, then you are residing on another planet with a different reality system.
general.author: william james

general.quote: Events of all sorts creep or fly exactly as God pleases.
general.author: william cowper

general.quote: A president either is constantly on top of events or, if he hesitates, events will soon be on top of him. I never felt that I could let up for a moment.
general.author: harry s. truman quotes

general.quote: History is the version of past events that people have decided to agree upon.
general.author: napoleon bonaparte quotes

general.quote: Great events make me quiet and calm; it is only trifles that irritate my nerves.
general.author: queen victoria

general.quote: In every great time there is some one idea at work which is more powerful than any other, and which shapes the events of the time and determines their ultimate issues.
general.author: francis bacon

general.quote: No event in American history is more misunderstood than the Vietnam War. It was misreported then, and it is misremembered now.
general.author: richard m. nixon

general.quote: I’ve never had anyone define purity. You probably can’t define purity. Purity is to live according to original design.
general.author: josh mcdowell

general.quote: A pure hand needs no glove to cover it.
general.author: nathaniel hawthorne

general.quote: Purity of mind and conduct is the first glory of a woman.
general.author: madame de stael

general.quote: Pure and chaste as the falling snow.
general.author: thomas buchanan read

general.quote: Purity of heart is the noblest inheritance, and love the fairest ornament, of woman.
general.author: matthias claudius

general.quote: He who loves with purity considers not the gift of the lover, but the love of the giver.
general.author: thomas a kempis

general.quote: My strength has the strength of ten because my heart is pure.
general.author: lord alfred tennyson

general.quote: Purity and simplicity are the two wings with which man soars above the earth and all temporary nature.
general.author: thomas a kempis

general.quote: Man flows at once to God when the channel of purity is open.
general.author: henry david thoreau

general.quote: Be purity of life the test, leave to the heart, to heaven the rest.
general.author: charles sprague

general.quote: Purity of speech, of the mind, of the senses, and of a compassionate heart are needed by one who desires to rise to the divine platform.
general.author: chanakya

general.quote: Rare is the union of beauty and purity.
general.author: juvenal

general.quote: True human goodness, in all its purity and freedom, can come to the fore only when its recipient has no power.
general.author: milan kundera

general.quote: The man who in this world can keep the whiteness of his soul is not likely to lose it in any other.
general.author: alexander smith

general.quote: Purity of heart is to will one thing.
general.author: soren kierkegaard

general.quote: Cleanse the fountain if you would purify the streams.
general.author: amos bronson alcott

general.quote: Each of us is born with a share of purity, predestined to be corrupted by our commerce with mankind.
general.author: emile cioran

general.quote: Purity in person and in morals is true godliness.
general.author: hosea ballou

general.quote: Purity lives and derives its life solely from the Spirit of God.
general.author: charles caleb colton

general.quote: The smallest speck is seen on snow.
general.author: john gay

general.quote: Purity is the power to contemplate defilement.
general.author: simone weil

general.quote: Well, purity – there’s no purity in politics.
general.author: jim demint

general.quote: The sun, though it passes through dirty places, yet remains as pure as before.
general.author: lord edward coke

general.quote: While our hearts are pure, our lives are happy and our peace is sure.
general.author: william winter

general.quote: Purity is the feminine, truth the masculine of honor.
general.author: david hare

general.quote: The real ornament of woman is her character, her purity.
general.author: mahatma gandhi

general.quote: Purity is the diamond of the soul.
general.author: edward counsel

general.quote: Purity engenders Wisdom, Passion avarice, and Ignorance folly, infatuation and darkness.
general.author: cyril connolly

general.quote: Purity is the gatekeeper for everything precious and blissful in God’s kingdom.
general.author: eric ludy

general.quote: The stream is always purer at its source.
general.author: blaise pascal

general.quote: Purity is a negative state and therefore contrary to nature.
general.author: william faulkner

general.quote: Purity is obscurity.
general.author: ogden nash

general.quote: Life does not need to mutilate itself in order to be pure.
general.author: simone weil

general.quote: To the pure all things are pure!
general.author: marcel proust

general.quote: Our children had the privilege of growing up where they’d raised a lot of food. They were never hungry. They could share their food with people. And so, you share your lives with people.
general.author: ella baker

general.quote: The most fatal illusion is the settled point of view. Since life is growth and motion, a fixed point of view kills anybody who has one.
general.author: brooks atkinson

general.quote: If you live in the past and allow the past to define who you are, then you never grow.
general.author: oprah winfrey

general.quote: Do you want my one-word secret of happiness — It’s growth — mental, financial, you name it.
general.author: harold s. geneen

general.quote: Growth means change and change involves risk, stepping from the known to the unknown.
general.author: george shinn

general.quote: Life is change. Growth is optional. Choose wisely.
general.author: karen kaiser clark

general.quote: Rarely do members of the same family grow up under the same roof.
general.author: richard bach

general.quote: In the end, it is the person you become, not the things you have achieved, that is the most important.
general.author: les brown

general.quote: It has been said that there is no fool like an old fool, except a young fool. But the young fool has first to grow up to be an old fool to realize what a damn fool he was when he was a young fool.
general.author: harold macmillan

general.quote: Only by contending with challenges that seem to be beyond your strength to handle at the moment you can grow more surely toward the stars.
general.author: brian tracy

general.quote: Only in growth, reform, and change, paradoxically enough, is true security to be found.
general.author: anne morrow lindbergh

general.quote: Smile at each other, smile at your wife, smile at your husband, smile at your children, smile at each other — it doesn’t matter who it is — and that will help you to grow up in greater love for each other.
general.author: mother teresa

general.quote: It takes courage to grow up and turn out to be who you really are.
general.author: ee cummings

general.quote: We find comfort among those who agree with us — growth among those who don’t.
general.author: frank a. clark

general.quote: The joy of life consists in the exercise of one’s energies, continual growth, constant change, the enjoyment of every new experience.
general.author: aleister crowley

general.quote: You know your children are growing up when they stop asking you where they came from and refuse to tell you where they’re going.
general.author: p.j. o’rourke

general.quote: The minute a man ceases to grow, no matter what his years, that minute he begins to be old.
general.author: william james

general.quote: The purpose of learning is growth, and our minds, unlike our bodies, can continue growing as we continue to live.
general.author: mortimer j. adler

general.quote: The growth of true friendship may be a lifelong affair.
general.author: sarah orne jewett

general.quote: It kills you to see them grow up. But I guess it would kill you quicker if they didn’t.
general.author: barbara kingsolver

general.quote: Growth is the only evidence of life.
general.author: john henry newman

general.quote: All growth depends upon activity. There is no development physically or intellectually without effort, and effort means work.
general.author: calvin coolidge

general.quote: All change is not growth; all movement is not forward.
general.author: ellen glasgow

general.quote: Growth itself contains the germ of happiness.
general.author: pearl s. buck

general.quote: One can choose to go back toward safety or forward toward growth. Growth must be chosen again and again; fear must be overcome again and again.
general.author: abraham h. maslow

general.quote: The growth of understanding follows an ascending spiral rather than a straight line.
general.author: joanna field

general.quote: The growth of wisdom may be gauged exactly by the diminution of ill temper.
general.author: friedrich nietzsche

general.quote: Unless you try to do something beyond what you have mastered, you will never grow.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson

general.quote: We need 4 hugs a day for survival. We need 8 hugs a day for maintenance. We need 12 hugs a day for growth.
general.author: virginia satir

general.quote: All bodies are slow in growth but rapid in decay.
general.author: publius cornelius tacitus

general.quote: The trick is growing up without growing old.
general.author: casey stengel

general.quote: Today I have grown taller from walking with the trees.
general.author: karl baker

general.quote: Growth begins when we start to accept our own weakness.
general.author: jean vanier

general.quote: The key to success is to keep growing in all areas of life — mental, emotional, spiritual, as well as physical.
general.author: julius erving

general.quote: Strength and growth come only through continuous effort and struggle.
general.author: napoleon hill

general.quote: Marriage is our last, best chance to grow up.
general.author: joseph barth

general.quote: Without continual growth and progress, such words as improvement, achievement, and success have no meaning.
general.author: benjamin franklin

general.quote: Love dies only when growth stops.
general.author: pearl s. buck

general.quote: You grow up on the day you have your first real laugh at, yourself.
general.author: ethel barrymore

general.quote: The key to growth is the introduction of higher dimensions of consciousness into our awareness.
general.author: pir vilayat khan

general.quote: We grow a little every time we do not take advantage of somebody’s weakness.
general.author: bern williams

general.quote: It’s a great country, where anybody can grow up to be president… except me.
general.author: barry goldwater

general.quote: A man’s growth is seen in the successive choirs of his friends.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson

general.quote: All my life I used to wonder what I would become when I grew up. Then, about seven years ago, I realized that I was never going to grow up — that growing is an ever-ongoing process.
general.author: m. scott peck

general.quote: We grow because we struggle, we learn and overcome.
general.author: r. c. allen

general.quote: Every child is an artist. The problem is to remain an artist once they grow up.
general.author: pablo picasso

general.quote: Growing old is not growing up.
general.author: doug horton

general.quote: Age does not depend upon years, but upon temperament and health. Some men are born old, and some never grow up.
general.author: tryon edwards

general.quote: All of us need to grow continuously in our lives.
general.author: les brown

general.quote: Growth demands a temporary surrender of security.
general.author: gail sheehy

general.quote: Our only security is our ability to change.
general.author: john lilly

general.quote: Change is not progress.
general.author: henry louis mencken

general.quote: People don’t change. Only their costumes do.
general.author: gene moore

general.quote: What is necessary to change a person is to change his awareness of himself.
general.author: abraham h. maslow

general.quote: The most useless are those who never change through the years.
general.author: james m. barrie

general.quote: He who rejects change is the architect of decay. The only human institution which rejects progress is the cemetery.
general.author: harold wilson

general.quote: Change may come to you in trinkets and I hope it adorns your life gracefully.
general.author: dodinsky

general.quote: We live in a moment of history where change is so speeded up that we begin to see the present only when it is already disappearing.
general.author: r.d. laing

general.quote: It’s the most unhappy people who most fear change.
general.author: mignon mclaughlin

general.quote: You must change in order to survive.
general.author: pearl bailey

general.quote: Change is inevitable. Change for the better is a full-time job.
general.author: adlai e. stevenson

general.quote: Not everything that is faced can be changed, but nothing can be changed until it is faced.
general.author: james baldwin

general.quote: All love shifts and changes. I don’t know if you can be wholeheartedly in love all the time.
general.author: julie andrews

general.quote: The absurd man is he who never changes.
general.author: auguste barthelemy

general.quote: We don’t change what we are, we change what we think what we are.
general.author: eric butterworth

general.quote: The first step toward change is awareness. The second step is acceptance.
general.author: nathaniel branden

general.quote: Consider how hard it is to change yourself and you’ll understand what little chance you have in trying to change others.
general.author: jacob m. braude

general.quote: The most significant change in a person’s life is a change of attitude. Right attitudes produce right actions.
general.author: william j. johnston

general.quote: Every single thing changes and is changing always in this world. Yet with the same light the moon goes on shining.
general.author: saigyo

general.quote: Life is about not knowing, having to change, taking the moment and making the best of it, without knowing what’s going to happen next.
general.author: gilda radner

general.quote: Progress is a nice word, but change is its motivator and change has enemies.
general.author: robert f. kennedy

general.quote: That things are changed, and that nothing really perishes, and that the sum of matter remains exactly the same, is sufficiently certain.
general.author: francis bacon

general.quote: Change is such hard work.
general.author: billy crystal

general.quote: Change is the constant, the signal for rebirth, the egg of the phoenix.
general.author: christina baldwin

general.quote: If you don’t like something change it; if you can’t change it, change the way you think about it.
general.author: mary engelbreit

general.quote: We must all obey the great law of change. It is the most powerful law of nature.
general.author: edmund burke

general.quote: Earth changes, but thy soul and God stand sure.
general.author: robert browning

general.quote: Matters change and morals change; men remain.
general.author: john galsworthy

general.quote: The things that have come into being change continually. The man with a good memory remembers nothing because he forgets nothing.
general.author: augusto roa bastos

general.quote: Time, which changes people, does not alter the image we have retained of them.
general.author: marcel proust

general.quote: Change is not made without inconvenience, even from worst to better.
general.author: samuel johnson

general.quote: They must often change, who would be constant in happiness or wisdom.
general.author: confucius

general.quote: People can cry much easier than they can change.
general.author: james baldwin

general.quote: If you’re in a bad situation, don’t worry it’ll change. If you’re in a good situation, don’t worry it’ll change.
general.author: john a. simone, sr.

general.quote: Continuity gives us roots; change gives us branches, letting us stretch and grow and reach new heights.
general.author: pauline r. kezer

general.quote: All change is not growth, as all movement is not forward.
general.author: ellen glasgow

general.quote: The world does not have to change.… The only thing that has to change is our attitude.
general.author: gerald g. jampolsky

general.quote: Just because everything is different doesn’t mean anything has changed.
general.author: irene peter

general.quote: Everything comes to pass, nothing comes to stay.
general.author: matthew flickstein

general.quote: We do not succeed in changing things according to our desire, but gradually our desire changes.
general.author: marcel proust

general.quote: God grant me the serenity to accept the things I cannot change, the courage to change the things I can, and the wisdom to know the difference.
general.author: reinhold niebuhr

general.quote: We all have big changes in our lives that are more or less a second chance.
general.author: harrison ford

general.quote: We did not change as we grew older; we just became more clearly ourselves.
general.author: lynn hall

general.quote: The devil could change. He was once an angel and may be evolving still.
general.author: laurence j. peter

general.quote: You have the power to change.
general.author: les brown

general.quote: Everything in life that we really accept undergoes a change.
general.author: katherine mansfield

general.quote: Things do not change; we change.
general.author: henry david thoreau

general.quote: Seek not to change the world, but choose to change your mind about the world.
general.author: a course in miracles

general.quote: Those who expect moments of change to be comfortable and free of conflict have not learned their history.
general.author: joan wallach scott

general.quote: You must welcome change as the rule but not as your ruler.
general.author: denis waitley

general.quote: Each new season grows from the leftovers from the past. That is the essence of change, and change is the basic law.
general.author: hal borland

general.quote: Be the change you wish to see in the world.
general.author: mahatma gandhi

general.quote: If one desires a change, one must be that change before that change can take place.
general.author: gita bellin

general.quote: Change your thoughts and you change your world.
general.author: norman vincent peale

general.quote: Change the fabric of your own soul and your own visions, and you change all.
general.author: vachel lindsay

general.quote: There is change in all things. You yourself are subject to continual change and some decay, and this is common to the entire universe.
general.author: marcus aurelius

general.quote: You will never change your life until you change something you do daily.
general.author: mike murdock

general.quote: Times change and we change with them. The stars rule men but God rules the stars.
general.author: christoph cellarius

general.quote: The wheel of change moves on, and those who were down go up and those who were up go down.
general.author: jawaharlal nehru

general.quote: Change is inevitable in a progressive society. Change is constant.
general.author: benjamin disraeli

general.quote: All changes, even the most longed for, have their melancholy; for what we leave behind us is a part of ourselves; we must die to one life before we can enter another.
general.author: anatole france

general.quote: We must be the change we wish to see.
general.author: indira gandhi

general.quote: Without change nothing changes.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: If you want to truly understand something, try to change it.
general.author: kurt lewin

general.quote: Growth is the only evidence of life.
general.author: john henry newman

general.quote: Very often a change of self is needed more than a change of scene.
general.author: arthur christopher benson

general.quote: Nothing is lasting but change; nothing perpetual but death.
general.author: ludwig borne

general.quote: It is strange and wonderful what changes may be wrought by a few fleeting months, on the human frame, and the human heart.
general.author: elizabeth j. eames

general.quote: That’s the risk you take if you change: that people you’ve been involved with won’t like the new you. But other people who do will come along.
general.author: lisa alther

general.quote: We change, whether we like it or not.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson

general.quote: If you want to make enemies, try to change something.
general.author: woodrow wilson

general.quote: When we are no longer able to change a situation, we are challenged to change ourselves.
general.author: viktor frankl

general.quote: Life belongs to the living, and he who lives must be prepared for changes.
general.author: johann wolfgang von goethe

general.quote: Life is its own journey, presupposes its own change and movement, and one tries to arrest them at one’s eternal peril.
general.author: laurens van der post

general.quote: Change or die.
general.author: eldridge cleaver

general.quote: Most of us are about as eager to be changed as we were to be born, and go through our changes in a similar state of shock.
general.author: james baldwin

general.quote: Any change, even a change for the better, is always accompanied by drawbacks and discomforts.
general.author: arnold bennett

general.quote: The joy of life consists in the exercise of one’s energies, continual growth, constant change, the enjoyment of every new experience.
general.author: aleister crowley

general.quote: We can’t become what we need to be by remaining what we are.
general.author: oprah winfrey

general.quote: The main dangers in this life are the people who want to change everything or nothing.
general.author: lady nancy astor

general.quote: To exist is to change, to change is to mature, to mature is to go on creating oneself endlessly.
general.author: henri louis bergson

general.quote: All things must change to something new, to something strange.
general.author: henry wadsworth longfellow

general.quote: Change excites me. I am fifty years old. It’s when the mind catches up with the body.
general.author: raquel welch

general.quote: It is not necessary to change. Survival is not mandatory.
general.author: w. edwards deming

general.quote: You cannot expect to achieve new goals or move beyond your present circumstances unless you change.
general.author: les brown

general.quote: To improve is to change; to be perfect is to change often.
general.author: winston churchill

general.quote: People change and forget to tell each other.
general.author: lillian hellman

general.quote: Never follow the crowd.
general.author: bernard m. baruch

general.quote: Get away from the crowd when you can. Keep yourself to yourself, if only for a few hours daily.
general.author: arthur brisbane

general.quote: The toughest part of getting to the top of the ladder, is getting through the crowd at the bottom.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: Business today consists in persuading crowds.
general.author: t. s. eliot

general.quote: The man who follows the crowd will usually get no further than the crowd. The man who walks alone is likely to find himself in places no one has.
general.author: alan ashley-pitt

general.quote: The man who follows a crowd will never be followed by a crowd.
general.author: r. s. donnell

general.quote: The only certainty about following the crowd is that you will all get there together.
general.author: mychal wynn

general.quote: A charming woman… doesn’t follow the crowd. She is herself.
general.author: loretta young

general.quote: It takes people to move crowds in the right direction, crowds by themselves just stand around and mutter.
general.author: drew curtis

general.quote: Love is made by two people, in different kinds of solitude. It can be in a crowd, but in an oblivious crowd.
general.author: louis aragon

general.quote: If there is a look of human eyes that tells of perpetual loneliness, so there is also the familiar look that is the sign of perpetual crowds.
general.author: alice meynell

general.quote: Every crowd has a silver lining.
general.author: p.t. barnum

general.quote: I don’t like being out of the crowd. It’s lonely within a group.
general.author: julie walters

general.quote: With the crowds on your side, it’s easier to play up to your potential.
general.author: julius erving

general.quote: A man who wants to lead the orchestra must turn his back on the crowd.
general.author: james crook

general.quote: Nobody goes there anymore. It’s too crowded.
general.author: yogi berra

general.quote: The future belongs to crowds.
general.author: don delillo

general.quote: If it has to choose who is to be crucified, the crowd will always save Barabbas.
general.author: jean cocteau

general.quote: The crowd gives the leader new strength.
general.author: evenus

general.quote: Four short words sum up what has lifted most successful individuals above the crowd: a little bit more. They did all that was expected of them and a little bit more.
general.author: a. lou vickery

general.quote: The ‘wisdom of the crowds’ is the most ridiculous statement I’ve heard in my life. Crowds are dumb.
general.author: drew curtis

general.quote: Youth doesn’t need friends – it only needs crowds.
general.author: zelda fitzgerald

general.quote: Crowds are somewhat like the sphinx of ancient fable: It is necessary to arrive at a solution of the problems offered by their psychology or to resign ourselves to being devoured by them.
general.author: gustave le bon

general.quote: Look, when that crowd gets to cheering, when we know they’re with us, when we know they like us, we play better. A hell of a lot better!
general.author: bill carlin

general.quote: The crowd that follows me with admiration would run with the same eagerness if I were marching to the guillotine.
general.author: napoleon bonaparte

general.quote: Give to every human being every right that you claim for yourself.
general.author: robert ingersoll

general.quote: We need to restore the full meaning of that old word, duty. It is the other side of rights.
general.author: pearl s. buck

general.quote: Silence never won rights. They are not handed down from above; they are forced by pressures from below.
general.author: roger baldwin

general.quote: Everyone has the right to own property alone as well as in association with others.
general.author: eleanor roosevelt

general.quote: I disapprove of what you say, but I will defend to the death your right to say it.
general.author: claude arien helvetius

general.quote: Rights that do not flow from duty well performed are not worth having.
general.author: mahatma gandhi

general.quote: Where there is a human being, I see God-given rights inherent in that being, whatever may be the sex or complexion.
general.author: william lloyd garrison

general.quote: A man will fight harder for his interests than for his rights. Men are moved by only two mechanisms: fear and self-interest. Victory belongs to the most persevering.
general.author: napoleon bonaparte

general.quote: Reparation for our rights at home, and security against the like future violations.
general.author: william pitt

general.quote: The extension of women’s rights is the basic principle of all social progress.
general.author: francois marie charles fourier

general.quote: In giving rights to others which belong to them, we give rights to ourselves and to our country.
general.author: john f. kennedy

general.quote: Never exceed your rights, and they will soon become unlimited.
general.author: jean jacques rousseau

general.quote: All human beings are born free and equal in dignity and rights…
general.author: eleanor roosevelt

general.quote: Everyone has the right to recognition everywhere as a person before the law.
general.author: eleanor roosevelt

general.quote: Live with integrity, respect the rights of other people, and follow your own bliss.
general.author: nathaniel branden

general.quote: As a man is said to have a right to his property, he may be equally said to have a property in his rights.
general.author: james madison

general.quote: Every man has by the law of nature a right to such a waste portion of the earth as is necessary for his subsistence.
general.author: sir thomas more

general.quote: On this day, and every day, let us remember our roots as one human family, forever dedicated to upholding the central tenets of the Universal Declaration of Human Rights.
general.author: barack obama

general.quote: There is only one duty, only one safe course, and that is to try to be right.
general.author: winston churchill

general.quote: From the equality of rights springs identity of our highest interests; you cannot subvert your neighbor’s rights without striking a dangerous blow at your own.
general.author: carl schurz

general.quote: disapprove of what you say, but I will defend to the death your right to say it.
general.author: claude arien helvetius

general.quote: We discovered that peace at any price is no peace at all… life at any price has no value whatever;… life is nothing without the privileges, the prides, the rights, the joys that make it worth living, and also worth giving.
general.author: eve curie

general.quote: Every man has a right to be wrong in his opinions. But no man has a right to be wrong in his facts.
general.author: bernard m. baruch

general.quote: They made and recorded a sort of institute and digest of anarchy, called the rights of man.
general.author: edmund burke

general.quote: It isn’t enough to talk about peace. One must believe in it. And it isn’t enough to believe in it. One must work at it.
general.author: eleanor roosevelt

general.quote: Observe good faith and justice toward all nations. Cultivate peace and harmony with all.
general.author: george washington

general.quote: Establishing lasting peace is the work of education; all politics can do is keep us out of war.
general.author: maria montessori

general.quote: Peace is the happy natural state of man; war is corruption and disgrace.
general.author: james thomson

general.quote: If they want peace, nations should avoid the pin-pricks that precede cannon-shots.
general.author: napoleon bonaparte quotes

general.quote: Peace is not merely the absence of visible conflict. Only a just peace based on the inherent rights and dignity of every individual can truly be lasting.
general.author: barack obama quotes

general.quote: Peace and justice are two sides of the same coin.
general.author: dwight david eisenhower quotes

general.quote: There is nothing so likely to produce peace as to be well prepared to meet an enemy.
general.author: george washington quotes

general.quote: What all men are really after is some form, or perhaps only some formula, of peace.
general.author: joseph conrad

general.quote: Peace has her victories which are no less renowned than war.
general.author: john milton

general.quote: Peace is the bright star of the world.
general.author: edward counsel

general.quote: Let him who desires peace prepare for war.
general.author: vegetius

general.quote: Let us have peace.
general.author: ulysses simpson grant,

general.quote: We seek peace, knowing that peace is the climate of freedom.
general.author: dwight david eisenhower

general.quote: In moderating, not satisfying desires, lies peace.
general.author: ben hecht

general.quote: In a nuclear age, each of us is threatened when peace is not secured everywhere.
general.author: jimmy carter quotes

general.quote: Peace is the masterpiece of reason.
general.author: johann muller

general.quote: Peace is much more precious than a piece of land.
general.author: anwar al-sadat

general.quote: There is no way to peace. Peace is the way.
general.author: a. j. muste

general.quote: All we are saying is give peace a chance…
general.author: john lennon

general.quote: There is a price which is too great to pay for peace, and that price can be put in one word. One cannot pay the price of self-respect.
general.author: woodrow t. wilson

general.quote: Peace, n. In international affairs, a period of cheating between two periods of fighting.
general.author: ambrose bierce

general.quote: We are going to have peace even if we have to fight for it.
general.author: dwight david eisenhower

general.quote: The greatest honor history can bestow is that of peacemaker.
general.author: richard m. nixon

general.quote: What we need is a generation of peace.
general.author: jawaharlal nehru quotes

general.quote: Peace with honor.
general.author: theobald ii

general.quote: It must be peace without victory; only a peace between equals can last.
general.author: woodrow t. wilson

general.quote: You have peace … when you make it with yourself.
general.author: mitch albom

general.quote: Peace can become a lens through which you see the world. Be it. Live it. Radiate it out. Peace is an inside job.
general.author: wayne dyer

general.quote: Peace is not only better than war, but infinitely more arduous.
general.author: george bernard shaw quotes

general.quote: You may either win your peace or buy it: win it, by resistance to evil; buy it, by compromise with evil.
general.author: john ruskin

general.quote: Peace is rarely denied to the peaceful.
general.author: johann christoph friedrich von schiller

general.quote: Peace is the only battle worth waging.
general.author: albert camus

general.quote: At the heart of happiness lies peace. It is the last and the highest attainment of the soul.
general.author: hugh black

general.quote: Peace is the fairest form of happiness.
general.author: william ellery channing

general.quote: Peace won by compromise is usually a short lived achievement.
general.author: winfield scott

general.quote: It is madness for sheep to talk peace with a wolf.
general.author: thomas fuller

general.quote: Peace is a daily, a weekly, a monthly process, gradually changing opinions, slowly eroding old barriers, quietly building new structures.
general.author: john f. kennedy quotes

general.quote: One little person, giving all of her time to peace, makes news. Many people, giving some of their time, can make history.
general.author: peace pilgrim

general.quote: Peace we want because there is another war to fight: against poverty and disease.
general.author: indira gandhi quotes

general.quote: An army in peace is like an overcoat in July–not useful, but not to be thrown away.
general.author: austin o’malley

general.quote: Blessedness is promised to the peacemaker, not to the conqueror.
general.author: francis quarles

general.quote: Never for the sake of peace and quiet deny your convictions.
general.author: dag hammarskjold

general.quote: Peace cannot be kept by force. It can only be achieved by understanding.
general.author: albert einstein quotes

general.quote: Peace is produced by war.
general.author: pierre corneille

general.quote: The firmest security of peace is the preparation during peace of the defenses of war.
general.author: john quincy adams

general.quote: Though force can protect in emergency, only justice, fairness, consideration and cooperation can finally lead men to the dawn of eternal peace.
general.author: dwight david eisenhower

general.quote: If you don’t have peace, it isn’t because someone took it from you; you gave it away. You cannot always control what happens to you, but you can control what happens in you.
general.author: john c. maxwell

general.quote: You either get tired fighting for peace, or you die.
general.author: john lennon

general.quote: We should have much more peace if we would not busy ourselves with the sayings and doings of others.
general.author: thomas a kempis

general.quote: A peace above all earthly dignities, a still and quiet conscience.
general.author: william shakespeare

general.quote: Peace cannot be achieved through violence, it can only be attained through understanding.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson quotes

general.quote: Peace and friendship with all mankind is our wisest policy, and I wish we may be permitted to pursue it.
general.author: thomas jefferson

general.quote: Peace is more than the absence of war. Peace is accord. Harmony.
general.author: laini taylor

general.quote: Even peace may be purchased at too high a price.
general.author: benjamin franklin
