general.quote: The key to abundance is meeting limited circumstances with unlimited thoughts.
general.author: marianne williamson

general.quote: Remember, your attitude toward a situation can help you to change it — you create the very atmosphere for defeat or victory.
general.author: franco harris

general.quote: In the islands of the Aegean Sea, every island is full of graves.
general.author: james theodore bent

general.quote: Life is just a short walk from the cradle to the grave, and it sure behooves us to be kind to one another along the way.
general.author: alice childress

general.quote: My family had a business where they worked with gravestones, and I remember growing up and playing in cemeteries like it was a normal playground.
general.author: zach roerig

general.quote: I’m going to put on my gravestone, ‘He never owned a cell phone.’
general.author: jesse ventura

general.quote: Nowadays, many Americans have forgotten the meaning and traditions of Memorial Day. At cemeteries across the country, the graves of the fallen are sadly ignored, and worse, neglected.
general.author: allen west

general.quote: To that dark inn, the Grave!
general.author: sir walter scott

general.quote: The grave has a door on its inner side.
general.author: alexander maclaren

general.quote: Death ends our woes, and the kind grave shuts up the mournful scene.
general.author: john dryden

general.quote: The house appointed for all the living.
general.author: bible

general.quote: Even in the grave, all is not lost.
general.author: edgar allan poe

general.quote: Let us form one body, one heart, and defend to the last warrior our country, our homes, our liberty, and the graves of our fathers.
general.author: tecumseh

general.quote: The grave is a very small hillock, but we can see farther from it, when standing on it, than from the highest mountain in all the world."
general.author: friedrich august tholuck

general.quote: One puts off the biography like you put off death. To write an autobiography is to etch the words on your own gravestone.
general.author: carlos fuentes

general.quote: The grave itself is but a covered bridge, leading from light to light, through a brief darkness!
general.author: henry wadsworth longfellow

general.quote: The bitterest tears shed over graves are for words left unsaid and deeds left undone.
general.author: harriet beecher stowe

general.quote: Man is a noble animal, splendid in ashes, and pompous in the grave.
general.author: sir thomas browne

general.quote: There is little much beyond the grave, but the strong are saying nothing until they see.
general.author: robert frost

general.quote: Before you embark on a journey of revenge, dig two graves.
general.author: confucius quotes

general.quote: Fame – a few words upon a tombstone, and the truth of those not to be depended on.
general.author: christian nestell bovee

general.quote: Every man’s road in life is marked by the graves of his personal liking.
general.author: alexander smith

general.quote: The grave where even the great find rest.
general.author: alexander pope

general.quote: There’s no reason to be the richest man in the cemetery. You can’t do any business from there.
general.author: colonel sanders

general.quote: ‘Learn your lines.’ I want that on my gravestone.
general.author: john c. mcginley

general.quote: (Bodies) carefully to be laid up in the wardrobe of the grave.
general.author: bishop john pearson

general.quote: The grave is still the best shelter against the storms of destiny.
general.author: georg christoph lichtenberg

general.quote: In matters of grave importance, style, not sincerity, is the vital thing.
general.author: oscar wilde quotes

general.quote: You only live once. You don’t want your tombstone to read: ‘Played it Safe.’
general.author: rosario dawson

general.quote: A tomb now suffices him for whom the whole world was not sufficient.
general.author: alexander the great

general.quote: Science is a cemetery of dead ideas.
general.author: miguel de unamuno

general.quote: Under the wide and starry sky. Dig the grave and let me lie.
general.author: adlai e. stevenson

general.quote: You better be very convinced, very sure, before you pull your plug or someone else’s plug, that you know what’s on the other side of the gravestone.
general.author: joni eareckson tada

general.quote: How peaceful and how powerful is the grave!
general.author: lord byron

general.quote: Tombs are the clothes of the dead and a grave is a plain suit; while an expensive monument is one with embroidery.
general.author: r. buckminster fuller

general.quote: We weep over the graves of infants and the little ones taken from us by death; but an early grave may be the shortest way to heaven.
general.author: tryon edwards

general.quote: A good character is the best tombstone. Those who loved you and were helped by you will remember you when forget-me-nots have withered. Carve your name on hearts, not on marble.
general.author: charles spurgeon

general.quote: The graves of those we have loved and lost distress and console as.
general.author: arsene houssaye

general.quote: Graves they say are warm’d by glory; Foolish words and empty story.
general.author: heinrich heine

general.quote: One foot in the grave.
general.author: francis beaumont and john fletcher

general.quote: Bores put you in a mental cemetery while you are still walking.
general.author: elsa maxwell

general.quote: Don’t die old, die empty. That’s the goal of life. Go to the cemetery and disappoint the graveyard.
general.author: myles munroe

general.quote: To the solemn graves, near a lonely cemetery, my heart like a muffled drum is beating funeral marches.
general.author: charles baudelaire

general.quote: I would rather sleep in the southern corner of a little country churchyard, than in the tombs of the Capulets.
general.author: edmund burke

general.quote: He who hurries through life hurries to his grave.
general.author: george r.r. martin

general.quote: We go to the grave of a friend saying, a man is dead; but angels throng about him, saying, a man is born.
general.author: henry ward beecher

general.quote: And the story of love is a long sad tale ending in graves.
general.author: jack kerouac

general.quote: I can’t believe that we would lie in our graves wondering if we had spent our living days well. I can’t believe that we would lie in our graves dreaming of things that we might have been.
general.author: dave matthews

general.quote: ‘A collected poems’ is either a gravestone or a testimonial to survival.
general.author: al purdy

general.quote: Be peaceful, be courteous, obey the law, respect everyone; but if someone puts his hand on you, send him to the cemetery.
general.author: malcolm x

general.quote: Every man should keep a fair-sized cemetery in which to bury the faults of his friends.
general.author: henry ward beecher

general.quote: Doubt is the vestibule through which all must pass before they can enter into the temple of wisdom.
general.author: charles caleb colton

general.quote: We know accurately only when we know little, with knowledge doubt increases.
general.author: johann wolfgang von goethe

general.quote: Faith keeps many doubts in her pay. If I could not doubt, I should not believe.
general.author: henry david

general.quote: Doubt can only be removed by action.
general.author: goethe

general.quote: The fearful unbelief is unbelief in yourself.
general.author: thomas carlyle

general.quote: Men become civilized, not in proportion to their willingness to believe, but in proportion to their readiness to doubt.
general.author: h. l. mencken

general.quote: He that knows nothing doubts nothing.
general.author: george herbert

general.quote: Doubt is the father of invention.
general.author: galileo galilei

general.quote: Only when we know little do we know anything; doubt grows with knowledge.
general.author: goethe

general.quote: To have doubted one’s own first principles is the mark of a civilized man.
general.author: oliver wendell holmes

general.quote: Doubt grows with knowledge.
general.author: goethe

general.quote: An honest man can never surrender an honest doubt.
general.author: walter malone

general.quote: Feed your faith and doubt will starve to death.
general.author: author unknown

general.quote: The only limit of our realization of tomorrow will be our doubts of today.
general.author: franklin d. roosevelt

general.quote: I will listen to anyone’s convictions, but pray keep your doubts to yourself.
general.author: goethe

general.quote: Doubt whom you will, but never yourself."
general.author: john christian bovee

general.quote: Neither in this world nor elsewhere is there any happiness in store for him who always doubts."
general.author: bhagavad gita

general.quote: Doubt is a pain too lonely to know that faith is his twin brother."
general.author: kahlil gibran

general.quote: Modest doubt is called the beacon of the wise.
general.author: william shakespeare

general.quote: Just think of the tragedy of teaching children not to doubt.
general.author: clarence darrow

general.quote: There lives more faith in honest doubt, believe me, than in half the creeds.
general.author: lord alfred tennyson

general.quote: I wish I could be half as sure of anything as some people are of everything.
general.author: gerald barzan

general.quote: Philosophy when superficially studied, excites doubt, when thoroughly explored, it dispels it."
general.author: francis bacon

general.quote: Doubt is the beginning, not the end, of wisdom.
general.author: george iles

general.quote: Doubt breeds doubt.
general.author: franz grillparzer

general.quote: When you start to doubt yourself, the real world will eat you alive!
general.author: henry rollins

general.quote: When you doubt, abstain.
general.author: zoroaster

general.quote: Life is doubt, and faith without doubt is nothing but death."
general.author: miguel de unamuno

general.quote: If the Sun and Moon should ever doubt, they’d immediately go out.
general.author: william blake

general.quote: I respect faith, but doubt is what gets you an education.
general.author: wilson mizner

general.quote: Doubt, of whatever kind, can be ended by action alone.
general.author: thomas carlyle

general.quote: There was a castle called Doubting Castle, the owner whereof was Giant Despair.
general.author: john bunyan

general.quote: The road to perseverance lies by doubt.
general.author: francis quarles

general.quote: When in charge ponder. When in trouble delegate. When in doubt mumble.
general.author: author unknown

general.quote: Who never doubted, never half believed. Where doubt is, there truth is — it is her shadow.
general.author: philip james bailey

general.quote: Our doubts are traitors and make us lose the good we might win, by fearing to attempt.
general.author: william shakespeare

general.quote: If you would be a real seeker after truth, it is necessary that at least once in your life you doubt, as far as possible, all things.
general.author: rene descartes

general.quote: To doubt is worse than to have lost; And to despair is but to antedate those miseries that must fall on us.
general.author: philip massinger

general.quote: Doubt is the incentive to truth and inquiry leads the way.
general.author: hosea ballou

general.quote: Being president is like running a cemetery: you’ve got a lot of people under you and nobody’s listening.
general.author: william j. clinton

general.quote: Somebody asked what I wanted on my gravestone. I’m just going to put: ‘Glad I Could Help.’
general.author: dick van dyke

general.quote: The tombstone is about the only thing that can stand upright and lie on its face at the same time.
general.author: mary wilson little

general.quote: The truth is that when it comes to suffering, if we do not go to our graves in confusion, we will not go to our graves trusting. Explanations are a substitute for trust.
general.author: tullian tchividjian

general.quote: A grave, wherever found, preaches a short and pithy sermon to the soul.
general.author: nathaniel hawthorne

general.quote: Most men lead lives of quiet desperation and go to the grave with the song still in them.
general.author: henry david thoreau

general.quote: Ask yourself whether the dream of heaven and greatness should be waiting for us in our graves – or whether it should be ours here and now and on this earth.
general.author: ayn rand

general.quote: The grave is a common treasury, to which we must all be taken.
general.author: edmund burke

general.quote: I try to extract something positive from every situation, even if it’s just learning not to make the same mistake twice.
general.author: claudia schiffer

general.quote: If one is willing to do a thing he is afraid to do, he does not have to … face a situation fearlessly, and if there is no situation to face; it falls away of its own weight.
general.author: florence scovel shinn

general.quote: Your present circumstances don’t determine where you can go; they merely determine where you start.
general.author: nido qubein

general.quote: Resolve never to quit, never to give up, no matter what the situation.
general.author: jack nicklaus

general.quote: A quarrel between friends, when made up, adds a new tie to friendship.
general.author: st. francis de sales

general.quote: For every quarrel a man and wife have before others, they have a hundred when alone.
general.author: edgar watson howe

general.quote: A quarrel is quickly settled when deserted by one party; there is no battle unless there be two.
general.author: marcus annaeus seneca

general.quote: Lovers quarrels are the renewal of love.
general.author: terence

general.quote: We don’t make mistakes, we only have happy accidents.
general.author: author unknown

general.quote: You make mistakes. Mistakes don’t make you.
general.author: maxwell maltz

general.quote: Nobody’s perfect. Even the most successful people make serious mistakes.
general.author: travis bradberry

general.quote: Mistakes are the usual bridge between inexperience and wisdom.
general.author: phyllis theroux

general.quote: It is wise for us to forget our troubles, there are always new ones to replace them.
general.author: brigham young

general.quote: The art of living lies not in eliminating but in growing with troubles.
general.author: bernard m. baruch

general.quote: Whether planned or not, humor takes our mind off of our troubles.
general.author: allen klein

general.quote: Never complain about your troubles; they are responsible for more than half of your income.
general.author: robert r. updegraff

general.quote: How long after you are gone will ripples remain as evidence that you were cast into the pool of life?
general.author: grant m. bright

general.quote: But there’s a thin line between songwriting and arranging.
general.author: warren zevon

general.quote: Art is a process of delivering or arranging elements that appeal to the emotions of a person looking at it. It’s what you feel.
general.author: shaquille o’neal

general.quote: No human being can really understand another, and no one can arrange another’s happiness.
general.author: graham greene quotes

general.quote: History creates comprehensibility primarily by arranging facts meaningfully and only in a very limited sense by establishing strict causal connections.
general.author: johan huizinga

general.quote: Design is a plan for arranging elements in such a way as best to accomplish a particular purpose.
general.author: charles eames

general.quote: If you think squash is a competitive activity, try flower arranging.
general.author: alan bennett

general.quote: Arranging a bowl of flowers in the morning can give a sense of quiet in a crowded day – like writing a poem or saying a prayer.
general.author: anne morrow lindbergh

general.quote: But friendship is precious, not only in the shade, but in the sunshine of life, and thanks to a benevolent arrangement the greater part of life is sunshine.
general.author: thomas jefferson quotes

general.quote: If you can’t beat them, arrange to have them beaten.
general.author: george carlin

general.quote: Arrange whatever pieces come your way.
general.author: virginia woolf quotes

general.quote: Technology is the knack of so arranging the world that we don’t have to experience it.
general.author: max frisch

general.quote: The small part of ignorance that we arrange and classify we give the name of knowledge.
general.author: ambrose bierce

general.quote: Management is about arranging and telling. Leadership is about nurturing and enhancing.
general.author: tom peters

general.quote: Since the masses are always eager to believe something, for their benefit nothing is so easy to arrange as facts.
general.author: charles maurice de talleyrand

general.quote: Death is the great adventure beside which moon landings and space trips pale in insignificance.
general.author: joseph bayly

general.quote: Death is the dropping of the flower that the fruit may swell.
general.author: henry ward beecher

general.quote: I’m not afraid of death. It’s the stake one puts up in order to play the game of life.
general.author: jean giraudoux

general.quote: I do not pray for a lighter load, but for a stronger back.
general.author: phillips brooks

general.quote: Hope is like the sun, which, as we journey toward it, casts the shadow of our burden behind us.
general.author: samuel smiles

general.quote: Everyone carries around his own monsters.
general.author: richard pryor

general.quote: All we are asked to bear we can bear.
general.author: elizabeth goudge

general.quote: A beggar always remains a beggar. Africa, stop begging – you have what it takes to solve your problem.
general.author: t. b. joshua

general.quote: Though our donations are made to please ourselves, we insist, upon those who receive our alms being pleased with them.
general.author: johann georg von zimmermann

general.quote: Beggar that I am, I am even poor in thanks, but I thank you; and sure, dear friends, my thanks are too dear a halfpenny.
general.author: william shakespeare

general.quote: Better a living beggar than a buried emperor.
general.author: jean de la fontaine

general.quote: The time to stop a revolution is at the beginning, not the end.
general.author: adlai e. stevenson

general.quote: A reform is a correction of abuses; a revolution is a transfer of power.
general.author: edward george earle lytton bulwer-lytton

general.quote: It is not a revolt, it is a revolution.
general.author: Francois la Rochefoucauld-Liancourt

general.quote: revolutions never go backward.
general.author: wendell phillips

general.quote: We live in a world that is full of problems, and we are the solutions to those problems.
general.author: julia butterfly hill

general.quote: The best solutions are often simple, yet unexpected.
general.author: julian casablancas

general.quote: I never worry about the problem. I worry about the solution.
general.author: shaquille o’neal

general.quote: Problems cannot be solved at the same level of awareness that created them.
general.author: albert einstein

general.quote: Good apple pies are a considerable part of our domestic happiness.
general.author: jane austen

general.quote: It is remarkable how closely the history of the Apple-tree is connected with that of man.
general.author: henry david thoreau

general.quote: History is made in the class struggle and not in bed.
general.author: Alex Mitchell

general.quote: The sweeter the apple, the blacker the core. scratch a lover and find a foe!
general.author: dorothy parker

general.quote: We are born believing. A man bears beliefs as a tree bears apples.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson quotes

general.quote: The flowers of the apple are perhaps the most beautiful of any trees, so copious and so delicious to both sight and scent.
general.author: henry david thoreau

general.quote: Ever since Eve started it all by offering Adam the apple, woman’s punishment has been to supply a man with food then suffer the consequences when it disagrees with him.
general.author: helen rowland

general.quote: Even if I knew that tomorrow the world would go to pieces, I would still plant my apple tree.
general.author: martin luther quotes

general.quote: Anyone can cut an apple open and count the number of seeds. But, who can look at a single seed and count the trees and apples?
general.author: dottie walters

general.quote: Surely the apple is the noblest of fruits.
general.author: henry david thoreau

general.quote: And what is more melancholy than the old apple-trees that linger about the spot where once stood a homestead, but where there is now only a ruined chimney rising out of a grassy and weed-grown cellar? They offer their fruit to every wayfarer–apples that are bitter-sweet with the moral of times vicissitude.
general.author: nathaniel hawthorne

general.quote: Oh! Happy are the apples when the south winds blow.
general.author: william wallace harney

general.quote: Millions saw the apple fall, but Newton was the one who asked why.
general.author: bernard m. baruch

general.quote: Stay me with flagons, comfort me with apples: for I am sick of love.
general.author: bible

general.quote: Bad taste creates many more millionaires than good taste.
general.author: charles bukowski

general.quote: We never taste happiness in perfection, our most fortunate successes are mixed with sadness.
general.author: pierre corneille

general.quote: It is good taste, and good taste alone, that possesses the power to sterilize and is always the first handicap to any creative functioning.
general.author: salvador dali quotes

general.quote: Sometimes it’s more important to be human, than to have good taste.
general.author: bertolt brecht

general.quote: When you taste super-success after tasting super-failure, there is huge relief.
general.author: akshay kumar

general.quote: They are much to be pitied who have not been given a taste for nature early in life.
general.author: jane austen quotes

general.quote: Art is not for the cultivated taste. It is to cultivate taste.
general.author: nikki giovanni

general.quote: There is a fine line between censorship and good taste and moral responsibility.
general.author: steven spielberg

general.quote: Sometimes we should express our gratitude for the small and simple things like the scent of the rain, the taste of your favorite food, or the sound of a loved one’s voice.
general.author: joseph b. wirthlin

general.quote: Between friends differences in taste or opinion are irritating in direct proportion to their triviality.
general.author: w. h. auden

general.quote: Lunch kills half of Paris, supper the other half.
general.author: charles de montesquieu

general.quote: A good, honest, wholesome, hungry breakfast.
general.author: izaak walton

general.quote: When someone you greatly admire and respect appears to be thinking deep thoughts, they are probably thinking about lunch.
general.author: author unknown

general.quote: We must explain the truth: There is no free lunch.
general.author: grace napolitano

general.quote: A bachelor’s life is a fine breakfast, a flat lunch, and a miserable dinner.
general.author: jean de la bruyere

general.quote: Eat breakfast like a king, lunch like a prince, and dinner like a pauper.
general.author: adelle davis

general.quote: The City attaches an exaggerated importance to the healing power of lunch.
general.author: christopher fieldes

general.quote: Some days you tame the tiger. And some days the tiger has you for lunch.
general.author: tug mcgraw

general.quote: Never work before breakfast. If you have to work before breakfast, get your breakfast first.
general.author: josh billings

general.quote: Strange to see how a good dinner and feasting reconciles everybody.
general.author: samuel pepys

general.quote: Not too long ago, if you did 75 percent of the things you did right, it was okay. Now, if you don’t do 98 percent of those things right, some competitor will eat you for lunch.
general.author: john spoelhof

general.quote: Nature provides a free lunch, but only if we control our appetites.
general.author: william ruckelshaus

general.quote: Feedback is the breakfast of champions.
general.author: ken blanchard

general.quote: Only dull people are brilliant at breakfast.
general.author: oscar wilde

general.quote: Once a woman has forgiven her man, she must not reheat his sins for breakfast.
general.author: marlene dietrich

general.quote: The only man who is really free is the one who can turn down an invitation to dinner without giving an excuse.
general.author: jules renard

general.quote: All happiness depends on a leisurely breakfast.
general.author: john gunther

general.quote: Life is a rollercoaster. Try to eat a light lunch.
general.author: david a. schmaltz

general.quote: Instinct. When the house burns one forgets even lunch. Yes, but one eats it later in the ashes.
general.author: friedrich nietzsche

general.quote: If you knew how meat was made, you’d probably lose your lunch.
general.author: k. d. lang

general.quote: On Thanksgiving Day, all over America, families sit down to dinner at the same moment — half-time.
general.author: author unknown

general.quote: After a good dinner one can forgive anybody, even one’s own relations.
general.author: oscar wilde

general.quote: A woman is as old as she looks before breakfast.
general.author: edgar watson howe

general.quote: A dinner lubricates business.
general.author: william scott

general.quote: I don’t stop eating when I’m full. The meal isn’t over when I’m full. It’s over when I hate myself.
general.author: louis c. k.

general.quote: The pig and the chicken were on their way to breakfast, trying to decide what to have. When chicken said, "Let’s have ham and eggs." The pig then replied, "That’s fine for you, it’s a small donation on your part, but it’s a total sacrifice for me."
general.author: author unknown

general.quote: My body is like breakfast, lunch, and dinner. I don’t think about it, I just have it.
general.author: arnold schwarzenegger

general.quote: If the wolf had ever come to our back door, he’d have had to bring a picnic lunch.
general.author: bill anderson

general.quote: A man may be a pessimistic determinist before lunch and an optimistic believer in the will’s freedom after it.
general.author: aldous huxley

general.quote: He who waits upon fortune is never sure of dinner.
general.author: benjamin franklin

general.quote: The problem with marriage is that it ends every night after making love, and it must be rebuilt every morning before breakfast.
general.author: gabriel garcia marquez

general.quote: Ask not what you can do for your country. Ask what’s for lunch.
general.author: orson welles

general.quote: The food here is so tasteless you could eat a meal of it and belch and it wouldn’t remind you of anything.
general.author: redd foxx

general.quote: Sometimes I’ve believed as many as six possible things before breakfast.
general.author: lewis carroll

general.quote: Everyday happiness means getting up in the morning, and you can’t wait to finish your breakfast. You can’t wait to do your exercises. You can’t wait to put on your clothes. You can’t wait to get out. And you can’t wait to come home, because the soup is hot.
general.author: george burns

general.quote: Never argue at the dinner table, for the one who is not hungry always gets the best of the argument.
general.author: richard whately

general.quote: How do you live a long life? "Take a two-mile walk every morning before breakfast."
general.author: harry s. truman

general.quote: Despair is perfectly compatible with a good dinner, I promise you.
general.author: william m. thackeray

general.quote: When the wine goes in, strange things come out.
general.author: johann friedrich von schiller

general.quote: A new friend is like new wine; when it has aged you will drink it with pleasure.
general.author: apocrypha

general.quote: A sweetheart is a bottle of wine; a wife is a wine bottle.
general.author: charles baudelaire

general.quote: Wine lead to folly, making even the wise to laugh immoderately, to dance, and to utter what had better have been kept silent.
general.author: homer

general.quote: The blood that is once inflamed with wine is apt to boil with rage.
general.author: joseph hall

general.quote: Wine often turns the good-natured man into an idiot and the choleric into an assassin.
general.author: joseph addison

general.quote: Although it is better to hide our ignorance, this is hard to do when we relax over wine.
general.author: heraclitus of ephesus

general.quote: Drinking of wine maketh men to act like so many furies.
general.author: nathaniel morton

general.quote: That is a treacherous friend whom you must always be on your guard. Such a friend is wine.
general.author: christian nestell bovee

general.quote: Drinking of wine brings poverty, shame, quarrels; leads to calumnious talk, unchastity, murder, and the loss of freedom, of honor, of understanding.
general.author: tosafot

general.quote: This wine is too good for toast-drinking, my dear. You don’t want to mix emotions up with a wine like that. You lose the taste.
general.author: ernest hemingway

general.quote: It has become quite a common proverb that in wine there is truth.
general.author: pliny the elder

general.quote: Wine makes a poor man rich in imagination, a rich man poor in reality.
general.author: edward parsons day

general.quote: Wine is a turncoat; first a friend, and then an enemy.
general.author: henry fielding

general.quote: Wine takes away reason, engenders insanity, leads to thousands of crimes, and imposes such an enormous expense on nations.
general.author: pliny the elder

general.quote: A hangover is the wrath of grapes.
general.author: author unknown

general.quote: We are all mortal until the first kiss and the second glass of wine.
general.author: eduardo galeano

general.quote: Who loves not women, wine and song remains a fool his whole life long.
general.author: martin luther

general.quote: Wine and other luxuries have a tendency to enervate the mind and make men less brave in battle.
general.author: julius caesar

general.quote: Wine stimulates the mind and makes it quick with heat; care flees and is dissolved in much drink.
general.author: ovid

general.quote: Life is like wine, the longer you take to enjoy it the more chance you’ve got of tasting vinegar.
general.author: author unknown

general.quote: When asked what kind of wine he liked to drink he replied, "That which belongs to another.
general.author: laertius diogenes

general.quote: The use of wine is quite superfluous to man. It is constantly followed by the expenditure of power. The drinker draws a bill on his health which must always be renewed.
general.author: baron justus von liebig

general.quote: From wine what sudden friendship springs?
general.author: john gay

general.quote: Wine is a cunning wrestler.
general.author: plautus

general.quote: Wine is bottled poetry.
general.author: robert louis stevenson

general.quote: There is nothing to which men, while they have food and drink, cannot reconcile themselves.
general.author: george santayana

general.quote: Food is our common ground, a universal experience.
general.author: james beard

general.quote: Good food and a warm kitchen are what make a house a home.
general.author: rachael ray

general.quote: God comes to the hungry in the form of food.
general.author: mahatma gandhi

general.quote: Food probably has a very great influence on the condition of men. Wine exercises a more visible influence, food does it more slowly but perhaps just as surely. Who knows if a well-prepared soup was not responsible for the pneumatic pump or a poor one for a war?
general.author: georg c. lichtenberg

general.quote: Make food a very incidental part of your life by filling your life so full of meaningful things that you’ll hardly have time to think about food.
general.author: peace pilgrim

general.quote: I am not a glutton — I am an explorer of food.
general.author: erma bombeck

general.quote: More die in the United States of too much food than of too little.
general.author: john kenneth

general.quote: You can’t just eat good food. You’ve got to talk about it too. And you’ve got to talk about it to somebody who understands that kind of food.
general.author: kurt vonnegut

general.quote: Food … is the topmost taper on the golden candelabrum of existence.
general.author: donald barthelme

general.quote: The act of putting into your mouth what the earth has grown is perhaps your most direct interaction with the earth.
general.author: frances moore lappe

general.quote: Sharing food with another human being is an intimate act that should not be indulged in lightly.
general.author: m.f.k. fisher

general.quote: There is such a thing as food and such a thing as poison. But the damage done by those who pass off poison as food is far less than that done by those who generation after generation convince people that food is poison.
general.author: paul goodman

general.quote: Food is an important part of a balanced diet.
general.author: fran lebowitz

general.quote: Food is "everyday"–it has to be, or we would not survive for long. But food is never just something to eat. It is something to find or hunt or cultivate first of all; for most of human history we have spent a much longer portion of our lives worrying about food, and plotting, working, and fighting to obtain it, than we have in any other pursuit. As soon as we can count on a food supply (and so take food for granted), and not a moment sooner, we start to civilize ourselves.
general.author: margaret visser

general.quote: We may find in the long run that tinned food is a deadlier weapon than the machine-gun.
general.author: george orwell

general.quote: Never eat more than you can lift.
general.author: miss piggy

general.quote: The discovery of a new dish does more for human happiness than the discovery of a new star.
general.author: anthelme brillat-savarin

general.quote: Food is much better off the hand than the fork.
general.author: mario batali

general.quote: Tea is a work of art and needs a master hand to bring out its noblest qualities. We have good and bad teas, as we have good and bad paintings — generally the latter.
general.author: kakuzo okakura

general.quote: Should I, after tea and cakes and ices, have the strength to force the moment to its crisis?
general.author: t. s. eliot quotes

general.quote: Tea, though ridiculed by those who are naturally coarse in their nervous sensibilities will always be the favorite beverage of the intellectual.
general.author: thomas de quincey

general.quote: This morning’s tea makes yesterday distant.
general.author: author unknown

general.quote: It has been well said that tea is suggestive of a thousand wants, from which spring the decencies and luxuries of civilization.
general.author: agnes repplier

general.quote: Bread and water can so easily be toast and tea.
general.author: author unknown

general.quote: I would rather have a cup of tea than sex.
general.author: boy george

general.quote: Thank God for tea! What would the world do without tea! How did it exist? I am glad I was not born before tea.
general.author: sir philip sidney

general.quote: Drinking tea … punctuates our day with precious and refreshing pauses, whether it is after a satisfying meal or when taking a much-needed break in our busy schedule.
general.author: mutsuko tokunaga

general.quote: Come, let us have some tea and continue to talk about happy things.
general.author: chaim potok

general.quote: Good bankers, like good tea, can only be appreciated when they are in hot water.
general.author: jaffar hussein

general.quote: Is there no Latin word for Tea? Upon my soul, if I had known that I would have let the vulgar stuff alone.
general.author: hilaire belloc

general.quote: Today I’d like to sit and sip, forget about the world a bit, Ignore the things I have to do, and just enjoy a cup or two.
general.author: author unknown

general.quote: Love and scandal are the best sweeteners of tea.
general.author: henry fielding quotes

general.quote: There are few hours in life more agreeable than the hour dedicated to the ceremony known as afternoon tea.
general.author: henry james

general.quote: You can’t get a cup of tea big enough or a book long enough to suit me.
general.author: c. s. lewis

general.quote: In an age when everyone is constantly busy and short of time, what could be more enjoyable than taking time to indulge in what was once part of everyday life, but has now become a luxury — afternoon tea.
general.author: lesley mackley

general.quote: If this is coffee, please bring me some tea; but if this is tea, please bring me some coffee.
general.author: abraham lincoln

general.quote: I am Chinese. Tea is in my very bones.
general.author: kit chow

general.quote: Tea is a cup of life.
general.author: author unknown

general.quote: Tea began as a medicine and grew into a beverage.
general.author: kakuzo okakura

general.quote: Tea to the English is really a picnic indoors.
general.author: alice walker

general.quote: The froth of tea burns with brilliance.
general.author: author unknown

general.quote: Tea … is one of those rare treasures, enjoyed throughout the world, that actually benefits health.
general.author: kit chow

general.quote: Women are like tea bags; put them in hot water and they get stronger.
general.author: eleanor roosevelt quotes

general.quote: Tea is the most popular beverage, after water, throughout the world.
general.author: lester mitscher

general.quote: Wine is the drink of the gods, milk the drink of babes, tea the drink of women, and water the drink of beasts.
general.author: john stuart blackie

general.quote: Tea is more than an idealization of the form of drinking; it is a religion of the art of life.
general.author: kakuzo okakura

general.quote: Doing nothing is respectable at tea.
general.author: author unknown

general.quote: A cup of tea is a cup of peace.
general.author: author unknown

general.quote: Drink ’til the ground looks blue.
general.author: thomas heywood

general.quote: I think a man ought to get drunk at least twice a year just on principle, so he won’t let himself get snotty about it.
general.author: raymond chandler

general.quote: One reason I don’t drink is that I want to know when I am having a good time.
general.author: lady astor

general.quote: I drink exactly as much as I want, and one drink more.
general.author: h.l. mencken

general.quote: My country, right or wrong is a thing that no patriot would think of saying except in a desperate case. It is like saying "My mother, drunk or sober."
general.author: gilbert k. chesterton

general.quote: He who sins when drunk will have to atone for it when sober.
general.author: decimus laberius

general.quote: It is immoral to get drunk because the headache comes after the drinking, but if the headache came first and the drunkenness afterwards, it would be moral to get drunk.
general.author: samuel butler

general.quote: He was a wise man who invented beer.
general.author: plato

general.quote: Drunkenness is temporary suicide.
general.author: bertrand russell

general.quote: The worst thing about some men is that when they are not drunk they are sober.
general.author: william butler yeats

general.quote: Of the demonstrably wise there are but two: those who commit suicide and those who keep their reasoning faculties atrophied by drink.
general.author: mark twain

general.quote: No poems can please for long or live that are written by water-drinkers.
general.author: horace

general.quote: If merely "feeling good" could decide, drunkenness would be the supremely valid human experience.
general.author: william james

general.quote: It was a woman who drove me to drink, and I never had the courtesy to thank her for it.
general.author: w. c. fields

general.quote: Let the lover be disgraceful, crazy, absent-minded. Someone sober will worry about events going badly. Let the lover be.
general.author: jalal-uddin rumi

general.quote: My grandmother is over eighty and still doesn’t need glasses. Drinks right out of the bottle.
general.author: henny youngman

general.quote: A woman drove me to drink and I never even had the courtesy to thank her.
general.author: w.c. fields

general.quote: If you are young and you drink a great deal it will spoil your health, slow your mind, make you fat — in other words, turn you into an adult.
general.author: p.j. o’rourke

general.quote: Oh, you hate your job? Why didn’t you say so? There’s a support group for that. It’s called everybody, and they meet at the bar.
general.author: drew carey

general.quote: When I played drunks I had to remain sober because I didn’t know how to play them when I was drunk.
general.author: sir richard burton

general.quote: I have drunk, and seen the spider.
general.author: william shakespeare

general.quote: I prefer to think that God is not dead, just drunk.
general.author: john marcellus huston

general.quote: Young men are apt to think themselves wise enough, as drunken men are apt to think themselves sober enough.
general.author: philip dormer stanhope chesterfield

general.quote: A drunkard’s purse is a bottle.
general.author: george herbert

general.quote: It takes only one drink to get me drunk. The trouble is, I can’t remember if it’s the thirteenth or the fourteenth.
general.author: george burns

general.quote: Most Americans are born drunk, and really require a little wine or beer to sober them.
general.author: gilbert k. chesterton

general.quote: The drunk mind speaks the sober heart.
general.author: author unknown

general.quote: There is this to be said in favor of drinking, that it takes the drunkard first out of society, then out of the world.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson

general.quote: Wine that cost nothing is digested before it be drunk.
general.author: george herbert

general.quote: Where ever I go, there I am. Drunk.
general.author: rita e. torres

general.quote: Health — what my friends are always drinking to before they fall down.
general.author: phyllis diller

general.quote: Always do sober what you said you’d do drunk. That will teach you to keep your mouth shut.
general.author: ernest hemingway

general.quote: Other countries drink to get drunk, and this is accepted by everyone; in France, drunkenness is a consequence, never an intention. A drink is felt as the spinning out of a pleasure, not as the necessary cause of an effect which is sought: wine is not only a philter; it is also the leisurely act of drinking.
general.author: roland barthes

general.quote: Sobriety is either the love of health or incapacity for debauch.
general.author: françois vi de la rochefoucault

general.quote: Even though a number of people have tried, no one has yet found a way to drink for a living.
general.author: jean kerr

general.quote: I have been brought up and trained to have the utmost contempt for people who get drunk.
general.author: winston churchill

general.quote: If four or five guys tell you that you’re drunk, even though you know you haven’t had a thing to drink, the least you can do is to lie down a little while.
general.author: joseph schenck

general.quote: He is a drunkard who takes more than three glasses though he be not drunk.
general.author: epictetus

general.quote: The best audience is one that is intelligent, well-educated, and a little drunk.
general.author: alben w. barkley

general.quote: Now don’t say you can’t swear off drinking; it’s easy, I’ve done it a thousand times.
general.author: w.c. fields

general.quote: Stay busy, get plenty of exercise, and don’t drink too much. Then again, don’t drink too little.
general.author: herman smith-johannsen

general.quote: One drink is too many for me and a thousand not enough.
general.author: brendan f. behan

general.quote: It’s a great advantage not to drink among hard-drinking people. You can hold your tongue and, moreover, you can time any little irregularity of your own so that everybody else is so blind that they don’t see or care.
general.author: f. scott fitzgerald

general.quote: It pays to get drunk with the best people.
general.author: joe e lewis

general.quote: People creep into childhood, bound into youth, sober in adulthood, and soften into old age.
general.author: henry giles

general.quote: I don’t get drunk — I get awesome.
general.author: author unknown

general.quote: When the doors of opportunity swing open, we must make sure that we are not too drunk or too indifferent to walk through.
general.author: jesse jackson

general.quote: Man, being reasonable, must get drunk; the best of life is but intoxication.
general.author: lord byron

general.quote: Read over your existing business plan like you read the menu at your favorite restaurant.
general.author: darren l johnson

general.quote: I’m like a menu at an expensive restaurant; you can look at me, but you can’t afford me.
general.author: anna kournikova

general.quote: It’s easier to be faithful to a restaurant than it is to a woman.
general.author: federico fellini

general.quote: How someone treats a waiter or doorman can tell you so much about a person.
general.author: austin butler

general.quote: The C student starts a restaurant. The A student writes restaurant reviews.
general.author: p. j. o’rourke

general.quote: If your mother cooks Italian food, why should you go to a restaurant?
general.author: martin scorsese

general.quote: A Cannibal is a person who walks into a restaurant and orders a waiter.
general.author: morey amsterdam

general.quote: I don’t like Switzerland; it has produced nothing but theologians and waiters.
general.author: oscar wilde

general.quote: I asked the waiter, ‘Is this milk fresh?’ He said, ‘Lady, three hours ago it was grass.
general.author: phyllis diller

general.quote: Fame itself… doesn’t really afford you anything more than a good seat in a restaurant.
general.author: david bowie

general.quote: Leave the table while you still feel you could eat a little more.
general.author: helena rubinstein

general.quote: There are things you just can’t do in life. You can’t beat the phone company, you can’t make a waiter see you until he’s ready to see you, and you can’t go home again.
general.author: bill bryson

general.quote: It is a good thing that life is not as serious as it seems to a waiter.
general.author: don herold

general.quote: Life is like a restaurant; you can have anything you want as long as you are willing to pay the price.
general.author: moffat machingura

general.quote: If you’re not at the table, you’re on the menu.
general.author: michael enzi

general.quote: A person, who is nice to you, but rude to the waiter, is not a nice person.
general.author: dave barry

general.quote: Love, like a chicken salad or restaurant hash, must be taken with blind faith or it loses its flavor.
general.author: helen rowland

general.quote: When you do a menu at a restaurant, you have to be the engineer of that menu. It has to be a crowd-pleaser.
general.author: jean-georges vongerichten

general.quote: I judge a restaurant by the bread and by the coffee.
general.author: burt lancaster

general.quote: A woman’s chastity consists, like an onion, of a series of coats.
general.author: nathaniel hawthorne

general.quote: There is no such thing as a little garlic.
general.author: a. baer

general.quote: Happy is said to be the family which can eat onions together. They are, for the time being, separate, from the world, and have a harmony of aspiration.
general.author: charles dudley warner

general.quote: Acting is like peeling an onion. You have to peel away each layer to reveal another.
general.author: juliette binoche

general.quote: Plant a radish; get a radish, never any doubt. That’s why I love vegetables; you know what they’re about!
general.author: tom jones and harvey schmidt

general.quote: Stop and smell the garlic! That’s all you have to do.
general.author: william shatner

general.quote: This special feeling towards fruit, its glory and abundance, is I would say universal…. We respond to strawberry fields or cherry orchards with a delight that a cabbage patch or even an elegant vegetable garden cannot provoke.
general.author: jane grigson

general.quote: Cabbage: a familiar kitchen-garden vegetable about as large and wise as a man’s head
general.author: ambrose bierce

general.quote: Vulgarity is the garlic in the salad of life.
general.author: cyril connolly

general.quote: I have known many meat eaters to be far more nonviolent than vegetarians.
general.author: mahatma gandhi

general.quote: Indeed the tears live in an onion that should water this sorrow.
general.author: william shakespeare

general.quote: Expecting the world to treat you fairly because you are a good person is a little like expecting a bull not to attack you because you are a vegetarian.
general.author: dennis wholey

general.quote: Life expectancy would grow by leaps and bounds if green vegetables smelled as good as bacon.
general.author: doug larson

general.quote: Life is like an onion. You peel it off one layer at a time, and sometimes you weep.
general.author: carl sandburg

general.quote: Appeasers believe that if you keep on throwing steaks to a tiger, the tiger will become a vegetarian.
general.author: heywood c. broun

general.quote: I am not a vegetarian because I love animals; I am a vegetarian because I hate plants.
general.author: a. whitney brown

general.quote: It doesn’t matter how precisely the onion is cut as long as the person chewing it is happy.
general.author: padma lakshmi

general.quote: Using lots of fresh foods, fruits and vegetables, helps to keep the menu buoyant – I don’t know if that’s the right word, but it keeps a balance of freshness and health.
general.author: sally schneider

general.quote: It’s toughest to forgive ourselves. So it’s probably best to start with other people. It’s almost like peeling an onion. Layer by layer, forgiving others, you really do get to the point where you can forgive yourself.
general.author: patty duke

general.quote: Most dear actors, eat no onions nor garlic, for we are to utter sweet breath.
general.author: william shakespeare

general.quote: Good intentions are not enough. They’ve never put an onion in the soup yet.
general.author: sonya levien

general.quote: Without civilization, we would not turn into animals, but vegetables.
general.author: mason cooley

general.quote: Onions can make ev’n Heirs and Widows weep.
general.author: benjamin franklin

general.quote: What garlic is to salad, insanity is to art.
general.author: augustus saint-gaudens

general.quote: I understand the big food companies are developing a tearless onion. I think they can do it — after all, they’ve already given us tasteless bread.
general.author: robert orben

general.quote: If you like garlic, you’ll like ramps.
general.author: jim chamberlain

general.quote: Hatred, for the man who is not engaged in it, is a little like the odor of garlic for one who hasn’t eaten any.
general.author: jean rostand

general.quote: Life is like an onion: you peel off layer after layer and then you find there is nothing in it.
general.author: james huneker

general.quote: A man of my spiritual intensity does not eat corpses.
general.author: george bernard shaw

general.quote: Nothing will benefit human health and increase the chances for survival of life on earth as much as the evolution to a vegetarian diet.
general.author: albert einstein

general.quote: I do not say that one who is vegetarian is full of compassion and one who is not, is otherwise. We sometimes find people, who are vegetarians, are very bad people.
general.author: morarji desai

general.quote: Vegetarians don’t live longer, they just look older.
general.author: author unknown

general.quote: I’ve been a vegetarian for so long, I forgot how much I missed meat. You know you don’t realize how important meat is to you until you don’t have it for long time.
general.author: brittany daniel

general.quote: Most vegetarians I ever see looked enough like their food to be classed as cannibals.
general.author: finley peter dunne

general.quote: The work was like peeling an onion. The outer skin came off with difficulty… but in no time you’d be down to its innards, tears streaming from your eyes as more and more beautiful reductions became possible.
general.author: edward blishen

general.quote: Vegetarian – that’s an old Indian word meaning ‘lousy hunter.
general.author: andy rooney

general.quote: When I work, I try to eat as much vegetarian as possible. When I do Cupid, I eat vegetarian because I need the energy. I’ve got those wings on my back.
general.author: karl urban

general.quote: A vegetarian is a person who won’t eat anything that can have children.
general.author: david brenner

general.quote: We have garlic days, and onion days. You know what they’re cooking.
general.author: leslie white

general.quote: Vegetarians are cool. All I eat are vegetarians – except for the occasional mountain lion steak.
general.author: ted nugent

general.quote: You can never have enough garlic. With enough garlic, you can eat The New York Times.
general.author: morley safer

general.quote: An onion can make people cry, but there has never been a vegetable invented to make them laugh.
general.author: will rogers

general.quote: I think that if a person wants to remain vegetarian, they’re just going to have to go hungry.
general.author: robert atkins

general.quote: A good home must be made, not bought. In the end, it’s not track lighting or a sun room that brings light into a kitchen.
general.author: joyce maynard

general.quote: A kitchen without a knife is not a kitchen.
general.author: masaharu morimoto

general.quote: Know you food, know your farmers, and know your kitchen.
general.author: joel salatin

general.quote: If you look at the statistics, people spend most of their time in the kitchen. Aside from the backyard, it’s one of my favorite places to renovate.
general.author: vanilla ice

general.quote: If you can’t stand the heat, get out of the kitchen.
general.author: harry s truman

general.quote: Get people back into the kitchen and combat the trend toward processed food and fast food.
general.author: andrew weil

general.quote: Good food and a warm kitchen are what makes a house a home.
general.author: rachael ray

general.quote: Keep it simple in the kitchen. If you use quality ingredients, you don’t need anything fancy to make food delicious: just a knife, a cutting board, and some good nonstick cookware, and you’re set.
general.author: curtis stone

general.quote: If men can quilt and take over the kitchen, then women can pick up a wrench and fix a leaky pipe.
general.author: hanna rosin

general.quote: The kitchen really is the castle itself. This is where we spend our happiest moments and where we find the joy of being a family.
general.author: mario batali

general.quote: Cleanliness is very important. If you let kids make a total mess in the kitchen and then leave, you’re not really teaching them anything.
general.author: emeril lagasse

general.quote: The kitchen’s a laboratory, and everything that happens there has to do with science. It’s biology, chemistry, physics. Yes, there’s history. Yes, there’s artistry. Yes, to all of that. But what happened there, what actually happens to the food is all science.
general.author: alton brown

general.quote: Taste every fruit of every tree in the garden at least once. It is an insult to creation not to experience it fully. Temperance is wickedness.
general.author: stephen fry

general.quote: China is trying to become America without democracy while America is trying to become France without cheese calories.
general.author: p. j. o’rourke

general.quote: I’d rather have bread and cheese with my darlings than roast turkey, cranberry sauce, and mince-pie all alone.
general.author: jay benson hamilton

general.quote: The poets have been mysteriously silent on the subject of cheese.
general.author: gilbert k. chesterton

general.quote: Lawyers are like cheeses. There are lots of good ones, but not everybody likes the taste of some or can afford the best of others.
general.author: robin ellison

general.quote: Cheese is milk’s leap toward immortality.
general.author: clifton fadiman

general.quote: Worry is today’s mice nibbling on tomorrow’s cheese.
general.author: saying

general.quote: What happens to the hole when the cheese is gone?
general.author: bertolt brecht

general.quote: How can anyone govern a nation that has two hundred and forty-six different kinds of cheese?
general.author: charles de gaulle

general.quote: Sometimes when everybody’s feeding you the cheese it’s hard not to eat it.
general.author: bill parcells

general.quote: Age is something that doesn’t matter, unless you are a cheese.
general.author: luis bunuel

general.quote: Thirst is the aim for quest, it keeps inspiring to find more and more; Otherwise, satisfied we would sit, and lazily rest on the shore!
general.author: neelam saxena chandra

general.quote: Curiosity is the thirst of the soul.
general.author: samuel johnson

general.quote: The thirst for powerful sensations takes the upper hand both over fear and over compassion for the grief of others.
general.author: anton chekhov

general.quote: You should not see the desert simply as some faraway place of little rain. There are many forms of thirst.
general.author: william langewiesche

general.quote: Love, with very young people, is a heartless business. We drink at that age from thirst, or to get drunk; it is only later in life that we occupy ourselves with the individuality of our wine.
general.author: isak dinesen

general.quote: He that has satisfied his thirst turns his back on the well.
general.author: baltasar gracian

general.quote: The best books for a man are not always those which the wise recommend, but often those which meet the peculiar wants, the natural thirst of his mind, and therefore awaken interest and rivet thought.
general.author: william ellery channing

general.quote: Whoever thirst for money is real victim of a capital illusion.
general.author: toba beta

general.quote: The bible is a remarkable fountain: the more one draws and drinks of it, the more it stimulates thirst.
general.author: martin luther

general.quote: We will drink what we thirst for and eat what we hunger for if we allow ourselves to be used for what we were created for!
general.author: israelmore ayivor

general.quote: At the bottom of the modern man there is always a great thirst for self-forgetfulness, self-distraction . . . and therefore he turns away from all those problems and abysses which might recall to him his own nothingness.
general.author: henri frederic amiel

general.quote: I offer neither pay, nor quarters, nor food; I offer only hunger, thirst, forced marches, battles and death. Let him who loves his country with his heart, and not merely with his lips, follow me.
general.author: giuseppe garibaldi

general.quote: Fame is the thirst of youth.
general.author: lord byron

general.quote: What an unrequited love it is, this thirst! But is it love, when it is unrequited?
general.author: eleanor catton

general.quote: He supposed that even in Hell, people got an occasional sip of water, if only so they could appreciate the full horror of unrequited thirst when it set in again.
general.author: stephen king

general.quote: Kissing her is like drinking salted water, he thinks. His thirst only increases.
general.author: sara sheridan

general.quote: Our culture has filled our heads but emptied our hearts, stuffed our wallets but starved our wonder. It has fed our thirst for facts but not for meaning or mystery. It produces "nice" people, not heroes.
general.author: peter kreeft

general.quote: To hunger and thirst after righteousness is when nothing in the world can fascinate us so much as being near God.
general.author: smith wigglesworth

general.quote: You don’t know what thirst is until you drink for the first time.
general.author: carlos ruiz zafón

general.quote: Do not curse the well that quenches your thirst.
general.author: matshona dhliwayo

general.quote: After digging a thousand wells of my own and stumbling upon a thousand others dug by the hands of thirsty men, I have yet to realize that the only well that can satiate every thirst is the one that men will never dig.
general.author: craig d. lounsbrough

general.quote: I drank at every vine, the last was like the first. I came upon no wine so wonderful as thirst.
general.author: edna st. vincent millay

general.quote: We need houses as we need clothes, architecture stimulates fashion. It’s like hunger and thirst — you need them both.
general.author: karl lagerfeld

general.quote: Of hunger and thirst, thirst is the greater imperative.
general.author: yann martel

general.quote: Like hunger or thirst, the instinct for balance is built into the human body.
general.author: deepak chopra

general.quote: The soul’s deepest thirst is for God Himself, who has made us so that we can never be satisfied without Him.
general.author: f. f. bruce

general.quote: Someone feeling wronged is like someone feeling thirsty. Don’t tell them they aren’t. Sit with them and have a drink.
general.author: lemony snicket

general.quote: Drink in the moon as though you might die of thirst.
general.author: sanober khan

general.quote: The only way when your thirst for excellence is satisfied is when you take up the challenge to do a little more every day than you have already been doing every day!
general.author: israelmore ayivor

general.quote: I’m looking for someone to quench my thirst-for all eternity.
general.author: luna maxwell”

general.quote: The journey towards success is more like a traveller lost in a desert, desperate to find an oasis, desperate to quench his thirst. But it is not about how grave the thirst is but about how long he chooses to walk thirsty.
general.author: chirag tulsiani

general.quote: The desire of knowledge, like the thirst of riches, increases ever with the acquisition of it.
general.author: laurence sterne

general.quote: The wine in the bottle does not quench thirst.
general.author: george herbert

general.quote: Give up your thirst for books, so that you do not die a grouch.
general.author: marcus aurelius

general.quote: Amuse yourself, torment your desires. Drink when you’re thirsty — that would be very much too simple! If you didn’t harbour a temptation eternally in your soul, you’d run the risk of forgetting yourself.
general.author: jean-paul sartre

general.quote: Because I know it in my bones. You are the only female I desire, the only water that will quench my thirst, the only sun that will warm my skin, the only lips that were made for mine.
general.author: dannika dark

general.quote: Don’t wear perfume in the garden — unless you want to be pollinated by bees.
general.author: anne raver

general.quote: When you go in search of honey you must expect to be stung by bees.
general.author: kenneth kaunda

general.quote: Books are the bees which carry the quickening pollen from one to another mind.
general.author: james russell lowell

general.quote: Even bees, the little almsmen of spring bowers, know there is richest juice in poison-flowers.
general.author: john keats

general.quote: So our student will flit like a busy bee through the entire garden of literature, light on every blossom, collect a little nectar from each, and carry it to his hive…
general.author: desiderius erasmus

general.quote: You are my honey, honeysuckle, I am the bee.
general.author: albert h. fitz

general.quote: The pedigree of honey does not concern the bee, a clover, anytime, to him, is aristocracy.
general.author: emily dickinson

general.quote: Life is a flower of which love is the honey.
general.author: victor hugo

general.quote: Bees do have a smell, you know, and if they don’t they should, for their feet are dusted with spices from a million flowers.
general.author: ray bradbury

general.quote: If the bee disappeared off the face of the earth, man would only have four years left to live.
general.author: maurice maeterlinck

general.quote: It is not how busy you are, but why you are busy — the bee is praised, the mosquito is swatted.
general.author: author unknown

general.quote: Books are the beehives of thought; laconics, the honey taken from them.
general.author: james ellis

general.quote: Sweet words are like honey, a little may refresh, but too much gluts the stomach.
general.author: anne bradstreet

general.quote: The hum of bees is the voice of the garden.
general.author: elizabeth lawrence

general.quote: Bees were busy, and their humming brought pleasant hopes of summer.
general.author: lady john manners

general.quote: When I hear a man preach, I like to see him act as if he were fighting bees.
general.author: abraham lincoln

general.quote: Aerodynamically the bumble bee shouldn’t be able to fly, but the bumble bee doesn’t know it, so it goes on flying anyway.
general.author: mary kay ash

general.quote: Handle a book as a bee does a flower, extract its sweetness but do not damage it.
general.author: john muir

general.quote: Every saint has a bee in his halo.
general.author: elbert hubbard

general.quote: The fly that touches honey cannot use it’s wings; so too the soul that clings to spiritual sweetness ruins it’s freedom and hinders contemplation.
general.author: ghose aurobindo

general.quote: Hope is the only bee that makes honey without flowers.
general.author: robert green ingersoll

general.quote: I expect some new phases of life this summer, and shall try to get the honey from each moment.
general.author: lucy stone

general.quote: Take time to smell the roses and eventually you’ll inhale a bee.
general.author: author unknown

general.quote: If your words are soft and sweet, they won’t be as hard to swallow if you have to eat them.
general.author: author unknown

general.quote: When my horse is running good, I don’t stop to give him sugar.
general.author: william faulkner

general.quote: Health and appetite impart the sweetness to sugar, bread, and meat.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson

general.quote: A wise woman puts a grain of sugar into everything she says to a man, and takes a grain of salt with everything he says to her.
general.author: helen rowland

general.quote: There is only one difference between a long life and a good dinner: that, in the dinner, the sweets come last.
general.author: robert louis stevenson

general.quote: A woman whose face looked as if it had been made of sugar and someone had licked it.
general.author: george bernard shaw

general.quote: Every sweet has its sour; every evil its good.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson

general.quote: A little girl is sugar and spice and everything nice, especially when she’s taking a nap.
general.author: author unknown

general.quote: Failure is not sweet, but it need not be bitter.
general.author: author unknown

general.quote: But friendship is the breathing rose, with sweets in every fold.
general.author: oliver wendell holmes

general.quote: The roots of education are bitter, but the fruit is sweet.
general.author: aristotle

general.quote: Please God, make my words today sweet and tender, for tomorrow I may have to eat them.
general.author: author unknown

general.quote: The smell of profit is clean and sweet, whatever the source.
general.author: juvenal

general.quote: I believe that water is the only drink for a wise man.
general.author: henry david thoreau

general.quote: Water, taken in moderation, cannot hurt anybody.
general.author: mark twain

general.quote: There is no small pleasure in sweet water.
general.author: ovid (publius ovidius naso)

general.quote: This life is like a swimming pool. You dive into the water, but you can’t see how deep it is.
general.author: dennis rodman

general.quote: The people are like water and the ruler a boat. Water can support a boat or overturn it.
general.author: li shimim

general.quote: But I do see the good side of water now. How good it is when you’re really thirsty, how it glitters and gurgles! How alive it is!
general.author: g.k. chesterton

general.quote: I love the sounds and the power of pounding water, whether it is the waves or a waterfall.
general.author: mike may

general.quote: Nothing is softer or more flexible than water, yet nothing can resist it.
general.author: lao tzu

general.quote: We never know the worth of water till the well is dry.
general.author: thomas fuller

general.quote: Expect poison from standing water.
general.author: william blake

general.quote: I eat everything that nature voluntarily gives: fruits, vegetables, and the products of plants. But I ask you to spare me what animals are forced to surrender: meat, milk, and cheese.
general.author: author unknown

general.quote: Cutting meat out of your diet is the best thing you can do for animals and your own health.
general.author: joan jett

general.quote: Vegetables are interesting but lack a sense of purpose when unaccompanied by a good cut of meat.
general.author: fran lebwitz

general.quote: Tongue – a variety of meat, rarely served because it clearly crosses the line between a cut of beef and a piece of a dead cow.
general.author: bob ekstrom

general.quote: The way you cut your meat reflects the way you live.
general.author: confucius

general.quote: Red meat is not bad for you. Now blue-green meat, that’s bad for you!
general.author: tommy smothers

general.quote: They claim red meat is bad for you. But I never saw a sick-looking tiger.
general.author: chi chi rodriguez

general.quote: Work is the meat of life, pleasure the dessert.
general.author: b. c. forbes

general.quote: Nothing spoils lunch any quicker than a rogue meatball rampaging through your spaghetti.
general.author: jim davis

general.quote: Some have meat, and cannot eat, and some cannot eat that want it; but we have meat, and we can eat – And let the Lord be thanked.
general.author: robert burns

general.quote: I think if you want to eat more meat you should kill it yourself and eat it raw so that you are not blinded by the hypocrisy of having it processed for you.
general.author: margi clark

general.quote: I do not like eating meat because I have seen lambs and pigs killed. I saw and felt their pain. They felt the approaching death. I could not bear it. I cried like a child. I ran up a hill and could not breathe. I felt that I was choking. I felt the death of the lamb.
general.author: vaslav nijinsky

general.quote: All normal people love meat. If I went to a barbeque and there was no meat, I would say, "Yo Goober! Where’s the meat?" I’m trying to impress people here, Lisa. You don’t win friends with salad.
general.author: matt groening

general.quote: A man can live and be healthy without killing animals for food; therefore, if he eats meat, he participates in taking animal life merely for the sake of his appetite. And to act so is immoral.
general.author: leo tolstoy

general.quote: Tis not the meat, but ’tis the appetite makes eating a delight.
general.author: john suckling

general.quote: Doctors confuse color and chemistry. The white meat of chicken is therefore the essence of a light diet and dark meat is poison.
general.author: martin h. fischer

general.quote: Meat is an inefficient way to eat. An acre of land can yield 20,000 pounds of potatoes, but that same acre would only graze enough cows to get 165 pounds of meat.
general.author: alexandra paul

general.quote: Rice at present prices provides more food for the money than most of the other cereals.
general.author: david f. houston

general.quote: With coarse rice to eat, with water to drink, and my bent arm for a pillow — I have still joy in the midst of all these things.
general.author: confucius

general.quote: Let there be work, bread, water and salt for all.
general.author: nelson mandela

general.quote: Business is the salt of life.
general.author: jeff rich

general.quote: A day without an argument is like an egg without salt.
general.author: angela carter

general.quote: You have to take criticism with a grain of salt because you’re never going to please everybody.
general.author: yolanda adams

general.quote: Wit is the salt of conversation, not the food.
general.author: william hazlitt

general.quote: Adding salt to desserts helps to balance and pronounce flavors.
general.author: johnny iuzzini

general.quote: Wit – the salt with which the American humorist spoils his intellectual cookery by leaving it out.
general.author: ambrose bierce

general.quote: No man is worth his salt who is not ready at all times to risk his well-being, to risk his body, to risk his life, in a great cause.
general.author: theodore roosevelt

general.quote: The two basic items necessary to sustain life are sunshine and coconut milk.
general.author: dustin hoffman

general.quote: I don’t believe that you have to be a cow to know what milk is.
general.author: ann landers

general.quote: Get off your horse and drink your milk.
general.author: john wayne

general.quote: You cannot have power for good without having power for evil too. Even mother’s milk nourishes murderers as well as heroes.
general.author: george bernard shaw

general.quote: Adversity’s sweet milk, philosophy.
general.author: william shakespeare

general.quote: The way to my heart is through Belgian milk chocolate.
general.author: emma donoghue

general.quote: Mankind has a free will; but it is free to milk cows and to build houses, nothing more.
general.author: martin luther

general.quote: What really counts is not the immediate act of courage or of valor, but those who bear the struggle day in and day out.
general.author: john f. kennedy

general.quote: We grow because we struggle, we learn and overcome.
general.author: r. c. allen

general.quote: To win one’s joy through struggle is better than to yield to melancholy.
general.author: andre gide

general.quote: Yesterday I dared to struggle. Today I dare to win.
general.author: bernadette devlin

general.quote: The struggle to learn to listen to and respect our own intuitive, inner promptings is the greatest challenge of all.
general.author: herb goldberg

general.quote: Need and struggle are what excite and inspire us; our hour of triumph is what brings the void.
general.author: william james

general.quote: The difficulties and struggles of today are but the price we must pay for the accomplishments and victories of tomorrow.
general.author: william boetck

general.quote: Don’t ask me to give in to this body of mine. I can’t afford it. Between me and my body there must be a struggle until death.
general.author: st. margaret of cortona

general.quote: It is in struggle and service with our brothers and sisters, individually and collectively, that we find the meaning of life.
general.author: jesse jackson

general.quote: Many who seem to be struggling with adversity are happy; many, amid great affluence, are utterly miserable.
general.author: publius cornelius tacitus

general.quote: Every worthwhile accomplishment, big or little, has its stages of drudgery and triumph: a beginning, a struggle, and a victory.
general.author: mahatma gandhi

general.quote: Youth is a blunder, manhood is a struggle and old age a regret.
general.author: benjamin disraeli

general.quote: Hope is the struggle of the soul, breaking loose from what is perishable, and attesting her eternity.
general.author: herman melville

general.quote: This struggle of people against their conditions, this is where you find the meaning in life.
general.author: rose chernin

general.quote: Those who cannot tell what they desire or expect, still sigh and struggle with indefinite thoughts and vast wishes.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson

general.quote: It may be that the most interesting American struggle is the struggle to set oneself free from the limits one is born to, and then to learn something of the value of those limits.
general.author: greil marcus

general.quote: The best education in the world is that got by struggling to get a living.
general.author: wendell phillips

general.quote: I always try to turn my personal struggles into something helpful for others.
general.author: henri nouwen

general.quote: Such is hope, heaven’s own gift to struggling mortals, pervading, like some subtle essence from the skies, all things both good and bad.
general.author: charles dickens

general.quote: But are not this struggle and even the mistakes one may make better, and do they not develop us more, than if we kept systematically away from emotions?
general.author: vincent van gogh

general.quote: To see what is in front of one’s nose requires a constant struggle.
general.author: george orwell

general.quote: The hardest struggle of all is to be something different from what the average man is.
general.author: charles m. schwab

general.quote: I have always fought for ideas — until I learned that it isn’t ideas but grief, struggle, and flashes of vision which enlighten.
general.author: margaret anderson

general.quote: Anyone who has struggled with poverty knows how extremely expensive it is to be poor.
general.author: james baldwin

general.quote: There is no sense in the struggle, but there is no choice but to struggle.
general.author: ernie pyle

general.quote: All life is the struggle, the effort to be itself.
general.author: jose ortega y gasset

general.quote: Nothing should be permanent except struggle with the dark side within ourselves.
general.author: shirley maclaine

general.quote: All art is a struggle to be, in a particular sort of way, virtuous.
general.author: iris murdoch

general.quote: A woman can look both moral and exciting — if she also looks as if it was quite a struggle.
general.author: edna ferber

general.quote: It isn’t until you begin to fight in your own cause that you (a) become really committed to winning, and (b) become a genuine ally of other people struggling for their freedom.
general.author: robin morgan

general.quote: I’ve never forgotten for long at a time that living is struggle. I know that every good and excellent thing in the world stands moment by moment on the razor-edge of danger and must be fought for — whether it’s a field, or a home, or a country.
general.author: thornton wilder

general.quote: Man errs as long as he struggles.
general.author: johann wolfgang von goethe

general.quote: No idea can succeed except at the expense of sacrifice; no one ever escapes without enduring strain from the struggle of life.
general.author: ernest renan

general.quote: Creativity is essentially a lonely art, an even lonelier struggle. To some a blessing; to others a curse. It is in reality the ability to reach inside yourself and drag forth from your very soul an idea.
general.author: lou dorfsman

general.quote: Man’s creative struggle, his search for wisdom and truth, is a love story.
general.author: iris murdoch

general.quote: Every action we take, everything we do, is either a victory or defeat in the struggle to become what we want to be.
general.author: anne byrhhe

general.quote: I have always struggled to achieve excellence. One thing that cycling has taught me is that if you can achieve something without a struggle, it’s not going to be satisfying.
general.author: greg lemond
