general.quote: Men who want to support women in our struggle for freedom and justice should understand that it is not terrifically important to us that they learn to cry; it is important to us that they stop the crimes of violence against us.
general.author: andrea dworkin

general.quote: Education comes from within; you get it by struggle and effort and thought.
general.author: napoleon hill

general.quote: The bravest sight in the world is a great man struggling against adversity.
general.author: marcus annaeus seneca

general.quote: The struggle itself towards the heights is enough to fill a man’s heart. One must imagine Sisyphus happy.
general.author: albert camus

general.quote: A revolution is not a bed of roses. A revolution is a struggle between the future and the past.
general.author: fidel castro

general.quote: Life is essentially a cheat and its conditions are those of defeat… the redeeming things are not "happiness and pleasure" but the deeper satisfactions that come out of struggle.
general.author: f. scott fitzgerald

general.quote: Happiness is to take up the struggle in the midst of the raging storm, not to pluck the lute in the moonlight or recite poetry among the blossoms.
general.author: ding ling

general.quote: Cushion the painful effects of hard blows by keeping the enthusiasm going strong, even if doing so requires struggle.
general.author: norman vincent peale

general.quote: All the arts and sciences have their roots in the struggle against death.
general.author: saint gregory of nyssathe struggle alone pleases us, not the victory.~ blaise pascal

general.quote: If you forget you have to struggle for improvement you go backward.
general.author: geoffrey hickson

general.quote: Emotional maturity is the ability to stick to a job and to struggle through until it is finished, to endure unpleasantness, discomfort and frustration.
general.author: edward a. strecker

general.quote: We see many who are struggling against adversity who are happy, and more although abounding in wealth, who are wretched.
general.author: publius cornelius tacitus

general.quote: In a serious struggle there is no worse cruelty than to be magnanimous at an inopportune time.
general.author: leon trotsky

general.quote: We struggle with the complexities and avoid the simplicities.
general.author: norman vincent peale

general.quote: Originality and the feeling of one’s own dignity are achieved only through work and struggle.
general.author: fyodor dostoevsky

general.quote: There is no longer beauty except in the struggle. No more masterpieces without an aggressive character. Poetry must be a violent assault against the unknown forces in order to overcome them and prostrate them before men.
general.author: tommaso marinetti

general.quote: The most important thing in life is not the triumph but the struggle. The essential thing is not to have conquered but to have fought well.
general.author: baron pierre de coubertin

general.quote: In struggling against anguish one never produces serenity; the struggle against anguish only produces new forms of anguish.
general.author: simone weil

general.quote: How base a thing it is when a man will struggle with necessity! We have to die.
general.author: euripides

general.quote: Strength and growth come only through continuous effort and struggle.
general.author: napoleon hill

general.quote: The way I see things, the way I see life, I see it as a struggle. And there’s a great deal of reward I have gained coming to that understanding — that existence is a struggle.
general.author: harvey keitel

general.quote: Some of us might find happiness if we quit struggling so desperately for it.
general.author: william feather

general.quote: Success is sweet and sweeter if long delayed and gotten through many struggles and defeats.
general.author: amos bronson alcott

general.quote: It is the eternal struggle between these two principles — right and wrong. They are the two principles that have stood face to face from the beginning of time and will ever continue to struggle. It is the same spirit that says, "You work and toil and earn bread, and I’ll eat it.
general.author: abraham lincoln

general.quote: Life is a struggle, but not warfare.
general.author: john burroughs

general.quote: Tranquility is the old man’s milk.
general.author: thomas jefferson

general.quote: A child is fed with milk and praise.
general.author: mary lamb

general.quote: If you must cry over spilled milk then please try to condense it.
general.author: author unknown

general.quote: Opie, you haven’t finished your milk. We can’t put it back in the cow, you know.
general.author: aunt bee taylor

general.quote: He who distributes the milk of human kindness cannot help but spill a little on himself.
general.author: james matthew barrie

general.quote: Never cry over spilt milk, because it may have been poisoned.
general.author: w. c. fields

general.quote: You can only milk a cow so long, then you’re left holding the pail.
general.author: hank aaron

general.quote: All the good ideas I ever had came to me while I was milking a cow.
general.author: grant wood

general.quote: Salt is one of the flavors that makes food taste good – salt, sugar and fat. So it’s a natural thing for all chefs and cooks to add salt, because it enhances the flavor of the food. If you go out to eat, I guarantee you’re going to be eating a lot of salted foods that you are going to have no idea.
general.author: brett hoebel

general.quote: To grow a tomato or a pepper and prepare a meal from your labor and care is primordially satisfying.
general.author: nell newman

general.quote: The cure for anything is salt water: sweat, tears or the sea.
general.author: isak dinesen

general.quote: The salt of any interesting civilization is mixture.
general.author: antonio tabucchi

general.quote: The American dream is a crock. Stop wanting everything. Everyone should wear jeans and have three T-shirts, eat rice and beans.
general.author: bill hicks

general.quote: She’s been married so many times she has rice marks on her face.
general.author: henny youngman

general.quote: Same old slippers, same old rice, same old glimpse of paradise.
general.author: william james lampton

general.quote: Eating rice cakes is like chewing on a foam coffee cup, only less filling.
general.author: dave barry

general.quote: A man loves the meat in his youth that he cannot endure in his age.
general.author: william shakespeare

general.quote: It is not the quantity of the meat, but the cheerfulness of the guests, which makes the feast.
general.author: edward hyde

general.quote: Recognize meat for what it really is: the antibiotic- and pesticide-laden corpse of a tortured animal.
general.author: ingrid newkirk

general.quote: The earth requires the use of its two-thirds water to keep its face clean.
general.author: james lendall basford

general.quote: If there is magic on this planet, it is contained in water.
general.author: loren eiseley

general.quote: Water flows uphill towards money.
general.author: author unknown

general.quote: The tree that is beside the running water is fresher and gives more fruit.
general.author: saint teresa of avila

general.quote: Just because you liked something as a youngster doesn’t mean you have to like it as an adult. You can change your taste a little bit on the sweets and things like that.
general.author: mike ditka

general.quote: Heard melodies are sweet, but those unheard are sweeter.
general.author: john keats

general.quote: Written by a sponge dipped in warm milk and sprinkled with sugar.
general.author: john ciardi

general.quote: Jesus makes the bitterest mouthful taste sweet.
general.author: st. theresa of lisieux

general.quote: Stands the Church clock at ten to three? And is there honey still for tea?
general.author: rupert brooke

general.quote: It takes a bee to get the honey out.
general.author: arthur guiterman

general.quote: If you want to gather honey, don’t kick over the beehive.
general.author: dale carnegie

general.quote: As busie as a Bee.
general.author: john lyly

general.quote: My spirit thirst for the living water.
general.author: lailah gifty akita

general.quote: The insatiable thirst for everything which lies beyond, and which life reveals, is the most living proof of our immortality.
general.author: charles baudelaire

general.quote: Every living person and thing responds to beauty. We all thirst for it. We receive strength and renewal by seeing stirring and satisfying sites.
general.author: lady bird johnson

general.quote: Our misery is that we thirst so little for these sublime things, and so much for the mocking trifles of time and space.
general.author: charles spurgeon

general.quote: There’s always free cheese in a mousetrap.
general.author: saying

general.quote: The early bird may get the worm, but its the second mouse that gets the cheese.
general.author: author unknown

general.quote: The clever cat eats cheese and breathes down rat holes with baited breath.
general.author: w. c. fields

general.quote: Wine and cheese are ageless companions, like aspirin and aches, or June and moon, or good people and noble ventures.
general.author: m. f. k. fisher

general.quote: Success without honor is an unseasoned dish; it will satisfy your hunger, but it won’t taste good.
general.author: joe paterno

general.quote: I have drunken deep of joy, And I will taste no other wine tonight.
general.author: percy bysshe shelley

general.quote: The kitchen is the heart of every home, for the most part. It evokes memories of your family history.
general.author: debi mazar

general.quote: You are what you eat. For example, if you eat garlic you’re apt to be a hermit.
general.author: franklin p. jones

general.quote: Most of the food allergies die under garlic and onion.
general.author: martin h. fischer

general.quote: Tomatoes and oregano make it Italian; wine and tarragon make it French. Sour cream makes it Russian; lemon and cinnamon make it Greek. Soy sauce makes it Chinese; garlic makes it good.
general.author: alice may brock

general.quote: I’m not a vegetarian, but I eat animals who are.
general.author: groucho marx

general.quote: Once a waitress, always a waitress.
general.author: sandra bullock

general.quote: A great restaurant doesn’t distinguish itself by how few mistakes it makes but by how well they handle those mistakes.
general.author: danny meyer

general.quote: There are advantages to being a star though – you can always get a table in a full restaurant.
general.author: ingrid bergman

general.quote: The soup is never hot enough if the waiter can keep his thumb in it.
general.author: william collier

general.quote: I was somewhat drunk with what I had done. And I am always one to prefer being sober.
general.author: gertrude stein

general.quote: Drunkenness is nothing but voluntary madness.
general.author: seneca

general.quote: No animal ever invented anything so bad as drunkenness — or so good as drink.
general.author: lord chesterton

general.quote: A man, who exposes himself when he is intoxicated, has not the art of getting drunk.
general.author: samuel johnson

general.quote: Tea beckons us to enjoy quality time with friends and loved ones, and especially to rediscover the art of relaxed conversation.
general.author: dorothea johnson

general.quote: I got nasty habits; I take tea at three.
general.author: mick jagger

general.quote: Tea purifies spirit, removes anxiety and nervousness, brings ease and comfort, and is conducive to meditation.
general.author: author unknown

general.quote: Old maids sweeten their tea with scandal.
general.author: josh billings

general.quote: I will not eat oysters. I want my food dead — not sick, not wounded — dead.
general.author: woody allen

general.quote: What is food to one, is to others bitter poison.
general.author: lucretius

general.quote: If you’re going to America, bring your own food.
general.author: fran lebowitz

general.quote: There is no love sincerer than the love of food.
general.author: george bernard shaw

general.quote: Sadder than destitution, sadder than a beggar is the man who eats alone in public. Nothing more contradicts the laws of man or beast, for animals always do each other the honor of sharing or disputing each other’s food.
general.author: jean baudrillard

general.quote: Wine hath drowned more men than the sea.
general.author: thomas fuller

general.quote: Wine and youth are fire upon fire.
general.author: henry fielding

general.quote: Seek but provision of bread and wine, fools to flatter, and clothing fine; and nothing of God shall ever be thine.
general.author: wes smith

general.quote: Let us have wine and women, mirth and laughter. Sermons and soda water the day after.
general.author: lord byronw

general.quote: Square meals often make round people.
general.author: joseph e. cossman

general.quote: A man is in general better pleased when he has a good dinner upon his table, than when his wife talks Greek.
general.author: samuel johnson

general.quote: Breakfast is a notoriously difficult meal to serve with a flourish.
general.author: clement freud

general.quote: Good taste is as tiring as good company.
general.author: francis picabia

general.quote: Knowing what you can not do is more important than knowing what you can do. In fact, that’s good taste.
general.author: a. c. benson

general.quote: Good taste is the worst vice ever invented.
general.author: edith sitwell

general.quote: There is always a heavy demand for fresh mediocrity. In every generation the least cultivated taste has the largest appetite.
general.author: paul gauguin

general.quote: It is not actual suffering but the taste of better things which excites people to revolt.
general.author: eric hoffer quotes

general.quote: We should not teach children the sciences; but give them a taste for them.
general.author: jean-jacques rousseau

general.quote: Intelligence is really a kind of taste: taste in ideas.
general.author: susan sontag

general.quote: I rise to taste the dawn, and find that love alone will shine today.
general.author: ken wilber

general.quote: Good taste doesn’t exist. It is our taste. We have to be proud of it.
general.author: franco moschino

general.quote: We never taste a perfect joy; our happiest successes are mixed with sadness.
general.author: pierre corneille

general.quote: Taste is the common sense of genius.
general.author: victor hugo quotes

general.quote: Love of beauty is taste. The creation of beauty is art.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson quotes

general.quote: Bad taste is simply saying the truth before it should be said.
general.author: mel brooks

general.quote: Pessimism is as american as apple pie – frozen apple pie with a slice of processed cheese.
general.author: george will

general.quote: In hollywood, the women are all peaches. it makes one long for an apple occasionally.
general.author: william somerset maugham

general.quote: I tell you, all politics is apple sauce.
general.author: will rogers

general.quote: Almost all wild apples are handsome. they cannot be too gnarly and crabbed and rusty to look at. the gnarliest will have some redeeming traits even to the eye.
general.author: henry david thoreau

general.quote: If the family were a fruit, it would be an orange, a circle of sections, held together but separable, each segment distinct.
general.author: lefty cotton pogrebin

general.quote: You have to give people permission to laugh. That’s why they would always cut to the banana peel in the Laurel and Hardy movies.
general.author: danny devito

general.quote: Bananas are more like flowers, … you can’t mess around with them.
general.author: richard benson

general.quote: God doesn’t make orange juice, God makes oranges.
general.author: jesse jackson

general.quote: Baking is how you start kids at cooking in the kitchen. It’s fun whether it’s baking bread or cookies. With baking, you have to be exact when it comes to ingredients.
general.author: sandra lee

general.quote: If you want to become a great chef, you have to work with great chefs. And that’s exactly what I did.
general.author: gordon ramsay

general.quote: You don’t come into cooking to get rich.
general.author: gordon ramsay

general.quote: I’m just someone who likes cooking and for whom sharing food is a form of expression.
general.author: maya angelou

general.quote: A medium Vodka dry Martini–with a slice of lemon peel. Shaken and not stirred.
general.author: ian fleming

general.quote: A man ought not never to get drunk above the neck.
general.author: author unknown

general.quote: A man can hide all things, excepting twain– That he is drunk, and that he is in love.
general.author: antiphanes of macedonia

general.quote: A good writer is not necessarily a good book critic. No more so than a good drunk is automatically a good bartender.
general.author: jim bishop

general.quote: Hunger makes a fool of a man.
general.author: h. g. wells

general.quote: Hunger steals the memory.
general.author: louise erdrich

general.quote: The hunger for love is much more difficult to remove than the hunger for bread.
general.author: mother teresa

general.quote: A hungry people listens not to reason, not cares for justice, nor is bent by any prayers.
general.author: seneca

general.quote: Without music life would be a mistake.
general.author: friedrich wilhelm nietzschef

general.quote: Music is well said to be the speech of angels.
general.author: thomas carlyle

general.quote: Music is the wine that fills the cup of silence.
general.author: robert fripp

general.quote: If music be the food of love; play on.
general.author: william shakespeare quotes

general.quote: Music fills the infinite between two souls.
general.author: rabindranath tagore

general.quote: If one hears bad music, it is one’s duty to drown it by one’s conversation.
general.author: oscar wilde quotes

general.quote: Music is moonlight in the gloomy night of life.
general.author: jean paul richter

general.quote: Music is what I breath, what I love to do. It keeps me alive.
general.author: miley cyrus

general.quote: Music is only love looking for words.
general.author: lawrence durrell

general.quote: Music is the wine which inspires one to new generative processes, and I am Bacchus who presses out this glorious wine for mankind and makes them spiritually drunken.
general.author: ludwig van beethoven

general.quote: Only sick music makes money today.
general.author: friedrich nietzsche

general.quote: Without music, life is a journey through a desert.
general.author: pat conroy

general.quote: It is incontestable that music induces in us a sense of the infinite and the contemplation of the invisible.
general.author: victor de laprade

general.quote: The music in my heart I bore, Long after it was heard no more.
general.author: william wordsworth

general.quote: Music is the harmonious voice of creation; an echo of the invisible world.
general.author: giuseppe mazzini

general.quote: Music does bring people together. It allows us to experience the same emotions. People everywhere are the same in heart and spirit.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: No music is so pleasant to my ears as that word father.
general.author: lydia m. child

general.quote: Music is the art of thinking with sounds.
general.author: jules combarieu

general.quote: Music is the medicine of the breaking heart.
general.author: leigh hunt

general.quote: Good music is very close to primitive language.
general.author: denis diderot

general.quote: It is easier to understand a nation by listening to its music than by learning its language.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: Music is enough for a lifetime, but a lifetime is not enough for music.
general.author: sergei rachmaninov

general.quote: Music, the greatest good that mortals know, And all of heaven we have below.
general.author: joseph addison quotes

general.quote: Life is one grand, sweet song, so start the music.
general.author: ronald reagan quotes

general.quote: To stop the flow of music would be like the stopping of time itself, incredible and inconceivable.
general.author: aaron copeland

general.quote: Music is the mediator between the spiritual and the sensual life.
general.author: ludwig van beethoven

general.quote: Music is the art which is most nigh to tears and memory.
general.author: oscar wilde

general.quote: Music is a beautiful opiate, if you don’t take it too seriously.
general.author: henry miller

general.quote: Modern music is as dangerous as cocaine.
general.author: pietro mascagni

general.quote: Music, once admitted to the soul, becomes a sort of spirit, and never dies.
general.author: edward george bulwer-lytton

general.quote: Music is the cup which holds the wine of silence.
general.author: robert fripp

general.quote: Of all noises, I think music is the least disagreeable.
general.author: samuel johnson

general.quote: Music is my first love.
general.author: mandy moore

general.quote: True music must repeat the thought and inspirations of the people and the time.
general.author: george gershwin

general.quote: Life can’t be all bad when for ten dollars you can buy all the Beethoven sonatas and listen to them for ten years.
general.author: william f. buckley, jr.

general.quote: Music is the only language in which you cannot say a mean or sarcastic thing.
general.author: john erskine

general.quote: Next to theology I give music the highest place of honor.
general.author: martin luther

general.quote: Music and woman I cannot but give way to, whatever my business is.
general.author: samuel pepys

general.quote: If the King loves music, it is well with the land.
general.author: mencius

general.quote: In music the passions enjoy themselves.
general.author: nietzsche

general.quote: When words leave off, music begins.
general.author: heinrich heine

general.quote: Music washes away from the soul the dust of everyday life.
general.author: berthold auerbach

general.quote: Music produces a kind of pleasure which human nature cannot do without.
general.author: confucius quotes

general.quote: Music is an outburst of the soul.
general.author: frederick delius

general.quote: All good music resembles something. Good music stirs by its mysterious resemblance to the objects and feelings which motivated it.
general.author: jean cocteau

general.quote: Music is the shorthand of emotion.
general.author: leo tolstoy

general.quote: Take a music bath once or twice a week for a few seasons. You will find it is to the soul what a water bath is to the body.
general.author: oliver wendell holmes

general.quote: Love cannot express the idea of music, while music may give an idea of love.
general.author: louis-hector berlioz

general.quote: All the sounds of the earth are like music.
general.author: oscar hammerstein ii

general.quote: Music is nothing but unconscious arithmetic.
general.author: gottfried wilhelm leibniz

general.quote: Music is what life sounds like.
general.author: eric olson

general.quote: Music is the pleasure the human mind experiences from counting without being aware that it is counting.
general.author: gottfried leibniz

general.quote: Extraordinary how potent cheap music is.
general.author: noel coward

general.quote: Music is forever; music should grow and mature with you, following you right on up until you die.
general.author: paul simon

general.quote: There is nothing in the world so much like prayer as music is.
general.author: william p. merrill

general.quote: Music is the universal language of mankind.
general.author: henry wadsworth longfellow

general.quote: Music is spiritual. The music business is not.
general.author: van morrison

general.quote: Music is the refuge of souls ulcerated by happiness.
general.author: e. m. cioran

general.quote: What passion cannot music raise and quell!
general.author: john dryden

general.quote: Music is the poetry of the air.
general.author: richter

general.quote: Without music to decorate it, time is just a bunch of boring production deadlines or dates by which bills must be paid.
general.author: frank zappa

general.quote: Music is God’s gift to man, the only art of Heaven given to earth, the only art of earth we take to Heaven.
general.author: walter savage landor

general.quote: Where words fail, music speaks.
general.author: hans christian andersen

general.quote: If in the after life there is not music, we will have to import it.
general.author: doménico cieri estrada

general.quote: Music should never be harmless.
general.author: robbie robertson

general.quote: Music and rhythm find their way into the secret places of the soul.
general.author: plato

general.quote: Most people live and die with their music still unplayed. They never dare to try.
general.author: mary kay ash

general.quote: If you look deep enough you will see music; the heart of nature being everywhere music.
general.author: thomas carlyle

general.quote: Music is the color of sound.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: He who hears music, feels his solitude peopled at once.
general.author: robert browning

general.quote: Too many pieces of music finish too long after the end.
general.author: igor stravinsky

general.quote: Music is love in search of a word.
general.author: sidney lanier

general.quote: You are the music while the music lasts.
general.author: t.s. eliot

general.quote: The trouble with music appreciation in general is that people are taught to have too much respect for music; they should be taught to love it instead.
general.author: igor stravinsky

general.quote: Music is the fourth great material want, first food, then clothes, then shelter, then music.
general.author: john christian bovee

general.quote: Music cleanses the understanding; inspires it, and lifts it into a realm which it would not reach if it were left to itself.
general.author: henry ward beecher

general.quote: Words make you think a thought. Music makes you feel a feeling. A song makes you feel a thought.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: Music is the only sensual pleasure without vice.
general.author: samuel johnson

general.quote: Great music is that which penetrates the ear with facility and leaves the memory with difficulty. Magical music never leaves the memory.
general.author: sir thomas beecham

general.quote: My idea is that there is music in the air, music all around us; the world is full of it, and you simply take as much as you require.
general.author: edward elgar

general.quote: Music of all the arts has the most influence on the passions and the legislator should give it the greatest encouragement.
general.author: napoleon bonaparte quotes

general.quote: The effects of good music are not just because it’s new; on the contrary music strikes us more the more familiar we are with it.
general.author: johann wolfgang von goethe  quotes

general.quote: Were it not for music, we might in these days say, the Beautiful is dead.
general.author: benjamin disraeli

general.quote: Life without music would be a mistake.
general.author: friedrich nietzsche

general.quote: Music can name the unnamable and communicate the unknowable.
general.author: james duffecy

general.quote: Music is the literature of the heart; it commences where speech ends.
general.author: alphonse de lamartine

general.quote: When people hear good music, it makes them homesick for something they never had, and never will have.
general.author: edgar watson howe

general.quote: Music is a readily available, highly effective tool that you use to improve both your cognitive and physical abilities.
general.author: arthur winter

general.quote: The music of life is in danger of being lost in the music of the voice.
general.author: mahatma gandhi quotes

general.quote: The joy of music should never be interrupted by a commercial.
general.author: leonard bernstein

general.quote: Music is the brandy of the damned.
general.author: george bernard shaw quotes

general.quote: Nothing separates the generations more than music. By the time a child is eight or nine, he has developed a passion for his own music that is even stronger than his passions for procrastination and weird clothes.
general.author: bill cosby

general.quote: Music is the soul of language.
general.author: max heindel

general.quote: If I were to begin life again, I would devote it to music. It is the only cheap and unpunished rapture upon earth.
general.author: sydney smith

general.quote: Music is what feelings sound like.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: Life exists for the love of music or beautiful things.
general.author: gilbert k. chesterton

general.quote: Life is like music; it must be composed by ear, feeling, and instinct, not by rule.
general.author: samuel butler

general.quote: Life is a song. Love is the music.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: Music is your own experience, your thoughts, your wisdom. If you don’t live it, it won’t come out of your horn.
general.author: charlie parker

general.quote: Music is a higher revelation than philosophy.
general.author: ludwig van beethoven

general.quote: Oh, the brave Music of a distant drum!
general.author: omar khayyam

general.quote: Music begins to atrophy when it departs too far from the dance… poetry begins to atrophy when it gets too far from music.
general.author: ezra pound

general.quote: Music expresses feeling and thought, without language; it was below and before speech, and it is above and beyond all words.
general.author: robert g. ingersoll

general.quote: Music melts all the separate parts of our bodies together.
general.author: anaïs nin

general.quote: Nothing is capable of being well set to music that is not nonsense.
general.author: joseph addison quotes

general.quote: There are three things I have loved but never understood. Art, music and women.
general.author: bernard le bovier fontenelle

general.quote: Men profess to be lovers of music, but for the most part they give no evidence in their opinions and lives that they have heard it.
general.author: henry david thoreau

general.quote: Music was my refuge. I could crawl into the space between the notes and curl my back to loneliness.
general.author: maya angelou

general.quote: Music and silence combine strongly because music is done with silence, and silence is full of music.
general.author: marcel marceau

general.quote: Music is the key to the female heart.
general.author: johann g. seume

general.quote: Music has been my playmate, my lover, and my crying towel.
general.author: buffy sainte-marie

general.quote: The English may not like music, but they absolutely love the noise it makes.
general.author: sir thomas beecham

general.quote: Music expresses that which can not be said and on which it is impossible to be silent.
general.author: victor hugo

general.quote: If classical music is the state of the art, then the arts are in a sad state.
general.author: frank zappa

general.quote: Music is a friend of labor for it lightens the task by refreshing the nerves and spirit of the worker.
general.author: william green

general.quote: Music causes us to think eloquently.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson

general.quote: Music when healthy, is the teacher of perfect order, and when depraved, the teacher of perfect disorder.
general.author: john ruskin

general.quote: Music’s the medicine of the mind.
general.author: john a. logan

general.quote: Music should strike fire from the heart of man, and bring tears form the eyes of woman.
general.author: ludwig van beethoven

general.quote: Music is the effort we make to explain to ourselves how our brains work. We listen to Bach transfixed because this is listening to a human mind.
general.author: lewis thomas

general.quote: Music was invented to confirm human loneliness.
general.author: lawrence durrell

general.quote: The greatest advantage I know of being thought a wit by the world is that it gives one the greater freedom of playing the fool.
general.author: alexander pope

general.quote: Avoid witticisms at the expense of others.
general.author: horace mann

general.quote: Great wits, like great beauties, look upon mere esteem as a flat insipid thing; nothing less than admiration will content them.
general.author: jeremiah seed

general.quote: The mere wit is only a human bauble. He is to life what bells are to horses–not expected to draw the load, but only to jingle while the horses draw.
general.author: henry ward beecher

general.quote: Digression is the soul of wit. Take the philosophic asides away from Dante, Milton or Hamlet’s father’s ghost and what stays is dry bones.
general.author: ray bradbury

general.quote: Some people seem born with a head in which the thin partition that divides great wit from folly is wanting.
general.author: robert southey

general.quote: He who has provoked the shaft of wit, cannot complain that he smarts from it.
general.author: samuel johnson

general.quote: It is inconceivable how much wit it requires to avoid being ridiculous.
general.author: sebastien roch nicolas chamfort

general.quote: Brevity is the soul of wit.
general.author: william shakespeare

general.quote: Every witticism is an inexact thought; that which is perfectly true is imperfectly witty.
general.author: walter savage landor

general.quote: Wit is of the true Pierian spring, that can make anything of anything.
general.author: george chapman

general.quote: Wit appreciates wit.
general.author: coelius

general.quote: He who doesn’t lose his wits over certain things has no wits to lose.
general.author: gotthold lessing

general.quote: For when the wine is in, the wit is out.
general.author: thomas becon

general.quote: Look, he’s winding up the watch of his wit; by and by it will strike.
general.author: william shakespeare

general.quote: The banalities of a great man pass for wit.
general.author: alexander chase

general.quote: The well of true wit is truth itself.
general.author: george meredith

general.quote: A witty woman is a treasure; a witty beauty is a power.
general.author: george meredith

general.quote: The monuments of wit survive the monuments of power.
general.author: francis bacon

general.quote: When the drink is in the wit is out.
general.author: sonia sims

general.quote: Less judgment than wit, is more sail than ballast.
general.author: william penn

general.quote: She had a pretty gift for quotation, which is a serviceable substitute for wit.
general.author: w. somerset maugham

general.quote: Truth, when witty, is the wittiest of all things.
general.author: julius charles hare

general.quote: There are many witty men whose brains can’t fill their bellies.
general.author: american

general.quote: Wit is a form of force that leaves the limbs at rest.
general.author: george eliot

general.quote: Anger makes dull men witty — but it keeps them poor.
general.author: francis bacon

general.quote: The distrust of wit is the beginning of tyranny.
general.author: edward abbey

general.quote: Wit is the most rascally, contemptible, beggarly thing on the face of the earth.
general.author: colley cibber

general.quote: Wit is the lightning of the mind.
general.author: c. t. kaeuffer

general.quote: Surprise is so essential an ingredient of wit that no wit will bear repetition.
general.author: sydney smith

general.quote: Wit is not fed, but sharpened with applause; For wealth is solid food, and wit but hungry sauce.
general.author: john dryden

general.quote: Wit in conversation is only a readiness of thought and a facility of expression, or (in the midwives’ phrase) a quick conception, and an easy delivery.
general.author: alexander pope

general.quote: There’s a hell of a distance between wisecracking and wit. Wit has truth in it; wisecracking is simply calisthenics with words.
general.author: dorothy parker

general.quote: Too much wit makes the world rotten.
general.author: alfred, lord tennyson

general.quote: Wit spares no one.
general.author: jerome ustariz

general.quote: Wit is an unruly engine, wildly striking sometimes a friend, sometimes the engineer.
general.author: george herbert

general.quote: To be comic is merely to be playful, but wit is a serious matter. To laugh at it is to confess that you do not understand.
general.author: ambrose bierce

general.quote: Wit, like poetry, is insusceptible of being constructed upon rules founded merely in reason. Like faith, it exists independent of reason, and sometimes in hostility to it.
general.author: christian nestell bovee

general.quote: A witty saying proves nothing.
general.author: voltaire

general.quote: Wit is well-bred insolence.
general.author: aristotle

general.quote: A thing well said will be wit in all languages.
general.author: john dryden

general.quote: Real wit is shown in language. We need language.
general.author: maya angelou

general.quote: Be pretty if you can, be witty if you must, but be gracious if it kills you.
general.author: elsie de wolfe

general.quote: Some wits, too, like oracles, deal in ambiguities, but not with equal success; for though ambiguities are the first excellence of an imposter, they are the last of a wit.
general.author: edward young

general.quote: Wit is the only wall between us and the dark.
general.author: mark van doren

general.quote: Where judgment has wit to express it, there’s the best orator.
general.author: william penn

general.quote: Wit is educated insolence.
general.author: aristotle

general.quote: Wit beyond measure is man’s greatest treasure.
general.author: j. k. rowling

general.quote: Those who object to wit are envious of it.
general.author: william hazlitt

general.quote: Don’t put too fine a point to your wit for fear it should get blunted.
general.author: miguel de cervantes

general.quote: He seemeth to be most ignorant that trusteth most to his wit.
general.author: plato

general.quote: Wit is the sudden marriage of ideas which, before their union, were not perceived to have any relation.
general.author: mark twain

general.quote: There was a monstrous deal of stupid quizzing and common-place nonsense talked, but scarcely any wit.
general.author: jane austen

general.quote: I think humor is warmer, and wit is colder. Wit is judgment, whereas humor invites some sort of response.
general.author: fran lebowitz

general.quote: A wise man will live as much within his wit as within his income.
general.author: philip dormer stanhope chesterfield

general.quote: A clever wit is always timeless.
general.author: kate wingfield

general.quote: Humor is consistent with pathos, whilst wit is not.
general.author: samuel taylor coleridge

general.quote: Reader, if you are gifted with nerves like mine, aspire to any character but that of a wit.
general.author: charles lamb

general.quote: Wit catches of wit, as fire of fire.
general.author: fulke greville

general.quote: Wit can render instant aid or lasting harm.
general.author: lewis f. korns

general.quote: Witticism. A sharp and clever remark, usually quoted and seldom noted; what the Philistine is pleased to call a "joke.
general.author: ambrose bierce

general.quote: He’s winding up the watch of his wit. By and by it will strike.
general.author: william shakespeare

general.quote: It is easier to be a lover than a husband for the simple reason that it is more difficult to be witty every day than to say pretty things from time to time.
general.author: honore de balzac

general.quote: True wit is nature to advantage dressed, what oft was thought, but never so well expressed.
general.author: alexander pope

general.quote: Melancholy men are of all others the most witty.
general.author: aristotle

general.quote: Wit, after all, is a mighty tart, pungent ingredient, and much too acid for some stomachs; but honest good humor is the oil and wine of a merry meeting.
general.author: washington irving

general.quote: Wit is something more than a gymnastic trick of the intellect; true wit implies a beam of thought into the essence of a question, a flash that lights up a situation. Wit suggests the delicate but delightful play of a rapier in the hands of a master.
general.author: arthur lynch

general.quote: I don’t like jokes in speeches; I do like wit and humor. A joke is to humor what pornography is to erotic language in a good novel.
general.author: james humes

general.quote: The wittiest man is one who says a good thing, and appears not to know it.
general.author: john van buren

general.quote: If you want to be witty, work on your character and say what you think on every occasion.
general.author: marie-henri beyle stendhal

general.quote: There’s no possibility of being witty without a little ill-nature — the malice of a good thing is the barb that makes it stick.
general.author: richard brinsley sheridan

general.quote: Wit is the epitaph of an emotion.
general.author: friedrich nietzsche

general.quote: He must be a dull Fellow indeed, whom neither Love, Malice, nor Necessity, can inspire with Wit.
general.author: jean de la bruyère

general.quote: Wit lies in recognizing the resemblance among things which differ and the difference between things which are alike.
general.author: anne germain de stael

general.quote: One cannot be always laughing at a man without now and then stumbling on something witty.
general.author: jane austen

general.quote: Next to being witty yourself, the best thing is being able to quote another’s wit.
general.author: john christian bovee

general.quote: Wit is the Fruitful Womb where Thoughts conceive.
general.author: daniel defoe

general.quote: Ev’n wit’s a burthen, when it talks too long.
general.author: john dryden

general.quote: Wit malignantly employed is like a crackling fire that with every fresh blaze sends out sparks. Take care that you are not burnt.
general.author: john thornton

general.quote: Many would live by their Wits, but break for want of Stock.
general.author: benjamin franklin

general.quote: Wit is a weapon. Jokes are a masculine way of inflicting superiority. But humor is the pursuit of a gentle grin, usually in solitude.
general.author: frank muir

general.quote: For we seldom admire the wit, when we dislike the man.
general.author: jeremiah seed

general.quote: To be witty is not enough. One must possess sufficient wit to avoid having too much of it.
general.author: andre maurois

general.quote: Antithesis may be the blossom of wit, but it will never arrive at maturity unless sound sense be the trunk and truth the root.
general.author: charles caleb colton

general.quote: A man cannot please long who has only one kind of wit.
general.author: françois de la rochefoucauld

general.quote: Humor wades across a brook, wit jumps over it.
general.author: austin o’malley

general.quote: Wit is a sword; it is meant to make people feel the point as well as see it.
general.author: g. k. chesterton

general.quote: It is foolish to lay out money in the purchase of repentance.
general.author: benjamin franklin

general.quote: True repentance also involves reform.
general.author: hosea ballou

general.quote: The strongest proof of repentance is the endeavor to atone.
general.author: mary elizabeth braddon

general.quote: Repentance is the debt one owes to virtue.
general.author: edward counsel

general.quote: What is past is past, there is a future left to all men, who have the virtue to repent and the energy to atone.
general.author: edward g. bulwer-lytton

general.quote: Sins may be forgiven through repentance, but no act of wit will ever justify them.
general.author: thomas sherlock

general.quote: True repentance is to cease from sin.
general.author: saint ambrose

general.quote: Of all acts of man repentance is the most divine. The greatest of all faults is to be conscious of none.
general.author: thomas carlyle

general.quote: Repentance is a goddess and the preserver of those who have erred.
general.author: flavius claudius julianus

general.quote: It is good for a man to repent of his sins; but better for him had he never sinned.
general.author: william scott downey

general.quote: People don’t do what they believe in, they just do what’s most convenient, then they repent.
general.author: bob dylan

general.quote: Repentance is a magistrate that exacts the strictest duty and humility.
general.author: lord clarendon,

general.quote: Our repentance is not so much regret for the ill we have done as fear of the ill that may happen to us in consequence.
general.author: francois de la rochefoucauld

general.quote: He that hath promised pardon on our repentance hath not promised life till we repent.
general.author: francis quarles

general.quote: Take care not to begin anything of which you may repent.
general.author: publilius syrus

general.quote: Repentance is the turning of the soul from the way of midnight to the point of the coming sun.
general.author: henry ward beecher

general.quote: Repentance must be something more than mere remorse for sins: it comprehends a change of nature befitting heaven.
general.author: lewis wallace

general.quote: God never repents of what He has first resolved upon.
general.author: seneca

general.quote: Let not neither the tears of natural tenderness, nor the sudden terrors of conscious guilt, be mistaken for genuine repentance.
general.author: john thornton

general.quote: The seeds of repentance are sown in youth by pleasure, but the harvest is reaped in age by pain.
general.author: charles caleb colton

general.quote: Repentance is accepted remorse.
general.author: anne sophie swetchine

general.quote: A guilty mind can be eased by nothing but repentance; by which what was ill done is revoked and morally voided and undone.
general.author: benjamin whichcote

general.quote: Remorse sleeps during prosperity but awakes bitter consciousness during adversity.
general.author: jean jacques rousseau

general.quote: Repentance may be old fashioned, but it is not outdated so long as there is sin.
general.author: j. c. macaulay

general.quote: True repentance has a double aspect; it looks upon things past with a weeping eye, and upon the future with a watchful eye.
general.author: bishop robert south

general.quote: Repentance is but want of power to sin.
general.author: john dryden

general.quote: Repentance, without amendment, is like continually pumping without mending the leak.
general.author: lewis w. dilwyn

general.quote: What is past is past. There is a future left to all men, who have the virtue to repent and the energy to atone.
general.author: edward george earle lytton bulwer-lytton

general.quote: Remorse is impotence; it will sin again. Only repentance is strong — it can end everything.
general.author: henry miller

general.quote: It is foolish to lay out money for the purchase of repentance.
general.author: benjamin franklin

general.quote: When we have heartily repented of a wrong, we should let all the waves of forgetfulness roll over it, and go forward unburdened to meet the future.
general.author: henry ward beecher

general.quote: Late repentance is seldom true, but true repentance is never too late.
general.author: ralph venning

general.quote: Our hearts must not only be broken with sorrow, but be broken from sin, to constitute repentance.
general.author: – orville dewey

general.quote: Repentance is nothing but mockery when it comes too late.
general.author: edward counsel

general.quote: Repentance is heart’s sorrow, and a clear life ensuing.
general.author: william shakespeare

general.quote: Well, I’ll repent, and that suddenly, while I am in some liking. I shall be out of heart shortly, and then I shall have no strength to repent.
general.author: william shakespeare,

general.quote: People do not mind their faults being spread out before them, but they become impatient if called on to give them up.
general.author: johann wolfgang von goethe

general.quote: He that does not repent, sins again.
general.author: benjamin whichcote

general.quote: True repentance is to cease from sinning.
general.author: ambrose of milan

general.quote: It is a great deal easier to commit a second sin, than it was to commit the first; and a great deal harder to repent of a second, than it was to repent of the first.
general.author: benjamin whichcote

general.quote: He who is sorry for having sinned is almost innocent.
general.author: seneca

general.quote: He who seeks repentance for the past, should woo the angel virtue for the future.
general.author: edward george earle lytton bulwer-lytton

general.quote: Repentance hath a purifying power, and every tear is of a cleansing virtue; but these penitential clouds must be still kept dropping: one shower will not suffice; for repentance is not one single action, but a course.
general.author: bishop robert south

general.quote: True repentance has a double aspect. It looks upon things past with a weeping eye, and upon the future with a watchful eye.
general.author: robert smith

general.quote: Remorse is the poison of life, and repentence its cure.
general.author: eliza cook

general.quote: How much easier it is to be generous than just! Men are sometimes bountiful who are not honest.
general.author: junius

general.quote: Generosity wins favour for every one, especially when it is accompanied by modesty.
general.author: johann wolfgang von goethe quotes

general.quote: Generosity during life is a very different thing from generosity in the hour of death; one proceeds from genuine liberality and benevolence, the other from pride or fear.
general.author: horace mann

general.quote: It’s hard to outdo the Lord in generosity.
general.author: jerold panas

general.quote: All my experience of the world teaches me that in ninety-nine cases out of a hundred, the safe and just side of a question is the generous and merciful side.
general.author: anna jameson

general.quote: There is a greatness in being generous, and there is only simple justice in satisfying creditors. Generosity is the part of the soul raised above the vulgar.
general.author: oliver goldsmith

general.quote: Be kind, generous and loving in your thoughts, words and actions.
general.author: ann sykes walter

general.quote: When you give, take to yourself no credit for generosity, unless you deny yourself something in order that you may give.
general.author: sir henry taylor

general.quote: How much easier is it to be generous than just.
general.author: junius

general.quote: Generosity is a principle — not an amount.
general.author: millie thornton

general.quote: Generosity is the accompaniment of high birth; pity and gratitude are its attendants.
general.author: pierre corneille

general.quote: If you’re a generous person you’ll have no trouble admitting that somebody else is good. If you’re a better person you’ll find its total impossibility.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: Generosity is not in giving me that which I need more than you do, but it is in giving me that which you need more than I do.
general.author: kahlil gibran quotes

general.quote: Each of you who has been the recipient of somebody’s generosity should try to remember that in your life, and preferably while you are living, do something about that.
general.author: terry bennett

general.quote: One of the finest virtues is generosity — a quality characteristic of the person who thinks more highly of others than he does of himself.
general.author: malcolm d. maxwell

general.quote: Be generous, and you will be prosperous. Help others, and you will be helped.
general.author: bible

general.quote: What seems to be generosity is often no more than disguised ambition, which overlooks a small interest in order to secure a great one.
general.author: francois de la rochefoucauld

general.quote: True generosity does not consist in obeying every impulse of humanity… so as to render us incapable of future ones.
general.author: oliver goldsmith

general.quote: A generous action is its own reward.
general.author: william t. walsh

general.quote: Generosity is more charitable than wealth.
general.author: joseph roux

general.quote: Generosity is not merely a trait that pleases God; it is a practice which releases us from bondage to the ego, and also to things.
general.author: albert e. day

general.quote: Watch lest prosperity destroy generosity.
general.author: henry ward beecher

general.quote: Generosity lies less in giving much than in giving at the right moment.
general.author: jean de la bruyere

general.quote: Be generous, good and just, when anything is to be gained by virtue.
general.author: billy boy franklin

general.quote: Generosity is giving more than you can, and pride is taking less than you need.
general.author: kahlil gibran

general.quote: The record of a generous life runs like a vine around the memory of our dead, and every sweet unselfish act is now a perfumed flower.
general.author: robert green ingersoll

general.quote: Real generosity toward the future lies in giving all to the present.
general.author: albert camus

general.quote: Generosity is good deeds that are done quietly, inconspicuously and are immediately forgotten.
general.author: dave grant

general.quote: Don’t let those who take advantage of your generosity stop you from being generous.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: Almost always the most indigent are the most generous.
general.author: leszczynski stanislaus

general.quote: The test of generosity is not how much you give, but how much you have left.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: If we should deal out justice only, in this world, who would escape? No, it is better to be generous, and in the end more profitable, for it gains gratitude for us, and love.
general.author: mark twain quotes

general.quote: All my experience of the world teaches me that in ninety-nine cases out of a hundred the safe side and the just side of a question is the generous side and the merciful side.
general.author: mrs. anna brownell jameson

general.quote: Never suppress a generous impulse.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: How delightful is the company of generous people, who overlook trifles and keep their minds instinctively fixed on whatever is good and positive in the world about them.
general.author: van wyck brooks

general.quote: Sometimes we don’t give generously because we don’t see the generous Giver to whom it all belongs anyway!
general.author: kent r. hunter

general.quote: We’d all like a reputation for generosity, and we’d all like to buy it cheap.
general.author: mignon mclaughlin

general.quote: As a rule, only the poor are generous. Rich people can always find excellent reasons for not handing over twenty thousand francs to a relative.
general.author: honore de balzac

general.quote: Generosity is only benevolence in practice.
general.author: bishop thomas ken

general.quote: The truly generous is the truly wise; And he who loves not others, lives unblest.
general.author: quintus horatius flaccus

general.quote: It is good to be unselfish and generous; but don’t carry that too far. It will not do to give yourself to be melted down for the benefit of the tallow-trade; you must know where to find yourself.
general.author: george eliot

general.quote: The generous who is always just, and the just who is always generous, may, unannounced, approach the throne of heaven.
general.author: john caspar lavater

general.quote: Be just before you are generous.
general.author: richard brinsley sheridan

general.quote: The poor don’t know that their function in life is to exercise our generosity.
general.author: jean-paul sartre quotes

general.quote: A man is sometimes more generous when he has but a little money than when he has plenty, perhaps through fear of being thought to have but little.
general.author: benjamin franklin quotes

general.quote: Generosity with strings is not generosity: it is a deal.
general.author: marya mannes

general.quote: Generosity, to be perfect, should always be accompanied by dash of humor.
general.author: marie von ebner-eschenbach

general.quote: The greatest good you can do for another is not just to share your riches but to reveal to him his own.
general.author: benjamin disraeli quotes

general.quote: Real generosity is doing something nice for someone who will never find out.
general.author: frank a. clark

general.quote: Generous deeds would be repeated oftener if more gratitude had been shown for the first ones.
general.author: william feather

general.quote: Generosity should never exceed ability.
general.author: marcus t. cicero

general.quote: It is not in everyone’s power to secure wealth, office, or honors; but everyone may be good, generous, and wise.
general.author: luc de clapiers de vauvenargues

general.quote: Generosity is something we learn, from our parents, schools and community.
general.author: h. ross perot

general.quote: Let them do good, and be rich in well-doing. Be ready to give generously and share with others.
general.author: bible

general.quote: Our generosity never should exceed our abilities.
general.author: marcus tullius cicero

general.quote: A generous man places the benefits he confers beneath his feet; those he receives, nearest his heart.
general.author: lord greville

general.quote: Many people are capable of doing a wise thing, more a cunning thing, but very few a generous thing.
general.author: alexander pope

general.quote: I take as my guide the hope of a saint: in crucial things, unity… in important things, diversity… in all things, generosity.
general.author: george h. bush

general.quote: There is not another country in the world that can come close to matching the generosity of Americans. And each year we give more.
general.author: jerold panas

general.quote: It is always so pleasant to be generous, though very vexatious to pay debts.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson quotes

general.quote: Generosity, when once set going, knows not how to stop; as the more familiar we are with the lovely form, the more enamored we become of her charms.
general.author: pliny the younger

general.quote: Lavishness is not generosity.
general.author: thomas fuller

general.quote: Too many have dispensed with generosity to practice charity.
general.author: albert camus quotes

general.quote: Good will comes to him who is generous and lends freely, who conducts his affairs with justice.
general.author: bible

general.quote: People who think they’re generous to a fault usually think that’s their only fault.
general.author: sidney j. harris

general.quote: Sir, he throws away his money without thought and without merit. I do not call a tree generous that sheds its fruit at every breeze.
general.author: samuel johnson

general.quote: One can love any man that is generous.
general.author: james henry leigh hunt

general.quote: He who gives what he would as readily throw away gives without generosity; for the essence of generosity is in self-sacrifice.
general.author: sir henry taylor

general.quote: True generosity is a duty as indispensably necessary as those imposed upon us by the law. It is a rule imposed upon us by reason, which should be the sovereign law of a rational being.
general.author: oliver goldsmith

general.quote: It needs as much generosity to take as to give.
general.author: ivan panin

general.quote: How seldom is generosity perfect and pure! How often do men give because it throws a certain inferiority on those who receive, and superiority on themselves!
general.author: fulke greville

general.quote: There were in him candor and generosity, which, unless tempered by due moderation, lead to ruin.
general.author: caius cornelius tacitus

general.quote: If a man be endowed with a generous mind, this is the best kind of nobility.
general.author: plato

general.quote: You will be made rich in every way so that you can be generous on every occasion, and through us your generosity will result in thanksgiving to God.
general.author: bible

general.quote: Generosity, wrong placed, becometh a vice; a princely mind will undo a private family.
general.author: thomas fuller

general.quote: Never measure your generosity by what you give, but rather by what you have left.
general.author: fulton john sheen

general.quote: Kindness and generosity … form the true morality of human actions.
general.author: anne germain de stael

general.quote: Be a rainbow in someone else’s cloud.
general.author: maya angelou

general.quote: What is called generosity is usually only the vanity of giving; we enjoy the vanity more than the thing given.
general.author: francois de la rochefoucauld

general.quote: To generous souls every task is noble.
general.author: euripides

general.quote: Wherever I find a great deal of gratitude in a poor man, I take it for granted there would be as much generosity if he were a rich man.
general.author: alexander pope

general.quote: I can remember way back when a liberal was one who was generous with his own money.
general.author: will rogers

general.quote: A man who suddenly becomes generous may please fools, but he will not deceive the wise.
general.author: phaedrus

general.quote: One of the sanest, surest, and most generous joys of life comes from being happy over the good fortune of others.
general.author: archibald rutledge

general.quote: The best practical advice I can give to the present generation is to practice the virtue which the Christians call love.
general.author: bertrand russell

general.quote: To be generous, guiltless, and of a free disposition is to take those things for bird-bolts that you deem cannon-bullets.
general.author: william shakespeare quotes

general.quote: Generosity is the flower of justice.
general.author: nathaniel hawthorne

general.quote: There is no loneliness greater than the loneliness of a failure. The failure is a stranger in his own house.
general.author: eric hoffer

general.quote: The day your horse dies and your money’s gone, your relatives change into strangers.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: What a strange thing man is; and what a stranger thing woman.
general.author: lord byron

general.quote: America, where people do not inquire of a stranger, "What is he?" But "What can he do?
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: Strange to say, the luminous world is the invisible world; the luminous world is that which we do not see. Our eyes of flesh see only night.
general.author: victor hugo

general.quote: Truth is stranger than fiction, but it is because fiction is obliged to stick to possibilities; truth isn’t.
general.author: mark twain

general.quote: There are German songs which can make a stranger to the language cry.
general.author: mark twain

general.quote: Every time a man unburdens his heart to a stranger he reaffirms the love that unites humanity.
general.author: germaine greer

general.quote: It is strange what contempt men have for the joys that are offered them freely.
general.author: george duhamel

general.quote: If a man be gracious and courteous to strangers, it shows he is a citizen of the world.
general.author: francis bacon

general.quote: Don’t borrow money from a neighbor or a friend, but of a stranger where, paying for it you shall hear of it no more.
general.author: lord burleigh

general.quote: Politics doesn’t make strange bedfellows – marriage does.
general.author: groucho marx

general.quote: It is strange to be known so universally and yet to be so lonely.
general.author: albert einstein

general.quote: Honest criticism is hard to take, especially from a relative, a friend, an acquaintance, or a stranger.
general.author: franklin p. jones

general.quote: If two friends ask you to judge a dispute, don’t accept because you will lose one friend; on the other hand, if two strangers come with the same request, accept because you will gain one friend.
general.author: st. augustine

general.quote: The sensitivity of men to small matters, and their indifference to great ones, indicates a strange inversion.
general.author: blaise pascal

general.quote: If you have only one smile in you, give it to the people you love. Don’t be surly at home, then go out in the street and start grinning ‘Good morning’ at total strangers.
general.author: maya angelou

general.quote: I, a stranger and afraid, in a world I never made.
general.author: a. e. housman

general.quote: When one is a stranger to oneself then one is estranged from others too.
general.author: anne morrow lindbergh

general.quote: We have a strange and wonderful relationship – he’s strange and I’m wonderful.
general.author: mike ditka

general.quote: How strange this fear of death is! We are never frightened at a sunset.
general.author: george macdonald

general.quote: Nothing, perhaps, is strange, once you have accepted life itself, the great strange business which includes all lesser strangeness.
general.author: rose macaulay

general.quote: It is a strange desire, to seek power, and to lose liberty; or to seek power over others, and to lose power over a man’s self.
general.author: francis bacon

general.quote: There are certain queer times and occasions in this strange mixed affair we call life when a man takes his whole universe for a vast practical joke.
general.author: herman melville

general.quote: Men always talk about the most important things to perfect strangers. In the perfect stranger we perceive man himself; the image of a God is not disguised by resemblances to an uncle or doubts of wisdom of a mustache.
general.author: gilbert k. chesterton

general.quote: It is the strange fate of man, that even in the greatest of evils the fear of the worst continues to haunt him.
general.author: goethe

general.quote: They do certainly give very strange, and newfangled, names to diseases.
general.author: plato

general.quote: Strangers are just friends I haven’t met yet.
general.author: will rogers

general.quote: There is no excellent beauty that hath not some strangeness in the proportion.
general.author: francis bacon

general.quote: Anyone who knows a strange fact shares in its singularity.
general.author: jean genet

general.quote: I work in a strange business, and trust is a word that’s not even in the vocabulary.
general.author: kim basinger

general.quote: He whom God has touched will always be a being apart: he is, whatever he may do, a stranger among men; he is marked by a sign.
general.author: ernest renan

general.quote: The only living life is in the past and future — the present is an interlude — strange interlude in which we call on past and future to bear witness that we are living.
general.author: eugene o’neill

general.quote: Strange as it may seem, no amount of learning can cure stupidity, and formal education positively fortifies it.
general.author: stephen vizinczey

general.quote: What a strange vanity painting is; it attracts admiration by resembling the original, we do not admire.
general.author: blaise pascal

general.quote: Where a blood relation sobs, an intimate friend should choke up, a distant acquaintance should sigh, a stranger should merely fumble sympathetically with his handkerchief.
general.author: mark twain

general.quote: Congress is so strange. A man gets up to speak and says nothing. Nobody listens, then everybody disagrees.
general.author: boris marshalov

general.quote: If it weren’t for marriage, men and women would have to fight with total strangers.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: I have always depended on the kindness of strangers.
general.author: tennessee williams

general.quote: I do desire we may be better strangers.
general.author: william shakespeare

general.quote: Misery acquaints a man with strange bedfellows.
general.author: william shakespeare

general.quote: ‘Tis strange what a man may do and a woman yet think him an angel.
general.author: william m. thackeray

general.quote: There are strange flowers of reason to match each error of the senses.
general.author: louis aragon

general.quote: It is disgraceful to live as a stranger in one’s country, and be an alien in any matter that affects our welfare.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: On what strange stuff Ambition feeds!
general.author: eliza cook

general.quote: The more I traveled the more I realized that fear makes strangers of people who should be friends.
general.author: shirley maclaine

general.quote: Is it not strange that desire should so many years outlive performance?
general.author: william shakespeare

general.quote: Never fight fair with a stranger, boy. You’ll never get out of the jungle that way.
general.author: arthur miller

general.quote: Life is strange. Every so often a good man wins.
general.author: frank dane

general.quote: It was his peculiar happiness that he scarcely ever found a stranger whom he did not leave a friend; but it must likewise be added, that he had not often a friend long without obliging him to become a stranger.
general.author: samuel johnson

general.quote: All things must change to something new, to something strange.
general.author: henry wadsworth longfellow

general.quote: We that are true lovers run into strange capers.
general.author: william shakespeare

general.quote: A single event can awaken within us a stranger totally unknown to us.
general.author: antoine de saint-exupery

general.quote: The moment one accosts a stranger or is accosted by him is above all in this life the moment of drama… Whoever we meet watches us intently at the quick, strange moment of meeting, to see whether we are disposed to be friendly.
general.author: haniel long

general.quote: One of the characteristics of the dream is that nothing surprises us in it. With no regret, we agree to live in it with strangers, completely cut off from our habits and friends.
general.author: jean cocteau

general.quote: Truth is always strange, stranger than fiction.
general.author: lord byron

general.quote: It’s all right for a perfect stranger to kiss your hand as long as he’s perfect.
general.author: mae west

general.quote: We cannot possibly let ourselves get frozen into regarding everyone we do not know as an absolute stranger.
general.author: albert schweitzer

general.quote: When strangers start acting like neighbors… communities are reinvigorated.
general.author: ralph nader

general.quote: Education helps one cease being intimidated by strange situations.
general.author: maya angelou

general.quote: Curiosity is not a sin…. But we should exercise caution with our curiosity… yes, indeed.
general.author: j.k. rowling

general.quote: Haste makes work which caution prevents.
general.author: william penn

general.quote: Caution is the eldest child of wisdom.
general.author: victor hugo

general.quote: Idealists foolish enough to throw caution to the winds have advanced mankind and have enriched the world.
general.author: emma goldman

general.quote: Caution, though very often wasted is a good risk to take.
general.author: henry wheeler shaw

general.quote: We must substitute courage for caution.
general.author: martin luther king jr.

general.quote: Precaution is better than cure.
general.author: edward coke

general.quote: Confident because of our caution.
general.author: epictetus

general.quote: You must not allow yourself to be advised, cautioned, influenced, persuaded.
general.author: minnie maddern fiske

general.quote: Beware the hobby that eats.
general.author: benjamin franklin

general.quote: Caution is the path to mediocrity.
general.author: frank herbert

general.quote: Caution is the lower story of prudence.
general.author: thomas carlyle

general.quote: If you wish to succeed in life, make perseverance your bosom friend, experience your wise counselor, caution your elder brother, and hope your guardian genius.
general.author: joseph addison

general.quote: I have learned to use the word impossible with the greatest caution.
general.author: wernher von braun

general.quote: The torment of precautions often exceeds often exceeds the dangers to be avoided. It is sometimes better to abandon one’s self to destiny.
general.author: napoleon bonaparte

general.quote: More firm and sure the hand of courage strikes, when it obeys the watchful eye of caution.
general.author: james thomson

general.quote: The innocence that feels no risk and is taught no caution, is more vulnerable than guilt, and oftener assailed.
general.author: nathaniel parker willis

general.quote: Distrust and caution are the parents of security.
general.author: benjamin franklin

general.quote: The scars of others should teach us caution.
general.author: st. jerome

general.quote: One of the rules of caution is not to be too cautious.
general.author: bahya ibn paquda

general.quote: The chief danger in life is that you may take too many precautions.
general.author: alfred adler

general.quote: It is a good thing to learn caution from the misfortunes of others.
general.author: publilius syrus

general.quote: Caution comes too late when we are in the midst of evils.
general.author: sir walter scott

general.quote: Thoughtless risks are destructive, of course, but perhaps even more wasteful is thoughtless caution which prompts inaction and promotes failure to seize opportunity.
general.author: gary ryan blair

general.quote: Caution is the confidential agent of selfishness.
general.author: woodrow wilson

general.quote: Deliberate with caution, but act with decision; and yield with graciousness or oppose with firmness.
general.author: charles caleb colton

general.quote: Every human being has, like Socrates, an attendant spirit; and wise are they who obey its signals. If it does not always tell us what to do, it always cautions us what not to do.
general.author: lydia m. child

general.quote: Man’s caution often into danger turns, and his guard falling crushes him to death.
general.author: edward young

general.quote: You go for it. All the stops are out. Caution is to the wind, and you’re battling with everything you have. That’s the real fun of the game.
general.author: dan dierdorf

general.quote: I would caution all of us or I would remind all of us that any candidate that we support, they are going to be flawed.
general.author: j. c. watts

general.quote: Choose your friends with caution; plan your future with purpose, and frame your life with faith.
general.author: thomas s. monson

general.quote: There is a courageous wisdom; there is also a false reptile prudence, the result, not of caution, but of fear.
general.author: edmund burke

general.quote: Action makes more fortune than caution.
general.author: charlotte whitton

general.quote: Of all forms of caution, caution in love is perhaps the most fatal to true happiness.
general.author: bertrand russell

general.quote: Scars fade with time. And the ones that never go away, well, they build character, maturity, caution.
general.author: erin mccarthy

general.quote: There is but one thing that can free a man from superstition, and that is belief. All history proves it. The most sceptical have ever been the most credulous.
general.author: george macdonald

general.quote: It is bad luck to be superstitious.
general.author: andrew w. mathis

general.quote: Superstitions are, for the most part, but the shadows of great truths.
general.author: tryon edwards

general.quote: Where the flag of truth waves unfurled, there you will find superstition waiting in ambush.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: They that are against superstition oftentimes run into it of the wrong side. If I wear all colors but black, then I am superstitious in not wearing black.
general.author: john selden

general.quote: Superstition is a quality that seems indigenous to the ocean.
general.author: james fenimore cooper

general.quote: Superstitions are habits rather than beliefs.
general.author: marlene dietrich

general.quote: Superstition is the poesy of practical life; hence, a poet is none the worse for being superstitious.
general.author: johann wolfgang von goethe

general.quote: Superstition is the only religion of which base souls are capable of.
general.author: joseph joubert

general.quote: Superstition is only the fear of belief, while religion is the confidence.
general.author: marguerite gardiner

general.quote: Superstition always inspires littleness, religion grandeur of mind; the superstitious raises beings inferior to himself to deities.
general.author: johann kaspar lavater

general.quote: The master of superstition is the people, and in all superstition wise men follow fools, and arguments are fitted to practice in a reversed order.
general.author: francis bacon

general.quote: The greatest burden in the world is superstition, not only of ceremonies in the church, but of imaginary and scarecrow sins at home.
general.author: john milton

general.quote: A foolish superstition introduces the influences of the gods even in the smallest matters.
general.author: titus livy

general.quote: Let me make the superstitions of a nation and I care not who makes its laws or its songs either.
general.author: mark twain

general.quote: Superstition is but the fear of belief.
general.author: lady marguerite blessington

general.quote: In superstition wise men follow fools.
general.author: francis bacon

general.quote: When superstition is allowed to perform the task of old age in dulling the human temperament, we can say goodbye to all excellence in poetry, in painting, and in music.
general.author: denis diderot

general.quote: Superstition is the religion of feeble minds.
general.author: edmund burke

general.quote: Superstition is the poetry of life. It is inherent in man’s nature; and when we think it is wholly eradicated, it takes refuge in the strangest holes and corners, whence it peeps out all at once, as soon as it can do it with safety.
general.author: johann wolfgang von goethe

general.quote: The worst superstition is to consider our own tolerable.
general.author: doris lessing

general.quote: Religion is not removed by removing superstition.
general.author: cicero

general.quote: Superstition is to religion what astrology is to astronomy; the mad daughter of a wise mother.
general.author: voltaire

general.quote: No one is so thoroughly superstitious as the godless man.
general.author: harriet beecher stowe

general.quote: There is in superstition a senseless fear of God; religion consists in the pious worship of Him.
general.author: cicero

general.quote: Superstition is part of the poetry of life.
general.author: johann wolfgang von goethe

general.quote: Superstition, idolatry, and hypocrisy have ample wages, but truth goes begging.
general.author: martin luther

general.quote: Superstition renders a man a fool, and scepticism makes him mad.
general.author: henry fielding

general.quote: Superstition is an unreasoning fear of God.
general.author: marcus t. cicero

general.quote: Superstition changes a man to a beast, fanaticism makes him a wild beast, and despotism a beast of burden.
general.author: jean francois de la harpe

general.quote: Danger is the very basis of superstition. It produces a searching after help supernaturally when human means are no longer supposed to be available.
general.author: benjamin robert haydon

general.quote: Superstition sets the whole world in flames; philosophy quenches them.
general.author: voltaire

general.quote: Our greatest joy and satisfaction comes from the act of giving.
general.author: leo buscaglia

general.quote: Great issues develop from small beginnings.
general.author: norman vincent peale

general.quote: Whether you find satisfaction in life depends not on your tale of years, but on your will.
general.author: michel eyquem de montaigne

general.quote: Action itself, so long as I am convinced that it is right action, gives me satisfaction.
general.author: jawaharlal nehru
