general.quote: Show me a thoroughly satisfied man and I will show you a failure.
general.author: thomas a. edison

general.quote: Along the way of our service to others and community, we learn that a very large side benefit is an enormous sense of personal satisfaction, personal purpose and personal worth.
general.author: brian o’connell

general.quote: Unless each day can be looked back upon by an individual as one in which he has had some fun, some joy, some real satisfaction, that day is a loss.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: When we have got it, we want something else.
general.author: michel eyquem de montaigne

general.quote: There are some days when I think I’m going to die from an overdose of satisfaction.
general.author: salvador dali

general.quote: That spot of earth has special charms for me, in which a limited income produces happiness, and moderate wealth abundance.
general.author: marcus valerius martial

general.quote: My satisfaction comes from my commitment to advancing a better world.
general.author: faye wattleton.

general.quote: No nation became great by becoming rich. Neither does a man find enduring satisfaction in life by owning something — only by becoming something.
general.author: norman vincent peale

general.quote: Though thy beginning was small, yet thy latter end should greatly increase.
general.author: bible

general.quote: I’d rather be dead than singing "Satisfaction" when I’m forty-five.
general.author: mick jagger

general.quote: True love grows by sacrifice and the more thoroughly the soul rejects natural satisfaction, the stronger and more detached its tenderness becomes.
general.author: st. theresa of lisieux

general.quote: No one but a fool would measure their satisfaction by what the world thinks of it.
general.author: oliver goldsmith

general.quote: He who knows that enough is enough will always have enough.
general.author: lao-tzu

general.quote: Life at court does not satisfy a man, but it keeps him from being satisfied with anything else.
general.author: jean de la bruyere

general.quote: It is of practical value to learn to like yourself. Since you must spend so much time with yourself you might as well get some satisfaction out of the relationship.
general.author: norman vincent peale

general.quote: As long as a woman can look ten years younger than her own daughter, she is perfectly satisfied.
general.author: oscar wilde

general.quote: The amount of satisfaction you get from life depends largely on your own ingenuity, self-sufficiency, and resourcefulness. People who wait around for life to supply their satisfaction usually find boredom instead.
general.author: william c. menninger

general.quote: Satisfaction consists in freedom from pain, which is the positive element of life.
general.author: arthur schopenhauer

general.quote: Satisfaction lies in the effort, not in the attainment, full effort is full victory.
general.author: mahatma gandhi

general.quote: Whoever renders service to many puts himself in line for greatness — great wealth, great return, great satisfaction, great reputation, and great joy.
general.author: jim rohn

general.quote: Personal satisfaction is the most important ingredient of success.
general.author: denis waitley

general.quote: To be able to look back upon one’s past life with satisfaction is to live twice.
general.author: marcus valerius martial

general.quote: It is books that teach us to refine our pleasures when young, and to recall them with satisfaction when we are old.
general.author: leigh hunt

general.quote: One must desire something to be alive: perhaps absolute satisfaction is only another name for Death.
general.author: margaret deland

general.quote: How I relate to my inner self influences my relationships with all others. My satisfaction with myself and my satisfaction with other people are directly proportional.
general.author: sue atchley ebaugh

general.quote: There is not any memory with less satisfaction than the memory of some temptation we resisted.
general.author: james branch cabell

general.quote: Laziness may appear attractive but work gives satisfaction.
general.author: anne frank

general.quote: One forgives to the degree that one loves.
general.author: francois de la rochefoucauld

general.quote: Forgiveness is the key to action and freedom.
general.author: hannah arendt

general.quote: Forgiveness is the act of admitting we are like other people.
general.author: christina baldwin

general.quote: The world can forgive practically anything except people who mind their own business.
general.author: margaret mitchell

general.quote: We read that we ought to forgive our enemies; but we do not read that we ought to forgive our friends.
general.author: cosmus

general.quote: We should always forgive,–the penitent for their sake, the impenitent for our own.
general.author: marie von ebner-eschenbach

general.quote: I can have peace of mind only when I forgive rather than judge.
general.author: gerald g. jampolsky

general.quote: Forgiving those who hurt us is the key to personal peace.
general.author: g. weatherly

general.quote: He who forgives readily only invites offense.
general.author: pierre corneille

general.quote: A woman who can’t forgive should never have more than a nodding acquaintance with a man.
general.author: edgar watson howe

general.quote: When you are happy you can forgive a great deal.
general.author: princess diana

general.quote: The more we know, the better we forgive; Whoe’er feels deeply, feels for all who live.
general.author: madame de stael

general.quote: To forgive heals the wound, to forget heals the scar.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: When women love us they forgive everything.
general.author: honore de balzac

general.quote: Who understands much, forgives much.
general.author: anne germain de stael

general.quote: Give us this day our daily bread. And forgive us our debts, as we forgive our debtors.
general.author: bible

general.quote: He that cannot forgive others, breaks the bridge over which he himself must pass if he would ever reach heaven; for everyone has need to be forgiven.
general.author: george herbert

general.quote: Youth, which is forgiven everything, forgives itself nothing: age, which forgives itself everything, is forgiven nothing.
general.author: george bernard shaw

general.quote: We never ask God to forgive anybody except when we haven’t.
general.author: elbert hubbard

general.quote: Beware of the man who does not return your blow: he neither forgives you nor allows you to forgive yourself.
general.author: george bernard shaw

general.quote: Humanity is never so beautiful as when praying for forgiveness, or else forgiving another.
general.author: jean paul richter

general.quote: Forgive all who have offended you, not for them, but for yourself.
general.author: harriet nelson

general.quote: What we forgive too freely doesn’t stay forgiven.
general.author: mignon mclaughlin

general.quote: Life is an adventure in forgiveness.
general.author: norman cousins

general.quote: It is a very delicate job to forgive a man, without lowering him in his own estimation, and yours too.
general.author: henry wheeler shaw

general.quote: To love is human, it is also human to forgive.
general.author: plautus

general.quote: The heart of a mother is a deep abyss at the bottom of which you will always find forgiveness.
general.author: honore de balzac

general.quote: Forgiveness is better than revenge.
general.author: pittacus of mitylene

general.quote: As nice as we are in love, we forgive more faults in that than in friendship.
general.author: henry home

general.quote: Today I forgive all those who have ever offended me. I give my love to all thirsty hearts, both to those who love me and to those who do not love me.
general.author: paramahansa yogananda

general.quote: Forgive yourself for your faults and your mistakes and move on.
general.author: les brown

general.quote: Love is an act of endless forgiveness, a tender look which becomes a habit.
general.author: peter ustinov

general.quote: The weak can never forgive. Forgiveness is the attribute of the strong.
general.author: mahatma gandhi

general.quote: The man who forgives is far stronger than the man who fights.
general.author: nathan croall

general.quote: Nothing inspires forgiveness quite like revenge.
general.author: scott adams

general.quote: If you want to see the brave, look at those who can forgive.
general.author: bhagavad gita

general.quote: We should forgive freely, but forget rarely.
general.author: charles caleb colton

general.quote: I never forgive, but I always forget.
general.author: arthur james balfour

general.quote: Without forgiveness, there’s no future.
general.author: desmond tutu

general.quote: Life, that ever need’s forgiveness, has, for its, first duty, to forgive.
general.author: lord edward robert bulwer lytton

general.quote: Forgiveness is man’s deepest need and highest achievement.
general.author: horace bushnell

general.quote: God may forgive your sins, but your nervous system won’t
general.author: alfred korzybski

general.quote: Forgiveness is almost a selfish act because of its immense benefits to the one who forgives.
general.author: lawana blackwell

general.quote: Forgiveness is the final form of love.
general.author: reinhold niebuhr

general.quote: And be kind to one another, tender-hearted, forgiving each other, just as God in Christ also has forgiven you.
general.author: bible

general.quote: From my experience, forgiving is the only way to survive.
general.author: molly ringwald

general.quote: It is easy enough to forgive your enemies if you have not the means to harm them.
general.author: heinrich heine

general.quote: There is no revenge so complete as forgiveness.
general.author: josh billings

general.quote: It’s easier to ask forgiveness than it is to get permission.
general.author: grace hopper

general.quote: Forgive many things in others; nothing in yourself.
general.author: decimus magnus ausonius

general.quote: Forgive others often, yourself never.
general.author: syrus

general.quote: We all like to forgive, and love best not those who offend us least, nor who have done most for us, but those who make it most easy for us to forgive them.
general.author: samuel butler

general.quote: "I can forgive, but I cannot forget," is only another way of saying "I will not forgive." A forgiveness ought to be like a cancelled note, torn in two and burned up, so that it never can be shown against the man.
general.author: henry ward beecher

general.quote: To forgive oneself? No, that doesn’t work: we have to be forgiven. But we can only believe this is possible if we ourselves can forgive.
general.author: dag hammarskjold

general.quote: The secret of forgiving everything is to understand nothing
general.author: george bernard shaw

general.quote: One thing you will probably remember well is any time you forgive and forget.
general.author: franklin p. jones

general.quote: When a deep injury is done us, we never recover until we forgive.
general.author: alan paton

general.quote: Forgiveness is an act of the will, and the will can function regardless of the temperature of the heart.
general.author: corrie ten boom

general.quote: Forgiveness is the most tender part of love.
general.author: john sheffield

general.quote: We may forgive those who bore us, we cannot forgive those whom we bore.
general.author: francois duc de la rochefoucauld

general.quote: Always forgive your enemies – nothing annoys them so much.
general.author: oscar wilde

general.quote: And if your friend does evil to you, say to him, "I forgive you for what you did to me, but how can I forgive you for what you did to yourself?
general.author: friedrich nietzsche

general.quote: To forgive is to set a prisoner free and discover that the prisoner was you.
general.author: lewis b. smedes

general.quote: Forgive you? Oh, of course, dear, a dozen times a week! We women were created forgiveness but to speak.
general.author: ella higginson

general.quote: Forgiveness does not change the past, but it does enlarge the future.
general.author: paul boese

general.quote: A coward never forgives.
general.author: laurence sterne

general.quote: To be social is to be forgiving
general.author: robert frost

general.quote: Yes, this is what good is: to forgive evil. There is no other good.
general.author: antonio porchia

general.quote: Forgiveness is the fragrance the violet sheds on the heel that has crushed it.
general.author: mark twain

general.quote: Those who easily forgive invite offenses.
general.author: pierre corneille

general.quote: The mind that too frequently forgives bad actions will at last forget good ones.
general.author: frederic reynolds

general.quote: Forgiveness is the oil of relationships.
general.author: josh mcdowell

general.quote: One of the secrets of a long and fruitful life is to forgive everybody every night you go to bed.
general.author: ann landers

general.quote: Men are less forgiving than women.
general.author: samuel richardson

general.quote: It is easier to forgive an enemy than to forgive a friend.
general.author: william blake

general.quote: Forgiveness is the giving, and so the receiving, of life.
general.author: george macdonald

general.quote: Forgive thyself little, and others much.
general.author: robert leighton

general.quote: Only the brave know how to forgive; it is the most refined and generous pitch of virtue human nature can arrive at.
general.author: laurence sterne

general.quote: God will forgive me; that’s his business
general.author: heinrich heine

general.quote: Forgiveness is the highest and most difficult of all moral lessons.
general.author: joseph jacobs

general.quote: Forgiveness is the noblest vengeance.
general.author: h.g. bohn

general.quote: As long as you don’t forgive, who and whatever it is will occupy a rent-free space in your mind.
general.author: isabelle holland

general.quote: To receive an injury is to be wounded; but to forgive and forget it is the cure.
general.author: william scott downey

general.quote: Forgiveness is the remission of sins. For it is by this that what has been lost, and was found, is saved from being lost again.
general.author: st. augustine

general.quote: Forgiveness is healing … especially forgiving yourself.
general.author: alyson noël

general.quote: To forgive is the highest, most beautiful form of love. In return, you will receive untold peace and happiness.
general.author: robert muller

general.quote: Forgiveness is the sweetest revenge.
general.author: isaac friedmann

general.quote: People find it far easier to forgive others for being wrong than being right.
general.author: j. k. rowling

general.quote: The stupid neither forgive nor forget; the naive forgive and forget; the wise forgive but do not forget.
general.author: thomas szasz

general.quote: They who forgive most shall be most forgiven.
general.author: philip james bailey

general.quote: It is easier to ask forgiveness than permission.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: A man must learn to forgive himself.
general.author: arthur davison ficke

general.quote: Forgiving is love’s toughest work, and love’s biggest risk.
general.author: lewis b. smedes

general.quote: Women do not often have it in their power to give like men, but they forgive like Heaven.
general.author: madame suzanne curchod necker

general.quote: The narrow soul knows not the godlike glory of forgiving.
general.author: nicholas rowe

general.quote: Forgiveness is all-powerful. Forgiveness heals all ills.
general.author: catherine ponder

general.quote: To err is human, to forgive, divine.
general.author: alexander pope

general.quote: Forgiveness is a gift we give ourselves that allows us to get on with our lives instead of being trapped in the past by resentment.
general.author: rick warren

general.quote: Forgive your enemies, but never forget their names.
general.author: john fitzgerald kennedy

general.quote: To forgive a fault in another is more sublime than to be faultless one’s self.
general.author: george sand

general.quote: Forgiveness is a virtue of the brave.
general.author: indira gandhi

general.quote: Forgiveness is a funny thing. It warms the heart and cools the sting.
general.author: william arthur ward

general.quote: Forgiveness is the way to true health and happiness.
general.author: gerald g. jampolsky

general.quote: If you haven’t forgiven yourself something, how can you forgive others?
general.author: dolores huerta

general.quote: He who has not forgiven an enemy has never yet tasted one of the most sublime enjoyments of life.
general.author: johann kaspar lavater

general.quote: The brave only know how to forgive.
general.author: laurence sterne

general.quote: Yes, we ought to forgive our enemies, but not until they are hanged.
general.author: heinrich heine

general.quote: A wise man will make haste to forgive, because he knows the full value of time and will not suffer it to pass away in unnecessary pain.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: He who forgives ends the quarrel.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: If I owe Smith ten dollars and God forgives me, that doesn’t pay Smith.
general.author: robert green ingersoll

general.quote: Forgiveness is God’s command.
general.author: martin luther

general.quote: Forgiveness is the key to happiness.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: That neither God nor man can well forgive.
general.author: lord alfred tennyson

general.quote: Forgive! How many will say, "forgive," and find a sort of absolution in the sound to hate a little longer!
general.author: lord alfred tennyson

general.quote: God has a big eraser.
general.author: billy zeoli

general.quote: We forgive too little, forget too much.
general.author: madame soimonoff

general.quote: A winner rebukes and forgives; a loser is too timid to rebuke and too petty to forgive.
general.author: sidney j. harris

general.quote: It’s far easier to forgive an enemy after you’ve got even with him.
general.author: olin miller

general.quote: Inner peace can be reached only when we practice forgiveness. Forgiveness is letting go of the past, and is therefore the means for correcting our misperceptions.
general.author: gerald g. jampolsky

general.quote: The forgiving state of mind is a magnetic power for attracting good.
general.author: catherine porter

general.quote: The moment an individual can accept and forgive himself, even a little, is the moment in which he becomes to some degree lovable.
general.author: eugene kennedy

general.quote: What is forgiven is usually well remembered.
general.author: louis dudek

general.quote: Always keep an open mind and a compassionate heart.
general.author: phil jackson

general.quote: Compassion is not just feeling with someone, but seeking to change the situation. Frequently people think compassion and love are merely sentimental. No! They are very demanding. If you are goint to be compassionate, be prepared for action!
general.author: desmond tutu

general.quote: Until he extends the circle of his compassion to all living things, man will not himself find peace.
general.author: albert schweitzer

general.quote: When we know ourselves to be connected to all others, acting compassionately is simply the natural thing to do.
general.author: rachel naomi remen

general.quote: Compassion is silent but does not remain secluded. It goes out at the sight of trouble, sin, and need.
general.author: e. m. bounds

general.quote: Compassion is the chief law of human existence.
general.author: fyodor dostoevsky

general.quote: The dew of compassion is a tear.
general.author: lord byron

general.quote: Honesty without compassion and understanding is not honesty, but subtle hostility.
general.author: rose n. franzblau

general.quote: Compassion for others begins with kindness to ourselves.
general.author: pema chodron

general.quote: If you want others to be happy, practice compassion. If you want to be happy, practice compassion.
general.author: john le carre

general.quote: Be kind to people whether they deserve your kindness or not. If your kindness reaches the deserving good for you if your kindness reaches the undeserving take joy in your compassion.
general.author: james fadiman

general.quote: Saving lives is not a top priority in the halls of power. Being compassionate and concerned about human life can cause a man to lose his job. It can cause a woman not to get the job to begin with.
general.author: myriam miedzian

general.quote: In the beginning, compassion is like the seed without which we cannot have any fruit; in the middle, compassion is like water to nourish the see we have planted; in the end, compassion is like the warmth of the sun that brings the fruit to ripening.
general.author: buddha

general.quote: Compassion crowns the soul with its truest victory.
general.author: aberjhani

general.quote: Compassion is the sense of our own misfortunes in those of another.
general.author: l. m. stretch

general.quote: Compassion is the antitoxin of the soul: where there is compassion even the most poisonous impulses remain relatively harmless.
general.author: eric hoffer

general.quote: True compassion is more than flinging a coin to a beggar; it is not haphazard and superficial. It comes to see that an edifice which produces beggars needs restructuring.
general.author: martin luther king jr.

general.quote: We have to make mistakes, its how we learn compassion for others.
general.author: curtis sittenfeld

general.quote: True compassion is not forged at a distance from pain but in its fires.
general.author: christina feldman

general.quote: Some people’s compassion is worse than their indifference or even hatred.
general.author: e. p. day

general.quote: I know the compassion of others is a relief at first. I don’t despise it. But it can’t quench pain, it slips through your soul as through a sieve. And when our suffering has been dragged from one pity to another, as from one mouth to another, we can no longer respect or love it.
general.author: georges bernanos

general.quote: I would rather make mistakes in kindness and compassion than work miracles in unkindness and hardness.
general.author: mother teresa

general.quote: Love and compassion are necessities, not luxuries. Without them, humanity cannot survive.
general.author: dalai lama xiv

general.quote: Love and compassion are the mother and father of a smile. We need to create more smiles in our world today. Smiles, after all, pave the way to a happy world.
general.author: steve maraboli

general.quote: Compassion has no place in the natural order of the world which operates on the basis of necessity. Compassion opposes this order and is therefore best thought of as being in some way supernatural.
general.author: john berger

general.quote: Compassion is not just a feeling; it is a response to pain that is deeply rooted in wisdom. It is a commitment to alleviating suffering and the cause of suffering in all its forms.
general.author: christina feldman

general.quote: The individual is capable of both great compassion and great indifference. He has it within his means to nourish the former and outgrow the latter.
general.author: norman cousins

general.quote: It is only with true love and compassion that we can begin to mend what is broken in the world. It is these two blessed things that can begin to heal all broken hearts.
general.author: steve maraboli

general.quote: Compassion for myself is the most powerful healer of them all.
general.author: theodore i. rubin

general.quote: The family is a school of compassion because it is here that we learn to live with other people.
general.author: karen armstrong

general.quote: Nobody who is somebody looks down on anybody.
general.author: margaret deland

general.quote: Pain must enter into its glorified life of memory before it can turn into compassion.
general.author: george eliot

general.quote: Compassion will cure more sins than condemnation.
general.author: willard beecher

general.quote: There is nothing heavier than compassion. Not even one’s own pain weighs so heavy as the pain one feels with someone, for someone, a pain intensified by the imagination and prolonged by a hundred echoes.
general.author: milan kundera

general.quote: Compassion makes you a lotus. You start rising above the muddy world of desires, greed, anger. Compassion is a transformation of your energies.
general.author: osho

general.quote: Great compassion is the root of all spiritual paths, and of all Superior beings.
general.author: geshe kelsang gyatso

general.quote: The symptoms of compassion and benevolence, in some people, are like those minute guns which warn you that you are in deadly peril.
general.author: madame swetchine

general.quote: We will be remembered not for the power of our weapons but for the power of our compassion, our dedication to human welfare.
general.author: hubert h. humphrey

general.quote: Let’s get loose with compassion. Let’s drown in the delicious ambience of love.
general.author: hafiz

general.quote: Most women bestow their favors upon men, not from Passion, but from Compassion.
general.author: abraham miller

general.quote: Compassion is that species of affection which is excited either by the actual distress of its object, or by some impending calamity, which appears inevitable; it is a benevolent sorrow for the sufferings or approaching misery of another.
general.author: charles buck

general.quote: Compassion to an offender who has grossly violated the laws is, in effect, a cruelty to the peaceable subject who has observed them.
general.author: junius

general.quote: Compassion is born when we discover in the center of our own existence not only that God is God and man is man, but also that our neighbor really is our fellow man.
general.author: henri nouwen

general.quote: Out of compassion I destroy the darkness of their ignorance. From within them I light the lamp of wisdom and dispel all darkness from their lives.
general.author: bhagavad gita

general.quote: The mind is no match with the heart in persuasion; constitutionality is no match with compassion.
general.author: everett m. dirksen

general.quote: No deep and strong feeling, such as we may come across here and there in the world, is unmixed with compassion. The more we love, the more the object of our love seems to us to be a victim.
general.author: boris pasternak

general.quote: Compassion–that’s the one thing no machine ever had. Maybe it’s the one thing that keeps man ahead of them.
general.author: d.c. fontana

general.quote: Compassion hurts. When you feel connected to everything, you also feel responsible for everything. And you cannot turn away.
general.author: andrew boyd

general.quote: Compassion is the basis of all truthful relationship: it means being present with love—for ourselves and for all life, including animals, fish, birds, and trees.
general.author: ram dass

general.quote: There is no small kindness; every compassionate act makes large the world.
general.author: mary anne radmacher

general.quote: Biblical orthodoxy without compassion is surely the ugliest thing in the world.
general.author: francis schaeffer

general.quote: Liberals measure compassion by how many people are given welfare. Conservatives measure compassion by how many people no longer need it.
general.author: rush limbaugh

general.quote: Man may dismiss compassion from his heart, but God never will.
general.author: william cowper

general.quote: Compassion is no substitute for justice.
general.author: rush limbaugh

general.quote: A kind gesture can reach a wound that only compassion can heal.
general.author: steve maraboli

general.quote: Compassion is hard because it requires the inner disposition to go with others to the place where they are weak, vulnerable, lonely, and broken.
general.author: henri j. m. nouwen

general.quote: Let our compassion express itself in efforts to bring the erring back to sacred principles, and if they persist, let us pity them the more for a blindness so fatal to themselves.
general.author: s. e. d. charnage

general.quote: You may call God love, you may call God goodness. But the best name for God is compassion.
general.author: meister eckhart

general.quote: All people are endowed with the faculty of compassion, and for this reason can develop the humanitarian spirit.
general.author: albert schweitzer

general.quote: We must bring compassion back to the market place. Social justice is our goal. To achieve it, we all must help create a more tolerant and fair society.
general.author: rave bird

general.quote: Minerva save us from the cloying syrup of coercive compassion!
general.author: camille paglia

general.quote: Compassion is not a relationship between the healer and the wounded. It’s a relationship between equals.
general.author: pema chodron

general.quote: To grow old is to pass from passion to compassion.
general.author: albert camus

general.quote: Compassion is the basis of morality.
general.author: arthur schopenhauer

general.quote: The ideal of compassion is not feeling bad for what we cannot do; it is joyfully and energetically doing all that we can for others in any given moment.
general.author: lorne ladner

general.quote: Compassion alone stands apart from the continuous traffic between good and evil within us. Compassion is the antitoxin of the soul: where there is compassion even the most poisonous impulses remain relatively harmless.
general.author: eric hoffer

general.quote: The wretched have no compassion, they can do good only from strong principles of duty.
general.author: samuel johnson

general.quote: Compassion is a mixed passion, composed of love and sorrow.
general.author: noah webster

general.quote: When affection fell on its ass, politeness could step up.
general.author: lorrie moore

general.quote: Politeness is better than logic. You can often persuade when you cannot convince.
general.author: henry wheeler shaw

general.quote: Politeness is to human nature what warmth is to wax.
general.author: arthur schopenhauer

general.quote: There is no accomplishment so easy to acquire as politeness, and none more profitable.
general.author: henry wheeler shaw

general.quote: Politeness is … forgetting ourselves in order to seek what may be agreeable to others.
general.author: wellins calcott

general.quote: Politeness is the art of choosing among one’s real thoughts.
general.author: abel stevens

general.quote: Politeness is the ideal union between the character of an individual and his external actions.
general.author: richard j. watts

general.quote: It seems to me that the spirit of politeness is a certain attention in causing that, by our words and by our manners, others may be content with us and with themselves.
general.author: jean de la bruyere

general.quote: There is no policy like politeness; and a good manner is the best thing in the world, either to get a good name, or to supply the want of it.
general.author: edward george earle lytton bulwer-lytton

general.quote: Politeness is nothing more than an elegant and concealed species of flattery, tending to put the person to whom it is addressed in good humor and respect with himself.
general.author: richard cumberland

general.quote: Because politeness is part of the common behavioural heritage of humanity, it is culturally as diverse as the human race is.
general.author: daniel z. kadar & francesca bargiela- chiappini

general.quote: The true effect of genuine politeness seems to be rather ease than pleasure.
general.author: samuel johnson

general.quote: When one is polite in German, one lies.
general.author: johann wolfgang von goethe

general.quote: Politeness is part of the social immune system, preventing hostility, calming inflammations and healing breaches.
general.author: mitali saran

general.quote: True politeness is perfect ease and freedom. It simply consists in treating others just as you love to be treated yourself.
general.author: philip dormer stanhope

general.quote: It is astounding what power being kind, mannered, polite and considerate has in transforming your life.
general.author: bryant mcgill

general.quote: Being polite is not meant to be a graceful way of being dishonest. Politeness is a way in which we honor and respect others.
general.author: mark nichols

general.quote: Politeness — The most acceptable hypocrisy.
general.author: ambrose bierce

general.quote: Be polite to all, but intimate with few.
general.author: thomas jefferson
true politeness is a virtue of the understanding and of the heart. john s.c. abbott

general.quote: Politeness is an inexpensive way of making friends.
general.author: william feather

general.quote: Politeness is natural good nature.
general.author: eratosthenes

general.quote: The wisest and best are repulsive, if they are characterized by repulsive manners. Politeness is an easy virtue, costs little, and has great purchasing power.
general.author: amos bronson alcott

general.quote: Politeness is to goodness what words are to thoughts.
general.author: joseph joubert

general.quote: A man never loses anything by politeness.
general.author: henry venn

general.quote: Politeness and a sense of honor have this advantage: we bestow them on others without losing a thing.
general.author: baltasar gracian

general.quote: Politeness induces morality. Serenity of manners requires serenity of mind.
general.author: julia ward howe

general.quote: Politeness is a wreath of flowers that adorns the world.
general.author: mme. de bassanville

general.quote: True politeness consists in being easy one’s self, and in making every one about one as easy as one can.
general.author: alexander pope

general.quote: Politeness has been defined to be artificial good-nature; but we may affirm, with much greater propriety, that good-nature is natural politeness.
general.author: leszczynski stanislaus

general.quote: Politeness is the outward garment of goodwill.
general.author: julius charles hare

general.quote: Politeness is something you owe other people, because when you show a little courtesy, everything becomes easier and better. But first and foremost, it’s something you owe yourself.
general.author: anne holm

general.quote: Politeness is practical Christianity.
general.author: orville dewey

general.quote: Nobody loses anything by being polite, but there are a lot of people who are afraid to take the risk.
general.author: evan esar

general.quote: Politeness is the flower of humanity.
general.author: joseph joubert

general.quote: Avoid all haste; calmness is an essential ingredient of politeness.
general.author: alphonse karr

general.quote: Of course, it is no easy matter to be polite; in so far, I mean, as it requires us to show great respect for everybody, whereas most people deserve none at all.
general.author: arthur schopenhauer

general.quote: Be polite; write diplomatically; even in a declaration of war one observes the rules of politeness.
general.author: otto von bismarck

general.quote: Politeness does not always inspire goodness, equity, complaisance, and gratitude; it gives at least the appearance of these qualities, and makes man appear outwardly, as he should be within.
general.author: jean de la bruyere

general.quote: Treat everyone politely, even those rude to you; not because they are nice, but because you are.
general.author: jean cherni

general.quote: There is a politeness of the heart; this is closely allied to love.
general.author: johann wolfgang von goethe

general.quote: Politeness only teaches us to save others from unnecessary pain…. You are not bound by politeness to tell any falsehoods.
general.author: maria edgeworth

general.quote: Politeness smooths wrinkles.
general.author: joseph joubert

general.quote: Politeness is a mixture of discretion, civility, complaisance and circumspection spread over all we do and say.
general.author: charles de marguetel de saint-denis de saint-evremond

general.quote: One of the greatest victories you can gain over any man is to beat him at politeness.
general.author: josh bilings

general.quote: In truth, politeness is artificial good humor, it covers the natural want of it, and ends by rendering habitual a substitute nearly equivalent to the real virtue.
general.author: thomas jefferson

general.quote: It is a part of good breeding that a man should be polite even to himself.
general.author: jean paul friedrich richter

general.quote: Politeness is like an air cushion: there may be nothing in it, but it eases our jolts wonderfully.
general.author: samuel johnson

general.quote: Politeness is not always a sign of wisdom; but the want of it always leaves room for a suspicion of folly, if folly and imprudence are the same.
general.author: walter savage landor

general.quote: Politeness is the produce of nature’s soil; it was never taught, never acquired from instruction–we find it as often in the lowly cottage as in the most magnificent palace.
general.author: joseph bartlett

general.quote: Either one learns politeness at home … or the world teaches it to you with a whip and you may get hurt in the process.
general.author: f. scott fitzgerald

general.quote: Politeness is … good nature regulated by good sense.
general.author: sydney smith

general.quote: Politeness costs little and yields much.
general.author: madame anne therese de lambert

general.quote: Politeness is one of those advantages which we never estimate rightly but by the inconvenience of its loss.
general.author: samuel johnson

general.quote: I consider that the spirit of politeness is a certain desire to bring it about, that, by our words and manners, others may be pleased with us and with themselves.
general.author: charles de montesquieu

general.quote: Politeness is fictitious benevolence. Depend upon it, the want of it never fails to produce something disagreeable to one or other.
general.author: samuel johnson

general.quote: Politeness is as natural to delicate natures as perfume is to flowers.
general.author: j. de finod

general.quote: The truest politeness comes of sincerity.
general.author: samuel smiles

general.quote: Being polite is, by itself, not a form of hypocrisy. It is not an empty formalism unless you choose to make it so.
general.author: andre dekker

general.quote: Politeness has been well defined as benevolence in small things.
general.author: thomas b. macaulay

general.quote: We live by our imagination, our admirations, and our sentiments.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson quotes

general.quote: When we view elevated ideas of Nature, the result of that view is admiration, which is always the cause of pleasure.
general.author: john dryden

general.quote: Between flattery and admiration there often flows a river of contempt.
general.author: minna antrim

general.quote: Admiration begins where acquaintance ceases.
general.author: samuel johnson quotes

general.quote: No nobler feeling than this, of admiration for one higher than himself, dwells in the breast of man. It is to this hour, and at all hours, the vivifying influence in man’s life.
general.author: thomas carlyle

general.quote: It may be laid down as a general rule, that no woman who hath any great pretensions to admiration is ever well pleased in a company where she perceives herself to fill only the second place.
general.author: henry fielding

general.quote: How happy is it for us, that the admiration of others should depend so much more on their ignorance than our perfection!
general.author: fulke greville

general.quote: The love of admiration leads to fraud, much more than the love of commendation; but, on the other hand, the latter is much more likely to spoil our: good actions by the substitution of an inferior motive.
general.author: archbishop richard whately

general.quote: Marrying a man is like buying something you’ve been admiring for a long time in a shop window. You may love it when you get it home, but it doesn’t always go with everything else in the house.
general.author: jean kerr

general.quote: Women fancy admiration means more than it does.
general.author: mary lydon simonsen

general.quote: Admiration is a youthful fancy which scarcely ever survives to mature years.
general.author: h.w.shaw

general.quote: A fool always finds a bigger fool to admire him.
general.author: evan esar

general.quote: The desire to be pitied or to be admired is often the main reason we confide in others.
general.author: francois de la rochefoucauld

general.quote: It is only important to love the world …to regard the world and ourselves and all beings with love, admiration and respect.
general.author: hermann hesse

general.quote: There is nothing in the world so much admired as a man who knows how to bear unhappiness with courage.
general.author: marcus annaeus seneca

general.quote: Admiration for a quality or an art can be so strong that it deters us from striving to possess it.
general.author: friedrich nietzsche

general.quote: Though familiarity may not breed contempt, it takes the edge of admiration.
general.author: william hazlitt

general.quote: Admiration; is our polite recognition of another’s resemblance to ourselves.
general.author: ambrose bierce

general.quote: There is a wide difference between admiration and love. The sublime, which is the cause of the former, always dwells on great objects and terrible; the latter on small ones and pleasing; we submit to what we admire, but we love what submits to us: in one case we are forced, in the other, we are flattered, into compliance.
general.author: edmund burke

general.quote: You always admire what you really don’t understand.
general.author: eleanor roosevelt quotes

general.quote: Don’t accept your dog’s admiration as conclusive evidence that you are wonderful.
general.author: ann landers

general.quote: A mixture of admiration and pity is one of the surest recipes for affection.
general.author: andre maurois

general.quote: Admiration must be continued by that novelty which first produces it; and how much soever is given, there must always be reason to imagine that more remains.
general.author: samuel johnson

general.quote: Admiration is a forced tribute ; to extort it from mankind, envious and ignorant as they are, they must be taken unawares.
general.author: james northcote

general.quote: There is an innocence in admiration; it is found in those to whom it has never yet occurred that they, too, might be admired some day.
general.author: friedrich nietzsche

general.quote: Nothing is so admirable in politics as a short memory.
general.author: john kenneth galbraith

general.quote: Distance is a great promoter of admiration.
general.author: denis diderot

general.quote: For fools admire, but me of sense approve.
general.author: alexander pope

general.quote: Men of genius are admired, men of wealth are envied, men of power are feared, but only men of character are trusted.
general.author: zig ziglar

general.quote: To cease to admire is a proof of deterioration.
general.author: charles horton cooley

general.quote: Nothing is more admirable than the fortitude with which millionaires tolerate the disadvantages of their wealth.
general.author: nero wolfe

general.quote: A hero is someone we can admire without apology.
general.author: kitty kelley

general.quote: A modest man is usually admired, if people ever hear of him.
general.author: edgar watson howe

general.quote: The secret of happiness is to admire without desiring. And that is not happiness.
general.author: f.h.bradley

general.quote: That which astonishes, astonishes once; but whatever is admirable becomes more and more admired.
general.author: joseph joubert

general.quote: Admiration bestowed upon any one but ourselves is always tedious.
general.author: honore de balzac

general.quote: Season your admiration for a while.
general.author: william shakespeare quotes

general.quote: Those who are formed to win general admiration are seldom calculated to bestow individual happiness.
general.author: lady marguerite blessington

general.quote: It is the rooted instinct in men to admire what is better and more beautiful than themselves.
general.author: james russell lowell

general.quote: About the only time losing is more fun than winning is when you’re fighting temptation.
general.author: tom wilson

general.quote: You oughtn’t to yield to temptation. Well, somebody must, or the thing becomes absurd.
general.author: anthony hope

general.quote: The source and cause of all temptation is in the inward desire; that being purified or eliminated, outward objects and extraneous powers are utterly powerless to move the soul to sin or to temptation.
general.author: james allen

general.quote: No man knows what he will do till the right temptation comes.
general.author: henry ward beecher

general.quote: Find out what your temptations are, and you will find out largely what you are yourself.
general.author: henry ward beecher

general.quote: Frequent and violent temptations were a proof that the citadel of the soul had not fallen and that the devil raged to make it fall.
general.author: james joyce

general.quote: Temptations are enemies outside the castle seeking entrance.
general.author: henry ward beecher

general.quote: God is better served in resisting a temptation to evil, than in many formal prayers.
general.author: william penn

general.quote: Let a man be but in earnest in praying against a temptation as the tempter is in pressing it, and he needs not proceed by a surer measure.
general.author: bishop robert south

general.quote: Temptation is a woman’s weapon and man’s excuse.
general.author: h. l. mencken

general.quote: The realization of God’s presence is the one sovereign remedy against temptation.
general.author: francois de salignac fenelon

general.quote: What makes resisting temptation difficult for many people is they don’t want to discourage it completely.
general.author: franklin p. jones

general.quote: For I am that way going to temptation, where prayers cross.
general.author: william shakespeare

general.quote: Most dangerous is that temptation that doth goad us on to sin to loving virtue.
general.author: william shakespeare

general.quote: Do you really think, Arthur, that it is weakness that yields to temptation? I tell you that there are terrible temptations that it requires strength, strength and courage, to yield to.
general.author: oscar wilde

general.quote: Some temptations come to the industrious, but all temptations attack the idle.
general.author: charles haddon spurgeon

general.quote: The virtue which has never been attacked by temptation is deserving of no monument.
general.author: madeleine de scuderi

general.quote: Every Christian is endued with a power whereby he is enabled to resist temptations.
general.author: john tillotson

general.quote: Devils soonest tempt, resembling spirits of light.
general.author: william shakespeare

general.quote: Temptation is an irresistible force at work on a movable body.
general.author: henry louis mencken

general.quote: The force of the blow depends on the resistance. It is sometimes better not to struggle against temptation. Either fly or yield at once.
general.author: francis h. bradley

general.quote: Why resist temptation? There will always be more.
general.author: don herold

general.quote: Terrible is the temptation to be good.
general.author: bertolt brecht

general.quote: The Devil’s subtlest temptations are the ones you yield to without even knowing you’ve given in.
general.author: glen duncan

general.quote: Temptation hath a music for all ears.
general.author: nathaniel parker willis

general.quote: To attempt to resist temptation, to abandon our bad habits.
general.author: benjamin waugh

general.quote: We usually know what we can do, but temptation shows us who we are.
general.author: thomas ã kempis

general.quote: Do not worry about avoiding temptation. As you grow older it will avoid you.
general.author: joey lauren adams

general.quote: There’s a lesson in every temptation.
general.author: frank herbert

general.quote: The trouble with resisting temptation is it may never come your way again.
general.author: korman’s law

general.quote: Temptation is the fire that brings up the scum of the heart.
general.author: thomas boston

general.quote: Every man living shall assuredly meet with an hour of temptation, a certain critical hour, which shall more especially try what mettle his heart is made of.
general.author: bishop robert south

general.quote: Most people want to be delivered from temptation but would like it to keep in touch.
general.author: robert orben

general.quote: I am that way going to temptation, Where prayers cross.
general.author: william shakespeare

general.quote: Honest bread is very well–it’s the butter that makes the temptation.
general.author: douglas william jerrold

general.quote: Opportunity may knock only once, but temptation leans on the doorbell.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: Many a dangerous temptation comes to us in fine gay colours, that are but skin-deep.
general.author: matthew henry

general.quote: The temptation is not here, where you are reading about it or praying about it. It is down in your shop, among bales and boxes, ten-penny nails, and sand-paper.
general.author: edwin hubbell chapin

general.quote: There is a cure for temptation. What? Yielding to it.
general.author: honore de balzac

general.quote: Those who flee temptation generally leave a forwarding address.
general.author: lane olinghouse

general.quote: Nothing makes it easier to resist temptation than a proper bringing-up, a sound set of values — and witnesses.
general.author: franklin p. jones

general.quote: Saintliness is also a temptation.
general.author: jean anouilh

general.quote: Temptations, when we meet them at first, are as the lion that roared upon Samson; but if we overcome them, the next time we see them we shall find a nest of honey within them.
general.author: john bunyan

general.quote: We find many things, to which the prohibition of them constitutes the only temptation.
general.author: william hazlitt

general.quote: Every moment of resistance to temptation is a victory.
general.author: frederick w. faber

general.quote: We like slipping, but not falling: our real desire is to be tempted enough.
general.author: augustus william hare

general.quote: I generally avoid temptation unless I can’t resist it.
general.author: mae west

general.quote: Temptations come, as a general rule, when they are sought.
general.author: margaret oliphant

general.quote: No temptation can ever be measured by the value of its object.
general.author: sidonie gabrielle colette

general.quote: Temptations, like misfortunes, are sent to test our moral strength.
general.author: marguerite de valois

general.quote: I never resist temptation, because I have found that things that are bad for me do not tempt me.
general.author: george bernard shaw

general.quote: Without temptation the soul cannot grow.
general.author: james allen

general.quote: If you take temptations into account, who is to say that he is better than his neighbor?
general.author: william makepeace thackeray

general.quote: To go into temptation to find how strong you are, is as wise as to go before a mirror, with closed eyes, to find how you look when asleep.
general.author: ivan panin

general.quote: Temptations are a file which rub off much of the rust of self-confidence.
general.author: francois de salignac fenelon

general.quote: One learns more metaphysics from a single temptation than from all the philosophers.
general.author: james russell lowell

general.quote: If men had only temptations to great sins, they would always be good; but the daily fight with little ones accustoms them to defeat.
general.author: jean paul friedrich richter

general.quote: All men are tempted. There is no man that lives that can’t be broken down, provided it is the right temptation, put in the right spot.
general.author: henry ward beecher

general.quote: In so far as you approach temptation to a man, you do him an injury; and if he is overcome, you share his guilt.
general.author: samuel johnson

general.quote: The difference between those whom the world esteems as good and those whom it condemns as bad, is in many cases little else than that the former have been better sheltered from temptation.
general.author: augustus william hare

general.quote: The biggest human temptation is to settle for too little.
general.author: thomas merton

general.quote: There are temptations which strong exercise best enables us to resist.
general.author: sir john lubbock

general.quote: Tempt not a desperate man.
general.author: william shakespeare

general.quote: There are several good protections against temptations, but the surest is cowardice.
general.author: mark twain

general.quote: It is one thing to be tempted, another thing to fall.
general.author: william shakespeare

general.quote: Anybody can be good in the country. There are no temptations there.
general.author: oscar wilde

general.quote: No man is matriculated to the art of life till he has been well tempted.
general.author: george eliot

general.quote: When tempted to be unfaithful, the intellectual woman will try to inspire her husband with indifference, the sentimental woman with hatred, and the passionate woman with disgust.
general.author: honore de balzac

general.quote: Great possessions and great want of them are both strong temptations.
general.author: johann wolfgang von goethe

general.quote: No temptation can gravitate to a man unless there is that in his heart which is capable of responding to it.
general.author: james allen

general.quote: We gain the strength of the temptation we resist.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson

general.quote: Temptation cannot exist without the concurrence of inclination and opportunity.
general.author: e. h. chapin

general.quote: Remove the temptation of idleness and cupid’s bow is useless.
general.author: ovid

general.quote: ‘Tis no sin to be tempted, but to be overcome.
general.author: william penn

general.quote: Temptation is like a knife, that may either cut the meat or the throat of a man; it may be his food or his poison, his exercise or his destruction.
general.author: john owen

general.quote: For as men in battle are continually in the way of shot, so we, in this world, are ever within the reach of Temptation.
general.author: william penn

general.quote: The only way to get rid of a temptation is to yield to it.
general.author: oscar wilde

general.quote: I gaze into the doorway of temptation’s angry flame, and every time I pass that way I always hear my name.
general.author: bob dylan

general.quote: Temptations, unlike opportunities, will always give you many second chances.
general.author: orlando a. battista

general.quote: A beautiful woman, if poor, should use double circumspection; for her beauty will tempt others, her poverty herself.
general.author: charles caleb colton

general.quote: A tender conscience is a stronger obligation than a prison.
general.author: thomas fuller

general.quote: Government’s first duty and highest obligation is public safety.
general.author: arnold schwarzenegger

general.quote: To owe an obligation to a worthy friend is a happiness, and can be no disparagement.
general.author: pierre charron

general.quote: There is a moral obligation that those who have should give to those who don’t.
general.author: audrey hepburn

general.quote: The Universe is under no obligation to make sense to you.
general.author: neil degrasse tyson

general.quote: Relationships based on obligation lack dignity.
general.author: wayne dyer

general.quote: You find in some a sort of graceless modesty, that makes them ashamed to requite an obligation.
general.author: seneca

general.quote: Noblesse oblige; or, superior advantages bind you to larger generosity.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson

general.quote: Our obligation is to give meaning to life and in doing so to overcome the passive, indifferent life.
general.author: elie wiesel

general.quote: Some pretend want of power to make a competent return; and you shall find in others a kind of graceless modesty, that makes a man ashamed of requiting an obligation, because it is a confession that he has received one.
general.author: seneca

general.quote: Every right implies a responsibility; Every opportunity, an obligation, Every possession, a duty.
general.author: john d. rockefeller

general.quote: What do I owe to my times, to my country, to my neighbors, to my friends? Such are the questions which a virtuous man ought to ask himself often.
general.author: john caspar lavater

general.quote: We are solemnly obliged to the children of those who have loved us.
general.author: achille poincelot

general.quote: One of man’s greatest obligations is anger.
general.author: nikos kazantzakis

general.quote: Life is made up, not of great sacrifices or duties, but of little things, in which smiles and kindness, and small obligations given habitually, are what preserve the heart and secure comfort.
general.author: humphry davy

general.quote: Base natures ever judge a thing above them, and hate a power they are too much obliged to.
general.author: thomas otway

general.quote: To feel oppressed by obligation is only to prove that we are incapable of a proper sentiment of gratitude. To receive favors from the unworthy is simply to admit that our selfishness is superior to our pride. Most men remember obligations, but not often to be grateful for them. The proud are made sour by the remembrance and the vain silent.
general.author: william gilmore simms

general.quote: There is one thing diviner than duty, namely, the bond of obligation transmuted into liberty.
general.author: william r. alger

general.quote: It is no great misfortune to oblige ungrateful people, but an unsupportable one to be forced to be under an obligation to a scoundrel.
general.author: philip james bailey

general.quote: Obligation is thraldom, and thraldom is hateful.
general.author: thomas hobbes

general.quote: It is a secret, well known to all great men, that by conferring an obligation they do not always procure a friend, but are certain of creating many enemies.
general.author: henry fielding

general.quote: We are always much better pleased to see those whom we have obliged than those who have obliged us.
general.author: francois duc de la rochefoucauld

general.quote: Trifling favors are readily acknowledged, though cheaply esteemed; but important ones are most rarely remembered.
general.author: giovanni ruffini

general.quote: Sincerity doesn’t mean anything. A person can be sincere and be more destructive than a person who is insincere.
general.author: edward albee

general.quote: Faithfulness and sincerity first of all.
general.author: confucius

general.quote: I only desire sincere relations with the worthiest of my acquaintance, that they may give me an opportunity once in a year to speak the truth.
general.author: henry david thoreau

general.quote: The tongue of the sincere is rooted in his heart; hypocrisy and deceit have no place in his words.
general.author: robert dodsley

general.quote: The merit of originality is not novelty; it is sincerity.
general.author: thomas carlyle

general.quote: It is dangerous to be sincere unless you are also stupid.
general.author: george bernard shaw

general.quote: Nothing is less sincere than the act of asking and giving advice.
general.author: francois de la rochefoucauld

general.quote: A habit of sincerity in acknowledging faults is a guard against committing them.
general.author: goold brown

general.quote: Those that vow the most are the least sincere.
general.author: richard brinsley sheridan

general.quote: Sincerity is to speak as we think, to do as we pretend and profess, to perform and make good what we promise, and really to be what we would seem and appear to be.
general.author: john tillotson

general.quote: Always be sincere, even when you don’t mean it.
general.author: irene peter

general.quote: Sincerity is impossible, unless it pervade the whole being, and the pretence of it saps the very foundation of character.
general.author: james russell lowell

general.quote: Sincerity: if you can fake it, you’ve got it made.
general.author: daniel schorr

general.quote: As her technique became sounder, sincerity became less necessary.
general.author: thornton wilder

general.quote: Sincerity is the highest compliment you can pay.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson

general.quote: Sincerity is not a spontaneous flower nor is modesty either.
general.author: sidonie gabrielle colette

general.quote: Everyone says he’s sincere, but everyone isn’t sincere. If everyone was sincere who says he’s sincere, there wouldn’t be half so many insincere ones in the world and there would be lots, lots, lots more really sincere ones!
general.author: tennessee williams

general.quote: Sincerity and honesty carry one through many difficulties which all the arts he can invent would never help him through.
general.author: benjamin stillingfleet

general.quote: I would replace the quality of sincerity with honesty, since one can hold a conviction sincerely without examining it, while honesty would require that one subject one’s convictions to frequent scrutiny.
general.author: christopher phillips

general.quote: Sincerity is the key which will open the door through which you will see your separate parts, and you will see something quite new. You must go on trying to be sincere. Each day you put on a mask, and you must take it off little by little.
general.author: g. i. gurdjieff

general.quote: Sincerity is the face of the soul, as dissimulation is the mask.
general.author: joseph sanial-dubay

general.quote: Insincerity is always weakness; sincerity even in error is strength.
general.author: george henry lewes

general.quote: Teach French and un-teach sincerity.
general.author: leo tolstoy

general.quote: A silent address is the genuine eloquence of sincerity.
general.author: oliver goldsmith

general.quote: Sincerity is an openness of heart that is found in very few people. What we usually see is only an artful disguise people put on to win the confidence of others.
general.author: francois de la rochefoucauld

general.quote: Sincerity and plain dealing are conducive to the interest of mankind at large because they afford that ground of confidence and reasonable expectation which are essential to wisdom and virtue.
general.author: w. godwin

general.quote: Sincerity is the way of heaven.
general.author: confucius

general.quote: Nothing is more disgraceful than insincerity.
general.author: cicero (marcus tullius cicero)

general.quote: Sincerity is the most compendious wisdom.
general.author: philip dormer stanhope

general.quote: Weak people cannot be sincere.
general.author: francois de la rochefoucauld

general.quote: Sincerity is always subject to proof.
general.author: john f. kennedy

general.quote: One who is very variable cannot be very sincere; today’s truth is tomorrow’s falsehood.
general.author: madame swetchine

general.quote: Sincerity does not and cannot substitute for truth.
general.author: jimmy pritchard

general.quote: Sincerity may be humble, but she cannot be servile.
general.author: lord byron

general.quote: Sincerity is like traveling on a plain, beaten road, which commonly brings a man sooner to his journey’s end than by-ways, in which men often lose themselves.
general.author: john tillotson

general.quote: Where there is the greatest sincerity, there is the greatest humility; and where the least truth, there is the greatest pride.
general.author: asen nicholson

general.quote: If I’m sincere today, what does it matter if I regret it tomorrow?
general.author: josé saramago

general.quote: What is earnest is not always true; on the contrary, error is often more earnest than truth.
general.author: benjamin disraeli

general.quote: Of all the evil spirits abroad at his hour in the world, insincerity is the most dangerous.
general.author: james anthony froude,

general.quote: Even when exercising their greatest duplicity, women are always sincere because they are yielding to some natural feeling.
general.author: honore de balzac

general.quote: Be sincere; be brief; be seated.
general.author: franklin d. roosevelt

general.quote: You can play a shoestring if you’re sincere.
general.author: john coltrane

general.quote: Sincerity makes the very least person to be of more value than the most talented hypocrite.
general.author: charles haddon spurgeon

general.quote: When pure sincerity forms within, it is outwardly realized in other people’s hearts.
general.author: lao tzu

general.quote: Sincerity is the parent of truth.
general.author: oliver goldsmith

general.quote: An inward sincerity will of course influence the outward deportment; but where the one is wanting, there is great reason to suspect the absence of the other.
general.author: laurence sterne

general.quote: Sincerity and truth are the basis of every virtue.
general.author: confucius

general.quote: The great man fights the elements in his time that hinder his own greatness, in other words his own freedom and sincerity.
general.author: friedrich nietzsche

general.quote: Sincere deeds invite new friends.
general.author: toba beta

general.quote: Bashful sincerity and comely love.
general.author: william shakespeare

general.quote: However we distrust the sincerity of those whom we talk with, we always believe them more sincere with us than with others.
general.author: francois de la rochefoucauld

general.quote: Insincerity in a man’s own heart must make all his enjoyments, all that concerns him, unreal; so that his whole life must seem like a merely dramatic representation.
general.author: nathaniel hawthorne

general.quote: Hold faithfulness and sincerity as first principles.
general.author: confucius

general.quote: A little sincerity is a dangerous thing, and a great deal of it is absolutely fatal.
general.author: oscar wilde

general.quote: Private sincerity is a public welfare.
general.author: cyrus augustus bartol

general.quote: Sincerity increases willingness to care.
general.author: toba beta

general.quote: Loss of sincerity is loss of vital power.
general.author: christian nestell bovee,

general.quote: Frank sincerity, though no invited guest, is free to all, and brings his welcome with him.
general.author: william havard

general.quote: To be sincere means to be the same person when one is with oneself; that is to say, alone — but that is all it means.
general.author: paul valery

general.quote: There is no greater delight than to be conscious of sincerity on self-examination.
general.author: mencius

general.quote: The way I see it, it doesn’t matter what you believe just so you’re sincere.
general.author: charles m. schulz

general.quote: I should say sincerity, a deep, great, genuine sincerity, is the first characteristic of all men in any way heroic.
general.author: thomas carlyle

general.quote: My chief talent is to be frank and sincere.
general.author: molère

general.quote: There should be more sincerity and heart in human relations, more silence and simplicity in our interactions. Be rude when you’re angry, laugh when something is funny, and answer when you’re asked.
general.author: anton chekhov

general.quote: We are to give in sincerity, not to make a show of our good deeds. Sincerity of purpose, real kindness of heart, is the motive that heaven values.
general.author: maxine biome

general.quote: Sincerity is the luxury allowed, like diadems and authority, only to the highest rank. Every man alone is sincere. At the entrance of a second person, hypocrisy begins.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson

general.quote: Better is the wrong with sincerity, rather than the right with falsehood.
general.author: martin farquhar tupper

general.quote: The presumption of innocence only means you don’t go right to jail.
general.author: ann coulter

general.quote: Innocence is ignorance.
general.author: madame de girardin

general.quote: But innocence has nothing to dread.
general.author: jean baptiste racine

general.quote: The temperate person’s pleasures are durable because they are regular; and all their life is calm and serene, because it is innocent.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: Innocence and mystery never dwell long together.
general.author: suzanne necker

general.quote: It’s innocence when it charms us, ignorance when it doesn’t.
general.author: mignon mclaughlin

general.quote: Ignorance is learned; innocence is forgotten.
general.author: josé bergamín

general.quote: Innocence is a flower which withers when touched, but blooms not again, though watered with tears.
general.author: lucy hooper

general.quote: Innocence is its own defense.
general.author: benjamin franklin

general.quote: Innocence is always unsuspicious.
general.author: thomas chandler haliburton

general.quote: The innocence of virgins is like milk which turns when exposed to a clap of thunder, to a tart smell, to a hot day, to the merest nothing.
general.author: honore de balzac

general.quote: It is well for the heart to be naive and the mind not to be.
general.author: anatole france

general.quote: Let our lives be pure as snow-fields, where our footsteps leave a mark, but not a stain.
general.author: madame soimonoff

general.quote: We have not the innocence of Eden; but by God’s help and Christ’s example we may have the victory of Gethsemane.
general.author: edwin hubbell chapin

general.quote: The worst of us is not without innocence, although buried deeply it might be.
general.author: walt disney

general.quote: Always the innocent are the first victims…. So it has been for ages past, so it is now.
general.author: j. k. rowling

general.quote: Innocence most often is a good fortune and not a virtue.
general.author: anatole france

general.quote: Nothing looks so like innocence as an indiscretion.
general.author: oscar wilde

general.quote: People who shut their eyes to reality simply invite their own destruction, and anyone who insists on remaining in a state of innocence long after that innocence is dead turns himself into a monster.
general.author: james baldwin

general.quote: Innocence alone dares commit certain acts of audacity. Virtue, when tutored, is as calculating as vice.
general.author: honore de balzac

general.quote: Innocence finds not near so much protection as guilt.
general.author: francois duc de la rochefoucauld

general.quote: If you would live innocently, seek solitude.
general.author: publilius syrus

general.quote: Those who are incapable of committing great crimes do not readily suspect them in others.
general.author: francois de la rochefoucauld

general.quote: He is armed without who is innocent within; be this thy screen, and this thy wall of brass.
general.author: horace

general.quote: Only the old are innocent. That is what the Victorians understood, and the Christians. Original sin is a property of the young. The old grow beyond corruption very quickly.
general.author: malcolm bradbury

general.quote: The first of all virtues is innocence; the next is modesty. If we banish modesty out of the world, she carries away with her half the virtue that is in it.
general.author: joseph addison

general.quote: The innocent seldom find an uneasy pillow.
general.author: william cowper

general.quote: It is better that ten guilty persons escape than that one innocent suffer.
general.author: william blackstone

general.quote: The essential self is innocent, and when it tastes its own innocence knows that it lives forever.
general.author: john updike

general.quote: Ignorance is not innocence but sin.
general.author: robert browning

general.quote: He’s armed without that’s innocent within.
general.author: alexander pope

general.quote: They that know no evil will suspect none.
general.author: ben jonson

general.quote: There is a heroic innocence, as well as a heroic courage.
general.author: charles de marguetel de saint-denis de saint-evremond

general.quote: Innocence always calls mutely for protection when we would be so much wiser to guard ourselves against it: innocence is like a dumb leper who has lost his bell, wandering the world, meaning no harm.
general.author: graham greene

general.quote: There is no aphrodisiac like innocence.
general.author: jean baudrillard

general.quote: When we take revenge against another, we lose some of our innocence.
general.author: patrice redd vecchione

general.quote: Innocence is the weakest defense. Innocence has a single voice that can only say over and over again, "I didn’t do it." Guilt has a thousand voices, all of them lies.
general.author: leonard f. peltier

general.quote: What narrow innocence it is for one to be good only according to the law.
general.author: seneca

general.quote: Unfortunately the innocent are always involved in any conflict. Always, everywhere, there is some voice crying from a tower.
general.author: graham greene

general.quote: The innocence that feels no risk and is taught no caution is more vulnerable than guilt, and oftener assailed.
general.author: nathaniel parker willis

general.quote: We become innocent when we are unfortunate.
general.author: jean de la fontaine, nymphes de vaux

general.quote: To be innocent is to be not guilty; but to be virtuous is to overcome our evil inclinations.
general.author: william penn

general.quote: To dread no eye and to suspect no tongue is the great prerogative of innocence–an exemption granted only to invariable virtue.
general.author: samuel johnson

general.quote: "In innocence there is no strength against evil," said Sparrowhawk, a little wryly. "But there is strength in it for good.
general.author: ursula k. le guin

general.quote: All things truly wicked start from an innocence.
general.author: ernest hemingway

general.quote: Innocence is like polished armor; it adorns and defends.
general.author: bishop robert south

general.quote: Alas! innocence is but a poor substitute for experience.
general.author: edward george earle lytton bulwer-lytton

general.quote: Happy the innocent whose equal thoughts are free from anguish as they are from faults.
general.author: edmund waller

general.quote: We each begin in innocence. We all become guilty.
general.author: leonard f. peltier

general.quote: Oh the innocent girl in her maiden teens knows perfectly well what everything means.
general.author: david herbert lawrence

general.quote: To vice, innocence must always seem only a superior kind of chicanery.
general.author: ouida

general.quote: The innocent is the person who explains nothing.
general.author: albert camus

general.quote: Now my innocence begins to weigh me down.
general.author: jean racine

general.quote: Justice is always violent to the party offending, for every man is innocent in his own eyes.
general.author: daniel defoe

general.quote: Oh, keep me innocent; make others great!
general.author: caroline matilda

general.quote: Children, I grant, should be innocent; but when the epithet is applied to men, or women, it is but a civil term for weakness.
general.author: mary wollstonecraft

general.quote: What a power there is in innocence! whose very helplessness is its safeguard: in whose presence even passion himself stands abashed, and stands worshipper at the very altar he came to despoil.
general.author: thomas moore

general.quote: A new life is innocent, like an empty page, ready for the hard lessons ahead.
general.author: gennita low

general.quote: All deception in the course of life is indeed nothing else but a lie reduced to practice, and falsehood passing from words into things.
general.author: – bishop robert south

general.quote: Fortune is a great deceiver. She sells very dear the things she seems to give us.
general.author: vincent voiture

general.quote: A computer would deserve to be called intelligent if it could deceive a human into believing that it was human.
general.author: alan turing

general.quote: A deception that elevates us is dearer than a host of low truths.
general.author: marina tsvetaeva

general.quote: Nature never deceives us; it is we who deceive ourselves.
general.author: jean-jacques rousseau

general.quote: We are never deceived; we deceive ourselves.
general.author: goethe

general.quote: Deceive not thy physician, confessor, nor lawyer.
general.author: george herbert

general.quote: Profit is sweet, even if it comes from deception.
general.author: sophocles

general.quote: Dishonesty is so grasping it would deceive God himself, were it possible.
general.author: george bancroft

general.quote: That which deceives us and does us harm, also undeceives us and does us good.
general.author: joseph roux

general.quote: The reason we bitterly hate those who deceive us is because they think they are cleverer than we are.
general.author: francois de la rochefoucauld

general.quote: When a person cannot deceive himself the chances are against his being able to deceive other people.
general.author: mark twain

general.quote: Whatever deceives men seems to produce a magical enchantment.
general.author: plato

general.quote: Self-deception is nature; hypocrisy is art.
general.author: mason cooley

general.quote: Life is the art of being well deceived.
general.author: william hazlitt

general.quote: Even good people are obliged to deceive.
general.author: greg lemond

general.quote: The essence of lying is in deception, not in words.
general.author: john ruskin

general.quote: Do not consider it proof just because it is written in books, for a liar who will deceive with his tongue will not hesitate to do the same with his pen.
general.author: maimonides

general.quote: I think people deceive themselves about themselves, particularly as they get older.
general.author: jeanette winterson

general.quote: Everyone is born sincere and dies deceivers.
general.author: marquis de vauvenargues

general.quote: We are inconsolable at being deceived by our enemies and being betrayed by our friends, yet we are often content in be being treated like that by our own selves.
general.author: francois de la rochefoucauld

general.quote: Adults find pleasure in deceiving a child. They consider it necessary, but they also enjoy it. The children very quickly figure it out and then practise deception themselves.
general.author: elias canetti

general.quote: Men who cannot deceive others are very often successful at deceiving themselves.
general.author: samuel johnson

general.quote: Tomorrow is an old deceiver, and his cheat never grows stale.
general.author: samuel johnson

general.quote: We like to be deceived.
general.author: blaise pascal

general.quote: Unlike grown ups, children have little need to deceive themselves.
general.author: goethe

general.quote: Sometimes I go about in pity for myself, and all the while a great wind is bearing me across the sky.
general.author: ojibway indian

general.quote: I’d rather have anybody’s hate than their pity.
general.author: s. e. hinton

general.quote: More helpful than all wisdom is one draught of simple human pity that will not forsake us.
general.author: george eliot

general.quote: Pity is always twinged with disgust.
general.author: daniel quinn

general.quote: Take out pity and the whole structure of our traditional morality crumbles to pieces.
general.author: frank thilly

general.quote: Pity in its embrace strangles respect.
general.author: abraham miller

general.quote: Self-pity is like a snake that gets in your brain and lays its eggs there.
