general.author: steve chandler

general.quote: Reform is born of need, not pity.
general.author: rebecca harding davis

general.quote: They tell us that "Pity is akin to Love;" if so, Pity must be a poor relation.
general.author: arthur helps

general.quote: Even your pity is like a blast of wind and the words you speak would strip a tree of its blossoms.
general.author: tulasidasa

general.quote: Pity is the most agreeable feeling among those who have little pride and no prospects of great conquests.
general.author: friedrich nietzsche

general.quote: The heart of pity is the mortal helping the mortal.
general.author: carolt t. olson

general.quote: Self-pity comes so naturally to all of us. The most solid happiness can be shaken by the compassion of a fool.
general.author: andre maurois

general.quote: Pity is often an eloquent advocate.
general.author: edward counsel

general.quote: Pity makes suffering contagious.
general.author: friedrich nietzsche

general.quote: If you wish me well, do not stand pitying me, but lend me some succour as fast as you can; for pity is but cold comfort when one is up to the chin in water, and within a hair’s breadth of starving or drowning.
general.author: aesop

general.quote: Pity is a thing often vowed, seldom felt; hatred is a thing often felt, seldom avowed.
general.author: charles caleb colton

general.quote: Pity is a noose we can hang ourselves with if we’re not careful.
general.author: jared estes

general.quote: To love with the spirit is to pity, and he who pities most loves most.
general.author: miguel de unamuno

general.quote: The deadliest feeling that can be offered to a woman is pity.
general.author: vicki baum

general.quote: Pity is treason.
general.author: maximilien robespierre

general.quote: It is when suffering finds a voice and sets our nerves quivering that this pity comes troubling us.
general.author: h. g. wells

general.quote: Pity those who nature abuses; never those who abuse nature.
general.author: richard brinsley sheridan

general.quote: A pity beyond all telling, is hid in the heart of love.
general.author: william butler yeats

general.quote: The recognition of pain and fear in others give rise in us to pity, and in our pity is our humanity, our redemption.
general.author: dean koontz

general.quote: Pity is more spectator-like than compassion; we can pity people while maintaining a safe emotional distance from them.
general.author: aaron ben-ze’ev

general.quote: Pity is the feeling which arrests the mind in the presence of whatsoever is grave and constant in human sufferings and unites it with the human sufferer.
general.author: james joyce

general.quote: Pity is an attribute of men rather than of gods.
general.author: r.p. winnington-ingram

general.quote: Pity is an emotion equally unpleasant to the bestower as to the recipient.
general.author: boleslaw prus

general.quote: To a sensitive being, pity is not seldom pain.
general.author: herman melville

general.quote: Pity is the feeling of well-intentioned people who are unable to act.
general.author: pramoedya ananta toer

general.quote: Pity is like a kind of illness that comes when it is too late and you can’t do anything about it.
general.author: rober lalonde

general.quote: All pity is self-pity.
general.author: w. h. auden

general.quote: Pity is like a swamp. The longer we stand in the muck, the more we stink.
general.author: nancy hull-mast

general.quote: It is easy to pity when once one’s vanity has been tickled.
general.author: willa cather

general.quote: Pity cost nothing and isn’t worth nothing.
general.author: josh billings

general.quote: A man who is prevented from helping by his own pity is like a man who, when he saw another blind, put out his own eyes in sorrow, instead of leading the blind.
general.author: jessie ethel sampter

general.quote: Pity is like lust … both like to masquerade as love and it’s powerfully hard to know the difference when you’re in the throes of it.
general.author: michelle black

general.quote: When Man evolved Pity, he did a queer thing–deprived himself of the power of living life as it is without wishing it to become something different.
general.author: john galsworthy

general.quote: Self-pity is like a dog eating its own vomit or a pig rolling around in its own waste.
general.author: keith cameron smith

general.quote: He best can pity who has felt the woe.
general.author: john gay

general.quote: Pity is for living, envy is for dead.
general.author: mark twain

general.quote: Pity those who don’t feel anything at all.
general.author: sarah j. maas

general.quote: We are seldom sorry for those who need and crave our pity–we reserve this for those who, by other means, make us exercise the abstract function of pity.
general.author: f. scott fitzgerald

general.quote: A woman’s pity often opens the door to love.
general.author: henry ward beecher

general.quote: Every deed of mercy and every act of charity and every thought of pity is like the balm of Gilead to our souls.
general.author: clarence darrow

general.quote: We pity in others only those evils which we have ourselves experienced.
general.author: jean-jacques rousseau

general.quote: Self-pity is like a clog in the pipe that stops the flow of life. It is the hand that takes rather than gives.
general.author: j. nicole williamson

general.quote: Pity is based in self love; it is benevolence towards those in sorrow, and its root is in a likeness to ourselves.
general.author: henry lee irwin

general.quote: Pity and friendship are two passions incompatible with each other.
general.author: oliver goldsmith

general.quote: Pity makes the world soft to the weak and noble to the strong.
general.author: edwin arnold

general.quote: No beast so fierce but knows some touch of pity.
general.author: william shakespeare

general.quote: Pity is like a knife, sometimes, and it may pierce one who employs it more shrewdly than the victim it would save.
general.author: edwin arilington robinson

general.quote: Soft pity enters an iron gate.
general.author: william shakespeare

general.quote: Pity and love are nearly allied.
general.author: edward counsel

general.quote: Those who do not complain are never pitied.
general.author: jane austen

general.quote: Pity is like eating mustard without beef.
general.author: augustus john cuthbert hare

general.quote: Dignity consists not in possessing honors, but in the consciousness that we deserve them.
general.author: aristotle

general.quote: The honors of this world, what are they but puff, and emptiness, and peril of falling?
general.author: joseph addison

general.quote: One cannot seek to uphold honor in a being that has none.
general.author: charles de lint

general.quote: Honor is self-esteem made visible in action.
general.author: ayn rand

general.quote: The law of honor is a system of rules constructed by people of fashion, and calculated to facilitate their intercourse with one another.
general.author: william paley

general.quote: A good intention does not mean honor.
general.author: francois rabelais

general.quote: Honor and fortune exist for him who always recognizes the neighborhood of the great, always feels himself in the presence of high causes.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson

general.quote: Purity is the feminine, truth the masculine, of honor.
general.author: a.w. hare and j.c. hare

general.quote: Honor is like an island, rugged and without a beach; once we have left it, we can never return.
general.author: nicholas boileau

general.quote: Honor is an old-world thing; but it smells sweet to those in whose hand it is strong.
general.author: ouida

general.quote: For one who has been honored, dishonor is worse than death.
general.author: bhagavad gita

general.quote: Honor isn’t about making the right choices. It’s about dealing with the consequences.
general.author: midori koto

general.quote: I think that we honor ourselves by honoring our past.
general.author: tom brokaw

general.quote: Honor appears to me to be an object of great importance, since men submit to every kind of labor, and undergo every sort of danger, with the desire of attaining it.
general.author: xenophon

general.quote: Honors achieved far exceed those that are created.
general.author: solon

general.quote: The fiery trials through which we pass will light us down in honor or dishonor to the latest generation.
general.author: abraham lincoln

general.quote: Honor is unstable, and seldom the same; for she feeds upon opinion, and is as fickle as her food.
general.author: charles caleb colton

general.quote: What he feels and not what he does honors a man.
general.author: johann christoph friedrich von schiller

general.quote: In whom the love of honor and praise is innate, are those who are elevated most above the brutes, and who are justly named men, and not merely human beings.
general.author: xenophon

general.quote: Honor’s a lease for life to come.
general.author: samuel butler

general.quote: No one ever lost his honor, except he who had it not.
general.author: publilius syrus

general.quote: When faith is lost, when honor dies, the man is dead.
general.author: john greenleaf whittier

general.quote: You cannot believe in honor until you have achieved it, better keep yourself clean and bright; you are the window through which you must see the world.
general.author: george bernard shaw

general.quote: What is left when honour is lost?
general.author: publilius syrus

general.quote: Rather fail with honor than succeed by fraud.
general.author: sophocles

general.quote: What can be more honorable than to have courage enough to execute the commands of reason and conscience,–to maintain the dignity of our nature, and the station assigned us?
general.author: jeremy collier

general.quote: Bullfighting is the only art in which the artist is in danger of death and in which the degree of brilliance in the performance is left to the fighter’s honor.
general.author: ernest hemingway

general.quote: There are no perfectly honorable men; but every true man has one main point of honor and a few minor ones.
general.author: george bernard shaw

general.quote: Every post is honorable in which a man can serve his country.
general.author: george washington

general.quote: The law often permits what honor prohibits.
general.author: bermard josef saurin

general.quote: To contemn all the wealth and power in the world, where they stand in competition with a man’s honor, is rather good sense than greatness of mind.
general.author: sir richard steele

general.quote: Honor is like the eye, which cannot suffer the least injury without damage; it is a precious stone, the price of which is lessened by the least flaw.
general.author: jacques benigue bossuet

general.quote: Honour is like a match, you can only use it once.
general.author: marcel pagnol, marius

general.quote: Next to living with honor is to die with honor.
general.author: christian nestell bovee

general.quote: One honor won is a surety for more.
general.author: francois duc de la rochefoucauld

general.quote: Our own heart, and not other men’s opinion, forms our true honor.
general.author: samuel taylor coleridge

general.quote: He who has lost honor can lose nothing more.
general.author: publilius syrus

general.quote: The louder he talked of his honor, the faster we counted our spoons.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson

general.quote: We treat our people like royalty. If you honor and serve the people who work for you, they will honor and serve you.
general.author: mary kay ash

general.quote: Envy honors the dead in order to insult the living.
general.author: claude a. helvétius

general.quote: Nobody can acquire honor by doing what is wrong.
general.author: thomas jefferson

general.quote: National honor is the national property of the highest value.
general.author: james monroe

general.quote: In believing in others, we are believed. In supporting others, we gain followers, and in recognizing the value of others, we are honored.
general.author: solon b. cousins

general.quote: Honor and shame from no condition rise; act well your part, there all the honor lies.
general.author: alexander pope

general.quote: In a district of ten families, there must be someone as honorable and sincere as I, but none as fond of learning.
general.author: confucius

general.quote: That nation is worthless which does not joyfully stake everything on her honor.
general.author: johann christoph friedrich von schiller

general.quote: Honor lies in honest toil.
general.author: grover cleveland

general.quote: The nation’s honor is dearer than the nation’s comfort; yes, than the nation’s life itself.
general.author: thomas woodrow wilson

general.quote: Ability without honor is useless.
general.author: marcus t cicero

general.quote: We would rather starve than sell our national honor.
general.author: indira gandhi

general.quote: The person is a poor judge who by an action can be disgraced more in failing than they can be honored in succeeding.
general.author: francis bacon

general.quote: The most tragic thing in the world is a man of genius who is not a man of honor.
general.author: george bernard shaw

general.quote: Honor is the most capricious in her rewards. She feeds us with air, and often pulls down our house, to build our monument.
general.author: charles caleb colton

general.quote: Let honor be to us as strong an obligation, as necessity is to others.
general.author: pliny the elder

general.quote: Once you pledge, don’t hedge.
general.author: nikita s. khrushchev

general.quote: When honor comes to you, be ready to take it; but reach not to seize it before it is near.
general.author: john boyle o’reilly

general.quote: Honor’s a good brooch to wear in a man’s hat at all times.
general.author: ben jonson

general.quote: Act well your part; there all honor lies.
general.author: alexander pope

general.quote: If honor be your clothing, the suit will last a lifetime; but if clothing be your honor, it will soon be worn threadbare.
general.author: william arnot

general.quote: Better to die ten thousand deaths than wound my honor.
general.author: joseph addison

general.quote: Honor has not to be won; it must only not be lost.
general.author: arthur schopenhauer

general.quote: One has honor if he holds himself to an ideal of conduct though it is inconvenient, unprofitable, or dangerous to do so.
general.author: walter lippmann

general.quote: Dishonor is like a gash on a tree trunk — instead of disappearing with age, it enlarges.
general.author: brian herbert & kevin j. anderson

general.quote: The strongest passion which I have is honor.
general.author: philip james bailey

general.quote: To those whose god is honor, disgrace alone is sin.
general.author: a.w. hare and j.c. hare

general.quote: Let my honor be without stain.
general.author: motto

general.quote: In honour I gained them, and in honour I will die with them.
general.author: lord horatio nelson

general.quote: The country’s honor must be upheld at home and abroad.
general.author: theodore roosevelt

general.quote: Honor is infinitely more valuable than positions of honor.
general.author: georg christoph lichtenberg

general.quote: Honor is but the reflection of a man’s own actions shining bright in the face of all about him, and from thence rebounding upon himself.
general.author: bishop robert south

general.quote: Content thyself to be obscurely good. When vice prevails, and impious men bear sway, the post of honor is a private station.
general.author: joseph addison

general.quote: Say not that honor is the child of boldness, nor believe thou that the hazard of life alone can pay the price of it: it is not to the action that it is due, but to the manner of performing it.
general.author: akhenaton

general.quote: What is honorable is also safest.
general.author: titus livy

general.quote: I have deserved neither so much honor nor so much disgrace.
general.author: pierre corneille

general.quote: Honour sits smiling at the sale of truth.
general.author: percy bysshe shelley

general.quote: If it be a sin to covet honor, I am the most offending soul.
general.author: william shakespeare

general.quote: Honor is simply the morality of superior men.
general.author: h.l.mencken

general.quote: Worthless is the nation that does not gladly stake its all on its honor.
general.author: johann friedrich von schiller

general.quote: Honor is the reward of virtue.
general.author: marcus t. cicero

general.quote: All men of honor are alone.
general.author: f. paul wilson

general.quote: Let us do what honor demands.
general.author: francois rabelais

general.quote: Honor is the moral conscience of the great.
general.author: sir william d’avenant

general.quote: No man of honor ever quite lives up to his code, any more than a moral man manages to avoid sin.
general.author: h. l. mencken

general.quote: The journey of high honor lies not in smooth ways.
general.author: sir philip sidney

general.quote: The best memorial for a mighty man is to gain honor ere death.
general.author: beowulf vii

general.quote: All honor’s wounds are self-inflicted.
general.author: andrew carnegie

general.quote: Honor is but an itch in youthful blood of doing acts extravagantly good.
general.author: samuel howard

general.quote: No person was ever honored for what he received. Honor has been the reward for what he gave.
general.author: calvin coolidge

general.quote: Without money honor is merely a disease.
general.author: jean racine

general.quote: I would prefer even to fail with honor than to win by cheating.
general.author: sophocles

general.quote: I love the name of honor, more than I fear death.
general.author: julius caesar

general.quote: Because there is very little honor left in American life, there is a certain built-in tendency to destroy masculinity in American men.
general.author: norman mailer

general.quote: A man of honor should never forget what he is because he sees what others are.
general.author: baltasar gracian

general.quote: Honor, thou strong idol of man’s mind.
general.author: sir philip sidney (sydney)

general.quote: Men honor men who honor their fellow men.
general.author: ken alstad

general.quote: You can be deprived of your money, your job and your home by someone else, but remember that no one can ever take away your honor.
general.author: william lyon phelps

general.quote: Honor — it was transitory and subjective, and often directly opposed to practicality.
general.author: amanda downum

general.quote: The more honor, the more danger.
general.author: aesop

general.quote: A person dishonored is worst than dead.
general.author: miguel de cervantes

general.quote: Some men think that the globe is a sponge that God puts into their hands to squeeze for their own garden or flower-pot.
general.author: henry ward beecher

general.quote: The avarice person is ever in want; let your desired aim have a fixed limit.
general.author: horace

general.quote: Nothing retains less of desire in art, in science, than this will to industry, booty, and possession.
general.author: andre breton

general.quote: Say not you know another entirely till you have divided an inheritance with him.
general.author: johann caspar lavater

general.quote: We’ve been raised to compete, to want more! More! More! It’s a way of life. It’s about greed.
general.author: sandy duncan

general.quote: If you wish to remove avarice you must remove its mother, luxuries.
general.author: marcus tullius cicero

general.quote: If a man had only his personal interest to guide his conduct, even if this guide were never to deceive him, the source of all generous actions would dry up in his heart.
general.author: anne germain de stael

general.quote: We are in danger of destroying ourselves by our greed and stupidity. We cannot remain looking inwards at ourselves on a small and increasingly polluted and overcrowded planet.
general.author: stephen hawking

general.quote: To do all the talking and not be willing to listen is a form of greed.
general.author: democritus

general.quote: There is enough in the world for everyone’s need, but not enough for everyone’s greed.
general.author: frank buchman

general.quote: Greed is the inventor of injustice as well as the current enforcer.
general.author: julian casablancas

general.quote: It is not the want, but rather abundance that creates avarice.
general.author: michel eyquem de montaigne

general.quote: A person is born with a liking for profit. If he gives way to this, it will lead him to quarrels and conflicts, and any sense of courtesy and humility will be abandoned.
general.author: confucius

general.quote: He who wishes to grow rich in a day will be hanged in a year.
general.author: leonardo da vinci

general.quote: So for a good old-gentlemanly vice, I think I must take up with avarice.
general.author: lord byron

general.quote: He who distinguishes the true savor of his food can never be a glutton; he who does not cannot be otherwise.
general.author: henry david thoreau

general.quote: He who is greedy is always in want.
general.author: horace

general.quote: The average man does not know what to do with this life, yet wants another one which will last forever.
general.author: anatole france

general.quote: Avarice is the sphincter of the heart.
general.author: matthew green

general.quote: Kill no more pigeons than you can eat.
general.author: benjamin franklin

general.quote: Men hate the individual whom they call avaricious only because nothing can be gained from him.
general.author: voltaire

general.quote: Hunger for gold is made greater as more gold is acquired.
general.author: aurelius clemens prudentius

general.quote: When money is unreasonably coveted, it is a disease of the mind which is called avarice.
general.author: marcus tullius cicero

general.quote: Greed is a bottomless pit which exhausts the person in an endless effort to satisfy the need without ever reaching satisfaction.
general.author: erich fromm

general.quote: Do not hold grain waiting for higher prices when people are hungry.
general.author: zoroaster

general.quote: For greed all nature is too little.
general.author: marcus annaeus seneca

general.quote: Greed’s worst point is its ingratitude.
general.author: marcus annaeus seneca

general.quote: Greediness of getting more deprives… the enjoyment of what it had got.
general.author: thomas sprat

general.quote: The big problem is not the haves and the have-nots — it’s the give-nots.
general.author: arnold h. glasow

general.quote: The greedy man is not content with a whole world set before him.
general.author: sadi

general.quote: Avarice is only prudence and economy pushed to excess.
general.author: paul chatfield

general.quote: Greed is all right, by the way I think greed is healthy. You can be greedy and still feel good about yourself.
general.author: ivan f. boesky

general.quote: Greed is so destructive. It destroys everything.
general.author: eartha kitt

general.quote: All good things of this world are no further good to us than as they are of use; and whatever we may heap up to give to others, we enjoy only as much as we can use, and no more.
general.author: daniel defoe

general.quote: Experience demands that man is the only animal which devours his own kind, for I can apply no milder term to the general prey of the rich on the poor.
general.author: thomas jefferson

general.quote: Greed has taken the whole universe, and nobody is worried about their soul.
general.author: little richard

general.quote: Wealth is like sea-water; the more we drink, the thirstier we become; and the same is true of fame.
general.author: arthur schopenhauer

general.quote: If your desires be endless, your cares and fears will be so too.
general.author: thomas fuller

general.quote: From the first day to this, sheer greed was the driving spirit of civilization.
general.author: friedrich engels

general.quote: Nothing makes us more vulnerable than loneliness, except greed.
general.author: thomas harris

general.quote: The avarice of mankind is insatiable.
general.author: aristotle

general.quote: Avarice, the spur of industry.
general.author: david hume

general.quote: Poverty wants some, luxury many, and avarice all things.
general.author: abraham cowley

general.quote: You show me a capitalist, and I’ll show you a bloodsucker.
general.author: malcolm x

general.quote: He is not poor that hath not much, but He who craves much.
general.author: thomas fuller

general.quote: Possession hinders enjoyment. It merely gives you the right to keep things from others; thus you gain more enemies than friends.
general.author: baltasar gracian

general.quote: Satiety is a mongrel that barks at the heels of plenty.
general.author: minna antrim

general.quote: Greed, like the love of comfort, is a kind of fear.
general.author: cyril connolly

general.quote: The problem of social organization is how to set up an arrangement under which greed will do the least harm, capitalism is that kind of a system.
general.author: milton friedman

general.quote: To me avarice seems not so much a vice as a deplorable piece of madness.
general.author: sir thomas browne

general.quote: If you ask for too much, you lose even that which you have.
general.author: isaac asimov

general.quote: Avarice is the vice of declining years.
general.author: george bancroft

general.quote: We risk all in being too greedy.
general.author: jean de la fontaine

general.quote: Riches either serve or govern the possessor.
general.author: horace

general.quote: Hate is a lack of imagination.
general.author: graham green

general.quote: I’d rather be a failure at something I love than a success at something I hate.
general.author: george burns

general.quote: Heaven has no rage, like love to hatred turned, Nor Hell a fury, like a woman scorned.
general.author: william congreve

general.quote: Hate always sells well, but for repeat trade and the long pull happiness is sounder merchandise.
general.author: robert heinlein

general.quote: Hatred does not cease by hatred, but only by love; this is the eternal rule.
general.author: buddha

general.quote: We hate some persons because we do not know them; and we will not know them, because we hate them.
general.author: charles caleb colton

general.quote: If you must hate a man for the many things about which you disagree, remember that you should also love him for the many things about which you agree.
general.author: ivan panin

general.quote: Hatred is self-punishment.
general.author: hosea ballou

general.quote: Hate misleads, fear distorts and love blinds.
general.author: tim lebbon

general.quote: If we judge love by most of its effects, it resembles rather hatred than affection.
general.author: francois de la rochefoucauld

general.quote: Hatred of the mother is familiar, but the mother’s hatred still comes as a surprise.
general.author: mason cooley

general.quote: Hatred is an affair of the heart; contempt that of the head.
general.author: arthur schopenhauer

general.quote: Hate is the consequence of fear; we fear something before we hate; a child who fears noises becomes the man who hates them.
general.author: cyril connolly

general.quote: Nothing turns to hate so bitter as what once was love.
general.author: laurell hamilton

general.quote: From the deepest desires often come the deadliest hate.
general.author: socrates

general.quote: Hate leaves ugly scars; love leaves beautiful ones.
general.author: mignon mclaughlin

general.quote: I think that hate is a thing, a feeling, that can only exist where there is no understanding.
general.author: tennessee williams

general.quote: Hatred is gained as much by good works as by evil.
general.author: niccolo machiavelli

general.quote: It is easier to hate those we love, than love those whom we have hated.
general.author: norman macdonald

general.quote: Next to meeting somebody who admires someone we admire, we all like to meet somebody who hates someone we hate.
general.author: robert elliott

general.quote: Folks never understand the folks they hate.
general.author: james russell lowell

general.quote: Others may hate you. But those who hate you don’t win, unless you hate them. And then, you destroy yourself.
general.author: richard nixon

general.quote: Love lights more fire than hate extinguishes.
general.author: ella wilcox

general.quote: We have just enough religion to make us hate, but not enough to make us love one another.
general.author: jonathan swift

general.quote: Jealousy is just love and hate at the same time.
general.author: drake

general.quote: Hatred makes us all ugly.
general.author: laurell hamilton

general.quote: Hatred is blind, as well as love.
general.author: oscar wilde

general.quote: Hatred unlocks no doors in heaven.
general.author: willian f.devault

general.quote: Hatred comes with a persistency worthy of a better cause, and clamors for possession of the citadel of the soul.
general.author: nicias cooksey

general.quote: There’s nothing in this world so sweet as love. And next to love the sweetest thing is hate.
general.author: henry wadsworth longfellow

general.quote: When we don’t know who to hate, we hate ourselves.
general.author: chuck palahniuk

general.quote: A strong hatred is the best lamp to bear in our hands as we go over the dark places of life, cutting away the dead things men tell us to revere.
general.author: rebecca west

general.quote: What we need is hatred. From it our ideas are born.
general.author: jean genet

general.quote: Love is a given, hatred is acquired.
general.author: doug horton

general.quote: If you hate a person, you hate something in him that is part of yourself. What isn’t part of ourselves doesn’t disturb us.
general.author: hermann hesse

general.quote: Hatred is the ballast of the rock which lies upon our necks and underfoot.
general.author: maya angelou

general.quote: Hatred is the atmosphere of hell.
general.author: martin tupper

general.quote: Hatred paralyzes life; love releases it. Hatred confuses life; love harmonizes it. Hatred darkens life; love illumines it.
general.author: dr. martin luther king jr.

general.quote: Darkness cannot drive out darkness; only light can do that. Hate cannot drive out hate; only love can do that.
general.author: martin luther king, jr.

general.quote: Dislike what deserves it, but never hate: for that is of the nature of malice; which is almost ever to persons, not things, and is one of the blackest qualities sin begets in the soul.
general.author: william penn

general.quote: Hatred is like fire–it makes even light rubbish deadly.
general.author: george eliot

general.quote: I met a young man who was wounded in love; I met another man who was wounded in hatred.
general.author: bob dylan

general.quote: The opposite of love is not hate; it’s indifference.
general.author: elie wiesel

general.quote: Hatred is active, and envy passive dislike; there is but one step from envy to hate.
general.author: johann wolfgang von goethe

general.quote: Hate is crystallized fear, fear’s dividend, fear objectified. We hate what we fear and so where hate is, fear will be lurking.
general.author: cyril connolly

general.quote: Lord, make me an instrument of thy peace. Where there is hatred, let me sow love.
general.author: francis of assisi

general.quote: Nothing is ever lost by courtesy. It is the cheapest of the pleasures; costs nothing and conveys much. It pleases him who gives and ;him who receives, and thus, like mercy, it is twice blessed.
general.author: erastus wiman

general.quote: The unmerciful man is most certainly an unblessed man. His sympathies are all dried up; he is afflicted with a chronic jaundice, and lives timidly and darkly in a little, narrow rat-hole of distrust.
general.author: e. h. chapin

general.quote: Think carefully before asking for justice. Mercy might be safer.
general.author: mason cooley

general.quote: it strikes me there is something greater than judgment. I think it is called mercy.
general.author: sebastian barry

general.quote: Be kind and merciful. Let no one ever come to you without leaving better and happier.
general.author: mother teresa

general.quote: Things which matter most must never be at the mercy of things which matter least.
general.author: johann wolfgang von goethe

general.quote: Kings in this world should imitate God; their mercy should be above their works.
general.author: william penn

general.quote: Christmas is not a time or a season but a state of mind. To cherish peace and good will, to be plenteous in mercy, is to have the real spirit of Christmas.
general.author: calvin coolidge

general.quote: Mercy often inflicts death.
general.author: seneca

general.quote: Mercy will get you killed, but sometimes it’s all that makes us human.
general.author: laurell k. hamilton

general.quote: No answer to prayer is an indication of our merit; every answer to prayer is an indication of God’s mercy.
general.author: john blanchard

general.quote: Among the attributes of God, although they are equal, mercy shines with even more brilliance than justice.
general.author: miguel de cervantes saavadra

general.quote: It is easy to condemn, it is better to pity.
general.author: lyman abbott

general.quote: Computers are like Old Testament gods; lots of rules and no mercy.
general.author: joseph campbell

general.quote: Amnesty is as good for those who give it as for those who receive it. It has the admirable quality of bestowing mercy on both sides.
general.author: victor hugo

general.quote: Where mercy is shown, mercy is given.
general.author: duane dog chapman

general.quote: Let us be merciful as well as just.
general.author: henry wadsworth longfellow

general.quote: I believe in the equality of man; and I believe that religious duties consist in doing justice, loving mercy, and endeavoring to make our fellow creatures happy.
general.author: thomas paine

general.quote: We simply cannot delegate the exercise of mercy and generosity to others.
general.author: margaret thatcher

general.quote: All the great things are simple, and many can be expressed in a single word: freedom, justice, honor, duty, mercy, hope.
general.author: winston churchill

general.quote: Mercy and forgiveness must be free and unmerited to the wrongdoer. If the wrongdoer has to do something to merit it, then it isn’t mercy.
general.author: timothy keller

general.quote: Mercy to living beings, self restraint, truth, honesty, chastity and contentment, right faith and knowledge, and austerity are but the entourage of morality.
general.author: sila-prabhrita

general.quote: Anyone without a sense of humor is at the mercy of everyone else.
general.author: william e. rothschild

general.quote: If the end of one mercy were not the beginning of another, we were undone.
general.author: philip henry

general.quote: I have always found that mercy bears richer fruits than strict justice.
general.author: abraham lincoln

general.quote: We shall show mercy, but we shall not ask for it.
general.author: winston churchill

general.quote: Sweet mercy is nobility’s true badge.
general.author: william shakespeare

general.quote: Saints of the early church reaped great harvests in the field of prayer and found the mercy seat to be a mine of untold treasures.
general.author: charles haddon spurgeon

general.quote: Nothing humbles and breaks the heart of a sinner like mercy and love. Souls that converse much with sin and wrath, may be much terrified; but souls that converse much with grace and mercy, will be much humbled.
general.author: thomas brooks

general.quote: Quality in a classical Greek sense is how to live with grace and intelligence, with bravery and mercy.
general.author: theodore white

general.quote: Teach me to feel another’s woe. To hide the fault I see: That the mercy I show to others; that mercy also show to me.
general.author: alexander pope

general.quote: Love, Mercy, and Grace, sisters all, attend your wounds of silence and hope.
general.author: aberjhani

general.quote: Truth and mercy require the exertion – never the suppression, of man’s noble rights and powers.
general.author: gerrit smith

general.quote: The essence of justice is mercy.
general.author: edwin hubbel chapin

general.quote: Cowards are cruel, but the brave love mercy and delight to save.
general.author: john gay

general.quote: Love has its place, as does hate. Peace has its place, as does war. Mercy has its place, as do cruelty and revenge.
general.author: meir kahane

general.quote: There are three things in the world that deserve no mercy; hypocrisy, fraud, and tyranny.
general.author: frederick w. robertson

general.quote: In case of doubt we should always lean on the side of mercy.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: Should not the giver be thankful that the receiver received? Is not giving a need? Is not receiving, mercy?
general.author: friedrich nietzsche

general.quote: The greatest attribute of Heaven is mercy.
general.author: francis beaumont and john fletcher

general.quote: We hand folks over to God’s mercy, and show none ourselves.
general.author: george eliot

general.quote: The angel of mercy, the child of love, together had flown to the realms above.
general.author: fanny crosby

general.quote: Though God’s attributes are equal, yet his mercy is more attractive and pleasing in our eyes than his justice.
general.author: miguel de cervantes

general.quote: Mercy turns her back to the unmerciful.
general.author: francis quarles

general.quote: Nothing emboldens sin so much as mercy.
general.author: william shakespeare

general.quote: Spare me through your mercy, do not punish me through your justice.
general.author: anselm of canterbury

general.quote: It is mercy, not justice or courage or even heroism, that alone can defeat evil.
general.author: peter kreeft

general.quote: Mercy is stronger than your sword.
general.author: p. c. cast

general.quote: Human judges can show mercy. But against the laws of nature, there is no appeal.
general.author: arthur c. clarke

general.quote: A man gazing on the stars is proverbially at the mercy of the puddles in the road.
general.author: alexander smith

general.quote: We do pray for mercy, and that same prayer doth teach us all to render the deeds of mercy.
general.author: william shakespeare

general.quote: Of all the characters of cruelty, I consider the most despicable the one that cloaks himself in a garb of mercy.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: The greatest firmness is the greatest mercy.
general.author: henry wadsworth longfellow

general.quote: Mercy to him that shows it, is the rule.
general.author: william cowper

general.quote: The fiercest fire is hatred.
general.author: gautama buddah

general.quote: Hatred is a cold fire, and it gives no warmth.
general.author: laurell hamilton

general.quote: You never really hate anyone as much as someone you cared about once.
general.author: cassandra clare

general.quote: Most hatred is based on fear, one way or another.
general.author: laurell hamilton

general.quote: The point is that you can’t be too greedy.
general.author: donald trump

general.quote: Avarice has ruined more souls than extravagance.
general.author: charles caleb colton

general.quote: To hazard much to get much has more of avarice than wisdom.
general.author: william penn

general.quote: Greed is all right . . . Greed is healthy. You can be greedy and still feel good about yourself.
general.author: ivan f. boesky

general.quote: No evil is honorable: but death is honorable; therefore death is not evil.
general.author: citium zeno

general.quote: Honor is the only really good disguise for an occasional act of dishonor.
general.author: tad williams

general.quote: The post of honor is a private station.
general.author: joseph addison

general.quote: For titles do not reflect honor on men, but rather men on their titles.
general.author: niccolo machiavelli

general.quote: God put self-pity by the side of despair like the cure by the side of the disease.
general.author: albert camus

general.quote: Do not scorn pity that is the gift of a gentle heart.
general.author: j. r. r. tolkien

general.quote: Such is the pure movement of nature prior to all reflection. Such is the force of natural pity.
general.author: jean-jacques rousseau

general.quote: What is pity but the vice of kindness.
general.author: emil cioran

general.quote: The art of pleasing is the art of deception.
general.author: marquis de vauvenargues

general.quote: Nothing is more common on earth than to deceive and be deceived.
general.author: johann g. seume

general.quote: The easiest person to deceive is one’s self.
general.author: edward g. bulwer-lytton

general.quote: Liars share with those they deceive the desire not to be deceived.
general.author: sissela bok

general.quote: As innocent as a new-laid egg.
general.author: sir william schwenk gilbert

general.quote: Birds do not sing in caves, nor do doves cherish their innocence in dovecots.
general.author: henry david thoreau

general.quote: One threatens the innocent who spares the guilty.
general.author: sir edward coke

general.quote: Justice is the virtue that innocence rejoiceth in.
general.author: ben jonson

general.quote: Insincerity is merely a method by which we can multiply our personalities.
general.author: oscar wilde

general.quote: It is best to be yourself, imperial, plain and true.
general.author: robert browning

general.quote: Sincerity is the way of heaven; to think how to be sincere is the way of man.
general.author: mencius

general.quote: The most exhausting thing in life is being insincere.
general.author: anne morrow lindbergh

general.quote: When you understand your obligations to God then you can understand your obligations to society.
general.author: h. rap brown

general.quote: Obligation is the bitterest thraldom.
general.author: madame suzanne curchod necker

general.quote: An obligation is something which constrains or induces us to act.
general.author: lord francis jeffrey

general.quote: There are minds so impatient of inferiority that their gratitude is a species of revenge, and they return benefits, not because recompense is a pleasure, but because obligation is a pain.
general.author: samuel johnson

general.quote: He who cannot resist temptation is not a man…. Whoever yields to temptation debases himself with a debasement from which he can never arise.
general.author: horace mann

general.quote: Every temptation is an opportunity of our getting nearer to God.
general.author: john quincy adams

general.quote: Marriage is popular because it combines the maximum of temptation with the maximum of opportunity.
general.author: george bernard shaw

general.quote: I can resist everything except temptation.
general.author: oscar wilde

general.quote: Animals do not admire each other. A horse does not admire its companion.
general.author: blaise pascal

general.quote: Admiration is a very short-lived passion that immediately decays upon growing familiar with its object, unless it be still fed with fresh discoveries, and kept alive by a new perpetual succession of miracles rising up to its view.
general.author: joseph addison quotes

general.quote: I have always been an admirer. I regard the gift of admiration as indispensable if one is to amount to something. I don’t know where I would be without it.
general.author: thomas mann

general.quote: It is better in some respects to be admired by those with whom you live than to be loved by them; and this not on account of any gratification of vanity, but because admiration is so much more tolerant than love.
general.author: sir arthur helps

general.quote: As charity covers a multitude of sins before God, so does politeness before men.
general.author: sir fulke greville

general.quote: Politeness is one half good nature and the other half good lying.
general.author: mary wilson little

general.quote: Politeness is an easy virtue, costs little, and has great purchasing power.
general.author: louisa may alcott

general.quote: Politeness is lost by anger.
general.author: al-bustii

general.quote: There is often more pride than goodness in our grief for our enemies’ miseries; it is to show how superior we are to them that we bestow on them the sign of our compassion.
general.author: francois de la rochefoucauld

general.quote: If it is not tempered by compassion, and empathy, reason can lead men and women into a moral void.
general.author: karen armstrong

general.quote: There never was any heart truly great and generous that was not also tender and compassionate.
general.author: robert south

general.quote: The whole idea of compassion is based on a keen awareness of the interdependence of all these living beings, which are all part of one another, and all involved in one another.
general.author: thomas merton

general.quote: Forgive those who have hurt you.
general.author: les brown

general.quote: To understand is to forgive, even oneself.
general.author: alexander chase

general.quote: Without forgiveness life is governed by… an endless cycle of resentment and retaliation.
general.author: roberto assagioli

general.quote: Let us forgive each other – only then will we live in peace.
general.author: leo nikolaevich tolstoy

general.quote: A human being is happiest and most successful when dedicated to a cause outside his own individual, selfish satisfaction.
general.author: benjamin spock

general.quote: Only when the money we earn is put to work for the benefit of others does it provide true satisfaction.
general.author: malcolm d. maxwell

general.quote: There is a great satisfaction in building good tools for other people to use.
general.author: freeman dyson

general.quote: Satisfaction of one’s curiosity is one of the greatest sources of happiness in life.
general.author: linus pauling

general.quote: I have been the recipient of love and service, therefore I can love and serve. There is great satisfaction in service to others, in …seeing people and their conditions change.
general.author: clarence e. hodges

general.quote: This life is not for complaint, but for satisfaction.
general.author: henry david thoreau

general.quote: You can never get enough of the things you don’t need, because the things you don’t need can never satisfy.
general.author: marvin j. ashton

general.quote: You can have peace of mind, improved health and an ever-increasing flow of energy. Life can be full of joy and satisfaction.
general.author: norman vincent peale

general.quote: Success is a peace of mind that is a direct result of self-satisfaction in knowing that you did your best to become the best you are capable of becoming.
general.author: john wooden

general.quote: You’ve got to get up every morning with determination if you’re going to go to bed with satisfaction.
general.author: geroge lorimer

general.quote: A terrace nine stories high begins with a pile of earth.
general.author: lao-tzu

general.quote: As long as I have a want, I have a reason for living. Satisfaction is death.
general.author: george bernard shaw

general.quote: I am easily satisfied with the very best.
general.author: winston churchill

general.quote: Few things are necessary to make the wise man happy while no amount of material wealth would satisfy a fool. I am not a fool.
general.author: og mandino

general.quote: The greatest masterpieces were once only pigments on a palette.
general.author: henry s. haskins

general.quote: There are proselytes from atheism, but done from superstition.
general.author: junius

general.quote: Reason shapes the future, but superstition infects the present.
general.author: iain m. banks

general.quote: Men become superstitious, not because they have too much imagination, but because they are not aware that they have any.
general.author: george santayana

general.quote: Superstition is a senseless fear of God; religion, the pious worship of God.
general.author: cicero

general.quote: It is better to err on the side of daring than the side of caution.
general.author: alvin toffler

general.quote: Throw caution to the wind and just do it.
general.author: carrie underwood

general.quote: Every step of life shows much caution is required.
general.author: goethe

general.quote: It requires as much caution to tell the truth as to conceal it.
general.author: baltasar gracian

general.quote: Be true to your own act and congratulate yourself if you have done something strange and extravagant to break the monotony of a decorous age.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson

general.quote: Today, give a stranger one of your smiles. It might be the only sunshine he sees all day.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: There is nothing so strange and so unbelievable that it has not been said by one philosopher or another.
general.author: rene descartes

general.quote: Money is a strange business. People who haven’t got it aim it strongly. People who have are full of troubles.
general.author: ayrton senna

general.quote: No one ever sowed the grain of generosity who gathered not up the harvest of the desire of his heart.
general.author: moslih eddin saadi

general.quote: There is wisdom in generosity, as in everything else.
general.author: charles haddon spurgeon

general.quote: Some people think they are generous because they give away free advice.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: Repentance is second innocence.
general.author: louis gabriel a. bonald

general.quote: To grieve over sin is one thing, to repent is another.
general.author: frederick william robertson

general.quote: Genuine repentance must bear the seal of a corrected life.
general.author: lewis f. korns

general.quote: If you have sinned, do not lie down without repentance; for the want of repentance after one has sinned makes the heart yet harder and harder.
general.author: john bunyan

general.quote: Judges ought to be more leaned than witty, more reverent than plausible, and more advised than confident. Above all things, integrity is their portion and proper virtue.
general.author: francis bacon

general.quote: Your wits make others witty.
general.author: catherine the great

general.quote: Wit makes its own welcome, and levels all distinctions.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson

general.quote: People who can’t be witty exert themselves to be devout and affectionate.
general.author: george eliot

general.quote: Music is the movement of sound to reach the soul for the education of its virtue.
general.author: plato

general.quote: I think music in itself is healing. It’s an explosive expression of humanity. It’s something we are all touched by. No matter what culture we’re from, everyone loves music.
general.author: billy joel

general.quote: You don’t need any brains to listen to music.
general.author: luciano pavarotti

general.quote: The pleasure we feel in music springs from the obedience which is in it.
general.author: henry david thoreau

general.quote: Everybody sooner or later has to drop the luggage and the baggage of illusions.
general.author: carlos santana

general.quote: The best thing about animals is they don’t talk much.
general.author: thornton wilder

general.quote: Who hears the fishes when they cry?
general.author: henry david thoreau

general.quote: The time to relax is when you don’t have time for it.
general.author: sidney j. harris

general.quote: Every once and a while, go away and take a relaxing break, and then when you come back to your work, your judgment will be better.
general.author: leonardo da vinci

general.quote: Rest is the sweet sauce of labor.
general.author: plutarch

general.quote: Enjoy the successes that you have, and don’t be too hard on yourself when you don’t do well. Too many times we beat up on ourselves. Just relax and enjoy it.
general.author: patty sheehan

general.quote: Rest is a fine medicine
general.author: thomas carlyle

general.quote: The chief secret of comfort lies in not suffering trifles to vex us, and in prudently cultivating an undergrowth of small pleasures, since very few great ones are let on long leases.
general.author: james h. aughey

general.quote: Ignorance is the softest pillow on which a man can rest his head.
general.author: michel de montaigne

general.quote: Of all created comforts, God is the lender; you are the borrower, not the owner.
general.author: samuel rutherford

general.quote: Relax, Recharge and Reflect. Sometimes it’s OK to do nothing.
general.author: izey victoria odiase

general.quote: There is no point at which you can say, "Well I am successful now, I might as well relax".
general.author: carrie fisher

general.quote: Rest is the fitting of self to its sphere.
general.author: john sullivan dwight

general.quote: Nothing gives rest but the sincere search for truth.
general.author: blaise pascal

general.quote: For too much rest becomes a pain.
general.author: homer

general.quote: A conventional good read is usually a bad read, a relaxing bath in what we know already.
general.author: malcolm bradbury

general.quote: To make the individual uncomfortable, that is my task.
general.author: friedrich wilhelm nietzsche

general.quote: The stars that have most glory have no rest.
general.author: samuel daniel

general.quote: Rest is not idleness, and to lie sometimes on the grass on a summer day listening to the murmur of water, or watching the clouds float across the sky, is hardly a waste of time.
general.author: sir john lubbock

general.quote: When God says run, don’t relax, just run. It is for a reason!
general.author: gift gugu mona

general.quote: No rest is worth anything except the rest that is earned.
general.author: jean paul richter

general.quote: No sooner do we think we have assembled a comfortable life than we find a piece of ourselves that has no place to fit in.
general.author: gail sheehy

general.quote: Rest, rest, shall I have not all eternity to rest.
general.author: antoine arnauld

general.quote: If you rest, you rust.
general.author: helen hayes

general.quote: If you need medical advice, let these three things be your physicians; a cheerful mind, relaxation from business, and a moderate diet.
general.author: schola salern

general.quote: Sometimes the most urgent thing you can possibly do is take a complete rest.
general.author: ashleigh brilliant

general.quote: He that can take rest is greater than he that can take cities.
general.author: benjamin franklin

general.quote: It is necessary to relax your muscles when you can. Relaxing your brain is fatal.
general.author: stirling moss

general.quote: They have most satisfaction in themselves, and consequently the sweetest relish of their creature comforts.
general.author: matthew

general.quote: Absence of occupation is not rest; A mind quite vacant is a mind distressed.
general.author: william cowper

general.quote: The chief secret of comfort lies in not suffering trifles to vex us, and in prudently cultivating our undergrowth of small pleasures, since very few great ones, alas! are let on long leases.
general.author: richard sharp

general.quote: He who seeks rest finds boredom. He who seeks work finds rest.
general.author: dylan thomas

general.quote: Rest when you’re weary. Refresh and renew yourself, your body, your mind, your spirit. Then get back to work.
general.author: ralph marston

general.quote: What is without periods of rest will not endure.
general.author: ovid

general.quote: The bourgeois prefers comfort to pleasure, convenience to liberty, and a pleasant temperature to the deathly inner consuming fire.
general.author: hermann hesse

general.quote: Man is so made that he can only find relaxation from one kind of labor by taking up another.
general.author: anatole france

general.quote: It is in human nature to relax, when not compelled by personal advantage or disadvantage.
general.author: goethe

general.quote: Get out of the blocks, run your race, stay relaxed. If you run your race, you’ll win. Channel your energy. Focus.
general.author: carol lewis

general.quote: It is requisite for the relaxation of the mind that we make use, from time to time, of playful deeds and jokes.
general.author: thomas aquinas

general.quote: Comfort and indolence are cronies.
general.author: thomas hood

general.quote: The lust for comfort, that stealthy thing that enters the house a guest and then becomes a host, and then a master.
general.author: kahlil gibran

general.quote: Good, better, best. Never let it rest. ‘Til your good is better and your better is best.
general.author: st. jerome

general.quote: The word "rest" is not in my vocabulary.
general.author: horace greeley

general.quote: Your mind will answer most questions if you learn to relax and wait for the answer.
general.author: william s. burroughs

general.quote: Work is man’s most natural form of relaxation.
general.author: dagobert d. runes

general.quote: Too much rest becomes a pain.
general.author: homer

general.quote: Men who pass most comfortably through this world are those who possess good digestions and hard hearts.
general.author: harriet martineau

general.quote: Rest is a good thing, but boredom is its brother.
general.author: voltaire

general.quote: You can’t use up creativity. The more you use, the more you have.
general.author: maya angelou

general.quote: It is better to create than to learn! Creating is the essence of life.
general.author: julius caesar

general.quote: The creative mind plays with the objects it loves.
general.author: carl jung

general.quote: To create, you must empty yourself of every artistic thought.
general.author: gilbert george

general.quote: The computer offers another kind of creativity. You cannot ignore the creativity that computer technology can bring. But you need to be able to move between those two different worlds.
general.author: tadao ando

general.quote: Creativity seems to emerge from multiple experiences, coupled with a well-supported development of personal resources, including a sense of freedom to venture beyond the known.
general.author: loris malaguzzi

general.quote: Creativity requires the courage to let go of certainties.
general.author: erich fromm

general.quote: Creative powers can just as easily turn out to be destructive. It rests solely with the moral personality whether they apply themselves to good things or to bad. And if this is lacking, no teacher can supply it or take its place.
general.author: carl jung

general.quote: Creativity has more to do with the elimination of the inessential than with inventing something new.
general.author: helmut jahn

general.quote: Our senses are indeed our doors and windows on this world, in a very real sense the key to the unlocking of meaning and the wellspring of creativity.
general.author: jean houston

general.quote: All works of art are commissioned in the sense that no artist can create one by a simple act of will but must wait until what he believes to be a good idea for a work "comes" to him.
general.author: w. h. auden

general.quote: Creativity becomes more visible when adults try to be more attentive to the cognitive processes of children than to the results they achieve in various fields of doing and understanding.
general.author: loris malaguzzi

general.quote: You can’t suppress creativity, you can’t suppress innovation.
general.author: james daly

general.quote: Creativity is thinking up new things. Innovation is doing new things.
general.author: theodore levitt

general.quote: One of your most powerful inner resources is your own creativity. Be willing to try on something new and play the game full-out.
general.author: marcia wieder

general.quote: Anxiety is part of creativity, the need to get something out, the need to be rid of something or to get in touch with something within.
general.author: david duchovny

general.quote: The worst enemy to creativity is self-doubt.
general.author: sylvia plath

general.quote: A truly creative person rids him or herself of all self-imposed limitations.
general.author: gerald g. jampolsky

general.quote: Creativity is merely a plus name for regular activity. Any activity becomes creative when the doer cares about doing it right, or better.
general.author: john updike

general.quote: Without this playing with fantasy no creative work has ever yet come to birth. The debt we owe to the play of the imagination is incalculable.
general.author: carl jung

general.quote: Creativity is the sudden cessation of stupidity.
general.author: edwin h. land

general.quote: There is only one answer to destructiveness and that is creativity.
general.author: sylvia ashton warner

general.quote: Some people use things; they destroy. You’re a creator, a builder.
general.author: amelia atwater-rhodes

general.quote: You can’t fake creativity, competence, or sexual arousal.
general.author: doug coupland

general.quote: Our current obsession with creativity is the result of our continued striving for immortality in an era when most people no longer believe in an after-life.
general.author: arianna stassinopoulos

general.quote: It is the creative potential itself in human beings that is the image of God.
general.author: mary daly

general.quote: God is creating at every moment of the world’s existence in and through the perpetually endowed creativity of the very stuff of the world.
general.author: arthur peacocke

general.quote: The power in which we must have faith if we would be well, is the creative and curative power which exists in every living thing.
general.author: john kellogg

general.quote: Responsibility is what awaits outside the Eden of Creativity.
general.author: nadine gordimer

general.quote: To creates omething you must be something.
general.author: goethe

general.quote: Creativity is a highfalutin’ word for the work I have to do between now and Tuesday.
general.author: ray kroc

general.quote: To live a creative life, we must lose our fear of being wrong.
general.author: joseph chilton pierce

general.quote: There is no doubt that creativity is the most important human resource of all. Without creativity, there would be no progress, and we would be forever repeating the same patterns.
general.author: edward de bono

general.quote: Creativity can solve almost any problem. The creative act, the defeat of habit by originality, overcomes everything.
general.author: george lois

general.quote: Creativity comes from awakening and directing men’s higher natures, which originate in the primal depths of the universe and are appointed by Heaven.
general.author: i ching

general.quote: My parents always pushed creativity on us, but they made it seem like the fun thing to do.
general.author: gwen stefani

general.quote: The thing that makes a creative person is to be creative and that is all there is to it.
general.author: edward albee

general.quote: Technology is driving the innovation. Technology is driving the creativity. Technology and the use of that is going to determine our workers’ ability to compete in the 21st century global marketplace.
general.author: ron kind

general.quote: Creative minds have always been known to survive any kind of bad training.
general.author: anna freud

general.quote: Creativity involves breaking out of established patterns in order to look at things in a different way.
general.author: edward de bono

general.quote: It seems safe to say that significant discovery, really creative thinking, does not occur with regard to problems about which the thinker is lukewarm.
general.author: mary henle

general.quote: The whole difference between construction and creation is this; that a thing constructed can only be loved after it is constructed; but a thing created is loved before it exists.
general.author: charles dickens

general.quote: The lash may force men to physical labor, it cannot force them to spiritual creativity.
general.author: sholem asch

general.quote: A hunch is creativity trying to tell you something.
general.author: frank capra

general.quote: Teaching creativity to your child isn’t like teaching good manners. No one can paint a masterpiece by bowing to another person’s precepts about elbows on the table.
general.author: gurney williams iii

general.quote: Clean out a corner of your mind and creativity will instantly fill it.
general.author: dee hock

general.quote: I must create a system or be enslaved by another man’s; I will not reason and compare: my business is to create.
general.author: william blake

general.quote: Chaos in the world brings uneasiness, but it also allows the opportunity for creativity and growth.
general.author: tom barrett

general.quote: Mystery is at the heart of creativity. That, and surprise.
general.author: julia cameron

general.quote: Creativity is an advertising agency’s most valuable asset, because it is the rarest.
general.author: jef i. richards

general.quote: Truly creative people care a little about what they have done, and a lot about what they are doing. Their driving focus is the life force that surges in them now.
general.author: alan cohen

general.quote: True creativity often starts where language ends.
general.author: arthur koestler

general.quote: Creativity makes a leap, then looks to see where it is.
general.author: mason cooley

general.quote: My theory about creativity is that the more money one has, the more creative one can be.
general.author: robert mapplethorpe

general.quote: Every single thing you see on-screen came out of somebody’s creativity. It doesn’t exist. Nature didn’t deliver it to us. Everything had to be dreamed.
general.author: jeffrey katzenberg

general.quote: The things we fear most in organizations — fluctuations, disturbances, imbalances — are the primary sources of creativity.
general.author: margaret j. wheatley

general.quote: We live at a time when man believes himself fabulously capable of creation, but he does not know what to create.
general.author: jose ortega y gasset

general.quote: You cannot teach creativity– how to become a good writer. But you can help a young writer discover within himself what kind of writer he would like to be.
general.author: mario vargas llosa

general.quote: Creativity is inventing, experimenting, growing, taking risks, breaking rules, making mistakes, and having fun.
general.author: mary lou cook

general.quote: The legs are the wheels of creativity.
general.author: albert einstein

general.quote: Creativity and artistic endeavors have a mission that goes far beyond just making music for the sake of music.
general.author: herbie hancock

general.quote: Most people die before they are fully born. Creativeness means to be born before one dies.
general.author: erich fromm

general.quote: The secret to creativity is knowing how to hide your sources.
general.author: albert einstein

general.quote: It is the child in man that is the source of his uniqueness and creativeness, and the playground is the optimal milieu for the unfolding of his capacities and talents.
general.author: eric hoffer

general.quote: Our task, regarding creativity, is to help children climb their own mountains, as high as possible. No one can do more.
general.author: loris malaguzzi

general.quote: Can anybody be given a great degree of creativity? No. They can be given the equipment to develop it-if they have it in them in the first place.
general.author: george shearing

general.quote: Creativity is more than just being different. Anybody can plan weird; that’s easy. What’s hard is to be as simple as Bach. Making the simple, awesomely simple, that’s creativity.
general.author: charles mingus

general.quote: What is originality? Undetected plagiarism.
general.author: william ralph inge

general.quote: Originality depends only on the character of the drawing and the vision peculiar to each artist.
general.author: georges seurat

general.quote: Every man is an original and solitary character. None can either understand or feel the book of his own life like himself.
general.author: richard cecil

general.quote: Originality consists in trying to be like everybody else and failing.
general.author: raymond radiguet

general.quote: Anoriginal artist is unable to copy. So he has only to copy in order to be original.
general.author: jean cocteau

general.quote: It takes a courageous fool to say things that have not been said and to do things that have not been done.
general.author: criss jami

general.quote: Originality does not consist in saying what no one has ever said before, but in saying exactly what you think yourself.
general.author: james stephens

general.quote: Originality is the fine art of remembering what you hear but forgetting where you heard it.
general.author: laurence j. peter

general.quote: No man can climb out beyond the limitations of his own character.
general.author: john morley

general.quote: The most original of authors are not so because they advance what is new, but more because they know how to say something, as if it had never been said before.
general.author: goethe

general.quote: There is just one life for each of us: our own.
general.author: euripides

general.quote: Originality is simply a pair of fresh eyes.
general.author: thomas wentworth higginson

general.quote: Originality usually amounts only to plagiarizing something unfamiliar.
general.author: katharine fullerton gerould

general.quote: Originality is independence, not rebellion; it is sincerity, not antagonism.
general.author: george henry lewes

general.quote: When there is an original sound in the world, it makes a hundred echoes.
general.author: john a. shedd

general.quote: It takes courage to grow up and become who you really are.
general.author: e.e. cummings

general.quote: All the knowledge I possess everyone else can acquire, but my heart is all my own.
general.author: goethe

general.quote: Utter originality is, of course, out of the question.
general.author: ezra pound

general.quote: But it is better to fail in originality than to succeed in imitation.
general.author: herman melville

general.quote: Cinema reflects culture and there is no harm in adapting technology, but not at the cost of losing your originality.
general.author: jackie chan

general.quote: Give up on trying to be original. Every song has been sung, every picture has been painted, and every story has been told. The best one can do is sing, draw, or tell it again well.
general.author: evan mandery

general.quote: You were born an original. Don’t die a copy.
general.author: john mason

general.quote: What is the point of being on this Earth if you are going to be like everyone else?
general.author: arnold schwarzenegger

general.quote: Best be yourself, imperial, plain and true!
general.author: robert browning

general.quote: The greater intellect one has, the more originality one finds in men. Ordinary persons find no difference between men.
general.author: blaise pascal

general.quote: Originality is not seen in single words or even in sentences. Originality is the sum total of a man’s thinking or his writing.
general.author: isaac bashevis singer

general.quote: The prerequisite of originality is the art of forgetting, at the proper moment, what we know.
general.author: arthur koestler

general.quote: It is the chiefest point of happiness that a man is willing to be what he is.
general.author: desiderius erasmus

general.quote: Originality is the essence of true scholarship. Creativity is the soul of the true scholar.
general.author: nnamdi azikiwe

general.quote: About the most originality that any writer can hope to achieve honestly is to steal with good judgment.
general.author: josh billings

general.quote: A man is original when he speaks the truth that has always been known to all good men.
general.author: patrick kavanagh

general.quote: Originality implies being bold enough to go beyond accepted norms.
general.author: anthony storr

general.quote: The beauty is that through disappointment you can gain clarity, and with clarity comes conviction and true originality.
general.author: conan o’brien

general.quote: One couldn’t carry on life comfortably without a little blindness to the fact that everything has been said better than we can put it ourselves.
general.author: george eliot

general.quote: One’s real life is often the life that one does not lead.
general.author: oscar wilde

general.quote: Follow your inner moonlight; don’t hide the madness.
general.author: allen ginsberg

general.quote: The most important kind of freedom is to be what you really are.
general.author: jim morrison

general.quote: The man with a new idea is a crank until the idea succeeds.
general.author: mark twain

general.quote: A thought is often original, though you have uttered it a hundred times.
general.author: oliver wendell holmes

general.quote: True originality consists not in a new manner but in a new vision.
general.author: edith wharton

general.quote: We all wear masks, and the time comes when we cannot remove them without removing some of our own skin.
general.author: andré berthiaume

general.quote: It is better to be hated for what you are than to be loved for something you are not.
general.author: andre gide

general.quote: A poor original is better than a good imitation.
general.author: ella wheeler wilcox

general.quote: If you would create something, you must be something.
general.author: goethe

general.quote: The originality of a subject is in its treatment.
general.author: benjamin disraeli

general.quote: Let us not forget that the greatest composers were also the greatest thieves. They stole from everyone and everywhere.
general.author: pablo casals

general.quote: Your time is limited, so don’t waste it living someone else’s life.
general.author: steve jobs

general.quote: Just keep thinking about the good side of ADD – the creativity and the originality it can stimulate.
general.author: david neeleman

general.quote: "Be yourself" is about the worst advice you can give some people.
general.author: tom masson

general.quote: No man knows himself as an original.
general.author: washington allston

general.quote: A man of great common sense and good taste – meaning thereby a man without originality or moral courage.
general.author: george bernard shaw

general.quote: Knowing how to paint and to use one’s colors rightly has not any connection with originality. This originality consists in properly expressing your own impressions.
general.author: thomas couture

general.quote: What the world calls originality is only an unaccustomed method of tickling it.
general.author: george bernard shaw

general.quote: Originality exists in every individual because each of us differs from the others. We are all primary numbers divisible only by ourselves.
general.author: jean guitton

general.quote: As a rule, I am very careful to be shallow and conventional where depth and originality are wasted.
general.author: lucy maud montgomery

general.quote: He who trims himself to suit everyone will soon whittle himself away.
general.author: raymond hull

general.quote: The more original a discovery, the more obvious it seems afterwards.
general.author: arthur koestler

general.quote: Originality is the art of concealing your source.
general.author: franklin p. jones

general.quote: Originality is what distinguishes art from craft. It is the yardstick of artistic greatness.
general.author: horst w. janson

general.quote: The secret of all effective originality in advertising is not the creation of new and tricky words and pictures, but one of putting familiar words and pictures into new relationships.
general.author: leo burnett

general.quote: Nearly all our originality comes from the stamp that time impresses upon our sensibility.
general.author: charles baudelaire

general.quote: Some writers confuse authenticity, which they ought always to aim at, with originality, which they should never bother about.
general.author: w. h. auden

general.quote: Great men are more distinguished by range and extent than by originality.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson

general.quote: Man is least himself when he talks in his own person. Give him a mask, and he will tell you the truth.
general.author: oscar wilde

general.quote: All thoughtful men are solitary and original in themselves.
general.author: james russell lowell

general.quote: Mistakes are the only universal form of originality.
general.author: mason cooley

general.quote: What a good thing Adam had. When he said a good thing he knew nobody had said it before.
general.author: mark twain

general.quote: Originality is the one thing which unoriginal minds cannot feel the use of.
general.author: john stuart mill

general.quote: It is better to fail in originality than to succeed in imitation.
general.author: herman melville

general.quote: Originality is… a by-product of sincerity.
general.author: marianne moore

general.quote: God has given you one face, and you make yourself another.
general.author: william shakespeare

general.quote: Almost all absurdity of conduct arises from the imitation of those whom we cannot resemble.
general.author: samuel johnson

general.quote: Originality is the best form of rebellion.
general.author: mike sasso

general.quote: The principle mark of genius is not perfection but originality, the opening of new frontiers.
general.author: arthur koestler

general.quote: Originality is nothing but judicious imitation. The most original writers borrowed one from another.
general.author: voltaire

general.quote: Almost every man wastes part of his life in attempts to display qualities which he does not possess, and to gain applause which he cannot keep.
general.author: samuel johnson

general.quote: I’ll develop my own image. I’m an original man. A one and only. I just need some help.
general.author: sam shepard

general.quote: That which is original creates a new origin. That which is original, by definition, must stay off the previously worn paths. It must wander; it must err.
general.author: blake charlton

general.quote: If they haven’t heard it before it’s original.
general.author: gene fowler

general.quote: If you cannot be a poet, be the poem.
general.author: david carradine

general.quote: The world in general doesn’t know what to make of originality; it is startled out of its comfortable habits of thought, and its first reaction is one of anger.
general.author: w. somerset maugham

general.quote: If God had wanted me otherwise, He would have created me otherwise.
general.author: goethe

general.quote: Be who you are and say what you feel, because those who mind don’t matter and those who matter don’t mind.
general.author: dr. seuss

general.quote: We are what we pretend to be, so we must be careful about what we pretend to be.
general.author: kurt vonnegut

general.quote: As long as we live, there is never enough singing.
general.author: martin luther

general.quote: I don’t sing because I’m happy; I’m happy because I sing.
general.author: william james

general.quote: O, she will sing the savageness out of a bear!
general.author: william shakespeare

general.quote: Singing has nothing to do with the affairs of this world: it is not for the law. Singers are merry, and free from sorrows and cares.
general.author: martin luther

general.quote: Of all the wonders of nature, a tree in summer is perhaps the most remarkable; with the possible exception of a moose singing "Embraceable You" in spats.
general.author: woody allen

general.quote: [H]e sang words without sense, but their tone went to his heart…
general.author: jean paul friedrich richter

general.quote: They sing, they will pay.
general.author: jules mazarin
