general.quote: The singer has everything within him. The notes come out from his very life. They are not materials gathered from outside.
general.author: rabindranath tagore

general.quote: There’s no half-singing in the shower, you’re either a rock star or an opera diva.
general.author: josh groban

general.quote: Sing out loud in the car even, or especially, if it embarrasses your children.
general.author: marilyn penland

general.quote: God respects me when I work; but God loves me when I sing.
general.author: rabindranath tagore

general.quote: That which is not worth speaking they sing.
general.author: pierre auguste caron de beaumarchais

general.quote: Birds sing after a storm; why shouldn’t people feel as free to delight in whatever remains to them?
general.author: rose f. kennedy

general.quote: He who sings frightens away his ills.
general.author: miguel de cervantes

general.quote: Singing has always seemed to me the most perfect means of expression. It is so spontaneous. And after singing, I think the violin. Since I cannot sing, I paint.
general.author: georgia o’keeffe

general.quote: A cat will teach her young ones all the tricks, except how to jump backwards.
general.author: netherlands antillean

general.quote: The cleverest trick of the Devil is that nobody believes in him. It. Her. Well, we have been very stupid.
general.author: doris lessing

general.quote: The fox has many tricks. The hedgehog has but one. But that is the best of all.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson

general.quote: Success can also cause misery. The trick is not to be surprised when you discover it doesn’t bring you all the happiness and answers you thought it would.
general.author: prince

general.quote: Little by little does the trick.
general.author: aesop

general.quote: No matter how lonely you get or how many birth announcements you receive, the trick is not to get frightened. There’s nothing wrong with being alone.
general.author: wendy wasserstein

general.quote: Love is only a dirty trick played on us to achieve continuation of the species.
general.author: w. somerset maugham

general.quote: Anyone can be great with money. With money, greatness is not a talent but an obligation. The trick is to be great without money.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: I want men to admire me, but that’s a trick you learn at school–a movement of the eyes, a tone of voice, a touch of the hand on the shoulder or the head. If they think you admire them, they will admire you because of your good taste, and when they admire you, you have an illusion for a moment that there’s something to admire.
general.author: graham green

general.quote: When in doubt, win the trick.
general.author: edmund hoyle

general.quote: Vanity plays lurid tricks with our memory.
general.author: joseph conrad

general.quote: One of the tricks of life is to have sense and money in roughly equal proportions.
general.author: craig brown

general.quote: Art doesn’t just happen by accident. It is about pulling out new tricks and trying new things.
general.author: nicholas meyer

general.quote: There just isn’t any pleasing some people. The trick is to stop trying.
general.author: joel rosenberg

general.quote: The nice thing about being a writer is that you can make magic happen without learning tricks.
general.author: humphrey carpenter

general.quote: I believe that only one person in a thousand knows the trick of really living in the present.
general.author: storm jameson

general.quote: The trick is to be grateful when your mood is high and graceful when it is low.
general.author: richard carlson

general.quote: I have the feeling that in a balanced life one should die penniless. The trick is dismantling.
general.author: art garfunkel

general.quote: Discipline and unconditional support is earned by understanding and trust and inclusion. Not by isolation, not by nasty tricks.
general.author: colm keaveney

general.quote: It is a trick among the dishonest to offer sacrifices that are not needed or not possible, to avoid making those that are required.
general.author: ivan goncharov

general.quote: Men have a trick of coming up to what is expected of them, good or bad.
general.author: jacob riis

general.quote: The notion of a universality of human experience is a confidence trick and the notion of a universality of female experience is a clever confidence trick.
general.author: angela carter

general.quote: Misfortune always comes to those who wait. The trick is to find happiness in the brief gaps between disasters.
general.author: christopher paolini

general.quote: Happiness is a gift and the trick is not to expect it, but to delight in it when it comes.
general.author: charles dickens

general.quote: The trick is growing up without growing old.
general.author: casey stengel

general.quote: In every marriage more than a week old, there are grounds for divorce. The trick is to find and continue to find grounds for marriage.
general.author: rober woodruff anderson

general.quote: Don’t just learn the tricks of the trade. Learn the trade.
general.author: james bennis

general.quote: A kiss is a lovely trick designed by nature to stop speech when words become superfluous.
general.author: ingrid bergman

general.quote: Setting goals for your game is an art. The trick is in setting them at the right level neither too low nor too high.
general.author: greg norman

general.quote: Religion is like magic. It is all about tricks.
general.author: michel onfray

general.quote: The trick to great romance is in overcoming adversity. In realizing that love is worth some uphill climbs.
general.author: sarah maclean

general.quote: A joke is not a thing but a process, a trick you play on the listener’s mind. You start him off toward a plausible goal, and then by a sudden twist you land him nowhere at all or just where he didn’t expect to go.
general.author: max eastman

general.quote: Tricks and treachery are the practice of fools, that don’t have brains enough to be honest.
general.author: benjamin franklin

general.quote: You must not fight too often with one enemy, or you will teach him all your tricks of war.
general.author: napoleon bonaparte

general.quote: Some people carry their heart in their head and some carry their head in their heart. The trick is to keep them apart yet working together.
general.author: david hare

general.quote: Writing is an act of faith, not a trick of grammar.
general.author: elwyn brooks white

general.quote: The trick is to make sure you don’t die waiting for prosperity to come.
general.author: lee iacocca

general.quote: Talent is always queer-tempered.
general.author: mary elizabeth braddon

general.quote: Tremendous amounts of talent are lost to our society just because that talent wears a skirt.
general.author: shirley chisholm

general.quote: Winning takes talent, to repeat takes character.
general.author: john wooden

general.quote: The world is always ready to receive talent with open arms. Very often it does not know what to do with genius.
general.author: oliver wendell holmes

general.quote: Talents go by nature not by birth.
general.author: frederick ii

general.quote: The greatest talents often lie buried out of sight.
general.author: titus maccius plautus

general.quote: Use what talents you possess; the woods would be very silent if no birds sang there except those that sang best.
general.author: henry van dyke

general.quote: Talent wins games, but teamwork and intelligence wins championships.
general.author: michael jordan

general.quote: However you make your living is where your talent lies.
general.author: ernest hemingway

general.quote: We each after a while have to become reconciled to what it is that our talents and appetites lead us to.
general.author: tobias wolff

general.quote: Concealed talent brings no reputation.
general.author: desiderius erasmus

general.quote: I have had enough success for two lifetimes. My success is talent put together with hard work and luck.
general.author: kareem abdul-jabbar

general.quote: Everyone has talent. What is rare is the courage to follow the talent to the dark place where it leads.
general.author: erica jong

general.quote: Middle age snuffs out more talent than even wars or sudden death.
general.author: gerald brenan

general.quote: To do easily what is difficult for others is the mark of talent. To do what is impossible for talent is the mark of genius.
general.author: henri frederic amiel

general.quote: Talent isn’t genius, and no amount of energy can make it so. I want to be great, or nothing.
general.author: louisa may alcott

general.quote: Talent is never static. It’s always growing or dying.
general.author: stephen king

general.quote: Every man has his own vocation, talent is the call.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson

general.quote: Talent is commonly developed at the expense of character.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson

general.quote: Hard work without talent is a shame, but talent without hard work is a tragedy.
general.author: robert half

general.quote: It takes little talent to see clearly what lies under one’s nose, a good deal of it to know in which direction to point that organ.
general.author: w. h. auden

general.quote: It is unfortunate that superior talent and superior men are so seldom united.
general.author: marie von ebner-eschenbach

general.quote: A really great talent finds its happiness in execution.
general.author: goethe

general.quote: I believe that every person is born with talent.
general.author: maya angelou

general.quote: Talent develops in quiet places, character in the full current of human life.
general.author: goethe

general.quote: Talent hits a target no one else can hit; genius hits a target no one else can see.
general.author: arthur schopenhauer

general.quote: Genius is the gold in the mine; talent is the miner who works and brings it out.
general.author: marguerite gardiner

general.quote: Talent works, genius creates.
general.author: robert schumann

general.quote: Where your talents and the needs of the world cross, there lies your vocation.
general.author: aristotle

general.quote: To do easily what is difficult for others is the mark of talent.
general.author: henri-frederic amiel

general.quote: Talent is only the starting point.
general.author: irving berlin

general.quote: Hidden talent counts for nothing.
general.author: nero

general.quote: Everyone has talent at twenty-five. The difficulty is to have it at fifty.
general.author: edward degas

general.quote: There is no such thing as a great talent without great will-power.
general.author: honore de balzac

general.quote: There are two kinds of talent; man-made talent and God-given talent. With man-made talent, you have to work very hard. With God-given talent, you just touch it up once in a while.
general.author: pearl bailey

general.quote: It is a happy talent to know how to play.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson

general.quote: Those who are blessed with the most talent don’t necessarily outperform everyone else. It’s the people with follow-through who excel.
general.author: mary kay ash

general.quote: Everyone has special talents, and it is our duty to find ours and use them well.
general.author: john templeton

general.quote: It is not always the highest talent that thrives best. Mediocrity, with tact, will outweigh talent oftentimes.
general.author: joseph cook

general.quote: Your talent is God’s gift to you; what you do with it is your gift to God.
general.author: leo buscaglia

general.quote: Talent is nothing but a prolonged period of attention and a shortened period of mental assimilation.
general.author: konstantin stanislavisky

general.quote: Talent is always conscious of its own abundance, and does not object to sharing.
general.author: alexander solzhenitsyn

general.quote: There is no substitute for talent. Industry and all the virtues are of no avail.
general.author: aldous huxley

general.quote: Brevity is the sister of talent.
general.author: anton chekhov

general.quote: It takes people a long time to learn the difference between talent and genius, especially ambitious young men and women.
general.author: louisa may alcott

general.quote: Use those talents you have. You will make it. You will give joy to the world. Take this tip from nature: the woods would be a very silent place if no birds sang except those who sang best.
general.author: bernard meltzer

general.quote: This is how I define talent; it is a gift that God has given us in secret, which we reveal without knowing it.
general.author: charles de montesquieu

general.quote: I’d rather have a lot of talent and a little experience than a lot of experience and a little talent.
general.author: john wooden

general.quote: Not he deserves praise that has talents, but he that uses them.
general.author: ivan panin

general.quote: A talent somewhat above mediocrity, shrewd and not too sensitive, is more likely to rise in the world than genius.
general.author: charles horton cooley

general.quote: The true eye for talent presupposes the true reverence for it.
general.author: thomas carlyle

general.quote: It is a proof of great talents to recall the mind from the senses, and to separate thought from habit.
general.author: cicero

general.quote: Doing easily what others find difficult is talent; doing what is impossible for talent is genius.
general.author: henri-frederic amiel

general.quote: Exceptional talent does not always win its reward unless favored by exceptional circumstances.
general.author: mary elizabeth braddon

general.quote: Genius does what it must, and Talent does what it can.
general.author: owen meredith

general.quote: Talent is a tenant in the house owned by genius.
general.author: austin o’malley

general.quote: Some bad qualities form great talents.
general.author: francois de la rochefoucauld

general.quote: The man who is born with a talent which he was meant to use finds his greatest happiness in using it.
general.author: goethe

general.quote: No one respects a talent that is concealed.
general.author: desiderius erasmus

general.quote: I don’t have a lot of respect for talent; talent is genetic. It’s what you do with it that counts.
general.author: martin ritt

general.quote: Talent is what you possess; genius is what possesses you.
general.author: malcolm cowley

general.quote: Mediocrity knows nothing higher than itself, but talent instantly recognizes genius.
general.author: sir arthur conan doyle

general.quote: Talent for talents’ sake is a bauble and a show. Talent working with joy in the cause of universal truth lifts the possessor to new power as a benefactor.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson

general.quote: The talent for being happy is appreciating and liking what you have, instead of what you don’t have.
general.author: woody allen

general.quote: A little magic can take you a long way.
general.author: roald dahl

general.quote: Parents can plant magic in a child’s mind through certain words spoken with some thrilling quality of voice, some uplift of the heart and spirit.
general.author: robert macneil

general.quote: Disbelief in magic can force a poor soul into believing in government and business.
general.author: tom robbins

general.quote: Speeches are not magic and there is no great speech without great policy.
general.author: peggy noonan

general.quote: Effective magic is transcendent nature.
general.author: george eliot

general.quote: The magic formula that successful businesses have discovered is to treat customers like guests and employees like people.
general.author: thomas j. peters

general.quote: It’s just like magic. When you live by yourself, all your annoying habits are gone!
general.author: merrill markoe

general.quote: A child’s kiss is magic. Why else would they be so stingy with them?
general.author: harvey fierstein

general.quote: If we are to have magical bodies, we must have magical minds.
general.author: wayne dyer

general.quote: Where there is woman, there is magic.
general.author: ntozake shange

general.quote: We do not need magic to change the world. We carry all the power we need inside ourselves already: we have the power to imagine better.
general.author: j. k. rowling

general.quote: Real magic in relationships means an absence of judgment of others.
general.author: wayne dyer quotes

general.quote: Believe…and the magic will follow.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: Magic is the science and art of causing change to occur in conformity with the Will.
general.author: aleister crowley

general.quote: Magic is believing in yourself. If you can do that, you can make anything happen.
general.author: foka gomez

general.quote: And where does magic come from? I think that magic’s in the learning.
general.author: dar williams

general.quote: Mystery is the basic appeal of magic. Once the secrets are known, the magician becomes a mere manipulator, an actor in a suspense drama which has little impact because the audience knows the ending in advance.
general.author: milbourne christopher

general.quote: We must not let daylight in upon the magic.
general.author: walter bagehot

general.quote: True magic is the art and science of changing states of mind at will.
general.author: douglas monroe

general.quote: Believe in love. Believe in magic. Hell, believe in Santa Clause. Believe in others. Believe in yourself. Believe in your dreams. If you don’t, who will?
general.author: jon bon jovi

general.quote: Success is neither magical or mysterious. Success is the natural consequence of consistently applying the basic fundamentals.
general.author: jim rohn

general.quote: Big dreams create the magic that stir men’s souls to greatness.
general.author: bill mccartney

general.quote: The universe is full of magical things patiently waiting for our wits to grow sharper.
general.author: eden phillpotts

general.quote: Any sufficiently advanced technology is indistinguishable from magic.
general.author: arthur c. clarke

general.quote: True Magic is the greatest of all natural sciences, because it includes a knowledge of visible and invisible nature. It is not only a science but an art, because it cannot be learned out of books and must be acquired by practical experience.
general.author: l. w. de laurence

general.quote: Children see magic because they look for it.
general.author: christopher moore

general.quote: Christmas waves a magic wand over this world, and behold, everything is softer and more beautiful.
general.author: norman vincent peale

general.quote: There is no magic. There is only knowledge, more or less hidden.
general.author: gene wolfe

general.quote: There is a real magic in enthusiasm. It spells the difference between mediocrity and accomplishment.
general.author: norman vincent peale

general.quote: The power of thought, the magic of the mind.
general.author: lord byron

general.quote: Art is a sense of magic.
general.author: stan brakhage

general.quote: The magic of first love is our ignorance that it can never end.
general.author: benjamin disraeli

general.quote: I don’t want realism. I want magic!
general.author: tennessee williams

general.quote: Real magic is not about gaining power over others: it is about gaining power over yourself.
general.author: rosemary guiley

general.quote: Real magic can never be made by offering someone else’s liver. You must tear out your own, and not expect to get it back.
general.author: peter s. beagle

general.quote: Books are a uniquely portable magic.
general.author: stephen king

general.quote: The magic of drama is infinitely more powerful than the magic of trickery. It is as available to the conjurer as it is to the actor. The only difference is that actors take it for granted, whereas few conjurers are even aware that it exists.
general.author: henning nelms

general.quote: The magic of the pen lies in the concentration of your thoughts upon one object.
general.author: george henry lewes

general.quote: Magic and all that is ascribed to it is a deep presentiment of the powers of science.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson

general.quote: Indubitably, Magic is one of the subtlest and most difficult of the sciences and arts. There is more opportunity for errors of comprehension, judgment and practice than in any other branch of physics.
general.author: aleister crowley

general.quote: Success isn’t magic or hocus-pocus — it’s simply learning how to focus.
general.author: jack canfield

general.quote: Love and magic have a great deal in common. They enrich the soul, delight the heart. And they both take unrelenting and unabating practice.
general.author: nora roberts

general.quote: Magic exists. Who can doubt it, when there are rainbows and wildflowers, the music of the wind and the silence of the stars? Anyone who has loved has been touched by magic. It is such a simple and such an extraordinary part of the lives we live.
general.author: nora roberts

general.quote: Every day use your magic to be of service to others.
general.author: marcia wieder

general.quote: I would not want to live in a world without dragons, as I would not want to live in a world without magic, for that is a world without mystery, and that is a world without faith.
general.author: r. a. salvatore

general.quote: There is magic, but you have to be the magician. You have to make the magic happen.
general.author: sidney sheldon

general.quote: Imagination is the true magic carpet.
general.author: norman vincent peale

general.quote: Magic is the ancestor of technology, the ancestor of what we call applied science. Medicine springs from it.
general.author: joseph alexander leighton

general.quote: Those who don’t believe in magic will never find it.
general.author: roald dahl

general.quote: Black magic operates most effectively in preconscious, marginal areas. Casual curses are the most effective.
general.author: william s. burroughs

general.quote: The entire sum of existence is the magic of being needed by just one person.
general.author: putnam vi

general.quote: It is human nature to want to believe in the wizardry of the magician–but also to turn against him and to scorn him the moment that he commits the slightest error that reveals his trickery. Those in the audience are embarrassed to have been so easily astonished, and they blame the performer for their gullibility.
general.author: dean koontz

general.quote: "Bed is the poor man’s opera."
general.author: italian proverb

general.quote: "My worry is that opera will become an historic art form as opposed to a living, breathing thing."
general.author: renee fleming

general.quote: "An opera may be allowed to be extravagantly lavish in its decorations, as its only design is to gratify the senses and keep up an indolent attention in the audience."
general.author: joseph addison

general.quote: "Opera is a type of drama whose integral existence is determined from point to point and in the whole by musical articulation. Dramma per musica."
general.author: joseph kerman

general.quote: "To sing opera, one needs two things: the voice and the passion – and above all, the passion."
general.author: andrea bocelli

general.quote: "[Opera] does not call so much for an imaginative ear as for an imaginative eye, an eye which can see beyond little absurdities toward great truths."
general.author: george mare

general.quote: "The aim of Opera has ever been, and still is today, confined to Music. Merely so as to afford Music with a colourable pretext for her own excursions, is the purpose of Drama dragged on — naturally, not to curtail the ends of Music, but rather to serve her simply as a means."
general.author: richard wagner

general.quote: "The opera is like a husband with a foreign title: expensive to support, hard to understand, and therefore a supreme social challenge."
general.author: cleveland amory

general.quote: "Opera in English, is about as sensible as baseball in Italian."
general.author: h. l. mencken

general.quote: "Opera is when a guy gets stabbed in the back and, instead of bleeding, he sings."
general.author: ed gardner

general.quote: "No good opera plot can be sensible, for people do not sing when they are feeling sensible."
general.author: w.h. auden

general.quote: "How wonderful opera would be if there were no singers."
general.author: gioacchino antonio rossini

general.quote: "The opera isn’t over till the fat lady sings."
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: "I have always believed that opera is a planet where the muses work together, join hands, and celebrate all the arts."
general.author: franco zeffirelli

general.quote: "The Opera was a very cold film, a hopeless and dark film, no hope, no love."
general.author: dario argento

general.quote: "The Opera is obviously the first draft of a fine spectacle; it suggests the idea of one."
general.author: jean de la bruyere

general.quote: "Going to the opera, like getting drunk, is a sin that carries its own punishment with it."
general.author: hannah more

general.quote: "Watching Italian opera, all those male sopranos screeching, stupid fat couples rolling their eyes about. That’s not love, it’s just rubbish."
general.author: peter shaffer

general.quote: "An opera begins long before the curtain goes up and ends long after it has come down. It starts in my imagination, it becomes my life, and it stays part of my life long after I’ve left the opera house."
general.author: maria callas

general.quote: "It is so important for people at a young age to be invited to embrace classical music and opera."
general.author: luciano pavarotti

general.quote: "Opera, next to Gothic architecture, is one of the strangest inventions of Western man. It could not have been foreseen by any logical process."
general.author: lord clark

general.quote: Don’t hate the media, become the media.
general.author: jello biafra

general.quote: We don’t like what we don’t know or understand. Parents don’t like the thought of their kids embracing social media because they don’t fully understand the benefits and dangers.
general.author: amy jo martin

general.quote: If your music is great, you will have fans, not because you have spent time chatting on social media.
general.author: bryan adams

general.quote: The media cause more problems than they do good.
general.author: chris kyle

general.quote: The media can be a really strong vehicle.
general.author: cecilia bartoli

general.quote: The American mass media have achieved what American political might could not: World domination.
general.author: akbar s. ahmed

general.quote: All media exist to invest our lives with artificial perceptions and arbitrary values.
general.author: marshall mcluhan

general.quote: With all the mass media concentrated in a few hands, the ancient faith in the competition of ideas in the free market seems like a hollow echo of a much simpler day.
general.author: kingman brewster, jr.

general.quote: Whoever controls the media, the images, controls the culture.
general.author: allen ginsberg

general.quote: The media’s the most powerful entity on earth. They have the power to make the innocent guilty and to make the guilty innocent, and that’s power. Because they control the minds of the masses.
general.author: malcolm x

general.quote: Social media is an amazing tool, but it’s really the face-to-face interaction that makes a long-term impact.
general.author: felicia day

general.quote: The media transforms the great silence of things into its opposite. Formerly constituting a secret, the real now talks constantly. News reports, information, statistics, and surveys are everywhere.
general.author: michel de certeau

general.quote: The media need superheroes in science just as in every sphere of life, but there is really a continuous range of abilities with no clear dividing line.
general.author: stephen hawking

general.quote: Social media is just a platform. Twitter is a very simple and immediate broadcast platform. Facebook is a very personal, when it comes to friends and when it comes to fan pages, a little bit less but still somewhat personal way to communicate.
general.author: mark cuban

general.quote: The media bring our wars home, but only rarely have they been able to do it in complete freedom.
general.author: bruce jackson

general.quote: We have more media than ever and more technology in our lives. It’s supposed to help us communicate, but it has the opposite effect of isolating us.
general.author: tracy chapman

general.quote: Whoever controls the media, controls the mind.
general.author: jim morrison

general.quote: The more social media we have, the more we think we’re connecting, yet we are really disconnecting from each other.
general.author: jr

general.quote: The corporate grip on opinion in the United States is one of the wonders of the Western World. No First World country has ever managed to eliminate so entirely from its media all objectivity — much less dissent.
general.author: gore vidal

general.quote: Whether via social media or in person, building your relationships is a long-term process, and the ultimate goal is to strengthen your network one person at a time.
general.author: raymond arroyo

general.quote: The dark side of social media is that, within seconds, anything can be blown out of proportion and taken out of context. And it’s very difficult not to get swept up in it all.
general.author: nicola formichetti

general.quote: It takes discipline not to let social media steal your time.
general.author: alexis ohanian

general.quote: Social media has given us this idea that we should all have a posse of friends when in reality, if we have one or two really good friends, we are lucky.
general.author: brene brown

general.quote: If Jesus were here today, he wouldn’t be riding around on a donkey. He’d be taking a plane; he’d be using the media.
general.author: joel osteen

general.quote: It’s important for people to talk and get beyond the wall of Facebook and social media.
general.author: billy corgan

general.quote: Social media is changing the way we communicate and the way we are perceived, both positively and negatively. Every time you post a photo, or update your status, you are contributing to your own digital footprint and personal brand.
general.author: amy jo martin

general.quote: Social media is the ultimate equalizer. It gives a voice and a platform to anyone willing to engage.
general.author: amy jo martin

general.quote: There’s a danger in the internet and social media. The notion that information is enough, that more and more information is enough, that you don’t have to think, you just have to get more information – gets very dangerous.
general.author: edward de bono

general.quote: Maybe it is the media that has us divided.
general.author: laura bush

general.quote: Media, the plural of mediocrity.
general.author: jimmy breslin

general.quote: It is advertising and the logic of consumerism that governs the depiction of reality in the mass media.
general.author: christopher lasch

general.quote: The information you get from social media is not a substitute for academic discipline at all.
general.author: bill nye

general.quote: The first problem of the media is posed by what does not get translated, or even published in the dominant political languages.
general.author: jacques derrida

general.quote: The effect of the mass media is not to elicit belief but to maintain the apparatus of addiction.
general.author: christopher lasch

general.quote: Smart phones and social media expand our universe. We can connect with others or collect information easier and faster than ever.
general.author: daniel goleman

general.quote: "Opera happens because a large number of things amazingly fail to go wrong."
general.author: terry pratchett

general.quote: "The more opera is dead, the more it flourishes."
general.author: slavoj zizek

general.quote: "I wish the opera was every night. It is, of all entertainments, the sweetest and most delightful. Some of the songs seemed to melt my very soul."
general.author: fanny burney

general.quote: "Of all the noises known to man, opera is the most expensive."
general.author: moliere

general.quote: There is nothing special in the world. Nothing magic. Just physics.
general.author: chuck palahniuk

general.quote: Magic is not done, it’s not performed. Like any performance art, it withers away to nothing if it’s not presented in the grand style. Moving your feet around is not dancing, reading the lyrics is not singing, and pulling a rabbit out of a hat is not magic.
general.author: john cassidy & michael stroud

general.quote: One man’s "magic" is another man’s engineering.
general.author: robert a. heinlein

general.quote: Magic is not a practice. It is a living, breathing web of energy that, with our permission, can encase our every action.
general.author: dorothy morrison

general.quote: God doesn’t give people talents that he doesn’t want people to use.
general.author: iron eagle

general.quote: I put all my genius into my life; I put only my talent into my works.
general.author: oscar wilde

general.quote: Talent is a dull knife that will cut nothing unless it is wielded with great force.
general.author: stephen king

general.quote: There is no greater joy under the sun than the joy of giving: giving of one’s time, energy, talent, and money to help one’s fellow man.
general.author: william h. taylor

general.quote: With God, what is terrible is that one never knows whether it’s not just a trick of the devil.
general.author: jean anouilh

general.quote: The trick is to realize that after giving your best, there’s nothing more to give.
general.author: sparky anderson

general.quote: Some people are so busy learning the tricks of the trade that they never learn the trade.
general.author: vernon law

general.quote: The real trick is to make the moves in your head first, as a way of testing them out.
general.author: juliene berk

general.quote: If you’re on thin ice, you might as well dance.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: Dance is a delicate balance between perfection and beauty.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: The one thing that can solve most of our problems is dancing.
general.author: james brown

general.quote: The dance is four-dimensional art in that it moves concretely in both space and time.
general.author: baker brownell

general.quote: I would rather dance as a ballerina, though faultily, than as a flawless clown.
general.author: margaret atwood

general.quote: Dance light, for my heart it lies under your feet, love.
general.author: john francis waller,

general.quote: Custom has made dancing sometimes necessary for a young man. Therefore mind it while you learn it, that you may learn to do it well, and not be ridiculous, though in a ridiculous act.
general.author: philip dormer stanhope chesterfield

general.quote: And let the winds of the heavens dance between you.
general.author: kahlil gibran

general.quote: Dance is for everybody. I believe that the dance came from the people and that it should always be delivered back to the people.
general.author: alvin ailey

general.quote: Dancing is an active motion of the body, which proceedeth from the lightness of the heart.
general.author: a. fandango

general.quote: If you look at a dancer in silence, his or her body will be the music. If you turn the music on, that body will become an extension of what you’re hearing.
general.author: judith jamison

general.quote: The Dance is love, it is only love, it alone, and that is enough.
general.author: isadora duncan

general.quote: Dancing is the world’s favorite metaphor.
general.author: kristy nilsson

general.quote: And those who were seen dancing were thought to be insane by those who could not hear the music.
general.author: friedrich wilhelm nietzsche

general.quote: Dancing [is] the poetry of the foot.
general.author: john dryden

general.quote: Dancing is a vertical expression of a horizontal desire.
general.author: oscar wilde

general.quote: In a dancer, there is a reverence for such forgotten things as the miracle of the small beautiful bones and their delicate strength.
general.author: martha graham

general.quote: There are those who dance to the rhythm that is played to them, those who only dance to their own rhythm, and those who don’t dance at all.
general.author: jose bergamin

general.quote: In a society that worships love, freedom and beauty, dance is sacred,It is a prayer for the future, a remembrance of the past and a joyful exclamation of thanks for the present.
general.author: amelia atwater-rhodes

general.quote: When you are on the dance floor, there is nothing to do but dance.
general.author: umberto eco

general.quote: You can dance anywhere, even if only in your heart.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: Always let them think of you as singing and dancing.
general.author: anita brookner

general.quote: The body is your instrument in dance, but your art is outside that creature, the body.
general.author: martha graham

general.quote: The modern dance is no dance in the first place, and when you’ve finally learned it, it’s not modern any more.
general.author: evan esar

general.quote: I have no desire to prove anything by it. I have never used it as an outlet or a means of expressing myself. I just dance.
general.author: fred astaire

general.quote: There is a bit of insanity in dancing that does everybody a great deal of good.
general.author: edwin denby

general.quote: They who love dancing too much seem to have more brains in their feet than their head, and think to play the fool with reason.
general.author: terence

general.quote: Dancing with the feet is one thing, but dancing with the heart is another.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: Those move easiest who have learn’d to dance.
general.author: alexander pope

general.quote: Life may not be the party we hoped for, but while we’re here we should dance.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: I would like to dance. Not professionally, just when everyone else does.
general.author: stephen fry

general.quote: To be fond of dancing was a certain step towards falling in love.
general.author: jane austen

general.quote: People have asked me why I chose to be a dancer. I did not choose. I was chosen to be a dancer, and with that, you live all your life.
general.author: martha graham

general.quote: Kids: they dance before they learn there is anything that isn’t music.
general.author: william stafford

general.quote: They love dancing over-much who will dance among thorns.
general.author: capacelli

general.quote: Common sense and a sense of humor are the same thing, moving at different speeds. A sense of humor is just common sense, dancing.
general.author: william james

general.quote: Anyone who says sunshine brings happiness has never danced in the rain.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: I actually grew up break-dancing. When you break-dance you listen to hip-hop and rap, so I’ve been listening to that music since I was a kid.
general.author: matthew morrison

general.quote: Dancing: the vertical expression of a horizontal desire legalized by music.
general.author: george bernard shaw

general.quote: Wives are people who feel they don’t dance enough.
general.author: groucho marx

general.quote: Dancing for the young is dangerous; for the old it is ridiculous.
general.author: bussy-rabutin

general.quote: I’m an excellent dancer. I keep up with whatever’s hot. I’ve been break-dancing and pop-locking since back in the day.
general.author: michael strahan

general.quote: Beauty seen is never lost, God’s colors all are fast.
general.author: john greenleaf whittier

general.quote: Coloring outside the lines is a fine art.
general.author: kim nance

general.quote: The colors live a remarkable life of their own after they have been applied to the canvas.
general.author: edvard munch

general.quote: We may have different religions, different languages, different colored skin, but we all belong to one human race.
general.author: kofi annan

general.quote: Colors, like features, follow the changes of the emotions.
general.author: pablo picasso

general.quote: Colors answer feeling in man; shapes answer thought; and motion answers will.
general.author: john sterling

general.quote: Colors fade, temples crumble, empires fall, but wise words endure.
general.author: edward thorndike

general.quote: It’s a good thing that when God created the rainbow he didn’t consult a decorator or he would still be picking colors.
general.author: sam levenson

general.quote: All the other colors are just colors, but purple seems to have a soul. Purple is not just a noun and an adjective but also a verb – when you look at it, it’s looking back at you.
general.author: uniek swain

general.quote: I cannot pretend to feel impartial about colors. I rejoice with the brilliant ones and am genuinely sorry for the poor browns.
general.author: winston churchill

general.quote: Lying in bed would be an altogether perfect and supreme experience if only one had a colored pencil long enough to draw on the ceiling.
general.author: g.k. chesterton

general.quote: I found I could say things with color and shapes that I couldn’t say any other way – things I had no words for.
general.author: georgia o’keeffe

general.quote: It is horrible to see everything that one detested in the past coming back wearing the colors of the future.
general.author: jean rostand

general.quote: All colors will agree in the dark.
general.author: francis bacon

general.quote: Blueness doth express trueness.
general.author: ben jonson

general.quote: How beautifully leaves grow old. How full of light and color are their last days.
general.author: john burroughs

general.quote: Light in Nature creates the movement of colors.
general.author: robert delaunay

general.quote: As the sun colors flowers, so does art color life.
general.author: john lubbock

general.quote: Colors are the smiles of nature.
general.author: leigh hunt

general.quote: Green is the prime color of the world, and that from which its loveliness arises.
general.author: pedro calderón de la barca

general.quote: Why do two colors, put one next to the other, sing? Can one really explain this? No. Just as one can never learn how to paint.
general.author: pablo picasso

general.quote: Of all God’s gifts to the sighted man, color is holiest, the most divine, the most solemn.
general.author: john ruskin

general.quote: Mere color, unspoiled by meaning, and unallied with definite form, can speak to the soul in a thousand different ways.
general.author: oscar wilde

general.quote: You look rather rash my dear your colors don’t quite match your face.
general.author: daisy ashford

general.quote: Nature always wears the colors of the spirit.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson

general.quote: He had that curious love of green, which in individuals is always the sign of a subtle artistic temperament, and in nations is said to denote a laxity, if not a decadence of morals.
general.author: oscar wilde

general.quote: The purest and most thoughtful minds are those which love color the most.
general.author: john ruskin

general.quote: There are only 3 colors, 10 digits, and 7 notes; it’s what we do with them that’s important.
general.author: ruth ross

general.quote: All colors are the friends of their neighbors and the lovers of their opposites.
general.author: marc chagall

general.quote: The best color in the whole world, is the one that looks good, on you.
general.author: coco chane

general.quote: There are not more than five primary colors (blue, yellow, red, white, and black), yet in combination they produce more hues than can ever been seen
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: Green how I want you green. Green wind. Green branches.
general.author: federico garcia lorca

general.quote: Beauty without colour seems somehow to belong to another world.
general.author: murasaki shikibu

general.quote: All the other colors are just colors, but purple seems to have a soul — when you look at it, it’s looking back at you.
general.author: uniek swain

general.quote: Color possesses me. I don’t have to pursue it. It will possess me always, I know it. That is the meaning of this happy hour: Color and I are one. I am a painter.
general.author: paul klee

general.quote: Art is the colors and textures of your imagination.
general.author: meghan

general.quote: What I don’t like about office Christmas parties is looking for a job the next day.
general.author: phyllis diller

general.quote: It’s just really important that we start celebrating our differences. Let’s start tolerating first, but then we need to celebrate our differences.
general.author: billie jean king

general.quote: Christmas is a holiday that we celebrate not as individuals nor as a nation, but as a human family.
general.author: ronald reagan

general.quote: An anniversary is a time to celebrate the joys of today, the memories of yesterday, and the hopes of tomorrow.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: At a dinner party one should eat wisely but not too well, and talk well but not too wisely
general.author: william somerset maugham

general.quote: If the sight of the blue skies fills you with joy, if a blade of grass springing up in the fields has power to move you, if the simple things of nature have a message that you understand, rejoice, for your soul is alive.
general.author: eleonora duse

general.quote: A wedding anniversary is the celebration of love, trust, partnership, tolerance and tenacity. The order varies for any given year.
general.author: paul sweeney

general.quote: Put yourself in a state of mind where you say to yourself, "Here is an opportunity for me to celebrate like never before, my own power, my own ability to get myself to do whatever is necessary.
general.author: anthony robbins

general.quote: Whenever, at a party, I have been in the mood to study fools, I have always looked for a great beauty: they always gather round her like flies around a fruit stall.
general.author: jean paul richter

general.quote: People wish to be poets more than they wish to write poetry, and that’s a mistake. One should wish to celebrate more than one wishes to be celebrated.
general.author: lucille clifton

general.quote: No one has yet computed how many imaginary triumphs are silently celebrated by people each year to keep up their courage.
general.author: henry s. haskins

general.quote: Celebrate the happiness that friends are always giving, make every day a holiday and celebrate just living!
general.author: amanda bradley

general.quote: I am thankful for the mess to clean after a party because it means I have been surrounded by friends.
general.author: nancie j. carmody

general.quote: Never be the first to arrive at a party or the last to go home, and never, ever be both.
general.author: david brown

general.quote: Nothing makes you more tolerant of a neighbor’s noisy party than being there.
general.author: franklin p. jones

general.quote: At every party there are two kinds of people — those who want to go home and those who don’t. The trouble is, they are usually married to each other.
general.author: ann landers

general.quote: A celebrated people lose dignity upon a closer view.
general.author: napoleon bonaparte

general.quote: It’s always good to remember where you come from and celebrate it. To remember where you come from is part of where you’re going.
general.author: anthony burgess

general.quote: No man does right by a woman at a party.
general.author: harry golden

general.quote: All of us celebrate our values in our behavior.
general.author: john w. gardner

general.quote: It’s fine to celebrate success but it is more important to heed the lessons of failure.
general.author: bill gates

general.quote: Too few rejoice at a friend’s good fortune.
general.author: aeschylus

general.quote: [N]o party is any fun unless seasoned with folly.
general.author: desiderius erasmus

general.quote: After all, what is your host’s purpose in having a party? Surely not for you to enjoy yourself; if that were their sole purpose, they’d have simply sent champagne and women over to your place by taxi.
general.author: p.j. o’rourke

general.quote: Let us celebrate the occasion with wine and sweet words.
general.author: plautus

general.quote: I celebrate myself, and sing myself.
general.author: walt whitman

general.quote: It’s easy to impress me. I don’t need a fancy party to be happy. Just good friends, good food, and good laughs. I’m happy. I’m satisfied. I’m content.
general.author: maria sharapova

general.quote: Drink, and dance and laugh and lie, love the reeling midnight through, for tomorrow we shall die! (But, alas, we never do.)
general.author: dorothy parker

general.quote: Cocktail party: A gathering held to enable forty people to talk about themselves at the same time. The man who remains after the liquor is gone is the host.
general.author: fred allen

general.quote: What we have to do… is to find a way to celebrate our diversity and debate our differences without fracturing our communities.
general.author: hillary clinton

general.quote: To live in Australia permanently is rather like going to a party and dancing all night with one’s mother.
general.author: barry humphries

general.quote: We need a day of the dead. That’s a perfect celebration.
general.author: kristin hersh

general.quote: I love any and all situations where you celebrate creativity.
general.author: brad paisley

general.quote: The more you praise and celebrate your life, the more there is in life to celebrate.
general.author: oprah winfrey

general.quote: Celebrate what you want to see more of.
general.author: thomas j. peters

general.quote: On with the dance! Let joy be unconfined; no sleep till morn, when Youth and pleasure meet to chase the glowing hours with flying feet.
general.author: george noel gordon

general.quote: Time is too slow for those who wait, too swift for those who fear, too long for those who grieve, too short for those who rejoice, but for those who love, time is eternity.
general.author: henry van dyke

general.quote: Never celebrate until you are really out of the woods. They might be behind the last tree.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: Good parties create a temporary youthfulness.
general.author: mason cooley

general.quote: Stop worrying about the potholes in the road and celebrate the journey!
general.author: barbara hoffman

general.quote: I believe that if life gives you lemons, you should make lemonade… And try to find somebody whose life has given them vodka, and have a party.
general.author: ron white

general.quote: All my life through, the new sights of Nature made me rejoice like a child.
general.author: marie curie

general.quote: Share our similarities, celebrate our differences.
general.author: m. scott peck

general.quote: If I had a party to attend and didn’t want to be there, I would play the part of someone who was having a lovely time.
general.author: shirley maclaine

general.quote: Be content with what you have; rejoice in the way things are. When you realize there is nothing lacking, the whole world belongs to you.
general.author: lao tzu

general.quote: Brave men rejoice in adversity, just as brave soldiers triumph in war.
general.author: lucius annaeus seneca

general.quote: Spring is nature’s way of saying, "Let’s party!
general.author: robin williams

general.quote: Thanksgiving is the holiday of peace, the celebration of work and the simple life…
general.author: david grayson

general.quote: Nurses don’t wait until October to celebrate Make a Difference Day – they make a difference every day!
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: You know, we’ve got to do it someday… throw away all the guns and invite all the jokers from the North and the South in here to a cocktail party… last man standing on his feet at the end wins the war.
general.author: hawkeye

general.quote: A party without cake is just a meeting.
general.author: julia child

general.quote: I used to hang out by the food table at parties because you don’t have to talk to anybody. If you do then you can talk about the food.
general.author: jennifer jason leigh

general.quote: Rejoice in the things that are present; all else is beyond thee.
general.author: michel de montaigne

general.quote: While we are living in the present, we must celebrate life every day, knowing that we are becoming history with every work, every action, every deed.
general.author: mattie stepanek

general.quote: Our wedding was many years ago. The celebration continues to this day.
general.author: gene perret

general.quote: Musicians don’t retire; they stop when there’s no more music in them.
general.author: louis armstrong

general.quote: Guitar is the best form of self-expression I know.
general.author: slash

general.quote: In jazz, you listen to what the bass player is doing and what the drummer is doing, what the pianist and the guitarist is doing, and then you play something that compliments that, so you are thinking simultaneously and thinking ahead.
general.author: david amram

general.quote: If we were all determined to play the first violin, we should never have an ensemble; therefore, respect every musician in his proper place.
general.author: robert schumann

general.quote: One of my biggest thrills for me still is sitting down with a guitar or a piano and just out of nowhere trying to make a song happen.
general.author: paul mccartney

general.quote: Sometimes the nicest thing to do with a guitar is just look at it.
general.author: hom yorke

general.quote: Of course the music is a great difficulty. You see, if one plays good music, people don’t listen, and if one plays bad music people don’t talk.
general.author: oscar wilde quotes

general.quote: The guitar is harmonic structure.
general.author: paul simon

general.quote: You can muffle the drum, and you can loosen the strings of the lyre, but who shall command the skylark not to sing?
general.author: kahlil gibran quotes

general.quote: I can whistle with my fingers, especially if I have a whistle.
general.author: mitch hedberg

general.quote: As humans we like to laugh at our fears, we like to whistle in the dark.
general.author: jeff dunham

general.quote: When I had nothing else, I had my mother and the piano. And you know what? They were all I needed.
general.author: alicia keys

general.quote: A jazz musician is a juggler who uses harmonies instead of oranges.
general.author: benny green

general.quote: Color is the keyboard, the eyes are the harmonies, the soul is the piano with many strings. The artist is the hand that plays, touching one key or another, to cause vibrations in the soul.
general.author: wassily kandinsky

general.quote: There is two kinds of music; the good and bad. I play the good kind.
general.author: louis armstrong

general.quote: Some people are drawn naturally – there are natural guitarists, and there are natural piano players, and I think guitar implies travel, a sort of footloose gypsy existence. You grab your bag and you go to the next town.
general.author: hugh laurie

general.quote: Play the music, not the instrument.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: The classical guitar has a dynamic to it unlike a regular acoustic guitar or an electric guitar. You know, there’s times when you should play and there’s times when you gotta hold back. It’s an extremely dynamic instrument.
general.author: steve vai

general.quote: To stay a great singer or guitar player, you’ve got to do it 24/7. That’s what I do.
general.author: sammy hagar

general.quote: Life is like a trumpet – if you don’t put anything into it, you don’t get anything out of it.
general.author: william christopher handy

general.quote: Playing drums feels like coming home for me. Even during the White Stripes I thought: ‘I’ll do this for now, but I’m really a drummer. That’s what I’ll put on my passport application.
general.author: jack white

general.quote: Touch not the flute when drums are sounding around; when fools have the word, the wise will be silent.
general.author: johann gottfried von herder

general.quote: My first love was the sound of guitar.
general.author: boz scaggs

general.quote: If a composer could say what he had to say in words he would not bother trying to say it in music.
general.author: gustav mahler

general.quote: Beethoven can write music, thank God, but he can do nothing else on earth.
general.author: ludwig van beethoven

general.quote: We love playing music but we’re too weird to play music.
general.author: wayne coyne

general.quote: A painter paints pictures on canvas. But musicians paint their pictures on silence.
general.author: leopold stokowski

general.quote: The piano is a monster that screams when you touch its teeth.
general.author: andres segovia

general.quote: I believe every  guitar player inherently has something unique about their playing. They just have to identify what makes them different and develop it.
general.author: jimmy page

general.quote: Sometimes I can only groan, and suffer, and pour out my despair at the piano.
general.author: frederic chopin

general.quote: I believe in using the entire piano as a single instrument capable of expressing every possible musical idea.
general.author: oscar peterson

general.quote: When you play the 12-string guitar, you spend half your life tuning the instrument and the other half playing it out of tune.
general.author: pete seeger

general.quote: I’ve always wanted to smash a guitar over someone’s head. You just can’t do that with a piano.
general.author: elton john

general.quote: It’s really important for the bass and the drums to somehow blend.
general.author: mike gordon

general.quote: What has keys but can’t listen to the beauty it unlocks? A piano.
general.author: jarod kintz

general.quote: Prayer is when you talk to God. Meditation is when you’re listening. Playing the piano allows you to do both at the same time.
general.author: kelsey grammer

general.quote: To succeed means that you may have to step out of line and march to the sound of your own drummer.
general.author: keith degreen

general.quote: When you play, never mind who listens to you.
general.author: robert schumann

general.quote: You know the drum was the first instrument besides the human voice.
general.author: billy higgins

general.quote: What we play is life.
general.author: louis armstrong

general.quote: These fingers of mine, they got brains in ’em. You don’t tell them what to do – they do it.
general.author: jerry lee lewis

general.quote: A musician must make music, an artist must paint, a poet must write, if he to be at peace with himself. What a man can be, he must be.
general.author: abraham h. maslow

general.quote: Life is like a piano; the white keys represent happiness and the black show sadness. But as you go through life’s journey, remember that the black keys also create music.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: Give me a guitar, give me a piano, give me a broom and string; I wouldn’t get bored anywhere.
general.author: keith richards

general.quote: If I’m going to Hell, I’m going there playing the piano.
general.author: jerry lee lewis

general.quote: I love power. But it is as an artist that I love it. I love it as a musician loves his violin, to draw out its sounds and chords and harmonies.
general.author: napoleon bonaparte quotes

general.quote: The guitar is a small orchestra. It is polyphonic. Every string is a different color, a different voice.
general.author: andres segovia

general.quote: Without a piano I don’t know how to stand, don’t know what to do with my hands.
general.author: norah jones

general.quote: I just go where the guitar takes me.
general.author: angus young

general.quote: What’s really good is African drum music.
general.author: fiona apple

general.quote: When you play a guitar for a long time, you get your hand oils in there; it starts feeling good and behaving, and you just don’t want to mess with that.
general.author: mac demarco

general.quote: With a guitar I would be able to express the things I felt in sounds.
general.author: william christopher handy

general.quote: A guitar is a very personal extension of the person playing it. You have to be emotionally and spiritually connected to your instrument
general.author: eddie van halen

general.quote: The piano keys are black and white but they sound like a million colors in your mind.
general.author: maria cristina mena

general.quote: A race track is a place where windows clean people.
general.author: danny thomas

general.quote: Don’t gamble; take all your savings and buy some good stock and hold it till it goes up. If it don’t go up, don’t buy it.
general.author: will rogers

general.quote: In most betting shops you will see three windows marked "Bet Here," but only one window with the legend "Pay Out.
general.author: jeffrey bernard

general.quote: You cannot get anything out of nature or from God by gambling; only out of your neighbor.
general.author: john ruskinpoker is good for you. it enriches the soul, sharpens the intellect, heals the spirit, and – when played well, nourishes the wallet. ~ lou krieger

general.quote: Poker’s a day to learn and a lifetime to master.
general.author: robert williamson iii

general.quote: Old card players never die, they just shuffle away.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: There is a very easy way to return from a casino with a small fortune: go there with a large one.
general.author: jack yelton

general.quote: Poker may be a branch of psychological warfare, an art form or indeed a way of life – but it is also merely a game, in which money is simply the means of keeping score.
general.author: anthony holden

general.quote: The world is a gambling table so arranged that all who enter the casino must play and all must lose more or less heavily in the long run, though they win occasionally by the way.
general.author: samuel butler

general.quote: If you play bridge badly you make your partner suffer, but if you play poker badly you make everybody happy.
general.author: joe laurie jr.

general.quote: The cardinal sin in poker, worse than playing did cards, worse even than figuring your odds correctly, is becoming emotionally involved.
general.author: katy lederer

general.quote: The strong point in poker is never to lose your temper, either with those you are playing with or, more particularly, with the cards. There is no sympathy in poker. Always keep cool. If you lose your head you will lose all your chips.
general.author: william j. florence

general.quote: The commonest mistake in history is underestimating your opponent; it happens at the poker table all the time.
general.author: david shoup

general.quote: Most of the money you’ll win at poker comes not from the brilliance of your own play, but from the ineptitude of your opponents.
general.author: lou krieger

general.quote: Casinos and prostitutes have the same thing in common; they are both trying to screw you out of your money and send you home with a smile on you face.
general.author: vp pappy

general.quote: Poker reveals to the frank observer something else of import—it will teach him about his own nature. Many bad players do not improve because the cannot bear self-knowledge.
general.author: david mamet

general.quote: The game [of poker] exemplifies the worst aspects of capitalism that have made our country so great.
general.author: walter matthau

general.quote: In a game of poker, I can put the players’ souls in my pocket.
general.author: beausourire

general.quote: The guy who invented poker was bright, but the guy who invented the chip was a genius.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: I like to play blackjack. I’m not addicted to gambling. I’m addicted to sitting in a semi-circle.
general.author: mitch hedberg

general.quote: When we play, we must realize, before anything else, that we are out to make money.
general.author: david sklansky

general.quote: If you ain’t just a little scared when you enter a casino, you are either very rich or you haven’t studied the games enough.
general.author: vp pappy

general.quote: Casino gambling is colorful and dramatic and theatrical.
general.author: steve wynn

general.quote: I like to play poker with politicians. They are easy to beat. Sometimes in poker is smarter to lose with a winning hand so that you could win later with a losing hand. Politicians can not accept that.
general.author: robert redford

general.quote: Poker is… a fascinating, wonderful, intricate adventure on the high seas of human nature.
general.author: david a. daniel

general.quote: A weekend in Vegas without gambling and drinking is just like being a born-again Christian.
general.author: artie lange

general.quote: You cannot beat a roulette table unless you steal money from it.
general.author: albert einstein

general.quote: One should always play fair when one has the winning cards.
general.author: oscar wilde

general.quote: Baccarat is a game whereby the croupier gathers in money with a flexible sculling oar, then rakes it home. If I could have borrowed his oar I would have stayed.
general.author: mark twain

general.quote: Whenever you see a gaming table be sure to know fortune is not there. Rather she is always in the company of industry.
general.author: oliver goldsmith

general.quote: No presidential candidate should visit Las Vegas without condemning organized gambling.
general.author: ralph nader

general.quote: Your best chance to get a Royal Flush in a casino is in the bathroom.
general.author: v.p. pappy

general.quote: There isn’t any luck that enters into anything, unless it’s poker or shooting dice, maybe.
general.author: fred w. fitch

general.quote: By gaming we lose both our time and treasure–two things most precious to the life of man.
general.author: owen felltham

general.quote: The attraction in this city is money, from gambling. What you are if you work here is a shill.
general.author: joe williams

general.quote: One of the worst things that can happen to you in life is to win a bet on a horse at an early age.
general.author: danny mcgoorty

general.quote: Italians come to ruin most generally in three ways, women, gambling, and farming. My family chose the slowest one.
general.author: pope john xxiii

general.quote: Show me a gambler and I’ll show you a loser.
general.author: mario puzo

general.quote: Man is a gaming animal. He must always be trying to get the better in something or other.
general.author: charles lamb

general.quote: There is but one good throw upon the dice, which is, to throw them away.
general.author: paul chatfield

general.quote: But I used to have a bit of a gambling problem. And that would have been the answer to my prayers. It got worse when I started playing this character, too.
general.author: fisher stevens

general.quote: My luck at the gambling table was varied; sometimes I was fifty to a hundred dollars ahead, and at other times I had to borrow money from my fellow workmen to settle my room rent and pay for my meals.
general.author: james weldon johnson

general.quote: Without gambling, I would not exist.
general.author: hunter s. thompson

general.quote: The President must stop gambling with taxpayers’ money and get the country back on the path of fiscal sanity.
general.author: tom harkin

general.quote: No dog can go as fast as the money you bet on him.
general.author: bud flanagan

general.quote: The subject of gambling is all encompassing. It combines man’s natural play instinct with his desire to know about his fate and his future.
general.author: franz rosenthal

general.quote: The only gambling tip which amounts to anything is to keep out of the game.
general.author: edgar watson howe

general.quote: No wife can endure a gambling husband; unless he is a steady winner.
general.author: thomas robert dewar

general.quote: Between the daylight gambler and the player at night there is the same difference that lies between a careless husband and the lover swooning under his lady’s window.
general.author: honore de balzac

general.quote: Gambling with cards or dice or stocks is all one thing. It’s getting money without giving an equivalent for it.
general.author: henry ward beecher

general.quote: Women’s total instinct for gambling is satisfied by marriage.
general.author: gloria steinem

general.quote: A racehorse is an animal that can take several thousand people for a ride at the same time.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: The typical gambler might not really understand the probabilistic nuances of the wheel or the dice, but such things seem a bit more tractable than, say, trying to raise a child in this lunatic society of ours.
general.author: arthur s. reber

general.quote: Life is a gamble at terrible odds, if it were a bet, you would not take it.
general.author: tom stoppard

general.quote: Uncertainty doesn’t make life worth living, quite, but it does make striving and gambling worth attempting.
general.author: walter kirn

general.quote: I can’t believe that God plays dice with the universe.
general.author: albert einstein

general.quote: It is lost at dice, what ancient honor won.
general.author: william shakespeare

general.quote: No horse can go as fast as the money you put on it.
general.author: earl wilson

general.quote: If you eliminate smoking and gambling, you will be amazed to find that almost all an Englishman’s pleasures can be, and mostly are, shared by his dog.
general.author: george bernard shaw

general.quote: Gambling is legal and betting is legal, for what I bet.
general.author: michael jordan

general.quote: Change your life today. Don’t gamble on the future, act now, without delay.
general.author: simone de beauvoir

general.quote: There are many harsh lessons to be learned from the gambling experience, but the harshest one of all is the difference between having Fun and being Smart.
general.author: hunter s. thompson

general.quote: Gambling is a disease of barbarians superficially civilized.
general.author: dean inge

general.quote: The gambler is a moral suicide.
general.author: charles caleb colton

general.quote: Gambling: The sure way of getting nothing for something.
general.author: wilson mizner

general.quote: Gambling promises the poor what property performs for the rich, something for nothing.
general.author: george bernard shaw

general.quote: Traveling is like gambling: it is always connected with winning and losing, and generally where it is least expected we receive, more or less than what we hoped for.
general.author: johann wolfgang von goethe

general.quote: The gambling known as business looks with severe disfavor on the business known as gambling.
general.author: ambrose bierce

general.quote: One of the healthiest ways to gamble is with a spade and a package of garden seeds.
general.author: dan bennett

general.quote: Oh, it’s not really gambling when you never lose.
general.author: jennifer aniston

general.quote: Horse racing is animated roulette.
general.author: roger kahn

general.quote: Horse sense is a good judgment which keeps horses from betting on people.
general.author: w.c. fields

general.quote: Gamblers play just as lovers make love and drunkards drink– blindly and of necessity, under domination of an irresistible force.
general.author: jacques anatole i. france

general.quote: In gambling the many must lose in order that the few may win.
general.author: george bernard shaw

general.quote: You know horses are smarter than people. You never heard of a horse going broke betting on people.
general.author: will rogers

general.quote: Victory is a fleeting thing in the gambling business. Today’s winners are tomorrow’s blinking toads, dumb beasts with no hope.
general.author: hunter s. thompson

general.quote: Gambling is part of the human condition. I love it. I have the best time gambling. I’ve been winning fortunes, and I’ve been losing them.
general.author: jerry lewis

general.quote: Gambling is the child of avarice, the brother of iniquity, and the father of mischief.
general.author: george washington

general.quote: That’s free enterprise, friends: freedom to gamble, freedom to lose. And the great thing — the truly democratic thing about it — is that you don’t even have to be a player to lose.
general.author: barbara ehrenreich

general.quote: I want people to understand, gambling is not a bad thing if you do it within the framework of what it’s meant to be, which is fun and entertaining.
general.author: michael jordan

general.quote: He was a degenerate gambler. That is, a man who gambled simply to gamble and must lose. As a hero who goes to war must die. Show me a gambler and I’ll show you a loser, show me a hero and I’ll show you a corpse.
general.author: mario puzo

general.quote: Betting is the manure to which the enormous crop of horse-races and racehorse breeding in this and other countries is to a large extent due.
general.author: richard blackmore

general.quote: A gambler plays even when the odds are immutable and against him.
general.author: lou krieger

general.quote: I will never be in the stock market. It’s just gambling. I’m a gambler, but I’ll gamble on the practicality of things.
general.author: jeremy renner

general.quote: The better the gambler, the worse the man.
general.author: publius syrus

general.quote: The safest way to double your money is to fold it over once and put it in your pocket.
general.author: kin hubbard

general.quote: There are three roads to ruin; women, gambling and technicians. The most pleasant is with women, the quickest is with gambling, but the surest is with technicians.
general.author: georges pompidou

general.quote: Gambling can turn into a dangerous two-way street when you least expect it. Weird things happen suddenly, and your life can go all to pieces.
general.author: hunter s. thompson

general.quote: The race is not always to the swift nor the battle to the strong, but that’s the way to bet.
general.author: hugh e. keough

general.quote: It [gaming] is the child of avarice, the brother of iniquity, and the father of mischief.
general.author: george washington

general.quote: Gambling is not a vice, it is an expression of our humanness. We gamble. Some do it at the gaming table, some do not. You play, you win, you play, you lose. You play.
general.author: jeanette winterson

general.quote: The race is not always to the swift, nor the battle to the strong, but that is the way to bet.
general.author: damon runyon

general.quote: He best can paint them who shall feel them most.
general.author: alexander pope

general.quote: The painter constructs, the photographer discloses.
general.author: susan sontag

general.quote: When I see a white piece of paper, I feel I’ve got to draw. And drawing, for me, is the beginning of everything.
general.author: ellsworth kelly

general.quote: A musician must make music, an artist must paint, a poet must write, if he is to be ultimately at peace with himself.
general.author: abraham maslow

general.quote: The mind paints before the brush.
general.author: james ellis

general.quote: A writer should write with his eyes and a painter paint with his ears.
general.author: gertrude stein

general.quote: What is the good of drawing conclusions from experience? I don’t deny we sometimes draw the right conclusions, but don’t we just as often draw the wrong ones?
general.author: georg c. lichtenberg

general.quote: One of the pleasant things those of us who write or paint do is to have the daily miracle. It does come.
general.author: gertrude stein

general.quote: Painting does not come from intelligence so much, as from sight and feeling and invention.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: Some painters transform the sun into a yellow spot; others transform a yellow spot into the sun.
general.author: pablo picasso

general.quote: Painting is poetry that is seen rather than felt, and poetry is painting that is felt rather than seen.
general.author: leonardo da vinci

general.quote: I do not paint a portrait to look like the subject; rather does the person grow to look like his portrait.
general.author: salvador dali

general.quote: Painting is silent poetry.
general.author: simonides of ceos

general.quote: The first writing of the human being was drawing, not writing.
general.author: marjane satrapi

general.quote: Good painters imitate nature, bad ones spew it up.
general.author: miguel de cervantes

general.quote: Lovers of painting and lovers of music are people who openly display their preference like a delectable ailment that isolates them and makes them proud.
general.author: maurice blanchot

general.quote: Painting doesn’t mean just describing; it’s a state of spirit.
general.author: caryl churchill

general.quote: Pure drawing is an abstraction. Drawing and colour are not distinct, everything in nature is coloured.
general.author: paul cezanne

general.quote: The painter should not paint what he sees, but what will be seen.
general.author: paul valery

general.quote: It’s a small world, but I wouldn’t want to have to paint it.
general.author: steven wright

general.quote: It took me four years to paint like Raphael, but a lifetime to paint like a child.
general.author: pablo picasso

general.quote: It is not hard to understand modern art. If it hangs on a wall it’s a painting, and if you can walk around it it’s a sculpture.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: Painting is just another way of keeping a diary.
general.author: pablo picasso

general.quote: The best portraits are those in which there is a slight mixture of caricature.
general.author: thomas b. macaulay

general.quote: All art is exorcism. I paint dreams and visions too; the dreams and visions of my time. Painting is the effort to produce order; order in yourself. There is much chaos in me, much chaos in our time.
general.author: otto dix

general.quote: One of the best things about paintings is their silence – which prompts reflection and random reverie.
general.author: mark stevens

general.quote: My drawings have been described as pre-internationalist, meaning that they were finished before the ideas for them had occurred to me. I shall not argue the point.
general.author: james thurber

general.quote: Painting is easy when you don’t know how, but very difficult when you do.
general.author: edgar degas

general.quote: I paint things as they are. I don’t comment. I record.
general.author: henri de toulouse lautrec

general.quote: For me, painting is a way to forget life. It is a cry in the night, a strangled laugh.
general.author: georges rouault

general.quote: Many are they who have a taste and love for drawing, but no talent; and this will be discernible in boys who are not diligent and never finish their drawings with shading.
general.author: leonardo da vinci

general.quote: There is nothing more difficult for a truly creative painter than to paint a rose, because before he can do so he has first to forget all the roses that were ever painted.
general.author: henri matisse

general.quote: When I judge art, I take my painting and put it next to a God made object like a tree or flower. If it clashes, it is not art.
general.author: marc chagall

general.quote: If you could say it in words there would be no reason to paint.
general.author: edward hopper

general.quote: Life is the art of drawing without an eraser.
general.author: john w. gardner

general.quote: Life is the art of drawing sufficient conclusions from insufficient premises.
general.author: samuel butler
