general.quote: It is a mistake for a sculptor or a painter to speak or write very often about his job. It releases tension needed for his work.
general.author: henry moore

general.quote: The painter’s work will be of little merit if he takes the painting of others as his standard, but if he studies from nature he will produce good fruits.
general.author: leonardo da vinci

general.quote: Only when he no longer knows what he is doing does the painter do good things.
general.author: edgar degas

general.quote: Painting was called silent poetry and poetry speaking painting.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson

general.quote: A great artist can paint a great picture on a small canvas.
general.author: charles dudley warner

general.quote: The true painter strives to paint what can only be seen through his world.
general.author: andré malraux

general.quote: As far as I am concerned, a painting speaks for itself. What is the use of giving explanations, when all is said and done? A painter has only one language.
general.author: pablo picasso

general.quote: Don’t be an art critic. Paint. There lies salvation.
general.author: paul cezanne

general.quote: If I try to articulate every little detail in a drawing, it would be like missing the forest for the trees, so it’s just about getting the outline of the forest.
general.author: jeff koons

general.quote: I prefer drawing to talking. Drawing is faster, and leaves less room for lies.
general.author: le corbusier

general.quote: Painting is a way to forget life. It is a cry in the night, a strangled laugh.
general.author: georges rouault

general.quote: There are only two styles of portrait painting; the serious and the smirk.
general.author: charles dickens

general.quote: If you paint in your mind a picture of bright and happy expectations, you put yourself into a condition conducive to your goal.
general.author: norman vincent peale

general.quote: Why should I paint dead fish, onions and beer glasses? Girls are so much prettier.
general.author: marie laurencin

general.quote: A man paints with his brains and not with his hands.
general.author: michelangelo

general.quote: I never felt oppressed because of my gender. When I’m writing a poem or drawing, I’m not a female; I’m an artist.
general.author: patti smith

general.quote: There is no way to success in art but to take off your coat, grind paint, and work like a digger on the railroad, all day and every day.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson

general.quote: Every time I paint a portrait I lose a friend.
general.author: john singer sargent

general.quote: Sunlight is painting.
general.author: nathaniel hawthorne

general.quote: Surely nothing has to listen to so many stupid remarks as a painting in a museum.
general.author: edmond & jules de goncourt

general.quote: Everything in creation has its appointed painter or poet and remains in bondage like the princess in the fairy tale ’til its appropriate liberator comes to set it free.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson

general.quote: In old times men used their powers of painting to show the objects of faith, in later times they use the objects of faith to show their powers of painting.
general.author: john ruskin

general.quote: Modern art is what happens when painters stop looking at girls and persuade themselves that they have a better idea.
general.author: john anthony ciardi

general.quote: If you hear a voice within you saying, "You are not a painter," then by all means paint and that voice will be silenced.
general.author: vincent van gogh

general.quote: He who pretends to be either painter or engraver without being a master of drawing is an impostor.
general.author: william blake

general.quote: I don’t paint things. I only paint the difference between things.
general.author: henri matisse

general.quote: Painters and poets have liberty to lie.
general.author: robert burns

general.quote: Painting is a blind man’s profession. He paints not what he sees, but what he feels, what he tells himself about what he has seen.
general.author: pablo picasso

general.quote: Are we to paint what’s on the face, what’s inside the face, or what’s behind it?
general.author: pablo picasso

general.quote: God created paper for the purpose of drawing architecture on it. Everything else is, at least for me, an abuse of paper.
general.author: alvar aalto

general.quote: For me, drawing is a way of navigating the imagination, and it remains the fundamental vehicle of my practice. Drawing allows me to be at my most inventive.
general.author: shahzia sikander

general.quote: Painting is silent poetry, poetry is eloquent painting.
general.author: plutarch

general.quote: Painting is a faith, and it imposes the duty to disregard public opinion.
general.author: vincent van gogh

general.quote: If you call painting dumb poetry, the painter may call poetry blind painting.
general.author: leonardo da vinci

general.quote: Painting dissolves the forms at its command … it melts them into color.
general.author: alexander eliot

general.quote: Every portrait that is painted with feeling is a portrait of the artist, not of the sitter.
general.author: oscar wilde

general.quote: I paint objects as I think them not as I see them.
general.author: pablo picasso

general.quote: I hope with all my heart there will be painting in heaven.
general.author: jean-baptiste corot

general.quote: Drawing on my fine command of the English language, I said nothing.
general.author: robert benchley

general.quote: Drawing makes you see things clearer, and clearer and clearer still, until your eyes ache.
general.author: david hockney

general.quote: Drawing is the true test of art.
general.author: horace

general.quote: Drawing is the honesty of the art. There is no possibility of cheating. It is either good or bad.
general.author: salvador dali

general.quote: Drawing is still basically the same as it has been since prehistoric times. It brings together man and the world. It lives through magic.
general.author: keith haring

general.quote: Style in painting is the same as in writing,–a power over materials, whether words or colors.
general.author: james ellis

general.quote: If we could but paint with the hand what we see with the eye.
general.author: honore de balzac

general.quote: Drawing is rather like playing chess: your mind races ahead of the moves that you eventually make.
general.author: david hockney

general.quote: Drawing is like making an expressive gesture with the advantage of permanence.
general.author: henri matisse

general.quote: Art, like morality, consists in drawing the line somewhere.
general.author: gilbert k. chesterton

general.quote: Every artist dips his brush in his own soul, and paints his own nature into his pictures.
general.author: henry ward beecher

general.quote: I paint my own reality. The only thing I know is that I paint because I need to, and I paint whatever passes through my head without any other consideration.
general.author: frida kahlo

general.quote: People don’t have time to wait for somebody to paint their portraits anymore. The money is in photography.
general.author: robert mapplethorpe

general.quote: Life is painting a picture, not doing a sum.
general.author: oliver wendell holmes jr.

general.quote: Drawing is speaking to the eye; talking is painting to the ear.
general.author: joseph joubert

general.quote: I adore the theater and I am a painter. I think the two are made for a marriage of love. I will give all my soul to prove this once more.
general.author: marc chagall

general.quote: The most effective moments in the theatre are those that appeal to basic and commonplace emotions–love of woman, love of home, love of country, love of right, anger, jealousy, revenge, ambition, lust, and treachery.
general.author: clayton hamilton

general.quote: The theatre is the best way of showing the gap between what is said and what is seen to be done, and that is why, ragged and gap-toothed as it is, it has still a far healthier potential than some poorer, abandoned arts.
general.author: david hare

general.quote: Theatre is a mirror, a sharp reflection of society.
general.author: yasmina reza

general.quote: The theatre, for all its artifices, depicts life in a sense more truly than history, because the medium has a kindred movement to that of real life, though an artificial setting and form.
general.author: george santayana

general.quote: I think theatre should always be somewhat suspect.
general.author: vaclav havel

general.quote: The theater needs continual reminders that there is nothing more debasing than the work of those who do well what is not worth doing at all.
general.author: gore vidal

general.quote: From the start it has been the theatre’s business to entertain people … it needs no other passport than fun.
general.author: bertolt brecht

general.quote: It’s one of the tragic ironies of the theatre that only one man in it can count on steady work — the night watchman.
general.author: tallulah bankhead

general.quote: The theatre is certainly a place for learning about the brevity of human glory: oh all those wonderful glittering absolutely vanished pantomimes.
general.author: iris murdoch

general.quote: Applause begets applause in the theatre, as laughter begets laughter and tears beget tears.
general.author: clayton hamilton

general.quote: You need three things in the theater – the play, the actors and the audience, – and each must give something.
general.author: kenneth haigh

general.quote: The pit of a theatre is the one place where the tears of virtuous and wicked men alike are mingled.
general.author: denis diderot

general.quote: Coughing in the theater is not a respiratory ailment. It is a criticism.
general.author: alan jay lerner

general.quote: I think that’s just the dichotomy of the theater, who funds and who comes to watch.
general.author: anna deavere smith

general.quote: The theatre is a gross art, built in sweeps and over-emphasis. Compromise is its second name.
general.author: enid bagnold

general.quote: To enter a theatre for a performance is to be inducted into a magical space, to be ushered into the sacred arena of the imagination.
general.author: simon callow

general.quote: The theater is the only branch of art much cared for by people of wealth; like canasta, it does away with the bother of talk after dinner.
general.author: mary mccarthy

general.quote: Many plays, certainly mine, are like blank cheques. The actors and directors put their own signatures on them.
general.author: thornton wilder

general.quote: The primary function of a theater is not to please itself, or even to please its audience. It is to serve talent.
general.author: robert brustein

general.quote: It isn’t a shortage of good scripts that ails the theater; it is a shortage of producers who know a good script when they see one.
general.author: george jean nathan

general.quote: The stage is life, music, beautiful girls, legs, breasts, not talk or intellectualism or dried-up academics.
general.author: harold clurman

general.quote: It is a lazy public which promotes a slothful and irresponsible theater.
general.author: edward albee

general.quote: I regard the theatre as the greatest of all art forms, the most immediate way in which a human being can share with another the sense of what it is to be a human being.
general.author: thornton wilder

general.quote: A theater requires two good producers: one to produce the play, and the other to produce the cash.
general.author: evan esar

general.quote: Cinema should make you forget you are sitting in a theater.
general.author: roman polanski

general.quote: A theatre, a literature, an artistic expression that does not speak for its own time has no relevance.
general.author: dario fo

general.quote: The theater, which is in no thing, but makes use of everything — gestures, sounds, words, screams, light, darkness — rediscovers itself at precisely the point where the mind requires a language to express its manifestations. To break through language in order to touch life is to create or recreate the theatre.
general.author: antonin artaud

general.quote: I write plays for people who wouldn’t be seen dead in the theatre.
general.author: barrie keeffe

general.quote: In the theater the audience wants to be surprised but by things that they expect.
general.author: tristan bernard

general.quote: Theatergoing is a communal act, movie going a solitary one.
general.author: robert brustein

general.quote: Movies will make you famous; Television will make you rich; But theatre will make you good.
general.author: terrence mann

general.quote: No theater could sanely flourish until there was an umbilical connection between what was happening on the stage and what was happening in the world.
general.author: kenneth tynan

general.quote: Theater people are always pining and agonizing because they’re afraid that they’ll be forgotten. And in America they’re quite right. They will be.
general.author: agnes de mille

general.quote: We need a type of theatre which not only releases the feelings, insights and impulses possible within the particular historical field of human relations in which the action takes place, but employs and encourages those thoughts and feelings which help transform the field itself.
general.author: bertolt brecht

general.quote: I have never regarded any theater as much more than the conclusion to a dinner or the prelude to a supper.
general.author: max beerbohm

general.quote: The history of theatre is the history of first nights.
general.author: john lahr

general.quote: It is a hopeless Endeavour to attract people to a theatre unless they can be first brought to believe that they will never get in.
general.author: charles dickens quotes

general.quote: The center of the stage is where I am.
general.author: martha graham

general.quote: We live in what is, but we find 1,000 ways not to face it. Great theatre strengthens our faculty to face it.
general.author: thornton wilder

general.quote: Broadway is a place where people spend money they haven’t earned to buy things they don’t need to impress people they don’t like.
general.author: sir henry wotton

general.quote: One of the first and most important things for a critic to learn is how to sleep undetected at the theatre.
general.author: william archer

general.quote: The truth, the absolute truth, is that the chief beauty for the theatre consists in fine bodily proportions.
general.author: sarah bernhardt

general.quote: The theatre is a place where one has time for the problems of people to whom one would show the door if they came to one’s office for a job.
general.author: tennessee williams

general.quote: The stage is not merely the meeting place of all the arts, but is also the return of art to life.
general.author: oscar wilde

general.quote: The theater is so endlessly fascinating because it’s so accidental. It’s so much like life.
general.author: arthur miller

general.quote: As long as more people will pay admission to a theater to see a naked body than to see a naked brain, the drama will languish.
general.author: george bernard shaw quotes

general.quote: There is only one necessary condition for the emergence of a new theatre, that the stage and auditorium should be open to the masses, should be able to contain a people and the actions of a people.
general.author: romain rolland

general.quote: The play was a great success but the audience was a disaster.
general.author: oscar wilde quotes

general.quote: From the viewpoint of analytic psychology, the theatre, aside from any aesthetic value, may be considered as an institution for the treatment of the mass complex.
general.author: carl jung

general.quote: Life is a theatre set in which there are but few practicable entrances.
general.author: victor hugo quotes

general.quote: A jest is a very serious thing.
general.author: charles churchill

general.quote: To smile at the jest which plants a thorn in another’s breast is to become a principal in the mischief.
general.author: richard brinsley sheridan

general.quote: A paltry, humbug jest; those who have the least wit make them best.
general.author: william combe

general.quote: A lot of truth is said in jest.
general.author: eminem

general.quote: Those who can least bear a jest upon themselves, will be most diverted with one passed on others.
general.author: samuel richardson

general.quote: Never injure a friend, even in jest.
general.author: marcus tullius cicero

general.quote: Jesters do often prove prophets.
general.author: joseph addison

general.quote: Beware of biting jests; the more truth they carry with them, the greater wounds they give, the greater smarts they cause, and the greater scars they leave behind them.
general.author: johann kaspar lavater

general.quote: I do not like this fooling.
general.author: william shakespeare

general.quote: A bitter jest, when the satire comes too near the truth, leaves a sharp sting behind.
general.author: tacitus

general.quote: A college joke to cure the dumps.
general.author: jonathan swift

general.quote: Jesting and levity accustom a man to lewdness.
general.author: akiva ben joseph

general.quote: The squirrel that you kill in jest, dies in earnest.
general.author: henry david thoreau

general.quote: Lightness, jesting, and joking, can only be indulged at the expense of barrenness of soul, and the loss of the favor of God.
general.author: ellen g. white

general.quote: Jests that give pains are no jests.
general.author: miguel de cervantes

general.quote: A jest loses its point when the jester laughs himself.
general.author: johann christoph friedrich von schiller

general.quote: Judge of a jest when you have done laughing.
general.author: robert lloyd

general.quote: The jest loses its point when he who makes it is the first to laugh.
general.author: friedrich schiller

general.quote: Wanton jests make fools laugh, and wise men frown.
general.author: thomas fuller

general.quote: Listen closely as those around you speak; great truths are revealed in jest.
general.author: javan

general.quote: The jest which is expected is already destroyed.
general.author: samuel johnson

general.quote: He that will lose his friend for a jest, deserves to die a beggar by the bargain.
general.author: thomas fuller

general.quote: No time to break jests when the heartstrings are about to be broken.
general.author: thomas fuller

general.quote: Life is a jest; and all things show it. I thought so once; but now I know it.
general.author: bette davis

general.quote: A good jest forever.
general.author: william shakespeare

general.quote: Wit loses its respect with the good when seen in company with malice; and to smile at the jest which plants a thorn in another’s breast is to become a principal in the mischief.
general.author: richard brinsley sheridan

general.quote: It is good to jest, but not to make a trade of jesting.
general.author: elizabeth i

general.quote: Jest not with the two-edged sword of God’s word.
general.author: thomas fuller

general.quote: Jest with your equals.
general.author: bion of smyrna

general.quote: Jesters do oft prove prophets.
general.author: william shakespeare

general.quote: In comedy, reconcilement with life comes at the point when to the tragic sense only an inalienable difference or dissension with life appears.
general.author: constance rourke

general.quote: All I need to make a comedy is a park, a policeman and a pretty girl.
general.author: charlie chaplin

general.quote: I’m funny how? I mean funny like I’m a clown, like I amuse you? I make you laugh, like I’m here to fuckin’ amuse you? LESS
general.author: nicholas pileggi

general.quote: We mustn’t complain too much of being comedians — it’s an honorable profession. If only we could be good ones the world might gain at least a sense of style. We have failed — that’s all. We are bad comedians, we aren’t bad men.
general.author: graham greene

general.quote: I think being funny is not anyone’s first choice.
general.author: woody allen

general.quote: Dare to wear the foolish clown face.
general.author: frank sinatra

general.quote: Comedy just pokes at problems, rarely confronts them squarely. Drama is like a plate of meat and potatoes, comedy is rather the dessert, a bit like meringue.
general.author: woody allen

general.quote: A man’s got to take a lot of punishment to write a really funny book.
general.author: ernest hemingway

general.quote: The only honest art form is laughter, comedy. You can’t fake it… try to fake three laughs in an hour — ha ha ha ha ha — they’ll take you away, man. You can’t.
general.author: lenny bruce

general.quote: Clowns wear a face that’s painted intentionally on them so they appear to be happy or sad. What kind of mask are you wearing today?
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: All the world loves a clown.
general.author: cole porter

general.quote: A clown is like aspirin, only he works twice as fast.
general.author: groucho marx

general.quote: Most comedy is based on getting a laugh at somebody else’s expense. And I find that that’s just a form of bullying in a major way. So I want to be an example that you can be funny and be kind, and make people laugh without hurting somebody else’s feelings.
general.author: ellen degeneres

general.quote: Writers are a little below the clowns and a little above the trained seals.
general.author: john steinbeck

general.quote: Comedy is simply a funny way of being serious.
general.author: peter ustinov

general.quote: A clown sees life simply, without complications.
general.author: george bishop

general.quote: I remain just one thing, and one thing only–and that is a clown. It places me on a far higher plane than any politician.
general.author: charlie chaplin

general.quote: Comedy naturally wears itself out — destroys the very food on which it lives; and by constantly and successfully exposing the follies and weaknesses of mankind to ridicule, in the end leaves itself nothing worth laughing at.
general.author: william hazlitt

general.quote: A clown’s makeup and character, that’s all he has to sell, He loves and believes in that character.
general.author: emmett kelly

general.quote: Today’s comedian has a cross to bear that he built himself. A comedian of the older generation did an "act" and he told the audience, "This is my act." Today’s comic is not doing an act. The audience assumes he’s telling the truth. What is truth today may be a damn lie next week.
general.author: lenny bruce

general.quote: Charlie Chaplin’s genius was in comedy. He has no sense of humor, particularly about himself.
general.author: lita grey chaplin

general.quote: There is not one female comic who was beautiful as a little girl.
general.author: joan rivers

general.quote: Comedy comes from conflict, from hatred.
general.author: warren mitchell

general.quote: Life is a tragedy when seen in close-up, but a comedy in long-shot.
general.author: charlie chaplin

general.quote: Tragedy is when I cut my finger. Comedy is when you fall into an open sewer and die.
general.author: mel brooks

general.quote: Comedy is an escape, not from truth but from despair; a narrow escape into faith.
general.author: christopher fry

general.quote: Comedy deflates the sense precisely so that the underlying lubricity and malice may bubble to the surface.
general.author: paul goodman

general.quote: The comic spirit is given to us in order that we may analyze, weigh, and clarify things in us which nettle us, or which we are outgrowing, or trying to reshape.
general.author: thornton wilder

general.quote: Comedy, like sodomy, is an unnatural act.
general.author: marty feldman

general.quote: Comedy is tragedy that happens to other people.
general.author: angela carter

general.quote: We are living in the machine age. For the first time in history the comedian has been compelled to supply himself with jokes and comedy material to compete with the machine. Whether he knows it or not, the comedian is on a treadmill to oblivion.
general.author: fred a. allen

general.quote: The only rules comedy can tolerate are those of taste, and the only limitations those of libel.
general.author: james thurber

general.quote: Comedy can be a cathartic way to deal with personal trauma.
general.author: robin williams

general.quote: Comedy may be big business but it isn’t pretty.
general.author: steve martin

general.quote: I see myself as an intelligent, sensitive human, with the soul of a clown which forces me to blow it at the most important moments.
general.author: jim morrison

general.quote: My own habitual feeling is that the world is so extremely odd, and everything in it so surprising. Why should there be green grass and liquid water, and why have I got hands and feet.
general.author: john jay chapman

general.quote: There is a thin line that separates laughter and pain, comedy and tragedy, humor and hurt.
general.author: erma bombeck

general.quote: Making eye contact with adults while dressed as a clown is risky.
general.author: doug coupland

general.quote: I always loved comedy, but I never knew it was something you could learn to do. I always thought that some people are born comedians … just like some people are born dentists.
general.author: paul reiser

general.quote: Comedy is tragedy plus time.
general.author: carol burnett

general.quote: Comedy is the art of making people laugh without making them puke.
general.author: steve martin

general.quote: Never contend with one that is foolish, proud, positive, testy, or with a superior, or a clown, in matter of argument.
general.author: thomas fuller

general.quote: The test of a real comedian is whether you laugh at him before he opens his mouth.
general.author: george jean nathan

general.quote: By blood a king, in heart a clown.
general.author: lord alfred tennyson

general.quote: Humorists can never start to take themselves seriously. It’s literary suicide.
general.author: erma bombeck

general.quote: This world is a comedy to those that think, a tragedy to those that feel.
general.author: horace walpole

general.quote: Life is a dream for the wise, a game for the fool, a comedy for the rich, a tragedy for the poor.
general.author: sholom aleichem

general.quote: Our comedies are not to be laughed at.
general.author: samuel goldwyn

general.quote: Jesting, often, only proves a want of intellect.
general.author: jean de la bruyere

general.quote: Jesting is frequently an evidence of the poverty of the understanding.
general.author: voltaire

general.quote: If you want to help the American theater, don’t be an actress, be an audience.
general.author: tallulah bankhead

general.quote: I believe that in a great city, or even in a small city or a village, a great theater is the outward and visible sign of an inward and probable culture.
general.author: sir laurence olivier

general.quote: Theater is, of course, a reflection of life. Maybe we have to improve life before we can hope to improve theater.
general.author: w r inge

general.quote: I think the theatre is as essential to civilization as safe, pure water.
general.author: vanessa redgrave

general.quote: The world today doesn’t make sense, so why should I paint pictures that do?
general.author: pablo picasso

general.quote: A drawing is simply a line going for a walk.
general.author: paul klee

general.quote: A drawing is always dragged down to the level of its caption.
general.author: james thurber

general.quote: When one paints an ideal, one does not need to limit one’s imagination.
general.author: ellen key

general.quote: There is no gambling like politics. Nothing in which the power of circumstance is more evident.
general.author: benjamin disraeli

general.quote: The gambler is more wicked as he is a greater proficient in his art.
general.author: syrus

general.quote: I do not have a problem, I enjoy gambling, but I think people are trying to make it seem like I have a problem, because people really don’t know.
general.author: michael jordan

general.quote: A gambler is nothing but a man who makes his living out of hope.
general.author: william bolitho

general.quote: Life is like a piano. What you get out of it depends on how you play it.
general.author: tom lehrer

general.quote: The best music happens when you have a personal connection to it. That same philosophy can extend to the instrument you hold in your hands: if a guitar means something special, you’re bound to do great things with it.
general.author: frank iero

general.quote: When I listen to music these days, and I hear Pro Tools and drums that sound like a machine – it kinda sucks the life out of music.
general.author: dave grohl

general.quote: I’m not a singer who plays a bit of drums. I’m a drummer that sings a bit.
general.author: phil collins

general.quote: To one who loves his country in all its parts, it is natural to rejoice in whatever contributes to the prosperity and honor and marks the stability and progress of any portion of its people.
general.author: jefferson davis

general.quote: Tolerance and celebration of individual differences is the fire that fuels lasting love.
general.author: tom hannah

general.quote: Like a ten-ton cake, the world is more than anyone can eat at one sitting. Select a piece of it, then enjoy the party.
general.author: samuel m silver

general.quote: We do not celebrate the death of our enemies.
general.author: yitzhak rabin

general.quote: A Picture of many colors proclaims images of many Thoughts.
general.author: donna a. favors

general.quote: Some colors reconcile themselves to one another, others just clash.
general.author: edvard munch

general.quote: Sit in reverie, and watch the changing color of the waves that break upon the idle seashore of the mind
general.author: henry wadsworth longfellow

general.quote: The beggar wears all colors fearing none.
general.author: charles lamb

general.quote: Many children appear graceful enough until they begin to learn to dance.
general.author: s. t. coleridge

general.quote: Don’t sing for me, dance for me.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: Dancing is wonderful training for girls, it’s the first way you learn to guess what a man is going to do before he does it.
general.author: christopher morley

general.quote: A perpendicular expression of a horizontal desire.
general.author: george bernard shaw

general.quote: Swans sing before they die — t’were no bad thing did certain persons die before they sing.
general.author: samuel taylor coleridge

general.quote: I sing like I feel.
general.author: ella fitzgerald

general.quote: The total person sings not just the vocal chords.
general.author: esther broner

general.quote: This is a fault common to all singers, that among their friends they will never sing when they are asked; unasked, they will never desist.
general.author: horace

general.quote: Always be a first-rate version of yourself, instead of a second-rate version of somebody else.
general.author: judy garland

general.quote: Most people think an artist tries to be original, but originality is the last thing that develops in the artist.
general.author: lukas foss

general.quote: Great success in examinations does naturally not as a rule go with originality of thought.
general.author: edward carpenter

general.quote: Be what you are. This is the first step toward becoming better than you are.
general.author: julius charles hare

general.quote: Every man is a damn fool for at least five minutes every day; wisdom consists in not exceeding the limit.
general.author: elbert hubbard

general.quote: Alone we can do so little; together we can do so much.
general.author: helen keller

general.quote: Ideologies separate us. Dreams and anguish bring us together.
general.author: wugene ionesco

general.quote: I think togetherness is a very important ingredient to family life. It’s a cliché and we use it too much but I think for a husband and wife, the way to stay close is to do things together and share.
general.author: barbara bush

general.quote: Chains do not hold a marriage together. It is threads, hundreds of tiny threads which sew people together through the years. That is what makes a marriage last –more than passion or even sex!
general.author: simon signoret

general.quote: A conference is a gathering of people who singly can do nothing, but together can decide that nothing can be done.
general.author: fred a.allen

general.quote: A city is a large community where people are lonesome together.
general.author: herbert prochnow

general.quote: Coming together is a beginning, staying together is progress, and working together is success.
general.author: henry ford

general.quote: All the wealth of the world cannot be compared with the happiness of living together happily united.
general.author: margaret d’youville

general.quote: Love does not consist in gazing at each other, but in looking outward together in the same direction.
general.author: antoine de saint-exupery

general.quote: We must learn to live together as brothers or perish together as fools.
general.author: martin luther king jr.

general.quote: Together, we’ll live with the sadness. I’ll love you with all the madness in my soul.
general.author: koushun takami

general.quote: Constant togetherness is fine — but only for Siamese twins.
general.author: victoria billings

general.quote: Problems can become opportunities when the right people come together.
general.author: robert redford

general.quote: Laughter is, after speech, the chief thing that holds society together.
general.author: max eastman

general.quote: Friendship is the only cement that will ever hold the world together.
general.author: woodrow t.wilson

general.quote: There are two golden rules for an orchestra: start together and finish together. The public doesn’t give a damn what goes on in between.
general.author: sir thomas beecham

general.quote: There can only be one state of mind as you approach any profound test; total concentration, a spirit of togetherness, and strength.
general.author: pat riley

general.quote: It’s easy to get the players; it’s getting them to play together that’s the tough part.
general.author: casey stengel

general.quote: True happiness comes from the joy of deeds well done, the zest of creating things new.
general.author: antoine de saint-exupery

general.quote: To those of you who received honours, awards and distinctions, I say well done. And to the C students, I say you, too, can be president of the United States.
general.author: george w. bush

general.quote: What is once well done is done forever.
general.author: henry david thoreau

general.quote: All of us want to do well. But if we do not do good, too, then doing well will never be enough.
general.author: anna quindlen

general.quote: Ability is what you’re capable of doing. Motivation determines what you do. Attitude determines how well you do it.
general.author: lou holtz

general.quote: If young men had wit and old men strength everything might be well done.
general.author: italian

general.quote: There is much satisfaction in work well done; praise is sweet; but there can be no happiness equal to the joy of finding a heart that understands.
general.author: victor robinson

general.quote: To say, "well done" to any bit of good work is to take hold of the powers which have made the effort and strengthen them beyond our knowledge.
general.author: phillips brooks

general.quote: Well done, is better than well said.
general.author: benjamin franklin

general.quote: Well begun is half done.
general.author: english

general.quote: Some people want to be praised for the rest of their lives for what they have done well for one day.
general.author: chinese

general.quote: The smallest task, well done, becomes a miracle of achievement.
general.author: og mandino

general.quote: It is the privilege of any human work which is well done to invest the doer with a certain haughtiness. He can well afford not to conciliate, whose faithful work will answer for him.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson

general.quote: A thing well done is worth doing.
general.author: hugh leonard

general.quote: If something is exceptionally well done it has embedded in it’s very existence the aim of lifting the common denominator rather than catering to it.
general.author: edward fischer

general.quote: If you want work well done, select a busy man; the other kind has no time.
general.author: elbert hubbard

general.quote: Any job very well done that has been carried out by a person who is fully dedicated is always a source of inspiration.
general.author: carlos ghosn

general.quote: Every day’s a perfect gift of time for us to use. Hours waiting to be filled in any way we choose. Each morning brings a quiet hope that rises with the sun. Each evening brings the sweet content that comes with work well done.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: If you be faithful, you will have that honor that comes from God: his Spirit will say in your hearts, Well done, good and faithful servants.
general.author: adam clarke

general.quote: The foolish think that nothing is well done, except that which they do themselves.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: Football is an art, like dancing is an art – but only when it’s well done does it become an art.
general.author: arsene wenger

general.quote: The true reward for a thing well done is to have been the one who did it.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: The worst mistake a boss can make is not to say ‘well done‘.
general.author: john ashcroft

general.quote: There is a wild, splendid, intoxicating joy that follows work well done.
general.author: elbert hubbard

general.quote: If you want a thing well done, do it yourself.
general.author: traditional

general.quote: The irony is that the person not taking risks feels the same amount of fear as the person who regularly takes risks.
general.author: peter mcwilliams

general.quote: Our lives improve only when we take chances — and the first and most difficult risk we can take is to be honest with ourselves.
general.author: walter anderson

general.quote: Educated risks are the key to success.
general.author: william olsten

general.quote: Every man has the right to risk his own life in order to preserve it. Has it ever been said that a man who throws himself out the window to escape from a fire is guilty of suicide.
general.author: jean jacques rousseau

general.quote: To be alive at all involves some risk.
general.author: harold macmillan

general.quote: When you play it too safe, you’re taking the biggest risk of your life. Time is the only wealth we’re given.
general.author: barbara sher

general.quote: Be wary of the man who urges an action in which he himself incurs no risk.
general.author: joaquin setanti

general.quote: Most people would rather be certain they’re miserable, than risk being happy.
general.author: dr. robert anthony

general.quote: To win you have to risk loss.
general.author: jean-claude killy

general.quote: Taking risks gives me energy.
general.author: jay chiat

general.quote: Often greater risk is involved in postponement than in making a wrong decision.
general.author: harry a. hopf

general.quote: Take calculated risks. This is quite different from being rash.
general.author: george s. patton

general.quote: Most successful people are people who take risks — calculated risks — but nevertheless, risks.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: Risk is essential. There is not growth of inspiration in staying within what is safe and comfortable. Once you find out what you do best, why not try something else?
general.author: alex noble

general.quote: There are always risks in freedom. The only risk in bondage is breaking free.
general.author: gita bellin

general.quote: A man sits as many risks as he runs.
general.author: henry david thoreau

general.quote: What is necessary is never a risk.
general.author: cardinal jean francois de retz

general.quote: If your life is free of failures, you’re not taking enough risks.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: I want to work with the top people, because only they have the courage and the confidence and the risk– seeking profile that you need.
general.author: laurel cutler

general.quote: During the first period of a man’s life, the danger is not to take the risk.
general.author: soren kierkegaard

general.quote: People who take risks are the people you’ll lose against.
general.author: john sculley

general.quote: If we don’t succeed, we run the risk of failure.
general.author: j danforth quayle

general.quote: If you are not willing to risk the unusual, you will have to settle for the ordinary.
general.author: jim rohn

general.quote: Sometimes I think we can tell how important it is to risk by how dangerous it is to do so.
general.author: sonia johnson

general.quote: And the trouble is, if you don’t risk anything, you risk even more.
general.author: erica jong

general.quote: Growth means change and change involves risk, stepping from the known to the unknown.
general.author: george shinn

general.quote: The people I want to hear about are the people who take risks.
general.author: robert lee frost

general.quote: We don’t grow unless we take risks. Any successful company is riddled with failures.
general.author: james e. burke

general.quote: The risks of luxury must be balanced against the costs of necessity and proof of utility.
general.author: arthur c. frantzreb

general.quote: You risk just as much in being credulous as in being suspicious.
general.author: denis diderot

general.quote: Progress always involves risks. You can’t steal second base and keep your foot on first.
general.author: frederick b. wilcox

general.quote: Risk comes from not knowing what you’re doing.
general.author: warren buffett

general.quote: In order to find the edge, you must risk going over the edge.
general.author: dennis dugan

general.quote: The willingness to take risks is our grasp of faith.
general.author: george e. woodberry

general.quote: All of life is a risk; in fact we’re not going to get out alive. Casualness leads to casualties. Communication is the ability to affect other people with words.
general.author: jim rohn

general.quote: It is only by risking… that we live at all.
general.author: william james

general.quote: Risk more than others think is safe. Care more than others think is wise. Dream more than others think is practical. Expect more than others think is possible.
general.author: cadet maxim

general.quote: If you don’t accept failure as a possibility, you don’t set high goals, you don’t branch out, you don’t try — you don’t take the risk.
general.author: rosalynn carter

general.quote: The trouble is, if you don’t risk anything, you risk even more.
general.author: erica jong

general.quote: Take a risk — jump out of your comfort zone!
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: The policy of being too cautious is the greatest risk of all.
general.author: jawaharlal nehru

general.quote: Every minute of life I take a risk; it’s part of the enjoyment.
general.author: otto preminger

general.quote: Risk is a part of God’s game, alike for men and nations.
general.author: george e. woodberry

general.quote: To live without risk for me would be tantamount to death.
general.author: jacqueline cochran

general.quote: In putting off what one has to do, one runs the risk of never being able to do it.
general.author: charles baudelaire

general.quote: There’s no reward in life without risk.
general.author: barry j. farber

general.quote: To win without risk is to triumph without glory.
general.author: pierre corneille

general.quote: Nothing noble is done without risk.
general.author: andre gide

general.quote: Every noble acquisition is attended with its risks; he who fears to encounter the one must not expect to obtain the other.
general.author: pietro metastasio

general.quote: It is impossible to win the great prizes of life without running risks, and the greatest of all prizes are those connected with the home.
general.author: theodore roosevelt

general.quote: Any life truly lived is a risky business, and if one puts up too many fences against the risks one ends by shutting out life itself.
general.author: kenneth s. davis

general.quote: Living at risk is jumping off the cliff and building your wings on the way down.
general.author: ray bradbury

general.quote: There’s as much risk in doing nothing as in doing something.
general.author: trammell crow

general.quote: If you don’t take risks, you’ll have a wasted soul.
general.author: drew barrymore

general.quote: First weigh the considerations, then take the risks.
general.author: helmuth von moltke

general.quote: We must have courage to bet on our ideas, to take the calculated risk, and to act.
general.author: maxwell maltz

general.quote: I think we should follow a simple rule: if we can take the worst, take the risk.
general.author: dr. joyce brothers

general.quote: Risk! Risk anything… Do the hardest thing on earth for you. Act for yourself. Face the truth.
general.author: katherine mansfield

general.quote: To get profit without risk, experience without danger and reward without work is as impossible as it is to live without being born.
general.author: a.p. gouthey

general.quote: Life is inherently risky. There is only one big risk you should avoid at all costs, and that is the risk of doing nothing.
general.author: denis waitley

general.quote: Great deeds are usually wrought at great risks.
general.author: william hazlitt

general.quote: He who is not courageous enough to take risks will accomplish nothing in life.
general.author: muhammad ali

general.quote: You have to risk failure to succeed.
general.author: an wang

general.quote: Where there is much to risk, there is much to consider.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: We don’t grow unless we take risks.
general.author: james e. burke

general.quote: Courage is clearly a readiness to risk self-humiliation.
general.author: nigel dennis

general.quote: The risk of a wrong decision is preferable to the terror of indecision.
general.author: maimonides

general.quote: Life has no romance without risk.
general.author: sarah doherty

general.quote: People of privilege will always risk their complete destruction rather than surrender any material part of their advantage.
general.author: john kenneth galbraith

general.quote: Take risks: if you win, you will be happy; if you lose, you will be wise.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: If you risk nothing, then you risk everything.
general.author: geena davis

general.quote: One of the reasons mature people stop learning is that they become less and less willing to risk failure.
general.author: john w. gardner

general.quote: To save all, we must risk all.
general.author: johann friedrich von schiller

general.quote: Security is not the meaning of my life. Great opportunities are worth the risk.
general.author: shirley hufstedler

general.quote: You’ve got to keep fighting; you’ve got to risk your life every six months to stay alive.
general.author: elia kazan

general.quote: To conquer without risk is to triumph without glory.
general.author: pierre corneille

general.quote: Life without risk is not worth living.
general.author: charles a. lindbergh

general.quote: It’s a little like wrestling a gorilla. You don’t quit when you’re tired, you quit when the gorilla is tired.
general.author: robert strauss

general.quote: Age wrinkles the body. Quitting wrinkles the soul.
general.author: douglas macarthur

general.quote: I hated every minute of training, but I said, "Don’t quit. Suffer now and live the rest of your life as a champion.
general.author: muhammad ali quotes

general.quote: He believes that marriage and a career don’t mix. So after the wedding he plans to quit his job.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: There’s only one way you can fail, and that’s to quit.
general.author: brian hays

general.quote: I’ve always made a total effort, even when the odds seemed entirely against me. I never quit trying; I never felt that I didn’t have a chance to win.
general.author: arnold palmer

general.quote: Quit now, you’ll never make it. If you disregard this advice, you’ll be halfway there.
general.author: david zucker

general.quote: Your biggest break can come from never quitting. Being at the right place at the right time can only happen when you keep moving toward the next opportunity.
general.author: arthur pine

general.quote: Quitting is the easiest thing to do.
general.author: robert kiyosaki

general.quote: There’s a difference between quittin and knowin when you’re beat.
general.author: cormac mccarthy

general.quote: Hard times ain’t quit and we ain’t quit.
general.author: meridel le sueur

general.quote: Have you ever considered the cost of quitting? For a real eye opener… ask Thomas Edison… Steve Jobs… Michael Jordan… or Jim Carrey. Ask them how much it would have cost them if they had quit. What about you?
general.author: doug firebaugh

general.quote: It’s not whether you get knocked down, it’s whether you get up.
general.author: vince lombardi

general.quote: People of mediocre ability sometimes achieve outstanding success because they don’t know when to quit. Most men succeed because they are determined to.
general.author: george e. allen

general.quote: You’re never a loser until you quit trying.
general.author: mike ditka

general.quote: Doing nothing is the most tiresome job in the world because you cannot quit and rest.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: No one wants to quit when he’s losing and no one wants to quit when he’s winning.
general.author: richard petty

general.quote: Learned helplessness is the giving-up reaction, the quitting response that follows from the belief that whatever you do doesn’t matter.
general.author: martin seligan

general.quote: You can’t go through life quitting everything. If you’re going to achieve anything, you’ve got to stick with something.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: It’s always too soon to quit.
general.author: david t. scoates

general.quote: Success… seems to be connected with action. Successful men keep moving. They make mistakes, but they don’t quit.
general.author: conrad hilton

general.quote: The basis of accomplishment is in never quitting.
general.author: mencius (mengzi meng-tse)

general.quote: If you don’t quit, and don’t cheat, and don’t run home when trouble arrives, you can only win.
general.author: shelley long

general.quote: Enjoy the journey, enjoy every moment, and quit worrying about winning and losing.
general.author: matt biondi

general.quote: Defeat doesn’t finish a man — quit does.
general.author: richard m. nixon quotes

general.quote: If at first you don’t succeed, try again. Then quit. No use being a damn fool about it.
general.author: w. c. fields

general.quote: Most people give up just when they’re about to achieve success. They quit on the one yard line. They give up at the last minute of the game, one foot from a winning touchdown.
general.author: h. ross perot

general.quote: A man is not finished when he’s defeated; he’s finished when he quits.
general.author: richard m. nixon

general.quote: A professional writer is an amateur who didn’t quit.
general.author: richard bach

general.quote: Champions don’t quit.
general.author: mike tyson

general.quote: Determination that just won’t quit — that’s what it takes.
general.author: aj foyt

general.quote: A quitter never wins and a winner never quits.
general.author: napoleon hill quotes

general.quote: The problem with self-improvement is knowing when to quit.
general.author: david lee roth

general.quote: I never quit trying. i never felt that i didn’t have a chance to win.
general.author: arnold palmer

general.quote: Pain is temporary. Quitting lasts forever.
general.author: lance armstrong

general.quote: I quit being afraid when my first venture failed and the sky didn’t fall down.
general.author: allen h. neuharth

general.quote: Effort only fully releases its reward after a person refuses to quit.
general.author: napoleon hill

general.quote: Once you learn to quit, it becomes a habit.
general.author: vince lombardi quotes

general.quote: Quit worrying about your health. It’ll go away.
general.author: robert orben

general.quote: First there are those who are winners, and know they are winners. Then there are the losers who know they are losers. Then there are those who are not winners, but don’t know it. They’re the ones for me. They never quit trying. They’re the soul of our game.
general.author: bear bryant

general.quote: The way to succeed is never quit. That’s it. But really be humble about it…. You start out lowly and humble and you carefully try to learn an accretion of little things that help you get there.
general.author: alex hailey

general.quote: What this power is I cannot say; all I know is that it exists and it becomes available only when a man is in that state of mind in which he knows exactly what he wants and is fully determined not to quit until he finds it.
general.author: alexander graham bell quotes

general.quote: Plans are nothing; planning is everything.
general.author: dwight d eisenhower

general.quote: Your life can’t go according to plan if you have no plan.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: Men never plan to be failures; they simply fail to plan to be successful.
general.author: william a.ward

general.quote: Plans get you into things, but you got to work your way out.
general.author: will rogers

general.quote: Many people spend more time in planning the wedding than they do in planning the marriage
general.author: zig ziglar

general.quote: Always be planning something.
general.author: john a. schindler

general.quote: It’s never too late to start planning for the future.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: When defeat comes, accept it as a signal that your plans are not sound, rebuild those plans, and set sail once more toward your coveted goal.
general.author: napoleon hill

general.quote: A good plan violently executed right now is far better than a perfect plan executed next week.
general.author: george s patton

general.quote: It is a bad plan that admits of no modification.
general.author: syrus (publilius syrus)

general.quote: If you don’t design your own life plan, chances are you’ll fall into someone else’s plan. And guess what they have planned for you? Not much.
general.author: jim rohn

general.quote: A good plan today is better than a perfect plan tomorrow.
general.author: george s patton

general.quote: If you have accomplished all that you have planned for yourself, you have not planned enough
general.author: edward

general.quote: Create a definite plan for carrying out your desire and begin at once, whether you ready or not, to put this plan into action.
general.author: napoleon hill

general.quote: God’s retirement plan is out of this world
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: Failure is nature’s plan to prepare you for great responsibilities.
general.author: napoleon hill

general.quote: Planning without action is futile, action without planning is fatal
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: A life that hasn’t a definite plan is likely to become driftwood.
general.author: david sarnoff

general.quote: Planning is an unnatural process; it is much more fun to do something. The nicest thing about not planning is that failure comes as a complete surprise, rather than being preceded by a period of worry and depression.
general.author: sir john harvey

general.quote: Architect. One who drafts a plan of your house, and plans a draft of your money.
general.author: ambrose bierce

general.quote: Plan for this world as if you expect to live forever; but plan for the hereafter as if you expect to die tomorrow.
general.author: ibn gabirol

general.quote: Plan your work for today and every day, then work your plan.
general.author: norman vincent peal

general.quote: Failing to plan is planning to fail.
general.author: alan lakein

general.quote: Nothing is so often irretrievably missed as a daily opportunity.
general.author: marie von ebner-eschenbach

general.quote: Opportunities are never lost; someone will take the one you miss.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: Catch a man a fish and you can sell it to him. Teach a man to fish, and you ruin a wonderful business opportunity.
general.author: karl marx

general.quote: The cleverest of all the devils is Opportunity.
general.author: christoph martin wieland

general.quote: The lack of opportunity is ever the excuse of the weak.
general.author: orison swett marden

general.quote: I always tried to turn every disaster into an opportunity.
general.author: john d. rockefeller

general.quote: Friendship is always a sweet responsibility, never an opportunity.
general.author: kahlil gibran quotes

general.quote: Equality of opportunity is an equal opportunity to prove unequal talents.
general.author: viscount samuel

general.quote: Improve time in the present; for opportunity is precious, and time is a sword.
general.author: moslih eddin

general.quote: While we stop to think, we often miss our opportunity.
general.author: publilius syrus

general.quote: Opportunities are usually disguised as hard work, so most people don’t recognize them.
general.author: ann landers

general.quote: The door of opportunity is wide open if you are prepared.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: Success occurs when opportunity meets preparation.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: It takes a certain level of aspiration before one can take advantage of opportunities that are clearly offered.
general.author: michael harrington

general.quote: Little opportunities should be improved.
general.author: francois de salignac fenelon

general.quote: In the middle of difficulty lies opportunity.
general.author: albert einstein quotes

general.quote: Opportunities do not come with their values stamped upon them.
general.author: maltbie babcock

general.quote: Opportunity is as scarce as oxygen; men fairly breathe it and do not know it.
general.author: doc sane

general.quote: The sure way to miss success is to miss the opportunity.
general.author: victor charles

general.quote: The bigger the challenge, the greater the opportunity.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: If a window of opportunity appears, don’t pull down the shade.
general.author: thomas j. peters

general.quote: Men do with opportunities as children do at the seashore; they fill their little hands with sand, and then let the grains fall through, one by one, till all are gone.
general.author: thomas jones

general.quote: The man who sees an opportunity and does nothing is asleep with his eyes open.
general.author: brian herbert & keven j. anderson

general.quote: Every day is an opportunity to make a new happy ending.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: Opportunity is one of those things that depend greatly on the eye of the beholder.
general.author: andrew sanchez

general.quote: Jumping at several small opportunities may get us there more quickly than waiting for one big one to come along.
general.author: hugh allen

general.quote: Opportunity rarely knocks until you are ready. And few people have ever been really ready without receiving opportunity’s call.
general.author: channing pollock

general.quote: A pessimist is one who makes difficulties of his opportunities and an optimist is one who makes opportunities of his difficulties.
general.author: harry truman

general.quote: Opportunity is missed by most people because it comes dressed in overalls and looks like work.
general.author: thomas a. edison quotes

general.quote: Every conversation is an opportunity for success.
general.author: debra fine

general.quote: Look for opportunity. You can’t wait for it to knock on the door…. You might not be home.
general.author: jinger heath

general.quote: A philosopher being asked what was the first thing necessary to win the love of a woman, answered, Opportunity!
general.author: thomas moore

general.quote: Opportunity, to statesmen, is as the just degree of heat to chemists; it perfects all the work.
general.author: sir john suckling

general.quote: Opportunity is the great bawd.
general.author: benjamin franklin quotes

general.quote: Small opportunities are often the beginning of great enterprises.
general.author: demosthenes

general.quote: The secret of success in life is for a man to be ready for his opportunity when it comes.
general.author: benjamin disraeli

general.quote: There is far more opportunity than there is ability.
general.author: thomas a. edison

general.quote: Opportunities … fall in the way of every man who is resolved to take advantage of them.
general.author: samuel smiles

general.quote: We must open the doors of opportunity.
general.author: lyndon b. johnson

general.quote: Opportunity is often difficult to recognize; we usually expect it to beckon us with beepers and billboards.
general.author: william arthur ward

general.quote: Opportunity is ever worth expecting; let your hood be ever hanging ready. The fish will be in the pool where you least imagine it to be.
general.author: ovid

general.quote: A wise man doesn’t just wait for the right opportunity, he creates the right opportunity.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: The golden opportunity is never offered twice.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: Opportunity always looks better going than coming.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: No great man ever complains of want of opportunity.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson quotes

general.quote: Trouble is only opportunity in work clothes.
general.author: henry j. kaiser

general.quote: Don’t think problem, think opportunity.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: As fast as each opportunity presents itself, use it! No matter how tiny an opportunity it may be, use it!
general.author: robert collier

general.quote: Education is the key to opportunity. It’s a ticket out of poverty.
general.author: george h. bush

general.quote: Opportunities fly by while we sit regretting the chances we have lost, and the happiness that comes to us we heed not, because of the happiness that is gone.
general.author: jerome k. jerome

general.quote: People wait for opportunity to come along…yet it is there every morning.
general.author: dennis the menace

general.quote: An opportunity is a conjunction of circumstances by which one may improve his condition of life or his equipment for life.
general.author: william de witt hyde

general.quote: The door of opportunity won’t open unless you do some pushing.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: Regret of neglected opportunity is the worst hell that a living soul can inhabit.
general.author: rafael sabatini

general.quote: Our great social and political advantage is opportunity.
general.author: george william curtis

general.quote: Many an opportunity is lost because a man is out looking for four-leaf clovers.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: If time be a ring of gold, opportunity is the rich diamond that gives it both its value and glory.
general.author: john flavel

general.quote: Nothing is more expensive than a missed opportunity.
general.author: h. jackson brown jr.

general.quote: A man must make his opportunity, as oft as find it.
general.author: francis bacon

general.quote: Opportunity is as constant as the shadows that walk with us, and is always present in our affairs.
general.author: doc schmidt

general.quote: If opportunity doesn’t knock, build a door.
general.author: milton berle

general.quote: There are those who see an opportunity, and those who seize an opportunity.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: I was seldom able to see an opportunity until it had ceased to be one.
general.author: mark twain quotes

general.quote: Present opportunities are not to be neglected; they rarely visit us twice.
general.author: voltaire quotes

general.quote: An opportunity well taken is the only weapon of advantage.
general.author: john udall

general.quote: Opportunity knocks but once.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: You can’t knock on opportunity’s door and not be ready.
general.author: bruno mars

general.quote: Opportunities are a tricky crop, with tiny flowers that are difficult to see and even more difficult to harvest.
general.author: brian herbert & kevin j. anderson

general.quote: To improve the golden moment of opportunity, and catch the good that is within our reach, is the great art of life.
general.author: samuel johnson

general.quote: Opportunity is a moving target, and the bigger the opportunity, the faster it moves.
general.author: richard gaylord briley

general.quote: Opportunities comes from knocking on doors until they open.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: Learn to listen. Opportunity sometimes knocks very softly.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: The door of opportunity is always marked PUSH.
general.author: bob gass

general.quote: Therefore, as we have opportunity, let us do good to all people.
general.author: bible

general.quote: Opportunity does not knock; it presents itself when you beat down the door.
general.author: kyle chandler

general.quote: In all your dealings, remember that today is your opportunity; tomorrow some other fellow’s.
general.author: george horace lorimer

general.quote: Grasp your opportunities, no matter how poor your health; nothing is worse for your health than boredom.
general.author: mignon mclaughlin

general.quote: I think everyone is an opportunist if they have an opportunity.
general.author: katharine hepburn

general.quote: The opportunity is often lost by deliberating.
general.author: syrus

general.quote: Opportunity makes us known to others, but more to ourselves.
general.author: francois de la rochefoucauld

general.quote: Between tomorrow’s dream and yesterday’s regret is today’s opportunity.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: Opportunity is often dressed up in work clothes.
general.author: croft m. pentz

general.quote: Your opportunity is just as good, perhaps even better, than any other man’s. Get to work where you are. And get to work right now.
general.author: william a. radford

general.quote: The opportunity for doing mischief is found a hundred times a day, and of doing good once in a year.
general.author: voltaire

general.quote: The secret of success is to be ready when your opportunity comes.
general.author: benjamin disraeli

general.quote: Determine your future now by taking hold of every opportunity.
general.author: debbye turner

general.quote: Nothing is so often irrevocably neglected as an opportunity of daily occurrence.
general.author: marie von ebner-eschenbach

general.quote: Alas, for the treachery of opportunity!
general.author: anne l’enclos

general.quote: A pessimist sees the difficulty in every opportunity; an optimist sees the opportunity in every difficulty.
general.author: winston churchill quotes

general.quote: Opportunity is more powerful even than conquerors and prophets.
general.author: benjamin disraeli

general.quote: It is often hard to distinguish between the hard knocks in life and those of opportunity.
general.author: frederick phillips

general.quote: Ability is of little account without opportunity.
general.author: napoleon bonaparte quotes

general.quote: Beware of the man who works hard to learn something, learns it, and finds himself no wiser than before. He is full of murderous resentment of people who are ignorant without having come by their ignorance the hard way.
general.author: kurt vonnegut, jr.

general.quote: I find that the harder I work, the more luck I seem to have.
general.author: thomas jefferson

general.quote: I am a great believer in luck. The harder I work, the more of it I seem to have.
general.author: coleman cox

general.quote: I doubt if hard work, steadily and regularly carried on, ever yet hurt anybody.
general.author: dean arthur penrhyn stanley

general.quote: It’s no credit to anyone to work too hard.
general.author: edgar watson howe

general.quote: Hard work beats all the tonics and vitamins in the world.
general.author: col. harland sanders

general.quote: Most people work just hard enough not to get fired and get paid just enough money not to quit.
general.author: george carlin

general.quote: For every two minutes of glamour, there are eight hours of hard work.
general.author: jessica savitch

general.quote: It is not hard work that is dreary; it is superficial work.
general.author: edith hamilton

general.quote: Whatever muscles I have are the product of my own hard work
general.author: evelyn ashford

general.quote: Hard work is the key to success.
general.author: charles lazarus

general.quote: Some people dream of success… while others wake up and work hard at it.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: If you have talent and you work long and hard at it, anything in the world can be yours.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: I’ve met a few people in my time who were enthusiastic about hard work. And it was just my luck that all of them happened to be men I was working for at the time.
general.author: bill gold

general.quote: The difference between possible and impossible is hard work and commitment.
general.author: robert dole

general.quote: If you continue to work hard, success will follow you.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: Leaders aren’t born they are made. And they are made just like anything else, through hard work. And that’s the price we’ll have to pay to achieve that goal, or any goal.
general.author: vince lombardi

general.quote: How well you like hard work often depends on whether you are doing it or paying for it.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: I believe in work, hard work, and long hours of work. Men do not breakdown from overwork, but from worry and dissipation.
general.author: charles evans hughes

general.quote: The three great essentials to achieve anything worthwhile are: Hard work, Stick-to-itiveness, and Common sense.
general.author: thomas a. edison

general.quote: Hard work brings prosperity; playing around brings poverty.
general.author: bible

general.quote: A dream doesn’t become reality through magic; it takes sweat, determination and hard work.
general.author: colin powell

general.quote: If I am anything, which I highly doubt, I have made myself so by hard work.
general.author: sir isaac newton

general.quote: I know you’ve heard it a thousand times before. But it’s true – hard work pays off. If you want to be good, you have to practice, practice, practice. If you don’t love something, then don’t do it.
general.author: ray bradbury

general.quote: I don’t believe people die from hard work. They die from stress and worry and fear — the negative emotions. Those are the killers, not hard work. The fact is, in our society today, most people don’t understand what hard work is all about.
general.author: a.l. williams

general.quote: My only concern was to get home after a hard day’s work.
general.author: rosa parks

general.quote: I believe in hard work. It keeps the wrinkles out of the mind and spirit.
general.author: helena rubinstein

general.quote: Without hard work, nothing grows but weeds.
general.author: gordon b. hinckley

general.quote: The reason a lot of people do not recognize opportunity is because it usually goes around wearing overalls looking like hard work.
general.author: thomas a. edison

general.quote: Nothing worthwhile comes easily. Work, continuous work and hard work, is the only way to accomplish results that last.
general.author: hamilton holt

general.quote: I pray hard, work hard, and leave the rest to God.
general.author: florence griffith-joyner

general.quote: The price of success is hard work, dedication to the job at hand, and the determination that whether we win or lose, we have applied the best of ourselves to the task at hand.
general.author: vince lombardi

general.quote: By working hard, you get to play hard, guilt-free.
general.author: jim rohn

general.quote: Work hard. Hard work is the best investment a man can make.
general.author: charles m. schwab

general.quote: It’s true hard work never killed anybody, but I figure, why take the chance?
general.author: ronald reagan

general.quote: The daily grind of hard work gets a person polished.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: Dictionary is the only place that success comes before work. Hard work is the price we must pay for success. I think you can accomplish anything if you’re willing to pay the price.
general.author: vince lombardi

general.quote: Love conquers all, but if love doesn’t do it, try hard work
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: The only thing that separates successful people from the ones who aren’t is the willingness to work very, very hard.
general.author: helen gurley brown

general.quote: The only genius that’s worth anything is the genius for hard work.
general.author: kathleen winsor

general.quote: If a job’s worth doing, it’s too hard.
general.author: scott adams

general.quote: Hard work has made it easy. That is my secret. That is why I win.
general.author: nadia comaneci

general.quote: Hope doesn’t guarantee anything; hard work does.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: Perseverance is the hard work you do after you get tired of doing the hard work you already did.
general.author: newt gingrich

general.quote: When a man tells you that he got rich through hard work, ask him: ‘Whose?’
general.author: don marquis

general.quote: What separates the talented individual from the successful one is a lot of hard work.
general.author: stephen king

general.quote: I learned the value of hard work by working hard.
general.author: margaret m. fitzpatrick

general.quote: The only difference between dreams and achievements is hard work.
general.author: chris bollwage.

general.quote: Hard work cheerfully done is easy work, while light work unwillingly done is mere drudgery.
general.author: e.p.day

general.quote: Hard work is rewarding. Taking credit for other people’s hard work is rewarding and faster.
general.author: scott adams

general.quote: There is no substitute for hard work.
general.author: thomas edison

general.quote: Men do their hardest work at the bottom of the ladder, not at the top.
general.author: william feather

general.quote: Hard work spotlights the character of people: some turn up their sleeves, some turn up their noses, and some don’t turn up at all.
general.author: sam ewing

general.quote: People say they love hard workers but they really love natural talent–a bias with troubling implications when it comes to hiring.
general.author: eric jaffe

general.quote: I am no stranger to working hard. I have done it all my life. As a result I have become accustomed to expecting success in everything I do. Some people call me lucky, but I know better.
general.author: donald trump

general.quote: It just seems so useless to have to work so hard and nothin’ ever really seems to come from it.
general.author: tom petty

general.quote: Life grants nothing to us mortals without hard work.
general.author: horace

general.quote: Fewer people are bent from hard work than are crooked from avoiding it.
general.author: zig ziglar

general.quote: Those who work much do not work hard.
general.author: henry david thoreau

general.quote: If hard work were such a wonderful thing, surely the rich would have kept it all to themselves.
general.author: lane kirkland

general.quote: We, whoever we are, must have a daily goal in our lives, no matter how small or great, to make that day mean something.
general.author: maxwell maltz

general.quote: Think little goals and expect little achievements. Think big goals and win big success.
general.author: david j. schwartz

general.quote: Set your goals high enough to inspire you and low enough to encourage you.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: Whoever wants to reach a distant goal must take small steps.
general.author: helmut schmidt

general.quote: If you want to achieve a high goal, you’re going to have to take some chances.
general.author: alberto salazar

general.quote: Write it down. Written goals have a way of transforming wishes into wants; cant’s into cans; dreams into plans; and plans into reality. Don’t just think it — ink it!
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: Often the search proves more profitable than the goal.
general.author: e. l. konigsburg

general.quote: Many are stubborn in pursuit of the path they have chosen, few in pursuit of the goal.
general.author: friedrich wilhelm nietzsche

general.quote: If we fix a goal and work towards it, then we are never just passing time.
general.author: anna neagle

general.quote: No matter what the competition is, I try to find a goal that day and better that goal.
general.author: antoinette brown blackwell

general.quote: What you get by achieving your goals is not as important as what you become by achieving your goals.
general.author: zig ziglar

general.quote: First you write down your goal; your second job is to break down your goal into a series of steps, beginning with steps which are absurdly easy.
general.author: fitzhugh dodson

general.quote: Goals that are not written down are just wishes.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: When we are motivated by goals that have deep meaning, by dreams that need completion, by pure love that needs expressing, then we truly live life.
general.author: greg anderson

general.quote: The important thing is to strive towards a goal which is not immediately visible. that goal is not the concern of the mind, but of the spirit.
general.author: antoine de saint-exupéry

general.quote: Without goals, and plans to reach them, you are like a ship that has set sail with no destination.
general.author: fitzhugh dodson

general.quote: Reach for the moon. If you fall short at least you’ll be among the stars.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: This one step — choosing a goal and sticking to it — changes everything.
general.author: scott reed

general.quote: I’m in my prime. There’s no goal too far, no mountain too high.
general.author: wilma rudolph

general.quote: Without a goal, discipline is nothing but self-punishment.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: God gives us dreams a size too big so that we can grow in them.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: If you’re bored with life — you don’t get up every morning with a burning desire to do things — you don’t have enough goals.
general.author: lou holtz

general.quote: There must be a goal at every stage of life! There must be a goal!
general.author: maggie kuhn

general.quote: The achievement of your goal is assured the moment you commit yourself to it.
general.author: mack r. douglas

general.quote: To solve a problem or to reach a goal, you don’t need to know all the answers in advance. But you must have a clear idea of the problem or the goal you want to reach.
general.author: w. clement stone

general.quote: If you want to reach a goal, you must see yourself reaching it in your own mind before you actually arrive at your goal.
general.author: zig ziglar

general.quote: Decide that you really want to achieve the goal…
general.author: robert j. mckain

general.quote: Our goals can only be reached through a vehicle of a plan, in which we must fervently believe, and upon which we must vigorously act. There is no other route to success.
general.author: stephen a. brennan

general.quote: You set a goal to be the best and then you work hard every hour of every day, striving to reach that goal. If you allow yourself to settle for anything less than number one, you are cheating yourself.
