general.author: don shula

general.quote: Review your goals twice every day in order to be focused on achieving them.
general.author: les brown

general.quote: You are successful the moment you start moving toward a worthwhile goal.
general.author: chester f. carlson

general.quote: My philosophy of life is that if we make up our mind what we are going to make of our lives, then work hard toward that goal, we never lose — somehow we win out.
general.author: ronald reagan

general.quote: Obstacles are those frightful things you see when you take your eyes off your goal.
general.author: henry ford

general.quote: Establishing goals is all right if you don’t let them deprive you of interesting detours.
general.author: doug larson

general.quote: I consider a goal as a journey rather than a destination. And each year I set a new goal.
general.author: curtis carlson

general.quote: The person who has the will to undergo all labor may win any goal.
general.author: menander of athens

general.quote: My ability to concentrate and work toward that goal has been my greatest asset.
general.author: jack nicklaus

general.quote: The only way to reach your long range goals is through achieving your short range objectives.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: Goals are as essential to success as air is to life.
general.author: david j. schwartz

general.quote: Decide what you want and write your goals. Then convert your goals into positive, present-tense statements called affirmations. Affirm your goals each day until they become part of your subconscious mechanism.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: The achievement of one goal should be the starting point of another.
general.author: alexander graham bell

general.quote: Happiness is not a goal, it is a by-product.
general.author: eleanor roosevelt

general.quote: The thing that contributes to anyone’s reaching the goal he wants is simple wanting that goal badly enough.
general.author: charles e. wilson

general.quote: The success mechanism only goes off with a goal. Every time we write down and talk about a goal, we push the button to start the success mechanism.
general.author: charles jones

general.quote: Part of the issue of achievement is to be able to set realistic goals, but that’s one of the hardest things to do because you don’t always know exactly where you’re going, and you shouldn’t.
general.author: george lucas

general.quote: The road leading to a goal does not separate you from the destination; it is essentially a part of it.
general.author: charles delint

general.quote: A goal properly set is halfway reached.
general.author: zig ziglar

general.quote: You must have long-range goals to keep you from being frustrated by short-range failures.
general.author: charles c. noble

general.quote: Concentrate on finding your goal, then concentrate on reaching it.
general.author: michael friedsam

general.quote: In the measurement world, we set a goal and strive to achieve it. In the universe of possibility, we set the context and let life unfold.
general.author: b. zander

general.quote: Success is the progressive realization of a worthy goal or ideal.
general.author: earl nightingale

general.quote: Set short term goals and you’ll win games. Set long term goals and you’ll win championships!
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: I just want to leave the world a little better than I found it, and that’s my goal in life.
general.author: armand hammer

general.quote: Never give up. Keep your thoughts and your mind always on the goal.
general.author: tom bradley

general.quote: Put your goals in writing. If you can’t put it on a sheet of paper, you probably can’t do what it takes to achieve the goal.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: Perfection is our goal, excellence will be tolerated.
general.author: j. yahl

general.quote: Difficulties increase the nearer we approach the goal.
general.author: goethe

general.quote: Without a goal to work toward, we will not get there.
general.author: natasha josefowitz

general.quote: Life’s up and downs provide windows of opportunity to determine your values and goals. Think of using all obstacles as stepping stones to build the life you want.
general.author: marsha sinetar

general.quote: The more goals you set, the more goals you get.
general.author: mark victor hansen

general.quote: You’ll never achieve your dreams if they don’t become goals.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: Freedom requires no effort to enjoy but requires heroic efforts to preserve.
general.author: richard g. scott

general.quote: By his own efforts man could never gain the true and desired riches.
general.author: joseph franklin rutherford

general.quote: The greatest efforts in sports came when the mind is as still as a glass lake.
general.author: timothy gallwey

general.quote: Of all the things I’ve done, the most vital is coordinating those who work with me and aiming their efforts at a certain goal.
general.author: walt disney quotes

general.quote: Wicked thoughts and worthless efforts gradually set their mark on the face, especially the eyes.
general.author: arthur schopenhauer

general.quote: No one can be great, or good or happy except through the inward efforts of themselves.
general.author: frederick w. robertson

general.quote: The jack-of-all-trades seldom is good at any. Concentrate all of your efforts on one definite chief aim.
general.author: napoleon hill

general.quote: Effort is only effort when it begins to hurt.
general.author: josé ortega y gassett

general.quote: God has no intention of setting a limit to the efforts of man to conquer space.
general.author: pius xii

general.quote: Work joyfully and peacefully, knowing that right thoughts and right efforts will inevitably bring about right results.
general.author: james allen

general.quote: Do each daily task the best we can; act as though the eye of opportunity were always upon us.
general.author: william feather

general.quote: If you have enough push, you don’t have to worry about the pull.
general.author: zig ziglar quotes

general.quote: You can do only one thing at a time. I simply tackle one problem and concentrate all efforts on what I am doing at the moment.
general.author: maxwell maltz

general.quote: In efforts to soar above our nature, we invariably fall below it.
general.author: edgar allan poe

general.quote: Who soweth good seed shall surely reap.
general.author: julia c. r. dorr

general.quote: The efforts which we make to escape from our destiny only serve to lead us into it.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson

general.quote: God doesn’t require us to succeed; he only requires us to try.
general.author: mother teresa quotes

general.quote: Things will get better — despite our efforts to improve them.
general.author: will rogers

general.quote: Whoever acquires knowledge but does not practice it is like one who ploughs a field but does not sow it.
general.author: calvin coolidge

general.quote: To learn, you have to listen. To improve, you have to try.
general.author: thomas jefferson quotes

general.quote: It takes no more effort to expect the best, than to fear for the worst. It’s healthier, more productive, and a lot more fun.
general.author: philip hambert

general.quote: Respect your efforts, respect yourself. Self-respect leads to self-discipline. When you have both firmly under your belt, that’s real power.
general.author: clint eastwood

general.quote: What we hope ever to do with ease, we must learn first to do with diligence.
general.author: samuel johnson

general.quote: Things don’t turn up in this world until somebody turns them up.
general.author: james a. garfield

general.quote: We forget that every good that is worth possessing must be paid for in strokes of daily effort. We postpone and postpone, until those smiling possibilities are dead.
general.author: william james

general.quote: Nothing can come of nothing.
general.author: william shakespeare

general.quote: To despise all effort is the greatest effort of all.
general.author: john fowles

general.quote: The bitter and the sweet come from the outside, the hard from within, from one’s own efforts.
general.author: albert einstein quotes

general.quote: Try to forget yourself in the service of others. For when we think too much of ourselves and our own interests, we easily become despondent. But when we work for others, our efforts return to bless us.
general.author: sidney powell

general.quote: No one can become rich by the efforts of only their toil, but only by the discovery of some method of taxing the labor of others.
general.author: john ruskin

general.quote: The one thing that matters is the effort.
general.author: antoine de saint-exupery

general.quote: Sufficient to each day are the duties to be done and the trials to be endured.
general.author: t.l. gayler

general.quote: You have to put in many, many, many tiny efforts that nobody sees or appreciates before you achieve anything worthwhile.
general.author: brian tracy

general.quote: It is only through labor and painful effort, by grim energy and resolute courage, that we move on to better things.
general.author: theodore roosevelt quotes

general.quote: The struggle alone pleases us, not the victory.
general.author: blaise pascal

general.quote: Prayer is not a substitute for work, thinking, watching, suffering, or giving; prayer is a support for all other efforts.
general.author: george a. buttrick

general.quote: Life does not require us to make good; it asks only that we give our best at each level of experience.
general.author: harold ruopp

general.quote: Many a man has finally succeeded only because he has failed after repeated efforts. If he had never met defeat he would never have known any great victory.
general.author: orison swett marden

general.quote: Freedom from effort in the present merely means that there has been effort stored up in the past.
general.author: theodore roosevelt quotes

general.quote: Abundant effort compensates for sparse talent.
general.author: larry hehn

general.quote: Leadership is the key to 99 percent of all successful efforts.
general.author: erskine bowles

general.quote: Do your duty that is best; leave unto the Lord the rest.
general.author: david o. mckay

general.quote: Welcome the task that makes you go beyond yourself.
general.author: frank mcgee

general.quote: Success is the sum of small efforts, repeated day in and day out…
general.author: robert collier

general.quote: Without some goals and some efforts to reach it, no man can live.
general.author: john dewey

general.quote: If a man has done his best, what else is there?
general.author: george s. patton

general.quote: Art is the symbol of the two noblest human efforts: to construct and to refrain from destruction.
general.author: simone weil

general.quote: If I could I would always work in silence and obscurity, and let my efforts be known by their results.
general.author: emily bronte

general.quote: I’m a determined person. And if I’ve got an objective, I’ll make hours of sacrifice — whatever efforts are needed.
general.author: gerald r. ford

general.quote: All that we do is done with an eye to something else.
general.author: aristotle quotes

general.quote: About the only thing that comes to us without effort is old age.
general.author: gloria pitzer

general.quote: I would rather earn 1% of a 100 people’s efforts than 100% of my own efforts.
general.author: john d. rockefeller

general.quote: The best efforts of a fine person is felt after we have left their presence.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson quotes

general.quote: Approach the game with no preset agendas and you’ll probably come away surprised at your overall efforts.
general.author: phil jackson

general.quote: He only is exempt from failures who makes no efforts.
general.author: richard whately

general.quote: Most achievements in science are to a certain degree group efforts.
general.author: willard libby

general.quote: Continuous effort! not strength or intelligence, is the key to unlocking your potential.
general.author: winston churchill quotes

general.quote: We cannot do everything at once, but we can do something at once.
general.author: calvin coolidge

general.quote: Will you be satisfied with the fruit of your life’s work? Will the efforts you are making now bring you satisfaction when the things of time are receding, and eternity looms ahead?
general.author: raymond l. cox

general.quote: Much effort, much prosperity.
general.author: euripides

general.quote: I want you to start a crusade in you life — to dare to be your best.
general.author: william danforth

general.quote: Be true to the best you know. This is your high ideal. If you do your best, you cannot do more.
general.author: horatio w. dresser

general.quote: The power of a man’s virtue should not be measured by his special efforts, but by his ordinary doing.
general.author: blaise pascal

general.quote: There are hundreds of tasks we feel we must accomplish in the day, but if we do not take them one at a time… we are bound to break our own physical or mental structure.
general.author: ted bengermino

general.quote: There are only two stimulants to one’s best efforts: the fear of punishment, and the hope of reward.
general.author: john m. wilson

general.quote: We are very much what others think of us. The reception our observations meet with gives us courage to proceed, or damps our efforts.
general.author: william hazlitt

general.quote: I honestly believed I would make it. I had the desire. A lot of people have the ability, but they don’t put forth the effort.
general.author: joe carter

general.quote: Do your best every day and your life will gradually expand into satisfying fullness.
general.author: horatio w. dresser

general.quote: Whatever you do for the sole purpose of having others admire you, your efforts will most likely be in vain.
general.author: dave pelzer

general.quote: Always make a total effort, even when the odds are against you.
general.author: arnold palmer

general.quote: Fanaticism consists in redoubling your efforts when you have forgotten your aim.
general.author: george santayana

general.quote: In all human affairs there are efforts, and there are results, and the strength of effort is the measure of the results.
general.author: james allen

general.quote: Men judge us by the success of our efforts. God looks at the efforts themselves.
general.author: charlotte bronte

general.quote: You have to accept whatever comes and the only important thing is that you meet it with the best you have to give.
general.author: eleanor roosevelt quotes

general.quote: To be nobody but myself in a world which is doing its best, night and day to make me the same as everybody else means to fight the hardest battle any human being can fight and never stop fighting.
general.author: ee cummings

general.quote: They indeed are fools who are satisfied with the fruits of their past effort and do not engage themselves in self-effort now.
general.author: swami venkatesananda

general.quote: There is so much to do, and I want to continue my efforts.
general.author: janet reno

general.quote: Courage is fear that has said its prayers.
general.author: dorothy bernard

general.quote: Courage is a special kind of knowledge; the knowledge of how to fear what ought to be feared and how not to fear what ought not to be feared.
general.author: david ben-gurion

general.quote: It takes courage to live — courage and strength and hope and humor. And courage and strength and hope and humor have to be bought and paid for with pain and work and prayers and tears.
general.author: jerome p. fleishman

general.quote: A man of courage is also full of faith.
general.author: marcus t. cicero

general.quote: Courage is facing your fears. Stupidity is fearing nothing.
general.author: todd bellemare

general.quote: Among wellborn spirits courage does not depend on age.
general.author: pierre corneille

general.quote: Courage is like love; it must have hope to nourish it.
general.author: napoleon bonaparte

general.quote: It requires more courage to suffer than to die.
general.author: napoleon bonaparte

general.quote: Courage is almost a contradiction in terms. It means a strong desire to live, taking the form of a readiness to die.
general.author: gilbert k. chesterton

general.quote: Courage is the capacity to conduct oneself with restraint in times of prosperity and with courage and tenacity when things do not go well.
general.author: james v. forrestal

general.quote: A lot of people do not muster the courage to live their dreams because they are afraid to die.
general.author: les brown

general.quote: Until the day of his death, no man can be sure of his courage.
general.author: jean anouilh

general.quote: Nothing gives a fearful man more courage than another’s fear.
general.author: umberto eco

general.quote: A great part of courage is the courage of having done the thing before.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson

general.quote: The paradox of courage is that a man must be a little careless of his life in order to keep it.
general.author: gilbert k. chesterton

general.quote: Courage is fire, and bullying is smoke.
general.author: benjamin disraeli

general.quote: The more wit the less courage.
general.author: thomas fuller

general.quote: Half a man’s wisdom goes with his courage.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson

general.quote: Every man has his own courage, and is betrayed because he seeks in himself the courage of other persons.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson

general.quote: Success is never final and failure is never fatal. It’s courage that counts.
general.author: jules ellinger

general.quote: Physical courage, which engages all danger, will make a person brave in one way; and moral courage, which defies all opinion, will make a person brave in another.
general.author: charles caleb colton

general.quote: Courage is getting away from death by continually coming within an inch of it.
general.author: gilbert k. chesterton

general.quote: We need the courage to start and continue what we should do, and courage to stop what we shouldn’t do.
general.author: richard l. evans

general.quote: Courage is rightly considered the foremost of the virtues, for upon it all others depend.
general.author: winston churchill

general.quote: Have the courage to live. Anyone can die.
general.author: robert cody

general.quote: Courage enlarges, cowardice diminishes resources. In desperate straits the fears of the timid aggravate the dangers that imperil the brave.
general.author: john christian bovee

general.quote: True miracles are created by men when they use the courage and intelligence that God gave them.
general.author: jean anouilh

general.quote: Courage to start and willingness to keep everlasting at it are the requisites for success.
general.author: alonzo newton benn

general.quote: We need to find the courage to say NO to the things and people that are not serving us if we want to rediscover ourselves and live our lives with authenticity.
general.author: barbara de angelis

general.quote: It takes a lot of courage to show your dreams to someone else.
general.author: erma bombeck

general.quote: Courage to be is the key to revelatory power of the feminist revolution.
general.author: mary daly

general.quote: You can surmount the obstacles in your path if you are determined, courageous and hardworking…. Do not fear to pioneer, to venture down new paths of endeavor.
general.author: ralph bunche

general.quote: Courage is the lovely virtue — the rib of Himself that God sent down to His children.
general.author: james m. barrie

general.quote: The scars you acquire while exercising courage will never make you feel inferior.
general.author: d.a. battista

general.quote: Keep courage. Whatever you do, do not feel sorry for yourself. You will win in a great age of opportunity.
general.author: richard l. evans

general.quote: On many of the great issues of our time, men have lacked wisdom because they have lacked courage.
general.author: william benton

general.quote: The courage we desire and prize is not the courage to die decently, but to live manfully.
general.author: thomas carlyle

general.quote: Courage follows action.
general.author: mack r. douglas

general.quote: Bravery and faith bring both material and spiritual rewards.
general.author: preston bradley

general.quote: True courage is a result of reasoning. A brave mind is always impregnable.
general.author: jeremy collier

general.quote: Most of us have far more courage than we ever dreamed we possessed.
general.author: dale carnegie

general.quote: Courage is the integrating strength that causes one to overcome tragedy.
general.author: eugene e. brussell

general.quote: Courage is the thing. All goes if courage goes.
general.author: james m. barrie

general.quote: True courage consists not in flying from the storms of life, but in braving and steering through them with prudence.
general.author: hannah webster faster

general.quote: Courage consists of the power of self-recovery.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson

general.quote: The last thing a woman will consent to discover in a man whom she loves, or on whom she simply depends, is want of courage.
general.author: joseph conrad

general.quote: Be courageous! Have faith! Go forward.
general.author: thomas a. edison

general.quote: Courage is the first of human qualities, because it is the quality which guarantees all others.
general.author: winston churchill

general.quote: If we have the courage and tenacity of our forebears who stood firmly like a rock against the lash of slavery, we shall find a way to do for our day what they did for theirs.
general.author: mary mcleod bethune

general.quote: Courage is a virtue only so far as it is directed by prudence.
general.author: francois de salignac fenelon

general.quote: Often the test of courage is not to die but to live.
general.author: vittorio

general.quote: Courage is the power to let go of the familiar.
general.author: mary byrant

general.quote: The person who figures out how to harness the collective genius of his or her organization is going to blow the competition away.
general.author: walter wriston

general.quote: The ability to learn faster than your competitors may be the only sustainable competitive advantage.
general.author: arie de geus

general.quote: If you have no confidence in self, you are twice defeated in the race of life.
general.author: marcus garvey

general.quote: The reason why men who mind their own business succeed is that they have so little competition.
general.author: evan esar

general.quote: Perseverance is not a long race; it is many short races one after the other.
general.author: walter elliot

general.quote: the collective genius of his or her organization is going to blow the competition away.
general.author: walter wriston

general.quote: Differentiate your products, provide great service and don’t even think about trying to compete with Wal-Mart on Price.
general.author: michael bergdahl

general.quote: I just tried to keep my cool and continue with my race plan: to win.
general.author: mark spitz

general.quote: Competition is in the genes of all living things. Watch a flower compete for its share of sunlight or watch the goldfish in your aquarium. Infants and small children compete without knowing it. Remember how the queen bee wins? Competition is the spice of life and the soul of progress. How else can quality rise to the top?
general.author: charles t. clark

general.quote: Competition, which is said to be "the life of trade," when pushed too far, is no less the death of it–and of the soul.
general.author: christian nestell bovee

general.quote: You must take the compromise to win, or else nothing. That means: you race or you do not.
general.author: ayrton senna

general.quote: The biggest things are often the easiest to do because there is so little competition.
general.author: william van horne

general.quote: It is impossible to win the race unless you venture to run, impossible to win the victory unless you dare to battle.
general.author: richard m. devos

general.quote: Competition is a complex thing. It brings out the best and the worst in all participants. It refines the technique and sharpens the mind, body and spirit.
general.author: herb perez

general.quote: You get out in front — you stay out in front.
general.author: aj foyt

general.quote: World records are only borrowed.
general.author: sebastian coe

general.quote: If you can’t win, make the fellow ahead of you break the record.
general.author: evan esar

general.quote: Up, you mighty race, accomplish what you will.
general.author: marcus garvey

general.quote: Men often compete with one another until the day they die; comradeship consists of rubbing shoulders jocularly with a competitor.
general.author: edward hoagland

general.quote: Competitions are for horse, not artist.
general.author: bela bartok

general.quote: A competitor will find a way to win. Competitors take bad breaks and use them to drive themselves just that much harder. Quitters take bad breaks and use them as reasons to give up. It’s all a matter of pride.
general.author: nancy lopez

general.quote: When a man can do better than everyone else in the same walk, he does not make any very painful exertions to outdo himself. The progress of improvement ceases nearly at the point where competition ends.
general.author: william hazlitt

general.quote: Competition is for dogs and horses.
general.author: geri halliwell

general.quote: Competition is warfare. Mostly it is played by prescribed rules–there is a sort of Geneva Convention for competition–but it’s thorough and often brutal.
general.author: andrew s. grove

general.quote: Although competition is beneficial from a social point of view, individually each of us would prefer to be loosened from its grip.
general.author: richard l. stroup

general.quote: Do your work with your whole heart, and you will succeed — there’s so little competition.
general.author: elbert hubbard

general.quote: Competition means decentralized planning by many separate persons.
general.author: friedrich hayek

general.quote: The only competition worthy of a wise man is with himself.
general.author: washington allston

general.quote: Competition is a rude yet effective motivation.
general.author: toba beta

general.quote: Our life is not really a mutual helpfulness; but rather, it’s fair competition cloaked under due laws of war; it’s a mutual hostility.
general.author: thomas carlyle

general.quote: Competition, in and of itself, is neither good nor bad. If a person or group seeks a desired objective to the exclusion of such higher ethics as truth and fairness, the seeking indeed is unhealthy. However, if a person or group seeks a desired objective while remaining true to high ethical standards, the pursuit will be a healthy growth experience.
general.author: philip solomons

general.quote: There are two kinds of people: those who do the work and those who take the credit. Try to be in the first group because there is less competition there.
general.author: indira gandhi

general.quote: This dream that men shall cease to waste strength in competition and shall come to pool their powers of production is coming to pass all over the earth.
general.author: jane addams

general.quote: Competition, founded upon the conflicting interests of individuals, is in reality far less productive of wealth and enterprise than co-operation, involving though it does the constant apparent sacrifice of the individual to the common interests.
general.author: robert hugh benson

general.quote: Focus on competition has always been a formula for mediocrity.
general.author: daniel burrus

general.quote: I feel sorry for those who live without competition … fat, dumb, and unhappy in cradle-to-grave security.
general.author: donald m. kendall

general.quote: Competition is a process or variety of habitual behavior that grows out of a habit of mind.
general.author: willard beecher

general.quote: Thank God for competition. When our competitors upset our plans or outdo our designs, they open infinite possibilities of our own work to us.
general.author: gil atkinson

general.quote: World trade means competition from anywhere; advancing technology encourages cross-industry competition. Consequently, strategic planning must consider who our future competitors will be, not only who is here today.
general.author: eric allison

general.quote: To free the mind from the habit of competition, we must see in detail the process by which the mind is ensnared by competition.
general.author: marguerite beecher

general.quote: The price which society pays for the law of competition, like the price it pays for cheap comforts and luxuries, is also great; but the advantages of this law are also greater still, for it is to this law that we owe our wonderful material development, which brings improved conditions in its train.
general.author: andrew carnegie

general.quote: All dealings among men are a contest in which some will succeed and others fail. And some are failing quite spectacularly.
general.author: brandon san

general.quote: Competition brings out the best in products and the worst in people.
general.author: david sarnoff

general.quote: Competition is the keen cutting edge of business, always shaving away at costs.
general.author: henry ford

general.quote: It is better for a woman to compete impersonally in society, as men do, than to compete for dominance in her own home with her husband, compete with her neighbors for empty status, and so smother her son that he cannot compete at all.
general.author: betty friedan

general.quote: I found that competition was supposed to be a menace and that a good manager circumvented his competitors by getting a monopoly by artificial means.
general.author: henry ford

general.quote: Competition has been shown to be useful up to a certain point and no further, but cooperation, which is the thing we must strive for today, begins where competition leaves off.
general.author: franklin d. roosevelt

general.quote: Becoming number one is easier than remaining number one.
general.author: bill bradley

general.quote: Action expresses priorities.
general.author: mahatma gandhi

general.quote: We should be taught not to wait for inspiration to start a thing. Action always generates inspiration. Inspiration seldom generates action.
general.author: frank tibolt

general.quote: Act like you expect to get into the end zone.
general.author: joe paterno

general.quote: To begin with, you must realize that any idea accepted by the brain is automatically transformed into an action of some sort. It may take seconds or minutes or longer — but ideas always produce a reaction of some sort.
general.author: scott reed

general.quote: Actions are the seed of fate deeds grow into destiny.
general.author: a. l. linall jr.

general.quote: Words may show a man’s wit but actions his meaning.
general.author: benjamin franklin quotes

general.quote: The end of life is life. life is action, the use of one’s powers. and to use them to their height is our joy of duty.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: Ideas are a dime a dozen, they are worthless; but people who put their ideas into action are priceless.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: You can’t truthfully explain your smallest action without fully revealing your character.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: A real decision is measured by the fact that you’ve taken a new action. If there’s no action, you haven’t truly decided.
general.author: anthony robbins

general.quote: Be content to act, and leave the talking to others.
general.author: baltasar gracián

general.quote: Action is the real measure of intelligence.
general.author: napoleon hill

general.quote: Thought is the blossom; language the bud; action the fruit behind it.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson

general.quote: Planning without action is futile, action without planning is fatal.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: Success could be described as 50/50 — 50% vision and 50% action.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: Successful leaders have the courage to take action where others hesitate.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: Action will remove the doubts that theory cannot solve.
general.author: tehyi hsieh

general.quote: A man who waits to believe in action before acting is anything you like, but he’s not a man of action. You must act as you breathe.
general.author: georges clemenceau

general.quote: Action and faith enslave thought, both of them in order not be troubled or inconvenienced by reflection, criticism, and doubt.
general.author: henri frederic amiel

general.quote: A human action becomes genuinely important when it springs from the soil of a clear-sighted awareness of the temporality and the ephemerally of everything human. It is only this awareness that can breathe any greatness into an action.
general.author: vaclav havel

general.quote: You must take action now that will move you towards your goals. Develop a sense of urgency in your life.
general.author: les brown

general.quote: Action springs not from thought, but from a readiness for responsibility.
general.author: dietrich bonhoeffer

general.quote: All human actions have one or more of these seven causes: chance, nature, compulsions, habit, reason, passion, desire.
general.author: aristotle quotes

general.quote: When we commit to action, to actually doing something rather than feeling trapped by events, the stress becomes manageable.
general.author: greg anderson

general.quote: An ounce of action is worth a ton of theory.
general.author: friedrich engels

general.quote: Think like a man of action, and act like a man of thought.
general.author: henri l. bergson

general.quote: We are all inclined to judge ourselves by our ideals; others, by their acts.
general.author: harold nicolson

general.quote: Try out your ideas by visualizing them in action.
general.author: david seabury

general.quote: You don’t have to act as if you care; you just have to care enough to act.
general.author: richard dreyfuss

general.quote: What really distinguishes this generation in all countries from earlier generations… is its determination to act, its joy in action, the assurance of being able to change things by one’s own efforts.
general.author: hannah arendt

general.quote: To achieve great things, we must dream as well as act.
general.author: anatole france

general.quote: A good action is never lost; it is a treasure laid up and guarded for the doer’s need.
general.author: pedro calderon de la barca

general.quote: We have too many high-sounding words, and too few actions that correspond with them.
general.author: abigail adams

general.quote: We cannot seek or attain health, wealth, learning, justice or kindness in general. Action is always specific, concrete, individualized, unique.
general.author: john dewey

general.quote: We become just by performing just actions, temperate by performing temperate actions, brave by performing brave actions.
general.author: aristotle

general.quote: Who can separate his faith from his actions, or his belief from his occupations?
general.author: kahlil gibran quotes

general.quote: Action is the antidote to despair.
general.author: joan baez

general.quote: We enjoy or suffer the consequences of our ideas, our acts or our hopes, and our fears. I cannot affirm God if I fail to affirm man.
general.author: norman cousins

general.quote: It takes a single idea and a single action to move the world.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: Life is built of the things we do. the only constructive material is positive action.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: Logic will not change an emotion, but action will.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: We should not be so taken up in the search for truth, as to neglect the needful duties of active life; for it is only action that gives a true value and commendation to virtue.
general.author: marcus t. cicero

general.quote: Begin somewhere: you cannot build a reputation on what you intend to do.
general.author: elizabeth smith

general.quote: We should be as careful of our words as of our actions, and as far from speaking ill as from doing ill.
general.author: marcus tullius cicero

general.quote: A man’s action is only a picture book of his creed.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson

general.quote: Acting on a good idea is better than just having a good idea.
general.author: robert half

general.quote: To make ideas effective, we must be able to fire them off. We must put them into action.
general.author: virginia woolf

general.quote: All the beautiful sentiments in the world weigh less than one lovely action.
general.author: james russell lowell

general.quote: Those who are more adapted to the active life can prepare themselves for contemplation in the practice of the active life, while those who are more adapted to the contemplative life can take upon themselves the works of the active life so as to become yet more apt for contemplation.
general.author: st. thomas aquinas

general.quote: Action without a name, a "who" attached to it, is meaningless.
general.author: hannah arendt

general.quote: When all is said the greatest action is to limit and isolate one’s self.
general.author: johann wolfgang von goethe quotes

general.quote: Action is the product of the qualities inherent in nature.
general.author: bhagavad gita

general.quote: We have all the light we need, we just need to put it in practice.
general.author: peace pilgrim

general.quote: Actions lie louder than words.
general.author: carolyn wells

general.quote: Action is the only thing that matters… I can see that at the end of my life, I am not going to look back and say, "I wish I had taken more action".
general.author: diana von welanetz wentworth

general.quote: Act as if what you do makes a difference. It does.
general.author: william james

general.quote: Action seems to follow feeling, but really action and feeling go together; and by regulating the action, which is under the more direct control of the will, we can indirectly regulate the feeling, which is not.
general.author: william james

general.quote: Because they had a vision, a desire, and they took action.
general.author: thomas j. vilord

general.quote: A certain harmony should be kept between actions and ideas if we want to fully develop the effects they can produce.
general.author: francois de la rochefoucauld

general.quote: Action is character.
general.author: f. scott fitzgerald

general.quote: A good idea plus capable men cannot fail; it is better than money in the bank.
general.author: john berry

general.quote: Action should culminate in wisdom, or is it action is a culmination of wisdom.
general.author: bhagavad gita

general.quote: Action is no less necessary than thought to the instinctive tendencies of the human frame.
general.author: mahatma gandhi

general.quote: Thinking is easy, acting is difficult, and to put one’s thoughts into action is the most difficult thing in the world.
general.author: johann wolfgang von goethe

general.quote: Action to be effective must be directed to clearly conceived ends.
general.author: jawaharlal nehru

general.quote: Action is the last resource of those who know not how to dream.
general.author: oscar wilde quotes

general.quote: All you have to do is look straight and see the road, and when you see it, don’t sit looking at it — walk.
general.author: ayn rand

general.quote: And all that you are sorry for is what you haven’t done.
general.author: margaret widdemer

general.quote: We are born to action; and whatever is capable of suggesting and guiding action has power over us from the first.
general.author: charles horton cooley

general.quote: Will is character in action.
general.author: william mcdougall

general.quote: Why should we be cowed by the name of Action?.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson

general.quote: Action is coarsened thought; thought becomes concrete, obscure, and unconscious.
general.author: henri frederic amiel

general.quote: Action is the highest perfection and drawing forth of the utmost power, vigor,and activity of man’s nature.
general.author: bishop robert south

general.quote: Action must be taken at once! There is no time to be lost.
general.author: miguel hidalgo

general.quote: Words have a magical power. They can bring either the greatest happiness or deepest despair; they can transfer knowledge from teacher to student; words enable the orator to sway his audience and dictate its decisions. Words are capable of arousing the strongest emotions and prompting all men’s actions.
general.author: sigmund freud

general.quote: Action speaks louder than words but not nearly as often.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: Embrace life, have confidence in yourself, take action.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: Unless a capacity for thinking be accompanied by a capacity for action, a superior mind exists in torture.
general.author: benedetto croce

general.quote: A thought which does not result in an action is nothing much, and an action which does not proceed from a thought is nothing at all.
general.author: georges bernanos

general.quote: Action may not always bring happiness, but there is no happiness without action.
general.author: william james

general.quote: A man is the sum of his actions, of what he has done, of what he can do nothing else.
general.author: mahatma gandhi quotes

general.quote: Your actions, and your action alone, determines your worth.
general.author: johann g. fichte

general.quote: Act well at the moment, and you have performed a good action for all eternity.
general.author: johann kaspar lavater

general.quote: To think is easy. To act is difficult. To act as one thinks is the most difficult.
general.author: johann wolfgang von goethe quotes

general.quote: Act, and God will act.
general.author: joan of arc

general.quote: When it is obvious that the goals cannot be reached, don’t adjust the goals, adjust the action steps.
general.author: confucius quotes

general.quote: All these primary impulses, not easily described in words, are the springs of man’s actions.
general.author: albert einstein quotes

general.quote: You prove your worth with your actions, not with your mouth.
general.author: pat riley

general.quote: For every action, there is an equal and opposite criticism.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: Making people uncomfortable is one of my hobbies. I’m always hoping that half the people get the joke and the other half are the joke.
general.author: josh homme

general.quote: Advice is sometimes transmitted more successfully through a joke than grave teaching.
general.author: baltasar gracian

general.quote: British politics, as the world knows, is a joke. Yet it’s rarely funny.
general.author: steven patrick morrissey

general.quote: The joke of our time is the suicide of intention.
general.author: theodor adorno

general.quote: If you tell a joke in the forest, but nobody laughs, was it a joke?
general.author: steven wright

general.quote: After a while, a joke, if you say it too much, just becomes contrived, or fake-sounding.
general.author: dave chappelle

general.quote: The marvelous thing about a joke with a double meaning is that it can only mean one thing.
general.author: ronnie barker

general.quote: The joke loses everything when the joker laughs himself.
general.author: johann friedrich von schiller

general.quote: Joke is not a thing but a process, a trick you play on the listener’s mind. You start him off toward a plausible goal, and then by a sudden twist you land him nowhere at all or just where he didn’t expect to go.
general.author: max eastman

general.quote: Every time a woman makes herself laugh at her husband’s often told jokes she betrays him. The man who looks at his woman and says "What would I do without you?" is already destroyed.
general.author: germaine greer

general.quote: Even the gods love jokes.
general.author: plato

general.quote: A difference of taste in jokes is a great strain on the affections.
general.author: george eliot

general.quote: A rich man’s joke is always funny.
general.author: thomas edward brown

general.quote: A dirty joke is a sort of mental rebellion.
general.author: george orwell quotes

general.quote: Forgive, O Lord, my little jokes on Thee, and I’ll forgive Thy great big one on me.
general.author: robert frost

general.quote: Granting our wish is one of Fate’s saddest jokes.
general.author: james russell lowell

general.quote: I don’t make jokes. I just watch the government and report the facts.
general.author: will rogers

general.quote: The right honorable gentleman is indebted to his memory for his jokes and his imagination for his facts.
general.author: richard brinsley sheridan

general.quote: Jokes are grievances.
general.author: marshal mcluhn

general.quote: The aim of a joke is not to degrade the human being, but to remind him that he is already degraded.
general.author: george orwell

general.quote: It’s much easier to make jokes about sensitive issues if there is some dissent, some conflict.
general.author: mo rocca

general.quote: Humor is always based on a modicum of truth. Have you ever heard a joke about a father-in-law?
general.author: dick clark

general.quote: The world is indeed comic, but the joke is on mankind.
general.author: h. p. lovecraft

general.quote: In polite society one laughs at all the jokes, including the ones one has heard before.
general.author: frank dane

general.quote: Nothing is a better icebreaker than a great joke.
general.author: dane cook

general.quote: If your regime is not strong enough to handle a joke, then you don’t have a regime.
general.author: jon stewart

general.quote: Our subconscious minds have no sense of humor, play no jokes and cannot tell the difference between reality and an imagined thought or image. What we continually think about eventually will manifest in our lives.
general.author: sidney madwed

general.quote: I think repeating yourself is a sign of old age, telling the same joke again and again. Especially if they’re jokes that don’t make people laugh.
general.author: simon le bon

general.quote: It is the ability to take a joke, not make one, that proves you have a sense of humor.
general.author: max eastman

general.quote: I try to visit people in hospitals when I can, smiling and joking while I’m there. But when I leave, I just start crying.
general.author: loretta lynn

general.quote: My life has been one great big joke, a dance that’s walked, a song that’s spoke, I laugh so hard I almost choke, when I think about myself.
general.author: maya angelou

general.quote: I have always noticed that deeply and truly religious persons are fond of a joke, and I am suspicious of those who aren’t.
general.author: alfred north whitehead

general.quote: It is a good deed to forget a poor joke.
general.author: brendan behan

general.quote: They say the seeds of what we will do are in all of us, but it always seemed to me that in those who make jokes in life the seeds are covered with better soil and with a higher grade of manure.
general.author: ernest hemingway

general.quote: The best ideas come as jokes. Make your thinking as funny as possible.
general.author: david ogilvy

general.quote: For every ten jokes you acquire a hundred enemies.
general.author: laurence sterne

general.quote: A caricature is putting the face of a joke on the body of a truth.
general.author: joseph conrad

general.quote: It is a medium of entertainment which permits millions of people to listen to the same joke at the same time, and yet remain lonesome.
general.author: t.s. eliot

general.quote: The crisis of today is the joke of tomorrow.
general.author: h. g. wells

general.quote: Everything is changing. People are taking their comedians seriously and the politicians as a joke.
general.author: will rogers

general.quote: It requires a surgical operation to get a joke well into a Scotch understanding.
general.author: sydney smith

general.quote: The gods too are fond of a joke.
general.author: edward albee

general.quote: Family jokes, though rightly cursed by strangers, are the bond that keeps most families alive.
general.author: stella benson

general.quote: A sense of humor is the ability to understand a joke – and that the joke is oneself.
general.author: clifton fadiman

general.quote: The shortest distance between two jokes makes a perfect speech.
general.author: orlando a. battista

general.quote: A loyal friend laughs at your jokes when they’re not so good, and sympathizes with your problems when they’re not so bad.
general.author: arnold h. glasow

general.quote: Most jokes state a bitter truth.
general.author: larry gelbart

general.quote: Jokes are better than war. Even the most aggressive jokes are better than the least aggressive wars. Even the longest jokes are better than the shortest wars.
general.author: george mikes

general.quote: A person reveals his character by nothing so clearly as the joke he resents.
general.author: georg c. lichtenberg

general.quote: You may easily play a joke on a man who likes to argue — agree with him.
general.author: edgar watson howe

general.quote: My way of joking is to tell the truth. It’s the funniest joke in the world.
general.author: george bernard shaw

general.quote: The trouble with practical jokes is that very often they get elected.
general.author: will rogers

general.quote: A serious and good philosophical work could be written consisting entirely of jokes.
general.author: ludwig wittgenstein

general.quote: People confuse the subject of the joke with the target of the joke, and they’re very rarely the same.
general.author: ricky gervais

general.quote: Suppose the world were only one of God’s jokes, would you work any the less to make it a good joke instead of a bad one?
general.author: george bernard shaw

general.quote: Sex is God’s joke on human beings.
general.author: bette davis

general.quote: With Congress, every time they make a joke it’s a law, and every time they make a law it’s a joke.
general.author: will rogers

general.quote: If you’ve heard this story before, don’t stop me, because I’d like to hear it again.
general.author: groucho marx

general.quote: Sometimes people get passionate about the obscure jokes.
general.author: martin short

general.quote: In most betting shops you will see three windows marked “bet here,” but only one window with the legend “pay out.”
general.author: jeffrey bernard

general.quote: All men’s misfortunes spring from their hatred of being alone.
general.author: jean de la bruyere

general.quote: We enter the world alone, we leave the world alone.
general.author: james a. froude

general.quote: It is strange how the presence of additional people can make you feel more alone.
general.author: james alan gardner

general.quote: One travels more usefully when alone, because he reflects more.
general.author: thomas jefferson

general.quote: When thinking about companions gone, we feel ourselves doubly alone.
general.author: sir walter scott

general.quote: The strong man is strongest when alone.
general.author: johann friedrich von schiller

general.quote: We walk alone in the world.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson

general.quote: Everything that lives, lives not alone, nor for itself.
general.author: william blake

general.quote: To be adult is to be alone.
general.author: jean rostand

general.quote: The man who follows the crowd will usually get no further than the crowd. The man who walks alone is likely to find himself in places no one has.
general.author: alan ashley-pitt

general.quote: The right to be alone — the most comprehensive of rights, and the right most valued by civilized man.
general.author: louis d. brandeis

general.quote: Often we can help each other most by leaving each other alone; at other times we need the hand-grasp and the word of cheer.
general.author: elbert hubbard

general.quote: Just as the individual is not alone in the group, nor any one in society alone among the others, so man is not alone in the universe.
general.author: claude levi-strauss

general.quote: If you make friends with yourself you will never be alone.
general.author: maxwell maltz

general.quote: Do not rely completely on any other human being … we meet all of life’s greatest tests alone.
general.author: agnes macphail

general.quote: It is a rather pleasant experience to be alone in a bank at night.
general.author: william sutton

general.quote: One can endure sorrow alone, but it takes two to be glad.
general.author: elbert hubbard

general.quote: On stage I make love to twenty five thousand people; and then I go home alone.
general.author: janis joplin

general.quote: Is he alone who has courage on his right hand and faith on his left hand?
general.author: charles a. lindbergh

general.quote: Better mad with the rest of the world than wise alone.
general.author: baltasar gracian

general.quote: A man can be himself only so long as he is alone.
general.author: arthur schopenhauer

general.quote: The right to be let alone is indeed the beginning of all freedom.
general.author: william o. douglas

general.quote: We’re born alone, we live alone, we die alone. Only through our love and friendship can we create the illusion for the moment that we’re not alone.
general.author: orson welles

general.quote: We are never the same with others as when we are alone. We are different, even when we are in the dark with them.
general.author: maurice maeterlinck

general.quote: Walking with a friend in the dark is better than walking alone in the light.
general.author: helen keller

general.quote: To live alone is the fate of all great souls.
general.author: arthur schopenhauer

general.quote: The reason old souls enjoy spending time alone is because they never really are.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: The strongest man in the world is he who stands most alone.
general.author: henrik ibsen

general.quote: We are rarely proud when we are alone.
general.author: voltaire

general.quote: It’s better to be unhappy alone than unhappy with someone – so far.
general.author: marilyn monroe

general.quote: A man is never completely alone in this world. At the worst, he has the company of a boy, a youth, and by and by a grown man — the one he used to be.
general.author: cesare pavese

general.quote: I restore myself when I’m alone.
general.author: marilyn monroe

general.quote: A dream you dream alone is only a dream. A dream you dream together is reality.
general.author: john lennon

general.quote: The person who tries to live alone will not succeed as a human being. His heart withers if it does not answer another heart. His mind shrinks away if he hears only the echoes of his own thoughts and finds no other inspiration.
general.author: pearl s. buck

general.quote: I would rather go to heaven alone than go to hell in company.
general.author: r.a.torry

general.quote: Perhaps I know best why it is man alone who laughs; he alone suffers so deeply that he had to invent laughter.
general.author: friedrich nietzsche

general.quote: In our extreme youth, in our most humiliating sorrow, we think we are alone. When we are older we find that others have suffered too.
general.author: suzanne moarny

general.quote: Inside myself is a place where I live all alone, and that’s where I renew my springs that never dry up.
general.author: pearl buck

general.quote: When we cannot bear to be alone, it means we do not properly value the only companion we will have from birth to death — ourselves.
general.author: eda leshan

general.quote: We’re all in this alone.
general.author: lily tomlin

general.quote: By all means use sometimes to be alone. salute thyself; see what thy soul doth wear.
general.author: george herbert

general.quote: It’s a terrible thing to be alone — yes it is — it is — but don’t lower your mask until you have another mask prepared beneath — as terrible as you like — but a mask.
general.author: katherine mansfield

general.quote: They are never alone that are accompanied with noble thoughts.
general.author: sir philip sidney

general.quote: One fails forward toward success.
general.author: charles f. kettering

general.quote: I wasn’t afraid to fail. Something good always comes out of failure.
general.author: anne baxter

general.quote: Failure is the tuition you pay for success.
general.author: walter brunell

general.quote: You always pass failure on your way to success.
general.author: mickey rooney

general.quote: Just don’t give up trying to do what you really want to do. Where there is love and inspiration, I don’t think you can go wrong.
general.author: ella fitzgerald

general.quote: I have tried 99 times and have failed, but on the 100th time came success.
general.author: albert einstein quotes

general.quote: Failure doesn’t mean you are a failure… it just means you haven’t succeeded yet.
general.author: robert schuller

general.quote: You cannot explain failure any more than you can argue with success.
general.author: richard j. clarke

general.quote: He’s no failure. He’s not dead yet.
general.author: william lloyd george

general.quote: Most people don’t plan to fail, they fail to plan.
general.author: john l. beckley

general.quote: There is no failure. Only feedback.
general.author: robert allen

general.quote: Failure too is a form of death…
general.author: graham greene

general.quote: No man is ever whipped until he quits in his own mind.
general.author: napoleon hill

general.quote: In order to succeed you must fail so you know what to do better the next time.
general.author: anthony j. d’angelo

general.quote: Failure is something made only by those who fail to dare, not by those who dare to fail.
general.author: louis binstock

general.quote: Today’s opportunities erase yesterday’s failures.
general.author: gene brown

general.quote: They fail, and they alone, who have not striven.
general.author: thomas b. aldrich

general.quote: There is no failure except in no longer trying.
general.author: elbert hubbard

general.quote: Failure is an event, never a person.
general.author: william d. brown

general.quote: A first failure is often a blessing.
general.author: a. whitney brown

general.quote: Finite to fail, but infinite to venture.
general.author: emily dickinson quotes

general.quote: Failure is the condiment that gives success its flavor.
general.author: truman capote

general.quote: No man is a failure who is enjoying life.
general.author: william feather

general.quote: When nothing is sure, everything is possible.
general.author: margaret drabble

general.quote: Doing is overrated, and success undesirable, but the bitterness of failure even more so.
general.author: cyril connolly

general.quote: Failure is only the opportunity to begin again more intelligently.
general.author: henry ford

general.quote: If your project doesn’t work, look for the part that you didn’t think was important.
general.author: arthur bloch

general.quote: Use the losses and failures of the past as a reason for action, not inaction.
general.author: charles j. givens

general.quote: Try again. Fail again. Fail better.
general.author: samuel beckett

general.quote: Unless you’re willing to have a go, fail miserably, and have another go, success won’t happen.
general.author: phillip adams

general.quote: The only people who never fail are those who never try.
general.author: ilka chase

general.quote: He that is down can fall no lower.
general.author: samuel butler

general.quote: Most success springs from an obstacle or failure.
general.author: scott adams

general.quote: Sometimes the best gain is to lose.
general.author: george herbert

general.quote: We are all failures — at least, all the best of us are.
general.author: james m. barrie

general.quote: If you think you can, you can. And if you think you can’t, you’re right.
general.author: mary kay ash

general.quote: Nothing fails like failure.
general.author: margaret drabble

general.quote: The wisest person is not the one who has the fewest failures, but the one who turns failures to best account.
general.author: richard r. grant

general.quote: Failure is usually the line of least persistence.
general.author: wilfred beaver

general.quote: If by a failure you mean an attempt — yes, you’re right.
general.author: rudolf besier

general.quote: Nothing fails like success because we don’t learn from it. We learn only from failure.
general.author: kenneth boulding

general.quote: A shy failure is nobler than an immodest success.
general.author: kahlil gibran quotes

general.quote: relying On "Where there’s a Will There’s a Way.
general.author: eliza cook

general.quote: Strong people are made by opposition, like kites that go up against the wind.
general.author: frank harris

general.quote: You must accept that you might fail; then, if you do your best and still don’t win, at least you can be satisfied that you’ve tried.
general.author: rosalynn carter

general.quote: Failure is impossible.
general.author: susan b. anthony

general.quote: Wherever there is failure, there is some giddiness, some superstition about luck, some step omitted, which, Nature never pardons.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson quotes

general.quote: There is much to be said for failure. It is more interesting than success.
general.author: max beerbohm

general.quote: Our greatest glory is not in never failing, but in rising up every time we fail.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson quotes

general.quote: You can’t have any successes unless you can accept failure.
general.author: george cukor

general.quote: You win only if you aren’t afraid to lose.
general.author: rocky aoki

general.quote: You don’t drown by falling in the water; you drown by staying there.
general.author: edwin louis cole

general.quote: The men who try to do something and fail are infinitely better than those who try to do nothing and succeed.
general.author: lloyd jones

general.quote: If you’re not failing every now and again, it’s a sign you’re not doing anything very innovative.
general.author: woody allen

general.quote: Reading well is one of the great pleasures that solitude can afford you.
general.author: harold bloom

general.quote: If you are lonely when you are alone, you are in bad company.
general.author: jean-paul sarter

general.quote: In cities no one is quiet but many are lonely; in the country, people are quiet but few are lonely.
general.author: geoffrey f. fisher

general.quote: In solitude, where we are least alone.
general.author: george gordon

general.quote: At the innermost core of all loneliness is a deep and powerful yearning for union with one’s lost self.
general.author: brendan francis

general.quote: Be good and you will be lonely.
general.author: mark twain

general.quote: We are all sentenced to solitary confinement inside our own skins, for life.
general.author: tennessee williams

general.quote: An artist is always alone — if he is an artist. No, what the artist needs is loneliness.
general.author: henry miller

general.quote: There is none more lonely than the man who loves only himself.
general.author: abraham ibn esra

general.quote: With some people solitariness is an escape not from others but from themselves. For they see in the eyes of others only a reflection of themselves.
general.author: eric hoffer

general.quote: People are lonely because they build walls instead of bridges.
general.author: joseph f. newton

general.quote: Every time I look at you I get a fierce desire to be lonesome.
general.author: oscar levant

general.quote: We are most of us very lonely in this world; you who have any who love you, cling to them and thank God.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: What should young people do with their lives today? Many things, obviously. But the most daring thing is to create stable communities in which the terrible disease of loneliness can be cured.
general.author: kurt vonnegut

general.quote: Solitude appeared to me as the only fit state of man.
general.author: walter benjamin

general.quote: It is very lonely sometimes, trying to play God.
general.author: oliver wendell holmes

general.quote: The fool needs company, the wise solitude.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: Loneliness is never more cruel than when it is felt in close propinquity with someone who has ceased to communicate.
general.author: germaine greer

general.quote: A lyric touch of the solitude…
general.author: bliss carman

general.quote: No man should go through life without once experiencing healthy, even bored solitude in the wilderness, finding himself depending solely on himself and thereby learning his true and hidden strength.
general.author: jack kerouac

general.quote: Only in a house where one has learnt to be lonely does one have this solicitude for things. One’s relation to them, the daily seeing or touching, begins to become love, and to lay one open to pain.
general.author: elizabeth bowen

general.quote: Loneliness can be conquered only by those who can bear solitude.
general.author: paul tillich

general.quote: Our language has wisely sensed the two sides of being alone. it has created the word “loneliness” to express the pain of being alone. and it has created the word “solitude” to express the glory of being alone.
general.author: paul johannes tillich

general.quote: Man’s loneliness is but his fear of life.
general.author: eugene o’neill

general.quote: There are days when solitude is a heady wine that intoxicates you with freedom, others when it is a bitter tonic, and still others when it is a poison that makes you beat your head against the wall.
general.author: colette

general.quote: The worst loneliness is not to be comfortable with yourself.
general.author: mark twain

general.quote: For it may be said, in general, that every man will love or hate solitude — in other words, his own society — just in proportion as he is worth anything in himself.
general.author: arthur schopenhauer

general.quote: Solitude shows us what should be; society shows us what we are.
general.author: robert cecil

general.quote: I love to be alone. I never found the companion that was so companionable as solitude.
general.author: henry david thoreau

general.quote: Lonely people, in talking to each other can make each other lonelier.
general.author: lillian hellman

general.quote: Towards evening, they wound down precipices, black with forests of cypress, pine and cedar, into a glen so savage and secluded, that, if Solitude ever had local habitation, this might have been "her place of dearest residence.
general.author: ann radcliffe

general.quote: Loneliness and the feeling of being unwanted is the most terrible poverty.
general.author: mother teresa

general.quote: How tired God must be of guilt and loneliness, for that is all we ever bring to Him.
general.author: mignon mclaughlin

general.quote: The happiest of all lives is a busy solitude.
general.author: voltaire

general.quote: I owe my solitude to other people.
general.author: alan watts

general.quote: The gift of loneliness is sometimes a radical vision of society or one’s people that has not previously been taken into account.
general.author: alice walker

general.quote: Columbus discovered no isle or key so lonely as himself.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson

general.quote: I never found the companion that was so companionable as solitude. we are for the most part more lonely when we go abroad among men than when we stay in our chambers.
general.author: henry david thoreau

general.quote: What loneliness is more lonely than distrust?
general.author: george eliot

general.quote: Language has created the word loneliness to express the pain of being alone, and the word solitude to express the glory of being alone.
general.author: paul tillich

general.quote: What makes loneliness anguish is not that I have no one to share my burden, but this: I have only my own burden to bear.
general.author: dag hammarskjold

general.quote: Leadership is the other side of the coin of loneliness, and he who is a leader must always act alone. And acting alone, accept everything alone.
general.author: ferdinand e.marcos

general.quote: The great omission in American life is solitude; not loneliness, for this is an alienation that thrives most in the midst of crowds, but that zone of time and space, free from the outside pressures, which is the incubator of the spirit.
general.author: marya mannes

general.quote: But on the first day came veiled spirits from all hours into his soul… a soft intoxication, which the atmosphere of nature, like that of a wine-store, communicated to him, spread itself, like an enchanted solitude around his soul.
general.author: jean paul friedrich richter

general.quote: Solitude never hurt anyone. Emily Dickinson lived alone, and she wrote some of the most beautiful poetry the world has ever known… then went crazy as a loon.
general.author: matt groening

general.quote: We live in a very tense society. we are pulled apart… and we all need to learn how to pull ourselves together…. i think that at least part of the answer lies in solitude.
general.author: helen hayes

general.quote: The whole conviction of my life now rests upon the belief that loneliness, far from being a rare and curious phenomenon, peculiar to myself and to a few other solitary men, is the central and inevitable fact of human existence.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: To most people loneliness is a doom. Yet loneliness is the very thing which God has chosen to be one of the schools of training for His very own. It is the fire that sheds the dross and reveals the gold.
general.author: bernard m. martin

general.quote: True solitude is a din of birdsong, seething leaves, whirling colors, or a clamor of tracks in the snow.
general.author: edward hoagland

general.quote: I’m not anti-social. I’m pro-solitude.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: The eternal quest of the human being is to shatter his loneliness.
general.author: norman cousins

general.quote: When people are lonely they stoop to any companionship.
general.author: lew wallace

general.quote: He that is taken and put into prison or chains is not conquered, though overcome; for he is still an enemy.
general.author: thomas hobbes

general.quote: We who live in prison, and in whose lives there is no event but sorrow, have to measure time by throbs of pain, and the record of bitter moments.
general.author: oscar wilde

general.quote: No man will be a sailor who has contrivance enough to get himself into a jail; for being in a ship is being in a jail, with the chance of being drowned… a man in a jail has more room, better food, and commonly better company.
general.author: samuel johnson

general.quote: One of the many lessons that one learns in prison is that things are what they are and will be what they will be.
general.author: oscar wilde

general.quote: A man will be imprisoned in a room with a door that’s unlocked and opens inwards; as long as it does not occur to him to pull rather than push.
general.author: ludwig wittgenstein

general.quote: If you can manipulate news, a judge can manipulate the law. A smart lawyer can keep a killer out of jail, a smart accountant can keep a thief from paying taxes, a smart reporter could ruin your reputation- unfairly.
general.author: mario cuomo

general.quote: I turn and turn in my cell like a fly that doesn’t know where to die.
general.author: antonio gramsci

general.quote: When the prison doors are opened, the real dragon will fly out.
general.author: ho chi minh

general.quote: Thieves must sit in prison.
general.author: vladimir putin

general.quote: One should respect public opinion insofar as is necessary to avoid starvation and keep out of prison, but anything that goes beyond this is voluntary submission to an unnecessary tyranny.
general.author: bertrand russell

general.quote: The prisoner is not the one who has committed a crime, but the one who clings to his crime and lives it over and over.
general.author: henry miller

general.quote: The worst prison would be a closed heart.
general.author: pope jobn paul ii

general.quote: OPIATE, n. An unlocked door in the prison of Identity. It leads into the jail yard.
general.author: ambrose bierce

general.quote: If you want total security, go to prison. There you’re fed, clothed, given medical care and so on. The only thing lacking… is freedom.
general.author: dwight d. eisenhower

general.quote: I don’t want to send them to jail. I want to send them to school.
general.author: adlai e. stevenson

general.quote: I never saw a man who looked with such a wistful eye upon that little tent of blue which prisoners call the sky.
general.author: oscar wilde

general.quote: Going to prison is like dying with your eyes open.
general.author: bernard kerik

general.quote: There are not enough jails, not enough police, not enough courts to enforce a law not supported by the people.
general.author: hubert h. humphrey

general.quote: There is no more independence in politics than there is in jail.
general.author: will rogers

general.quote: In my country we go to prison first and then become President.
general.author: nelson mandela

general.quote: Prison make you a better judge of character. You pick up on people much faster.
general.author: suge knight

general.quote: I feel like the fellow in jail who is watching his scaffold being built.
general.author: dwight david eisenhower

general.quote: While there is a lower class, I am in it; while there is a criminal element, I am of it; and while there is a soul in prison, I am not free.
general.author: eugene v. debs

general.quote: The difference between tax avoidance and tax evasion is the thickness of a prison wall.
general.author: denis healey

general.quote: Probably the only place where a man can feel really secure is in a maximum security prison, except for the imminent threat of release.
general.author: germaine greer

general.quote: A healthy body is a guest chamber for the soul: a sick body is a prison.
general.author: francis bacon, sr.

general.quote: No man will be a sailor who has contrivance enough to get himself into a jail; for being in a ship is being in a jail, with the chance of being drowned.
general.author: samuel johnson

general.quote: Prison continues, on those who are entrusted to it, a work begun elsewhere, which the whole of society pursues on each individual through innumerable mechanisms of discipline.
general.author: michel foucault

general.quote: Books won’t stay banned. They won’t burn. Ideas won’t go to jail. In the long run of history, the censor and the inquisitor have always lost. The only sure weapon against bad ideas is better ideas.
general.author: alfred whitney griswold

general.quote: I know not whether Laws be right or whether Laws be wrong; all that we know who live in gail is that the wall is strong; and that each day is like a year, a year whose days are long.
general.author: oscar wilde

general.quote: Liberty is a different kind of pain from prison.
general.author: t. s. eliot

general.quote: Under a government which imprisons any unjustly, the true place for a just man is also a prison.
general.author: henry david thoreau

general.quote: Jails and prisons are designed to break human beings, to convert the population into specimens in a zoo-obedient to our keepers, but dangerous to each other.
general.author: angela davis

general.quote: The beauty, the poetry of the fear in their eyes. I didn’t mind going to jail for, what, five, six hours? It was absolutely worth it.
general.author: johnny depp

general.quote: Give us kinder laws to bring us back when we’re a-going wrong and don’t set Jail, Jail, Jail afore us everywhere we turn.
general.author: charles dickens

general.quote: In prison, those things withheld from and denied to the prisoner become precisely what he wants most of all.
general.author: eldridge cleaver

general.quote: Once we are destined to live out our lives in the prison of our mind, our duty is to furnish it well.
general.author: peter ustinov

general.quote: The world is but a large prison, out of which some are daily selected for execution.
general.author: sir walter raleigh

general.quote: The Founding Fathers in their wisdom decided that children were an unnatural strain on parents. So they provided jails called schools, equipped with tortures called an education.
general.author: john updike

general.quote: Being in a ship is being in a jail, with the chance of being drowned.
general.author: samuel johnson

general.quote: I have never been contained except I made the prison
general.author: mary evans

general.quote: Our task must be to free ourselves from this prison by widening our circles of compassion to embrace all living creatures and the whole of nature in its beauty.
general.author: albert einstein

general.quote: Jails and prisons are the complement of schools; so many less as you have of the latter, so many more must you have of the former.
general.author: horace mann

general.quote: America is the land of the second chance – and when the gates of the prison open, the path ahead should lead to a better life.
general.author: george w. bush

general.quote: The most anxious man in a prison is the governor.
general.author: george bernard shaw

general.quote: If you seek violence, we will seek to put you in jail.
general.author: edward koch

general.quote: Books won’t stay banned. They won’t burn. Ideas won’t go to jail.
general.author: alfred whitney griswold

general.quote: Stone walls do not a prison make nor iron bars a cage; minds innocent and quiet take that for an hermitage.
general.author: richard lovelace

general.quote: Where is the justice of political power if it executes the murderer and jails the plunderer, and then itself marches upon neighboring lands, killing thousands and pillaging the very hills?
general.author: kahlil gibran

general.quote: We are all conceived in close prison; in our mothers wombs, we are close prisoners all; when we are born, we are born but to the liberty of the house; prisoners still, though within larger walls; and then all our life is but a going out to the place of execution, to death.
general.author: john donne

general.quote: What does labor want? We want more schoolhouses and less jails; more books and less arsenals; more learning and less vice; more leisure and less greed; more justice and less revenge; in fact, more of the opportunities to cultivate our better natures.
general.author: samuel gompers

general.quote: I don’t like jail, they got the wrong kind of bars in there.
general.author: charles bukowski

general.quote: By taking revenge, a man is but even with his enemy; but in passing over it, he is superior.
general.author: francis bacon

general.quote: No one rejoices more in revenge than woman.
general.author: juvenal

general.quote: Revenge is barren of itself; itself is the dreadful food it feeds on; its delight is murder, and its satiety, despair.
general.author: friedrich schiller

general.quote: When violence hurries on too fast, and caution does not keep pace with revenge, people generally do themselves more harm than the enemy.
general.author: wellins calcott

general.quote: No revenge is so heroic than that which torments envy by doing good.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: Eye for eye, tooth for tooth, hand for hand, foot for foot.
general.author: bible
