general.quote: The instinct of revenge is the force which constitutes the essence of what we call psychology, history, metaphysics and morality. The spirit of revenge is the genealogical element of our thought, the transcendental principle of our way of thinking.
general.author: gilles deleuze

general.quote: When a man steals your wife, there is no better revenge than to let him keep her.
general.author: sacha guitry

general.quote: The man who seeks revenge is like the man who shoots himself in order to hit his enemy with the kick of the gun’s recoil.
general.author: tim lahaye & bob phillips

general.quote: Revenge may not be a particularly high consciousness-oriented activity.
general.author: carrie fisher

general.quote: The human heart in its perversity finds it hard to escape hatred and revenge.
general.author: moses luzzatto

general.quote: Revenge is the act of passion, vengeance is an act of justice.
general.author: samuel johnson

general.quote: Revenge, the attribute of gods! They stamped it with their great image on our natures.
general.author: thomas otway

general.quote: Which, if not victory, is yet revenge.
general.author: john milton

general.quote: Women do most delight in revenge.
general.author: sir thomas browne

general.quote: The man who seeks revenge digs two graves.
general.author: ken kesey

general.quote: In taking revenge a man is but equal to his enemy, but in passing it over he is his superior.
general.author: francis bacon

general.quote: ‘Tis more noble to forgive, and more manly to despise, than to revenge an Injury.
general.author: benjamin franklin

general.quote: Living well is the best revenge.
general.author: george herbert

general.quote: Revenge is the law of the outlaws.
general.author: laura blumenfeld

general.quote: Revenge is but a small circle.
general.author: edward counsel

general.quote: No more tears now; I will think upon revenge.
general.author: mary stuart

general.quote: Revenge is for children and the emotionally retarded.
general.author: frank herbert

general.quote: Sweet is revenge–especially to women.
general.author: lord byron

general.quote: Revenge is private and personal, and so readily gets out of hand.
general.author: ernest lucas

general.quote: Revenge is a debt, in the paying of which the greatest knave is honest and sincere, and, so far as he is able, punctual.
general.author: charles caleb colton

general.quote: Far from being a psychological trait, the spirit of revenge is the principle on which our whole psychology depends.
general.author: gilles deleuze

general.quote: Revenge is the infliction of pain, in consequence of the neglect or violation of duty.
general.author: elhanan winchester

general.quote: To admit wanting revenge is to admit you have been crushed and need to be rebuilt. Few are comfortable admitting that, even to themselves.
general.author: laura blumenfeld

general.quote: It is through madness that we hate an enemy, and think of revenging ourselves; and it is through indolence that we are appeased, and do not revenge ourselves.
general.author: jean de la bruyere

general.quote: Revenge has no more quenching effect on emotions than salt water has on thirst.
general.author: walter weckler

general.quote: Revenge, which, like envy, is an instinct of justice, does but take into its own hands the execution of that natural law which precedes the social.
general.author: paul chatfield

general.quote: Revenge, like some poisonous plant, replete with baneful juices, rankles in the breast, and meditates mischief to its neighbor.
general.author: wellins calcott

general.quote: Revenge is often like biting a dog because the dog bit you.
general.author: austin o’malley

general.quote: A man that studieth revenge keeps his own wounds green, which otherwise would heal and do well.
general.author: francis bacon

general.quote: What is revenge but courage to call in our honor’s debts, and wisdom to convert others’ self-love into our own protection?
general.author: edward young

general.quote: While you are meditating revenge, the devil is meditating a recruit.
general.author: francois de malherbe

general.quote: Revenge is like a ghost. It takes over every man it touches. Its thirst cannot be quenched until the last man standing has fallen.
general.author: vladmir makrov

general.quote: Pleasure and revenge, have ears more deaf than adders to the voice of any true decision.
general.author: william shakespeare

general.quote: A man who contemplates revenge keeps his wounds green.
general.author: francis bacon

general.quote: Revenge is sweeter than life itself. So think fools.
general.author: juvenal

general.quote: Revenge is a common passion; it is the sin of the uninstructed.
general.author: bulwer lytton

general.quote: Revenge is a boomerang.
general.author: garret smith

general.quote: Revenge is always the weak pleasure of a little and narrow mind.
general.author: juvenal

general.quote: The best revenge is massive success.
general.author: frank sinatra

general.quote: Revenge could steal a man’s life until there was nothing left but emptiness.
general.author: louis l’amour

general.quote: Every failure made me more confident. Because I wanted even more to achieve as revenge. To show that I could.
general.author: roman polanski

general.quote: There is no passion of the human heart that promises so much and pays so little as revenge.
general.author: henry wheeler shaw

general.quote: Life being what it is, one dreams of revenge.
general.author: paul gauguin

general.quote: Revenge is fever in our own blood, to be cured only by letting the blood of another.
general.author: charles caleb colton

general.quote: Revenge is a virus which eats into the very vitals of the mind and poisons the entire spiritual being.
general.author: james allen

general.quote: To be angry is to revenge the faults of others on ourselves.
general.author: alexander pope

general.quote: Revenge is profitable.
general.author: edward gibbon

general.quote: Surviving well is your finest revenge.
general.author: morgan nito

general.quote: The pleasure of revenge is like the pleasure of eating chalk and coals.
general.author: jeremy taylor

general.quote: I will not be revenged, and this I owe to my enemy; but I will remember, and this I owe to myself.
general.author: charles caleb colton

general.quote: Hatred is the coward’s revenge for being intimidated.
general.author: george bernard shaw

general.quote: Revenge is the raging fire that consumes the arsonist.
general.author: max lucado

general.quote: Revenge, that thirsty dropsy of our souls, makes us covet that which hurts us most.
general.author: philip massinger

general.quote: Revenge is an act of passion; vengeance, of justice: injuries are revenged; crimes are avenged.
general.author: samuel johnson

general.quote: I’m not real big on repentance … I like revenge better.
general.author: laurell k. hamilton

general.quote: He that has revenge in his power, and does not use it, is the greater man.
general.author: wellins calcott

general.quote: Revenge is the naked idol of the worship of a semi-barbarous age.
general.author: percy bysshe shelley

general.quote: There is no truer saying than "Revenge is a dish best eaten cold." It is so much sweeter for the waiting, and my only regret is that I cannot broadcast my triumph to the world.
general.author: minette walters

general.quote: It is useless to meet revenge with revenge: it will heal nothing.
general.author: john ronald reuel tolkien

general.quote: Revenge is the most worthless weapon in the world.
general.author: tim lahaye & bob phillips

general.quote: It is commonly said that revenge is sweet, but to a calm and considerate mind, patience and forgiveness are sweeter.
general.author: issac barrow

general.quote: In revenge a man is but even with his enemy; for it is a princely thing to pardon, and Solomon saith it is the glory of a man to pass over a transgression.
general.author: francis bacon

general.quote: Revenge is not always sweet, once it is consummated we feel inferior to our victim.
general.author: emil cioran

general.quote: A man can lose sight of everything else when he’s bent on revenge, and it ain’t worth it.
general.author: louis l’amour

general.quote: You will suffer and you will have hurt. You will have joy and you will have peace.
general.author: alison cheek

general.quote: Men must try and try again. They must suffer the consequences of their own mistakes and learn by their own failures and their own successes.
general.author: lawson purdy

general.quote: To succeed in life one must have determination and must be prepared to suffer during the process. If one isn’t prepared to suffer during adversities, I don’t really see how he can be successful.
general.author: gary player

general.quote: To try and fail is at least to learn. To fail to try is to suffer the loss of what might have been.
general.author: benjamin franklin

general.quote: Surfing is the most blissful experience you can have on this planet, a taste of heaven.
general.author: john mccarthy

general.quote: About the only difference between the poor and the rich, is this, the poor suffer misery, while the rich have to enjoy it.
general.author: henry wheeler shaw

general.quote: We have resolved to endure the unendurable and suffer what is insufferable.
general.author: source unknown

general.quote: Better to suffer than to die.
general.author: jean de la fontaine

general.quote: It is not suffering as such that is most deeply feared but suffering that degrades.
general.author: susan sontag

general.quote: People of Wealth and the so called upper class suffer the most from boredom.
general.author: arthur schopenhauer

general.quote: When it becomes more difficult to suffer than change — then you will change.
general.author: source unknown

general.quote: You do not have to suffer to be a poet. Adolescence is enough suffering for anyone.
general.author: john ciardi

general.quote: Suffering can become a means to greater love and greater generosity.
general.author: mother teresa

general.quote: I can sympathize with everything, except suffering.
general.author: oscar wilde

general.quote: Fear causes hesitation, and hesitation will cause your worst fears to come true.
general.author: patrick swayze

general.quote: Wisdom comes alone through suffering.
general.author: aeschylus

general.quote: Most American children suffer too much mother and too little father.
general.author: gloria steinem

general.quote: Life is truly known only to those who suffer, lose, endure adversity and stumble from defeat to defeat.
general.author: ryszard kapuscinski

general.quote: Everyone will experience the consequences of his own acts. If his acts are right, he’ll get good consequences; if they’re not, he’ll suffer for it.
general.author: harry browne

general.quote: When a good man is hurt all who would be called good must suffer with him.
general.author: euripides

general.quote: We are one; after all, you and I. Together we suffer, together exist, and forever will recreate each other.
general.author: pierre teilhard de chardin

general.quote: Suffering is the ancient law of love; there is no quest without pain; there is no lover who is not also a martyr.
general.author: heinrich suso

general.quote: So long as little children are allowed to suffer, there is no true love in this world.
general.author: isadora duncan

general.quote: You never suffer from a money problem; you always suffer from an idea problem.
general.author: robert h. schuller

general.quote: We are healed of a suffering only by experiencing it in full.
general.author: marcel proust

general.quote: The tears of those repenting are the wine of angels.
general.author: st. bernard

general.quote: In art there are tears that lie too deep for thought.
general.author: louis kronenberger

general.quote: Only to have a grief equal to all these tears!
general.author: adrienne rich

general.quote: And god shall wipe away all tears from their eyes; and there shall be no more death, neither sorrow nor crying, neither shall there be any more pain.
general.author: bible

general.quote: Whatever tears one may shed, in the end one always blows one’s nose.
general.author: heinrich heine

general.quote: In youth one has tears without grief, in old age grief without tears.
general.author: jean paul richter

general.quote: For women’s tears are but the sweat of eyes.
general.author: juvenal

general.quote: Tears such as angels weep.
general.author: john milton

general.quote: Shining through tears, like April suns in showers, that labor to overcome the cloud that loads em.
general.author: thomas otway

general.quote: Through reconciliation, streams of tears will come to our eyes.
general.author: jean-bertrand aristide

general.quote: Tears may be dried up, but the heart never.
general.author: margaret valois

general.quote: Love is a smoke made with the fume of sighs. Being purged, a fire sparkling in lovers eyes. Being vexed, a sea nourished with lovers tears. What is it else? A madness most discreet, a choking gall and a preserving sweet.
general.author: william shakespeare

general.quote: Pearls mean tears.
general.author: doris lessing

general.quote: Let a man accept his destiny. No pity and no tears.
general.author: euripides

general.quote: Every woman is wrong until she cries, and then she is right; immediately.
general.author: sam slick

general.quote: There is a sacredness in tears. They are not the mark of weakness, but of power. They speak more eloquently than ten thousand tongues. They are the messengers of overwhelming grief, of deep contrition, and of unspeakable love.
general.author: washington irving

general.quote: Tears are the silent language of grief.
general.author: voltaire quotes

general.quote: It is only the women whose eyes have been washed clear with tears who get the broad vision that makes them little sisters to all the world.
general.author: dorothy dix

general.quote: Time engraves our faces with all the tears we have not shed.
general.author: natalie clifford barney

general.quote: Tears are the summer showers to the soul.
general.author: alfred austin

general.quote: Tears are the symbol of the inability of the soul to restrain its emotion and retain its self command.
general.author: henri frederic amiel

general.quote: I have nothing to offer but blood, toil, tears and sweat.
general.author: winston churchill

general.quote: Delicious tears! The heart’s own dew.
general.author: letitia elizabeth landon

general.quote: Tears of joy are like the summer rain drops pierced by sunbeams.
general.author: hosea ballou

general.quote: There are times when God asks nothing of his children except silence, patience and tears.
general.author: c. s. robinson

general.quote: Many shed tears merely for show, and have dry eyes when no one’s around to observe them.
general.author: marcus annaeus seneca

general.quote: Only eyes washed by tears can see clearly.
general.author: louis l. mann

general.quote: My tears of love are a waste of time if I turn away.
general.author: kim wilde

general.quote: The busy have no time for tears.
general.author: lord byron

general.quote: Tears are the natural penalties of pleasure. It is a law that we should pay for all that we enjoy.
general.author: william gilmore simms

general.quote: Tears are nature’s lotion for the eyes. The eyes see better for being washed by them.
general.author: john christian bovee

general.quote: Oh eyes, no eyes, but fountains fraught with tears; O life, no life, but lively form of death; Oh world, no world, but mass of public wrongs.
general.author: thomas kyd

general.quote: Tearless grief bleeds inwardly.
general.author: john christian bovee

general.quote: Tears shed for self are tears of weakness, but tears shed for others are a sign of strength.
general.author: billy graham

general.quote: We know God wipes away all tears, but it certainly feels good when He uses human hands.
general.author: mary paulson-lauda

general.quote: Friends show their love in times of trouble…
general.author: euripides

general.quote: Dreams are today’s answers to tomorrow’s questions.
general.author: edgar cayce

general.quote: Cold prayers shall never have any warm answers.
general.author: thomas b. brooks

general.quote: There are three answers to prayer: yes, no, and wait a while. It must be recognized that no is an answer.
general.author: ruth stafford peale

general.quote: God answers all true prayer, either in kind or in kindness.
general.author: adoniram judson

general.quote: Beware of the man who knows the answer before he understands the question.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: You can tell whether a man is clever by his answers. You can tell whether a man is wise by his questions.
general.author: naguib mahfouz

general.quote: He must be very ignorant, for he answers every question he is asked.
general.author: voltaire quotes

general.quote: Sometimes the answer to prayer is not that it changes life, but that it changes you.
general.author: james dillet freeman

general.quote: It is not the answer that enlightens, but the question.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: Giving half answers won’t make the conversation half as long.
general.author: dave johnson

general.quote: As long as one keeps searching, the answers come.
general.author: joan baez

general.quote: Always the beautiful answer who asks a more beautiful question.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: Real prayer seeks an audience and an answer.
general.author: william s. plumer

general.quote: Computers are useless. They can only give you answers.
general.author: pablo picasso quotes

general.quote: It is a sign of strength, not of weakness, to admit that you don’t know all the answers.
general.author: john p. lougbrane

general.quote: Unintelligible answers to insoluble problems.
general.author: henry brooks adams

general.quote: To find the exact answer, one must first ask the exact question.
general.author: tobin s. webster

general.quote: I believe the best test of a model is how well can the modeler answer the questions, "What do you know now, that you did not know before?" and "How can you find out if it is true?
general.author: jim bower

general.quote: God answers prayer with certainty. Wish fulfillment is something else.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: You need to make a commitment, and once you make it, then life will give you some answers.
general.author: les brown

general.quote: The uncreative mind can spot wrong answers, but it takes a very creative mind to spot wrong questions.
general.author: anthony jay

general.quote: The only interesting answers are those which destroy the questions.
general.author: susan sontag

general.quote: Do not answer the person whose questions are vile. Do not question a person whose answers are vile.
general.author: confucius

general.quote: Be thankful that God’s answers are wiser than your answers.
general.author: william culbertson

general.quote: We grow in time to trust the future for our answers.
general.author: ruth benedict

general.quote: A writer is someone who can make a riddle out of an answer.
general.author: karl kraus

general.quote: If you want a wise answer, ask a reasonable question.
general.author: goethe quotes

general.quote: Man will not live without answers to his questions.
general.author: hans j. morgenthau

general.quote: An expert knows all the answers — if you ask the right questions.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: Stay a little and news will find you.
general.author: george herbert

general.quote: If it’s called the USA Today, why is all the news from yesterday? BAM. Busted!
general.author: stephen colbert

general.quote: If you’re not careful, the newspapers will have you hating the people who are being oppressed, and loving the people who are doing the oppressing.
general.author: malcolm x

general.quote: Read two newspapers a day. And not just online. Hold them in your hands. Get ink on your fingers.
general.author: john callaway

general.quote: I do not like to get the news, because there has never been an era when so many things were going so right for so many of the wrong persons.
general.author: ogden nash

general.quote: Once a newspaper touches a story, the facts are lost forever, even to the protagonists.
general.author: norman mailer

general.quote: Newspapers are the world’s mirrors.
general.author: james ellis

general.quote: Ill news is wing’d with fate, and flies apace.
general.author: john dryden

general.quote: Newspapers are to the body politic what arteries are to the human body, their function being to carry blood and sustenance and repair to every part of the body.
general.author: henry ward beecher

general.quote: It’s not the world that’s gotten so much worse, but the news coverage that’s gotten so much better.
general.author: gilbert keith chesterton

general.quote: No news is good news.
general.author: ludovic halevy

general.quote: A newspaper is a circulating library with high blood pressure.
general.author: arthur baer

general.quote: Newspapers are unable, seemingly, to discriminate between a bicycle accident and the collapse of civilisation.
general.author: george bernard shaw

general.quote: That endless book, the newspaper, is our national glory.
general.author: henry ward beecher

general.quote: I fear three newspapers more than a hundred thousand bayonets.
general.author: napoleon bonaparte

general.quote: They kill good trees to put out bad newspapers.
general.author: james g. watt

general.quote: No news is good news. No journalists is even better.
general.author: nicolas bentley

general.quote: When a dog bites a man that is not news, but when a man bites a dog that is news.
general.author: charles anderson dana

general.quote: Newspapers have degenerated. They may now be absolutely relied upon.
general.author: oscar wilde quotes

general.quote: Editor: a person employed on a newspaper whose business it is to separate the wheat from the chaff, and to see that the chaff is printed.
general.author: elbert hubbard

general.quote: It is the newspaper’s duty to print the news and raise hell.
general.author: wilbur f. storey

general.quote: Some newspapers are fit only to line the bottom of bird cages !
general.author: spiro t. agnew

general.quote: I read the newspaper avidly. It is my one form of continuous fiction.
general.author: aneurin bevan

general.quote: It is necessary, if one would read aright, that he should read at least two newspapers, representing both sides of important subjects.
general.author: henry ward beecher

general.quote: Newspapers always excite curiosity. No one ever puts one down without the feeling of disappointment.
general.author: charles lamb

general.quote: In these times we fight for ideas, and newspapers are our fortresses.
general.author: heinrich heine

general.quote: News is history shot on the wing.
general.author: gene fowler

general.quote: All newspaper writers have heard that the stuff they compose today has an excellent chance of being used to wrap tomorrow’s mackerel.
general.author: ira berkow

general.quote: Everyone has inside of him a piece of news good. the good news is that you don’t know how great you can be! how much you can love! what you can accomplish! and what your potential is!`
general.author: anne frank

general.quote: Everything you read in newspapers is absolutely true, except for that rare story of which you happen to have first-hand knowledge.
general.author: erwin knoll

general.quote: If one has not read the newspapers for some months and then reads them all together, one sees, as one never saw before, how much time is wasted with this kind of literature.
general.author: johann wolfgang von goethe quotes

general.quote: One of the objects of a newspaper is to understand popular feeling and to give expression to it; another is to arouse among the people certain desirable sentiments; and the third is fearlessly to expose popular defects.
general.author: mahatma gandhi

general.quote: We need not be theologians to see that we have shifted responsibility for making the world interesting from God to the newspaperman.
general.author: daniel j. boorstin

general.quote: It is good news, worthy of all acceptation, and yet not too good to be true.
general.author: matthew

general.quote: In the case of news, we should always wait for the sacrament of confirmation.
general.author: francois-marie arouet de voltaire

general.quote: The nature of bad news affects the teller.
general.author: william shakespeare

general.quote: You should always believe all you read in the newspapers, as this makes them more interesting.
general.author: rose maccaulay

general.quote: The news of any politician’s death should be listed under "Public Improvements.
general.author: frank dane

general.quote: I have a piece of great and sad news to tell you: I am dead.
general.author: jean cocteau

general.quote: For evil news rides post, while good news baits.
general.author: john milton

general.quote: Newspapers widen the sphere of our sympathies. They make their readers enter into the joys and sorrows of thousands of whom they would else know nothing, and for whom they would otherwise care nothing.
general.author: christian nestell bovee

general.quote: To a philosopher all news, as it is called, is gossip, and they who edit it and read it are old women over their tea.
general.author: henry david thoreau

general.quote: The real news is bad news.
general.author: marshall mcluhan

general.quote: A newspaper is the lowest thing there is.
general.author: richard j. daley

general.quote: Every editor of newspapers pays tribute to the devil.
general.author: jean de la fontaine

general.quote: The conflict between the men who make and the men who report the news is as old as time. News may be true, but it is not truth, and reporters and officials seldom see it the same way. In the old days, the reporters or couriers of bad news were often put to the gallows; now they are given the Pulitzer Prize, but the conflict goes on.
general.author: james reston

general.quote: I do not take a single newspaper nor read one a month, and I feel myself infinitely happier for it.
general.author: thomas jefferson quotes

general.quote: Write the news as if your very life depended on it. It does!
general.author: heywood broun

general.quote: Trying to determine what is going on in the world by reading newspapers is like trying to tell the time by watching the second hand of a clock.
general.author: ben hecht

general.quote: Four hostile newspapers are more to be feared than a thousand bayonets.
general.author: napoleon bonaparte quotes

general.quote: The evening papers print what they do and get away with it because by afternoon the human mind is ruined anyhow.
general.author: christopher morley

general.quote: Nobody likes the man who brings bad news.
general.author: sophocles

general.quote: I’ll give anything for a good copy now, be it true or false, so it be news.
general.author: ben johnson

general.quote: Nothing would improve newspaper criticism so much as the knowledge that it was to be read by men too hardy to acquiesce to the authoritative statement of the reviewer.
general.author: r. h. hutton

general.quote: The most efficacious secular book that ever was published in America is the newspaper.
general.author: henry ward beecher quotes

general.quote: Newspapers will ultimately engross all literature.
general.author: alphonse de lamartine

general.quote: News is what a chap who doesn’t care much about anything wants to read. And it’s only news until he’s read it. After that it’s dead.
general.author: evelyn waugh

general.quote: A newspaper consists of just the same number of words, whether there be any news in it or not.
general.author: henry fielding

general.quote: We live in the midst of alarms; anxiety beclouds the future; we expect some new disaster with each newspaper we read.
general.author: abraham lincoln quotes

general.quote: That ephemeral sheet,… the newspaper, is the natural enemy of the book, as the whore is of the decent woman.
general.author: edmond de goncourt and jules de goncourt

general.quote: Newspapers: dead trees with information smeared on them.
general.author: horizon

general.quote: A good newspaper is never nearly good enough but a lousy newspaper is a joy forever.
general.author: garrison keillor

general.quote: The man who reads nothing at all is better educated than the man who reads nothing but newspapers.
general.author: thomas jefferson

general.quote: There’s a compelling reason to master information and news. Clearly there will be better job and financial opportunities. Other high stakes will be missed by people if they don’t master and connect information.
general.author: everette dennis

general.quote: A good newspaper, i suppose, is a nation talking to itself.
general.author: arthur miller

general.quote: news is the first rough draft of history.`
general.author: philip l. graham

general.quote: Republicans study the financial pages of the newspaper. Democrats put them in the bottom of the bird cage.
general.author: will stanton

general.quote: Advertisements contain the only truths to be relied on in a newspaper.
general.author: thomas jefferson quotes

general.quote: When woman has a newspaper which fear and favor cannot touch, then it will be that she can freely write her own thoughts.
general.author: susan b. anthony

general.quote: Newspapers are the schoolmasters of the common people.
general.author: henry ward beecher

general.quote: It is better to be making the news than taking it; to be an actor rather than a critic.
general.author: winston churchill quotes

general.quote: Many a good newspaper story has been ruined by over verification.
general.author: james gordon bennett

general.quote: Journalism is popular, but it is popular mainly as fiction. Life is one world, and life seen in the newspapers another.
general.author: gilbert k. chesterton

general.quote: Though it be honest, it is never good to bring bad news.
general.author: william shakespeare

general.quote: If the newspapers are useful in overthrowing tyrants, it is only to establish a tyranny of their own.
general.author: james fenimore cooper

general.quote: No one knows who is listening, say nothing you would not wish put in the newspapers.
general.author: charles haddon spurgeon

general.quote: For those who govern, the first thing required is indifference to newspapers.
general.author: louis adolphe thiers

general.quote: The newspaper is in all its literalness the bible of democracy, the book out of which a people determines its conduct.
general.author: walter lippmann

general.quote: News as wholesome as the morning air.
general.author: george chapman

general.quote: Early in life I had noticed that no event is ever correctly reported in a newspaper.
general.author: george orwell

general.quote: The advertisements are the most truthful part of a newspaper.
general.author: thomas jefferson quotes

general.quote: Accuracy is to a newspaper what virtue is to a lady, but a newspaper can always print a retraction.
general.author: adlai e. stevenson

general.quote: News is that which comes from the North, East, West and South, and if it comes from only one point on the compass, then it is a class ; publication and not news.
general.author: benjamin disraeli

general.quote: The newspaper is a greater treasure to the people than uncounted millions of gold.
general.author: henry ward beecher

general.quote: The one function that TV news performs very well is that when there is no news we give it to you with the same emphasis as if there were.
general.author: david brinkley

general.quote: The advertisements in a newspaper are more full of knowledge in respect to what is going on in a state or community than the editorial columns are.
general.author: henry ward beecher

general.quote: Curiosity doesn’t matter anymore. These days people don’t want to be transported to emotional territories where they don’t know how to react.
general.author: hector babenko

general.quote: Curiosity will conquer fear even more than bravery will.
general.author: james stephens

general.quote: Curiosity is free-wheeling intelligence.
general.author: alistair cooke

general.quote: Curiosity is the wick in the candle of learning.
general.author: william a. ward

general.quote: What we want to tell, we wish our friend to have curiosity to hear.
general.author: samuel richardson

general.quote: The important thing is not to stop questioning. Curiosity has its own reason for existing.
general.author: albert einstein

general.quote: It is a miracle that curiosity survives formal education.
general.author: albert einstein quotes

general.quote: Seize the moment of excited curiosity on any subject to solve your doubts; for if you let it pass, the desire may never return, and you may remain in ignorance.
general.author: william wirt

general.quote: Curiosity is one of the great secrets of happiness.
general.author: bryant h. mcgill

general.quote: Morality comes with the sad wisdom of age, when the sense of curiosity has withered.
general.author: graham greene

general.quote: Only when one has lost all curiosity about the future has one reached the age to write an autobiography.
general.author: evelyn waugh

general.quote: When you meet people, show real appreciation, then genuine curiosity.
general.author: martha beck

general.quote: Curiosity in children is but an appetite for knowledge.
general.author: john locke

general.quote: Be less curious about people and more curious about ideas.
general.author: marie curie

general.quote: One who is too wise an observer of the business of others, like one who is too curious in observing the labor of bees, will often be stung for his curiosity.
general.author: alexander pope

general.quote: Curiosity is one of the forms of feminine bravery.
general.author: victor hugo quotes

general.quote: One of the secrets of life is to keep our intellectual curiosity acute.
general.author: william lyon phelps

general.quote: Curiosity is the very basis of education and if you tell me that curiosity killed the cat, I say only the cat died nobly.
general.author: arnold edinborough

general.quote: An impersonal and scientific knowledge of the structure of our bodies is the surest safeguard against prurient curiosity and lascivious gloating.
general.author: marie carmichael stopes

general.quote: The first and simplest emotion which we discover in the human mind is curiosity.
general.author: edmund burke

general.quote: You know what a woman’s curiosity is.
general.author: oscar wilde

general.quote: Life must be lived and curiosity kept alive. One must never, for whatever reason, turn his back on life.
general.author: eleanor roosevelt

general.quote: Curiosity is as much the parent of attention, as attention is of memory.
general.author: richard whately

general.quote: Her curiosity instructed her more than the answers she was given.
general.author: clarice lispector

general.quote: We keep moving forward, opening new doors, and doing new things, because we’re curious and curiosity keeps leading us down new paths.
general.author: walt disney quotes

general.quote: There are different kinds of curiosity: one comes from self-interest, which makes us want to know everything that may be profitable to us; another from pride, which comes from a desire to know what others are ignorant of.
general.author: francois de la rochefoucauld

general.quote: I could not, at any age, be content to take my place by the fireside and simply look on. Life was meant to be lived. Curiosity must be kept alive. One must never, for whatever reason, turn his back on life.
general.author: eleanor roosevelt quotes

general.quote: Curiosity has its own reason for existence.
general.author: albert einstein

general.quote: The greatest virtue of man is perhaps curiosity.
general.author: anatole france

general.quote: I know quite certainly that I myself have no special talent; curiosity, obsession and dogged endurance, combined with self-criticism have brought me to my ideas.
general.author: albert einstein quotes

general.quote: Curiosity is the direct incontinence of the spirit.
general.author: jeremy taylor

general.quote: Curiosity about life in all of its aspects, I think, is still the secret of great creative people.
general.author: leo burnett

general.quote: My alma mater was books, a good library. I could spend the rest of my life reading, just satisfying my curiosity.
general.author: malcolm x

general.quote: Love is three quarters curiosity.
general.author: giacomo casanova

general.quote: First love is only a little foolishness and a lot of curiosity: no really self-respecting woman would take advantage of it.
general.author: george bernard shaw quotes

general.quote: When you’re curious, you find lots of interesting things to do.
general.author: walt disney

general.quote: Curiosity is the lust of the mind.
general.author: thomas hobbes

general.quote: We praise old times, but show no curiosity about modern events.
general.author: syrus publilius syrus

general.quote: Curiosity is the key to creativity.
general.author: akio morita

general.quote: It is the spur of ignorance, the consciousness of not understanding, and the curiosity about that which lies beyond that are essential to our progress.
general.author: john pierce

general.quote: Curiosity is, in great and generous minds, the first passion and the last.
general.author: samuel johnson

general.quote: Curiosity is lying in wait for every secret.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson quotes

general.quote: The public have an insatiable curiosity to know everything, except what is worth knowing.
general.author: oscar wilde quotes

general.quote: Curiosity is natural to the soul of man and interesting objects have a powerful influence on our affections.
general.author: daniel boone

general.quote: Curiosity . . . endows the people who have it with a generosity in argument and a serenity in cheerful willingness to let life take the form it will.
general.author: alistair cooke

general.quote: Curiosity is the one thing invincible in Nature.
general.author: freya stark

general.quote: Never lose a holy curiosity.
general.author: albert einstein quotes

general.quote: The cure for boredom is curiosity. There is no cure for curiosity.
general.author: ellen parr

general.quote: Curiosity is idle only to those who fail to realize that it may be a very rare and indispensable thing.
general.author: james harvey robinson

general.quote: Let’s just say I was testing the bounds of reality. I was curious to see what would happen. That’s all it was: curiosity.
general.author: jim morrison

general.quote: The philosophic spirit of inquiry may be traced to brute curiosity, and that to the habit of examining all things in search of food.
general.author: winwood w. reade

general.quote: The scientist is motivated primarily by curiosity and a desire for truth.
general.author: irving langmuir

general.quote: People die when curiosity goes.
general.author: graham swift

general.quote: We don’t know when our name came into being or how some distant ancestor acquired it. We don’t understand our name at all, we don’t know its history and yet we bear it with exalted fidelity, we merge with it, we like it, we are ridiculously proud of it as if we had thought it up ourselves in a moment of brilliant inspiration.
general.author: milan kundera

general.quote: What’s in a name? That which we call a rose by any other name would smell as sweet.
general.author: william shakespeare

general.quote: You have but to know an object by its proper name for it to lose its dangerous magic.
general.author: elias canetti

general.quote: The invisible thing called a Good Name is made up of the breath of numbers that speak well of you.
general.author: edward f. halifax

general.quote: The modern girl is less concerned with everything being a brand name.
general.author: sophia amoruso

general.quote: Should envious tongues some malice frame; to soil and tarnish your good name; Live it down!
general.author: henry rink

general.quote: God is the name we give our conscience.
general.author: nader shureih

general.quote: So, our lives, in acts exemplary, not only win ourselves good names, but doth to others give matter for virtuous deeds by which we live.
general.author: john jay chapman

general.quote: Words have meaning and names have power.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: I have fallen in love with american names, the sharp, gaunt names that never get fat.
general.author: stephen vincent benet

general.quote: Nature is a good name for an effect whose cause is God.
general.author: william cowper

general.quote: Nicknames are the most essential in life, more valuable than names.
general.author: chespirito

general.quote: Love is the silent saying and saying of a single name.
general.author: mignon mclaughlin

general.quote: He lives who dies to win a lasting name.
general.author: henry drummond

general.quote: Many are the names of God and infinite the forms through which He may be approached.
general.author: ramakrishna

general.quote: Our names are labels, plainly printed on the bottled essence of our past behavior.
general.author: logan pearsall smith

general.quote: A nickname is the hardest stone that the devil can throw at a man.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: We do what we must, and call it by the best names.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson

general.quote: If you have a good name, if you are right more often than you are wrong, if your children respect you, if your grandchildren are glad to see you, if your friends can count on you and you can count on them in time of trouble, if you can face your God and say "I have done my best," then you are a success.
general.author: ann landers

general.quote: Napoleon for the sake of a good name broke in pieces half the world.
general.author: johann wolfgang von goethe

general.quote: In real life, unlike in Shakespeare, the sweetness of the rose depends upon the name it bears. Things are not only what they are. They are, in very important respects, what they seem to be.
general.author: hubert h. humphrey

general.quote: Mathematics is the art of giving the same name to different things.
general.author: henri poincare

general.quote: Proper names are poetry in the raw. Like all poetry they are untranslatable.
general.author: w.h. auden

general.quote: Names are an important key to what a society values. Anthropologists recognize naming as ‘one of the chief methods for imposing order on perception.’
general.author: david s. slawson

general.quote: The pyramids, attached with age, have forgotten the names of their founders.
general.author: r. buckminster fuller

general.quote: I don’t like giving names to generations. It’s like trying to read the song title on a record that’s spinning.
general.author: ian williams

general.quote: If names are not correct, language will not be in accordance with the truth of things.
general.author: confucius

general.quote: He said true things, but called them by wrong names.
general.author: elizabeth barrett browning

general.quote: I think a child should be allowed to take his father’s or mother’s name at will on coming of age. Paternity is a legal fiction.
general.author: james joyce

general.quote: In the name of God, stop a moment, cease your work, look around you.
general.author: leo tolstoy

general.quote: Names, once they are in common use, quickly become mere sounds, their etymology being buried, like so many of the earth’s marvels, beneath the dust of habit.
general.author: salman rushdie

general.quote: Of all eloquence a nickname is the most concise; of all arguments the most unanswerable.
general.author: william hazlitt

general.quote: A name pronounced is the recognition of the individual to whom it belongs. He who can pronounce my name aright, he can call me, and is entitled to my love and service.
general.author: henry david thoreau

general.quote: Nicknames stick to people, and the most ridiculous are the most adhesive.
general.author: thomas c. haliburton

general.quote: Each generation wants new symbols, new people, new names. They want to divorce themselves from their predecessors.
general.author: jim morrison

general.quote: Good will, like a good name, is got by many actions and lost by one.
general.author: francis jeffrey

general.quote: Man is the inventor of stupidity.
general.author: remy de gourmont

general.quote: We never really know what stupidity is until we have experimented on ourselves.
general.author: paul gauguin

general.quote: The doctor sees all the weakness of mankind; the lawyer all the wickedness, the theologian all the stupidity.
general.author: arthur schopenhauer

general.quote: It is much easier for good to deal with evil than it is for good to deal with stupidity.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: Things fall apart and happen out of stupidity and carelessness.
general.author: john sandford

general.quote: The question now is: Can we understand our stupidity? This is a test of intellect, not of character.
general.author: john king fairbank

general.quote: Genius may have its limitations, but stupidity is not thus handicapped.
general.author: elbert hubbard

general.quote: If Stupidity got us into this mess, then why can’t it get us out?
general.author: will rogers

general.quote: The two most abundant things in the universe are Hydrogen and stupidity.
general.author: harlan ellison

general.quote: Stupidity is the friend of evil.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: The difference between stupidity and genius is that genius has its limits.
general.author: albert einstein

general.quote: Stupidity is an elemental force for which no earthquake is a match.
general.author: karl kraus

general.quote: Stupidity gets up early; that is why events are accustomed to happening in the morning.
general.author: karl kraus

general.quote: It costs to be stupid. The stupider you are, the more it costs.
general.author: sherrill brown

general.quote: The only thing that ever consoles man for the stupid things he does is the praise he always gives himself for doing them.
general.author: oscar wilde

general.quote: Only two things are infinite, the universe and human stupidity, and I’m not sure about the former.
general.author: albert einstein

general.quote: Stupidity is without anxiety.
general.author: johann wolfgang von goethe

general.quote: If poverty is the mother of crime, stupidity is its father.
general.author: jean de la bruyere

general.quote: Our greatest stupidities may be very wise.
general.author: ludwig wittgenstein

general.quote: Stupidity often saves a man from going mad.
general.author: oliver wendell holmes

general.quote: Wise men talk because they have something to say; fools, because they have to say something.
general.author: plato

general.quote: When the stomach is full, it is easy to talk of fasting.
general.author: st. jerome

general.quote: When people talk, listen completely. Most people never listen.
general.author: ernest hemingway

general.quote: When a woman is talking to you, listen to what she says with her eyes.
general.author: victor hugo

general.quote: We must stop talking about the American dream and start listening to the dreams of Americans.
general.author: max beerbohm

general.quote: To talk to someone who does not listen is enough to tense the devil.
general.author: pearl bailey

general.quote: To listen well is as powerful a means of communication and influence as to talk well.
general.author: john marshall

general.quote: They never taste who always drink; they always talk who never think.
general.author: matthew prior

general.quote: The opposite of talking isn’t listening. The opposite of talking is waiting.
general.author: fran lebowitz

general.quote: The moment you start to talk about playing music, you destroy music. It cannot be talked about. It can only be played, enjoyed and listened to.
general.author: john mclaughlin

general.quote: The less you talk, the more you’re listened to.
general.author: abigail van buren

general.quote: The key to acting has much more to do with listening than with talking.
general.author: melissa leo

general.quote: The focus should not be on talking. Talk is cheap. It must be on action.
general.author: howard berman

general.quote: Talking much is a sign of vanity, for the one who is lavish with words is cheap in deeds.
general.author: sir walter raleigh

general.quote: Talk to a man about himself and he will listen for hours.
general.author: benjamin disraeli

general.quote: Talk about yourself as much as you like, but do not expect others to listen.
general.author: mason cooley

general.quote: Talk is cheap, except when Congress does it.
general.author: cullen hightower

general.quote: Spend a lot of time talking to customers face to face. You’d be amazed how many companies don’t listen to their customers.
general.author: ross perot

general.quote: Reading is a conversation. All books talk. But a good book listens as well.
general.author: mark haddon

general.quote: Prayer is talking with God and telling Him you love Him, conversing with God about all the things that are important in life, both large and small, and being assured that He is listening.
general.author: neil c. strait

general.quote: One advantage of talking to yourself is that you know at least somebody’s listening.
general.author: franklin p. jones

general.quote: On sensitive issues, talk isn’t cheap – it takes real courage to pry open topics nailed shut.
general.author: arvin olasky

general.quote: I’ll talk. You’ll listen.
general.author: bruce nauman

general.quote: If you talk to your body, it will listen.
general.author: bernie siegel

general.quote: If there’s anything I have learned since returning to Congress, it’s that talk is still cheap, progress is still slow, and our liberties continue to erode every day.
general.author: matt salmon

general.quote: I used to love to sit and listen to the old people talk about yesterday. There’s a lot of good information there.
general.author: curtis mayfield

general.quote: The object of teaching a child is to enable him to get along without his teacher.
general.author: elbert hubbard

general.quote: Adversity is a great teacher, but this teacher makes us pay dearly for its instruction; and often the profit we derive, is not worth the price we paid.
general.author: jean jacques rousseau

general.quote: The whole art of teaching is only the art of awakening the natural curiosity of young minds for the purpose of satisfying it afterwards.
general.author: anatole france

general.quote: The key to fixing education is better teaching, and the key to better teaching is figuring out who can teach and who can’t.
general.author: jonathan alter

general.quote: Teaching is leaving a vestige of oneself in the development of another. And surely the student is a bank where you can deposit your most precious treasures.
general.author: eugene p. bertin

general.quote: A teacher is one who makes himself progressively unnecessary.
general.author: thomas carruthers

general.quote: Teaching is the greatest act of optimism.
general.author: colleen wilcox

general.quote: Those who know how to think need no teachers.
general.author: mahatma gandhi

general.quote: Prosperity is a great teacher; adversity is a greater. Possession pampers the mind; privation trains and strengthens it.
general.author: william hazlitt

general.quote: None can teach admirably if not loving his task.
general.author: amos bronson alcott

general.quote: Teach the art of living well.
general.author: seneca

general.quote: You teach best what you most need to learn.
general.author: richard bach

general.quote: You can teach a student a lesson for a day; but if you can teach him to learn by creating curiosity, he will continue the learning process as long as he lives.
general.author: clay p. bedford

general.quote: Life is amazing: and the teacher had better prepare himself to be a medium for that amazement.
general.author: edward blishen

general.quote: A true teacher defends his students against his own personal influences.
general.author: amos bronson alcott

general.quote: Every truth has four corners: as a teacher I give you one corner, and it is for you to find the other three.
general.author: confucius

general.quote: A good teacher is a determined person.
general.author: gilbert highet

general.quote: It is the supreme art of the teacher to awaken joy in creative expression and knowledge.
general.author: albert einstein

general.quote: Success is a lousy teacher. It seduces smart people into thinking they can’t lose.
general.author: bill gates

general.quote: The art of teaching is the art of assisting discovery.
general.author: mark van doren

general.quote: Ask yourself: ‘Do I feel the need to laminate?’ Then teaching is for you.
general.author: gordon korman

general.quote: What the teacher is, is more important than what he teaches.
general.author: karl menninger

general.quote: The things taught in schools and colleges are not an education, but the means of education.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson

general.quote: Teaching is only demonstrating that it is possible. Learning is making it possible for yourself.
general.author: paulo coelho

general.quote: A good teacher is like a candle – it consumes itself to light the way for others.
general.author: mustafa kemal atatürk

general.quote: Fear is not a good teacher. The lessons of fear are quickly forgotten.
general.author: mary bateson

general.quote: Teaching isn’t one-tenth as effective as training.
general.author: horace mann

general.quote: Teacher appreciation makes the world of education go around.
general.author: helen peters

general.quote: Good teaching must be slow enough so that it is not confusing, and fast enough so that it is not boring.
general.author: sydney j. harris

general.quote: The greatest sign of a success for a teacher…is to be able to say, "The children are now working as if I did not exist.
general.author: maria montessori

general.quote: First let a man teach himself, and then he will be taught by others.
general.author: johann wolfgang von goethe

general.quote: The task of the excellent teacher is to stimulate “apparently ordinary” people to unusual effort. the tough problem is not in identifying winners: it is in making winners out of ordinary people.
general.author: k. patricia cross

general.quote: The teacher who is indeed wise does not bid you to enter the house of his wisdom but rather leads you to the threshold of your mind.
general.author: khalil gibran

general.quote: the one exclusive sign of a thorough knowledge is the power of teaching.
general.author: aristotle

general.quote: The teacher is one who makes two ideas grow where only one grew before.
general.author: elbert hubbard

general.quote: In the practice of tolerance, one’s enemy is the best teacher.
general.author: dalai lama

general.quote: To teach is to learn twice.
general.author: joseph joubert

general.quote: The mediocre teacher tells. The good teacher explains. The superior teacher demonstrates. The great teacher inspires.
general.author: william a. ward

general.quote: In learning you will teach, and in teaching you will learn.
general.author: phil collins

general.quote: The mistakes of others are good teachers.
general.author: estonian

general.quote: The teacher gives not of his wisdom, but rather of his faith and lovingness.
general.author: kahlil gibran

general.quote: What do you think of God, the teacher asked. After a pause, the young pupil replied, "He’s not a think, he’s a feel.
general.author: paul frost

general.quote: Come into the light of things. Let nature be your teacher.
general.author: william wordsworth

general.quote: I am not a teacher: only a fellow-traveler of whom you asked the way. I pointed ahead–ahead of myself as well as you.
general.author: george bernard shaw

general.quote: Any teacher that can be replaced by a machine should be!
general.author: arthur c. clarke

general.quote: He who can, does. He who cannot, teaches.
general.author: george bernard shaw

general.quote: Everybody who is incapable of learning has taken to teaching.
general.author: oscar wilde

general.quote: A good teacher must know the rules; a good pupil, the exceptions.
general.author: martin h. fischer

general.quote: Teaching is one of the noblest of professions. It requires an adequate preparation and training, patience, devotion, and a deep sense of responsibility..
general.author: calvin coolidge

general.quote: A teacher’s job is to take a bunch of live wires and see that they are well-grounded.
general.author: d. martin

general.quote: The world teaches you more than your supervisor.
general.author: maltese

general.quote: Unless we do his teachings, we do not demonstrate faith in him.
general.author: ezra taft benson

general.quote: There is no real teacher who in practice does not believe in the existence of the soul, or in a magic that acts on it through speech.
general.author: allan bloom

general.quote: Teaching is reminding others that they know just as well as you. You are all learners, doers, and teachers.
general.author: richard bach

general.quote: You cannot teach a man anything; you can only help him to find it within himself.
general.author: galilei galileo

general.quote: A teacher affects eternity; he can never tell where his influence stops.
general.author: henry brooks adams

general.quote: A teacher must believe in the value and interest of his subject as a doctor believes in health.
general.author: gilbert highet

general.quote: It is not possible for one to teach others who cannot teach his own family.
general.author: confucius

general.quote: Tell me and I forget. Teach me and I remember. Involve me and I learn.
general.author: benjamin franklin

general.quote: Teaching is not a lost art, but the regard for it is a lost tradition.
general.author: jacques barzun

general.quote: Teaching may be compared to selling commodities. No one can sell unless somebody buys.
general.author: john dewey

general.quote: A good teacher is a master of simplification and an enemy of simplism.
general.author: louis a. berman

general.quote: A schoolteacher or professor cannot educate individuals, he educates only species.
general.author: georg c. lichtenberg

general.quote: Creative activity could be described as a type of learning process where teacher and pupil are located in the same individual.
general.author: arthur koestler

general.quote: Good teachers are costly, but bad teachers cost more.
general.author: bob talbert

general.quote: Love is a better teacher than duty.
general.author: albert einstein

general.quote: I am not a teacher, but an awakener
general.author: robert frost

general.quote: Time is a great teacher, but unfortunately it kills all its pupils.
general.author: hector louis berlioz

general.quote: Teachers have three loves: love of learning, love of learners, and the love of bringing the first two loves together.
general.author: scott hayden

general.quote: Don’t try to fix the students, fix ourselves first. the good teacher makes the poor student good and the good student superior. when our students fail, we, as teachers, too, have failed.
general.author: marva collins

general.quote: Experience is a good teacher, but she sends in terrific bills.
general.author: minna antrim

general.quote: Teachers are expected to reach unattainable goals with inadequate tools. The miracle is that at times they accomplish this impossible task.
general.author: haim g. ginott

general.quote: Kids don’t remember what you try to teach them. They remember what you are.
general.author: jim henson

general.quote: True teaching liberates the student from his teacher.
general.author: ernest holmes

general.quote: A master can tell you what he expects of you. A teacher, though, awakens your own expectations.
general.author: patricia neal

general.quote: If you think in terms of a year, plant a seed; if in terms of ten years, plant trees; if in terms of 100 years, teach the people.
general.author: confucius

general.quote: I am indebted to my father for living, but to my teacher for living well.
general.author: alexander the great

general.quote: Everyone and everything around you is your teacher.
general.author: ken keyes jr.

general.quote: Who dares to teach must never cease to learn.
general.author: john cotton dana

general.quote: I cannot teach anybody anything, I can only make them think.
general.author: socrates

general.quote: Treat people as if they were what they ought to be and you help them become what they are capable of becoming.
general.author: johann wolfgang von goethe

general.quote: The true aim of everyone who aspires to be a teacher should be, not to impart his own opinions, but to kindle minds.
general.author: frederick w. robertson

general.quote: A teacher who is not dogmatic is simply a teacher who is not teaching.
general.author: gilbert k. chesterton

general.quote: Woe to him who teaches men faster than they can learn.
general.author: william j. durant

general.quote: if you have forgotten how to be a child you cannot teach children.
general.author: austin o’malley

general.quote: To be good is noble, but to teach others how to be good is nobler and less trouble.
general.author: mark twain

general.quote: Fear is not a lasting teacher of duty.
general.author: marcus t. cicero

general.quote: Once more I would adopt the graver style — a teacher should be sparing of his smile.
general.author: william cowper

general.quote: When teaching, light a fire, don’t fill a bucket.
general.author: dan snow

general.quote: If the past cannot teach the present and the father cannot teach the son, then history need not have bothered to go on, and the world has wasted a great deal of time.
general.author: russell hoban

general.quote: The good teacher makes the poor student good and the good student superior. When our students fail, we, as teachers, too, have failed.
general.author: marva collins

general.quote: A teacher should have maximal authority, and minimal power.
general.author: thomas szasz

general.quote: Good teaching is one-fourth preparation and three-fourths theater.
general.author: gail godwin

general.quote: Teaching is of more importance than urging.
general.author: martin luther

general.quote: In teaching you cannot see the fruit of a day’s work. It is invisible and remains so, maybe for twenty years.
general.author: jacques barzun

general.quote: If we teach today’s students as we taught yesterday’s, we rob them of tomorrow.
general.author: john dewey

general.quote: The teacher is like the candle which lights others in consuming itself.
general.author: giovanni ruffini

general.quote: Teachers who educate children deserve more honor than parents who merely gave birth; for bare life is furnished by the one, the other ensures a good life.
general.author: aristotle

general.quote: Acquire new knowledge whilst thinking over the old, and you may become a teacher of others.
general.author: confucius

general.quote: In a completely rational society, the best of us would be teachers and the rest of us would have to settle for something else.
general.author: lee iacocca

general.quote: Your enemy can be your greatest teacher.
general.author: buddha

general.quote: We never completely escape the teachers of our childhood nor any of the patterns that formed us.
general.author: frank herbert

general.quote: A teacher who is attempting to teach without inspiring the pupil with a desire to learn is hammering on a cold iron.
general.author: horace mann

general.quote: When you study great teachers… you will learn much more from their caring and hard work than from their style.
general.author: william glasser

general.quote: The evil of people can come from their like of being teachers of others.
general.author: mencius mengzi meng-tse

general.quote: Pain makes man think. Thought makes man wise. Wisdom makes life endurable.
general.author: john patrick

general.quote: Wisdom always makes men fortunate: for by wisdom no man could ever err, and therefore he must act rightly and succeed, or his wisdom would be wisdom no longer.
general.author: plato

general.quote: Wisdom no more consists in science than happiness in wealth.
general.author: marquis stanislas jean de boufflers

general.quote: Knowledge speaks, but wisdom listens.
general.author: jimi hendrix

general.quote: Wisdom consists in being able to distinguish among dangers and make a choice of the least harmful.
general.author: niccolo machiavelli

general.quote: Knowledge is a process of piling up facts; wisdom lies in their simplification.
general.author: martin h. fischer

general.quote: A man remains ignorant because he loves ignorance, and chooses ignorant thoughts; a man becomes wise because he loves wisdom and chooses wise thoughts.
general.author: james allen

general.quote: Wisdom is often counted folly by the unwise.
general.author: edward counsel

general.quote: Wisdom begins at the end.
general.author: daniel webster

general.quote: Never, no, never did Nature say one thing and Wisdom say another.
general.author: edmund burke

general.quote: Wisdom is understanding when to ask questions.
general.author: brian herbert & kevin j. anderson

general.quote: Memory is the mother of all wisdom.
general.author: aeschylus

general.quote: There is a wisdom of the head, and … there is a wisdom of the heart.
general.author: charles dickens

general.quote: Learned men fall into error oftenest by mistaking knowledge for wisdom.
general.author: austin o’malley

general.quote: There is no wisdom, save in truth. Truth is everlasting, but our ideas about truth are changeable. Only a little of the first fruits of wisdom, only a few fragments of the boundless heights, breadths and depths of truth, have I been able to gather.
general.author: martin luther quotes

general.quote: Wisdom is a safe ship; and we may trust ourselves to it in all weathers.
general.author: edward counsel

general.quote: Wisdom is wisdom, wherever found.
general.author: g. david nordley

general.quote: He dares to be a fool, and that is the first step in the direction of wisdom.
general.author: james gibbons huneker

general.quote: The wisdom of the wise and the experience of the ages may be preserved by quotation.
general.author: isaac d’israeli,

general.quote: Knowledge is flour, but wisdom is bread.
general.author: austin o’malley

general.quote: Wisdom’s door is ever open.
general.author: edward counsel

general.quote: Travel makes a wise man better, and a fool worse.
general.author: thomas fuller

general.quote: Wisdom grows in quiet places.
general.author: austin o’malley

general.quote: Wisdom comes to us when it can no longer do any good.
general.author: gabriel garcia marquez

general.quote: Like water in the desert is wisdom to the soul.
general.author: edward counsel

general.quote: All wisdom ends in paradox.
general.author: jeffrey eugenides

general.quote: Wisdom is mostly the fruit of experience.
general.author: edward counsel

general.quote: When wisdom leaves the house folly enters it.
general.author: edward counsel

general.quote: This type of man who is devoted to the study of wisdom is always most unlucky in everything, and particularly when it comes to procreating children; I imagine this is because Nature wants to ensure that the evils of wisdom shall not spread further throughout mankind.
general.author: desiderius erasmus

general.quote: Mixing one’s wines may be a mistake, but old and new wisdom mix admirably.
general.author: bertolt brecht

general.quote: Wisdom is never on the menu, you have to own the restaurant.
general.author: carrie latet

general.quote: Learning sleeps and snores in libraries, but wisdom is everywhere, wide awake, on tiptoe.
general.author: josh billings

general.quote: Wisdom too often never comes, and so one ought not to reject it merely because it comes late.
general.author: felix frankfurter

general.quote: Never does nature say one thing and wisdom another.
general.author: juvenal, satires

general.quote: Wisdom sails with wind and time.
general.author: john florio

general.quote: The wise man knows nothing if he cannot benefit from his wisdom. Wisdom is not only to be acquired, but also to be utilized.
general.author: marcus t. cicero

general.quote: Wisdom hath her excesses, and no less need of moderation than folly.
general.author: michel eyquem de montaigne

general.quote: No man has all the wisdom in the world; everyone has some.
general.author: edgar watson howe

general.quote: Common-sense in an uncommon degree is what the world calls wisdom.
general.author: samuel taylor coleridge

general.quote: Cunning is seeing a hundred yards ahead–wisdom, fifty miles in advance.
general.author: charles william day

general.quote: Justice without wisdom is impossible.
general.author: james anthony froude

general.quote: It’s a beautiful thing, the blossoming of Wisdom. Like a flower in spring.
general.author: michael rudd

general.quote: The doors of wisdom are never shut.
general.author: benjamin franklin quotes

general.quote: We judge of man’s wisdom by his hope.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson

general.quote: Wisdom comes only through suffering.
general.author: aeschylus

general.quote: Does wisdom perhaps appear on the earth as a raven which is inspired by the smell of carrion?
general.author: friedrich nietzsche

general.quote: Patience is the companion of wisdom.
general.author: st. augustine

general.quote: Everyone whose deeds are more than his wisdom, his wisdom endures; and everyone whose wisdom is more than his deeds, his wisdom does not endure.
general.author: the talmud

general.quote: To finish the moment, to find the journey’s end in every step of the road, to live the greatest number of good hours, is wisdom.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson quotes

general.quote: Wisdom consists of the anticipation of consequences.
general.author: norman cousins

general.quote: Wisdom lies neither in fixity nor in change, but in the dialectic between the two.
general.author: octavio paz

general.quote: The wealth of mankind is the wisdom they leave.
general.author: john boyle o’reilly

general.quote: Wisdom is the only thing which can relieve us from the sway of the passions and the fear of danger, and which can teach us to bear the injuries of fortune itself with moderation, and which shows us all the ways which lead to tranquillity and peace.
general.author: marcus tullius cicero

general.quote: There is this difference between happiness and wisdom: he that thinks himself the happiest man is really so; but he that thinks himself the wisest is generally the greatest fool.
general.author: francis bacon

general.quote: A simple realization that there are other points of view is the beginning of wisdom.
general.author: grenville kleiser

general.quote: There are many gates to the house of wisdom.
general.author: edward counsel

general.quote: Wisdom is the daughter of experience.
general.author: leonardo da vinci quotes

general.quote: It requires wisdom to understand wisdom: The music is nothing if the audience is deaf.
general.author: walter lippmann

general.quote: Wisdom is only found in truth.
general.author: johann wolfgang von goethe quotes

general.quote: A man begins cutting his wisdom teeth the first time he bites off more than he can chew.
general.author: herb caen

general.quote: Wisdom consists not no much in seeing as in foreseeing.
general.author: hosea ballou

general.quote: Was not this … what we spoke of as the great advantage of wisdom — to know what is known and what is unknown to us?
general.author: plato

general.quote: The next thing to having wisdom ourselves, is to profit by that of others.
general.author: charles caleb colton

general.quote: Wisdom is the reward you get for a lifetime of listening when you’d have preferred to talk.
general.author: doug larson

general.quote: Each of us knows all. We need only open our minds to hear our own wisdom.
general.author: dan brown

general.quote: Knowledge comes, but wisdom lingers.
general.author: alfred lord tennyson

general.quote: Wisdom is a treasure, the key whereof is never lost.
general.author: edward counsel

general.quote: The beginning of wisdom is the knowledge of folly.
general.author: norman macdonald

general.quote: Wisdom outweighs any wealth.
general.author: sophocles

general.quote: The wise man questions the wisdom of others because he questions his own, the foolish man, because it is different from his own.
general.author: leo stein

general.quote: When people agree with me I always feel that I must be wrong.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: Nobody agrees with anybody else anyhow, but adults conceal it and infants show it.
general.author: ogden nash

general.quote: Minds do not act together in public; they simply stick together; and when their private activities are resumed, they fly apart again.
general.author: frank moore colby

general.quote: A verbal contract isn’t worth the paper it’s written on.
general.author: samuel goldwyn

general.quote: The fellow that agrees with everything you say is either a fool or he is getting ready to skin you.
general.author: kin hubbard

general.quote: An agreement between two men to do what both agree is wrong.
general.author: lord edward cecil,

general.quote: There is nothing more likely to start disagreement among people or countries than an agreement.
general.author: elwyn brooks white

general.quote: What we call reality is an agreement that people have arrived at to make life more livable.
general.author: louise nevelson

general.quote: We seldom find any person of good sense, except those who share our opinions.
general.author: francois de la rochefoucauld

general.quote: Men keep agreements when it is to the advantage of neither to break them.
general.author: solon

general.quote: If you wish to appear agreeable in society, you must consent to be taught many things which you know already.
general.author: johann kaspar lavater

general.quote: Three may keep counsel, if two are away.
general.author: john heywood

general.quote: One can be very happy without demanding that others agree with them.
general.author: johann wolfgang von goethe

general.quote: If two men agree on everything, you may be sure that one of them is doing the thinking.
general.author: lyndon baines johnson

general.quote: My idea of an agreeable person is a person who agrees with me.
general.author: benjamin disraeli

general.quote: There’s nothing is this world more instinctively abhorrent to me than finding myself in agreement with my fellow humans.
general.author: malcolm muggeridge

general.quote: Even savage animals can agree among themselves.
general.author: juvenal

general.quote: Too much agreement kills the chat.
general.author: eldridge cleaver

general.quote: The reason why so few people are agreeable in conversation is that each is thinking more about what he intends to say than others are saying.
general.author: francois de la rochefoucauld

general.quote: You can always tell when a man’s well informed. His views are pretty much like your own.
general.author: louie morris

general.quote: Man, an animal that makes bargains.
general.author: adam smith

general.quote: A consensus means that everyone agrees to say collectively what no one believes individually.
general.author: abba eban

general.quote: He that complies against his will is of his own opinion still.
general.author: samuel butler

general.quote: My opinion, my conviction, gains immensely in strength and sureness the minute a second mind as adopted it.
general.author: novalis

general.quote: One good analogy is worth three hours discussion.
general.author: james t. mccay

general.quote: Make fair agreements and stick to them.
general.author: confucius

general.quote: What usually comes first is the contract.
general.author: ira gershwin

general.quote: I have never in my life learned anything from any man who agreed with me.
general.author: dudley field malone

general.quote: An alliance with a powerful person is never safe.
general.author: phaedrus

general.quote: Those who agree with us may not be right, but we admire their astuteness.
general.author: cullen hightower

general.quote: You can get assent to almost any proposition so long as you are not going to do anything about it.
general.author: john jay chapman

general.quote: I seem to smell the stench of appeasement in the air.
general.author: margaret thatcher

general.quote: Perhaps the most delightful friendships are those in which there is much agreement, much disputation, and yet more personal liking.
general.author: george eliot quotes

general.quote: The rule of my life is to make business a pleasure, and pleasure my business.
general.author: aaron burr

general.quote: Let’s be honest. There’s not a business anywhere that is without problems. Business is complicated and imperfect. Every business everywhere is staffed with imperfect human beings and exists by providing a product or service to other imperfect human beings.
general.author: bob parsons

general.quote: You are not in business to be popular.
general.author: kristie alley

general.quote: If you can run one business well, you can run any business well.
general.author: richard branson

general.quote: Being good in business is the most fascinating kind of art. Making money is art and working is art and good business is the best art.
general.author: andy warhol

general.quote: What helps people, helps business.
general.author: leo burnett

general.quote: Fidelity is seven-tenths of business success.
general.author: james parton

general.quote: You have to have your heart in the business and the business in your heart.
general.author: thomas j. watson

general.quote: Business has only two functions, marketing and innovation.
general.author: peter f. drucker

general.quote: Business is more exciting than any game.
general.author: lord beaverbrook

general.quote: Profit in business comes from repeat customers, customers that boast about your project or service, and that bring friends with them.
general.author: w. edwards deming

general.quote: The success combination in business is: Do what you do better… and: do more of what you do…
general.author: david joseph schwartz

general.quote: A business exists to create a customer.
general.author: peter f. drucker

general.quote: Leisure for people of business, and business for people of leisure would cure many problems.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: When you’re out of quality you’re out of business.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: In business, three things are necessary: knowledge, temper, and time.
general.author: owen felltham

general.quote: To succeed in business it is necessary to make others see things as you see them.
general.author: john h. patterson

general.quote: A business that makes nothing but money is a poor kind of business.
general.author: henry ford

general.quote: Business is like a wheelbarrow — it stands still until someone pushes it.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: What you think of me is none of my business.
general.author: terry cole-whittaker

general.quote: My own business always bores me to death; I prefer other people’s
general.author: oscar wilde

general.quote: Business, that’s easily defined; it’s other people’s money.
general.author: alexandre dumas

general.quote: If you don’t drive your business you will be driven out of business.
