general.quote: Perfect freedom is reserved for the man who lives by his own work and in that work does what he wants to do.
general.author: robin g. collingwood

general.quote: If people have to choose between freedom and sandwiches, they will take sandwiches.
general.author: lord boyd orr

general.quote: If we wish to free ourselves from enslavement, we must choose freedom and the responsibility this entails.
general.author: leo buscaglia

general.quote: We who officially value freedom of speech above life itself seem to have nothing to talk about but the weather.
general.author: barbara ehrenreich

general.quote: Freedom is the emancipation from the arbitrary rule of other men.
general.author: mortimer j. adler

general.quote: All we have of freedom — all we use or know — this our fathers bought for us, long and long ago.
general.author: rudyard kipling

general.quote: Work means so many things! So many! Among other things, work also means freedom…. Without it even the miracle of love is only a cruel deception.
general.author: eleanora duse

general.quote: None who have always been free can understand the terrible fascinating power of the hope of freedom to those who are not free.
general.author: pearl s. buck

general.quote: Freedom exists only with power.
general.author: johann friedrich von schiller

general.quote: Freedom means you are unobstructed in living your life as you choose. Anything less is a form of slavery.
general.author: wayne dyer

general.quote: Any nation that thinks more of its ease and comfort than its freedom will soon lose its freedom.
general.author: w. somerset maugham

general.quote: Every general increase of freedom is accompanied by some degeneracy, attributable to the same causes as the freedom.
general.author: charles horton cooley

general.quote: Freedom means choosing your burden.
general.author: hephzibah menuhin

general.quote: Freedom is man’s capacity to take a hand in his own development. It is our capacity to mold ourselves.
general.author: rollo may

general.quote: A nation which makes the final sacrifice for life and freedom does not get beaten.
general.author: kemal ataturk

general.quote: Just as war is freedom’s cost, disagreement is freedom’s privilege.
general.author: bill clinton quotes

general.quote: Freedom is the freedom to say that two plus two make four. If that is granted, all else follows.
general.author: george orwell

general.quote: Yet, Freedom! Yet thy banner, torn, but flying, streams like the thunderstorm against the wind.
general.author: lord byron

general.quote: Until economic freedom is attained for everybody, there can be no real freedom for anybody.
general.author: suzanne la follette

general.quote: Freedom is a gift from heaven, and every individual of the same species has the right to enjoy it as soon as he is in enjoyment of his reason.
general.author: denis diderot

general.quote: Freedom suppressed and again regained bites with keener fangs than freedom never endangered.
general.author: marcus t. cicero

general.quote: To buy happiness is to sell soul.
general.author: doug horton

general.quote: Happiness held is the seed; happiness shared is the flower.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: Happiness is in the heart, not in the circumstances.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: Many people are extremely happy, but are absolutely worthless to society.
general.author: charles gow

general.quote: The good life, as I conceive it, is a happy life. I do not mean that if you are good you will be happy; I mean that if you are happy you will be good.
general.author: bertrand russell

general.quote: Happiness is like a butterfly which, when pursued, is always beyond our grasp, but, if you will sit down quietly, may alight upon you.
general.author: nathaniel hawthorne

general.quote: We are more interested in making others believe we are happy than in trying to be happy ourselves.
general.author: francois de la rochefoucauld

general.quote: Happiness comes from… some curious adjustment to life.
general.author: sir hugh walpole

general.quote: Happiness is excitement that has found a settling down place. But there is always a little corner that keeps flapping around.
general.author: e.l. konigsburg

general.quote: We are seldom happy with what we now have, but would go to pieces if we lost any part of it.
general.author: mignon mclaughlin

general.quote: Having more money does not insure happiness. People with ten million dollars are no happier than people with nine million dollars.
general.author: hobart brown

general.quote: Give a man health and a course to steer, and he’ll never stop to trouble about whether he’s happy or not.
general.author: george bernard shaw

general.quote: Even if happiness forgets you a little bit, never completely forget about it.
general.author: jacques prévert

general.quote: The fact is always obvious much too late, but the most singular difference between happiness and joy is that happiness is a solid and joy a liquid.
general.author: j.d. salinger

general.quote: There is no way to happiness – happiness is the way.
general.author: thich nhat hanh

general.quote: The foolish man seeks happiness in the distance; the wise grows it under his feet.
general.author: james openheim

general.quote: Happiness is a by-product of an effort to make someone else happy.
general.author: gretta brooker palmer

general.quote: Those who can laugh without cause have either found the true meaning of happiness or have gone stark raving mad.
general.author: norm papernick

general.quote: All happiness is in the mind.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: You cannot always have happiness, but you can always give happiness.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: Happiness is the interval between periods of unhappiness.
general.author: don marquis

general.quote: The only way to find true happiness is to risk being completely cut open.
general.author: chuck palahniuk

general.quote: Happiness always looks small while you hold it in your hands, but let it go, and you learn at once how big and precious it is.
general.author: maxim gorky

general.quote: The secret of happiness is to find a congenial monotony.
general.author: v.s. pritchett

general.quote: Buried deep in the maze of commonplace, the pearl of true happiness lies. And he, who rejoices in little things, finds the pathway that leads to the prize.
general.author: lucy m. thompson

general.quote: We act as though comfort and luxury were the chief requirements in life, when all we need to make us really happy is something to be enthusiastic about.
general.author: charles kingsley

general.quote: Happiness is the natural flower of duty.
general.author: phillips brooks

general.quote: True happiness is the full use of your powers along lines of excellence in a life affording scope.
general.author: john f. kennedy

general.quote: We have no more right to consume happiness without producing it than to consume wealth without producing it.
general.author: george bernard shaw

general.quote: We are no longer happy so soon as we wish to be happier.
general.author: walter savage landor

general.quote: Happiness will never come to those who fail to appreciate what they already have.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: True happiness comes from doing what’s right, not just doing what makes you feel good.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: Plenty of people miss their share of happiness, not because they never found it, but because they didn’t stop to enjoy it
general.author: william feather

general.quote: Happiness is not a goal; it is a by-product.
general.author: eleanor roosevelt

general.quote: Happiness is an inside job.
general.author: william arthur ward

general.quote: Money doesn’t always bring happiness. A man with ten million dollars is no happier than a man with nine million dollars.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: It is true that money cannot buy happiness but it does make it possible for you to enjoy the best that the world has to offer.
general.author: george s. clason

general.quote: It is difficult for any of us to go through life without either increasing or diminishing somebody’s happiness.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: To be of use in the world is the only way to happiness.
general.author: hans christian andersen

general.quote: She thinks that happiness is a mat that sits on her doorway.
general.author: rob thomas

general.quote: If happiness could be bought, few of us could pay the price.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: Considering the way the world is, one happy day is almost a miracle.
general.author: paulo coelho

general.quote: There is no cosmetic for beauty like happiness.
general.author: lady blessington

general.quote: You can’t pursue happiness and catch it. Happiness comes upon you unaware while you are helping others.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: We tend to forget that happiness doesn’t come as a result of getting something we don’t have, but rather of recognizing and appreciating what we do have.
general.author: frederick keonig

general.quote: Happiness consists more in conveniences of pleasure that occur everyday than in great pieces of good fortune that happen but seldom.
general.author: benjamin franklin

general.quote: Happiness is good for the body but sorrow strengthens the spirit.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: We must laugh before we are happy, for fear of dying without having laughed at all.
general.author: jean de la bruyere

general.quote: [U]sefulness is happiness, and… all other things are but incidental.
general.author: lydia maria child

general.quote: True happiness arises, in the first place, from the enjoyment of one’s self, and in the next, from the friendship and conversation of a few select companions.
general.author: joseph addison

general.quote: Man’s only true happiness is to live in hope of something to be won by him. Reverence something to be worshipped by him, and love something to be cherished by him, forever.
general.author: john ruskin

general.quote: A great obstacle to happiness is to expect too much happiness.
general.author: bernard de fontenelle

general.quote: Gather the crumbs of happiness and they will make you a loaf of contentment.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: Some pursue happiness, others create it.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: Most of us believe in trying to make other people happy only if they can be happy in ways which we approve.
general.author: robert s. lynd

general.quote: Happiness is the absence of the striving for happiness.
general.author: chuang tzu

general.quote: Happiness is a way station between too little and too much.
general.author: channing pollock

general.quote: Man is meant for happiness and this happiness is in him, in the satisfaction of the daily needs of his existence.
general.author: count leo tolstoy

general.quote: There can be no happiness if the things we believe in are different from the things we do.
general.author: freya stark

general.quote: Happiness is not an ideal of reason, but of imagination.
general.author: immanuel kant

general.quote: Some cause happiness wherever they go; others whenever they go.
general.author: oscar wilde

general.quote: True happiness comes from the knowledge that we are of some use in this world.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: To be obliged to beg our daily happiness from others bespeaks a more lamentable poverty than that of him who begs his daily bread.
general.author: charles caleb colton

general.quote: The happiness which is lacking makes one think even the happiness one has unbearable.
general.author: joseph roux

general.quote: If there were in the world today any large number of people who desired their own happiness more than they desired the unhappiness of others, we could have a paradise in a few years.
general.author: bertrand russell

general.quote: Man must search for what is right, and let happiness come on its own.
general.author: johann pestalozzi

general.quote: We must learn that to enjoy happiness we must conscientiously and continuously seek to spread happiness. Selfishness is suicidal to happiness.
general.author: b.c. forbes

general.quote: People don’t notice whether it’s winter or summer when they’re happy.
general.author: anton chekhov

general.quote: Money may not buy happiness, but it can damn well give it!
general.author: freddie mercury

general.quote: Realize that true happiness lies within you. Waste no time and effort searching for peace and contentment and joy in the world outside.
general.author: og mandino

general.quote: Happiness is a conscious choice, not an automatic response.
general.author: mildred barthel

general.quote: So long as we can lose any happiness, we possess some.
general.author: booth tarkington

general.quote: Happiness is perfume; you can’t pour it on somebody else without getting a few drops on yourself.
general.author: james van der zee

general.quote: People take different roads seeking fulfillment and happiness. Just because they’re not on your road doesn’t mean they’ve gotten lost.
general.author: h. jackson brown

general.quote: A truly happy person is one who can enjoy the scenery while on a detour.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: If you’re ever given the choice between happiness and intelligence choose happiness.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: Money can’t buy happiness, but it can buy you the kind of misery you prefer.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: Happiness does not lie in happiness, but in the achievement of it.
general.author: fyodor dostoevsky

general.quote: The most exciting happiness is the happiness generated by forces beyond your control.
general.author: ogden nash

general.quote: If you ever find happiness by hunting for it, you will find it, as the old woman did her lost spectacles, safe on her own nose all the time.
general.author: josh billings

general.quote: Happiness is… usually attributed by adults to children, and by children to adults.
general.author: thomas szasz

general.quote: When we are happy we are always good, but when we are good we are not always happy.
general.author: oscar wilde

general.quote: Happiness: an agreeable sensation arising from contemplating the misery of another.
general.author: ambrose bierce

general.quote: The world is full of people looking for spectacular happiness while they snub contentment.
general.author: doug larson

general.quote: Life is too short and too long to spend it doing anything that doesn’t make you happy
general.author: jill conner brown

general.quote: Many people have the wrong idea of what constitutes true happiness. It is not attained through self-gratification, but through fidelity to a worthy purpose.
general.author: helen keller

general.quote: Most folks are about as happy as they make up their minds to be.
general.author: abraham lincoln

general.quote: Most true happiness comes from one’s inner life, from the disposition of the mind and soul.
general.author: william l. shirer

general.quote: But what is happiness except the simple harmony between a man and the life he leads?
general.author: albert camus

general.quote: The key to happiness is having dreams. The key to success is making your dreams come true.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: It’s pretty hard to tell what does bring happiness. Poverty and wealth have both failed.
general.author: frank mckinney “kin” hubbard

general.quote: Real happiness is cheap enough, yet how dearly we pay for its counterfeit.
general.author: hosea ballou

general.quote: Happiness and sadness run parallel to each other. When one takes a rest, the other one tends to take up the slack.
general.author: hazelmarie elliott

general.quote: Happiness makes up in height for what it lacks in length.
general.author: robert frost

general.quote: The pursuit of happiness is a most ridiculous phrase: if you pursue happiness you’ll never find it.
general.author: c.p. snow

general.quote: True happiness involves the full use of one’s power and talents.
general.author: john w. gardner

general.quote: True happiness, if understood, consists alone in doing good.
general.author: william somerville

general.quote: It’s never too late to have a happy childhood.
general.author: berke breathed

general.quote: If you cannot renounce the world the genius of happiness will never salute you.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: Happiness is like the penny candy of our youth: we got a lot more for our money back when we had no money.
general.author: mignon mclaughlin

general.quote: Depend not on another, but lean instead on thyself. True happiness is born of self-reliance.
general.author: the laws of manu

general.quote: Happiness is your dentist telling you it won’t hurt and then having him catch his hand in the drill.
general.author: johnny carson

general.quote: Whoever said money can’t buy happiness didn’t know where to shop.
general.author: gittel hudnick

general.quote: Before we set our hearts too much on anything, let us examine how happy are those who already possess it.
general.author: françois duc de la rochefoucauld

general.quote: Is it not clear, however, that bliss and envy are the numerator and denominator of the fraction called happiness?
general.author: yevgeny zamyatin

general.quote: Money won’t buy happiness, but it will pay the salaries of a huge research staff to study the problem.
general.author: bill vaughan

general.quote: As people spin faster and faster in the pursuit of merely personal happiness, they become exhausted in the futile effort of chasing themselves.
general.author: andrew delbanco

general.quote: Happiness is a direction, not a place.
general.author: sydney j. harris

general.quote: There are men who are happy without knowing it.
general.author: marquis de vauvenargues

general.quote: Most people ask for happiness on condition. Happiness can only be felt if you don’t set any condition.
general.author: arthur rubinstein

general.quote: Happiness is the cheapest thing in the world when we buy it for someone else.
general.author: paul flemming

general.quote: For every minute you are angry, you lose sixty seconds of happiness.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: Happiness is the sense that one matters. Happiness is an abiding enthusiasm. Happiness is single-mindedness. Happiness is whole-heartedness. Happiness is a by-product. Happiness is faith.
general.author: samuel m. shoemaker

general.quote: True happiness… is not attained through self-gratification, but through fidelity to a worthy purpose.
general.author: helen keller

general.quote: Happiness? That’s nothing more than health and a poor memory.
general.author: albert schweitzer

general.quote: There is an old saying that money can’t buy happiness. If it could, I would buy myself four hits every game.
general.author: pete rose

general.quote: Happiness is like a kiss in order to get any good out of it you have to give it to somebody else.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: When a man has lost all happiness, he’s not alive. Call him a breathing corpse.
general.author: sophocles

general.quote: The secret of happiness is curiosity
general.author: norman douglas

general.quote: Happiness is when what you think, what you say, and what you do are in harmony.
general.author: mahatma gandhi

general.quote: All happiness depends on courage and work.
general.author: honore de balza

general.quote: The only true happiness is to learn, to advance, and to improve: which could not happen unless we had commenced with error, ignorance, and imperfection.
general.author: albert pike

general.quote: If money is all that a man makes, then he will be poor. Poor in happiness and poor in all that makes life worth living.
general.author: herbert n. casson

general.quote: True happiness, we are told, consists in getting out of one’s self, but the point is not only to get out; you must stay out, and to stay out, you must have some absorbing errand.
general.author: henry james

general.quote: Money can’t buy happiness; it can, however, rent it.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: Happiness is a matter of one’s most ordinary and everyday mode of consciousness being busy and lively and unconcerned with self.
general.author: iris murdoch

general.quote: The only true happiness comes from squandering ourselves for a purpose.
general.author: john mason brown

general.quote: The Constitution only guarantees the American people the right to pursue happiness. You have to catch it yourself.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: There is no greater happiness than that which comes from sharing, no greater joy than that which comes from loving, giving, and caring.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: Many things can make you miserable for weeks; few can bring you a whole day of happiness.
general.author: mignon mclaughlin

general.quote: What’s the use of happiness? It can’t buy you money.
general.author: henny youngman

general.quote: Money itself won’t bring happiness, but it sure makes paying the bills easier.
general.author: thomas j. vilord

general.quote: The happiness of most people is not ruined by great catastrophes or fatal errors, but by the repetition of slowly destructive little things.
general.author: ernest dimnet

general.quote: Happiness often sneaks in through a door you didn’t know you left open.
general.author: john barrymore

general.quote: Happiness grows at our own firesides, and is not to be picked in strangers’ gardens.
general.author: douglas jerrold

general.quote: Happiness is the resultant of the relative strengths of positive and negative feelings rather than an absolute amount of one or the other.
general.author: norman bradburn

general.quote: I have only two kinds of days: happy and hysterically happy.
general.author: allen j. lefferdink

general.quote: Let us be grateful to people who make us happy, they are the charming gardeners who make our souls blossom.
general.author: marcel proust

general.quote: Happiness is not a brilliant climax to years of grim struggle and anxiety. It is a long succession of little decisions simply to be happy in the moment.
general.author: donald j. walters

general.quote: Happiness consists of living each day as if it were the first day of your honeymoon and the last day of your vacation.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: Happiness is the feeling you’re feeling when you want to keep feeling it.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: To be without some of the things you want is an indispensable part of happiness.
general.author: bertrand russell

general.quote: The thing that counts most in the pursuit of happiness is choosing the right companion.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: The only true happiness is that which we give others.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: The greatest happiness you can have is knowing that you do not necessarily require happiness.
general.author: william saroyan

general.quote: Remember that very little is needed to make a happy life.
general.author: marcus aurelius

general.quote: Happiness is a positive cash flow.
general.author: fred adler

general.quote: Money can’t buy happiness, but it can make you awfully comfortable while you’re being miserable.
general.author: clare boothe luce

general.quote: Happiness is never stopping to think if you are.
general.author: palmer sondreal

general.quote: Money can’t buy health, happiness, or what it did last year.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: Happiness is often the result of being too busy to be miserable.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: With some whose nerves have a deep covering of fat, happiness is less of a problem that it is an accident of anatomy.
general.author: attributed to henry s. haskins

general.quote: Money, or even power, can never yield happiness unless it be accompanied by the goodwill of others.
general.author: b.c. forbes

general.quote: Happiness is a form of courage.
general.author: holbrook jackson

general.quote: Money has never made man happy, nor will it, there is nothing in its nature to produce happiness. The more of it one has the more one wants.
general.author: benjamin franklin

general.quote: Happiness will never come if it’s a goal in itself; happiness is a by-product of a commitment of worthy causes.
general.author: norman vincent peale

general.quote: Happy is he that chastens himself.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: True happiness consists not in the multitude of friends, but in the worth and choice.
general.author: ben jonson

general.quote: Happiness is the act of being tough with ourselves and tender with others.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: The essence of philosophy is that a man should so live that his happiness shall depend as little as possible on external things.
general.author: epictetus

general.quote: Happiness cannot be traveled to, owned, earned, worn or consumed. Happiness is the spiritual experience of living every minute with love, grace and gratitude.
general.author: denis waitley

general.quote: Happiness is a function of accepting what is.
general.author: werner erhard

general.quote: Happiness is the ability to recognize it.
general.author: carolyn wells

general.quote: Happiness is activity.
general.author: aristotle

general.quote: Don’t waste time on jealousy. Sometimes you’re ahead, sometimes you’re behind.
general.author: mary schmich

general.quote: Never underestimate the power of jealousy and the power of envy to destroy. Never underestimate that.
general.author: oliver stone

general.quote: You can be the moon and still be jealous of the stars.
general.author: gary allan

general.quote: Jealousy is all the fun you think they had.
general.author: erica jong

general.quote: If one of two lovers is loyal, and the other jealous and false, how may their friendship last, for Love is slain!
general.author: marie de france

general.quote: Jealousy is the dragon in paradise; the hell of heaven; and the most bitter of the emotions because associated with the sweetest.
general.author: a.r. orage

general.quote: Envy and jealousy, twin sisters, come with the cunning of the fox to steal away our peace and happiness.
general.author: nicias ballard cooksey

general.quote: Jealousy is the jaundice of the soul.
general.author: john dryden

general.quote: It is not love that is blind, but jealousy.
general.author: lawrence durrell

general.quote: More men die of jealousy than of cancer.
general.author: joseph p. kennedy

general.quote: There is no greater glory than love, nor any great punishment than jealously.
general.author: lope de vega

general.quote: Jealousy lives upon doubts. It becomes madness or ceases entirely as soon as we pass from doubt to certainty.
general.author: francois de la rochefoucauld

general.quote: Pity is for the living, envy is for the dead.
general.author: mark twain quotes

general.quote: Envy is the most stupid of vices, for there is no single advantage to be gained from it.
general.author: honore de balzac

general.quote: Nothing is more capable of troubling our reason, and consuming our health, than secret notions of jealousy in solitude.
general.author: aphra behn

general.quote: Man is by nature competitive, combative, ambitious, jealous, envious, and vengeful.
general.author: arthur keith

general.quote: A show of envy is an insult to oneself.
general.author: yevgeny alexandrovich yevtushenko

general.quote: It is matrimonial suicide to be jealous when you have a really good reason.
general.author: clare boothe luce

general.quote: In jealousy there is more self-love than love.
general.author: françois, duc de la rochefoucauld

general.quote: It will be found an unjust and unwise jealousy to deprive a man of his natural liberty upon the supposition he may abuse it.
general.author: george washington quotes

general.quote: Jealousy, the jaundice of the soul.
general.author: john dryden

general.quote: Man is jealous because of his amour propre; woman is jealous because of her lack of it.
general.author: germaine greer

general.quote: As iron is eaten by rust, so are the envious consumed by envy.
general.author: antisthenes

general.quote: Jealousy is the fear of comparison.
general.author: max frisch

general.quote: The lovesick, the betrayed, and the jealous all smell alike.
general.author: sidonie gabrielle colette

general.quote: Jealousy is always born with love, but does not always die with it.
general.author: françois duc de la rochefoucauld

general.quote: He that is jealous is not in love.
general.author: saint augustine

general.quote: Never love unless you can. Bear with all the faults of man: Men will sometimes jealous be, though but little cause they see.
general.author: thomas campion

general.quote: Jealousy is no more than feeling alone against smiling enemies.
general.author: elizabeth bowen

general.quote: Jealousy is, I think, the worst of all faults because it makes a victim of both parties.
general.author: gene tierney

general.quote: Jealousy contains more of self-love than of love.
general.author: francois de la rochefoucauld

general.quote: Lovers may be and indeed generally are enemies, but they never can be friends, because there must always be a spice of jealousy and a something of Self in all their speculations.
general.author: george byron

general.quote: Envy is ignorance.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson quotes

general.quote: Jealousy is a kind of civil war in the soul, where judgment and imagination are at perpetual jars.
general.author: william penn

general.quote: Love is that condition in which the happiness of another person is essential to your own… Jealousy is a disease, love is a healthy condition. The immature mind often mistakes one for the other, or assumes that the greater the love, the greater the jealousy.
general.author: robert a. heinlein

general.quote: Jealousy in romance is like salt in food. A little can enhance the savor, but too much can spoil the pleasure and, under certain circumstances, can be life-threatening.
general.author: maya angelou

general.quote: The jealous are troublesome to others, but a torment to themselves.
general.author: william penn

general.quote: No true love there can be without Its dread penalty–jealousy.
general.author: lord edward robert

general.quote: Jealousy is not at all low, but it catches us humbled and bowed down, at first sight.
general.author: sidonie gabrielle colette

general.quote: Jealousy is a vice of weakness; it arises from a mind whose aspirations and desires are inferior to its accomplishments; it is the child of baulked vanity and failure of courage.
general.author: arthyr lynch

general.quote: Envy slays itself by its own arrows.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: Envy is the art of counting the other fellow’s blessings instead of your own.
general.author: harold coffin

general.quote: Love shouldn’t be about jealousy or anything like that. It should be about commitment and being able to trust that person. If you can’t have that from the get-go, there’s a problem.
general.author: aaron carter

general.quote: Jealousy is never satisfied with anything short of an omniscience that would detect the subtlest fold of the heart.
general.author: george eliot quotes

general.quote: Hunger, revenge, to sleep are petty foes, but only death the jealous eyes can close.
general.author: william wycherley

general.quote: Jealousy… is a mental cancer.
general.author: b.c. forbes quotes

general.quote: Jealousy is a dog’s bark which attracts thieves.
general.author: karl kraus

general.quote: The disease of jealously is so malignant that is converts all it takes into its own nourishment.
general.author: joseph addison quotes

general.quote: Jealousy seems the absolute reversal of love. It is the swinging from the sunny warmth of the Equator to the frigid cold of the North Pole.
general.author: elbert hubbard

general.quote: Anger and jealousy can no more bear to lose sight of their objects than love.
general.author: george eliot

general.quote: The jealous are possessed by a mad devil and a dull spirit at the same time.
general.author: johann kaspar lavater

general.quote: Jealousy is one of the wickedest of all the passions. It is that which has been the most fruitful mother of tragedies, murders, and wars.
general.author: arthur lynch

general.quote: The knives of jealousy are honed on details.
general.author: ruth rendell

general.quote: Those who believe in nothing are very, very jealous and angry at those who believe in something.
general.author: dennis prager

general.quote: My wife’s jealousy is getting ridiculous. The other day she looked at my calendar and wanted to know who May was.
general.author: rodney dangerfield

general.quote: Love looks through a telescope; envy, through a microscope.
general.author: josh billings

general.quote: Dogs are our link to paradise. They don’t know evil or jealousy or discontent.
general.author: milan kundera

general.quote: Jealousy seldom punishes with the severity it suffers.
general.author: norman macdonald

general.quote: Passion can quickly slip to jealousy, or even hatred.
general.author: arthur golden

general.quote: There is never jealousy where there is not strong regard.
general.author: washington irving

general.quote: Jealousy is the tribute mediocrity pays to genius.
general.author: fulton j. sheen

general.quote: Nothing is more noble, nothing more venerable, than loyalty.
general.author: cicero

general.quote: The game is my life. It demands loyalty and responsibility, and it gives me back Satisfaction and peace.
general.author: michael jordan

general.quote: You cannot buy loyalty; you cannot buy the devotion of hearts, minds, and souls. You have to earn these things.
general.author: clarence francis

general.quote: If you are not too long, I will wait here for you all my life.
general.author: oscar wilde

general.quote: The fan is the one who suffers. He cheers a guy to a .350 season then watches that player sign with another team. When you destroy fan loyalties, you destroy everything.
general.author: frank robinson

general.quote: Lack of loyalty is one of the major causes of failure in every walk of life.
general.author: napoleon hill

general.quote: The only true test of loyalty is fidelity in the face of ruin and despair.
general.author: eric felten

general.quote: You don’t earn loyalty in a day. You earn loyalty day-by-day.
general.author: jeffrey h. gitomer

general.quote: Unless you can find some sort of loyalty, you cannot find unity and peace in your active living.
general.author: josiah royce

general.quote: The only people I owe my loyalty to are those who never made me question theirs.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: A boy can learn a lot from a dog: obedience, loyalty, and the importance of turning around three times before lying down.
general.author: robert benchley

general.quote: A man’s country is not a certain area of land, of mountains, rivers, and woods, but it is a principle; and patriotism is loyalty to that principle.
general.author: george william curtis

general.quote: Not observation of a duty but liberty itself is the pledge that assures fidelity.
general.author: ellen key

general.quote: What they call their loyalty, and their fidelity, I call either the lethargy of custom or their lack of imagination.
general.author: oscar wilde

general.quote: We must do our business faithfully, without trouble or disquiet, recalling our mind to God mildly, and with tranquility, as often as we find it wandering from him.
general.author: brother lawrence

general.quote: We have to recognize that there cannot be relationships unless there is commitment, unless there is loyalty, unless there is love, patience, persistence.
general.author: cornel west

general.quote: Another of our highly prized virtues is fidelity. We are immensely pleased with ourselves when we are faithful.
general.author: ida r. wylie

general.quote: Fidelity purchased with money, money can destroy.
general.author: marcus annaeus seneca

general.quote: Total loyalty is possible only when fidelity is emptied of all concrete content, from which changes of mind might naturally arise.
general.author: hannah arendt

general.quote: The secret of a good life is to have the right loyalties and hold them in the right scale of values.
general.author: norman thomas

general.quote: Matrimonial devotion doesn’t seem to suit her notion.
general.author: w. s. gilbert

general.quote: When put to the test, an ounce of loyalty is worth a pound of cleverness.
general.author: elbert hubbard

general.quote: It is difficult to discriminate the voice of truth from amid the clamor raised by heated partisans.
general.author: johann friedrich von schiller

general.quote: Staying with someone that doesn’t appreciate you isn’t loyalty, it’s stupidity.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: Constancy is the complement of all other human virtues.
general.author: giuseppe mazzini

general.quote: I’ll take fifty percent efficiency to get one hundred percent loyalty.
general.author: samuel goldwyn

general.quote: Loyalty gives traitors opportunity.
general.author: seneca

general.quote: To be loyal to our country is the duty of every man; to be loyal to ourselves is the first trust of manhood; but the most essential of all loyalty is to be loyal to Him who created us.
general.author: e. p. day

general.quote: Loyalty is a fine quality, but in excess it fills political graveyards.
general.author: neil kinnock

general.quote: Most important in a friendship? Tolerance and loyalty.
general.author: joanne kathleen rowling

general.quote: An ideal wife is one who remains faithful to you but tries to be just as charming as if she weren’t.
general.author: sacha guitry

general.quote: Men are more often bribed by their loyalties and ambitions than by money.
general.author: robert h. jackson

general.quote: Loyalty binds me.
general.author: motto

general.quote: Loyalty is from above, betrayal is from below.
general.author: bob sorge

general.quote: The strength of a family, like the strength of an army, is in its loyalty to each other.
general.author: mario puzo

general.quote: You can’t buy loyalty, you can only invest in it.
general.author: ronny m. cole

general.quote: I always think loyalty’s such a tiresome virtue.
general.author: agatha christie

general.quote: You’ve got to give loyalty down, if you want loyalty up.
general.author: donald t. regan

general.quote: Birds of a feather flock together.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: Always laugh heartily at the jokes your boss tells, it maybe a loyalty test.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: Besides pride, loyalty, discipline, heart, and mind, confidence is the key to all the locks.
general.author: joe paterno

general.quote: Fidelity. A virtue peculiar to those who are about to be betrayed.
general.author: ambrose bierce

general.quote: Independence – is loyalty to one’s best self and principles, and this is often disloyalty to the general idols and fetishes.
general.author: mark twain

general.quote: Loyalty is something you give regardless of what you get back, and in giving loyalty, you’re getting more loyalty; and out of loyalty flow other great qualities.
general.author: charles jones

general.quote: An ounce of loyalty is worth a pound of cleverness.
general.author: elbert hubbard

general.quote: Success is the result of perfection, hard work, learning from failure, loyalty, and persistence.
general.author: colin powell

general.quote: Loyalty is a good for the loyal man; but it may be mischievous for those whom his cause assails.
general.author: josiah royce

general.quote: Nothing is more noble, nothing more venerable than fidelity. Faithfulness and truth are the most sacred excellences and endowments of the human mind.
general.author: marcus t. cicero

general.quote: Leadership is a two-way street, loyalty up and loyalty down.
general.author: grace murray hopper

general.quote: Loyalty to an unjust cause is a perversion of honor.
general.author: brian herbert

general.quote: Wherever there is a grain of loyalty there is a glimpse of freedom.
general.author: algernon charles swinburne

general.quote: Loyalty is still the same, whether it win or lose the game; true as a dial to the sun, although it be not shined upon.
general.author: samuel butler

general.quote: Men are only as loyal as their options.
general.author: bill maher

general.quote: It is better to be faithful than famous.
general.author: theodore roosevelt

general.quote: Where there is loyalty, weapons are of no use.
general.author: paulo coelho

general.quote: Loyalty to petrified opinion never broke a chain or freed a human soul.
general.author: mark twain

general.quote: The whole point of loyalty was not to change: stick with those who stuck with you.
general.author: larry mcmurtry

general.quote: Faithfulness and sincerity are the highest things.
general.author: confucius

general.quote: Loyalty means nothing unless it has at its heart the absolute principle of self-sacrifice.
general.author: woodrow wilson loyalty isn’t grey. it’s black and white. you’re either loyal completely, or not loyal at all. ~ sharnay

general.quote: Luck always seems to be against the man who depends on it.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: Today, well lived, will prepare me for both the pleasure and the pain of tomorrow.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: The wise don’t expect to find life worth living; they make it that way.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: Success is just a matter of luck, all you need to do is ask a failure.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: Luck is when opportunity knocks and you answer.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: Luck is good planning, carefully executed.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: Luck is a very good word if you put a P before it.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: Luck is a disease for which hard work is the only remedy.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: Luck has a peculiar habit of favoring those who don’t depend on it.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: Good luck is the twin brother of hard work.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: Good luck is often with the man who doesn’t include it in his plans.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: Good luck is a lazy man’s estimate of a worker’s success.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: Combine common sense and the Golden Rule, and you will have very little bad luck.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: The worst cynicism: a belief in luck.
general.author: joyce carol oates

general.quote: What is luck? It is not only chance, it is also creating the opportunity, recognizing it when it is there, and taking it when it comes.
general.author: natasha josefowitz

general.quote: A man forgets his good luck next day, but remembers his bad luck until next year.
general.author: edgar watson howe

general.quote: Luck is what a capricious man believes in.
general.author: benjamin disraeli

general.quote: I believe in luck. The harder I work the luckier I get.
general.author: sam shoen

general.quote: Luck is being in the right place at the right time, but location and timing are to some extent under our control.
general.author: natasha josefowitz

general.quote: I’m a great believer in luck and I find the harder I work, the more I have of it.
general.author: thomas jefferson

general.quote: Luck is not the hand of God…. Luck is the way the wind swirls and the dust settles eons after God has passed by.
general.author: kurt vonnegut

general.quote: Luck? I don’t know anything about luck. I’ve never banked on it, and I’m afraid of people who do. Luck to me is something else: hard work — and realizing what opportunity is and what isn’t.
general.author: lucille ball

general.quote: I find I’m luckier when I work harder.
general.author: dr. denton cooley

general.quote: Good and bad luck is but a synonym, in the great majority of instances, for good and bad judgment.
general.author: paul chatfield

general.quote: Luck. Take a second look at what appears to be someone’s "good luck." You’ll find not luck but preparation, planning, and success-producing thinking.
general.author: david j. schwartz

general.quote: I think the harder you work the more luck you have.
general.author: david thomas

general.quote: The lucky have whole days which still they choose; the unlucky have but hours, and those they lose.
general.author: john dryden

general.quote: I have been extraordinarily lucky. Anyone who pretends that some kind of luck isn’t involved in his success is deluding himself.
general.author: arthur hailey

general.quote: To believe in luck… is skepticism.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson

general.quote: Luck is what you have left over after you give 100 percent.
general.author: langston coleman

general.quote: You must always be open to your luck. You cannot force it, but you can recognize it.
general.author: henry moore

general.quote: People always call it luck when you’ve acted more sensibly than they have.
general.author: anne tyler

general.quote: You don’t just luck into things as much as you would like to think you do. You build step by step, whether it is friendships or opportunities.
general.author: barbara bush

general.quote: Luck is believing you’re lucky.
general.author: tennessee williams

general.quote: Today is a new day. You will get out of it just what you put into it.
general.author: mary pickford

general.quote: Luck is not chance, it is toil. Fortune is expensive smile is earned.
general.author: emily dickinson

general.quote: Luck always seems like it belongs to someone else.
general.author: david levien

general.quote: Luck has a way of evaporating when you lean on it.
general.author: brandon mull

general.quote: Motivation triggers luck.
general.author: mike wallace

general.quote: Luck is everything…. My good luck in life was to be a really frightened person. I’m fortunate to be a coward, to have a low threshold of fear, because a hero couldn’t make a good suspense film.
general.author: alfred hitchcock

general.quote: Luck, good or bad, is the invisible play of mind upon affairs, the effect of mental aptitudes and habits which are not in sight, but which work and bring forth their due issues.
general.author: james vila blake

general.quote: I’ve found that luck is quite predictable. If you want more luck, take more chances. Be more active. Show up more often.
general.author: brian tracy

general.quote: I would rather have a lucky general than a smart general…. They win battles, and they make me lucky.
general.author: dwight d. eisenhower

general.quote: I’ve had bad luck and I’ve had good and neither one lasted long enough to dry spit.
general.author: jo clayton

general.quote: As long as we are lucky we attribute it to our smartness; our bad luck we give the gods credit for.
general.author: josh billings

general.quote: Lady Luck generally woos those who earnestly, enthusiastically, unremittingly woo her.
general.author: b.c. forbes

general.quote: Luck is a discernible, if mysterious, pattern of influences on your life path.
general.author: david kennedy

general.quote: Luck is a dividend of sweat. The more you sweat, the luckier you get.
general.author: ray kroc

general.quote: I believe in luck: how else can you explain the success of those you dislike?
general.author: jean cocteau

general.quote: Lucky people are usually bad players when it comes to correcting their faults; they always believe that they are right when chance backs up their vice or folly.
general.author: francois de la rochefoucauld

general.quote: Luck is a combination of confidence and getting the breaks.
general.author: christy mathewson

general.quote: No luck was dumb because luck was just another name for miracle.
general.author: margaret atwood

general.quote: Luck is not as random as you think. Before that lottery ticket won the jackpot, someone had to buy it.
general.author: vera nazarian

general.quote: I always think luck‘s a bit like splitting a log. You’re much more likely to succeed if you read the grain and look for flaw-lines.
general.author: k.j.parker

general.quote: If the influence of luck is a delusion, then all I can say is that the delusion is virtually universal.
general.author: felix dennis

general.quote: Luck can be assisted. It is not all chance with the wise.
general.author: baltasar gracian

general.quote: Luck implies an absolute absence of any principle.
general.author: chuang tzu

general.quote: What we call luck is the inner man externalized. We make things happen to us.
general.author: robertson davies

general.quote: You can create your own luck just like a cloud can create its own rain. You create your own luck by the way you act, think, feel, and talk.
general.author: mark benedict

general.quote: It is a great piece of skill to know how to guide your luck even while waiting for it.
general.author: baltasar gracian

general.quote: Get as much experience as you can, so that you’re ready when luck works. That’s the luck.
general.author: henry fonda

general.quote: I find that the harder I work the more luck I seem to have.
general.author: thomas jefferson

general.quote: Ill luck, you know, seldom comes alone.
general.author: miguel de cervantes

general.quote: You’ve got to be in a position for luck to happen. Luck doesn’t go around looking for a stumblebum.
general.author: darrell royal

general.quote: Destiny is the invention of the cowardly, and the resigned.
general.author: ignazio silone

general.quote: Luck, mere luck may make even madness wisdom.
general.author: douglas william jerrold

general.quote: A man never has good luck who has a bad wife.
general.author: henry ward beecher

general.quote: The doors we open and close each day decide the lives we live.
general.author: flora whittemore

general.quote: Everything that happened to me happened by mistake. I don’t believe in fate. It’s luck, timing and accident.
general.author: mery griffin

general.quote: The lucky fellow is the plucky fellow who has been burning midnight oil and taking defeat after defeat with a smile.
general.author: james b. hill

general.quote: Virtue without success is a fair picture shown by an ill light; but lucky men are favorites of heaven; all own the chief, when fortune owns the cause.
general.author: john dryden

general.quote: Luck relies on chance, labor on character.
general.author: richard cobden

general.quote: No writer should minimize the factor that affects everyone, but is beyond control: luck.
general.author: john jakes

general.quote: Hope nothing from. Luck; and the probability is that you will be so prepared, forewarned, and forearmed that all shallow observers will call you lucky.
general.author: edward george earle lytton bulwer-lytton

general.quote: Much of my good fortune was a matter of nothing more clever on my part than luck.
general.author: james fixx

general.quote: They say you have to be good to be lucky, but I think you have to be lucky to be good.
general.author: rico carty

general.quote: Luck was something you either earned or invented through strength of character. You had to come by it honestly; you could not trick or bluff your way into it.
general.author: patrick dewitt

general.quote: The powerless worship Luck and Fate.
general.author: mason cooley

general.quote: I will ride my luck on occasion, but I like to pick the occasion.
general.author: rex stout

general.quote: Luck is simply the advantage a true warrior gains in executing the correct course of action.
general.author: r.a.salvatore

general.quote: Luck marches with those who give their very best.
general.author: h. jackson brown jr.

general.quote: I was born lucky, and I have lived lucky. What I had was used. What I still have is being used. Lucky.
general.author: katharine hepburn

general.quote: Some people are so fond of bad luck they run half way to meet it.
general.author: douglas william jerrold

general.quote: The harder you work, the luckier you get.
general.author: gary player

general.quote: All psychological studies indicate that a person’s luck is influenced by his state of mind.
general.author: june sawyer

general.quote: I think that one can have luck if one tries to create an atmosphere of spontaneity.
general.author: federico fellini

general.quote: Men of action are favored by the Goddess of luck.
general.author: george s. clason

general.quote: Nothing is as obnoxious as other people’s luck.
general.author: f.scott fitzgerald

general.quote: A pound of pluck is worth a ton of luck.
general.author: james a. garfield

general.quote: Luck’s always to blame.
general.author: jean de la fontaine

general.quote: When I work fourteen hours a day, seven days a week, I get lucky.
general.author: dr. armand hammer

general.quote: The only sure thing about luck is that it will change.
general.author: bret harte

general.quote: You know what luck is? Luck is believing you’re lucky….
general.author: tennessee williams

general.quote: When it comes to luck you make your own.
general.author: bruce springsteen

general.quote: Luck, bad if not good, will always be with us. But it has a way of favoring the intelligent and showing its back to the stupid.
general.author: john dewey

general.quote: Since luck’s a nine days’ wonder, wait their end.
general.author: euripides

general.quote: Shallow people believe in luck and in circumstances; Strong people believe in cause and effect.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson

general.quote: Everything in life is luck.
general.author: donald trump

general.quote: Luck is a matter of preparation meeting opportunity.
general.author: oprah winfrey

general.quote: When good luck knocks at the door, let him in and keep him there.
general.author: cervantes

general.quote: Don’t you know by now, luck don’t lead to anything or why you keep on moving.
general.author: steve winwood

general.quote: Those who have succeeded at anything and don’t mention luck are kidding themselves.
general.author: larry king

general.quote: The luck of having talent is not enough; one must also have a talent for luck.
general.author: hector berlioz

general.quote: Luck cannot change birth.
general.author: horace

general.quote: You don’t have to justify a beautiful stroke of good luck. Accept it. Smile and say thank you.
general.author: garrison keillor

general.quote: Luck is tenacity of purpose.
general.author: elbert hubbard

general.quote: It’s hard to detect good luck – it looks so much like something you’ve earned.
general.author: frank a. clark

general.quote: Luck is the savior for the few but a demon for the masses.
general.author: michael titorenk

general.quote: Luck enters into every contingency. You are a fool if you forget it — and a greater fool if you count upon it.
general.author: phyllis bottome

general.quote: In the queer mess of human destiny, the determining factor is luck.
general.author: william e. woodward

general.quote: Luck generally comes to those who look for it, and my notion is that it taps, once in a lifetime, at everybody’s door, but if industry does not open it luck goes away.
general.author: charles haddon spurgeon

general.quote: We must believe in luck. For how else can we explain the success of those we don’t like?
general.author: jean cocteau

general.quote: The man who glories in his luck may be overthrown by destiny.
general.author: euripides

general.quote: I think luck is the sense to recognize an opportunity and the ability to take advantage of it. The man who can smile at his breaks and grab his chances gets on.
general.author: samuel goldwyn

general.quote: Good luck needs no explanation.
general.author: shirley temple black

general.quote: I am a great believer in luck, and I find the harder I work, the more of it I have.
general.author: stephen leacock

general.quote: Luck, be a lady tonight.
general.author: frank loesser

general.quote: A rabbit’s foot may bring good luck to you, but it brought none to the rabbit.
general.author: ambrose bierce

general.quote: Good luck is the willing handmaid of an upright and energetic character, and conscientious observance of duty.
general.author: james russell lowell

general.quote: Luck is what happens when preparation meets opportunity.
general.author: elmer g. letterman

general.quote: The profits of good luck are perishable; if you build on fortune, you build on sand; the more advancement you achieve, the more dangers you run.
general.author: marquis de racan

general.quote: I don’t believe in luck. We make our own good fortune.
general.author: dr. joyce brothers

general.quote: The best luck of all is the luck you make for yourself.
general.author: douglas macarthur

general.quote: The only thing that overcomes hard luck is hard work.
general.author: harry golden

general.quote: There are so many people with all kinds of lucky things happening to them, and they don’t know how to use it.
general.author: rocky aoki

general.quote: I like people to be saints; but I want them to be first and superlatively honest men.
general.author: madame anne sophie swetchine

general.quote: No such thing as a man willing to be honest--that would be like a blind man willing to see.
general.author: f.scott fitzgerald

general.quote: After all, the most natural beauty in the world is honesty and moral truth; for all beauty is truth.
general.author: lord shaftesbury

general.quote: Dare to be honest and fear no labor.
general.author: robert burns

general.quote: It is a fine thing to be honest, but it is also very important to be right.
general.author: winston churchill quotes

general.quote: If you want to follow some good steps, it would Proverbs, all over.
general.author: pedro martinez (dominican-american baseball player)

general.quote: There is no proverb which is not true.
general.author: miguel de cervantes (1547-1616 spanish novelist)

general.quote: A proverb is one man’s wit and all men’s wisdom.
general.author: lord john russell (american actor, 1921-1991)

general.quote: Patch grief with proverbs.
general.author: william shakespeare (1564-1616, british poet)

general.quote: A proverb is good sense brought to a point.
general.author: john morley (1838-1923, british journalist)

general.quote: Much matter decocted into few words.
general.author: thomas fuller (1608-1661 english churchman)

general.quote: Maxims are the condensed good sense of nations.
general.author: james mackintosh (1765-1832 scottish politician)

general.quote: The maxims of men reveal their characters.
general.author: luc de clapier de vauvanargues (1715-1747 french writer)

general.quote: There is often more spiritual force in a proverb than in whole philosophical systems.
general.author: thomas carlyle (1795-1881, scottish philosopher, author)

general.quote: A proverb is a short sentence based on long experience.
general.author: miguel de cervantes (1547-1616, spanish novelist)

general.quote: The study of proverbs may be more instructive and comprehensive than the most elaborate scheme of philosophy.
general.author: william motherwell (1797-1835 scottish poet)

general.quote: Short sentences drawn from a long experience.
general.author: miguel de cervantes (1547-1616 spanish novelist)

general.quote: The genius, wit, and the spirit of a nation are discovered by their proverbs.
general.author: francis bacon (1561-1626, british philosopher)

general.quote: Which form of proverb do you prefer Better late than never, or Better never than late?
general.author: lewis carroll (1832-1898 english writer)

general.quote: Almost every wise saying has an opposite one, no less wise, to balance it.
general.author: george santayana (1863-1952 spanish philosopher)

general.quote: Proverbs are mental gems gathered in the diamond districts of the mind.
general.author: william rounseville alger (1822-1905 american author)

general.quote: The proverbs of a nation, furnish the index to its spirit, and the results of its civilization.
general.author: josiah gilbert holland (1819-1881 american novelist)

general.quote: Proverbs like the sacred books of each nation are the sanctuary of the intuitions.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson (1803-1882 american essayist)

general.quote: The wise make proverbs, and fools repeat them.
general.author: isaac d’israeli (1766-1848 british writer)

general.quote: Proverbs generalize the verdicts of the world.
general.author: drew sirtors

general.quote: Time is money says the proverb, but turn it around and you get a precious truth. Money is time.
general.author: george robert gissing (1857-1903 english novelist)

general.quote: A proverb is much matter distilled into few words.
general.author: r. buckminster fuller (1895-1983, american inventor)

general.quote: Proverbs are always platitudes until you have personally experienced the truth of them.
general.author: aldous huxley (1894-1963, british author)

general.quote: The proverb answers where the sermon fails, as a well-charged pistol will do more execution than a whole barrel of gunpowder idly exploded.
general.author: william gilmore simms ((1806-1870 american poet)

general.quote: Proverbs are somewhat analogous to those medical formulas which, being in frequent use, are kept ready made up in the chemists’ shops, and which often save the framing of a distinct prescription.
general.author: archbishop richard whately (1787-1863 english rhetorician)

general.quote: Books, like proverbs, receive their chief value from the stamp and esteem of the ages through which they have passed.
general.author: sir william temple (1628-1699, british diplomat )

general.quote: For proverbs are the pith, the proprieties, the proofs, the purities, the elegancies, as the commonest so the commendablest phrases of a language. To use them is a grace, to understand them a good.
general.author: john florio (c.1553-1625, british author )

general.quote: A proverb is not a proverb to you until life has illustrated it.
general.author: john keats (1795-1821, british poet)

general.quote: I believe there’s no proverb but what is true; they are all so many sentences and maxims drawn from experience, the universal mother of sciences.
general.author: miguel de cervantes (1547-1616, spanish novelist)

general.quote: The proverbial wisdom of the populace in the streets, on the roads, and in the markets, instructs the ear of him who studies man more fully than a thousand rules ostentatiously.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: Proverbs are for the most part rules of moral or, still more properly, of prudential.
general.author: dorothea brande (1893-1948 american writer)

general.quote: Proverbs embody the current and practical philosophy of an age or nation.
general.author: william fleming (1729-1795 former united states senator)

general.quote: The proverb is something musty.
general.author: william shakespeare (1564-1616, british poet)

general.quote: Proverbs are short sentences drawn from long experience.
general.author: miguel de cervantes saavedra(1547-1616)

general.quote: How many of us have been attracted to reason; first learned to think, to draw conclusions, to extract a moral from the follies of life, by some dazzling aphorism."
general.author: edward bulwer-lytton (1803-1873 english novelist)

general.quote: Sense, shortness, and salt.
general.author: james howell (1594-1666 anglo-welsh historian and writer)

general.quote: A proverb is the wisdom of many and the wit of one.
general.author: lord john russell (american actor, 1921-1991)

general.quote: When an occasion arises, there is a proverb to suit it.
general.author: william r. alger (1822-1905, american writer)

general.quote: Until a friend or relative has applied a particular proverb to your own life, or until you’ve watched him apply the proverb to his own life, it has no power to sway you.
general.author: nicholson baker (1957-, american author)

general.quote: If you hear a wise sentence or an apt phrase, commit it to your memory.
general.author: sir henry sidney (1529-1586 irish politician)

general.quote: A short saying often contains much wisdom.
general.author: sophocles (406 bc greek tragedian)

general.quote: Honest men are the gentlemen of nature.
general.author: edward george earle lytton bulwer-lytton

general.quote: The first step toward greatness is to be honest, says the proverb; but the proverb fails to state the case strong enough. Honesty is not only "the first step toward greatness,"–it is greatness itself.
general.author: christian nestell bovee

general.quote: No one can earn a million dollars honestly.
general.author: william jennings bryan

general.quote: Honesty is not only the deepest policy, but the highest wisdom.
general.author: charles caleb colton

general.quote: Sometimes honesty can be incredibly messy.
general.author: wm.paul young

general.quote: Honesty is a person’s most valuable asset. His or her good name, good reputation, and good word depend on the individual’s quality of honesty.
general.author: james h. merkel & abdul wahad al-falaij

general.quote: Be prepared and be honest.
general.author: john wooden

general.quote: Honesty is as rare as a man without self-pity.
general.author: stephen vincent benet

general.quote: Lies get people into trouble, but honesty is its own defense.
general.author: david huddleston

general.quote: I hold the maxim no less applicable to public than to private affairs, that honesty is the best policy.
general.author: george washington quotes

general.quote: Honesty’s praised, then left to freeze.
general.author: juvenal

general.quote: A day without honesty is like a day without sunshine.
general.author: james h. merkel & abdul wahad al-falau

general.quote: Honesty doesn’t always pay, but dishonesty always costs.
general.author: michael josephson

general.quote: An honest man is always a child.
general.author: marcus valerius martialis

general.quote: Honesty pays, but it don’t seem to pay enough to suit some people.
general.author: frank mckinney

general.quote: Honesty is such a lonely word. Everyone is so untrue. Honesty is hardly ever heard. And mostly what I need from you.
general.author: billy joel

general.quote: To be honest as this world goes is to be one man picked out of ten thousand.
general.author: william shakespeare quotes

general.quote: Honesty is the first chapter of the book of wisdom.
general.author: thomas jefferson quotes

general.quote: What is becoming is honest, and whatever is honest must always be becoming.
general.author: marcus tullius cicero

general.quote: Honesty is the rarest wealth anyone can possess, and yet all the honesty in the world ain’t lawful tender for a loaf of bread.
general.author: josh billings

general.quote: Being entirely honest with oneself is a good exercise.
general.author: sigmund freud

general.quote: Let us raise a standard to which the wise and honest can repair; the rest is in the hands of God.
general.author: george washington

general.quote: How desperately difficult it is to be honest with oneself. It is much easier to be honest with other people.
general.author: edward frederic benson

general.quote: Honesty is the best policy.
general.author: benjamin franklin

general.quote: Honesty needs no disguise nor ornament; be plain.
general.author: thomas otway

general.quote: A man who is as honest as the day is long often needs watching at night.
general.author: robert elliott gonzales

general.quote: Friends, if we be honest with ourselves, we shall be honest with each other.
general.author: george macdonald

general.quote: An honest heart possesses a kingdom.
general.author: lucius annaeus seneca

general.quote: Make yourself an honest man, and then you may be sure there is one less rascal in the world.
general.author: thomas carlyle

general.quote: An honest man’s the noblest work of God.
general.author: alexander pope

general.quote: Pretty much all the honest truth telling in the world is done by children.
general.author: oliver wendell

general.quote: To make your children capable of honesty is the beginning of education.
general.author: john ruskin

general.quote: The badge of honesty is simplicity.
general.author: novalis

general.quote: An honest man is believed without an oath, for his reputation swears for him.
general.author: eliza cook

general.quote: The measure of life is not length, but honestie.
general.author: john lyly

general.quote: Honest minds are pleased with honest things.
general.author: francis beaumont and john fletcher

general.quote: An honest man is respected by all parties.
general.author: william hazlitt

general.quote: The honester the man, the worse luck.
general.author: john ray

general.quote: No legacy is so rich as honesty.
general.author: william shakespeare

general.quote: Just be honest with yourself. That opens the door.
general.author: vernon howard

general.quote: I have found that being honest is the best technique I can use. Right up front, tell people what you’re trying to accomplish and what you’re willing to sacrifice to accomplish it.
general.author: lee iacocca

general.quote: Pain is a part of growing up. It’s how we learn.
general.author: dan brown

general.quote: The most painful part of our bodily pain is that which is bodiless or immaterial, namely, our impatience, and the delusion that it will last forever.
general.author: jean paul friedrich richter

general.quote: The same refinement which brings us new pleasures exposes us to new pains.
general.author: edward george earle lytton bulwer-lytton

general.quote: Sweet is pleasure after pain.
general.author: john dryden

general.quote: Pain is temporary. It may last a minute, or an hour, or a day, or a year, but eventually it will subside and something else will take its place. If I quit, however, it lasts forever.
general.author: lance armstrong

general.quote: Pain is a part of being alive, and we need to learn that. Pain does not last forever, nor is it necessarily unbeatable, and we need to be taught that.
general.author: rabbi harold s. kushner

general.quote: A little bit of pain is good for you. I feel alive. Everybody needs struggle. Once you overcome an obstacle, you springboard into the future.
general.author: pamela anderson

general.quote: Of all the things we can feel with our minds and bodies, severe pain is the purest, for it drives everything else from our awareness and focuses us as perfectly as we can ever be focused.
general.author: dean koontz

general.quote: Pain pays the income of each precious thing.
general.author: william shakespeare quotes

general.quote: Pain is such an uncomfortable feeling that even a tiny amount of it is enough to ruin every enjoyment.
general.author: will rogers

general.quote: Pain nourishes courage. You can’t be brave if you’ve only had wonderful things happen to you.
general.author: mary tyler moore

general.quote: There is no more lively sensation than that of pain; its impressions are certain and dependable, they never deceive as may those of the pleasure women perpetually feign and almost never experience.
general.author: marquis de sade

general.quote: There is purpose in pain; otherwise it were devilish.
general.author: owen meredith

general.quote: My definition of success is to live your life in a way that causes you to feel a ton of pleasure and very little pain – and because of your lifestyle, have the people around you feel a lot more pleasure than they do pain.
general.author: tony robbins

general.quote: It is easier to find men who will volunteer to die, than to find those who are willing to endure pain with patience.
general.author: julius caesar

general.quote: Pain is never permanent.
general.author: st. teresa of avila

general.quote: The power to cause pain is the only power that matters, the power to kill and destroy, because if you can’t kill then you are always subject to those who can, and nothing and no one will ever save you.
general.author: orson scott card

general.quote: The secret of success is learning how to use pain and pleasure instead of having pain and pleasure use you. If you do that, you’re in control of your life. If you don’t, life controls you.
general.author: tony robbins

general.quote: Your pain is the breaking of the shell that encloses your understanding.
general.author: kahlil gibran quotes

general.quote: He who makes a beast of himself gets rid of the pain of being a man.
general.author: samuel johnson

general.quote: Pain has its own noble joy, when it starts a strong consciousness of life, from a stagnant one.
general.author: john sterling

general.quote: When pain can’t bless, heaven quits us in despair.
general.author: edward young

general.quote: Pain is only what you allow it to be.
general.author: dan simmons

general.quote: People come and go, pain comes and goes. But so does joy. And if our hearts are closed because we don’t want to suffer, they won’t be open enough to recognize the joy as it flies by.
general.author: geneen roth

general.quote: When there is pain, there are no words. All pain is the same.
general.author: toni morrison

general.quote: Pain is a gift. Humanity, without pain, would know neither fear nor pity.
general.author: dean koontz

general.quote: One pain is lessened by another’s anguish.
general.author: william shakespeare

general.quote: There is room in the halls of pleasure For a large and lordly train, But one by one we must all file on Through the narrow isles of pain.
general.author: ella wheeler wilcox

general.quote: Imaginary pains are by far the most real we suffer, since we feel a constant need for them and invent them because there is no way of doing without them.
general.author: emil cioran

general.quote: All pain is either severe or slight, if slight, it is easily endured; if severe, it will without doubt be brief.
general.author: marcus t. cicero

general.quote: Sometimes it is harder to deprive oneself of a pain than of a pleasure.
general.author: f. scott fitzgerald

general.quote: There is no detachment where there is no pain. And there is no pain endured without hatred or lying unless detachment is present too.
general.author: simone weil

general.quote: Tragedy delights by affording a shadow of the pleasure which exists in pain.
general.author: percy bysshe shelley

general.quote: Every nerve that can thrill with pleasure, can also agonize with pain.
general.author: horace mann

general.quote: Pleasure that is obtained by unreasonable and unsuitable cost, must always end in pain.
general.author: samuel johnson

general.quote: There is no tyrant as merciless as pain.
general.author: stephen king

general.quote: There is a pleasure that is born of pain.
general.author: owen meredith

general.quote: There are ships sailing to many ports, but not a single one goes where life is not painful.
general.author: fernando pessoa

general.quote: That which is escaped now is pain to come.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: The worst pain … isn’t the pain you feel at the time, it’s the pain you feel later on when there’s nothing you can do about it.
general.author: jose saramago

general.quote: Pain is the great teacher of mankind. Beneath its breath souls develop.
general.author: marie von ebner-eschenbach

general.quote: Pleasure is often a visitant; but pain Clings cruelly to us.
general.author: john keats

general.quote: Pain was their body’s way of telling them that they’d pushed themselves to their limits — which was exactly where they were supposed to be.
general.author: richard marcinko

general.quote: Language… has created the word "loneliness" to express the pain of being alone. And it has created the word "solitude" to express the glory of being alone.
general.author: paul tillich

general.quote: Pain adds rest unto pleasure, and teaches the luxury of health.
general.author: martin tupper

general.quote: May the pain you have known and the conflict you have experienced give you the strength to walk through life facing each new situation with courage and optimism.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: There are no gains without pains.
general.author: benjamin franklin quotes

general.quote: There has never been a great athlete who died not knowing what pain is.
general.author: bill bradley

general.quote: And God shall wipe away all tears from their eyes; and there shall be nor more death, neither sorrow nor crying, neither shall there be any more pain.
general.author: bible

general.quote: Pain is real when you get other people to believe in it. If no one believes in it but you, your pain is madness or hysteria.
general.author: naomi wolf

general.quote: A wise man will make haste to forgive, because he knows the true value of time, and will not suffer it to pass away in unnecessary pain.
general.author: samuel johnson

general.quote: Pain for the old was no longer a surprise.
general.author: cormac mccarthy

general.quote: There are cases in which it is necessary to inflict pain now to avoid greater pain later on, or to gain future pleasure that is worth the current pain.
general.author: susan hubbard

general.quote: No pain, no palm; no thorns, no throne; no gall, no glory; no cross, no crown.
general.author: william penn

general.quote: Pain and pleasure, like light and darkness, succeed each other.
general.author: laurence sterne

general.quote: Pain can only feed on pain. Pain cannot feed on joy. It finds it quite indigestible.
general.author: eckhart tolle

general.quote: Those who do not feel pain seldom think that it is felt.
general.author: samuel johnson

general.quote: Pain is rewarding, in every capacity.
general.author: christina aguilera

general.quote: Pain has a way of clipping our wings and keeping us from being able to fly …
general.author: wm. paul young

general.quote: Pain is no longer pain when it is past.
general.author: margaret junkin preston

general.quote: The great art of life is sensation, to feel that we exist, even in pain.
general.author: lord byron

general.quote: The evils we do to others give us less pain than those we do to ourselves.
general.author: francois de la rochefoucauld

general.quote: This horror of pain is a rather low instinct and… if I think of human beings I’ve known and of my own life, such as it is, I can’t recall any case of pain which didn’t, on the whole, enrich life.
general.author: malcolm muggeridge

general.quote: Pain is no evil, unless it conquers us.
general.author: charles kingsley

general.quote: Pain revealed the paltry dimensions of love. The paltry dimensions of everything, in fact, except pain.
general.author: glen duncan

general.quote: The pain of the mind is worse than the pain of the body.
general.author: syrus

general.quote: There is no greater pain than to remember, in our present grief, past happiness.
general.author: dante

general.quote: The aim of the wise is not to secure pleasure, but to avoid pain.
general.author: aristotle quotes

general.quote: Pain of mind is worse than pain of body.
general.author: publilius syrus

general.quote: Pain is the deepest thing we have in our nature, and union through pain has always seemed more real and holy than any other.
general.author: henry hallam

general.quote: Find a place inside where there’s joy, and the joy will burn out the pain.
general.author: joseph campbell

general.quote: All pain is a punishment, and every punishment is inflicted for love as much as for justice.
general.author: joseph de maistre

general.quote: Never a lip is curved with pain That can’t be kissed into smiles again.
general.author: bret harte
