general.quote: Without pain, there would be no suffering, without suffering we would never learn from our mistakes. To make it right, pain and suffering is the key to all windows, without it, there is no way of life.
general.author: angelina jolie

general.quote: Pain is just another form of information.
general.author: don delillo

general.quote: There is no coming to consciousness without pain.
general.author: carl jung

general.quote: Pain is an outcry of sin.
general.author: bishop robert south

general.quote: One word frees us of all the weight and pain of life: That word is love.
general.author: sophocles

general.quote: It’s much easier to wear your pain on the outside.
general.author: e. l. james

general.quote: There is no mortal whom pain and disease do not reach.
general.author: cicero

general.quote: Long pains, with use of bearing, are half eased.
general.author: john dryden

general.quote: If pain could have cured us we should long ago have been saved.
general.author: george santayana

general.quote: Pain is life — the sharper, the more evidence of life.
general.author: charles lamb

general.quote: Pain and death are a part of life. To reject them is to reject life itself.
general.author: havelock ellis

general.quote: Doubt is a pain too lonely to know that faith is his twin brother.
general.author: khalil gibran

general.quote: Other men’s pains are easily borne.
general.author: cervantes

general.quote: Pain and disease awaken us to convictions which are necessary to our moral condition.
general.author: samuel johnson

general.quote: Pain is the root of knowledge.
general.author: simone weil

general.quote: Nothing begins, and nothing ends, that is not paid with moan; for we are born in others’ pain, and perish in our own.
general.author: francis thompson

general.quote: Remember that pain has this most excellent quality. If prolonged it cannot be severe, and if severe it cannot be prolonged.
general.author: marcus annaeus seneca

general.quote: Lord, help us to accept the pains and conflicts that come to us each day as opportunities to grow as people and become more like you.
general.author: mother teresa quotes

general.quote: Pain has its reasons, pleasure is totally indifferent.
general.author: francis picabia

general.quote: The longer the life the more the offense, the more the offense the more the pain, the more the pain the less defense and the less defense the less the gain.
general.author: sir t. wyatt

general.quote: The art of life is the art of avoiding pain; and he is the best pilot, who steers clearest of the rocks and shoals with which it is beset.
general.author: thomas jefferson quotes

general.quote: You purchase pain with all that joy can give, and die of nothing but a rage to live.
general.author: alexander pope

general.quote: The moment an ill can be patiently handled, it is disarmed of its poison, though not of its pain.
general.author: henry ward beecher

general.quote: The greatest evil is physical pain.
general.author: st. augustine

general.quote: We must all suffer one of two things: the pain of discipline or the pain of regret or disappointment.
general.author: jim rohn

general.quote: So great was the extremity of his pain and anguish, that he did not only sigh but roar.
general.author: matthew

general.quote: To truly laugh, you must be able to take your pain, and play with it!
general.author: charlie chaplin

general.quote: Pain shared, my brother, is pain not doubled, but halved.
general.author: neil gaimain

general.quote: Pain is God’s midwife, that helps some virtue into existence.
general.author: henry ward beecher

general.quote: Pain can be endured and defeated only if it is embraced. Denied or feared, it grows.
general.author: dean koontz

general.quote: Pain may be said to follow pleasure as its shadow; but the misfortune is that in this particular case, the substance belongs to the shadow, the emptiness to its cause.
general.author: charles caleb colton

general.quote: The truth is that we can learn to condition our minds, bodies, and emotions to link pain or pleasure to whatever we choose. By changing what we link pain and pleasure to, we will instantly change our behaviors.
general.author: tony robbins

general.quote: One good thing about music, when it hits you, you feel no pain.
general.author: bob marley

general.quote: Man is only truly great when he acts from the passions; never irresistible but when he appeals to the imagination.
general.author: benjamin disraeli

general.quote: Passion is like a ruin, which, in falling upon its victim, breaks itself to pieces.
general.author: eliza cook

general.quote: What passion cannot Music raise and quell?
general.author: john dryden

general.quote: The passions are like fire, useful in a thousand ways and dangerous only in one, through their excess.
general.author: christian nestell bovee

general.quote: I flush with heaving passion’s strange delight, yet find contentment lost in appetite.
general.author: edwin leibfreed

general.quote: The passions of men are commonly more potent than their reason.
general.author: thomas hobbes

general.quote: Whereas the law is passionless, passion must ever sway the heart of man.
general.author: aristotle quotes

general.quote: He who has no passion has no principal or motive to act.
general.author: claude a. helvetius

general.quote: Human character is smaller now, people don’t have durable passions; they’ve replaced passions with excitement.
general.author: saul bellow

general.quote: The worst of slaves is he whom passion rules.
general.author: henry brooke

general.quote: There is in most passions a shrinking away from ourselves. The passionate pursuer has all the earmarks of a fugitive.
general.author: eric hoffer

general.quote: We must act out passion before we can feel it.
general.author: jean-paul sartre

general.quote: Who does not believe his first passion eternal?
general.author: william makepeace thackeray

general.quote: Man is to be found in reason, God in the passions.
general.author: georg c. lichtenberg

general.quote: The fire which enlightens is the same fire which consumes.
general.author: henri frederic amiel

general.quote: Anyone who seeks to destroy the passions instead of controlling them is trying to play the angel.
general.author: francois-marie arouet de voltaire

general.quote: Without passion man is a mere latent force and possibility, like the flint which awaits the shock of the iron before it can give forth its spark.
general.author: henri frederic amiel

general.quote: Let the sap of reason quench the fire of passion.
general.author: william shakespeare

general.quote: Passion is absolutely necessary to achieve any kind of long-lasting success. I know this from experience. If you don’t have passion, everything you do will ultimately fizzle out or, at best, be mediocre. Is that how you want to live your life?
general.author: donald trump quotes

general.quote: My passions were all gathered together like fingers that made a fist. Drive is considered aggression today; I knew it then as purpose.
general.author: bette davis

general.quote: None, but people of strong passion are capable of rising to greatness.
general.author: gabriel riqueti mirabeau

general.quote: Nothing great in the world has been accomplished without passion.
general.author: donald trump quotes

general.quote: Only passions, great passions, can elevate the soul to great things.
general.author: denis diderot

general.quote: Passion is the drunkenness of the mind.
general.author: bishop robert south

general.quote: There are moments when our passions speak and decide for us … like a fire kindled within our being to which everything else in us is mere fuel.
general.author: george eliot

general.quote: It is the passions that do and undo everything.
general.author: bernard le bovier fontenelle

general.quote: Passion doesn’t look beyond the moment of its existence.
general.author: john christian bovee

general.quote: To know your ruling passion, examine your castles in the air.
general.author: richard whately

general.quote: Chase your passion, not your pension.
general.author: denis waitley

general.quote: Our headstrong passions shut the door of our souls against God.
general.author: confucius quotes

general.quote: The most beautiful make-up of a woman is passion. But cosmetics are easier to buy.
general.author: yves saint laurent

general.quote: Only passions can raise a man above the level of the animal.
general.author: andre maurois

general.quote: A willing heart adds feather to the heel.
general.author: joanna baillie

general.quote: A man or a woman without passions is like a windmill in a calm–motionless, ghastly, useless.
general.author: abraham miller

general.quote: The only sin passion can commit is to be joyless.
general.author: dorothy l. sayers

general.quote: Men spend their lives in the service of their passions, instead of employing their passions in the service of their lives.
general.author: sir richard steele

general.quote: Passion makes the best observations and the sorriest conclusions.
general.author: jean paul richter

general.quote: Strong as our passions are, they may be starved into submission, and conquered without being killed.
general.author: charles caleb colton

general.quote: Great passions are hopeless diseases. That which could cure them is the first thing to make them really dangerous.
general.author: johann wolfgang von goethe quotes

general.quote: The passions are the voice of the body.
general.author: jean-jacques rousseau

general.quote: Passions are vices or virtues to their highest powers.
general.author: johann wolfgang von goethe

general.quote: Our passions are, in truth, like the phoenix. When the old one burns away, the new one rises out of its ashes at once.
general.author: johann wolfgang von goethe

general.quote: If passion drives you, let reason hold the reins.
general.author: benjamin franklin

general.quote: Passions are the gales of life.
general.author: alexander pope

general.quote: What our age lacks is not reflection, but passion.
general.author: soren kierkegaard

general.quote: Passion is always suffering, even when gratified.
general.author: marie von ebner-eschenbach

general.quote: There is no greatness without a passion to be great, whether it’s the aspiration of an athlete or an artist, a scientist, a parent, or a businessperson.
general.author: anthony robbins

general.quote: Passion costs me too much to bestow it on every trifle.
general.author: thomas adams

general.quote: It is madness to think that we can fix an end to passions which we cannot control at their beginning.
general.author: seneca

general.quote: Passion, though a bad regulator, is a powerful spring.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson quotes

general.quote: There is no passion to be found playing small — in settling for a life that is less than the one you are capable of living.
general.author: nelson mandela

general.quote: If we resist our passions, it is more through their weakness than from our strength.
general.author: francois de la rochefoucauld

general.quote: You can no more bridle passions with logic than you can justify them in the law courts. Passions are facts and not dogmas.
general.author: alexander herzen

general.quote: Check your passions, that you may not be punished by them.
general.author: epictetus

general.quote: The passions are the winds which fill the sails of the vessel; they sink it at times, but without them it would be impossible to make way. Bile makes man passionate and sick; but without bile man could not live.
general.author: voltaire quotes

general.quote: No passion so effectually robs the mind of all its powers of acting and reasoning as fear.
general.author: edmund burke

general.quote: Men experience many passions in a lifetime. One passion drives away the one before it.
general.author: paul newman

general.quote: A man who has not passed through the inferno of his passions has never overcome them.
general.author: carl jung

general.quote: Everyone’s got to be passionate about something, or they’re not worth shit.
general.author: joseph finder

general.quote: Passion ungoverned by Reason is Madness.
general.author: benjamin whichcote

general.quote: There is only one passion, the passion for happiness.
general.author: denis diderot

general.quote: Every civilization is, among other things, an arrangement for domesticating the passions and setting them to do useful work.
general.author: aldous huxley

general.quote: It is with our passions as it is with fire and water; they are good servants, but bad masters.
general.author: roger l’estrange

general.quote: We may affirm absolutely that nothing great in the world has ever been accomplished without passion.
general.author: georg hegel

general.quote: With men passion is all at the beginning and with women it is all along.
general.author: anita brookner

general.quote: A strong passion for any object will ensure success, for the desire of the end will point out the means.
general.author: william hazlitt

general.quote: All passion becomes strength when it has an outlet.
general.author: george eliot

general.quote: Passion looks not beyond the moment of its existence. Better, it says, the kisses of love to day, than the felicities of heaven afar off.
general.author: christian nestell bovee

general.quote: I think if you find your passion and you go with it you are rewarded.
general.author: kirby larson

general.quote: Passion makes idiots of the cleverest men, and makes the biggest idiots clever.
general.author: francois de la rochefoucauld

general.quote: We are never like angels till our passion dies.
general.author: thomas dekker

general.quote: When passion is dead, or absent, then the magnificent throb of beauty is incomprehensible and even a little despicable.
general.author: d. h. lawrence

general.quote: All passions exaggerate; and they are passions only because they do exaggerate.
general.author: sebastien-roch-nicolas de chamfort

general.quote: He only employs his passion who can make no use of his reason.
general.author: marcus t. cicero

general.quote: It would be beneficial for us to know what all our passions make us do.
general.author: francois de la rochefoucauld

general.quote: He whom passion rules, is bent to meet his death.
general.author: sir philip sidney

general.quote: Passion makes the world go round. Love just makes it a safer place.
general.author: the ice opinion

general.quote: Our passions do not live apart in locked chambers but dress in their small wardrobe of notions, bring their provisions to a common table and mess together, feeding out of the common store according to their appetite.
general.author: george eliot

general.quote: Passion is for holidays, not homecoming.
general.author: jeanette winterson

general.quote: All passions are exaggerated, otherwise they would not be passions.
general.author: chamfort

general.quote: A man in passion rides a horse that runs away with him.
general.author: thomas fuller

general.quote: Our passions are like convulsion fits, which, though they make us stronger for the time, leave us the weaker ever after.
general.author: jonathan swift

general.quote: There is no end. There is no beginning. There is only the infinite passion of life.
general.author: federico fellini

general.quote: Moral passion without entertainment is propaganda, and entertainment without moral passion is television.
general.author: rita mae brown

general.quote: Our passion are the true phoenixes; when the old one is burnt out, a new one rises from its ashes.
general.author: johann wolfgang von goethe

general.quote: The passions are the gales of life; and it is religion only that can prevent them from rising into a tempest.
general.author: isaac watts

general.quote: Nothing is so intolerable to man as being fully at rest, without a passion, without business, without entertainment, without care.
general.author: blaise pascal

general.quote: Passion is universal humanity. Without it religion, history, romance and art would be useless.
general.author: honore de balzac

general.quote: Passion and prejudice govern the world; only under the name of reason.
general.author: john wesley

general.quote: Live with passion!
general.author: anthony robbins

general.quote: We welcome passion, for the mind is briefly let off duty.
general.author: mignon mclaughlin

general.quote: Regret is … an unavoidable result of any loss, for in loss we lose the tomorrow that we needed to make right our yesterday or today.
general.author: gerald lawson sittser

general.quote: The follies which a man regrets most are those which he didn’t commit when he had the opportunity.
general.author: helen rowland

general.quote: Better by far you should forget and smile, than that you should remember and be sad.
general.author: christina rosetti

general.quote: Regrets over the past should chasten the future.
general.author: james ellis

general.quote: It is human nature to want to go back and fix things or change things that we regret.
general.author: john gray

general.quote: One doesn’t recognize the really important moments in one’s life until it’s too late.
general.author: agatha christie

general.quote: Let’s not burden our remembrance with a heaviness that’s gone.
general.author: william shakespeare

general.quote: Speak when you are angry and you will make the best speech you will ever regret.
general.author: ambrose bierce

general.quote: The worst thing you can do is to try to cling to something that’s gone, or to recreate it.
general.author: johnette napolitano

general.quote: One of the sweetest pleasures of a woman is to cause regret.
general.author: paul gavarni

general.quote: When you can think of yesterday without regret and tomorrow without fear, you are near contentment.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: To regret deeply is to live afresh.
general.author: henry david thoreau

general.quote: The most painful thing to experience is not defeat but regret.
general.author: leo buscaglia

general.quote: It’s not what your are, it’s what you don’t become that hurts.
general.author: oscar levant

general.quote: Nobody who ever gave his best, regretted it.
general.author: george halas

general.quote: I have no regrets, I wouldn’t have lived my life the way I did if I was going to worry about what people were going to say.
general.author: ingrid bergman

general.quote: Maybe all one can do is hope to end up with the right regrets.
general.author: arthur miller

general.quote: A ton of regret never makes an ounce of difference.
general.author: grenville kleiser

general.quote: Let the dead Past bury its dead!
general.author: henry wadsworth longfellow

general.quote: You’ll seldom experience regret for anything that you’ve done. It is what you haven’t done that will torment you.
general.author: wayne dyer

general.quote: Make it a rule of life never to regret and never to look back. Regret is an appalling waste of energy; you can’t build on it; it’s only good for wallowing in.
general.author: katherine mansfield

general.quote: My one regret in life is that I’m not someone else.
general.author: woody allen

general.quote: The past will not tell us what we ought to do, but… what we ought to avoid.
general.author: jose ortega y gasset

general.quote: Were it not better to forget than to remember and regret?
general.author: letitia elizabeth landon

general.quote: I have always found that each step we take in life is to be regretted — if we once begin to wonder how many other steps might have been possible.
general.author: john oliver hobbes

general.quote: A few moments of misplaced values can mean a lifetime of regret.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: If we always look back, we lose sight of what’s ahead.
general.author: justin sims

general.quote: Regret for the things we did can be tempered by time; it is regret for the things we did not do that is inconsolable.
general.author: sidney j. harris

general.quote: Regret for time wasted can become a power for good in the time that remains, if we will only stop the waste and the idle, useless regretting.
general.author: arthur brisbane

general.quote: People seldom do what they believe in. They do what is convenient, then repent.
general.author: bob dylan

general.quote: I have no regrets because I know I did my best — all I could do.
general.author: midori ito

general.quote: In history as in human life, regret does not bring back a lost moment and a thousand years will not recover something lost in a single hour.
general.author: stefan zweig

general.quote: I demolish my bridges behind me… then there is no choice but forward.
general.author: firdtjof nansen

general.quote: A great source of calamity lies in regret and anticipation; therefore a person is wise who thinks of the present alone, regardless of the past or future.
general.author: oliver goldsmith

general.quote: Judgement comes from experience, and great judgement comes from bad experience.
general.author: robert packwood

general.quote: Never look for the birds of this year in the nests of the last.
general.author: miguel de cervantes

general.quote: When the past has taught us that we have more within us than we have ever used, our prayer is a cry to the divine to come to us and fill us with its power.
general.author: rudolph steiner

general.quote: Nostalgia: When you find the present tense and past perfect.
general.author: the lion

general.quote: Make the most of your regrets; never smother your sorrow, but tend and cherish it till it come to have a separate and integral interest. To regret deeply is to live afresh.
general.author: henry david thoreau

general.quote: Regrets are the natural property of gray hairs.
general.author: charles dickens

general.quote: We crucify ourselves between two thieves: regret for yesterday and fear of tomorrow.
general.author: fulton oursler

general.quote: The biggest thing in today’s sorrow is the memory of yesterday’s joy.
general.author: kahlil gibran

general.quote: Only in your imagination can you revise.
general.author: fay wray

general.quote: You must never regret what might have been. The past that did not happen is as hidden from us as the future we cannot see.
general.author: richard martin stern

general.quote: There is no man, however wise, who has not at some period of his youth said things, or lived in a way the consciousness of which is so unpleasant to him in later life that he would gladly, if he could, expunge it from his memory.
general.author: marcel proust

general.quote: The only things you regret are the things you didn’t do.
general.author: michael curtiz

general.quote: "Unhappiness is best defined as the difference between our talents and our expectations."
general.author: edward de bono

general.quote: "We gather strength from sadness and from pain each time we die we learn to live again."
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: "Those who are unhappy have no need for anything in this world but people capable of giving them their attention."
general.author: simone weil

general.quote: "One must be perfectly stupid to be perfectly unhappy."
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: "We never taste happiness in perfection, our most fortunate successes are mixed with sadness."
general.author: pierre corneille

general.quote: "Much unhappiness has come into the world because of bewilderment and things left unsaid."
general.author: fyodor dostoevsky

general.quote: "I look at what I have not and think myself unhappy; others look at what I have and think me happy."
general.author: joseph roux

general.quote: "Be open to your happiness and sadness as they arise."
general.author: john m. thomas

general.quote: "Blessed is he who submits to the will of God; he can never be unhappy."
general.author: martin luther

general.quote: "Sadness flies on the wings of the morning, and out of the heart of darkness comes the light."
general.author: jean giraudoux

general.quote: "Women get unhappy the more they try to liberate themselves."
general.author: brigitte bardot

general.quote: "The greatest happiness is to know the source of unhappiness."
general.author: fyodor dostoevsky

general.quote: "It is kind of happiness to know to what extent we may be unhappy."
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: "When unhappy, one doubts everything; when happy, one doubts nothing."
general.author: joseph roux

general.quote: "In deep sadness there is no place for sentimentality."
general.author: william s. burroughs

general.quote: "The attitude of unhappiness is not only painful, it is mean and ugly."
general.author: william james

general.quote: "Sadness is almost never anything but a form of fatigue."
general.author: andre gide

general.quote: "It is better that some should be unhappy than that none should be happy, which would be the case in a general state of equality."
general.author: samuel johnson

general.quote: "We become moral when we are unhappy."
general.author: marcel proust

general.quote: "Sorrow is better than laughter, for by the sadness of the face the heart is made better."
general.author: bible

general.quote: "Happiness is mental harmony; unhappiness is mental in harmony."
general.author: james allen

general.quote: "Call no man unhappy until he is married."
general.author: socrates

general.quote: "One is never as happy or as unhappy as one thinks."
general.author: françois de la rochefoucauld

general.quote: "The more refined one is the unhappy."
general.author: anton chekhov

general.quote: "Oh! The good times when we were so unhappy."
general.author: alexandre dumas

general.quote: "Melancholy and sadness are the start of doubt… doubt is the beginning of despair; despair is the cruel beginning of the differing degrees of wickedness."
general.author: comte de lautreamont, isidore ducasse

general.quote: "We ask God to forgive us for our evil thoughts and evil temper, but rarely, if ever ask Him to forgive us for our sadness."
general.author: r. w. dale

general.quote: "You live longer once you realize that any time spent being unhappy is wasted."
general.author: ruth e. renkl

general.quote: "The reason for the sadness of this modern age and the men who live in it is that it looks for the truth in everything and finds it."
general.author: edmond and jules de goncourt

general.quote: "All mankind’s unhappiness derives from one thing: his inability to know how to remain in repose in one room."
general.author: blaise pascal

general.quote: "The poor, the unsuccessful, the unhappy, the unhealthy are the ones who use the word tomorrow the most."
general.author: robert kiyosaki

general.quote: "If you optimize everything, you will always be unhappy."
general.author: don knuth

general.quote: "In order to have great happiness you have to have great pain and unhappiness – otherwise how would you know when you’re happy?"
general.author: leslie caron

general.quote: "Nothing is funnier than unhappiness, I grant you that. Yes, yes, it’s the most comical thing in the world."
general.author: samuel beckett

general.quote: "No-one is completely unhappy at the failure of his best friend."
general.author: groucho marx

general.quote: "Money never prevented anyone from being happy or unhappy."
general.author: eddie barclay

general.quote: "Men are the only animals that devote themselves, day in and day out, to making one another unhappy."
general.author: h. l. mencken

general.quote: "Activity and sadness are incompatible."
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: "O Lord! Unhappy is the man whom man can make unhappy."
general.author: ralph waldo emerson

general.quote: "By becoming unhappy, we sometimes learn how to be less so."
general.author: anne sophie swetchine

general.quote: "Never let go of that fiery sadness called desire."
general.author: patti smith

general.quote: "It’s sad that, in our blindness we gather thorns for flowers."
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: "The primary cause of unhappiness in the world today is… lack of faith."
general.author: carl jung

general.quote: "A moment of time may make us unhappy forever."
general.author: john gay

general.quote: "The unhappy derive comfort from the misfortunes of others."
general.author: aesop

general.quote: "All happy families resemble one another; every unhappy family is unhappy in its own way."
general.author: count leo tolstoy

general.quote: "Sadness and gladness succeed each other."
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: "The best thing for being sad is to learn something."
general.author: theodore white

general.quote: "Unhappiness is not knowing what we want, and killing ourselves to get it."
general.author: don herold

general.quote: "It takes patience to appreciate domestic bliss; volatile spirits prefer unhappiness."
general.author: george santayana

general.quote: "If you deliberately plan on being less than you are capable of being, then I warn you that you’ll be unhappy for the rest of your life."
general.author: abraham h. maslow

general.quote: "Absolute silence leads to sadness. It is the image of death."
general.author: jean jacques rousseau

general.quote: "The essence of romantic love is that wonderful beginning, after which sadness and impossibility may become the rule."
general.author: anita brookner

general.quote: "An ounce of cheerfulness is worth a pound of sadness to serve God with."
general.author: thomas fuller

general.quote: "Sadness is a state of sin."
general.author: andre gide

general.quote: "Irresolution on the schemes of life which offer themselves to our choice, and inconstancy in pursuing them, are the greatest causes of all unhappiness."
general.author: joseph addison

general.quote: "He felt the loyalty we feel to unhappiness — the sense that is where we really belong."
general.author: graham greene

general.quote: "You don’t seem to realize that a poor person who is unhappy is in a better position than a rich person who is unhappy. Because the poor person has hope. He thinks money would help."
general.author: jean kerr

general.quote: "Never believe straight off in a man’s unhappiness. Ask him if he can still sleep. If the answer’s "yes," all’s well. That is enough."
general.author: louis-ferdinand celine

general.quote: "The melancholy days are come, the saddest of the year, Of wailing winds, and naked woods and meadows brown and sear."
general.author: william c. bryant

general.quote: "The unhappy of all men is he who believes himself to be so."
general.author: david hume

general.quote: "The walls we build around us to keep sadness out also keeps out the joy."
general.author: jim rohn

general.quote: "Sadness does not inhere in things; it does not reach us from the world and through mere contemplation of the world. It is a product of our own thought. We create it out of whole cloth."
general.author: emile durkheim

general.quote: "If our life is unhappy it is painful to bear; if it is happy it is horrible to lose, so the one is pretty equal to the other."
general.author: jean de la bruyere

general.quote: "Unhappiness is the ultimate form of self-indulgence."
general.author: tom robbins

general.quote: "Man’s unhappiness, as I construe, comes of his greatness; it is because there is an Infinite in him, which with all his cunning he cannot quite bury under the Finite."
general.author: thomas carlyle

general.quote: "Of all the unhappy people in the world, the unhappiest are those who have not found something they want to do."
general.author: lyn yutang

general.quote: "All of our unhappiness comes from our inability to be alone."
general.author: jean de la bruyere

general.quote: "If you plan on being anything less than you are capable of being, you will probably be unhappy all the days of your life."
general.author: abraham maslow

general.quote: "To worry about tomorrow is to be unhappy today."
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: "Nuns and married women are equally unhappy, if in different ways."
general.author: christina of sweden

general.quote: "Is anyone in all the world safe from unhappiness?"
general.author: sophocles

general.quote: "The search for happiness is one of the chief sources of unhappiness."
general.author: eric hoffer

general.quote: "The only unhappiness is a life of boredom."
general.author: henri b. stendhal

general.quote: "The happy think a lifetime short, but to the unhappy one night can be an eternity."
general.author: lucian

general.quote: "The man who does something under orders is not unhappy; he is unhappy who does something against his will."
general.author: seneca

general.quote: Trust is won not given.
general.author: tobsha learner

general.quote: The only way to make a man trustworthy is to trust him.
general.author: henry lewis stimson

general.quote: Trust men, and they will be true to you; trust them greatly, and they will show themselves great, though they make an exception in your favor to all their rules of trade.
general.author: j. f. zacharia

general.quote: I trust everyone. I just don’t trust the devil inside them.
general.author: troy kennedy-martin

general.quote: Put your trust in God and keep your powder dry.
general.author: oliver cromwell

general.quote: Trust few men; above all, keep your follies to yourself.
general.author: sir walter raleigh

general.quote: You may be deceived if you trust too much, but you will live in torment if you don’t trust enough.
general.author: frank crane

general.quote: We’re all born brave, trusting, and greedy, and most of us remain greedy.
general.author: mignon mclaughlin

general.quote: Treason is greatest where trust is greatest.
general.author: john dryden

general.quote: It is risky to trust. I may give someone my heart, and they may leave town with it.
general.author: macrina wiederkehr

general.quote: When a man has no reason to trust himself, he trusts in luck.
general.author: edgar watson howe

general.quote: Trust that still, small voice that says, This might work and I’ll try it.
general.author: diane mariechild

general.quote: Trust me not at all, or all in all.
general.author: lord alfred tennyson

general.quote: Trust thyself: every heart vibrates to that iron string.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson

general.quote: He that is dishonest, trusts nobody.
general.author: benjamin whichcote

general.quote: Trust becomes solidified when words consistently back up by deeds.
general.author: george david miller

general.quote: Trust one who has tried.
general.author: virgil

general.quote: In God we trust, all others we virus scan.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: I think that we may safely trust a good deal more than we do: we may waive just so much care of ourselves as we honestly bestow elsewhere.
general.author: henry david thoreau

general.quote: Trust is letting go of needing to know all the details before you open your heart.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: To be trusted is a greater compliment than being loved.
general.author: george macdonald

general.quote: We do not yet trust the unknown power of thoughts.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson

general.quote: He who trusts secrets to a servant makes him his master.
general.author: john dryden

general.quote: There is none deceived but he that trusts.
general.author: benjamin franklin

general.quote: Put not your trust in money, but put your money in trust.
general.author: oliver wendell holmes

general.quote: Trust your own instinct. Your mistakes might as well be your own, instead of someone else’s.
general.author: billy wilder

general.quote: I move on feeling and have learned to distrust those who don’t.
general.author: nikki giovanni

general.quote: Self-trust is the essence of heroism.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson

general.quote: Trust everybody, but cut the cards.
general.author: finley peter dunne

general.quote: For there to be betrayal, there would have to have been trust first.
general.author: suzanne collins

general.quote: Liberalism is trust of the people tempered by prudence. Conservatism is distrust of the people tempered by fear.
general.author: william e. gladstone

general.quote: Men are able to trust one another, knowing the exact degree of dishonesty they are entitled to expect.
general.author: stephen leacock

general.quote: Never trust a husband too far, nor a bachelor too near.
general.author: helen rowland

general.quote: There are indeed times when one should trust blindly, just as there are times when one should not. Wisdom consists in being able to tell one from the other.
general.author: daniel quinn

general.quote: You can only trust yourself… and barely that.
general.author: paige wilson

general.quote: If you can’t trust people, who can you trust?
general.author: hohn widdiconbe

general.quote: Trust him with little who, without proofs, trusts you with everything.
general.author: eliza cook

general.quote: Trust cannot thrive in an environment where we preach teamwork and cooperation, but seldom recognize or reward it.
general.author: wayne r. bills

general.quote: Trust men and they will be true to you; treat them greatly and they will show themselves great.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson

general.quote: Put least trust in him who is foremost to praise you, nor judge of a road till it draw to the end.
general.author: john boyle o’reilly

general.quote: Sudden trust brings sudden repentance.
general.author: leytyne gwegan

general.quote: Trust him little who praises all, him less who censures all, and him least who is indifferent about all.
general.author: johann kaspar lavater

general.quote: If I refuse to trust the word of an honest man, I may reasonably expect that with me, at least, he will break faith at the earliest opportunity.
general.author: josiah . g. holland

general.quote: The chief lesson I have learned in a long life is that the only way you can make a man trustworthy is to trust him; and the surest way to make him untrustworthy is to distrust him and show your distrust.
general.author: henry l. stimson

general.quote: You must train your intuition — you must trust the small voice inside you which tells you exactly what to say, what to decide.
general.author: ingrid bergman

general.quote: As soon as you trust yourself, you will know how to live.
general.author: johann wolfgang von goethe

general.quote: Trust is the lubrication that makes it possible for organizations to work.
general.author: warren g. bennis

general.quote: Ultimately, there can be no complete healing until we have restored our primal trust in life.
general.author: georg feuerstein

general.quote: You can’t trust anybody with power.
general.author: newton gingrich

general.quote: You may be deceived if you trust too much, but you will live in torment unless you trust enough.
general.author: frank crane

general.quote: The toughest thing about the power of trust is that it’s very difficult to build and very easy to destroy.
general.author: thomas j. watson

general.quote: Trust in the person’s promise who dares to refuse what they fear they cannot perform.
general.author: charles haddon spurgeon

general.quote: One must be fond of people and trust them if one is not to make a mess of life.
general.author: e.m. forster

general.quote: Trust dies but mistrust blossoms.
general.author: sophocles

general.quote: Woe to the man whose heart has not learned while young to hope, to love — and to put its trust in life.
general.author: joseph conrad

general.quote: Trust only movement. Life happens at the level of events, not of words. 1st movement.
general.author: alfred adler

general.quote: Few delights can equal the mere presence of one whom we trust utterly.
general.author: george macdonald

general.quote: Never trust a man who speaks well of everybody.
general.author: john churton collins

general.quote: Trust is the fruit of a relationship in which you know you are loved.
general.author: wm. paul young

general.quote: To accept anything on trust, to preclude critical application and development, is a grievous sin.
general.author: vladimir lenin

general.quote: It is impossible to go through life without trust: that is to be imprisoned in the worst cell of all, oneself.
general.author: graham greene

general.quote: Few things help an individual more than to place responsibility upon him, and to let him know that you trust him.
general.author: booker t. washington

general.quote: Trust instinct to the end, even though you can give no reason.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson

general.quote: One should never trust a woman who tells her real age. If she tells that, she’ll tell anything.
general.author: oscar wilde

general.quote: Our distrust is very expensive.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson

general.quote: You cannot stop trusting people in life but I have learned to be a little bit careful. The way to make people trust-worthy is to trust them.
general.author: ernest hemingway

general.quote: Who would not rather trust and be deceived?
general.author: eliza cook

general.quote: I think we may safely trust a good deal more than we do.
general.author: henry david thoreau

general.quote: The test of an adventure is that when you’re in the middle of it, you say to yourself, "Oh, now I’ve got myself into an awful mess; I wish I were sitting quietly at home." And the sign that something’s wrong with you is when you sit quietly at home wish.
general.author: thornton wilder

general.quote: Adventure is a state of mind and spirit. It comes with faith, for with complete faith there is no fear of what faces you in life or death.
general.author: jacqueline cochran

general.quote: Nothing ventured, nothing gained. And venture belongs to the adventurous.
general.author: navjot singh sidhu

general.quote: The only difference between fear and adventure is how much you breathe.
general.author: rob kalnitsky

general.quote: It is very difficult to generalize. Everyone’s adventure is original.
general.author: bernard pivot

general.quote: Adventure is not outside man; it is within.
general.author: george eliot

general.quote: The great living experience for every man is his adventure into the woman.
general.author: david herbert lawrence

general.quote: Chance is the providence of adventurers.
general.author: napoleon bonaparte

general.quote: Who dares nothing, need hope for nothing.
general.author: johann friedrich von schiller

general.quote: The thirst for adventure is the vent which Destiny offers; a war, a crusade, a gold mine, a new country, speak to the imagination and offer swing and play to the confined powers.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson

general.quote: It’s not because things are difficult that we dare not venture. It’s because we dare not venture that they are difficult.
general.author: lucius annaeus seneca

general.quote: Each child is an adventure into a better life –an opportunity to change the old pattern and make it new.
general.author: hubert h. humphrey

general.quote: Marriage is the only adventure open to the cowardly.
general.author: voltaire

general.quote: It is always the adventurers who do great things, not the sovereigns of great empires.
general.author: charles de montesquieu

general.quote: Many will call me an adventurer – and that I am, only one of a different sort: one of those who risks his skin to prove his platitudes.
general.author: che guevara

general.quote: Every man can transform the world from one of monotony and drabness to one of excitement and adventure.
general.author: irving wallace

general.quote: We love because it’s the only true adventure.
general.author: william gladstone

general.quote: We should come home from adventures, and perils, and discoveries every day with new experience and character.
general.author: henry david thoreau

general.quote: Marriage is an adventure, like going to war.
general.author: gilbert k. chesterton

general.quote: Our belief at the beginning of a doubtful undertaking is the one thing that assures the successful outcome of any venture.
general.author: william james

general.quote: Each venture is a new beginning.
general.author: t. s. eliot

general.quote: The True Artist has the planet for his pedestal; the adventurer, after years of strife, has nothing broader than his shoes.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson

general.quote: I have found adventure in flying, in world travel, in business, and even close at hand… Adventure is a state of mind – and spirit.
general.author: jacqueline cochran

general.quote: Men of age object too much, consult too long, adventure too little, repent too soon, and seldom drive business home to the full period, but content themselves with a mediocrity of success.
general.author: francis bacon

general.quote: The vision must be followed by the venture. It is not enough to stare up the steps – we must step up the stairs.
general.author: vance havner

general.quote: Back of every mistaken venture and defeat is the laughter of wisdom, if you listen.
general.author: carl sandburg

general.quote: The unknown puts adventure into life…. The unexpected around the corner gives a sense of anticipation and surprise. Thank God for the unknown future.
general.author: eli stanley jones

general.quote: Caution has its place, no doubt, but we cannot refuse our support to a serious venture challenging the whole of the personality.
general.author: carl jung

general.quote: And yet a little tumult, now and then, is an agreeable quickened of sensation; such as a revolution, a battle, or an adventure of any lively description.
general.author: lord byron

general.quote: Adventure may hurt but monotony will kill you.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: Children are curious and are risk takers. They have lots of courage. They venture out into a world that is immense and dangerous. A child initially trusts life and the processes of life.
general.author: john bradshaw

general.quote: Life is either a daring adventure or nothing.
general.author: helen keller

general.quote: I am not an adventurer by choice but by fate.
general.author: vincent van gogh

general.quote: Without adventure civilization is in full decay.
general.author: alfred north whitehead

general.quote: Having a perilous adventure is always better than comatose safety. Always, always, always, always, always.
general.author: james alan gardner

general.quote: Death is just life’s next big adventure.
general.author: j. k. rowling

general.quote: Faith is the soul’s adventure.
general.author: william bridges

general.quote: The biggest adventure you can take is to live the life of your dreams.
general.author: oprah winfrey

general.quote: Nature has been for me, for as long as I remember a source of solace, inspiration, adventure, and delight; a home, a teacher, a companion.
general.author: lorraine anderson

general.quote: Trust the actions and impulses of your soul-venture bravely and all is well.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson

general.quote: His venture sounds like a banana peel awaiting its victim.
general.author: charlotte curtis

general.quote: Art flourishes where there is a sense of adventure.
general.author: alfred north whitehead

general.quote: When you’re safe at home you wish you were having an adventure; when you’re having an adventure you wish you were safe at home.
general.author: thornton wilder

general.quote: The brave venture anything.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: Every production of an artist should be the expression of an adventure of his soul.
general.author: w. somerset maugham

general.quote: War is not an adventure. It is a disease. It is like typhus.
general.author: antoine de saint-exupery

general.quote: Begin, be bold and venture to be wise.
general.author: horace

general.quote: Let the spirit of adventure set the tone.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: Why fear death? It is the most beautiful adventure in life.
general.author: charles frohman

general.quote: A large volume of adventures may be grasped within this little span of life, by him who interests his heart in everything.
general.author: laurence sterne

general.quote: We live in a wonderful world that is full of beauty, charm and adventure. There is no end to the adventures that we can have if only we seek them with our eyes open.
general.author: jawaharlal nehru

general.quote: Nothing ventured, nothing gained — but if everything is ventured, and still nothing gained, give up and venture elsewhere.
general.author: peter wastholm

general.quote: Adventure is what happens when you just did something stupid.
general.author: professor bernie

general.quote: Be careful going in search of adventure – it’s ridiculously easy to find.
general.author: william least heat-moon

general.quote: The search for the perfect venture can turn into procrastination. Your idea may or may not have merit. The key is to get started.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: It is in the compelling zest of high adventure and of victory, and in creative action, that man finds his supreme joys.
general.author: antoine de saint-exupery

general.quote: A life without adventure is likely to be unsatisfying, but a life in which adventure is allowed to take whatever form it will is sure to be short.
general.author: bertrand russell

general.quote: Equipped with his five senses, man explores the universe around him and calls the adventure Science.
general.author: edwin powell hubble

general.quote: Adventure without risk is Disneyland.
general.author: doug coupland

general.quote: One of the advantages of defeat in life — maybe the main advantage — is that it provides an excuse for change. Defeat… invariably leads to new adventures.
general.author: james reston

general.quote: Nothing adventured, nothing attained.
general.author: peter mcwilliams

general.quote: There are those who are so scrupulously afraid of doing wrong that they seldom venture to do anything.
general.author: marquis de vauvenargues

general.quote: Service to a just cause rewards the worker with more real happiness and satisfaction than any other venture of life.
general.author: carrie chapman catt

general.quote: One way to get the most out of life is to look upon it as an adventure.
general.author: william feather

general.quote: All men’s gains are the fruit of venturing.
general.author: herodotus

general.quote: Adventure is worthwhile.
general.author: aesop

general.quote: What I love most about this crazy life is the adventure of it.
general.author: juliette binoche

general.quote: It’s when you’re safe at home that you wish you were having an adventure. When you’re having an adventure you wish you were safe at home.
general.author: thornton wilder

general.quote: Democracy is an extraordinary adventure. It’s difficult, full of daring and risk and danger. But it’s the greatest gift we have.
general.author: jon voight

general.quote: Adventure is worthwhile in itself.
general.author: amelia earhart

general.quote: An adventure is only an inconvenience rightly considered. An inconvenience is only an adventure wrongly considered.
general.author: gilbert k. chesterton

general.quote: If we didn’t live adventurously, plucking the wild goat by the beard and trembling over precipices, we should never be depressed, I’ve no doubt, but already should be faded, fatalistic and aged.
general.author: virginia woolf

general.quote: Knowledge is an unending adventure at the edge of uncertainty.
general.author: jacob bronowski

general.quote: Adventure is just bad planning.
general.author: roald amundsen

general.quote: It is only in adventure that some people succeed in knowing themselves — in finding themselves.
general.author: andré gide

general.quote: Arriving at one goal is the starting point to another.
general.author: fyodor dostoevsky

general.quote: Each friend represents a world in us, a world possibly not born until they arrive, and it is only by this meeting that a new world is born.
general.author: anais nin

general.quote: It is better to travel hopefully than to arrive.
general.author: robert louis stevenson

general.quote: Hasten slowly and ye shall soon arrive.
general.author: milarepa

general.quote: If we really think that home is elsewhere and that this life is a wandering to find home, why should we not look forward to the arrival?
general.author: c. s. lewis

general.quote: Waiting, waiting, waiting. All my life, I’ve been waiting for my life to begin, as if somehow my life was ahead of me, and that someday I would arrive at it.
general.author: camryn manheim

general.quote: An intelligent plan is the first step to success. The man who plans knows where he is going, knows what progress he is making and has a pretty good idea when he will arrive.
general.author: basil s. walsh

general.quote: The rainy days a man saves for usually seem to arrive during his vacation.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: If you wait for the perfect moment when all is safe and assured, it may never arrive. Mountains will not be climbed, races won, or lasting happiness achieved.
general.author: maurice chevalier

general.quote: If you want to reach a goal, you must ‘see the reaching’ in your own mind before you actually arrive at your goal.
general.author: zig ziglar

general.quote: There is nothing more miserable in the world than to arrive in paradise and look like your passport photo.
general.author: erma bombeck

general.quote: One must pass through the circumference of time before arriving at the center of opportunity.
general.author: baltasar gracian

general.quote: If we are always arriving and departing, it is also true that we are eternally anchored. One’s destination is never a place, but rather a new way of looking at things.
general.author: henry miller

general.quote: The shortest and surest way of arriving at real knowledge is to unlearn the lessons we have been taught, to mount the first principles, and take nobody’s word about them.
general.author: henry bolingbroke

general.quote: Happiness is not a state to arrive at, but a manner of traveling.
general.author: margaret lee runbeck

general.quote: The man who plans knows where he is going, knows what progress he is making and has a pretty good idea when he will arrive.
general.author: basil s. walsh

general.quote: We do not mind our not arriving anywhere nearly so much as our not having any company on the way.
general.author: frank moore colby

general.quote: We shall not cease from exploration, and the end of all our exploring will be to arrive where we started and know the place for the first time.
general.author: t. s. eliot

general.quote: We have perhaps a natural fear of ends. We would rather be always on the way than arrive. Given the means, we hang on to them and often forget the ends.
general.author: eric hoffer

general.quote: Ambition is the path to success, persistence is the vehicle you arrive in.
general.author: william eardley iv

general.quote: No one can arrive from being talented alone. God gives talent; work transforms talent into genius.
general.author: anna pavlova

general.quote: It is better to travel well than to arrive.
general.author: buddha

general.quote: Cars are like rolling diaries, metal and plastic and paint tableaux of the last ten years of their drivers’ lives … every dent, every drooping slice of chrome, has a story behind it.
general.author: jim atkinson

general.quote: Education makes a people easy to lead, but difficult to drive; easy to govern, but impossible to enslave.
general.author: omar nelson bradley

general.quote: As we drive down the freeways, we see the new cars, but not the massive new-car loans that enslave their drivers to the banks.
general.author: gerry spence

general.quote: The best car safety device is a rear-view mirror with a cop in it.
general.author: dudley moore

general.quote: The problem with drinking and driving is the mourning after.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: When everything’s coming your way, you’re in the wrong lane.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: Anyone driving slower than you is an idiot, and anyone going faster than you is a maniac.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: We aren’t addicted to oil, but our cars are.
general.author: james woolsey

general.quote: Most of american life consists of driving somewhere and then returning home, wondering why the hell you went.
general.author: john updike

general.quote: Two-hundred forty horsepower isn’t enough to move me anymore. Enough to move my body, yes, but not my soul.
general.author: s.a. sachs

general.quote: The civilized man has built a coach, but has lost the use of his feet.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson

general.quote: Environmentally friendly cars will soon cease to be an option … they will become a necessity.
general.author: fujio cho

general.quote: Fuel cells create a better automobile that’s 50 percent more energy-efficient overall and sustainable from energy and safety perspectives.
general.author: larry burns

general.quote: If you’re smart and you care about life, you’ll take driving seriously.
general.author: victoria justice

general.quote: Car designers are just going to have to come up with an automobile that outlasts the payments.
general.author: erma bombeck

general.quote: Car sickness is the feeling you get when the monthly payment is due.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: Wall Street is the only place that people ride to in a Rolls Royce to get advice from those who take the subway.
general.author: warren buffett

general.quote: Driving is better than walking, because hitting is better than being hit.
general.author: jarod kintz

general.quote: You don’t love someone for their looks, or their clothes, or for their fancy car, but because they sing a song only you can hear.
general.author: oscar wilde

general.quote: Life is too short for traffic.
general.author: dan bellack

general.quote: The problem with traffic is that the people of today are driving the cars of tomorrow on the roads of yesterday.
general.author: bob talbert

general.quote: Everything in life is somewhere else, and you get there in a car.
general.author: elwyn brooks white

general.quote: You never really learn to swear until you learn to drive.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: Self-driving cars are the natural extension of active safety and obviously something we should do.
general.author: elon musk

general.quote: Some men take good care of a car; others treat it like one of the family.
general.author: evan esar

general.quote: When you step on the brakes your life is in your foot’s hands.
general.author: george carlin

general.quote: Any man who can drive safely while kissing a pretty girl is simply not giving the kiss the attention it deserves.
general.author: albert einstein

general.quote: Money may not buy happiness, but I’d rather cry in a Jaguar than on a bus.
general.author: francoise sagan

general.quote: Don’t worry about the horse being blind, just load the wagon.
general.author: john madden

general.quote: In the history of the world, no one has ever washed a rented car.
general.author: lawrence summers

general.quote: When you are fitted in a racing car and you race to win, second or third place is not enough.
general.author: ayrton senna

general.quote: The driver is safer when the roads are dry; the roads are safer when the driver is dry.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: A man must drive his energy, not be driven by it.
general.author: william frederick book

general.quote: Automobiles are not ferocious…. it is man who is to be feared.
general.author: robbins b. stoeckel

general.quote: Cars are to the landscape what television sets are to interior decor–an unattractive necessity. For better or for worse, our lives are structured around these machines.
general.author: mary riley smith

general.quote: A driver reaches a destination by driving on that road, not by laying back to enjoy the view.
general.author: nabil n. jamal

general.quote: Take it easy driving – the life you save may be mine.
general.author: james dean

general.quote: I am emotional about engines, if you hurt my car, you hurt my heart.
general.author: amit kalantri

general.quote: Until you’ve learned to drive, you’ve never really learned how to swear.
general.author: robert paul

general.quote: If you give some men an inch, they’ll park a foreign sports car in it.
general.author: evan esar

general.quote: The man who can drive himself further once the effort gets painful is the man who will win.
general.author: roger bannister

general.quote: Modern man drives a mortgaged car over a bond-financed highway on credit-card gas.
general.author: earl wilson

general.quote: Family and God – that is what’s important. Money, cars, those are things that come and go.
general.author: fabrice muamba

general.quote: Give a man a car of his own and he leaves humility and common sense behind him in the garage.
general.author: john le carré

general.quote: Perhaps people, and kids especially, are spoiled today, because all the kids today have cars, it seems. When I was young you were lucky to have a bike.
general.author: james cagney

general.quote: No steam or gas ever drives anything until it is confined. No Niagara is ever turned into light and power until it is tunneled. No life ever grows until it is focused, dedicated and disciplined.
general.author: harry emerson fosdick

general.quote: Anything that reduces fuel consumption and cuts down on greenhouse gasses is good news.
general.author: norman foster

general.quote: He did not care in which direction the car was travelling, so long as he remained in the driver’s seat.
general.author: max beaverbrook

general.quote: Regardless of what our national credit rating is, people will always want a roof over their heads, food on their tables, fuel for their cars, and clothes on their backs.
general.author: robert kiyosaki

general.quote: Hug your kids at home, but belt them in the car.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: The car, the furniture, the wife, the children–everything had to be disposable. Because you see, the main thing today is shopping.
general.author: arthur miller

general.quote: Fuel prices are at the center of our lives. They affect our ability to travel, stay warm, and feed ourselves.
general.author: robert kiyosaki

general.quote: Women are like cars: we all want a Ferrari, sometimes want a pickup truck, and end up with a station wagon.
general.author: tim allen

general.quote: No action hero is more closely associated with cars than James Bond.
general.author: richard hammond

general.quote: Fast cars like Porsches and Ferraris – they are things of beauty.
general.author: rod stewart

general.quote: Nothing ages your car as much as the sight of your neighbor’s new one.
general.author: evan esar

general.quote: In the United States every man is entitled to life, liberty and a car in which to pursue happiness.
general.author: evan esar

general.quote: There are three things men always talk about – women, sports, and cars.
general.author: mario lopez

general.quote: I’m all about sharing the road with other drivers—as long as they use the part that’s behind me.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: The car was invented as a convenient place to sit out traffic jams.
general.author: evan esar

general.quote: No matter what sort of car you are driving or how fast you drive, we all meet behind the same red light.
general.author: moe cidaly

general.quote: Patience is something you admire in the driver behind you and scorn in the one ahead.
general.author: mac mccleary

general.quote: Never drive faster than your guardian angel can fly.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: The car has become… an article of dress without which we feel uncertain, unclad, and incomplete.
general.author: marshall mcluhan

general.quote: If all the cars in the United States were placed end to end, it would probably be Labor Day Weekend.
general.author: doug larson

general.quote: A person without a sense of humor is like a wagon without springs — jolted by every pebble in the road.
general.author: henry ward beecher

general.quote: I know a lot about cars, man. I can look at any car’s headlights and tell you exactly which way it’s coming.
general.author: mitch hedberg

general.quote: A merry companion is as good as a wagon.
general.author: john lyly

general.quote: Each year it seems to take less time to fly across the ocean and longer to drive to work.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: Electric cars are going to be very important for urban transportation.
general.author: carlos ghosn

general.quote: Cars come in three dimensions: height, width and debt.
general.author: evan esar

general.quote: Take care of your car in the garage, and the car will take care of you on the road.
general.author: amit kalantri

general.quote: Flying cars are not a very efficient way to move things from one point to another.
general.author: bill gates

general.quote: The longest journey begins with a single step, not with a turn of the ignition key.
general.author: edward abbey

general.quote: Cars are the ultimate symbol of freedom, independence and individualism. They offer the freedom to "go anywhere," whenever it suits and with whom one chooses.
general.author: sarah redshaw

general.quote: The cars we drive say a lot about us.
general.author: alexandra paul

general.quote: Life is only a fast lane if you get into a lane and drive fast.
general.author: nikhil rao and katherine reiter

general.quote: Hitch your wagon to a star, keep your seat, and there you are.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: God made the world round so we would never be able to see too far down the road.
general.author: isak dinesen

general.quote: If being the biggest company was a guarantee of success, we’d all be using IBM computers and driving GM cars.
general.author: james surowiecki

general.quote: Never lend your car to anyone to whom you have given birth.
general.author: erma bombeck

general.quote: Have fun, be active. Ride a bike instead of driving, for example.
general.author: dan buettner

general.quote: Drive now. Text later.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: Writing is like driving at night in the fog. You can only see as far as your headlights, but you can make the whole trip that way.
general.author: e. l. doctorow

general.quote: Once the automobile appeared you could have predicted that it would destroy as many people as it did.
general.author: ray bradbury

general.quote: We don’t need bigger cars or fancier clothes. We need self-respect, identity, community, love, variety, beauty, challenge and a purpose in living that is greater than material accumulation.
general.author: donella meadows

general.quote: In business or in life, don’t follow the wagon tracks too closely.
general.author: h. jackson brown, jr.

general.quote: We’ve got to get people out of their cars, out of those drive-thru windows, get them walking, get them in parks and get them more active.
general.author: mick cornett

general.quote: The middle of the road is where the white line is — and that’s the worst place to drive.
general.author: robert frost

general.quote: Stealing a man’s wife, that’s nothing, but stealing his car, that’s larceny.
general.author: james cain

general.quote: Remember the street car cannot turn out.
general.author: charles m. hayes

general.quote: The most exasperating car trouble is when the engine won’t start and the payments won’t stop.
general.author: evan esar

general.quote: Flying without feathers is not easy; my wings have no feathers.
general.author: titus maccius plautus

general.quote: I fly because it releases my mind from the tyranny of petty things.
general.author: antoine de saint-exupery

general.quote: My soul is in the sky.
general.author: william shakespeare

general.quote: Just go for a ride. Get into an airplane. Take off from the ground. See the world from a different perspective. See if you have the flying gene.
general.author: tom stillwell

general.quote: Spread your wings and let the fairy in you fly!
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: Without feathers it isn’t easy to fly: my wings have got no feathers.
general.author: plautus (titus maccius plautus)

general.quote: An airplane stands for freedom, for joy, for the power to understand, and to demonstrate that understanding.
general.author: richard bach

general.quote: Flying is hours and hours of boredom sprinkled with a few seconds of sheer terror.
general.author: gregory “pappy” boyington

general.quote: Life is simple. Eat, sleep and fly.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: Bicycling is the nearest approximation I know to the flight of birds. The airplane simply carries a man on its back like an obedient Pegasus; it gives him no wings of his own.
general.author: louis j. helle, jr.

general.quote: Any landing you can walk away from is a good one.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: Always try to keep the number of landings you make equal to the number of takeoffs.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: If black boxes survive air crashes, why don’t they make the whole plane out of that stuff?
general.author: george carlin

general.quote: Flying is liberating. I can fly anywhere and everywhere I want… There is no restriction and hurdle in the air.
general.author: mark jeffries

general.quote: The reason angels can fly is because they take themselves lightly.
general.author: g.k. chesterton

general.quote: Pilots are a rare kind of human. They leave the ordinary surface of the word, to purify their soul in the sky, and they come down to earth, only after receiving the communion of the infinite.
general.author: jose maria velasco ibarra

general.quote: Aviation is proof that given, the will, we have the capacity to achieve the impossible.
general.author: edward vernon rickenbacker

general.quote: Why fly? Simple. I’m not happy unless there’s some room between me and the ground.
general.author: richard bach

general.quote: I pick the prettiest part of the sky and I melt into the wing and then into the air, till I’m just soul on a sunbeam.
general.author: richard bach

general.quote: I wish I could write well enough to write about aircraft. Faulkner did it very well in Pylon but you cannot do something someone else has done though you might have done it if they hadn’t.
general.author: ernest hemingway

general.quote: People who don’t fly miss so much!
general.author: edna gardner whyte

general.quote: Both optimists and pessimists contribute to our society. The optimist invents the airplane and the pessimist the parachute.
general.author: gil stern

general.quote: There is an art, or rather a knack to flying. The knack lies in learning how to throw yourself at the ground and miss.
general.author: douglas adams

general.quote: Sometimes, flying feels too godlike to be attained by man. Sometimes, the world from above seems too beautiful, too wonderful, too distant for human eyes to see.
general.author: charles lindbergh

general.quote: I feel about airplanes the way I feel about diets. It seems to me that they are wonderful things for other people to go on.
general.author: jean kerr

general.quote: Flight is the only truly new sensation than men have achieved in modern history.
general.author: james dickey

general.quote: O! for a horse with wings!
general.author: william shakespeare

general.quote: The air up there in the clouds is very pure and fine, bracing and delicious. And why shouldn’t it be? –it is the same the angels breathe.
general.author: mark twain

general.quote: I think it is a pity to lose the romantic side of flying and simply to accept it as a common means of transport….
general.author: amy johnson

general.quote: The airplane has unveiled for us the true face of the earth.
general.author: antoine de saint-exupery

general.quote: There are only two emotions in a plane: boredom and terror.
general.author: orson welles

general.quote: He who would learn to fly one day must first learn to stand and walk and run and climb and dance; one cannot fly into flying.
general.author: friedrich nietzsche

general.quote: You haven’t seen a tree until you’ve seen it’s shadow from the sky.
general.author: amelia earhart

general.quote: If God had really intended men to fly, he’d make it easier to get to the airport.
general.author: george winters

general.quote: The engine is the heart of an airplane, but the pilot is its soul.
general.author: walter raleigh

general.quote: Whenever we safely land in a plane, we promise God a little something.
general.author: mignon mclaughlin

general.quote: One of the beautiful things about a single-piloted aircraft is the quality of the social experience.
general.author: richard s. drury

general.quote: Lovers of air travel find it exhilarating to hang poised between the illusion of immortality and the fact of death.
general.author: alexander chase

general.quote: The Wright Brothers created the single greatest cultural force since the invention of writing. The airplane became the first World Wide Web, bringing people, languages, ideas, and values together.
general.author: bill gates

general.quote: The art of being a good guest is to know when to leave.
general.author: prince philip

general.quote: Making a long stay short is a great aid to popularity.
general.author: kin hubbard

general.quote: It is equally offensive to speed a guest who would like to stay and to detain one who is anxious to leave.
general.author: homer

general.quote: Nobody can be as agreeable as an uninvited guest.
general.author: kin hubbard

general.quote: Wherever the storm carries me, I go a willing guest.
general.author: horace

general.quote: A host is like a general: It takes a mishap to reveal his genius.
general.author: horace

general.quote: Santa Claus has the right idea: Visit people once a year.
general.author: victor borge

general.quote: A guest never forgets the host who had treated him kindly.
general.author: homer

general.quote: A pretty woman is a welcome guest.
general.author: lord byron

general.quote: Guests, like fish, begin to smell after three days.
general.author: benjamin franklin

general.quote: To be an ideal guest, stay at home.
general.author: edgar watson howe

general.quote: For whom he means to make an often guest, one dish shall serve; and welcome makes the rest.
general.author: joseph hall

general.quote: If it were not for guests all houses would be graves.
general.author: kahlil gibran

general.quote: The good guest is almost invisible, enjoying him or herself, communing with fellow guests, and, most of all, enjoying the generous hospitality of the hosts.
general.author: emily post

general.quote: Nowadays the host does not admit you to his hearth, but has got the mason to build one for yourself somewhere in his alley, and hospitality is the art of keeping you at the greatest distance.
general.author: henry david thoreau

general.quote: No one can be so welcome a guest that he will not annoy his host after three days.
general.author: titus maccius plautus

general.quote: To the guests that must go, bid God’s speed and brush away all traces of their steps.
general.author: rabindranath tagore

general.quote: We flatter those we scarcely know, We please the fleeting guest, And deal full many a thoughtless blow To those who love us best.
general.author: ella wheeler wilcox

general.quote: To be an agreeable guest one need only enjoy oneself.
general.author: joseph joubert

general.quote: The ornaments of your house will be the guests who frequent it.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: It is not the quantity of the meat but the cheerfulness of the guests which makes the feast.
general.author: edward hyde

general.quote: I always feel that I have two duties to perform with a parting guest: one, to see that he doesn’t forget anything that is his; the other, to see that he doesn’t take anything that is mine.
general.author: alfred north whitehead

general.quote: The only advantage of not being too good a housekeeper is that your guests are so pleased to feel how very much better they are.
general.author: eleanor roosevelt

general.quote: Keeping one’s guests supplied with liquor is the first law of hospitality.
general.author: margaret way

general.quote: People are far more sincere and good-humored at speeding their parting guests than on meeting them.
general.author: anton chekhov

general.quote: Every house where love abides And friendship is a guest, Is surely home, and home, sweet home For there the heart can rest.
general.author: henry van dyke

general.quote: If you would have guests merry with your cheer. Be so yourself, or so at least appear.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: A dinner invitation, once accepted, is a sacred obligation. If you die before the dinner takes place, your executor must attend.
general.author: ward mcallister

general.quote: Hospitality is making your guests feel at home, even if you wish they were.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: A civil guest will no more talk all, than eat all the feast.
general.author: george herheri

general.quote: God provides the wind, but man must raise the sails.
general.author: st. augustine

general.quote: How happy is the sailor’s life, from coast to coast to roam; in every port he finds a wife, in every land a home.
general.author: isaac bickerstaffe

general.quote: It is of great use to the sailor to know the length of his line, though he cannot with it fathom all the depths of the ocean.
general.author: john locke

general.quote: The true ship is the ship builder.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson

general.quote: If a man knows not what harbor he seeks, any wind is the right wind.
general.author: marcus annaeus seneca

general.quote: He is the best sailor who can steer within fewest points of the wind and exact a motive power out of the greatest obstacles.
general.author: henry david thoreau

general.quote: I have the mouth of a sailor.
general.author: kristen bell

general.quote: We are imprisoned in the realm of life, like a sailor on his tiny boat, on an infinite ocean.
general.author: anna freud

general.quote: Thought is the wind, knowledge the sail, and mankind the vessel.
general.author: augustus hare

general.quote: To a crazy ship all winds are contrary.
general.author: george herbert

general.quote: They that go down to the sea in ships, that do business in great waters: These see the works of the Lord, and his wonders in the deep.
general.author: bible

general.quote: I grew up on the sea and I grew up sailing – I love sailing – and the presence of the sea gives the air and the light a very special quality that I absolutely adore.
general.author: connie nielsen

general.quote: We may have all come on different ships, but we’re in the same boat now.
general.author: martin luther king, jr.

general.quote: Sailing a boat calls for quick action, a blending of feeling with the wind and water as well as with the very heart and soul of the boat itself. Sailing teaches alertness and courage, and gives in return a joyousness and peace that but few sports afford.
general.author: george matthew adams

general.quote: A woman knows the face of the man she loves as a sailor knows the open sea.
general.author: honore de balzac

general.quote: Every man should pull a boat over a mountain once in his life.
general.author: werner herzog

general.quote: No wind serves him who addresses his voyage to no certain port.
general.author: michel de montaigne

general.quote: He who loves practice without theory is like the sailor who boards ship without a rudder and compass and never knows where he may cast.
general.author: leonardo da vinci

general.quote: The wonder is always new that any sane man can be a sailor.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson
