general.quote: If the wind is against you then start sailing against it because the wind may never change in your favor.
general.author: kazi shams

general.quote: I love the water element, specifically the sea. I grew up on the sea and I grew up sailing – I love sailing – and the presence of the sea gives the air and the light a very special quality that I absolutely adore.
general.author: connie nielsen

general.quote: The master of a single trade can support a family. The master of seven trades cannot support himself. The wind is never for the sailor who knows not to what port he is bound.
general.author: og mandino

general.quote: I keep sailing on in this middle passage. I am sailing into the wind and the dark. But I am doing my best to keep my boat steady and my sails full.
general.author: arthur ashe

general.quote: A community is like a ship; everyone ought to be prepared to take the helm.
general.author: henrik ibsen

general.quote: Give wind and tide a chance to change.
general.author: richard e. byrd

general.quote: I can’t change the direction of the wind, but I can adjust my sails to always reach my destination.
general.author: jimmy dean

general.quote: The most ordinary conditions for observing sailing birds are then the wind and sea are both aft.
general.author: lawrence hargrave

general.quote: What do you want to be a sailor for? There are greater storms in politics than you will ever find at sea. Piracy, broadsides, blood on the decks. You will find them all in politics.
general.author: david lloyd george

general.quote: My escape is to just get in a boat and disappear on the water.
general.author: carl hiaasen

general.quote: Vexed sailors cursed the rain, for which poor shepherds prayed in vain.
general.author: edmund waller

general.quote: History is the ship carrying living memories to the future.
general.author: stephen spender

general.quote: I don’t have to take a trip around the world or be on a yacht in the Mediterranean to have happiness. I can find it in the little things, like looking out into my backyard and seeing deer in the fields.
general.author: queen latifah

general.quote: Sailing round the world in a dirty gondola oh, to be back in the land of Coca-Cola!
general.author: bob dylan

general.quote: The pessimist complains about the wind; the optimist expects it to change; the realist adjusts the sails.
general.author: william arthur ward

general.quote: Wind to a sailor is what money is to life on shore.
general.author: sterling hayden

general.quote: As soon as you set foot on a yacht you belong to some man, not to yourself, and you die of boredom.
general.author: coco chanel

general.quote: To reach the port of heaven, we must sail sometimes with the wind and sometimes against it, but we must sail, and not drift, nor lie at anchor.
general.author: marjorie holmes

general.quote: Thought is the wind and knowledge the sail.
general.author: david hare

general.quote: We did not all come over on the same ship, but we are all in the same boat.
general.author: bernard baruch

general.quote: The Ancient Mariner would not have taken so well if it had been called The Old Sailor.
general.author: samuel butler

general.quote: If one does not know to which port one is sailing, no wind is favorable.
general.author: lucius annaeus seneca

general.quote: My future starts when I wake up every morning… Every day I find something creative to do with my life.
general.author: miles davis

general.quote: Who gets up early to discover the moment light begins?
general.author: rumi

general.quote: The older generation thought nothing of getting up at five every morning — and the younger generation doesn’t think much of it either.
general.author: john j. welsh

general.quote: You’ve got to get up every morning with a smile on your face, and show the world all the love in your heart.
general.author: carole king

general.quote: When one begins to turn in bed, it is time to get up.
general.author: duke of wellington

general.quote: I never really look for anything. What God throws my way comes. I wake up in the morning and whichever way God turns my feet, I go.
general.author: pearl bailey

general.quote: Three o’clock is always too late or too early for anything you want to do.
general.author: jean-paul sartre

general.quote: The time just before dawn contains the most energy of all hours of the day. This has helped me become an early riser and an early doer…. When I wake to see that it’s light out already, I feel like the world has started without me.
general.author: adabella radici

general.quote: It is by no haphazard chance that in every age men have risen early to pray. The first thing that marks decline in spiritual life is our relationship to the early morning.
general.author: oswald chambers

general.quote: I’m a very early riser, and I don’t like to miss that beautiful early morning light.
general.author: david hockney

general.quote: If people were meant to pop out of bed, we’d all sleep in toasters.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: Before a man can wake up and find himself famous he has to wake up and find himself.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: Some people dream of success, while others wake up and work hard at it!
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: If you want to make your dreams come true, the first thing you have to do is wake up.
general.author: j. m. power

general.quote: An early-rising man… a good spouse but a bad husband.
general.author: gabriel garcia marquez

general.quote: The moment when you first wake up in the morning is the most wonderful of the twenty-four hours. No matter how weary or dreary you may feel, you possess the certainty that, during the day that lies before you, absolutely anything may happen. And the fact that it practically always doesn’t, matters not a jot. The possibility is always there.
general.author: monica baldwin

general.quote: You can make the dream come true if you wake up and work.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: A happy family is but an earlier heaven.
general.author: sir john bowring

general.quote: I think we consider too much the good luck of the early bird and not enough the bad luck of the early worm.
general.author: franklin d. roosevelt

general.quote: The average, healthy, well-adjusted adult gets up at seven-thirty in the morning feeling just plain terrible.
general.author: jean kerr

general.quote: Wake up with a smile and go after life…. Live it, enjoy it, taste it, smell it, feel it.
general.author: joe knapp

general.quote: I wake up every morning at nine and grab for the morning paper. Then I look at the obituary page. If my name is not on it, I get up.
general.author: harry hershfield

general.quote: Autumn arrives in early morning, but spring at the close of a winter day.
general.author: elizabeth bowen

general.quote: Early to bed and early to rise is a bad rule for anyone who wishes to become acquainted with our most prominent and influential people.
general.author: george ade

general.quote: The early bird catches the worm.
general.author: william camden

general.quote: A dream is not something that you wake up from, but something that wakes you up.
general.author: charlie hedges

general.quote: Most people do not consider dawn to be an attractive experience — unless they are still up.
general.author: ellen goodman

general.quote: Early to bed, early to rise, work like hell, and advertise.
general.author: laurence j. peter

general.quote: Early to rise and early to bed makes a man healthy, wealthy, and dead.
general.author: james thurber

general.quote: Do you know what the greatest test is? Do you still get excited about what you do when you get up in the morning?
general.author: david halberstam

general.quote: When you wake up every day, you have two choices. You can either be positive or negative; an optimist or a pessimist. I choose to be an optimist. It’s all a matter of perspective.
general.author: harvey mackay

general.quote: The sun has not caught me in bed in fifty years.
general.author: thomas jefferson

general.quote: The brain is a wonderful organ; it starts working the moment you get up in the morning and does not stop until you get to the office.
general.author: robert frost

general.quote: You have to wake up and you have to run if you want to survive.
general.author: marat safin

general.quote: God gives all to those, who get up early.
general.author: anna kournikova

general.quote: I just wake up and say, "You’re a bum, go do something worthwhile today."
general.author: garth brooks

general.quote: You have to wake up a virgin each morning.
general.author: jean-louis barrault

general.quote: Thank God every morning when you get up that you have something to do that day, which must be done, whether you like it or not.
general.author: james russell lowell

general.quote: There is no hope for a civilization which starts each day to the sound of an alarm clock.
general.author: author unkmown

general.quote: If you are not happy every morning when you get up, leave for work, or start to work at home, and are not enthusiastic about doing that, you will not be successful.
general.author: donald m. kendall

general.quote: The best way to make your dreams come true is to wake up.
general.author: paul valery

general.quote: No human being believes that any other human being has a right to be in bed when he himself is up.
general.author: robert lynd

general.quote: Formula for success: rise early, work hard, strike oil.
general.author: j. paul getty

general.quote: Morning is the fresh page of nature.
general.author: edward counsel

general.quote: Be pleasant until ten o’clock in the morning and the rest of the day will take care of itself.
general.author: elbert hubbard

general.quote: It is early, early morning. It’s that time when it’s still dark but you know the day is coming. Blue is bleeding through black. Stars are dying.
general.author: markus zusak

general.quote: Sadness flies on the wings of the morning and out of the heart of darkness comes the light.
general.author: jean giraudoux

general.quote: Early morning does not mince words.
general.author: john galsworthy

general.quote: Morning is wonderful. Its only drawback is that it comes at such an inconvenient time of day.
general.author: glen cook

general.quote: What a benediction is this fragrance of the early morning! The vernal grass fills the whole atmosphere as with a shower of sweetness.
general.author: sarah smiley

general.quote: Sweet is the breath of morn, her rising sweet, with charm of earliest birds.
general.author: john milton

general.quote: The first hour of the morning is the rudder of the day. It is a blessed baptism which gives the first waking thoughts into the bosom of God.
general.author: henry ward beecher

general.quote: You can only come to the morning through the shadows.
general.author: j.r.r. tolkien

general.quote: Morning … ’tis Nature’s gayest hour!
general.author: sarah josepha hale

general.quote: The sun is but a morning star.
general.author: henry david thoreau

general.quote: The light of morning decomposes everything.
general.author: haruki murakami

general.quote: Dawn drowns the stars while still the city sleeps…
general.author: edgar fawcett

general.quote: Morning can always be counted on to bring us back to a more realistic level.
general.author: tennessee williams

general.quote: The sky rejoices in the morning’s birth.
general.author: william wordsworth

general.quote: The breeze at dawn has secrets to tell you. Don’t go back to sleep.
general.author: rumi

general.quote: Morning is an important time of day, because how you spend your morning can often tell you what kind of day you are going to have.
general.author: daniel handler

general.quote: I’d like mornings better if they started later.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: Early morning cheerfulness can be extremely obnoxious.
general.author: william feather

general.quote: The average, healthy, well-adjusted adult gets up at seven-thirty in the morning feeling just plain terrible.
general.author: jean kerr

general.quote: Don’t try to solve serious matters in the middle of the night.
general.author: philip k. dick

general.quote: What hath night to do with sleep?
general.author: john milton

general.quote: Life begins at night
general.author: charlaine harris

general.quote: The darker the night, the brighter the stars, The deeper the grief, the closer is God!
general.author: fyodor dostoyevsky

general.quote: There are nights when the wolves are silent and only the moon howls.
general.author: george carlin

general.quote: For the night shows stars and women in a better light.
general.author: lord byron, don juan

general.quote: [I]t seemed as if the streets were absorbed by the sky, and the night were all in the air.
general.author: charles dickens

general.quote: There’s no night without stars.
general.author: andre norton

general.quote: In a real dark night of the soul, it is always three o’clock in the morning, day after day.
general.author: f. scott fitzgerald

general.quote: Each night, when I go to sleep, I die. And the next morning, when I wake up, I am reborn.
general.author: mahatma gandhi

general.quote: The longest way must have its close – the gloomiest night will wear on to a morning.
general.author: harriet beecher stowe

general.quote: For the happiest life, rigorously plan your days, leave your nights open to chance.
general.author: mignon mclaughlin, the second neurotic’s notebook, 1966

general.quote: Only the lonely know the way I feel tonight.
general.author: roy orbison

general.quote: Night is a world lit by itself.
general.author: antonio porchia, voces

general.quote: The day has eyes; the night has ears.
general.author: david fergusson

general.quote: The night walked down the sky with the moon in her hand.
general.author: frederick l. knowles

general.quote: Night has become painful for me. It brings to light the regrets of the day.
general.author: grey e. livingston

general.quote: Loneliness adds beauty to life. It puts a special burn on sunsets and makes night air smell better.
general.author: henry rollins

general.quote: How long the night seems to one kept awake by pain.
general.author: bernard-joseph saurin

general.quote: Remember tonight… for it is the beginning of always.
general.author: dante alighieri

general.quote: I often think that the night is more alive and more richly colored than the day.
general.author: vincent van gogh

general.quote: It was a night so beautiful that your soul seemed hardly able to bear the prison of the body.
general.author: w. somerset maugham

general.quote: A man is a very small thing, and the night is very large and full of wonders.
general.author: edward plunkett

general.quote: We wake in the night, to stereophonic silence.
general.author: mignon mclaughlin

general.quote: Tomorrow night is nothing but one long sleepless wrestle with yesterday’s omissions and regrets.
general.author: william faulkner

general.quote: Look to the past for guidance into the future.
general.author: robert jacob goodkin

general.quote: The past is the only dead thing that smells sweet.
general.author: edward thomas

general.quote: Every saint has a past, and every sinner has a future.
general.author: oscar wilde quotes

general.quote: The past is not a package one can lay away.
general.author: emily dickinson quotes

general.quote: No man is rich enough to buy back his past.
general.author: oscar wilde

general.quote: The past beats inside me like a second heart.
general.author: john banville

general.quote: What is past is prologue.
general.author: william shakespeare quotes

general.quote: The past is the best way to suppose what may come.
general.author: lord halifax

general.quote: Our most merciless enemy is our past.
general.author: maxim gorky

general.quote: The past is over… forget it. The future holds hope… reach for it.
general.author: charles swindoll

general.quote: We go to the past to lay the blame – since the past can’t argue.
general.author: glen duncan

general.quote: Whatever we think of the past, we must not be prisoners to it.
general.author: barack obama quotes

general.quote: The past is a foreign country; they do things differently there.
general.author: lesley p. hartley

general.quote: Only by acceptance of the past will you alter its meaning.
general.author: t. s. eliot

general.quote: Look not mournfully into the Past. It comes not back again.
general.author: henry wadsworth longfellow

general.quote: How the past perishes is how the future becomes.
general.author: alfred north whitehead

general.quote: All the past is not worth one today.
general.author: ella wheeler wilcox

general.quote: The past is a funeral gone by.
general.author: sir edmund gosse

general.quote: The destruction of the past is perhaps the greatest of all crimes.
general.author: simone weil

general.quote: A good knowledge of things past is an armour against events to come.
general.author: edward counsel

general.quote: Who recollects distinctly his past adventures, knows his destiny to come.
general.author: johann caspar lavater

general.quote: You always romanticize the past as soon as the future begins to frighten you.
general.author: rick remender

general.quote: May you look back on the past with as much pleasure as you look forward to the future.
general.author: paul dickson

general.quote: The past is at least secure.
general.author: daniel webster

general.quote: The past is a towering mansion.
general.author: edward counsel

general.quote: No matter what a man’s past may have been, his future is spotless.
general.author: john r. rice

general.quote: All tradition is merely the past.
general.author: jiddu krishnamurti

general.quote: Every journey into the past is complicated by delusions, false memories, false namings of real events.
general.author: adrienne rich

general.quote: The only past which endures lies wordlessly within you.
general.author: frank herbert

general.quote: We all live on the past, and through the past are destroyed.
general.author: johann wolfgang von goethe quotes

general.quote: The past is a closed door.
general.author: margaret atwood

general.quote: I think we all agree, the past is over.
general.author: george w. bush

general.quote: One’s past is what one is. It is the only way by which people should be judged.
general.author: oscar wilde

general.quote: A man cannot free himself from the past more easily than he can from his own body.
general.author: andré maurois

general.quote: The past is a mist.
general.author: harold pinter

general.quote: It is one thing to learn about the past; it is another to wallow in it.
general.author: kenneth auchincloss

general.quote: Only a good-for-nothing is not interested in his past.
general.author: sigmund freud

general.quote: The past is never dead — it is not even past.
general.author: william faulkner

general.quote: My soul is not a palace of the past…
general.author: james russell lowell

general.quote: The past always looks better than it was because it isn’t here.
general.author: finley peter dunne

general.quote: The past is never where you think you left it.
general.author: katherine anne porter

general.quote: The past is a guidepost, not a hitching post.
general.author: thomas holcroft

general.quote: The past, though it cannot be relived, can always be repaired.
general.author: john la farge

general.quote: How easy it is to destroy the past and how difficult to forget it.
general.author: jeanette winterson

general.quote: Whatever with the past is gone, the best is always yet to come.
general.author: lucy larcom

general.quote: Bring the past only if you are going to build from it.
general.author: doménico cieri estrada

general.quote: Continuity with the past is a necessity, not a duty.
general.author: oliver wendell holmes, jr.

general.quote: I tend to live in the past because most of my life is there.
general.author: herb caen

general.quote: You can’t change the past, it just is.
general.author: alyson noël

general.quote: Study the past, if you would divine the future.
general.author: confucius quotes

general.quote: Learn from the past–don’t wear it like a yoke around your neck.
general.author: brian herbert & kevin j. anderson

general.quote: The past is utterly indifferent to its worshipers.
general.author: william winter

general.quote: We need not destroy the past. It is gone.
general.author: john cage

general.quote: The past is the present, isn’t it? It’s the future too.
general.author: eugene o’nei

general.quote: It’s harder to imagine the past that went away than it is to imagine the future.
general.author: william gibson

general.quote: The past is all holy to us; the dead are all holy; even they that were wicked when alive.
general.author: thomas carlyle

general.quote: Those who cannot remember the past are condemned to repeat it.
general.author: george santayana

general.quote: While I take inspiration from the past, like most Americans, I live for the future.
general.author: ronald reagan quotes

general.quote: The rewards in life go to those who are willing to give up the past.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: The past does not equal the future.
general.author: anthony robbins

general.quote: The past and future are veiled; but the past wears the widow’s veil; the future, the virgin’s.
general.author: jean paul friedrich richter

general.quote: I passionately scrutinize this past, in order to reconstruct from its scattered bits the illusion of a future.
general.author: octave mirbeau

general.quote: The one charm of the past is that it is the past.
general.author: oscar wilde

general.quote: The past is never completely lost, however extensive the devastation. Your sorrows are the bricks and mortar of a magnificent temple. What you are today and what you will be tomorrow are because of what you have been.
general.author: gordon wright

general.quote: In the maxim of the past you cannot go anywhere.
general.author: maxim gorky

general.quote: Nothing changes more constantly than the past; for the past that influences our lives does not consist of what actually happened, but of what men believe happened.
general.author: gerald w. johnson

general.quote: The past gives you an identity and the future holds the promise of salvation, of fulfillment in whatever form. Both are illusions.
general.author: eckhart tolle

general.quote: Recognizing what we have done in the past is a recognition of ourselves. By conducting a dialogue with our past, we are searching how to go forward.
general.author: kiyoko takeda

general.quote: The true picture of the past flits by. The past can be seized only as an image which flashes up at the instant when it can be recognized and is never seen again.
general.author: walter benjamin

general.quote: The light of other days is faded, and all their glories past.
general.author: alfred bunn

general.quote: There is no past that we can bring back by longing for it. There is only an eternally new now that builds and creates itself out of the best as the past withdraws.
general.author: johann wolfgang von goethe

general.quote: You read the past in some old faces.
general.author: william makepeace thackeray

general.quote: There is a way to look at the past. Don’t hide from it. It will not catch you — if you don’t repeat it.
general.author: pearl bailey

general.quote: We may be through with the past, but the past is not through with us. Ideas of the Stone Age exist side by side with the latest scientific thought. Only a fraction of mankind has emerged from the Dark Ages…
general.author: bergen evans

general.quote: The past is dead, and has no resurrection.
general.author: henry kirke white

general.quote: The past is strapped to our backs. We do not have to see it; we can always feel it.
general.author: mignon mclaughlin

general.quote: The free world must not prove itself worthy of its own past.
general.author: dwight d. eisenhower quotes

general.quote: A fixed image of the future is in the worst sense a historical.
general.author: juliet mitchell

general.quote: The past can’t see you, but the future is listening.
general.author: destin figuier

general.quote: You can never plan the future by the past.
general.author: edmund burke

general.quote: Our faith in the present dies out long before our faith in the future.
general.author: ruth benedict

general.quote: You don’t just stumble into the future. You create your own future.
general.author: roger smith

general.quote: Desire and hope will push us on toward the future.
general.author: michel eyquem de montaigne

general.quote: If we were logical, the future would be bleak indeed. But we are more than logical. We are human beings, and we have faith, and we have hope, and we can work.
general.author: jacques cousteau

general.quote: Without God there is for mankind no purpose, no goal, no hope, only a wavering future, an eternal dread of every darkness.
general.author: jean paul richter

general.quote: In love, unlike most other passions, the recollection of what you have had and lost is always better than what you can hope for in the future.
general.author: henri b. stendhal

general.quote: Let your hopes, not your hurts, shape your future.
general.author: robert h. schuller

general.quote: Never be afraid to trust an unknown future to a known God.
general.author: corrie ten boom

general.quote: The best way to predict the future is to invent it.
general.author: alan kay

general.quote: People at my stage of life are apt to cherish the past and be pessimistic about the future. But when I meet energetic young people who are making wonderful contributions to the communities, I feel rejuvenated and full of hope and trust in the future.
general.author: hirokichi yoshiyama

general.quote: He who seeks to know the future is out of harmony with the present.
general.author: james lendall basford

general.quote: The future, according to some scientists, will be exactly like the past, only far more expensive.
general.author: john sladek

general.quote: The future is always beginning now.
general.author: mark strand

general.quote: Our imagination is the only limit to what we can hope to have in the future.
general.author: charles f. kettering

general.quote: The future is an opaque mirror. Anyone who tries to look into it sees nothing but the dim outlines of an old and worried face.
general.author: jim bishop

general.quote: We have inherited the past; we can create the future.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: To make a man happy, fill his hands with work, his heart with affection, his mind with purpose, his memory with useful knowledge, his future with hope, and his stomach with food.
general.author: frederick e. crane

general.quote: Man’s future is God’s secret.
general.author: james lendall basford

general.quote: The future comes one day at a time.
general.author: dean acheson

general.quote: I know not what the future holds, but I know who holds the future.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: We should all be concerned about the future because we will have to spend the rest of our lives there.
general.author: charles f. kettering

general.quote: Create your future from your future, not your past.
general.author: werner erhard

general.quote: I believe the future is only the past again, entered through another gate.
general.author: arthur wing pinero

general.quote: Hope is the positive mode of awaiting the future.
general.author: emil brunner

general.quote: The future belongs to those who believe in the beauty of their dreams.
general.author: eleanor roosevelt quotes

general.quote: The trouble with our times is that the future is not what it used to be.
general.author: paul valery

general.quote: With high hope for the future, no prediction is ventured.
general.author: abraham lincoln quotes

general.quote: There are men who run on ahead of their age, and open the gates of the future.
general.author: james lendall basford

general.quote: I never think of the future — it comes soon enough.
general.author: albert einstein quotes

general.quote: We need not be afraid of the future, for the future will be in our own hands.
general.author: thomas e. dewey

general.quote: I’m treating you as a friend asking you to share my present minuses in the hope that I can ask you to share my future pluses.
general.author: katherine mansfield

general.quote: The future is called "perhaps," which is the only possible thing to call the future. And the only important thing is not to allow that to scare you.
general.author: tennessee williams

general.quote: Neither in the life of the individual nor in that of mankind is it desirable to know the future.
general.author: jakob burckhardt

general.quote: There are certain moments when we might wish the future were built by men of the past.
general.author: jean rostand

general.quote: I fear there will be no future for those who do not change.
general.author: louis l’amour

general.quote: It is said that the present is pregnant with the future.
general.author: voltaire quotes

general.quote: The past and present are only our means; the future is always our end. Thus we never really live, but only hope to live.
general.author: blaise pascal

general.quote: The best thing about the future is that it comes only one day at a time.
general.author: abraham lincoln quotes

general.quote: A perfect summer day is when the sun is shining, the breeze is blowing, the birds are singing, and the lawn mower is broken.
general.author: james dent

general.quote: Summer afternoon—summer afternoon; to me those have always been the two most beautiful words in the English language.
general.author: henry james

general.quote: Bright summer is crowned with roses; deep in the forest arbutus doth hide.
general.author: dora read goodale

general.quote: I almost wish we were butterflies and liv’d but three summer days — three such days with you I could fill with more delight than fifty common years could ever contain.
general.author: john keats

general.quote: Summer has set in with its usual severity.
general.author: samuel taylor coleridge

general.quote: In the depth of winter, I finally learned that within me there lay an invincible summer.
general.author: albert camus

general.quote: And so with the sunshine and the great bursts of leaves growing on the trees, just as things grow in fast movies, I had that familiar conviction that life was beginning over again with the summer.
general.author: f. scott fitzgerald

general.quote: What good is the warmth of summer, without the cold of winter to give it sweetness.
general.author: john steinbeck

general.quote: Beneath the winter’s snow lie germs of summer flowers.
general.author: john greenleaf whittier

general.quote: If it could only be like this always – always summer, always alone, the fruit always ripe and Aloysius in a good temper…
general.author: evelyn waugh

general.quote: The air of summer was sweeter than wine.
general.author: henry wadsworth longfellow

general.quote: Each fairy breath of summer, as it blows with loveliness, inspires the blushing rose.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: A man says a lot of things in summer he doesn’t mean in winter.
general.author: patricia briggs

general.quote: Summer — summer — summer! The soundless footsteps on the grass!
general.author: john galsworthy

general.quote: ‘Tis the last rose of summer, left blooming alone; all her lovely companions are faded and gone.
general.author: thomas moore

general.quote: Who loves not more the night of June than cold December’s gloomy noon?
general.author: sir walter scott

general.quote: The end-of-summer winds make people restless.
general.author: sebastian faulks

general.quote: What is one to say about June, the time of perfect young summer, the fulfillment of the promise of the earlier months, and with as yet no sign to remind one that its fresh young beauty will ever fade.
general.author: gertrude jekyll

general.quote: There shall be eternal summer in the grateful heart.
general.author: celia thaxter

general.quote: For men, like butterflies, show not their mealy wings but to the summer.
general.author: william shakespeare

general.quote: Then crowned with flowery hay, came real joy, and summer, with his fervid-beaming eye.
general.author: robert burns

general.quote: One benefit of summer was that each day we had more light to read by.
general.author: jeannette walls

general.quote: Summer’s parching heat.
general.author: william shakespeare

general.quote: The bigger the summer vacation the harder the fall.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: It was June, and the world smelled of roses. The sunshine was like powdered gold over the grassy hillside.
general.author: maud hart lovelace

general.quote: We are reformers in the spring and summer, but in autumn we stand by the old. Reformers in the morning, and conservers at night.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson

general.quote: Summer will end soon enough, and childhood as well.
general.author: george r.r. martin

general.quote: Child of sun, refulgent summer, comes.
general.author: james thomson

general.quote: I know I am but summer to your heart, and not the full four seasons of the year.
general.author: edna st. vincent millay

general.quote: Ah, summer, what power you have to make us suffer and like it.
general.author: russel baker

general.quote: [W]oods are filled with the music of birds, and all nature is laughing under the glorious influence of Summer.
general.author: charles lanman

general.quote: A summer romance is something special, because it blazes like a comet across the sky and then fades out. The thing that makes it special–that makes everything move so fast–is that a summer romance is doomed to end.
general.author: john vornholt

general.quote: Summertime is always the best of what might be.
general.author: charles bowden

general.quote: Oh, the summer night, Has a smile of light, And she sits on a sapphire throne.
general.author: barry cornwall

general.quote: Summer ends, and autumn comes, and he who would have it otherwise would have high tide always and a full moon every night.
general.author: hal borland

general.quote: Warm summer sun, shine kindly here. Warm southern wind, blow softly here. Green sod above, lie light, lie light. Good night, dear Heart, Good night, good night.
general.author: mark twain

general.quote: Do what we can, summer will have its flies.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson

general.quote: Summer bachelors, like summer breezes, are never as cool as they pretend to be.
general.author: nora ephron

general.quote: It will not always be summer; build barns.
general.author: hesiod

general.quote: Thy eternal summer shall not fade.
general.author: william shakespeare

general.quote: Write about winter in the summer.
general.author: annie dillard

general.quote: After winter comes the summer. After night comes the dawn. And after every storm, there comes clear, open skies.
general.author: samuel rutherford

general.quote: Today is the tomorrow we worried about yesterday.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: Never regret yesterday. Life is in you today and you make your tomorrow.
general.author: l. ron hubbard

general.quote: Never let yesterday use up too much of today.
general.author: will rogers

general.quote: For us, the best time is always yesterday.
general.author: tatyana tolstaya

general.quote: The boy who expects every morning to open into a new world finds that today is like yesterday, but he believes tomorrow will be different.
general.author: charles dudley warner

general.quote: Procrastination is the art of keeping up with yesterday.
general.author: don marquis

general.quote: Yesterday I lived, today I suffer, tomorrow I die; but I still think fondly, today and tomorrow, of yesterday.
general.author: gotthold lessing

general.quote: Yesterday’s just a memory, tomorrow is never what it’s supposed to be.
general.author: bob dylan

general.quote: Yesterday is but today’s memory, and tomorrow is today’s dream.
general.author: khalil gibran quotes

general.quote: I am not afraid of tomorrow, for I have seen yesterday and I love today!
general.author: william allen white

general.quote: If you are still talking about what you did yesterday, you haven’t done much today.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: If you have one eye on yesterday, and one eye on tomorrow, you’re going to be cockeyed today.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: Yesterday is a canceled check: Forget it. Tomorrow is a promissory note: Don’t count on it. Today is ready cash: Use it!
general.author: edwin bliss

general.quote: There are two days in the week on which I never worry; one is yesterday and the other is tomorrow.
general.author: robert burdette

general.quote: If we spend our time with regrets over yesterday, and worries over what might happen tomorrow, we have no today in which to live.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: Learning and innovation go hand in hand. The arrogance of success is to think that what you did yesterday will be sufficient for tomorrow.
general.author: william pollard

general.quote: If what you have done yesterday still looks big to you, you haven’t done much today.
general.author: mikhail gorbachev

general.quote: Yesterday is a cancelled check. Today is cash on the line. Tomorrow is a promissory note.
general.author: hank stram

general.quote: A man he seems of cheerful yesterdays, and confident to-morrows.
general.author: william wordsworth

general.quote: Pile up too many tomorrows and you’ll find that you’ve collected nothing but a bunch of empty yesterdays.
general.author: the music man

general.quote: There is no distance on this earth as far away as yesterday.
general.author: robert nathan

general.quote: The modernity of yesterday is the tradition of today, and the modernity of today will be tradition tomorrow.
general.author: jose andres puerta

general.quote: The crisis of yesterday is the joke of tomorrow.
general.author: h.g. wells

general.quote: Tomorrow is nothing, today is too late; the good lived yesterday.
general.author: marcus aurelius

general.quote: Let go of yesterday. Let today be a new beginning and be the best that you can, and you’ll get to where God wants you to be.
general.author: joel osteen

general.quote: We usually lose today, because there has been a yesterday, and tomorrow is coming.
general.author: johann wolfgang von goethe quotes

general.quote: Learn from yesterday, live for today, hope for tomorrow.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: Yesterday’s beauty and joy lie deep, in sorrow’s heart, asleep.
general.author: marjorie allen seiffert

general.quote: Remember, today is the tomorrow you worried about yesterday.
general.author: dale carnegie

general.quote: Tomorrow is the most important thing in life. Comes into us at midnight very clean. It’s perfect when it arrives and it puts itself in our hands. It hopes we’ve learned something from yesterday.
general.author: john wayne

general.quote: I don’t believe in yesterday, by the way.
general.author: john lennon

general.quote: The world goes up and the world goes down, the sunshine follows the rain; and yesterday’s sneer and yesterday’s frown can never come over again.
general.author: charles kingsley

general.quote: No yesterdays are ever wasted for those who give themselves to today.
general.author: brendan francis

general.quote: Yesterday’s a flower the wind blows away.
general.author: louise driscoll

general.quote: If you fell down yesterday, stand up today.
general.author: h. g. wells

general.quote: Yesterday, all my troubles seemed so far away, now it looks as though they’re here to stay, Oh, I believe in yesterday.
general.author: the beatles

general.quote: It is yesterday that makes tomorrow so sad.
general.author: austin o’malley

general.quote: It’s no use going back to yesterday, because I was a different person then.
general.author: lewis carroll

general.quote: Learn from yesterday, live for today, hope for tomorrow. The important thing is not to stop questioning.
general.author: albert einstein quotes

general.quote: Let lessons of stern yesterdays . . . be your food, your drink, your rest.
general.author: joseph seamon cotter

general.quote: Yesterday is not ours to recover, but tomorrow is ours to win or lose.
general.author: lyndon b. johnson quotes

general.quote: Yesterday ended last night. Today is a brand-new day.
general.author: zig ziglar

general.quote: It is difficult to say what is impossible, for the dream of yesterday is the hope of today and the reality of tomorrow.
general.author: bob goddard

general.quote: We seem to be going through a period of nostalgia, and everyone seems to think yesterday was better than today. I don’t think it was, and I would advise you not to wait ten years before admitting today was great. If you’re hung up on nostalgia, pretend today is yesterday and just go out and have one hell of a time.
general.author: art buchwald

general.quote: I can’t go back to yesterday – because I was a different person then.
general.author: lewis carroll

general.quote: Lost – yesterday, somewhere between sunrise and sunset, two golden hours, each set with sixty diamond minutes. No reward is offered, for they are gone forever.
general.author: horace mann

general.quote: Memories are nothing but the lash with which yesterday flogs tomorrow.
general.author: philip moeller

general.quote: When another day has arrived, we will find that we have consumed our yesterday’s to-morrow; another morrow will urge on our years, and still be a little beyond us.
general.author: persius

general.quote: An economist is an expert who will know tomorrow why the things he predicted yesterday didn’t happen today.
general.author: laurence j. peter

general.quote: Tomorrow hopes we have learned something from yesterday.
general.author: john wayne

general.quote: Yesterday’s weirdness is tomorrow’s reason why.
general.author: hunter s. thompson

general.quote: Glorify who you are today, do not condemn who you were yesterday, and dream of who you can be tomorrow.
general.author: neale donald walsch

general.quote: Live not in yesterdays, Look back and you may sorrow. Live precisely for today, Look forward to tomorrow.
general.author: j.j. hulsgen

general.quote: Living in dreams of yesterday, we find ourselves still dreaming of impossible future conquests.
general.author: charles lindbergh

general.quote: We are now at a point where we must educate our children in what no one knew yesterday, and prepare our schools for what no one knows yet.
general.author: margaret mead

general.quote: If what you did yesterday seems big, you haven’t done anything today.
general.author: lou holtz

general.quote: Perhaps there is no time in a summer’s day more cheering, than when the warmth of the sun is just beginning to triumph over the freshness of the morning–when there is just a lingering hint of early coolness to keep off languor under the delicious influence of warmth.
general.author: george eliot

general.quote: In summer, the song sings itself.
general.author: william carlos williams

general.quote: Love is to the heart what the summer is to the farmer’s year — it brings to harvest all the loveliest flowers of the soul.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: Deep summer is when laziness finds respectability.
general.author: sam keen

general.quote: The trouble with the future is that is usually arrives before we’re ready for it.
general.author: arnold h. glasgow

general.quote: I have seen the future and it is very much like the present – only longer.
general.author: kehlog albran

general.quote: The Present gallops away with clattering feet, while the Future steals noiselessly upon us.
general.author: james lendall basford

general.quote: The present is the laboratory of the future.
general.author: james lendall basford

general.quote: From the experience of the past we derive instructive lessons for the future.
general.author: john quincy adams

general.quote: The past is finished. There is nothing to be gained by going over it. Whatever it gave us in the experiences it brought us was something we had to know .
general.author: rebecca beard

general.quote: If the past is not to bind us … we should have no law but the inclination of the moment.
general.author: george eliot

general.quote: History-writing is a way of getting rid of the past.
general.author: johann wolfgang von goethe

general.quote: Night is the blotting paper for many sorrows.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: You can’t stand up to the night until you understand what’s hiding in its shadows.
general.author: charles de lint

general.quote: By night, an atheist half believes in God.
general.author: edward young

general.quote: Dawn: When men of reason go to bed.
general.author: ambrose bierce

general.quote: Put yourself in competition with yourself each day. Each morning look back upon your work of yesterday and then try to beat it.
general.author: charles m. sheldon

general.quote: The mind is found most acute and most uneasy in the morning.
general.author: johann wolfgang von goethe

general.quote: No man knows till he has suffered from the night how sweet and dear to his heart and eye the morning can be.
general.author: bram stoker

general.quote: To have a reason to get up in the morning, it is necessary to possess a guiding principle.
general.author: judith guest

general.quote: Work hard, stay positive, and get up early. It’s the best part of the day.
general.author: george allen

general.quote: It is always with excitement that I wake up in the morning wondering what my intuition will toss up to me, like gifts from the sea. I work with it and rely on it. It’s my partner.
general.author: dr. jonas salk

general.quote: It is the set of the sails, not the direction of the wind that determines which way we will go.
general.author: jim rohn

general.quote: Money can’t buy you happiness, but it can buy you a yacht big enough to pull up right alongside it.
general.author: david lee roth

general.quote: I don’t get cast as the guy who steps off a yacht in a white linen suit with a martini.
general.author: martin freeman

general.quote: It is not the ship so much as the skillful sailing that assures the prosperous voyage.
general.author: george william curtis

general.quote: Modern carpet designs may provide endless entertainment for your guests.
general.author: w. heath robinson and k.r.g. browne

general.quote: The first day a man is a guest, the second a burden, the third a pest.
general.author: edouard rene lefebure laboulaye

general.quote: One might well say that mankind is divisible into two great classes: hosts and guests.
general.author: max beerbohm

general.quote: Dessert is probably the most important stage of the meal, since it will be the last thing your guests remember before they pass out all over the table.
general.author: william powell

general.quote: If happy little bluebirds fly beyond the rainbow, why oh why can’t I?
general.author: e.y. harburg

general.quote: Thank God men cannot fly, and lay waste the sky as well as the earth.
general.author: henry david thoreau

general.quote: In the space age, man will be able to go around the world in two hours – one hour for flying and one hour to get to the airport.
general.author: neil mcelroy

general.quote: When once you have tasted flight, you will forever walk the earth with your eyes turned skyward, for there you have been, and there you will always long to return.
general.author: leonardo da vinci

general.quote: It’s a never ending battle of making your cars better and also trying to be better yourself.
general.author: dale earnhardt

general.quote: A business like an automobile has to be driven, in order to get results.
general.author: b. c. forbes

general.quote: The elderly don’t drive that badly; they’re just the only ones with time to do the speed limit.
general.author: jason love

general.quote: I love to travel, but hate to arrive.
general.author: albert einstein

general.quote: To travel hopefully is a better thing than to arrive, and the true success is to labor.
general.author: robert louis stevenson

general.quote: To be a successful hostess, when guest arrive say, "At last!" and when they leave say, "So soon!".
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: Peace is not merely a distant goal that we seek, but a means by which we arrive at that goal.
general.author: martin luther king jr.

general.quote: The greatest event for the world is the arrival of a new and wise person.
general.author: thomas carlyle

general.quote: Adventure is not outside a man; it is within.
general.author: david grayson

general.quote: Belief in oneself is one of the most important bricks in building any successful venture.
general.author: frank gifford

general.quote: A work of art is above all an adventure of the mind.
general.author: eugene ionesco

general.quote: There are two kinds of adventurers: those who go truly hoping to find adventure and those who go secretly hoping they won’t.
general.author: william trogdon

general.quote: Have enough courage to trust love one more time and always one more time.
general.author: maya angelou

general.quote: As contagion of sickness makes sickness, contagion of trust can make trust.
general.author: marianne moore

general.quote: Trust in yourself. Your perceptions are often far more accurate than you are willing to believe.
general.author: claudia black

general.quote: Trust exists; only lies are invented.
general.author: georges braque

general.quote: "There are seeds of self-destruction in all of us that will bear only unhappiness if allowed to grow."
general.author: dorothea brande

general.quote: "Much unhappiness results from our inability to remember the nice things that happen to us."
general.author: w.n. rieger

general.quote: "The world will never be long without some good reason to hate the unhappy; their real faults are immediately detected, and if those are not sufficient to sink them into infamy, an additional weight of calumny will be super added."
general.author: samuel johnson

general.quote: "How unhappy is he who cannot forgive himself."
general.author: publilius syrus

general.quote: Accept the pain, cherish the joys, resolve the regrets; then can come the best of benedictions, "If I had my life to live over, I’d do it all the same.
general.author: joan mcintosh

general.quote: The person whose doors I enter with most pleasure, and quit with most regret, never did me the smallest favor.
general.author: william hazlitt

general.quote: Go to the effort. Invest the time. Write the letter. Make the apology. Take the trip. Purchase the gift. Do it. The seized opportunity renders joy. The neglected brings regret.
general.author: max l. lucado

general.quote: Heart knows no sorrow like the sorrow of regretting.
general.author: martha lavinia hoffman

general.quote: Passion is the genesis of genius.
general.author: anthony robbins

general.quote: Understanding should go first and find out the way, then passion should be as wings to carry us on in it.
general.author: benjamin whichcote

general.quote: Men live by intervals of reason under the sovereignty of humor and passion.
general.author: sir thomas browne

general.quote: Great passions are incurable diseases.
general.author: johann wolfgang von goethe

general.quote: Life is pain and the enjoyment of love is an anesthetic.
general.author: cesare pavese

general.quote: It is pain that changes our lives.
general.author: steve martin

general.quote: Pain is less subject than pleasure to careless expression.
general.author: samuel johnson

general.quote: Nature has placed mankind under the government of two sovereign masters, pain and pleasure.
general.author: jeremy bentham

general.quote: There’s one way to find out if a man is honest — ask him. If he says, "Yes," you know he is a crook.
general.author: groucho marx

general.quote: An honest man’s word is as good as his bond.
general.author: cervantes

general.quote: Honest hearts produce honest actions.
general.author: brigham young

general.quote: With death comes honesty.
general.author: salman rushdie

general.quote: Luck is being ready for the chance.
general.author: j. frank doble

general.quote: Luck never made a man wise.
general.author: seneca

general.quote: The man who is intent on making the most of his opportunities is too busy to bother about luck.
general.author: b.c. forbes

general.quote: The amount of good luck coming your way depends on your willingness to act.
general.author: barbara sher

general.quote: It is better to be unfaithful than faithful without wanting to be.
general.author: brigitte bardot

general.quote: Camerado, I give you my hand; I give you my love more precious than money; I give you myself before preaching or law. Will you give me yourself?
general.author: walt whitman

general.quote: Constancy… that small change of love, which people exact so rigidly, receive in such counterfeit coin, and repay in baser metal.
general.author: lord byron

general.quote: Histories are more full of examples of the fidelity of dogs than of friends.
general.author: alexander pope

general.quote: Jealousy is bred in doubts. When those doubts change into certainties, then the passion either ceases or turns absolute madness.
general.author: francois de la rochefoucauld

general.quote: Jealousy would be far less torturous if we understood that love is a passion entirely unrelated to our merits.
general.author: paul eldridge

general.quote: Jealousy — that jumble of secret worship and ostensible aversion.
general.author: emil cioran

general.quote: Envy is a littleness of soul, which cannot see beyond a certain point, and if it does not occupy the whole space feels itself excluded.
general.author: william hazlitt

general.quote: Happiness is distraction from the human tragedy.
general.author: j.m. reinoso

general.quote: Those who are not looking for happiness are the most likely to find it, because those who are searching forget that the surest way to be happy is to seek happiness for others.
general.author: martin luther

general.quote: Unquestionably, it is possible to do without happiness; it is done involuntarily by nineteen-twentieths of mankind.
general.author: john stuart mill

general.quote: The secret of happiness is freedom, and the secret of freedom is courage.
general.author: thucydides

general.quote: You have been given freedom… to love and serve each other.
general.author: bible

general.quote: Freedom has its life in the hearts, the actions, the spirit of men and so it must be daily earned and refreshed – else like a flower cut from its life-giving roots, it will wither and die.
general.author: dwight d. eisenhower

general.quote: No matter what a man does, he is not fully sane or human unless there is a spirit of freedom in him, a soul unconfined by purpose and larger than the practicable world.
general.author: charles horton cooley

general.quote: If you are prepared, then you are able to feel confident.
general.author: robert j. ringer

general.quote: A competent and self-confident person is incapable of jealousy in anything. Jealousy is invariably a symptom of neurotic insecurity.
general.author: lazarus long

general.quote: We have to serve ourselves many years before we gain our own confidence.
general.author: henry s. haskins

general.quote: I’m sorry my existence is not very noble or sublime.
general.author: keanu reeves

general.quote: If people are good only because they fear punishment, and hope for reward, then we are a sorry lot indeed.
general.author: albert einstein quotes

general.quote: We would often be sorry if our wishes were gratified.
general.author: aesop

general.quote: Love means not ever having to say you’re sorry.
general.author: erich segal

general.quote: The ability to forgive is one of man’s greatest achievements."
general.author: bryant h. mcgill

general.quote: The first requisite for success is the ability to apply your physical and mental energies to one problem incessantly without growing weary."
general.author: thomas a. edison

general.quote: My most brilliant achievement was my ability to be able to persuade my wife to marry me."
general.author: winston churchill

general.quote: No amount of ability is of the slightest avail without honor."
general.author: andrew carnegie

general.quote: To suppose as we all suppose, that we could be rich and not behave as the rich behave, is like supposing that we could drink all day and stay sober.
general.author: logan pearsall smith

general.quote: Of all classes the rich are the most noticed and the least studied.
general.author: john kenneth galbraith

general.quote: Riches have never fascinated me, unless combined with the greatest charm or distinction.
general.author: f.scott fitzgerald

general.quote: I have the greatest of all riches: that of not desiring them.
general.author: eleanora duse

general.quote: The blaze of reputation cannot be blown out, but it often dies in the socket; a very few names may be considered as perpetual lamps that shine unconsumed.
general.author: samuel johnson

general.quote: A reputation for a thousand years may depend upon the conduct of a single moment.
general.author: ernest bramah

general.quote: An eminent reputation is as dangerous as a bad one.
general.author: tacitus

general.quote: At ev’ry word a reputation dies.
general.author: alexander pope

general.quote: The engine which drives enterprise is not thrift, but profit.
general.author: john maynard keynes

general.quote: If you count all your assets you always show a profit.
general.author: wilson mizner

general.quote: Loss is nothing else but change, and change is Nature’s delight.
general.author: marcus aurelius

general.quote: Profits are like breathing. You have to have them. But who would stay alive just to breathe?
general.author: maurice mascaranhas

general.quote: When one has a great deal to put into it a day has a hundred pockets.
general.author: friedrich nietzsche

general.quote: Since the governments are in the pockets of businesses, who’s going to control this most powerful institution? Business is more powerful than politics, and it’s more powerful than religion. So it’s going to have to be the vigilante consumer.
general.author: anita roddick

general.quote: We carry around computers in our pockets. Many people barely use them as phones. We use them as computers. If you think about the future, when you’re traveling around, it’s great to have a lightweight, small form factor.
general.author: mitchell baker

general.quote: If workers have less money in their pockets to put food on the table, they will be spending less money; your economy will suffer.
general.author: martin o’malley

general.quote: Boldness is business is the first, second, and third thing.
general.author: h.g bohn

general.quote: It’s better to take over and build upon an existing business than to start a new one.
general.author: harold s. geneen

general.quote: The first rule of any technology used in a business is that automation applied to an efficient operation will magnify the efficiency. The second is that automation applied to an inefficient operation will magnify the inefficiency.
general.author: bill gates

general.quote: Business opportunities are like buses, there’s always another one coming.
general.author: richard branson

general.quote: Better a lean agreement than a fat lawsuit.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: No two on earth in all things can agree. All have some daring singularity.
general.author: winston churchill

general.quote: Don’t agree and believe that success comes free… Gold on the floor is a lie! You must dig deep and then you will reap big!
general.author: israelmore ayivor

general.quote: On one issue at least, men and women agree; they both distrust women.
general.author: h. l. mencken

general.quote: Wisdom doesn’t necessarily come with age. Sometimes age just shows up all by itself.
general.author: tom wilson

general.quote: Wisdom is knowing what to do next; virtue is doing it.
general.author: david star jordan

general.quote: Wisdom is like electricity. There is no permanently wise man, but men capable of wisdom, who, being put into certain company, or other favorable conditions, become wise for a short time, as glasses rubbed acquire electric power for a while.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson quotes

general.quote: The growth of wisdom may be gauged exactly by the diminution of ill temper.
general.author: friedrich nietzsche

general.quote: Instructors should not only be skilful in those sciences which they teach, but have skill in the method of teaching, and patience in the practice.
general.author: isaac watts

general.quote: The world of knowledge takes a crazy turn when teachers themselves are taught to learn.
general.author: bertolt brecht

general.quote: Experience is the worst teacher; it gives the test before presenting the lesson.
general.author: vernon s. law

general.quote: No one ever teaches well who wants to teach, or governs well who wants to govern.
general.author: plato

general.quote: I like to get my hands dirty. Talk is cheap.
general.author: chen guangbiao

general.quote: I do do a lot of talking, because it saves me listening.
general.author: david hockney

general.quote: As a man sow, shall he reap. and I know that talk is cheap. But the heat of the battle is as sweet as the victory.
general.author: bob marley

general.quote: Anybody who thinks talk is cheap should get some legal advice.
general.author: franklin p. jones

general.quote: Stupidity combined with arrogance and a huge ego will get you a long way.
general.author: chris lowe

general.quote: To be clever enough to get all the money, one must be stupid enough to want it.
general.author: gilbert k. chesterton

general.quote: It is so pleasant to come across people more stupid than ourselves. We love them at once for being so.
general.author: jerome k. jerome

general.quote: We are all born ignorant, but one must work hard to remain stupid.
general.author: benjamin franklin

general.quote: Name is a fence and within it you are nameless.
general.author: samuli paronen

general.quote: I would rather make my name than inherit it.
general.author: william m thackeray

general.quote: People’s fates are simplified by their names.
general.author: elias canetti

general.quote: To live in mankind is far more than to live in a name.
general.author: vachel lindsay

general.quote: Curiosity is one of the permanent and certain characteristics of a vigorous mind.
general.author: samuel johnson

general.quote: Each story we approach in the same way, with curiosity and interest and determination to get behind the image.
general.author: martin bashir

general.quote: Curiosity begins as an act of tearing to pieces or analysis.
general.author: samuel alexander

general.quote: When the newspapers have got nothing else to talk about, they cut loose on the young. The young are always news. If they are up to something, that’s news. If they aren’t, that’s news too.
general.author: kenneth rexroth

general.quote: We live under a government of men and morning newspapers.
general.author: wendell phillips

general.quote: People everywhere confuse what they read in newspapers with news.
general.author: a.j. liebling

general.quote: One little person, giving all of her time to peace, makes news. Many people, giving some of their time, can make history.
general.author: peace pilgrim

general.quote: Only a weak mind seeks ultimate answers.
general.author: agnes thornton

general.quote: He who knows all the answers has not yet been asked all the questions.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: Too often we give children answers to remember rather than problems to solve.
general.author: roger lewin

general.quote: Judge a person by their questions, rather than their answers.
general.author: voltaire qoutes

general.quote: Tears mess up your makeup.
general.author: julia child

general.quote: Oh, I am very weary, though tears no longer flow; my eyes are tired of weeping, my heart is sick of woe.
general.author: anne bronte

general.quote: The soul would have no rainbow had the eyes no tears.
general.author: john vance cheney

general.quote: Tears are the noble language of the eye.
general.author: robert herrick

general.quote: Who will not suffer labor in this world, let him not be born.
general.author: john florio

general.quote: Thank God for a few free waves.
general.author: miki dora

general.quote: The tragedy of life is not so much what men suffer, but rather what they miss.
general.author: thomas carlyle

general.quote: We ought to fear a man who hates himself, for we are at risk of becoming victims of his anger and revenge. Let us then try to lure him into self-love.
general.author: friedrich nietzsche

general.quote: You will find that silence or very gentle words are the most exquisite revenge for insult.
general.author: judge hall

general.quote: The indulgence of revenge tends to make men more savage and cruel.
general.author: henry home

general.quote: Revenge is a kind of wild justice, which the more a man’s nature runs to, the more ought law to weed it out.
general.author: francis bacon

general.quote: A mind enclosed in language is in prison.
general.author: simone weil

general.quote: Prisons are built with stones of Law, Brothels with bricks of Religion.
general.author: william blake

general.quote: Two men look out the same prison bars; one sees mud and the other stars.
general.author: frederick langbridge

general.quote: He who opens a school door, closes a prison.
general.author: victor hugo

general.quote: No one ever discovers the depths of his own loneliness.
general.author: georges bernanos

general.quote: When so many are lonely as seem to be lonely, it would be inexcusably selfish to be lonely alone.
general.author: tennessee williams

general.quote: The surest cure for vanity is loneliness.
general.author: thomas wolfe

general.quote: You cannot be lonely if you like the person you’re alone with.
general.author: wayne dyer

general.quote: Every failure teaches a man something if he will learn.
general.author: charles dickens

general.quote: Failure changes for the better, success for the worse.
general.author: lucius annaeus seneca

general.quote: One who fears failure limits his activities.
general.author: henry ford quotes

general.quote: Failures to heroic minds are the stepping stones to success.
general.author: thomas c. haliburton

general.quote: It is better to be alone than in bad company.
general.author: george washington

general.quote: I was never less alone than when by myself.
general.author: edward gibbon

general.quote: Every man must do two things alone; he must do his own believing and his own dying.
general.author: martin luther

general.quote: I don’t want to be alone; I want to be left alone.
general.author: audrey hepburn

general.quote: Life is God’s joke on us. It’s our mission to figure out the punch line.
general.author: john guarrine

general.quote: If you want anything done well, do it yourself. This is why most people laugh at their own jokes.
general.author: bob edwards

general.quote: Were it not for my little jokes, I could not bear the burdens of this office.
general.author: abraham lincoln

general.quote: I hope life isn’t a big joke, because I don’t get it.
general.author: jack handey

general.quote: If faith without works is dead, willingness without action is fantasy.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: Action is the only reality; not only reality, but morality as well.
general.author: abbie hoffman

general.quote: We are taught by great actions that the universe is the property of every individual in it.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson quotes

general.quote: Action is eloquence.
general.author: william shakespeare quotes

general.quote: Competition is not only the basis of protection to the consumer, but is the incentive to progress.
general.author: herbert hoover

general.quote: All you have to do is play better than the other guy and things go well. If you don’t play better than the other players then somebody takes your place. Now a lot of guys, in this day and time with the transient nature of the sport, as soon as the competition gets too good, they want out.
general.author: bill parcells

general.quote: Slow but steady wins the race.
general.author: aesop

general.quote: Competition is the spice of sports; but if you make spice the whole meal you’ll be sick.
general.author: george leonard

general.quote: Whether you be man or woman you will never do anything in this world without courage. It is the greatest quality of the mind next to honor.
general.author: james allen

general.quote: Courage is the virtue which champions the cause of right.
general.author: marcus t. cicero

general.quote: All our dreams can come true, if we have the courage to pursue them.
general.author: walt disney

general.quote: Courage is the price that life exacts for granting peace.
general.author: amelia earhart

general.quote: Perhaps the best definition of progress would be the continuing efforts of men and women to narrow the gap between the convenience of the powers that be and the unwritten charter.
general.author: nadine gordimer

general.quote: One is happy as a result of one’s own efforts — once one knows the necessary ingredients of happiness — simple tastes, a certain degree of courage, self-denial to a point, love of work, and, above all, a clear conscience.
general.author: george sand

general.quote: So get a few laughs and do the best you can.
general.author: will rogers

general.quote: Men are convinced of your arguments, your sincerity, and the seriousness of your efforts only by your death.
general.author: albert camus quotes

general.quote: Goals are dreams with deadlines.
general.author: diana scharf hunt

general.quote: Success as I see it is a result, not a goal.
general.author: gustave flaubert

general.quote: A good system shortens the road to the goal.
general.author: orison swett marden

general.quote: Far away the best prize that life offers is the chance to work hard at work worth doing.
general.author: theodore roosevelt

general.quote: Hard work never hurt anyone who hired someone else to do it.
general.author: evan esar

general.quote: How hard you work matters more than how much you make.
general.author: michelle obama

general.quote: If you care about what you do and work hard at it, there isn’t anything you can’t do if you want to.
general.author: jim henson

general.quote: Opportunities multiply as they are seized; they die when neglected.
general.author: john wicker

general.quote: Opportunity dances with those who are ready on the dance floor.
general.author: h. jackson brown jr.

general.quote: A good opportunity is seldom presented, and is easily lost.
general.author: syrus

general.quote: A wise man will make more opportunities than he finds.
general.author: francis bacon

general.quote: It’s not the plan that is important, it’s the planning.
general.author: graeme edwards

general.quote: Planning is bringing the future into the present so that you can do something about it now.
general.author: alan lakein

general.quote: Winners never quit, and quitters never win.
general.author: vince lombardi

general.quote: If we do not succeed, then we run the risk of failure.
general.author: dan quayle

general.quote: If you’re not a risk taker, you should get the hell out of business.
general.author: ray kroc

general.quote: Everything is sweetened by risk.
general.author: alexander smith

general.quote: Rest satisfied with doing well, and leave others to talk of you as they please.
general.author: pythagoras

general.quote: Better a little which is well done, than a great deal imperfectly.
general.author: plato

general.quote: The reward of a thing well done is to have done it.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson

general.quote: The reward for work well done is the opportunity to do more.
general.author: dr. jonas salk

general.quote: If you want to make beautiful music, you must play the black and the white notes together.
general.author: richard m.nixon

general.quote: We are one, after all, you and I. Together we suffer, together exist, and forever will recreate each other.
general.author: pierre teilhard de chardin

general.quote: That is what our educational system has to encourage. It has to foster the social goals of living together, and working together, for the common good.
general.author: julius kambarge nyerere

general.quote: We cannot be separated in interest or divided in purpose. We stand together until the end.
general.author: woodrow t.wilson

general.quote: One test of strength is the ability to take defeat graciously.
general.author: lewise korns

general.quote: Faith is the strength by which a shattered world shall emerge into the light.
general.author: helen keller

general.quote: The strong are God’s natural protectors of the weak.
general.author: henry ward beecher

general.quote: Our strength is often composed of the weakness we’re damned if we’re going to show.
general.author: mignon mclaughlin

general.quote: We confide in our strength, without boasting of it; we respect that of others, without fearing it.
general.author: thomas jefferson

general.quote: A powerful idea communicates some of its strength to him who challenges it.
general.author: marcel proust

general.quote: He sends a cross, but He also sends the strength to bear it.
general.author: leo s tolstoy

general.quote: Few men during their lifetime come anywhere near exhausting the resources dwelling within them. There are deep wells of strength that are never used.
general.author: richard btrd

general.quote: Be faithful in small things because it is in them that your strength lies.
general.author: mother teresa

general.quote: The strongest may have need of more strength.
general.author: edward counsel

general.quote: Strength comes from solitude, a waiting, a communion with the best in us, which is at one with the divine spark.
general.author: elbert hubbard

general.quote: Strengthen me by sympathizing with my strength, not my weakness.
general.author: amos bronson alcott

general.quote: It does not take much strength to do things, but it requires great strength to decide what to do.
general.author: elbert hubbard

general.quote: The man who is swimming against the stream knows the strength of it.
general.author: woodrow t. wilson

general.quote: The greatest strength expires with loss of breath; the mightiest in one minute stoop to death.
general.author: thomas dekker

general.quote: People do not lack strength; they lack will.
general.author: victor hugo

general.quote: Only actions give life strength; only moderation gives it charm.
general.author: jean paul richter

general.quote: Cunning is better than strength.
general.author: bahamian

general.quote: You really have to look inside yourself and find your own inner strength, and say, "I’m proud of what I am and who I am, and I’m just going to be myself.
general.author: mariah carey

general.quote: Mastering others is strength; mastering yourself is true power…
general.author: tao te ching

general.quote: Strength is an empty shell.
general.author: jack london

general.quote: Consciousness of our strength increases it.
general.author: lucde claoiers

general.quote: The hand of the aggressor is stayed by strength–and strength alone.
general.author: dwight eisenhower

general.quote: Charm is a woman’s strength just as strength is a man’s charm.
general.author: havelock ellis

general.quote: We acquire the strength we have overcome.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson

general.quote: Never be afraid to expose a weakness in yourself. Exposing a weakness is the beginning of strength.
general.author: robert anthony

general.quote: Love many things, for therein lies the true strength, and whosoever loves much performs much, and can accomplish much, and what is done in love is done well.
general.author: vincent van gogh

general.quote: We do not have to become heroes overnight. Just a step at a time, meeting each thing that comes up … discovering we have the strength to stare it down.
general.author: eleanor roosevelt

general.quote: That which does not kill me makes me stronger.
general.author: friedrich nietzsche

general.quote: As long as I fear my weakness, I am stronger than when I trust my strength.
general.author: ivan panin

general.quote: Oh, it is excellent to have a giant’s strength, but it is tyrannous to use it like a giant.
general.author: william shakespeare

general.quote: If we are strong, our strength will speak for itself. If we are weak, words will be of no help.
general.author: john kennedy

general.quote: As our heart summons our strength, our wisdom must direct it.
general.author: dwight eisenhower

general.quote: The strength of a nation derives from the integrity of the home.
general.author: confucius

general.quote: Strength, if not used to protect, is but weakness.
general.author: lewise korns

general.quote: My strength is as the strength of ten, because my heart is pure.
general.author: alfred tennyson

general.quote: Endurance is nobler than strength and patience than beauty.
general.author: john ruskin

general.quote: Credulity is the man’s weakness, but the child’s strength.
general.author: charles lamb

general.quote: It is not when the cable lies coiled up on the deck that you know how strong or how weak it is; it is when it is put to the test.
general.author: henry ward beecher

general.quote: No man is infinitely strong; for every creature that runs, flies, hops or crawls there is a terminal nemesis which he will not circumvent, which will finally do him in.
general.author: philip dick

general.quote: Real strength never impairs beauty of harmony, but it often bestows it; and in everything imposingly beautiful, strength has much to do with the magic.
general.author: herman melville

general.quote: Where is the good in goodbye?
general.author: meredith willson

general.quote: Never part without loving words to think of during your absence. It may be that you will not meet again in this life.
general.author: jean paul richter

general.quote: Why does it take a minute to say hello and forever to say goodbye?
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: We only part to meet again.
general.author: john gay

general.quote: Goodbye, goodbye, I hate the word. Solitude has long since turned brown and withered, sitting bitter in my mouth and heavy in my veins.
general.author: r.m. grenon

general.quote: Until we meet again, may the good Lord take a liking to you."
general.author: roy rogers

general.quote: The return makes one love the farewell.
general.author: alfred de musset

general.quote: See you later, alligator. After a while, crocodile.
general.author: bill haley

general.quote: It’s time to say goodbye, but I think goodbyes are sad and I’d much rather say hello. Hello to a new adventure.
general.author: ernie harwell

general.quote: Don’t be dismayed at goodbyes. A farewell is necessary before you can meet again. And meeting again, after moments or lifetime, is certain for those who are friends.
general.author: richard bach

general.quote: A goodbye isn’t painful unless you’re never going to say hello again.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: Be well, do good work, and keep in touch.
general.author: garrison keillor

general.quote: Farewell! "But not for ever.
general.author: william cowper

general.quote: Absent in body, but present in spirit.
general.author: saint paul
