general.quote: Man is a dog’s idea of what God should be.
general.author: holbrook jackson

general.quote: Dogs have given us their absolute all. We are the center of their universe. We are the focus of their love and faith and trust. They serve us in return for scraps. It is without a doubt the best deal man has ever made.
general.author: roger caras

general.quote: The greatest pleasure of a dog is that you make a fool of yourself with him and not only will he not scold you, but he will make a fool of himself too.
general.author: samuel butler

general.quote: One reason a dog can be such a comfort when you’re feeling blue is that he doesn’t try to find out why.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: Who loves me will love my dog also.
general.author: saint bernard of clairvaux

general.quote: They never talk about themselves but listen to you while you talk about yourself, and keep up an appearance of being interested in the conversation.
general.author: jerome k. jerome

general.quote: Properly trained, a man can be dog’s best friend.
general.author: corey ford

general.quote: I love a dog. He does nothing for political reasons.
general.author: will rogers

general.quote: When a man’s best friend is his dog, that dog has a problem.
general.author: edward abbey

general.quote: Dogs are just wolves in sheep’s clothing.
general.author: stanley coren

general.quote: The dog is the only animal that leaves his own species to take up his abode with man.
general.author: oliver goldsmith

general.quote: Newfoundland dogs are good to save children from drowning, but you must have a pond of water handy and a child, or else there will be no profit in boarding a Newfoundland.
general.author: josh billings

general.quote: Barking dogs occasionally bite, but laughing men hardly ever shoot.
general.author: konrad zacharias lorenz

general.quote: Anybody who doesn’t know what soap tastes like never washed a dog.
general.author: franklin p. jones

general.quote: To his dog, every man is Napoleon; hence the constant popularity of dogs.
general.author: aldous huxley

general.quote: In order to really enjoy a dog, one doesn’t merely try to train him to be semi human. The point of it is to open oneself to the possibility of becoming partly a dog.
general.author: edward hoagland

general.quote: Young blood must have its course, lad, and every dog its day.
general.author: charles kingsley

general.quote: There is no psychiatrist in the world like a puppy licking your face.
general.author: bernard williams

general.quote: Outside of a dog, a book is man’s best friend. Inside of a dog it’s too dark to read.
general.author: groucho marx

general.quote: When a dog barks at the moon, then it is religion; but when he barks at strangers, it is patriotism!
general.author: david starr jordan

general.quote: Scratch a dog and you’ll find a permanent job.
general.author: franklin p. jones

general.quote: A dog is not "almost human" and I know of no greater insult to the canine race than to describe it as such.
general.author: john holmes

general.quote: Every boy who has a dog should also have a mother, so the dog can be fed regularly.
general.author: evan esar

general.quote: The better I get to know men, the more I find myself loving dogs.
general.author: charles andre joseph de gaulle

general.quote: Standing armies can never consist of resolute robust men; they may be well-disciplined machines, but they will seldom contain men under the influence of strong passions, or with very vigorous faculties.
general.author: mary wollstonecraft

general.quote: He belonged to that army known as invincible in peace, invisible in war.
general.author: general william tecumseh sherman

general.quote: The supreme art of war is to subdue the enemy without fighting.
general.author: sun tzu

general.quote: A standing army is one of the greatest mischief’s that can possibly happen.
general.author: james madison

general.quote: I am not afraid of an army of lions led by a sheep; I am afraid of an army of sheep led by a lion.
general.author: alexander the great

general.quote: Discipline is the soul of an army. It makes small numbers formidable; procures success to the weak and esteem to all.
general.author: george washington

general.quote: An army without culture is a dull-witted army, and a dull-witted army cannot defeat the enemy.
general.author: zedong mao

general.quote: An army marches on its stomach.
general.author: napoleon bonaparte

general.quote: Nothing can be more hurtful to the service, than the neglect of discipline; for that discipline, more than numbers, gives one army the superiority over another.
general.author: george washington

general.quote: The Romans thought of themselves as the chosen people, yet they built the greatest army on Earth by recruiting warriors from any background.
general.author: amy chua

general.quote: You are not going to get peace with millions of armed men. The chariot of peace cannot advance over a road littered with cannon.
general.author: david lloyd george

general.quote: Join the Army, see the world, meet interesting people — and kill them.
general.author: pacifist badge

general.quote: Secret operations are essential in war; upon them the army relies to make its every move.
general.author: sun tzu

general.quote: The army is a good book to open to study human life. One learns there to put his hand to everything, to the lowest and highest things. The most delicate and rich are forced to see living nearly everywhere poverty, and to live with it, and to measure his morsel of bread and draught of water.
general.author: comte alfred victor de vigny

general.quote: An army formed of good officers moves like clockwork; but there is no situation upon earth less enviable, nor more distressing, than that person’s who is at the head of troops which are regardless of order and discipline.
general.author: george washington

general.quote: That’s what an army is — a mob; they don’t fight with courage that’s born in them, but with courage that’s borrowed from their mass, and from their officers.
general.author: mark twain

general.quote: No army has ever done so much with so little.
general.author: general douglas macarthur

general.quote: The army is always the same. The sun and the moon change. The army knows no seasons.
general.author: frank s. nugent

general.quote: None but an armed nation can dispense with a standing army.
general.author: thomas jefferson

general.quote: It is better to have a lion at the head of an army of sheep, than a sheep at the head of an army of lions.
general.author: daniel defoe

general.quote: No nation ever had an army large enough to guarantee it against attack in time of peace or insure it victory in time of war.
general.author: calvin coolidge

general.quote: Victory usually goes to the army who has better trained officers and men.
general.author: sun tzu

general.quote: The sergeant is the Army.
general.author: dwight d. eisenhower

general.quote: History shows that there are no invincible armies.
general.author: joseph stalin

general.quote: The army is the true nobility of our country.
general.author: napoleon iii

general.quote: What hath night to do with sleep?
general.author: john milton

general.quote: Life begins at night
general.author: charlaine harris

general.quote: The darker the night, the brighter the stars, The deeper the grief, the closer is God!
general.author: fyodor dostoyevsky

general.quote: Let your entrance into the sick room decrease, not increase, the irritability of your patient.
general.author: martin h. fischer

general.quote: Stress is nothing more than a socially acceptable form of mental illness.
general.author: richard carlson

general.quote: I reckon being ill as one of the great pleasures of life, provided one is not too ill and is not obliged to work till one is better.
general.author: samuel butler

general.quote: In sickness the soul begins to dress herself for immortality. And first she unties the strings of vanity that made her upper garments cleave to the world and sit uneasy.
general.author: jeremy taylor

general.quote: For each illness that doctors cure with medicine, they provoke ten in healthy people by inoculating them with the virus that is a thousand times more powerful than any microbe: the idea that one is ill.
general.author: marcel proust

general.quote: Many ordinary illnesses are nothing but the expression of a serious dissatisfaction with life.
general.author: dr. paul tournier

general.quote: You can die of the cure before you die of the illness.
general.author: michael landon

general.quote: A wise man should consider that health is the greatest of human blessings, and learn how by his own thought to derive benefit from his illnesses.
general.author: hippocrates

general.quote: If you constantly think of illness, you eventually become ill; if you believe yourself to be beautiful, you become so.
general.author: shakti gawain

general.quote: Most of the time we think we’re sick, it’s all in the mind.
general.author: thomas wolfe

general.quote: An illness is like a journey into a far country; it sifts all one’s experience and removes it to a point so remote that it appears like a vision.
general.author: sholem asch

general.quote: Ill-health, of body or of mind, is defeat. Health alone is victory. Let all men, if they can manage it, contrive to be healthy! "
general.author: thomas carlyle

general.quote: Do not believe yourself healthy. Immortality is health; this life is a long sickness.
general.author: st. augustine

general.quote: Those who think they have not time for bodily exercise will sooner or later have to find time for illness.
general.author: edward stanley

general.quote: Neurotics complain of their illness, but they make the most of it, and when it comes to talking it away from them they will defend it like a lioness her young.
general.author: sigmund freud

general.quote: Just like those who are incurably ill, the aged know everything about their dying except exactly when.
general.author: philip roth

general.quote: The secret of learning to be sick is this: Illness doesn’t make you less of what you were. You are still you.
general.author: tony snow

general.quote: Few spirits are made better by the pain and languor of sickness; as few great pilgrims become eminent saints.
general.author: thomas a kempis

general.quote: When you are called to a sick man, be sure you know what the matter is — if you do not know, nature can do a great deal better than you can guess.
general.author: nicholas de belleville

general.quote: To safeguard one’s health at the cost of too strict a diet is a tiresome illness indeed.
general.author: francois de la rochefoucauld

general.quote: Humor may be hazardous to your illness.
general.author: ellie katz

general.quote: Sickness is a belief, to be annihilated by the divine Mind.
general.author: mrs. mary baker glover eddy

general.quote: Refuse to be ill. Never tell people you are ill; never own it to yourself. Illness is one of those things which a man should resist on principle at the onset.
general.author: edward g. bulwer-lytton

general.quote: If you be sick, your own thoughts make you sick.
general.author: ben jonson

general.quote: If you start to think about your physical or moral condition, you usually find that you are sick.
general.author: johann wolfgang von goethe

general.quote: To hate and to fear is the be psychologically ill… it is, in fact, the consuming illness of our time.
general.author: harry a. overstreet

general.quote: Most illnesses do not, as is generally thought, come like a bolt out of the blue. The ground is prepared for years through faulty diet, intemperance, overwork, and moral conflicts, slowly eroding the subject’s vitality.
general.author: dr. paul tournier

general.quote: In sickness let me not so much say, am I getting better of my pain? as am I getting better for it? "
general.author: william shakespeare

general.quote: To live by medicine is to live horribly.
general.author: carolus linnaeus

general.quote: There are two kinds of people; those who are always well and those who are always sick. Most of the evils of the world come from the first sort and most of the achievement from the second.
general.author: louis dudek

general.quote: To be too conscious is an illness. A real thorough going illness."
general.author: fyodor dostoevsky

general.quote: It is dainty to be sick, if you have leisure and convenience for it.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson

general.quote: Illness is the doctor to whom we pay most heed; to kindness, to knowledge we make promise only; pain we obey.
general.author: marcel proust

general.quote: I enjoy convalescence. It is the part that makes the illness worthwhile.
general.author: george bernard shaw

general.quote: The sovereign cure for worry is prayer.
general.author: william james

general.quote: To be sick is to enjoy monarchical prerogatives.
general.author: charles lamb

general.quote: The most important thing when ill, is to never lose heart.
general.author: vladimir ilyich lenin

general.quote: The sick soon come to understand that they live in a different world from that of the well and that the two cannot communicate.
general.author: jessamyn west

general.quote: Fear and restlessness kill more than do illnesses.
general.author: french

general.quote: Art is a kind of illness.
general.author: giacomo puccini

general.quote: It’s no longer a question of staying healthy. It’s a question of finding a sickness you like.
general.author: jackie mason

general.quote: A sure cure for seasickness is to sit under a tree.
general.author: spike milligan

general.quote: A Man’s illness is his private territory and, no matter how much he love you and how close you are, you stay an outsider. You are healthy.
general.author: lauren bacall

general.quote: The modern sympathy with invalids is morbid. Illness of any kind is hardly a thing to be encouraged in others.
general.author: oscar wilde

general.quote: When a man is ill nothing is so important to him as his own illness.
general.author: anthony trollope

general.quote: To have a curable illness and to leave it untreated except for prayer is like sticking your hand in a fire and asking God to remove the flame.
general.author: sandra l. douglas

general.quote: Illness strikes men when they are exposed to change.
general.author: herodotus

general.quote: Sickness is a sort of early old age; it teaches us a diffidence in our earthly state.
general.author: alexander pope

general.quote: Serious illness doesn’t bother me for long because I am too inhospitable a host.
general.author: albert schweitzer

general.quote: If you look like your passport picture you’re too ill to travel.
general.author: will kommen

general.quote: Because there is no glory in illness. There is no meaning to it. There is no honor in dying of.
general.author: john green

general.quote: The more serious the illness, the more important it is for you to fight back, mobilizing all your resources-spiritual, emotional, intellectual, physical.
general.author: norman cousins

general.quote: It takes three to make a child.
general.author: ee cummings

general.quote: Children are a great comfort to us in our old age, and they help us reach it faster too.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: Children are not casual guests in our home. They have been loaned to us temporarily for the purpose of loving them and instilling a foundation of values on which their future lives will be built.
general.author: dr. james c. dobson

general.quote: I love these little people; and it is not a slight thing when they, who are so fresh from god, love us.
general.author: charles dickens,

general.quote: The finest inheritance you can give to a child is to allow it to make its own way, completely on its own feet.
general.author: isadora duncan

general.quote: Children are poor men’s riches.
general.author: john ray (1627-1705, british naturalist)

general.quote: Children seldom misquote. In fact, they usually repeat word for word what you shouldn’t have said.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: You can learn many things from children. how much patience you have, for instance.
general.author: franklin p. jones

general.quote: If children grew up according to early indications, we should have nothing but geniuses.
general.author: johann wolfgang von goethe

general.quote: There never was a child so lovely, but his mother was glad to get him asleep.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson

general.quote: Hugs can do great amounts of good — especially for children.
general.author: princess diana

general.quote: A rich child often sits in a poor mothers lap.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: What is done to children, they will do to society.
general.author: karl a. menninger

general.quote: The world today is bad… because people don’t talk to the children in the way that the children need.
general.author: pablo casals

general.quote: You know children are growing up when they start asking questions that have answers.
general.author: john plomp

general.quote: Children and drunks always speak the truth.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: It is dangerous to confuse children with angels.
general.author: david fyfe

general.quote: Children find everything in nothing; men find nothing in everything.
general.author: giacomo leopardi

general.quote: We cannot fashion our children after our desires, we must have them and love them as God has given them to us.
general.author: johann wolfgang von goethe

general.quote: Let the child’s first lesson be obedience, and the second will be what thou wilt.
general.author: benjamin franklin

general.quote: If we had paid no more attention to our plants than we have to our children, we would now be living in a jungle of weed.
general.author: luther burbank

general.quote: Who is not attracted by bright and pleasant children, to prattle, to creep, and to play with them?
general.author: epictetus

general.quote: Where children are, there is the golden age.
general.author: novalis

general.quote: Children are given to us to discourage our better emotions.
general.author: saki

general.quote: A child miseducated is a child lost.
general.author: john f. kennedy

general.quote: There are no seven wonders of the world in the eyes of a child. there are seven million.
general.author: walt streightiff

general.quote: Each child is an adventure into a better life — an opportunity to change the old pattern and make it new.
general.author: hubert h. humphrey

general.quote: Children are very precious. We are blessed to have them, but we are blessed even more if we take care of them and see to their needs.
general.author: delores bennett

general.quote: My best creation is my children.
general.author: diane von furstenberg

general.quote: Children need models rather than critics.
general.author: joseph joubert

general.quote: Children always turn to the light.
general.author: david hare

general.quote: The only thing worth stealing is a kiss from a sleeping child.
general.author: joe houldsworth

general.quote: Adults are obsolete children.
general.author: dr. seuss

general.quote: Each day of our lives we make deposits in the memory banks of our children.
general.author: charles swindoll

general.quote: We worry about what a child will become tomorrow, yet we forget that he is someone today.
general.author: stacia tauscher

general.quote: What is a home without children? Quiet.
general.author: henny youngman

general.quote: A child can ask questions that a wise man cannot answer.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: I brought children into this dark world because it needed the light that only a child can bring.
general.author: liz armbruster

general.quote: Before you beat a child, be sure you are not the cause of the offense.
general.author: austin o’malley

general.quote: Children’s talent to endure stems from their ignorance of alternatives.
general.author: maya angelou

general.quote: Always be nice to your children because they are the ones who will choose your rest home.
general.author: phyllis diller

general.quote: Children are the living messages we send to a time we will not see.
general.author: neil postman

general.quote: A child learns to discard his ideals, whereas a grown-up never wears out his short pants.
general.author: karl kraus

general.quote: Your children will see what you’re all about by what you live rather than what you say.
general.author: wayne dyer

general.quote: The child is the father of the man.
general.author: william wordsworth

general.quote: Anyone who thinks the art of conversation is dead ought to tell a child to go to bed.
general.author: robert gallagher

general.quote: When children are doing nothing, they are doing mischief.
general.author: henry fielding

general.quote: Let your children be as so many flowers, borrowed from God. If the flowers die or wither, thank God for a summer loan of them.
general.author: samuel rutherford

general.quote: Some of my best friends are children. In fact, all of my best friends are children.
general.author: j. d. salinger

general.quote: Children make you want to start life over.
general.author: muhammad ali

general.quote: Children in a family are like flowers in a bouquet: there’s always one determined to face in an opposite direction from the way the arranger desires.
general.author: marcelene cox

general.quote: We must teach our children to dream with their eyes open.
general.author: harry edwards

general.quote: The distinctive character of a child is to always live in the tangible present.
general.author: john ruskin

general.quote: I have found the best way to give advice to your children is to find out what they want and then advise them to do it.
general.author: harry s. truman

general.quote: There is not so much comfort in having children as there is sorrow in parting with them.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: What you don’t know takes a lot of explaining to the children.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: Don’t limit a child to your own learning, for he was born in another time.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: Children’s liberation is the next item on our civil rights shopping list.
general.author: letty cottin pogrebin

general.quote: Every child comes with the message that God is not yet discouraged of man.
general.author: rabindranath tagore

general.quote: Do not handicap your children by making their lives easy.
general.author: lazarus long

general.quote: We dont see the passage of time so much in ourselves as in our children.
general.author: hayley foster

general.quote: Children have never been very good at listening to their elders, but they have never failed to imitate them.
general.author: james baldwin

general.quote: For many children, joy comes as the result of mining something unique and wondrous about themselves from some inner shaft.
general.author: thomas j. cottle

general.quote: Give me four years to teach the children and the seed I have sown will never be uprooted.
general.author: vladimir ilyich lenin

general.quote: The best way to keep children at home is to make the home a pleasant atmosphere and let the air out of the tires.
general.author: dorothy parker

general.quote: Children enjoy the present because they have neither a past nor a future.
general.author: jean de la bruyere

general.quote: It is not a bad thing that children should occasionally, and politely, put parents in their place.
general.author: sidonie gabrielle colette

general.quote: The secret of dealing successfully with a child is not to be its parent.
general.author: mel lazarus

general.quote: You see much more of your children once they leave home.
general.author: lucille ball

general.quote: We inevitably doom our children to failure and frustration when we try to set their goals for them.
general.author: dr. jess lair

general.quote: Every child is an artist. The problem is to remain an artist once they grow up.
general.author: pablo picasso

general.quote: A child’s education should begin at least one hundred years before he is born.
general.author: oliver wendell holmes

general.quote: A little less worry over the child and a bit more concern about the world we make for the child to live in.
general.author: adolph meyer

general.quote: Give a little love to a child, and you get a great deal back.
general.author: john ruskin

general.quote: Children need love, especially when they don’t deserve it.
general.author: harold hulbert

general.quote: Children are the keys of paradise.
general.author: richard henry stoddard (

general.quote: To be ignorant of what occurred before you were born is to remain always a child.
general.author: marcus t. cicero

general.quote: With children we must mix gentleness with firmness. They must not always have their own way, but they must not always be thwarted.
general.author: charles haddon spurgeon

general.quote: The best way for a man to train up a child in the way he should go is to travel that way himself.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: The training of children is a profession, where we must know how to waste time in order to save it.
general.author: jean jacques rousseau

general.quote: The first duty to children is to make them happy, If you have not made them so, you have wronged them, No other good they may get can make up for that.
general.author: charles buxton

general.quote: Children make your life important.
general.author: erma bombeck

general.quote: Every man has a right to a Saturday night bath.
general.author: lyndon b. johnson

general.quote: If you want to have clean ideas, change them as often as your shirt.
general.author: francis picabia

general.quote: Sorrow can be alleviated by good sleep, a bath and a glass of wine.
general.author: thomas aquinas

general.quote: Water is life, and clean water means health.
general.author: audrey hepburn

general.quote: I’m a hard worker. I get my hands dirty.
general.author: tori amos

general.quote: What is elegance? Soap and water!
general.author: cecil beaton

general.quote: Soap and water and common sense are the best disinfectants.
general.author: william osler

general.quote: Cleanliness becomes more important when godliness is unlikely.
general.author: p. j. o’rourke

general.quote: Whoso will pray, he must fast and be clean, And fat his soul, and make his body lean.
general.author: geoffrey chaucer

general.quote: Don’t call the world dirty because you forgot to clean your glasses.
general.author: aaron hill

general.quote: It’s hard to be funny when you have to be clean.
general.author: mae west

general.quote: God loveth the clean.
general.author: the holy koran

general.quote: Better keep yourself clean and bright; you are the window through which you must see the world.
general.author: george bernard shaw

general.quote: Character must be kept bright as well as clean.
general.author: philip dormer stanhope chesterfield

general.quote: Bath twice a day to be really clean, once a day to be passably clean, once a week to avoid being a public menace.
general.author: anthony burgess

general.quote: A hearty laugh gives one a dry cleaning, while a good cry is a wet wash.
general.author: puzant kevork thomajan

general.quote: Cleanliness is the scourge of art.
general.author: craig brown

general.quote: Those who fight corruption should be clean themselves.
general.author: vladimir putin

general.quote: There is just something about starting your day with something luxurious like a bath.
general.author: erin heatherton

general.quote: Whenever someone asks me if I want water with my Scotch, I say I’m thirsty, not dirty.
general.author: joe e. lewis

general.quote: Folded eyes see brighter colors than the open ever do.
general.author: elizabeth barrett browning

general.quote: When there is love in the heart there are rainbows in the eyes, which cover every black cloud with gorgeous hues.
general.author: henry ward beecher

general.quote: What we learn only through the ears makes less impression upon our minds than what is presented to the trustworthy eye.
general.author: horace

general.quote: The eyes of other people are the eyes that ruin us.
general.author: benjamin franklin

general.quote: The eyes have one language everywhere.
general.author: george herbert

general.quote: The eyes are the windows of a woman’s heart; you may enter that a way!
general.author: eugene sue

general.quote: He that lives by the sight of the eye may grow blind.
general.author: henry ward beecher

general.quote: Men trust their ears less than their eyes.
general.author: herodotus

general.quote: The voyage of discovery is not in seeking new landscapes but in having new eyes.
general.author: marcel proust

general.quote: The eyes see only what the mind is prepared to comprehend.
general.author: robertson davies

general.quote: The eye is the mirror of the soul.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: I need no dictionary of quotations to remind me that the eyes are the windows of the soul.
general.author: max beerbohm

general.quote: Her eyes are homes of silent prayers.
general.author: lord alfred tennyson

general.quote: Who has a daring eye tell downright truths and downright lies.
general.author: johann kaspar lavater

general.quote: Do everything as in the eye of another.
general.author: senecaw

general.quote: Close both eyes, to see with the other eye.
general.author: rumi

general.quote: The eye sees only what the mind is prepared to comprehend.
general.author: robertson davies

general.quote: A beautiful eye makes silence eloquent, a kind eye makes contradiction an assent, an enraged eye makes beauty deformed.
general.author: joseph addison

general.quote: An animal will always look for a person’s intentions by looking them right in the eyes.
general.author: h.powers

general.quote: The eyes of the lord are in every place seeing the evil and the good.
general.author: bible

general.quote: The eyes are not responsible when the mind does the seeing.
general.author: publilius syrus

general.quote: One’s eyes are what one is; one’s mouth is what one becomes.
general.author: john galsworthy

general.quote: The eye is the jewel of the body.
general.author: henry david thoreau

general.quote: The eyes indicate the antiquity of the soul.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson

general.quote: My eyes make pictures, when they are shut.
general.author: samuel taylor coleridge

general.quote: You never win a game unless you beat the guy in front of you.
general.author: vince lombardi

general.quote: And then learn to play the game of life, as well as the game of athletics, according to the rules of society. If you can take that and put it into practice in the community in which you live, then, to me you have won the greatest championship.
general.author: jesse owens

general.quote: I never see failure as failure, but only as the game I must play and win.
general.author: tom hopkins

general.quote: Losing is part of the game. If you never lose, you are never truly tested, and never forced to grow.
general.author: david sirlin

general.quote: In sports… you play from the time you’re eight years old, and then you’re done forever.
general.author: joe montana

general.quote: Aggressive fighting for the right is the greatest sport in the world.
general.author: theodore roosevelt quotes

general.quote: Do you know what my favorite part of the game is? The opportunity to play.
general.author: mike singletary

general.quote: As a youngster, I enjoyed sport and my ambition was to be a great sportsman.
general.author: lynn davies

general.quote: When the game is over it is really just beginning.
general.author: jerry kramer

general.quote: Don’t do anything in practice that you wouldn’t do in the game.
general.author: george halas

general.quote: Sport and life is about losing. It’s about understanding how to lose.
general.author: lynn davies

general.quote: Sports do not build character. They reveal it.
general.author: john wooden

general.quote: If life doesn’t offer a game worth playing, then invent a new one.
general.author: anthony j. d’angelo

general.quote: If you’ve had a good time playing the game, you’re a winner even if you lose.
general.author: malcolm s. forbes

general.quote: It is the first that ever I heard breaking of ribs was sport for ladies.
general.author: william shakespeare quotes

general.quote: All games are basically hostile. Winners and losers. We see them all around us: the winners and the losers. The losers can oftentimes become winners, and the winners can very easily become losers.
general.author: william s. burroughs

general.quote: Sports should always be fun.
general.author: charles mann

general.quote: Keep your sense of humor. There’s enough stress in the rest of your life to let bad shots ruin a game you’re supposed to enjoy.
general.author: louisa may alcott

general.quote: When a man wants to murder a tiger he calls it sport; when a tiger wants to murder him he calls it ferocity.
general.author: george bernard shaw quotes

general.quote: It isn’t hard to be good from time to time in sports. What’s tough is being good every day.
general.author: willie mays

general.quote: In France, cooking is a serious art form and a national sport.
general.author: julia child

general.quote: Sport is a preserver of health.
general.author: hippocrates

general.quote: Sport is an international phenomenon, like science or music.
general.author: avery brundage

general.quote: The man loves danger and sport. That is why he loves woman, the most dangerous of all sports.
general.author: friedrich nietzsche

general.quote: Serious sport has nothing to do with fair play. It is bound up with hatred, jealousy, boastfulness, disregard of all rules and sadistic pleasure in witnessing violence: in other words, it is war minus the shooting.
general.author: george orwell

general.quote: When you are through improving yourself, you are out of the game. You learn until your last breath.
general.author: richard a. nelson

general.quote: As soon as you take money for playing sport, it isn’t sport, it’s work.
general.author: avery brundage

general.quote: As I understand it, sport is hard work for which you do not get paid.
general.author: irvin s. cobb

general.quote: The key to any game is to use your strengths and hide your weaknesses.
general.author: paul westphal

general.quote: Sport is part of every man and woman’s heritage and its absence can never be compensated for.
general.author: pierre de coubertin

general.quote: The first thing is to love your sport. Never do it to please someone else. It has to be yours.
general.author: peggy fleming

general.quote: Olympism is the marriage of sport and culture.
general.author: juan antonio samaranch

general.quote: Ever notice that people never say "It’s only a game" when they’re winning?
general.author: ivern ball

general.quote: After a certain point, money is meaningless. It ceases to be the goal. The game is what counts.
general.author: aristotle onassis

general.quote: I love sport because I love life, and sport is one of the basic joys of life.
general.author: yevgeny yevtushenko

general.quote: All sports for all people.
general.author: pierre de coubertin

general.quote: Life is more fun if you play games.
general.author: roald dahl

general.quote: The game isn’t over until it’s over.
general.author: yogi berra

general.quote: Most games are lost, not won.
general.author: casey stengel

general.quote: If you plan to win as I do, the game never ends.
general.author: stan mikita

general.quote: You have to be able to center yourself, to let all of your emotions go. Don’t ever forget that you play with your soul as well as your body.
general.author: kareem abdul-jabbar

general.quote: It has meant a lot to me to challenge the best players in the world and to beat them. And it means a lot to me to be out here and fighting for the title and, you know, it hurts not to win it.
general.author: andre agassi

general.quote: There are only three sports: mountain climbing, bull fighting, and motor racing. All the rest are merely games.
general.author: ernest hemingway quotes

general.quote: When money comes in at the gate, sport flies out at the window.
general.author: theodore roosevelt quotes

general.quote: You have to learn the rules of the game. And then you have to play better than anyone else.
general.author: dianne feinstein

general.quote: The thing about sport, any sport, is that swearing is very much part of it.
general.author: jimmy greaves

general.quote: Sport is the habitual and voluntary cultivation of intensive physical effort.
general.author: pierre de coubertin

general.quote: It is not how big you are, it’s how big you play.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: Sport strips away personality, letting the white bone of character shine through. Sport gives players an opportunity to know and test themselves.
general.author: rita mae brown

general.quote: Set short term goals and you’ll win games. Set long term goals and you’ll win championships!
general.author: ِUnknown

general.quote: We didn’t lose the game; we just ran out of time.
general.author: vince lombardi

general.quote: Just play. Have fun. Enjoy the game.
general.author: michael jordan

general.quote: Concentrate, play your game, and don’t be afraid to win.
general.author: louisa may alcott

general.quote: Anybody can be a runner… We were meant to move. We were meant to run. It’s the easiest sport.
general.author: bill rodgers

general.quote: Never change a winning game; always change a losing one.
general.author: bill tilden

general.quote: All of the sports have a safety net, but boxing is the only sport that has none.
general.author: gerry cooney

general.quote: Politics is a blood sport.
general.author: aneurin bevan

general.quote: Whatever games are played with us, we must play no games with ourselves.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson quotes

general.quote: The best and fastest way to learn a sport is to watch and imitate a champion.
general.author: jean claude killy

general.quote: One man practicing sportsmanship is better than a hundred teaching it.
general.author: knute rockne

general.quote: Games lubricate the body and the mind.
general.author: benjamin franklin quotes

general.quote: Tactics, fitness, stroke ability, adaptability, experience, and sportsmanship are all necessary for winning.
general.author: fred perry

general.quote: Life-It’s not so important who starts the game but who finishes it.
general.author: john wooden

general.quote: To win you’ve got to stay in the game.
general.author: claude m. bristol

general.quote: Hunting is not a sport. In a sport, both sides should know they’re in the game.
general.author: paul rodriguez

general.quote: Life is a team sport. Sometimes you give and sometimes you get.
general.author: ann pearson

general.quote: I worked very hard. I felt I could play the game. The only thing that could stop me was myself.
general.author: jim abbott

general.quote: In love as in sport, the amateur status must be strictly maintained.
general.author: robert graves

general.quote: Sport fosters many things that are good; teamwork and leadership.
general.author: daley thompson

general.quote: The only way to prove that you’re a good sport is to lose.
general.author: ernie banks

general.quote: All sports are games of inches.
general.author: dick ritger

general.quote: The essence of sports is that while you’re doing it, nothing else matters, but after you stop, there is a place, generally not very important, where you would put it.
general.author: roger bannister

general.quote: If a man sits down to think, he is immediately asked if has a headache
general.author: ralph waldo emerson quotes

general.quote: A great wind is blowing, and that gives you either imagination or a headache
general.author: catherine the great

general.quote: It is immoral to get drunk because the headache comes after the drinking, but if the headache came first and the drunkenness afterwards, it would be moral to get drunk
general.author: samuel butler quotes

general.quote: Public appearances are a headache. I hold mine down to a minimum
general.author: jack nicklaus

general.quote: Culture, with us, ends in headache
general.author: ralph waldo emerson

general.quote: You really want to get a headache? Try to understand Internet advertising
general.author: barry diller

general.quote: Gratitude is the best food to start and sustain you. Hankering creates hunger, unhappiness, bellyache, headache and heartache – and often leaves a bitter taste
general.author: rasheed ogunlaru

general.quote: I could never say in the morning, "I have a headache and cannot do thus and so". Headache or no headache, thus and so had to be done
general.author: eleanor roosevelt quotes

general.quote: It’s a huge headache – the more money you have, the more hassles. I find money very uncomfortable
general.author: upamanyu chatterjee

general.quote: Life’s a long headache in a noisy street
general.author: john masefield

general.quote: If the headache would only precede the intoxication, alcoholism would be a virtue
general.author: samuel butler

general.quote: Do not undervalue the headache. While it is at its sharpest it seems a bad investment; but when relief begins, the unexpired remainder is worth $4 a minute
general.author: mark twain quotes

general.quote: I will not be as those who spend the day in complaining of headache, and the night in drinking the wine that gives it
general.author: johann wolfgang von goethe quotes

general.quote: Every single ounce of pain focused on the left part of the head. Feels like whole body except left part of head is in fucking numb state
general.author: shrestha sapan

general.quote: His headache was still sitting over his right eye as if it had been nailed there
general.author: ian fleming

general.quote: Holding on to anger, resentment and hurt only gives you tense muscles, a headache and a sore jaw from clenching your teeth. Forgiveness gives you back the laughter and the lightness in your life
general.author: joan lunden

general.quote: It’s a bit of a headache being a perfectionist. You’re never satisfied
general.author: cherie lunghi

general.quote: The awareness that health is dependent upon habits that we control makes us the first generation in history that to a large extent determines its own destiny.
general.author: jimmy carter

general.quote: Our health always seems much more valuable after we lose it.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: To insure good health: Eat lightly, breathe deeply, live moderately, cultivate cheerfulness, and maintain an interest in life.
general.author: william londen

general.quote: It is a wearisome disease to preserve health by too strict a regimen.
general.author: francois de la rochefoucauld

general.quote: Health is the greatest gift, contentment the greatest wealth, faithfulness the best elationship.
general.author: buddha

general.quote: From labor health, from health contentment springs.
general.author: melody beattie

general.quote: Health is the condition of wisdom, and the sign is cheerfulness — an open and noble temper.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson

general.quote: Health is a blessing that money cannot buy.
general.author: izaak walton

general.quote: Good health and good sense are two of life’s greatest blessings.
general.author: publilius syrus

general.quote: Man needs difficulties; they are necessary for health.
general.author: carl jung

general.quote: Being healthy is a revolutionary act.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: The greatest wealth is health.
general.author: virgil

general.quote: It is health that is real wealth and not pieces of gold and silver.
general.author: mahatma gandhi

general.quote: The groundwork of all happiness is health.
general.author: leigh hunt

general.quote: After you’re older, two things are possibly more important than any others: health and money.
general.author: helen gurley brown

general.quote: Health is a great treasure. It is the richest possession mortals can have. Wealth, honor, or learning is dearly purchased, if it be at the loss of the vigor of health. None of these attainments can secure happiness, if health is wanting.
general.author: ellen gould white

general.quote: A healthy outside starts from the inside.
general.author: robert urich

general.quote: My personal goals are to be happy, healthy and to be surrounded by loved ones.
general.author: kiana tom

general.quote: The first wealth is health.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson

general.quote: I have never yet met a healthy person who worried very much about his health, or a really good person who worried much about his own soul.
general.author: john b. s. haldane

general.quote: There’s lots of people in this world who spend so much time watching their health that they haven’t the time to enjoy it.
general.author: josh billings

general.quote: Health is the greatest of all possessions; a pale cobbler is better than a sick king.
general.author: isaac bickerstaffe

general.quote: Health is my expected heaven.
general.author: john keats

general.quote: Health is not valued till sickness comes.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: Give a man health and a course to steer; and he’ll never stop to trouble about whether he’s happy or not.
general.author: george bernard shaw

general.quote: The preservation of health is a duty. Few seem conscious that there is such a thing as physical morality.
general.author: herbert spencer

general.quote: If I had my way I’d make health catching instead of disease.
general.author: robert ingersoll

general.quote: Health is the vital principle of bliss.
general.author: james thomson

general.quote: Nothing is more fatal to health than an over care of it.
general.author: benjamin franklin

general.quote: The only way for a rich man to be healthy is, by exercise and abstinence, to live as if he was poor.
general.author: sir william temple

general.quote: Health is like money, we never have a true idea of its value until we lose it.
general.author: josh billing

general.quote: To get rich never risk your health. For it is the truth that health is the wealth of wealth.
general.author: richard baker

general.quote: The trouble with always trying to preserve the health of the body is that it is so difficult to do without destroying the health of the mind.
general.author: g.k. chesterton

general.quote: A little health now and again is the ailing person’s best remedy.
general.author: friedrich nietzsche

general.quote: I believe that if you’re healthy, you’re capable of doing everything. There’s no one else who can give you health but God, and by being healthy I believe that God is listening to me.
general.author: pedro martinez

general.quote: Health is the first muse, and sleep is the condition to produce it.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson

general.quote: Health is worth more than learning.
general.author: thomas jefferson

general.quote: A stitch in time saves nine.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: In health there is liberty. Health is the first of all liberties, and happiness gives us the energy which is the basis of health.
general.author: henri-frederic amiel

general.quote: We drink one another’s health and spoil our own.
general.author: jerome k. jerome

general.quote: Give me good health and I’ll take care of the rest.
general.author: marilyn horne

general.quote: Good health is above wealth.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: Money is the most envied, but the least enjoyed. Health is the most enjoyed, but the least envied.
general.author: charles caleb colton

general.quote: Health is the thing that makes you feel that now is the best time of the year.
general.author: franklin pierce adams

general.quote: The concept of total wellness recognizes that our every thought, word, and behavior affects our greater health and well-being. And we, in turn, are affected not only emotionally but also physically and spiritually.
general.author: greg anderson

general.quote: If you have health, you probably will be happy, and if you have health and happiness, you have all the wealth you need, even if it is not all you want.
general.author: elbert hubbard

general.quote: It is unconscionable that we ration health care by the ability to pay…. your heart breaks. Health care should be a given.
general.author: kathryn anastos

general.quote: Health will generally attend thee well if thou attend it well.
general.author: edward counsel

general.quote: Use your health, even to the point of wearing it out.
general.author: george bernard shaw

general.quote: The way to keep your health is to eat what you don’t want, drink what you don’t like, and do what you’d rather not.
general.author: mark twain

general.quote: Healthy people are invalids who don’t know it.
general.author: jules romains

general.quote: Health is not a condition of matter, but of mind; nor can the material senses bear reliable testimony on the subject of health.
general.author: mary baker eddy

general.quote: Give me health and a day, and I will make the pomp of emperors ridiculous.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson

general.quote: Health is merely the slowest way someone can die.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: Health is the requisite after morality.
general.author: thomas jefferson

general.quote: Happiness lies, first of all, in health.
general.author: george william curtis

general.quote: Trust not too much to appearances.
general.author: virgil

general.quote: Beauty is produced by the pleasing appearance and good taste of the whole, and by the dimensions of all the parts being duly proportioned to each other.
general.author: vitruvius

general.quote: Books are as useful to a stupid person as a mirror is useful to a blind person.
general.author: chanakya

general.quote: We should look to the mind, and not to the outward appearance.
general.author: aesop

general.quote: Beauty is eternity gazing at itself in a mirror.
general.author: khalil gibran

general.quote: People who don’t have it think beauty is a blessing, but actually it sets you apart.
general.author: candice bergen

general.quote: The lord prefers common looking people. that is why he made so many of them.
general.author: abraham lincoln

general.quote: It is only shallow people who do not judge by appearances. the true mystery of the world is the visible, not the invisible.
general.author: oscar wilde

general.quote: Appearance rules the world.
general.author: johann friedrich von schiller

general.quote: When you look in the mirror, your ‘appearance,’ that outer you, is what you see first.
general.author: teri hatcher

general.quote: You mirror what the world mirrors to you.
general.author: jennifer lopez

general.quote: People that seem so glorious are all show; underneath they are like everyone else.
general.author: euripides

general.quote: The art of a people is a true mirror to their minds.
general.author: jawaharlal nehru

general.quote: You are only what you are when no one is looking
general.author: robert c. edwards

general.quote: We look into mirrors but we only see the effects of our times on us – not our effects on others.
general.author: pearl bailey

general.quote: If one wishes to become rich they must appear rich.
general.author: oliver goldsmith

general.quote: Nothing so much prevents our being natural as the desire to seem so.
general.author: francois de la rochefoucauld

general.quote: First appearance deceives many.
general.author: ovid

general.quote: What lies behind appearance is usually another appearance.
general.author: mason cooley

general.quote: Outside show is a poor substitute for inner worth.
general.author: aesop

general.quote: Think not i am what i appear.
general.author: lord byron

general.quote: Beware, so long as you live, of judging men by their outward appearance.
general.author: jean de la fontaine

general.quote: Neglect of appearance becomes men.
general.author: ovid

general.quote: Behavior is the mirror in which everyone shows their image.
general.author: johann wolfgang von goethe

general.quote: The biggest problem with every art is by the use of appearance to create a loftier reality.
general.author: johann wolfgang von goethe

general.quote: Clothes and manners do not make the man; but when he is made, they greatly improve his appearance
general.author: henry ward beecher

general.quote: Stop saying these negative things about yourself. Look in the mirror and find something about yourself that’s positive and celebrate that!
general.author: tyra banks

general.quote: We only see what we want to see; we only hear what we want to hear. Our belief system is just like a mirror that only shows us what we believe.
general.author: don miguel ruiz

general.quote: You use a glass mirror to see your face; you use works of art to see your soul.
general.author: george bernard shaw

general.quote: Your best appearance may be what is most remembered about you; don’t leave home without it.~
general.author: clarence e. hodges

general.quote: I’m a mirror. If you’re cool with me, I’m cool with you, and the exchange starts. What you see is what you reflect. If you don’t like what you see, then you’ve done something. If I’m standoffish, that’s because you are.
general.author: jay-z

general.quote: Shadows cannot see themselves in the mirror of the sun.
general.author: evita peron

general.quote: When i see a bird that walks like a duck and swims like a duck and quacks like a duck, i call that bird a duck.
general.author: richard c. cushing

general.quote: Who sees the human face correctly: the photographer, the mirror, or the painter?
general.author: pablo picasso

general.quote: A beautiful woman should break her mirror early.
general.author: baltasar gracian

general.quote: Smile in the mirror. Do that every morning and you’ll start to see a big difference in your life.
general.author: yoko ono

general.quote: Things are entirely what they appear to be and behind them … there is nothing.
general.author: jean-paul sartre

general.quote: Mirrors are ice which do not melt: what melts are those who admire themselves in them.
general.author: paul morand

general.quote: If you begin to think you’re something you’re not, you’re looking in the wrong mirror.
general.author: eugene cernan

general.quote: Monkeys are superior to men in this: when a monkey looks into a mirror, he sees a monkey.
general.author: malcolm de chazal

general.quote: Things are not always what they seem; the first appearance deceives many; the intelligence of a few perceives what has been carefully hidden.
general.author: phaedrus

general.quote: You’re only as good as your last haircut.
general.author: susan lee

general.quote: The world is governed more by appearances than by realities, so that it is fully as necessary to seem to know something as to know it.
general.author: daniel webster

general.quote: Nothing succeeds like the appearance of success.
general.author: christopher lasch

general.quote: If you find the mirror of the heart dull, the rust has not been cleared from its face.
general.author: rumi

general.quote: Beauty is truth’s smile when she beholds her own face in a perfect mirror.
general.author: rabindranath tagore

general.quote: He that has a great nose, thinks everybody is speaking of it.
general.author: thomas fuller

general.quote: The aim of art is to represent not the outward appearance of things, but their inward significance.
general.author: aristotle

general.quote: No one is so miserable as the poor person who maintains the appearance of wealth.
general.author: charles spurgeon

general.quote: Life is a mirror and will reflect back to the thinker what he thinks into it.
general.author: ernest holmes

general.quote: There are two ways of spreading light: to be the candle or the mirror that reflects it.
general.author: edith wharton

general.quote: Hold up a mirror and ask yourself what you are capable of doing, and what you really care about. Then take the initiative – don’t wait for someone else to ask you to act.
general.author: sylvia earle

general.quote: Things are seldom what they seem.
general.author: w. s. gilbert

general.quote: A sister is both your mirror – and your opposite.
general.author: elizabeth fishel

general.quote: Our environment, the world in which we live and work, is a mirror of our attitudes and expectations.
general.author: earl nightingale

general.quote: To establish yourself in the world a person must do all they can to appear already established.
general.author: francois de la rochefoucauld

general.quote: A man’s manners are a mirror in which he shows his portrait.
general.author: johann wolfgang von goethe

general.quote: Let us be grateful to the mirror for revealing to us our appearance only.
general.author: samuel butler

general.quote: There are other things besides beauty with which to captivate the hearts of men. The Italians have a saying: "Fair is not fair, but that which pleaseth.
general.author: ninon de l’enclos

general.quote: If you’re an attractive guy, everyone thinks you’re successful just because of the way you look.
general.author: james marsden

general.quote: The moment somebody says to me, "This is very risky," is the moment it becomes attractive to me.
general.author: kate capshaw

general.quote: The courts are as a stage, people love to see attractive players.
general.author: anna kournikova

general.quote: No woman can be handsome by the force of features alone, any more than she can be witty only by the help of speech.
general.author: thomas hughes

general.quote: A man of character finds a special attractiveness in difficulty, since it is only by coming to grips with difficulty that he can realize his potentialities.
general.author: charles de gaulle

general.quote: Are you not scared by seeing that the gypsies are more attractive to us than the apostles?
general.author: ralph waldo emerson

general.quote: For attractive lips, speak words of kindness.
general.author: sam levenson

general.quote: I hold it to be the moral duty of women to make themselves beautiful in all lawful ways.
general.author: e. lynn linton

general.quote: The more equally attractive two alternatives seem, the harder it can be to choose between them — no matter that, to the same degree, the choice can only matter less.
general.author: edward fredkin’s paradox

general.quote: A woman’s natural quality is to attract, and having attracted to enchain; and how influential she may be for good or evil, the history of every age makes clear.
general.author: mrs. hugh r. haweis

general.quote: Zest is the secret of all beauty. There is no beauty that is attractive without zest.
general.author: christian dior

general.quote: On the attraction between man and woman society is based; but its refined is greater than its gross force, and its weight is like the gravitation of the globe.
general.author: cyrus augustus bartol

general.quote: Your enthusiasm will be infectious, stimulating and attractive to others. They will love you for it. They will go for you and with you.
general.author: norman vincent peale

general.quote: The inner speech, your thoughts, can cause you to be rich or poor, loved or unloved, happy or unhappy, attractive or unattractive, powerful or weak.
general.author: ralph charell

general.quote: The only thing that makes one place more attractive to me than another is the quantity of heart I find in it.
general.author: jane welsh carlyle

general.quote: Women and flowers are made to beloved for their beauty and sweetness, rather than themselves to love.
general.author: ninon de l’enclos

general.quote: Rarity gives a charm: thus early fruits are most esteemed; thus winter roses obtain a higher price; thus coyness sets off an extravagant mistress: a door ever open attracts no young suitor.
general.author: martial

general.quote: Military glory — the attractive rainbow that rises in showers of blood.
general.author: abraham lincoln

general.quote: Thirty-five is a very attractive age. London society is full of women of the highest birth who have, of their own free choice, remained thirty-five for years.
general.author: oscar wilde

general.quote: When truth is discovered by someone else, it loses something of its attractiveness.
general.author: alexander solzhenitsyn

general.quote: A pretty, silly, self-conceited woman will very often be far more courted, and seemingly far more liked and admired, than a woman of infinitely higher charms. All the while the men do not like her a tenth part as well.
general.author: charles buxton

general.quote: One of the most attractive things about the flowers is their beautiful reserve.
general.author: henry david thoreau

general.quote: Nothing under heaven so strongly doth allure the sense of man, and all his mind possess, as beauty’s love.
general.author: edmund spenser

general.quote: The most attractive sentences are not perhaps the wisest, but the surest and soundest.
general.author: henry david thoreau

general.quote: That hook of wiving, fairness which strikes the eye.
general.author: william shakespeare

general.quote: I like villains because there’s something so attractive about a committed person — they have a plan, an ideology, no matter how twisted. They’re motivated.
general.author: russell crowe

general.quote: The first duty of a woman is to be pretty.
general.author: madame delphine gay de girardin

general.quote: We’re able to judge attractiveness with surprising speed and on the basis of very little information.
general.author: ingrid olson

general.quote: The poetic element lying hidden in most women is the source of their magnetic attraction.
general.author: victor hugo

general.quote: When confronted with two evils, a man will always choose the most attractive.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: The more sensible a woman is, supposing her not to be masculine, the more attractive she is in her proportionate power to entertain.
general.author: leigh hunt

general.quote: She carried about her an indefinable air of having been used to love, or admiration probably, of men as well as women, which the most exquisitely modest women will sometimes wear, and which is unmistakable as it is alluring to the eye.
general.author: elizabeth stuart phelps

general.quote: To make the cunning artless, tame the rude, subdue the haughty, shake the undaunted soul; yea, put a bridle in the lion’s mouth, and lead him forth as a domestic cur;–these are the triumphs of all-powerful beauty.
general.author: joanna baillie

general.quote: Clever and attractive women do not want to vote; they are willing to let men govern as long as they govern men.
general.author: george bernard shaw

general.quote: A Code of Honor — never approach a friend’s girlfriend or wife with mischief as your goal. There are just too many women in the world to justify that sort of dishonorable behavior. Unless she’s really attractive.
general.author: bruce j freidmen

general.quote: Our poor eyes were so enriched as to behold, and our low hearts so exalted as to love, a maid who is such, that as the greatest thing the world can show is her beauty, so the least thing that may be praised in her is her beauty.
general.author: sir philip sidney

general.quote: The brain is wider than the sky.
general.author: emily dickinson

general.quote: My thoughts, my beliefs, my feelings are all in my brain. My brain is going to rot.
general.author: richard dawkins

general.quote: The brain can be easy to buy, but the heart never comes to market.
general.author: james russell lowell

general.quote: It’s good to make your brain work more than your body.
general.author: conor mcgregor

general.quote: The heart has eyes which the brain knows nothing of.
general.author: charles h. perkhurst

general.quote: But if God had wanted us to think just with our wombs, why did He give us a brain?
general.author: clare boothe luce

general.quote: Research has shown that even small amounts of processed food alter the chemical balance in our brain and cause negative mood swings along with noticeable dips ill energy.
general.author: marilu henner

general.quote: You can’t change who you are, but you can change what you have in your head, you can refresh what you’re thinking about, you can put some fresh air in your brain.
general.author: ernesto bertarelli

general.quote: Where the heart lies, let the brain lie also.
general.author: robert browning

general.quote: The human brain has 100 billion neurons, each neuron connected to 10 thousand other neurons. Sitting on your shoulders is the most complicated object in the known universe.
general.author: michio kaku

general.quote: There is no need for temples, no need for complicated philosophies. My brain and my heart are my temples; my philosophy is kindness.
general.author: dalai lama

general.quote: I was taught that the human brain was the crowning glory of evolution so far, but I think it’s a very poor scheme for survival.
general.author: kurt vonnegut

general.quote: Tears come from the heart and not from the brain.
general.author: leonardo da vinci

general.quote: I like nonsense; it wakes up the brain cells.
general.author: dr. seuss

general.quote: In making our decisions, we must use the brains that God has given us. But we must also use our hearts which He also gave us.
general.author: alexander maclaren

general.quote: Build your self-esteem by recalling all the ways you have succeeded, and your brain will be filled with images of you making your achievements happen again and again.
general.author: jack canfield

general.quote: The chief function of the body is to carry the brain around.
general.author: thomas a. edison

general.quote: The brain is a wonderful organ; it starts working the moment you get up in the morning and does not stop until you get into the office.
general.author: robert frost

general.quote: The stupidity of one brain multiplied by twelve.
general.author: elbert hubbard

general.quote: Math is like going to the gym for your brain. It sharpens your mind.
general.author: danica mckellar

general.quote: When God endowed human beings with brains, He did not intend to guarantee them.
general.author: charles de montesquieu

general.quote: A man’s brain has a more difficult time shifting from thinking to feeling than a women’s brain does.
general.author: barbara de angelis

general.quote: As long as my brain and fingers work, I’m cool.
general.author: eddie van halen

general.quote: Any man who reads too much and uses his own brain too little falls into lazy habits of thinking.
general.author: albert einstein

general.quote: No brain is stronger than its weakest think.
general.author: thomas l. masson

general.quote: A brain of feathers, and a heart of lead.
general.author: alexander pope

general.quote: We are all now connected by the Internet, like neurons in a giant brain.
general.author: stephen hawking

general.quote: Humor is by far the most significant activity of the human brain.
general.author: edward de bono

general.quote: To think is to practice brain chemistry.
general.author: deepak chopra

general.quote: Love is like an hourglass, with the heart filling up as the brain empties.
general.author: jules renard

general.quote: A fool’s brain digests philosophy into folly, science into superstition, and art into pedantry. Hence University education.
general.author: george bernard shaw

general.quote: Dollars and guns are no substitutes for brains and will power.
general.author: dwight david eisenhower

general.quote: We are dealing with the best-educated generation in history. But they’ve got a brain dressed up with nowhere to go.
general.author: timothy leary

general.quote: My own brain is to me the most unaccountable of machinery – always buzzing, humming, soaring roaring diving, and then buried in mud. And why? What’s this passion for?
general.author: virginia woolf

general.quote: Brains are an asset, if you hide them.
general.author: mae west

general.quote: Aristotle was famous for knowing everything. He taught that the brain exists merely to cool the blood and is not involved in the process of thinking. This is true only of certain persons.
general.author: will cuppy

general.quote: I regard the brain as a computer which will stop working when its components fail. There is no heaven or afterlife for broken down computers; that is a fairy story for people afraid of the dark.
general.author: stephen hawking

general.quote: The more you use your brain, the more brain you will have to use.
general.author: george a. dorsey

general.quote: Never trust anything that can think for itself if you can’t see where it keeps its brain.
general.author: j. k. rowling

general.quote: The right half of the brain controls the left half of the body. This means that only left handed people are in their right mind.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: What people see is determined by where they sit. They naturally see things from their own perspective, not from anyone else’s, including yours.
general.author: john c. maxwell

general.quote: Many are the things that man seeing must understand. Not seeing, how shall he know what lies in the hand of time to come?
general.author: sophocles

general.quote: If you gaze long into an abyss, the abyss will gaze back into you.
general.author: friedrich wilhelm nietzsche

general.quote: None is so blind as he who sees too much.
general.author: philip moeller

general.quote: One has not only an ability to perceive the world but an ability to alter one’s perception of it; more simply, one can change things by the manner in which one looks at them.
general.author: tom robbins

general.quote: Of more validity is the sight of one eye than the attention of ten ears; for in that a man seeth is an assurance, and that he heareth may be an error.
general.author: george turberville

general.quote: The only true love is love at first sight; second sight dispels it.
general.author: israel zangwill

general.quote: Of all the senses, sight must be the most delightful.
general.author: helen keller

general.quote: To see a thing clearly in the mind makes it begin to take form.
general.author: henry ford

general.quote: Perception is strong and sight weak.
general.author: miyamoto musashi

general.quote: Better see rightly on a pound a week than squint on a million.
general.author: george bernard shaw

general.quote: Seeing is believing.
general.author: john clarke

general.quote: When you focus all your attention on what is seen, your eyes will be blinded to what is real…. You must see the invisible, dream the impossible, and believe the unfathomable.
general.author: heritage james

general.quote: There is no sadder sight than a young pessimist.
general.author: mark twain

general.quote: Out of sight, out of mind. The absent are always in the wrong.
general.author: thomas a kempis

general.quote: No matter how intelligent a man is, he can’t see what he doesn’t know how to see.
general.author: ursula k. le guin

general.quote: Love at first sight is easy to understand; it’s when two people have been looking at each other for a lifetime that it becomes a miracle.
general.author: sam levenson

general.quote: At the moment of vision, the eyes see nothing.
general.author: william golding

general.quote: We need better sight for better choice.
general.author: r. a. feller

general.quote: In time of difficulties, we must not lose sight of our achievements.
general.author: mao zedong

general.quote: The only thing worse than being blind is having sight but no vision.
general.author: helen keller

general.quote: How alive is thought, invisible, yet without thought there is no sight.
general.author: dejan stojanovic

general.quote: The advantage of love at first sight is that it delays a second sight.
general.author: natalie clifford barney

general.quote: Where eyes are shut, nothing can be seen.
general.author: percy bysshe shelley

general.quote: Friendship is a word, the very sight of which in print makes the heart warm.
general.author: augustine birrell

general.quote: Charms strike the sight, but merit wins the soul.
general.author: alexander pope

general.quote: Would you rather have sight, or insight? I’d rather have a double cheeseburger.
general.author: jarod kintz

general.quote: If my ship sails from sight, it doesn’t mean my journey ends, it simply means the river bends.
general.author: enoch powell

general.quote: Sometimes not seeing things can be a blessing.
general.author: august strindberg

general.quote: Sight is by much the noblest of the senses.
general.author: laurence sterne

general.quote: What people see is never the end of what should be seen.
general.author: heritage james

general.quote: Many have sight but few have vision.
general.author: naren nagin

general.quote: The bravest sight in the world is to see a great man struggling against adversity.
general.author: lucius annaeus seneca

general.quote: For my part I know nothing with any certainty, but the sight of the stars makes me dream.
general.author: vincent van gogh

general.quote: Each man is good in the sight of the Great Spirit.
general.author: sitting bull

general.quote: The pressure of survival in the big city will make you lose sight of your dream… Hang in there.
general.author: james de la vega

general.quote: One does not discover new lands without consenting to lose sight of the shore for a very long time.
general.author: andre gide

general.quote: He that cannot contract the sight of his mind, as well as disperse and dilate it, wanteth a great faculty.
general.author: francis bacon

general.quote: Out of sight, out of mind.
general.author: john heywood

general.quote: It’s hubris to think that the way we see things is everything there is.
general.author: lisa randall

general.quote: A problem out of sight is a problem out of mind, but it’s still a problem.
general.author: kirsty major

general.quote: What you see and hear depends a good deal on where you are standing; it also depends on what sort of person you are.
general.author: c. s. lewis

general.quote: See and to be seen.
general.author: ben jonson

general.quote: I believe in love at first sight for houses – but not for people.
general.author: danielle steel

general.quote: No eyes that have seen beauty ever lose their sight.
general.author: jean toomer

general.quote: What you see is what you get.
general.author: flip wilson

general.quote: There is none so blind as they that won’t see.
general.author: jonathan swift

general.quote: We see things not as they are but as we are.
general.author: anais nin

general.quote: Man cannot discover new oceans unless he has the courage to lose sight of the shore.
general.author: andre gide

general.quote: Blindness itself commends the excellence of sight.
general.author: st. augustine

general.quote: The most pathetic person in the world is someone who has sight, but has no vision.
general.author: helen keller

general.quote: Each man is good in His sight. It is not necessary for eagles to be crows.
general.author: sitting bull

general.quote: You get caught up thinking about the future, you lose sight of the present.
general.author: antonio brown

general.quote: Seeing is an integrating activity. What you see is fixed in a moment; sight is a perception of depth and relationship, but not one of time and articulation.
general.author: james goodman

general.quote: The splinter in your eye is the best magnifying-glass available.
general.author: theodor w. adorno

general.quote: Sight is one of the most easily deceived senses. I could make a coin disappear and your eyes would believe it gone, even if it were merely up my sleeve.
general.author: megan chance

general.quote: What, my boy, you are not weeping? You should save your eyes for sight.
general.author: sarah williams

general.quote: You should show some respect for what other people see and feel, even though it be the exact opposite of what you see and feel.
general.author: luigi pirandello

general.quote: The folly of all follies is to be love sick for a shadow.
general.author: lord alfred tennyson

general.quote: Seek happiness for its own sake, and you will not find it; seek for duty, and happiness will follow as the shadow comes with the sunshine
general.author: tryon edwards

general.quote: Never fear shadows. They simply mean there’s a light shining somewhere nearby
general.author: ruth e. renkel

general.quote: When we have a world of only now, with no shadows of yesterdays or clouds of tomorrow, then saying what we can do will work
general.author: goldie ivener

general.quote: Man is a substance clad in shadows
general.author: john sterling

general.quote: Tragedy delights by affording a shadow of the pleasure which exists in pain
general.author: percy bysshe shelley

general.quote: The very substance of the ambitious is merely the shadow of a dream
general.author: william shakespeare quotes

general.quote: The hopeful man sees success where others see failure, sunshine where others see shadows and storm
general.author: orison swett marden

general.quote: Be content to stand in the light, and let the shadow fall where it will
general.author: mary w. stewart

general.quote: In this world everything changes except good deeds and bad deeds; these follow you as the shadow follows the body
general.author: ruth benedict

general.quote: Many miles away there’s a shadow on the door of a cottage on the Shore of a dark Scottish lake
general.author: sting

general.quote: What is life? It is the flash of a firefly in the night. It is the breath of a buffalo in the wintertime. It is the little shadow which runs across the grass and loses itself in the sunset
general.author: unknown

general.quote: To love someone is to isolate him from the world, wipe out every trace of him, dispossess him of his shadow, drag him into a murderous future. It is to circle around the other like a dead star and absorb him into a black light
general.author: jean baudrillard

general.quote: When men yield up the privilege of thinking, the last shadow of liberty quits the horizon
general.author: thomas paine

general.quote: When walking through the "valley of shadows," remember, a shadow is cast by a Light
general.author: h.k. barclay

general.quote: Shadows fall on even the brightest hours
general.author: bryan waller proctor

general.quote: Our ideals, like pictures, are made from lights and shadows
general.author: joseph joubert

general.quote: He who leaves his house in search of happiness pursues a shadow
general.author: unknown

general.quote: Power may be at the end of a gun, but sometimes it’s also at the end of the shadow or the image of a gun
general.author: jean genet

general.quote: Shadow owes its birth to light
general.author: john gay

general.quote: This life of separateness may be compared to a dream, a phantasm, a bubble, a shadow, a drop of dew, a flash of lightning
general.author: buddha

general.quote: Across the singing waves the shadows creep
general.author: celia leighton thaxter

general.quote: Thoughts are the shadows of our sensations — always darker, emptier, simpler than these
general.author: friedrich nietzsche

general.quote: Where love rules, there is no will to power; where power predominates, there love is lacking. The one is the shadow of the other
general.author: carl jung

general.quote: Thus shadow owes its birth to light
general.author: john gay

general.quote: What is life? A frenzy. What is life? An illusion, a shadow, a fiction. And the greatest good is trivial; for all life is a dream and all dreams are dreams
general.author: pedro calderon de la barca
