general.quote: Fear is the lengthened shadow of ignorance
general.author: arnold h. glasow

general.quote: Men are the dreams of a shadow
general.author: pindar

general.quote: Do we not all spend the greater part of our lives under the shadow of an event that has not yet come to pass?"
general.author: maurice maeterlinck

general.quote: Go forth to meet the shadowy Future without fear and with a manly heart
general.author: henry wadsworth longfellow quotes

general.quote: Where there is much light, the shadow is deep
general.author: johann wolfgang von goethe quotes

general.quote: Reason is like an officer when the king appears. The officer then loses his power and hides himself. Reason is the shadow cast by God; Go is the sun
general.author: jalal-uddin rumi

general.quote: Without knowledge, life is not more than the shadow of death
general.author: jean baptiste moliere

general.quote: Most of the shadows of this life are caused by standing in one’s own sunshine
general.author: ralph waldo emerson quotes

general.quote: Out of the chill and the shadow, Into the thrill and the shine; Out of the dearth and the famine, Into the fullness divine
general.author: margaret elizabeth sangster

general.quote: A crooked stick will have a crooked shadow
general.author: unknown

general.quote: To rid ourselves of our shadows — who we are — we must step into either total light or total darkness. Goodness and evil
general.author: jeremy p. johnson

general.quote: False friends are like our shadow, keeping close to us while we walk in the sunshine, but leaving us the instant we cross into the shade
general.author: john christian bovee

general.quote: Time is a very shadow that passeth away
general.author: apocrypha

general.quote: Bright lights cast dark shadows when shone from only one direction
general.author: david kelley

general.quote: To see a shadow and think it is a tree that is a pity; but to see a tree and to think it a shadow can be fatal
general.author: phyllis bottome

general.quote: We are formed and molded by our thoughts. Those whose minds are shaped by selfless thoughts give joy when they speak or act. Joy follows them like a shadow that never leaves them
general.author: buddha quotes

general.quote: In this world, full often, our joys are only the tender shadows which our sorrows cast
general.author: henry ward beecher

general.quote: Character is like a tree and reputation like its shadow. The shadow is what we think of it; the tree is the real thing
general.author: abraham lincoln quotes

general.quote: Like our shadows, our wishes lengthen as our sun declines
general.author: edward young

general.quote: Manners are like the shadows of virtues, they are the momentary display of those qualities which our fellow creatures love and respect
general.author: sydney smith

general.quote: Poetry is an echo, asking a shadow to dance
general.author: carl sandburg

general.quote: Friendship is the shadow of the evening, which increases with the setting sun of life
general.author: jean de la fontaine

general.quote: Beware lest you lose the substance by grasping at the shadow
general.author: aesop

general.quote: Shadows are in reality, when the sun is shining, the most conspicuous thing in a landscape, next to the highest lights
general.author: bayard ruskin

general.quote: Who never doubted, never half believed. Where doubt is, there truth is — it is her shadow
general.author: philip james bailey

general.quote: Good humor and enthusiasm should be the sunshine ahead that will keep that shadow behind
general.author: charles field

general.quote: Come like shadows, so depart!"
general.author: william shakespeare

general.quote: Afflictions are but the shadows of God’s wings
general.author: george macdonald

general.quote: The present is the ever moving shadow that divides yesterday from tomorrow. In that lies hope
general.author: frank lloyd wright

general.quote: A man’s character is the reality of himself; his reputation, the opinion others have formed about him; character resides in him, reputation in other people; that is the substance, this is the shadow
general.author: henry ward beecher

general.quote: When small men begin to cast big shadows, it means that the sun is about to set
general.author: yutang, lin

general.quote: Above the cloud with its shadow is the star with its light. Above all things reverence thyself
general.author: pythagoras

general.quote: Keep your face to the sunshine and you cannot see the shadow
general.author: helen keller quotes

general.quote: Beginnings are apt to be shadowy
general.author: rachel carson

general.quote: A people always ends by resembling its shadow
general.author: rudyard kipling

general.quote: Glory follows virtue as if it were its shadow
general.author: marcus t. cicero

general.quote: One’s reputation is like a shadow, it is gigantic when it precedes you, and a pigmy in proportion when it follows
general.author: charles maurice de talleyrand

general.quote: The shadows will always be behind those who walk toward the light
general.author: james f. oates jr.

general.quote: Discontent is something that follows ambition like a shadow
general.author: henry h. haskins

general.quote: The comic and the tragic lie inseparably close, like light and shadow
general.author: socrates quotes

general.quote: We stand in our own light wherever we go, and fight our own shadows forever
general.author: owen meredith

general.quote: The dearest friend on earth is a mere shadow compared to Jesus Christ
general.author: oswald chambers

general.quote: Fear has a large shadow, but he himself is small
general.author: ruth j. gendler

general.quote: And the greater shadows fall from the lofty mountains
general.author: virgil

general.quote: Loss and possession, Death and life are one. There falls no shadow where There shines no sun
general.author: hilaire belloc

general.quote: The reputation of a man is like his shadow, gigantic when it precedes him, and pigmy in its proportions when it follows
general.author: charles maurice de talleyrand

general.quote: There falls no shadow where There shines no sun
general.author: hilaire belloc

general.quote: It takes one person to forgive, it takes two people to be reunited
general.author: lewis b. smedes

general.quote: You only lie to two people in your life, your girlfriend and the police
general.author: jack nicholson

general.quote: If the people are happy, united, wealthy, and powerful, we presume the rest. We conclude that to be good from whence good is derived
general.author: edmund burke

general.quote: The people long eagerly for just two things. Bread and circuses
general.author: juvenal

general.quote: There are only two kinds of people who are really fascinating — people who know absolutely everything, and people who know absolutely nothing
general.author: oscar wilde

general.quote: Stupid people always think they are right. Wise people listen to advice
general.author: bible

general.quote: If you shoot for the stars and hit the moon, it’s OK. But you’ve got to shoot for something. A lot of people don’t even shoot
general.author: robert townsend

general.quote: A lot of people have the ability, but they don’t put forth the effort
general.author: joe carter

general.quote: The only real people are the people who never existed
general.author: oscar wilde

general.quote: There are only two people who can tell you the truth about yourself – an enemy who has lost his temper and a friend who loves you dearly
general.author: antisthenes

general.quote: When two people decide to get a divorce, it isn’t a sign that they ‘don’t understand’ one another, but a sign that they have, at last, begun to
general.author: helen rowland

general.quote: If you want to be original just try being yourself, because God has never made two people exactly alike
general.author: bernard meltzer

general.quote: There are two kinds of people in the world. Those who walk into a room and say, "There you are!" and those who say, "Here I am
general.author: abigail van buren

general.quote: What we know of other people’s only our memory of the moments during which we knew them
general.author: t. s. eliot

general.quote: Sometimes I am two people. Johnny is the nice one. Cash causes all the trouble. They fight
general.author: johnny cash

general.quote: No two people on earth are alike
general.author: billie

general.quote: When you have a taste for exceptional people, you always end up meeting them everywhere
general.author: mac orlan

general.quote: We hold the view that the people make the best judgment in the long run
general.author: john f. kennedy

general.quote: There are people who in spite of their merit disgust us, and others who please us in spite of their faults
general.author: francois de la rochefoucauld

general.quote: The character of the common people changes in a single day
general.author: voltaire

general.quote: The only normal people are the ones you don’t know very well

general.quote: We should enact an 'e' tax. We should also consider an additional $50,000 'ye' tax, so that the owner of a store called 'Ye Olde Shoppe' would have to fork over $150,000 a year. general.quote: I never dared to be radical when young for fear it would make me conservative when old.

general.quote: At fifteen life had taught me undeniably that surrender, in its place, was as honorable as resistance, especially if one had no choice.

general.quote: Segregation has no place in the education system.

general.quote: In the morning a man walks with his whole body in the evening, only with his legs.

general.quote: The important thing is that men should have a purpose in life. It should be something useful, something good.

general.quote: It is with trifles, and when he is off guard, that a man best reveals his character.

general.quote: If a cluttered desk is a sign of a cluttered mind, of what, then, is an empty desk a sign?

general.quote: A compromise is the art of dividing a cake in such a way that everyone believes he has the biggest piece.

general.quote: It is good even for old men to learn wisdom.

general.quote: A smile is a facelift that's in everyone's price range!

general.quote: Mirth is the sweet wine of human life. It should be offered sparkling with zestful life unto God.

general.quote: When men and woman die, as poets sung, his heart's the last part moves, her last, the tongue.

general.author: Maya Angelou

general.quote: The great city is that which has the greatest man or woman: if it be a few ragged huts, it is still the greatest city in the whole world.

general.quote: I have more than once in my time woken up feeling like death.

general.quote: Keep love in your heart. A life without it is like a sunless garden when the flowers are dead.

general.quote: History teaches that war begins when governments believe the price of aggression is cheap.

general.quote: Healthy citizens are the greatest asset any country can have.

general.quote: You need to overcome the tug of people against you as you reach for high goals.

general.quote: Things do not happen. Things are made to happen.

general.quote: The first requisite for the happiness of the people is the abolition of religion.

general.quote: Truthful words are not beautiful beautiful words are not truthful. Good words are not persuasive persuasive words are not good.

general.quote: When even one American - who has done nothing wrong - is forced by fear to shut his mind and close his mouth - then all Americans are in peril.

general.quote: Our actions seem to have their lucky and unlucky stars, to which a great part of that blame and that commendation is due which is given to the actions themselves.

general.quote: The things I want to know are in books my best friend is the man who'll get me a book I ain't read.

general.quote: Os homens trazem em si a crueldade. Não devemos esquecer-nos disso, devemos ter cuidado. É preciso defender a possibilidade de criar e defender esse espaço de consciência, de lucidez. Essa é a nossa pequenina esperança.

general.quote: I had a stick of CareFree gum, but it didn't work. I felt pretty good while I was blowing that bubble, but as soon as the gum lost its flavor, I was back to pondering my mortality.

general.quote: With my wife I don't get no respect. I made a toast on her birthday to 'the best woman a man ever had.' The waiter joined me.

general.quote: Advertising is legalized lying.

general.quote: If the nineteenth century was the age of the editorial chair, ours is the century of the psychiatrist's couch.

general.quote: Acting deals with very delicate emotions. It is not putting up a mask. Each time an actor acts he does not hide he exposes himself.

general.quote: Leadership is the art of getting someone else to do something you want done because he wants to do it.

general.quote: Every mind must make its choice between truth and repose. It cannot have both.

general.quote: I see great things in baseball. It's our game - the American game.

general.quote: In the revolt against idealism, the ambiguities of the word experience have been perceived, with the result that realists have more and more avoided the word.

general.quote: Toleration is the best religion.

general.quote: The health of the people is really the foundation upon which all their happiness and all their powers as a state depend.

general.quote: It isn't about 'games', for me, personally, and it never really was. It was about creating something, anything, far bigger than yourself.

general.quote: For modes of faith let graceless zealots fight, His can't be wrong whose life is in the right.

general.quote: Everything's got a moral, if only you can find it.

general.quote: God, to me, it seems, is a verb not a noun, proper or improper.

general.quote: People will survive, and they will find happiness. Happiness only comes when you're not looking for it.

general.quote: Imagination is the real and eternal world of which this vegetable universe is but a faint shadow.

general.quote: We are the miracle of force and matter making itself over into imagination and will. Incredible. The Life Force experimenting with forms. You for one. Me for another. The Universe has shouted itself alive. We are one of the shouts.

general.quote: The belief that all genuine education comes about through experience does not mean that all experiences are genuinely or equally educative.

general.quote: A man is as good as he has to be, and a woman as bad as she dares.

general.quote: I have known more men destroyed by the desire to have wife and child and to keep them in comfort than I have seen destroyed by drink and harlots.

general.quote: If there is anything I've learned from Linux, it's that projects have a life of their own, and you should not try to enforce your vision too strongly on them.

general.quote: Life is thickly sown with thorns, and I know no other remedy than to pass quickly through them. The longer we dwell on our misfortunes, the greater is their power to harm us.

general.quote: Women encourage men to be childish, then scold them.

general.quote: It has become almost a cliche to remark that nobody boasts of ignorance of literature, but it is socially acceptable to boast ignorance of science and proudly claim incompetence in mathematics.

general.quote: Limitations are like mirages created by your own mind. When you realise that limitation do not exist, those around you will also feel it and allow you inside their space.

general.quote: I don't love the world. I think Jupiter should have hit us.

general.quote: Half of the gain (in spending) was due to price increases. Mr. (Alan) Greenspan may want to convince you that inflation is relatively contained but that's hardly the case with what the data shows.

general.quote: There are only two ways to live your life. One is as though nothing is a miracle. The other is as though everything is a miracle.

general.quote: We must not say every mistake is a foolish one.

general.quote: We are Divine enough to ask and we are important enough to receive.

general.quote: When you see a man of worth, think of how you may emulate him. When you see one who is unworthy, examine yourself.

general.quote: In the long run we get no more than we have been willing to risk giving.

general.quote: Great talent finds happiness in execution.

general.quote: If there is no struggle, there is no progress.

general.quote: Once we accept our limits, we go beyond them.

general.quote: When we feel love and kindness toward others, it not only makes others feel loved and cared for, but it helps us also to develop inner happiness and peace.

general.quote: Do not be embarrassed by your mistakes. Nothing can teach us better than our understanding of them. This is one of the best ways of self-education.

general.quote: Time is the most valuable thing a man can spend.

general.quote: We must be as courteous to a man as we are to a picture, which we are willing to give the advantage of a good light.

general.quote: Today is the tomorrow you worried about yesterday.

general.quote: It is more important to know where you are going than to get there quickly. Do not mistake activity for achievement.

general.quote: Sometimes the cards we are dealt are not always fair. However you must keep smiling and moving on.

general.quote: The things that one most wants to do are the things that are probably most worth doing.

general.quote: Life is really simple, but we insist on making it complicated.

general.quote: Happiness depends upon ourselves.

general.quote: Being angry never solves anything.

general.quote: These days people seek knowledge, not wisdom. Knowledge is of the past, wisdom is of the future.

general.quote: Friendship with oneself is all important because without it one cannot be friends with anybody else in the world.

general.quote: In three words I can sum up everything Ive learned about life: it goes on.

general.quote: To lead people walk behind them.

general.quote: Those who try to do something and fail are infinitely better than those who try nothing and succeed.

general.quote: Never miss an opportunity to make others happy, even if you have to leave them alone in order to do it.

general.quote: Our doubts are traitors and make us lose the good we often might win, by fearing to attempt.

general.quote: By accepting yourself and being fully what you are, your presence can make others happy.

general.quote: I love my past. I love my present. Im not ashamed of what Ive had, and Im not sad because I have it no longer.

general.quote: Your body is precious. It is our vehicle for awakening. Treat it with care.

general.quote: I do not believe in a fate that falls on men however they act; but I do believe in a fate that falls on man unless they act.

general.quote: You are important enough to ask and you are blessed enough to receive back.

general.quote: Change in all things is sweet.

general.quote: If you can dream it, you can do it.

general.quote: Using the power of decision gives you the capacity to get past any excuse to change any and every part of your life in an instant.

general.quote: He who is fixed to a star does not change his mind.

general.quote: Your work is to discover your work and then with all your heart to give yourself to it.

general.quote: Every action of our lives touches on some chord that will vibrate in eternity.

general.quote: To be tested is good. The challenged life may be the best therapist.

general.quote: When people are like each other they tend to like each other.

general.quote: Failure will never overtake me if my determination to succeed is strong enough.

general.quote: Obstacles are those things you see when you take your eyes off the goal.

general.quote: Letting go isn’t the end of the world; it’s the beginning of a new life.

general.quote: An obstacle may be either a stepping stone or a stumbling block.

general.quote: Take it easy — but take it.

general.quote: The world is but a canvas to the imagination.

general.quote: I seek constantly to improve my manners and graces, for they are the sugar to which all are attracted.

general.quote: To the world you may be just one person, but to one person, you may be the world.

general.quote: If you must tell me your opinions, tell me what you believe in. I have plenty of douts of my own.

general.quote: Criticism is something you can easily avoid by saying nothing, doing nothing, and being nothing.

general.quote: Anticipate the difficult by managing the easy.

general.quote: The steeper the mountain the harder the climb the better the view from the finishing line

general.quote: All fixed set patterns are incapable of adaptability or pliability. The truth is outside of all fixed patterns.

general.quote: The exercise of an extraordinary gift is the supremest pleasure in life.

general.quote: A man is great by deeds, not by birth.

general.quote: Be sure you put your feet in the right place, then stand firm.

general.quote: The difficulties of life are intended to make us better, not bitter.

general.quote: Let us revere, let us worship, but erect and open-eyed, the highest, not the lowest; the future, not the past!

general.quote: Reality does not conform to the ideal, but confirms it.

general.quote: All things change; nothing perishes.

general.quote: Bad times have a scientific value. These are occasions a good learner would not miss.

general.quote: No one saves us but ourselves. No one can and no one may. We ourselves must walk the path.

general.quote: Whoso loves, believes the impossible.

general.quote: Always be smarter than the people who hire you.

general.quote: How many cares one loses when one decides not to be something but to be someone.

general.quote: Into each life rain must fall but rain can be the giver of life and it is all in your attitude that makes rain produce sunshine.

general.quote: Be slow of tongue and quick of eye.

general.quote: Most of the shadows of life are caused by standing in our own sunshine.

general.quote: Blessed is the person who is too busy to worry in the daytime, and too sleepy to worry at night.

general.quote: If you cannot do great things, do small things in a great way.

general.quote: The key to transforming our hearts and minds is to have an understanding of how our thoughts and emotions work.

general.quote: The amount of happiness that you have depends on the amount of freedom you have in your heart.

general.quote: Life is just a chance to grow a soul.

general.quote: Treat a man as he is, he will remain so. Treat a man the way he can be and ought to be, and he will become as he can be and should be.

general.quote: We know from science that nothing in the universe exists as an isolated or independent entity.

general.quote: You may say Im a dreamer, but Im not the only one, I hope someday you will join us, and the world will live as one.

general.quote: Learn to listen. Opportunity could be knocking at your door very softly.
general.author: Frank Tyger

general.quote: Arriving at one point is the starting point to another.
general.author: John Dewey

general.quote: Gratitude is not only the greatest of virtues, but the paren't of all the others.
general.author: Cicero

general.quote: Numberless are the worlds wonders, but none more wonderful than man.
general.author: Sophocles

general.quote: No alibi will save you from accepting the responsibility.

general.quote: Just as a flower, which seems beautiful has color but no perfume, so are the fruitless words of a man who speaks them but does them not.

general.quote: Our passion is our strength.

general.quote: You cannot have what you do not want.

general.quote: The world is round and the place which may seem like the end may also be the beginning.

general.quote: The only thing to do with good advice is to pass it on. It is never of any use to oneself.

general.quote: I believe that imagination is stronger than knowledge — myth is more potent than history —  dreams are more powerful than facts —  hope always triumphs over experience —  laughter is the cure for grief —  love is stronger than death.

general.quote: I allow my intuition to lead my path.
general.author: Manuel Puig

general.quote: Heaven, in the production of things, is sure to be bountiful to them, according to their qualities. Hence the tree that is flourishing, it nourishes, while that which is ready to fall, it overthrows.

general.quote: To keep the body in good health is a duty... otherwise we shall not be able to keep our mind strong and clear.

general.quote: Self-trust is the first secret of success.

general.quote: We are not animals. We are not a product of what has happened to us in our past. We have the power of choice.
general.author: Stephen Covey

general.quote: So is cheerfulness, or a good temper, the more it is spent, the more remains.
general.author: Ralph Emerson

general.quote: Intent is not a thought, or an object, or a wish. Intent is what can make a man succeed when his thoughts tell him that he is defeated. It operates in spite of the warriors indulgence. Intent is what makes him invulnerable. Intent is what sends a shaman through a wall, through space, to infinity.

general.quote: Few will have the greatness to bend history itself; but each of us can work to change a small portion of events, and in the total of all those acts will be written the history of this generation.
general.author: Robert Kennedy

general.quote: An ant on the move does more than a dozing ox
general.author: Lao Tzu

general.quote: Nothing will work unless you do.
general.author: Maya Angelou

general.quote: He who knows, does not speak. He who speaks, does not know.
general.author: Lao Tzu

general.quote: Every human being is the author of his own health or disease.
general.author: Buddha

general.quote: Inspiration exists, but it has to find us working.
general.author: Pablo Picasso

general.quote: If you smile when no one else is around, you really mean it.
general.author: Andy Rooney

general.quote: Ideals are an imaginative understanding of that which is desirable in that which is possible.
general.author: Walter Lippmann

general.quote: Silences make the real conversations between friends. Not the saying but the never needing to say is what counts.
general.author: Margaret Runbeck

general.quote: The shortest answer is doing.
general.author: Lord Herbert

general.quote: Every day I shall put my papers in order and every day I shall say farewell. And the real farewell, when it comes, will only be a small outward confirmation of what has been accomplished within me from day to day.
general.author: Etty Hillesum

general.quote: Silence is deep as Eternity, Speech is shallow as Time.
general.author: Carlyle

general.quote: I destroy my enemies when I make them my friends.
general.author: Abraham Lincoln

general.quote: I will prepare and some day my chance will come.
general.author: Abraham Lincoln

general.quote: Without leaps of imagination, or dreaming, we lose the excitement of possibilities. Dreaming, after all, is a form of planning.
general.author: Gloria Steinem

general.quote: We make our own fortunes and we call them fate.
general.author: Benjamin Disraeli

general.quote: Watch your thoughts, they become your words Watch your words, they become your actions Watch your actions, they become your habits Watch your habits, they become your character Watch your character, it becomes your destiny.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: Never apologize for showing feeling. When you do so, you apologize for truth.
general.author: Benjamin Disraeli

general.quote: Edison failed 10,000 times before he made the electric light. Do not be discouraged if you fail a few times.
general.author: Napoleon Hill

general.quote: All wrong-doing arises because of mind. If mind is transformed can wrong-doing remain?
general.author: Buddha

general.quote: There never was a good knife made of bad steel.
general.author: Benjamin Franklin

general.quote: Trust yourself. You know more than you think you do.
general.author: Benjamin Spock

general.quote: To be fully alive, fully human, and completely awake is to be continually thrown out of the nest.
general.author: Pema Chodron

general.quote: If I know what love is, it is because of you.
general.author: Hermann Hesse

general.quote: Real magic in relationships means an absence of judgement of others.
general.author: Wayne Dyer

general.quote: Happiness is a Swedish sunset — it is there for all, but most of us look the other way and lose it.
general.author: Mark Twain

general.quote: Well done is better than well said.
general.author: Benjamin Franklin

general.quote: To fly, we have to have resistance.
general.author: Maya Lin

general.quote: If you focus on results, you will never change. If you focus on change, you will get results.
general.author: Jack Dixon

general.quote: The one who always loses, is the only person who gets the reward.
general.author: Claire Charmont

general.quote: Gratitude is the fairest blossom which springs from the soul.
general.author: Henry Beecher

general.quote: If you come to a fork in the road, take it.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: What do we live for, if it is not to make life less difficult for each other?
general.author: George Eliot

general.quote: Success is getting what you want. Happiness is wanting what you get.
general.author: Dale Carnegie

general.quote: Be not afraid of greatness: some are born great, some achieve greatness, and some have greatness thrust upon them.
general.author: William Shakespeare

general.quote: Great acts are made up of small deeds.
general.author: Lao Tzu

general.quote: The Superior Man is aware of Righteousness, the inferior man is aware of advantage.
general.author: Confucius

general.quote: Not what we have but what we enjoy constitutes our abundance.
general.author: John Petit-Senn

general.quote: The deepest craving of human nature is the need to be appreciated.
general.author: William James

general.quote: We must become the change we want to see.
general.author: Mahatma Gandhi

general.quote: Conflict is the gadfly of thought. It stirs us to observation and memory. It instigates to invention. It shocks us out of sheeplike passivity, and sets us at noting and contriving.
general.author: John Dewey

general.quote: The more light you allow within you, the brighter the world you live in will be.
general.author: Shakti Gawain

general.quote: I think you can have moderate success by copying something else, but if you really want to knock it out of the park, you have to do something different and take chances.
general.author: Lee Womack

general.quote: A true friend is the most precious of all possessions and the one we take the least thought about acquiring.
general.author: Francois de La Rochefoucauld

general.quote: Remembering a wrong is like carrying a burden on the mind.
general.author: Buddha

general.quote: When our eyes see our hands doing the work of our hearts, the circle of Creation is completed inside us, the doors of our souls fly open, and love steps forth to heal everything in sight.
general.author: Michael Bridge

general.quote: No man was ever wise by chance.
general.author: Seneca

general.quote: Think as a wise man but communicate in the language of the people.
general.author: William Yeats

general.quote: We may encounter many defeats but we must not be defeated.
general.author: Maya Angelou

general.quote: Whatever we expect with confidence becomes our own self-fulfilling prophecy.

general.quote: When performance exceeds ambition, the overlap is called success.

general.quote: You have power over your mind — not outside events. Realize this, and you will find strength.

general.quote: Accept the things to which fate binds you, and love the people with whom fate brings you together, but do so with all your heart.
general.author: Marcus Aurelius

general.quote: Time you enjoyed wasting was not wasted.
general.author: John Lennon

general.quote: Anybody can make history. Only a great man can write it.
general.author: Oscar Wilde

general.quote: Our kindness may be the most persuasive argument for that which we believe.
general.author: Gordon  Hinckley

general.quote: All our knowledge has its origins in our perceptions.
general.author: Leonardo da Vinci

general.quote: Where there is great love, there are always miracles.
general.author: Willa Cather

general.quote: Translation is the paradigm, the exemplar of all writing. It is translation that demonstrates most vividly the yearning for transformation that underlies every act involving speech, that supremely human gift.
general.author: Harry Burchell Mathews

general.quote: Do not waste yourself in rejection, nor bark against the bad, but chant the beauty of the good.
general.author: Ralph Emerson

general.quote: Blessed is the man who expects nothing, for he shall never be disappointed.
general.author: Alexander Pope

general.quote: Things should be made as simple as possible, but not any simpler.
general.author: Albert Einstein

general.quote: As we are liberated from our own fear, our presence automatically liberates others.
general.author: Nelson Mandela

general.quote: Cherish your visions and your dreams as they are the children of your soul, the blueprints of your ultimate achievements.
general.author: Napoleon Hill

general.quote: Character develops itself in the stream of life.
general.author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

general.quote: Each time we face a fear, we gain strength, courage, and confidence in the doing.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: Trusting our intuition often saves us from disaster.
general.author: Anne Wilson Schaef

general.quote: There are two types of people... One who ask for directions and the others who find their way. Both may reach the destination but the satisfaction of the other kind is far greater.
general.author: Dominik Sliver

general.quote: You must do the things you think you cannot do.
general.author: Eleanor Roosevelt

general.quote: The man who trusts men will make fewer mistakes than he who distrusts them.
general.author: Cavour

general.quote: The world has the habit of making room for the man whose actions show that he knows where he is going.
general.author: Napoleon Hill

general.quote: Treat people as if they were what they ought to be and you help them to become what they are capable of being.
general.author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

general.quote: The world makes way for the man who knows where he is going.
general.author: Ralph Emerson

general.quote: Success is not the key to happiness. Happiness is the key to success. If you love what you are doing, you will be successful.
general.author: Albert Schweitzer

general.quote: True happiness means forging a strong spirit that is undefeated, no matter how trying our circumstances.
general.author: Daisaku Ikeda

general.quote: Keep true to the dreams of thy youth.
general.author: Friedrich von Schiller

general.quote: Yeah we all shine on, like the moon, and the stars, and the sun.
general.author: John Lennon

general.quote: If you have no respect for your own values how can you be worthy of respect from others.
general.author: Byron Pulsifer

general.quote: I recommend you to take care of the minutes: for hours will take care of themselves.
general.author: Chesterfield

general.quote: The cosmos is neither moral or immoral; only people are. He who would move the world must first move himself.
general.author: Edward Ericson

general.quote: Let us always meet each other with smile, for the smile is the beginning of love.
general.author: Mother Teresa

general.quote: Short words are best and the old words when short are best of all.
general.author: Winston Churchill

general.quote: Each day, accept everything that comes to you as a gift. At night, mentally give it all back. In this way, you become free.
general.author: Daniel Levin

general.quote: Love is never lost. If not reciprocated, it will flow back and soften and purify the heart.
general.author: Washington Irving

general.quote: Happiness comes when your work and words are of benefit to yourself and others.
general.author: Buddha

general.quote: Gratitude makes sense of our past, brings peace for today, and creates a vision for tomorrow.
general.author: Melody Beattie

general.quote: We cannot change our memories, but we can change their meaning and the power they have over us.
general.author: David Seamans

general.quote: From little acorns mighty oaks do grow.
general.author: American Proverb

general.quote: Make the most of yourself, for that is all there is of you.
general.author: Ralph Emerson

general.quote: Be great in act, as you have been in thought.
general.author: William Shakespeare

general.quote: The price of greatness is responsibility.
general.author: Winston Churchill

general.quote: To free us from the expectations of others, to give us back to ourselves — there lies the great, singular power of self-respect.
general.author: Joan Didion

general.quote: There is no way to happiness, happiness is the way.
general.author: Thich Nhat Hanh

general.quote: Silence is a source of great strength.
general.author: Lao Tzu

general.quote: We know what we are, but know not what we may be.
general.author: William Shakespeare

general.quote: Truth is powerful and it prevails.
general.author: Sojourner Truth

general.quote: Continuous effort—not strength or intelligence—is the key to unlocking our potential.
general.author: Winston Churchill

general.quote: All achievements, all earned riches, have their beginning in an idea.
general.author: Napoleon Hill

general.quote: It is impossible to feel grateful and depressed in the same moment.
general.author: Naomi Williams

general.quote: Things do not change; we change.
general.author: Henry Thoreau

general.quote: We see things not as they are, but as we are. Our perception is shaped by our previous experiences.
general.author: Dennis Kimbro

general.quote: The two most powerful warriors are patience and time.
general.author: Leo Tolstoy

general.quote: He is a wise man who does not grieve for the things which he has not, but rejoices for those which he has.
general.author: Epictetus

general.quote: The best place to find a helping hand is at the end of your own arm.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: We all live with the objective of being happy; our lives are all different and yet the same.
general.author: Anne Frank

general.quote: Let your hook always be cast; in the pool where you least expect it, there will be a fish.
general.author: Ovid

general.quote: To be great is to be misunderstood.
general.author: Ralph Emerson

general.quote: Positive thinking will let you do everything better than negative thinking will.
general.author: Zig Ziglar

general.quote: Do not follow where the path may lead. Go, instead, where there is no path and leave a trail.
general.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

general.quote: Very little is needed to make a happy life; it is all within yourself, in your way of thinking.
general.author: Marcus Aurelius

general.quote: Neither a lofty degree of intelligence nor imagination nor both together go to the making of genius. Love, love, love, that is the soul of genius.
general.author: Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart

general.quote: Love and compassion open our own inner life, reducing stress, distrust and loneliness.
general.author: Dalai Lama

general.quote: What lies behind us and what lies before us are tiny matters compared to what lies within us.
general.author: Walt Emerson

general.quote: Instead of saying that man is the creature of circumstance, it would be nearer the mark to say that man is the architect of circumstance.
general.author: Thomas Carlyle

general.quote: Your big opportunity may be right where you are now.
general.author: Napoleon Hill

general.quote: Kind words will unlock an iron door.
general.author: Turkish Proverb

general.quote: Happiness is not in the mere possession of money; it lies in the joy of achievement, in the thrill of creative effort.
general.author: Franklin Roosevelt

general.quote: One faces the future with ones past.
general.author: Pearl Buck

general.quote: The thing always happens that you really believe in; and the belief in a thing makes it happen.
general.author: Frank Wright

general.quote: Ideas are the beginning points of all fortunes.
general.author: Napoleon Hill

general.quote: Genuine love should first be directed at oneself – if we do not love ourselves, how can we love others?
general.author: Dalai Lama

general.quote: To live a pure unselfish life, one must count nothing as ones own in the midst of abundance.
general.author: Buddha

general.quote: Nobody can do everything, but everybody can do something.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: A dream is your creative vision for your life in the future. You must break out of your current comfort zone and become comfortable with the unfamiliar and the unknown.
general.author: Denis Waitley

general.quote: Some people are always grumbling because roses have thorns; I am thankful that thorns have roses.
general.author: Alphonse Karr

general.quote: Your only obligation in any lifetime is to be true to yourself. Being true to anyone else or anything else is not only impossible, but the mark of a fake messiah.
general.author: Richard Bach

general.quote: Work while you have the light. You are responsible for the talent that has been entrusted to you.
general.author: Henri-Frederic Amiel

general.quote: It is through science that we prove, but through intuition that we discover.
general.author: Jules Poincare

general.quote: Mountains cannot be surmounted except by winding paths.
general.author: Johann Wolfgang Von Goethe

general.quote: I hear and I forget. I see and I remember. I do and I understand.
general.author: Confucius

general.quote: The shoe that fits one person pinches another; there is no recipe for living that suits all cases.
general.author: Carl Jung

general.quote: The mind unlearns with difficulty what it has long learned.
general.author: Seneca

general.quote: Bodily exercise, when compulsory, does no harm to the body; but knowledge which is acquired under compulsion obtains no hold on the mind.
general.author: Plato

general.quote: Take heed: you do not find what you do not seek.
general.author: English Proverb

general.quote: You will never be happy if you continue to search for what happiness consists of. You will never live if you are looking for the meaning of life.
general.author: Albert Camus

general.quote: Time is not a measure the length of a day or month or year but more a measure of what you have accomplished.
general.author: Byron Pulsifer

general.quote: Begin, be bold, and venture to be wise.
general.author: Horace

general.quote: I would rather be attacked than unnoticed. For the worst thing you can do to an author is to be silent as to his works. An assault upon a town is a bad thing; but starving it is still worse.
general.author: Samuel Johnson

general.quote: Whenever something negative happens to you, there is a deep lesson concealed within it.
general.author: Eckhart Tolle

general.quote: No man can succeed in a line of endeavor which he does not like.
general.author: Napoleon Hill

general.quote: Men of perverse opinion do not know the excellence of what is in their hands, till some one dash it from them.
general.author: Sophocles

general.quote: To love someone deeply gives you strength. Being loved by someone deeply gives you courage.
general.author: Lao Tzu

general.quote: Go put your creed into the deed. Nor speak with double tongue.
general.author: Ralph Emerson

general.quote: All great men are gifted with intuition. They know without reasoning or analysis, what they need to know.
general.author: Alexis Carrel

general.quote: Nothing happens unless first we dream.
general.author: Carl Sandburg

general.quote: The smallest flower is a thought, a life answering to some feature of the Great Whole, of whom they have a persistent intuition.
general.author: Honore De Balzac

general.quote: Life is not measured by the breaths we take, but by the moments that take our breath.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: We must overcome the notion that we must be regular. It robs you of the chance to be extraordinary and leads you to the mediocre.
general.author: Uta Hagen

general.quote: Reality leaves a lot to the imagination.
general.author: John Lennon

general.quote: Constant kindness can accomplish much. As the sun makes ice melt, kindness causes misunderstanding, mistrust, and hostility to evaporate.
general.author: Albert Schweitzer

general.quote: Love life and life will love you back. Love people and they will love you back.
general.author: Arthur Rubinstein

general.quote: In rivers, the water that you touch is the last of what has passed and the first of that which comes; so with present time.

general.quote: Let yourself be silently drawn by the stronger pull of what you really love.
general.author: Rumi

general.quote: I believe that we are solely responsible for our choices, and we have to accept the consequences of every deed, word, and thought throughout our lifetime.
general.author: Elisabeth Kubler-Ross

general.quote: We have a hunger of the mind which asks for knowledge of all around us, and the more we gain, the more is our desire; the more we see, the more we are capable of seeing.
general.author: Maria Mitchell

general.quote: One that desires to excel should endeavour in those things that are in themselves most excellent.
general.author: Epictetus

general.quote: You may only be someone in the world, but to someone else, you may be the world.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: Before you can inspire with emotion, you must be swamped with it yourself. Before you can move their tears, your own must flow. To convince them, you must yourself believe.
general.author: Winston Churchill

general.quote: You do not become good by trying to be good, but by finding the goodness that is already within you.
general.author: Eckhart Tolle

general.quote: When in doubt, tell the truth.
general.author: Mark Twain

general.quote: Your worst enemy cannot harm you as much as your own unguarded thoughts.
general.author: Buddha

general.quote: Our ability to achieve happiness and success depends on the strength of our wings.
general.author: Catherine Pulsifer

general.quote: Be gentle first with yourself if you wish to be gentle with others.
general.author: Lama Yeshe

general.quote: Spirituality can be severed from both vicious sectarianism and thoughtless banalities. Spirituality, I have come to see, is nothing less than the thoughtful love of life.
general.author: Robert C. Solomon

general.quote: Nature is a mutable cloud which is always and never the same.
general.author: Ralph Emerson

general.quote: A wise man can learn more from a foolish question than a fool can learn from a wise answer.
general.author: Bruce Lee

general.quote: I find hope in the darkest of days, and focus in the brightest. I do not judge the universe.
general.author: Dalai Lama

general.quote: Time is the wisest counsellor of all.
general.author: Pericles

general.quote: Experience can only be gained by doing not by thinking or dreaming.
general.author: Byron Pulsifer

general.quote: There is no great genius without some touch of madness.
general.author: Seneca

general.quote: Without courage, wisdom bears no fruit.
general.author: Baltasar Gracian

general.quote: Those that know, do. Those that understand, teach.
general.author: Aristotle

general.quote: Never do things others can do and will do, if there are things others cannot do or will not do.
general.author: Amelia Earhart

general.quote: Truth is generally the best vindication against slander.
general.author: Abraham Lincoln

general.quote: A lot of people give up just before theyre about to make it. You know you never know when that next obstacle is going to be the last one.
general.author: Chuck Norris

general.quote: We choose our destiny in the way we treat others.
general.author: Wit

general.quote: There is nothing so useless as doing efficiently that which should not be done at all.
general.author: Peter Drucker

general.quote: Give thanks for a little and you will find a lot.
general.author: Hausa

general.quote: Our greatest glory is not in never failing but rising everytime we fall.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: Be a good listener. Your ears will never get you in trouble.
general.author: Frank Tyger

general.quote: People are like stained glass windows: they sparkle and shine when the sun is out, but when the darkness sets in their true beauty is revealed only if there is a light within.

general.quote: If you would take, you must first give, this is the beginning of intelligence.
general.author: Lao Tzu

general.quote: From wonder into wonder existence opens.
general.author: Lao Tzu

general.quote: If you correct your mind, the rest of your life will fall into place.
general.author: Lao Tzu

general.quote: Nothing in life is to be feared, it is only to be understood. Now is the time to understand more, so that we may fear less.
general.author: Marie Curie

general.quote: Face what you think you believe and you will be surprised.
general.author: William White

general.quote: All the world is a stage, And all the men and women merely players.They have their exits and entrances; Each man in his time plays many parts.
general.author: William Shakespeare

general.quote: Not only to say the right thing in the right place, but far more difficult, to leave unsaid the wrong thing at the tempting moment.
general.author: Sala

general.quote: If you will practice being fictional for a while, you will understand that fictional characters are sometimes more real than people with bodies and heartbeats.

general.quote: Intuition is the supra-logic that cuts out all the routine processes of thought and leaps straight from the problem to the answer.

general.quote: Good luck is another name for tenacity of purpose.
general.author: Ralph Emerson

general.quote: All is flux; nothing stays still.

general.quote: If your actions inspire others to dream more, learn more, do more and become more, you are a leader.
general.author: John Quincy Adams

general.quote: Go to your bosom: Knock there, and ask your heart what it doth know.
general.author: William Shakespeare

general.quote: There is only one way to happiness and that is to cease worrying about things which are beyond the power of our will.
general.author: Epictetus

general.quote: He who talks more is sooner exhausted.
general.author: Lao Tzu

general.quote: Adversity has the effect of eliciting talents, which in prosperous circumstances would have lain dormant.
general.author: Horace

general.quote: Doing what you love is the cornerstone of having abundance in your life.
general.author: Wayne Dyer

general.quote: We lost because we told ourselves we lost.
general.author: Leo Tolstoy

general.quote: Three things cannot be long hidden: the sun, the moon, and the truth.
general.author: Buddha

general.quote: Our deepest wishes are whispers of our authentic selves. We must learn to respect them. We must learn to listen.
general.author: Sarah Breathnach

general.quote: Build up your weaknesses until they become your strong points.

general.quote: Dreams pass into the reality of action. From the actions stems the dream again; and this interdependence produces the highest form of living.

general.quote: Vision without action is a daydream. Action without vision is a nightmare.
general.author: Japanese Proverb

general.quote: Never be afraid to try, remember... Amateurs built the ark, Professionals built the Titanic.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: Imagination will often carry us to worlds that never were. But without it we go nowhere.
general.author: Carl Sagan

general.quote: Look back over the past, with its changing empires that rose and fell, and you can foresee the future, too.
general.author: Marcus Aurelius

general.quote: Great is the art of beginning, but greater is the art of ending.
general.author: Lazurus Long

general.quote: To accomplish great things, we must dream as well as act.
general.author: Anatole France

general.quote: He who does not trust enough, Will not be trusted.
general.author: Lao Tzu

general.quote: If one is estranged from oneself, then one is estranged from others too. If one is out of touch with oneself, then one cannot touch others.
general.author: Anne Lindbergh

general.quote: You can fool some of the people all of the time, and all of the people some of the time, but you can not fool all of the people all of the time.
general.author: Abraham Lincoln

general.quote: What we see depends mainly on what we look for.
general.author: John Lubbock

general.quote: When you come to the edge of all the light you know, and are about to step off into the darkness of the unknown, faith is knowing one of two things will happen: There will be something solid to stand on, or you will be taught how to fly.
general.author: Barbara  Winter

general.quote: Fine words and an insinuating appearance are seldom associated with true virtue
general.author: Confucius

general.quote: Everyone can taste success when the going is easy, but few know how to taste victory when times get tough.
general.author: Byron Pulsifer

general.quote: Do more than dream: work.
general.author: William Arthur Ward

general.quote: Excellence can be obtained if you care more than others think is wise, risk more than others think is safe, dream more than others think is practical, expect more than others think is possible.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: As soon as the fear approaches near, attack and destroy it.
general.author: Chanakya

general.quote: Sadness flies away on the wings of time.
general.author: Jean de la Fontaine

general.quote: Sadness may be part of life but there is no need to let it dominate your entire life.
general.author: Byron Pulsifer

general.quote: Reality is merely an illusion, albeit a very persistent one.
general.author: Albert Einstein

general.quote: There is only one success — to be able to spend your life in your own way.
general.author: Christopher Morley

general.quote: To be wrong is nothing unless you continue to remember it.
general.author: Confucius

general.quote: Intuition will tell the thinking mind where to look next.
general.author: Jonas Salk

general.quote: The first step to getting the things you want out of life is this: decide what you want.
general.author: Ben Stein

general.quote: There are two primary choices in life: to accept conditions as they exist, or accept responsibility for changing them.
general.author: Denis Waitley

general.quote: Every problem has a gift for you in its hands.
general.author: Richard Bach

general.quote: To forgive is to set a prisoner free and realize that prisoner was you.
general.author: Lewis B. Smedes

general.quote: Logic will get you from A to B. Imagination will take you everywhere.
general.author: Albert Einstein

general.quote: Fear is a darkroom where negatives develop.
general.author: Usman Asif

general.quote: Make the most of yourself for that is all there is of you.
general.author: Ralph Emerson

general.quote: Hold a picture of yourself long and steadily enough in your minds eye, and you will be drawn toward it.
general.author: Napoleon Hill

general.quote: Your sacred space is where you can find yourself again and again.
general.author: Joseph Campbell

general.quote: Just trust yourself, then you will know how to live.
general.author: Goethe

general.quote: At the center of your being you have the answer; you know who you are and you know what you want.
general.author: Lao Tzu

general.quote: Deeds of kindness are equal in weight to all the commandments.
general.author: Talmud

general.quote: Life is movement-we breathe, we eat, we walk, we move!
general.author: John Pierrakos

general.quote: Happiness is found in doing, not merely possessing.
general.author: Napoleon Hill

general.quote: Count your joys instead of your woes. Count your friends instead of your foes.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: No snowflake in an avalanche ever feels responsible.
general.author: Voltaire

general.quote: Be as you wish to seem.
general.author: Socrates

general.quote: The best remedy for a short temper is a long walk.
general.author: Jacqueline Schiff

general.quote: Every man is a volume if you know how to read him.
general.author: Channing

general.quote: A stumble may prevent a fall.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: Happiness does not come about only due to external circumstances; it mainly derives from inner attitudes.
general.author: Dalai Lama

general.quote: The aim of life is self-development. To realize ones nature perfectly — that is what each of us is here for.
general.author: Oscar Wilde

general.quote: Just as treasures are uncovered from the earth, so virtue appears from good deeds, and wisdom appears from a pure and peaceful mind. To walk safely through the maze of human life, one needs the light of wisdom and the guidance of virtue.
general.author: Buddha

general.quote: There is only one happiness in life, to love and be loved.
general.author: George Sand

general.quote: There is nothing like returning to a place that remains unchanged to find the ways in which you yourself have altered.
general.author: Nelson Mandela

general.quote: Light tomorrow with today!
general.author: Elizabeth Browning

general.quote: Enjoy the little things, for one day you may look back and realize they were the big things.
general.author: Robert Brault

general.quote: It is a mistake to regard age as a downhill grade toward dissolution. The reverse is true. As one grows older one climbs with surprising strides.
general.author: George Sand

general.quote: It is not enough to have a good mind; the main thing is to use it well.
general.author: Rene Descartes

general.quote: The free man is he who does not fear to go to the end of his thought.
general.author: Leon Blum

general.quote: Those who are free of resentful thoughts surely find peace.
general.author: Buddha

general.quote: To see things in the seed, that is genius.
general.author: Lao Tzu

general.quote: We read the world wrong and say that it deceives us.
general.author: Rabindranath Tagore

general.quote: Ask yourself the secret of your success. Listen to your answer, and practice it.
general.author: Richard Bach

general.quote: When you arise in the morning, think of what a precious privilege it is to be alive — to breathe, to think, to enjoy, to love.
general.author: Marcus Aurelius

general.quote: Never tell a young person that anything cannot be done. God may have been waiting centuries for someone ignorant enough of the impossible to do that very thing.
general.author: John Holmes

general.quote: All children are artists. The problem is how to remain an artist once he grows up.
general.author: Pablo Picasso

general.quote: A man of ability and the desire to accomplish something can do anything.
general.author: Donald Kircher

general.quote: The way we communicate with others and with ourselves ultimately determines the quality of our lives.
general.author: Tony Robbins

general.quote: The meaning I picked, the one that changed my life: Overcome fear, behold wonder.
general.author: Richard Bach

general.quote: To get the full value of joy you must have someone to divide it with.
general.author: Mark Twain

general.quote: Things do not change, we change.
general.author: Henry Thoreau

general.quote: Deep listening is miraculous for both listener and speaker.When someone receives us with open-hearted, non-judging, intensely interested listening, our spirits expand.
general.author: Sue Patton Thoele

general.quote: If you propose to speak, always ask yourself, is it true, is it necessary, is it kind.
general.author: Buddha

general.quote: Do good by stealth, and blush to find it fame.
general.author: Alexander Pope

general.quote: Responsibility is not inherited, it is a choice that everyone needs to make at some point in their life.
general.author: Byron Pulsifer

general.quote: In every adversity there lies the seed of an equivalent advantage. In every defeat is a lesson showing you how to win the victory next time.
general.author: Robert Collier

general.quote: All our talents increase in the using, and the every faculty, both good and bad, strengthen by exercise.
general.author: Anne Bronte

general.quote: Hope arouses, as nothing else can arouse, a passion for the possible.
general.author: William Sloane Coffin

general.quote: Only those who dare to fail greatly can ever achieve greatly.
general.author: Robert Kennedy

general.quote: The grand essentials of happiness are: something to do, something to love, and something to hope for.
general.author: Chalmers

general.quote: Every great dream begins with a dreamer. Always remember, you have within you the strength, the patience, and the passion to reach for the stars to change the world.
general.author: Harriet Tubman

general.quote: The intuition of free will gives us the truth.
general.author: Corliss Lamont

general.quote: There are two types of people... One who ask for directions and the others who find their way. Both may reach the destination but the satisfaction of the other kindis far greater.
general.author: Dominik Sliver

general.quote: The harder you fall, the higher you bounce.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: With realization of ones own potential and self-confidence in ones ability, one can build a better world.
general.author: Dalai Lama

general.quote: And as we let our own light shine, we unconsciously give other people permission to do the same.
general.author: Nelson Mandela

general.quote: Strong beliefs win strong men, and then make them stronger.
general.author: Richard Bach

general.quote: If you look into your own heart, and you find nothing wrong there, what is there to worry about? What is there to fear?
general.author: Confucius

general.quote: The greatest way to live with honor in this world is to be what we pretend to be.
general.author: Socrates

general.quote: To give hope to someone occurs when you teach them how to use the tools to do it for themselves.
general.author: Byron Pulsifer

general.quote: Let us resolve to be masters, not the victims, of our history, controlling our own destiny without giving way to blind suspicions and emotions.
general.author: John Kennedy

general.quote: A goal without a plan is just a wish.
general.author: Larry Elder

general.quote: To make no mistakes is not in the power of man; but from their errors and mistakes the wise and good learn wisdom for the future.
general.author: Plutarch

general.quote: Try to do unto others as you would have them do to you, and do not be discouraged if they fail sometimes. It is much better that they should fail than you should.
general.author: Charles Dickens

general.quote: Everything is perfect in the universe — even your desire to improve it.
general.author: Wayne Dyer

general.quote: The most precious gift we can offer anyone is our attention. When mindfulness embraces those we love, they will bloom like flowers.
general.author: Thich Nhat Hanh

general.quote: When one door closes another door opens; but we so often look so long and so regretfully upon the closed door, that we do not see the ones which open for us.
general.author: Alexander Bell

general.quote: We all have problems. The way we solve them is what makes us different.

general.quote: You have to believe in yourself.

general.quote: Keep silence for the most part, and speak only when you must, and then briefly.

general.quote: Be the change that you want to see in the world.

general.quote: Important principles may, and must, be inflexible.

general.quote: Don't wait. The time will never be just right.

general.quote: Compassion and happiness are not a sign of weakness but a sign of strength.

general.quote: Joy is what happens to us when we allow ourselves to recognize how good things really are.

general.quote: People may doubt what you say, but they will believe what you do.

general.quote: If you are patient in one moment of anger, you will escape one hundred days of sorrow.

general.quote: Every man dies. Not every man really lives.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: If we learn to open our hearts, anyone, including the people who drive us crazy, can be our teacher.

general.quote: If you look over your left shoulder and it is saying to go this and your other shoulder is telling you to go the other way. Then just follow your heart and you willbe OK.

general.quote: It takes both sunshine and rain to make a rainbow.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: Time stays long enough for anyone who will use it.

general.quote: Every person, all the events of your life are there because you have drawn them there. What you choose to do with them is up to you.

general.quote: Courage is not about taking risks unknowingly but putting your own being in front of challenges that others may not be able to.

general.quote: Sometimes by losing a battle you find a new way to win the war.

general.quote: You will not be punished for your anger, you will be punished by your anger.

general.quote: Who looks outside, dreams; who looks inside, awakes.

general.quote: Life is a learning experience, only if you learn.

general.quote: The longer we dwell on our misfortunes, the greater is their power to harm us.

general.quote: Most smiles are started by another smile.

general.quote: Loss is nothing else but change,and change is Natures delight.

general.quote: It is common sense to take a method and try it. If it fails, admit it frankly and try another. But above all, try something.

general.quote: Moments of complete apathy are the best for new creations.

general.quote: He who has health has hope, and he who has hope has everything.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: Look forward to spring as a time when you can start to see what nature has to offer once again.

general.quote: Imagination disposes of everything; it creates beauty, justice, and happiness, which are everything in this world.

general.quote: Give a man a fish and you feed him for a day. Teach him how to fish and you feed him for a lifetime.

general.quote: The person born with a talent they are meant to use will find their greatest happiness in using it.

general.quote: An invasion of armies can be resisted, but not an idea whose time has come.

general.quote: The most important point is to accept yourself and stand on your two feet.

general.quote: Meditation is the dissolution of thoughts in eternal awareness or Pure consciousness without objectification, knowing without thinking, merging finitude in infinity.

general.quote: I am glad that I paid so little attention to good advice; had I abided by it I might have been saved from some of my most valuable mistakes.

general.quote: The reasonable man adapts himself to the world; the unreasonable man persists in trying to adapt the world to himself. Therefore, all progress depends on the unreasonable man.

general.quote: Build a better mousetrap and the world will beat a path to your door.

general.quote: Worry often gives a small thing a big shadow.
general.author: Swedish Proverb

general.quote: Either you run the day or the day runs you.
general.author: Jim Rohn

general.quote: I walk slowly, but I never walk backward.
general.author: Abraham Lincoln

general.quote: Kindness is the language which the deaf can hear and the blind can see.
general.author: Mark Twain

general.quote: If you accept the expectations of others, especially negative ones, then you never will change the outcome.

general.quote: I think and that is all that I am.
general.author: Wayne Dyer

general.quote: Those who will play with cats must expect to be scratched.

general.quote: Dreams come true. Without that possibility, nature would not incite us to have them.

general.quote: Strength to carry on despite the odds means you have faith in your own abilities and know how.

general.quote: Let us be grateful to people who make us happy; they are the charming gardeners who make our souls blossom.

general.quote: Moral excellence comes about as a result of habit. We become just by doing just acts, temperate by doing temperate acts, brave by doing brave acts.

general.quote: The beginning is always today.

general.quote: We can only be said to be alive in those moments when our hearts are conscious of our treasures.

general.quote: It is better to have enough ideas for some of them to be wrong, than to be always right by having no ideas at all.

general.quote: A little more persistence, a little more effort, and what seemed hopeless failure may turn to glorious success.

general.quote: From small beginnings come great things.

general.quote: We know the truth, not only by the reason, but by the heart.

general.quote: Truth, and goodness, and beauty are but different faces of the same all.

general.quote: I am a man of fixed and unbending principles, the first of which is to be flexible at all times.

general.quote: The mind is everything. What you think you become.

general.quote: Life can be found only in the present moment. The past is gone, the future is not yet here, and if we do not go back to ourselves in the present moment, we cannot be in touch with life.
